text: Everything was really good. We loved the salsa bar with all the interesting choices.  Carne asada tacos were great. Can't wait to come back and try the fish tacos.

Lord have mercy, this place is in strong contention for best downtown Mexican food. Strong drinks and fresh, delicious food at very reasonable prices. When you tire of Macayos and all the other cheap knockoffs, get your soon-to-be-chubbier behind to La Santisima.

This is one of the best (if not the best) places for tacos in the Phoenix area. We've tried several different tacos and quesadillas and everything has been delicious. It's also the closest I've seen to authentic Mexican in Phoenix. The variety of salsas makes it fun to eat these dishes.

Yes. Yes. Yes.  Anybody who does not give this restaurant a 5 is a food critic who's just trying to take down one of the best taco shops in America!  We were so excited when this place moved over to the west side closer to our house.  Try to quesadillas and the horchata.
Amazing place wish i lived in Phx so i could have this EVERYDAY!

A wonderful salsa bar with more than ten different kinds of salsa. I was seated and given a basket of chips but I had no clue where the salsa was till I saw people queuing at the backside of the room.
I had ordered tacos and they came out delicious wit the sides. The food is good but the service sucks.
The place gets very crowded in the evening even on non weekends so need to plan ahead if you are going with a big group.
5 stars for the excellent food and the salsa spread, will visit again if I'm in phoenix

this was our second time going to the restaurant food is great but the service is so bad we will not be returning again the first time we just thought had a bad server so we returned a second time and found out its always like this service is horrible will not recommend it to anyone because of the service and my 4 year old daughter was served her tacos on a broken plate

I hadn't been there in quite some time but went for lunch on Monday. Amazing! Had the chicken mole quesa which tasted great and was more than enough for lunch and dinner that night. Also had a salad which was really good. I'll go back often!

Truly superb food. Service is...quirky-- you need to order at the counter and grab your own utensils. Locals know the ropes, so the newbies have to figure it out on their own. But if you want an authentic, neighborhood feel, and excellent food, this is your place.
This place was pretty good! Shark tacos were really good. Their horchata was amazing! Must try, it had strawberry, pecan, and melon I believe. Will definitely return soon.
Oh, I dream about the salsas here... I love all the different combinations, and could very easily make a meal with those alone. Love the tacos and the horchata as well.

Nothing even close in Denver.  I may move to Phoenix over these tacos.  And the service, hilarious and amazing. Highly recommended!  Pretty sweet artwork as well, and top notch salsa. You will not go wrong with this place.

This place is amazing! I love their salsa bar and the quaint environment. They don't skimp on the serving sizes either. The tacos always have large portions of meat and fixings. It's one of my favorite places to take out of town visitors. They are always impressed and satisfied. Oh, and the horchata is the best I've ever had. Yes!

Well cross that one off the list....

We went in looking forward to giving the new neighborhood taco spot a shot. Read solid reviews and thought we could add a new dining spot to our rotation. Wrong.

Not only was it a billion degrees inside, the flies were everywhere! The service was adequate (given the volume of customers) but the food was...well, sub par. Not horrible...just not very good. The famed salsa bar turned out to be a few Tupperware tubs of salsa that tasted remarkably similar to the selection available at Pro's Ranch Market.

We're gonna head back over to America's next time we've got a taste for tacos.

La Santisima has a great variety of Mexican foods from many different regions of mexico, with a depth and richness of flavor that is absolutely amazing. Their happy hour is extraordinarily reasonable, but one of my favorite things is the salsa bar. Around 20 salsas with a variety of flavors and ingredients, from a pecan salsa, to old standbys like pico de gallo. I would highly recommend this restaurant to ANYONE, and have brought folks visiting from out of town. Everyone agrees, this is the best of the best.

P.S. The place is definitely cozy. I would recommend coming in during happy hours if you are trying to avoid a crowd.

This was an interesting place. I was craving tacos and what's better than going to the taco shop. I tried one of their steak tacos and they were alright. Awesome salsa bar, never had strawberry salsa nor sweet pecan. It's a little pricey but hey guess that's the gourmet part. Will definitely try more items on the menu. Staff was very nice. I wanted a strawberry lemonade and since they only had regular lemonade the guy made me some and honestly wasn't bad at all.

Ate there today after golf w/husband & his best friend, took some coaxing to get them into small place in not so best area ...but SUCCESS! Tacos were great, salsa bar & chips awesome, fun for all. Like posted elsewhere, SMALL noisy but worth it.
Delicious food. I am obsessed with their salsa, yum! Also they have an awesome happy hour.

The bakery sells traditional Mexican pastries which are excellent. The baked goods in the window are self-serve, to be placed on a tray, while the ones on the counter are not. There are a few tables in the front; I didn't see the back area. They sell a variety of coffee and tea. I suggest the guava pastries and the concha. I'll return to try other sweets.

I wanted to be blown away by a gourmet taco shop, but sadly I live in Southern California, and when you live there being amazed by tacos take A LOT. I definitely recommend this place, but it doesn't have the WOW factor.

The Pros:
Awesome Salsa Bar - about a dozen delicious salsas. The regular Mexican salsa was flavorful and spicy. Some nice rare options too.
Service - Our server was very nice and attentive.
The Al Pastor - I tried the premium carne asada, fish taco, and al pastor. This is the only one I would go back for - great taste and tender pork.

The Cons:
Price - Like double the price of what I'm used to paying for any kind of taco.
Pepsi brand soda - Hells to the no!! and they didn't have Mexican coke either (they were apparently out).
Bleh on the fish taco - again, I am spoiled because I only eat fish tacos in Baja, but the batter was very soggy and bland.

Small place and tight parking but it wasn't crowded on a Sunday.

Had the gourmet tacos and a quesadillas, tgey were both delicious. Love the salsa bar, never had peanut or pecan salsa before but really enjoyed them. The house margarita was great. Only downside was we waited for our food a bit long cause we went during lunch hour.

Stopped in on Saturday for lunch. Place was dead, only one other couple in the restaurant. Noticed speakers on the wall, but no music was playing. Not exactly a jovial atmosphere for a wonderful spring day in March. I ordered the Carne Asada and a Cochinita Pibil to be washed down with an Horchata. I then proceeded to the Salsa bar which appeared to have an outstanding selection and I immediately started filling cups with the many varietals eagerly anticipating being able to dress up my tacos. Chips were then brought out to snack on while I waited for my food. I can only describe these as cold, flavorless, and typical of most chain restaurant chips. Not a good sign. My Taco's arrived shortly thereafter. Unfortunately these too were nothing to write home about. The tortillas were cold and appeared store bought. The carne asada was overcooked and lacked any form of flavor. I attempted to spice things up by adding salsas, but these too were flavorless. Very little spice and hardly any seasoning. The cochinita pibil was enjoyable, as it was juicy and tasted like a quality cut of pork, but wrapped inside of a cold store bought tortilla the experience was muted. 

I highly doubt I will be returning to this restaurant, and I honestly question those that have written such outstanding reviews. My opinion, no taco shop should bill itself as "Gourmet" if it does not make its own tortillas, has bland salsas, and cannot make a juicy and flavorful carne asada.

I'm not a fan of what's annoyingly referred to as "Tex-Mex" food, at all. It gives me the idea of pseudo-not-fast-food like Moe's, or lame cantinas, run by people whose ancestors probably couldn't pronounce "cantina," that cater to the effete-minded "Margaritaville" crowd.

My wife, however, was attracted to the outside decor and lured in by the "gourmet" in the name.

Welp, folks, let me tell you: I'm really glad I went in this place. Their big advertisement is that they want to turn the tide of opinion on Mexican food/Tex Mex whatever from one of greasy, unhealthful junk to tasteful and thoughtfully-prepared fare- to the end of the latter, they did their due on me!

The woman and I had their take on quesadillas, which weren't the usual stupid flat flour tortilla cheese sandwiches with a pile o' salt and a not-pile of meat. In fact, these guys were made from homemade corn tortillas, deep fried (though not doused in grease) and filled well with your menu choice (In my case, al pastor; the wife got mahi-mahi). Folded over like a calzone and topped lightly with cojita sour cream, these guys are filled with flavor- flavor I've not experienced at any other Mexican joint in this city. The light crispiness of the tortilla really drives it home, and the quesadilla in all makes me think more of "tamale grande" than what you would classify as a quesadilla. (again, a boring flat cheese sandwich).

The price is kind of high; and while the portion is not *big* big as if you might get from a typical Mexican restaurant around here, let me tell you pals: It's well worth it.

Can't wait to try some new things here, sometime. In the meantime, go and try a quesadilla if you want to be flavor-blasted for the first time in Phoenix.

Great tacos and especially salsas in a somewhat crowded small shop on 16th st. Maybe the best part of the experience is loading up on the salsas from the salsa bar and going to town on warm chips. (My favorite is the peanut salsa). 

They are also really are proud of the chocolate mole which is very unique and something I have not seen at other shops. They mole is great, very flavorful, but also very intense, so make sure you want a hardy meal before ordering a dish with it! Parking can be tight, especially if you come during the lunch hour as there are only a handful of spots outside the building.

I can't even.  This place is so good.  The salsas are unique and tasty so check out the salsa bar.  My husband ordered a cactus burrito- devoured it.  He's a vegetarian and had lots of good choices!

But the big wow for me was the corn quesadillas.  I know it sounds a little unassuming but order one.  Really.  I ordered the black mole chicken quesadilla and thought I was the luckiest girl in the world when it arrived.  My husband was seriously jealous-  so much so that he immediately got up and ordered the vegetarian quesadilla... Remember that he just inhaled a burrito....  his was just as incredible as mine.  

We're now trying to figure out how many more times we can get here before we fly out Sunday.

Molé.
That's all I have to say.

If you can eat anything containing the above listed ingredient at this restaurant, I highly recommend it. You will send your taste buds on a journey not unlike the opening credits of "The Great Space Coaster". Yes...I know...that dates me.

But seriously? This place is one of the best holes-in-the-wall in the downtown area. A wide array of menu items including burros, tacos, and house specialties will not disappoint. And then there's the salsa bar - which is regularly replenished - and is yours for the taking. No waiting around for someone to bring you more salsa. YOU are the salsa master. There are always at least 12-15 different and wonderful choices. 

Their berry and nut topped Horchata is a delightful surprise that easily shareable. Though I'd rather have one all to myself. 'Cause I'm a greedy bastard.

I've never seen anyone seated at the bar, but with it's rich woodwork and veritable smorgasbord of tequilas, I'm half tempted to walk one day in with a 10-gallon cowboy hat, chaps, and plop down to have a couple shots of reposed...while turning my head slowly to give various people in the tiny but functional dining room the ol' stink eye. It's the only way I'll ever feel tough.

So my verdict? Go here. And eat. You won't be sorry. Todo bien.

Strawberry salsa?? I've never heard of such a thing....but damn it's good! It's like chips and salsa...for desert! Fish tacos were on point, flavorful and plentiful. Topped it off with a premium margarita and I tell you what, that was the best meal I ever had! Now, for a place that has such good food, they got no where to sit. There is like 4 tables here and the bar, so try and go here during a not-so-popular time during the day to eat. Being able to sit back and enjoy all the food here is well worth it. The art on the walls are cool too.
Best Mexican in Phoenix hands down. Incredible food, horchata is insane. Oh man, love this place.
If this is ur first time, order the La Santisima Specialty tacos with carne asada. You're welcome. That salsa bar though....
Excellent tacos & Unbelievable salsa.  Chips were marginal and she apologized and agreed.   Atmosphere is quaint, art is fabulous.  Outstanding combination of flavors that will keep me coming back.
The salsa bar is great. Try the strawberry salsa. Had the street tacos. Very tasty with the variety of salsas you can try with them.

First off, amazing salsa bar. Flavored I've never even seen and not sure if authentic, but great nontheless. If it weren't for Yelp, I know I would have never walked in. Wasn't necessary in a great location, but I'm so glad I went in regardless.

This place is pretty small but people popping in and out in a Saturday afternoon. Definitely a good sign but again I kinda want to keep it as my own secret place.

Got a their Cabo Shark taco and it was absolutely amazing. Also tried a bite from one of their shrimp tacos. Again amazing. Definitely coming here again.

Solid offerings and an excellent salsa bar make this dive taco bar one of the places you must visit in Phoenix.  I haven't frequented other taco bars in the area so I can't comment on how it stacks up.  However, I think if you are charging higher prices for tacos they should include the rice and beans if you order two, or be packed to the brim with filling.  I must admit I was a bit jealous when my brother got his pibil taco, as this seemed to be one of the more filled-tacos on the menu.  The shark was outstanding and had great flavor.  Seating is at a premium so be careful with larger groups. You may just want to get them togo, sit on the curb outside and have yourself an authentic Mexican experience. I'll definitely visit again next time I'm in the area.  I could see myself pouring that Cilantro salsa on some fries to make for an excellent side dish.
Slow service. Waited 15 minutes without just a bowl of chips and no order taken. One server on a Sunday wasn't a good idea. Headed elsewhere.

Went again tonight with my sisters and we shared a few tacos... great service, the waitress was super friendly, and although she was the only one there was attentive.  We ordered a burro to go, and she packed it nicely with a bag of chips.  We finished out this meal with some flan, and having had what I thought was great flan in Mexico, I was pretty impressed!

Wow!!! The food is amazing!!! The margaritas were very good as well.
Joel, our server, took great care of us!!!
Cool place to come to with family and friends.

$6.99 for 2 chicken mole tacos, rice, beans and chips and salsa?  Unreal.  I am a mole freak.  The first time I had mole it was hand made in a process that took 6-8 hours.  It spoiled me.  If mole is on a restaurant's menu I will try it and usually with disasterous results.  This is the first place in years and years....and years that has chicken mole that was as good as the homemade batch that spoiled me.  And for $6.99???  Jeeez.  I think I'm tearing up.  Also the horchada is ridiculous...Get it.

Everything here is delicious.
Best salsa bar in town. The pecan salsa is my favorite. Mexicana and pico are second favorites.
Horchata is a must.
Beware the cheezieness of the quesos!

I ordered a burrito and 2 tacos w/ rice/beans. I was charged $20.85 for what I thought was a rip off. Looking at the chicken it appears like it's been sitting at room temperature all day. It's black, dry and old looking. They must think people are stupid and won't know the difference. It's harsh to say, but I could not finish a meal I purchased due to disgust.

Stop!!!! And wait... forever.

Be prepared to have hunger pains for over an hour (at least) as you wait for your name to be called. Here's the kicker. The restaurant was full of empty frikin tables!!

I'm all in favor of waiting for a good meal...  but waiting endlessly to eat, while the restaraunt sits half empty is some sort of tortuous joke.

And they won't apologize for it, let alone have an explanation.

Go here to starve. Not to 'eat'.

I beg you. Don't go.

How's the food? I have no fu*!%ing idea! After waiting for over an hour, we left. To get good service, and good FOOD elsewhere.

Going here, after spending over $7 on an uber ride, is my first regret. Not getting a photo of the restaurant being empty, while there was a line of famished patrons waiting outside, is my second regret.

Could I have saved them??  No. Can I save you? Yes. It's my obligation.

Cheers, 
Dj

This was such a great find! The tacos were amazing and the horchata was absolutely delicious (never have seen it made that way!). The rice and beans were flavorful without being overpowering considering all of the ingredients in the tacos. We went around 2-3 pm and we're immediately seated. You must try the entire salsa bar - they're all SO different. Plus, the first bowl of chips is on the House. The service was great too!

Ya'll know I'm going to plant a solid 5 STARs for the gourmet-all-you-can-eat SALSAs in this wonderful establishment! 

Incredibly pleasing choices ranging from mild n' smokey to furious, flame-grilled. Warm chips are served and the menu is brimming with delectable, hot choices including burros, quesas, and super-tasty fillers. 

Firstly, the pecan-fruit filled horchata is like a cold, lingering dessert. And it's huge, perhaps +32ounces of deliciousness. Spoon, please!

The Mole Chicken burrito was on the *sweeter* side and although super complex and dark choco-infused, it called for 3xpinch more spice to counter the sucrose.

The beans and rice are fair to fairly good, but nothing special. I've had great refried beans in my life and La Santisima could improve on this. I'll admit. 

The melted queso dip pleased the eye but must be consumed ASAP, prior to cooling down. Order prior to entree.

The la House burro was very savory, filled with shredded, grilled chicken and finely chopped fixings.

Service was genuine and sweet. Hoping to have a party their soon! 

A clean, cozy, artful gourmet taco shop is what you can expect from La Santisima.  

Next visit:  margaritas and tacos .

Food was great, service was a bit slow as far as drinks.  But the food came out quickly.  We will be back.  Limited parking, but no fault of the restaurant other than where it's at on 7th street.  At lunch on a Saturday there was plenty of side street parking.  Boyfriend loved the horchata, said it was the best he ever had.
The food is better than average but the salsa bar is really good.

I saw the good reviews on here and decided to try it today. I was not a fan of the food at all. I left hungry because I decided not to eat my street tacos, they were still bleeding from the meat. My 3 year old loved his quesadilla though. It can be that I'm use to more authentic mexican food. I would have rather stuck with my instinct and went to salsita or El Taquito. This food is for people who has never tasted good mexican food. I wouldn't recommend this place to a hungery latino. Also its not kid friendly. Very very small inside. Everyone that left didn't look happy for some reason.
Everything here is delicious...  from the salsa bar to the quesa to the horchata to the street tacos...  I don't think you can go wrong.

Reasons why I love this place:
1. Horchata with all kinds of goodies inside, like pecans and cantaloups and strawberries, I mean these are "real" and not those freeze-dried stuff. My poblem with it is it only comes in one size--32 ounces, which is like two meals for me.

2. The salsa bar...never knew there could be so many kinds of salsa! That alone is an adventure in taste-testing. My personal fave is the jicama one, which really is more of a relish but who's checking. 

3. Chicken mole and pibil...they do it right. Their mole could be a bit spicier for my taste but that's what the salsas are there for. I had the chicken mole as a taco and the pibil as a burro (separate occasion, alright, don't think I'm a pig now).

It's a great date place, I think. It's small, it's quaint, in a good neighborhood, and the satffers are very friendy. 

I love this place so much that I didn't even care about the tiny creature scurrying across the floor near the front door. That's  not their fault though. That was just an unfortunate situation. Not a reflection of them.

So try it.
Tasty food, great horchata. But, the waitresses seemed stressed out. Nonetheless, I will be back. Really enjoyed the food. Great cheat meal.

It is all about the salsa bar.

I've eaten their tacos many times, both at the restaurant and to go.  Food is fresh and tastier than many of the other mexican eateries close by.  It isn't cheap by any means, but the salsa bar has so many choices (delicious each one) that more than makes up for the slightly higher cost.  And the choices don't just range from pico de gallo to hot to hotter.  Some are tart, some are creamy, some are smoky and hit the back of your throat, some are hot on the front end, etc.  Just go and taste it for yourself

Because I live close by, I prefer to take my tacos home because the space is very small and (because the food is so good) it can get quite cramped in no time.  (And when the unfortunate circumstance of someone bringing in a baby happens, there really isn't any way to pretend you aren't in hell no matter how much Yoda you think you can channel.)  But get there early and down a few of their happy hour margaritas you might not care about the space.  

If anyone knows of another place with a salsa bar even half as good as La Condesa's, please let me know.

For shame.   For shame.


Ok, this review is not to talk about the food at La Condesa .  I am a huge huge fan of the food and service, and everything else about this place except one thing.  While eating with a friend from Tucson, he recognized the art on the walls as being the art of famous San Francisco artist Sylvia Ji.   So we called the owner over to ask about the artist.  She told us all the art was by Mexican artists Manuel Gilavalos y Garcia and Ricardo Ramirez.   These are obvious reproductions of a young artist who is currently very hot and exhibiting all over the world.   How has La Condesa gotten away from this for so long?      

The owners probably have no idea, but this is some shameful shit, and as great of a reproduction as it looks and makes the little restaurant feel,  Sylvia should be notified and should cease and desist on these "artists".      Google Sylvia Ji  and check the La Condesa website and compare the art, and you'll see what Im talking about.   One of the paintings in there is an EXACT replica of one of her paintings.

On the rare occasion when I write a review, it's either about service, food, or both. Having been a server for 3 years, I'm very understanding and knowledgeable about the difficulties and disasters that can occur while serving. My experience at La Santisima was severely impacted by the understaffing. There was one woman on the floor and one bartender. Their roles included greeting guests, seating guests, getting water/drinks, making drinks, running food, taking orders, bussing tables, resetting tables, taking to go orders, packing up to go orders, and checking people out. I came the day after Christmas at 2pm, and every seat out of the 40 seats available at this restaurant were occupied. Not only is this impossible for two people to manage this type of volume on their own, but guest service several suffers because of it. My sister and I opted to just order to go, rather than sitting and adding another table to their load. After we ordered, We were directed to the extensive salsa bar, which would have been awesome, if half the salsa containers weren't already empty. I mean who has time to restock the salsa bar with sooooooo many other tasks to do, but as a guest it's disappointing.

The food we got to go was great! Hopefully they can get some more staff to make the whole experience more enjoyable for the guest and less stressful for those currently employed.

Best Mexican food I've had in years...and I've had a lot.  Everything was excellent, including the free salsas.  In fact, the cilantro salsa was so good I'd drink it. The quesadilla was deep fried, which I wasn't expecting.  Had I known, I'd have gotten something else.  The fried breaking was a little overpowering.  But, everything else was memorable, and we're working out how to stop again on the way out of town.

I've been here a few times and I loved it! I love their shrimp tacos and they have a salsa bar with a variety to choose from. Their displayed art work is beautiful and compliments the type of food they serve really nicely.

Amazing. Really. We were driving back to LA and we're looking for a place to stop for a quick but yummy lunch.... Found this place on Yelp and I am so glad we stopped here. Best tacos I've ever had. Salsa bar is amazing. The waitress mixed up my order so I have no idea what I ate but it was phenominal. Seriously, you need to eat here.
Fish tacos were amazing but two waiters for a jam packed restaurant. No bueno. Horchata was as nasty as it the name sounds.

One of my "go to" places in downtown Phoenix.  Food is very good, salsa bar is excellent.  Very creative menu, so you aren't stuck with just a single filling choice in your tortilla.  House special is a fave.
Place is very small, which can be an energetic environment for a meal.  However, it can also be a bit of a pain when you want to go to the salsa bar at the same time as someone else.
so so so glad I can walk here. Excellent food, tiny place, great atmosphere.  Salsa bar is unparalleled

The salsa bar was an instant hit amongst my family. The guacamole was creamy and spicy. The salsa Mexicana was our favorite. Food was wonderful and inexpensive. Service was fast considering how busy the restaurant was and there were only 2 waitresses. Would definitely recommend it!

I absolutely love this restaurant! The food is delicious!  I've tried several of their different gourmet tacos,  and they do not disappoint!! If you're looking for variety,  great prices,  and good food, don't miss this place!

Awesome flavors. We went on a Saturday around 1:00pm and the place was empty but filled up soon afterward. Service was prompt . The menu was bigger than expected and sounded pretty authentic. They have a full bar which was a plus as I was in mood for some tequila. I had the smoked marlin tacos and slow cooked pork tacos..both were incredibly flavorful and excellent. Not the best I have ever eaten but darn close and I have had a lot of great tacos in my travels. The only disappointment was I was hoping to also get a chile reano, sadly they don't offer them. I'll go back for sure when I am in Phoenix.

First thing, the food is freaking good. I never thought refried beans could actually be delicious and the margaritas were super flavorful. We had 4 different tacos and all of them were outstanding. 

One giant negative.....the lighting. They have 4 light bulbs lighting the whole restaurant. They have this great salsa bar that is their calling card and you literally can not see what you are selecting. They also have a beautiful, ornate, hand carved bar that is completely dark. 

The service is outstanding and the clientele is a great mix, from hipster to subarban.

Horrible service.  We walked in to place a to-go order and were not even acknowledged.  Then we stood there for at least 5 minutes and waited. No menu to even look at so we asked someone if we could see a menu and the man rudely told us to give him a second.  Clearly they don't need our business, so we walked out and will be taking our business elsewhere.  Also, it's pretty disgusting how you can look straight into the bathroom and see the toilet from the bar and tables.  Gross.
The Nagado taco was dope. Different from anything I've ever had. It was a little loud but the salsa bar and the food made up for that
Best tacos in Phoenix. Trust me, in from So Cal where you can get the best Mexican food in the country. This place is AMAZING!!

I just bit into the mole street taco.  Delicious.  I've lived in Puebla, Mexico, the birthplace of mole and La Condesa's is the best mole negra I've had outside of Puela.  This little restaurant is a wonderful suprise in this otherwise unassuming part of 16th Street.

Me and my partner ate here last weekend for the first time. It was busy, the wait was 20 minutes but well worth it. The prices are reasonable and parking wasn't difficult to find. The food and atmosphere are perfect.

Definite five. We're visiting PHX and trying to make as many taco stops as we can. This was a total yelp find, and we ordered based on tips. 

The horchata was exceptional--light and fruity. The best horchata I've had. Five just for that. 

Five for all three tacos we tried: Oaxacan Black Mole, Santa Condesa Mahi Mahi, and Mayan Cochinita Pibil. So good. 

And five for a varied and delicious salsa bar, great neighborhood feel, and helpful waitstaff. 

If I lived closer if be a regular!

Great place!
Reasonable price with delicious food and friendly service.
The cafe were cute and sweet, and the shop inside was beautiful and interesting.

I had AL pastor.  The meat was really well seasoned.  Great service with a friendly staff.  The salsa bar is amazing.  Plenty of options I loved the guacamole!  I would definitely come back.  They do have limited seating but the food was so good if there is a lengthy wait I'd order take out.

Amazing food. The menu offers many more interesting choices than I am used to from the other local Mexican restaurants, and they're absolutely delicious 

The service was solid.

The extensive salsa bar is worth the trip alone.

They have Anchor Steam Beer for $3.00 during happy hour (Try it, you'll like it)

Beautiful artwork on the walls, and a very laid back, non pretentious, but still classy, environment.

Awesome tacos. Salsa bar is super fresh and offers many unique combos. My favorite was the spicy peanutty salsa. Soooo good. The place looks a little dicey from the outside but the food is top notch and service is outstanding.

I am from California so used to amazing Mexican food. But this place may be my favorite yet!  I had the beef quesadilla which was prepared differently than I've ever seen.  Fried large corn tortillas with yummy tender steak and cheese inside.  Wish I had room to eat the whole huge thing!  Also sangria was a work of art.  And totally reasonably priced.  Plus really nice people. So happy I followed yelp to this wonderful place!

Fred M. pretty much said what I would say, so I won't beat a dead horse.  I'll add, though, that they offer a wide variety of deep-fried quesadillas.  

Did you catch that?

DEEP FRIED QUESADILLAS!

Our friends recommended the 16th St location a month or two ago and it was so simple yet awesome.  The salsa bar is fun and so many tasty varieties to try.  I really like the jicama, cilantro, peanut and of course traditional ones.  The menu is a little confusing but once you kind of figure it out, you're good.  I was suggested to try the grapefruit margarita by my friend and it as so refreshing.  Usually most places margarita's are loaded with that awful sour mix but this did not give me any weird after taste or belly aches :)  So of course had to get it again at this location and just the same, good!  Then last time I had tried two different tacos.  One was pork the other beef and the beef was incredible.  I then tried the beef yesterday in their quesa version and oh my.  Such a neat presentation and so good.  Loved the fresh sliced avocado on the top.  Even took half home for leftovers.  Can't wait to go back and try other items too.  I have heard about the horchata's but have not had enough room at the end of my meal to try them but maybe next time.

Been here a hand full of times and LOVE it every time I go. Their quesadillas are not like any quesadilla I've ever had; all of their tacos are delicious, they have a huge salsa bar, and the best horchata I've ever had. I'll def keep coming back.
Great food, me and my boyfriend eat here quite a few times.  Tacos are like street tacos, defiantly worth the drive.

Love this place! Great ambiance and busy. We've had to wait for a table on occasion but get there in-between times and you'll sit right away.  Cochinita pibil is the first taco we pick and then whatever else strikes the mood, you can't go wrong with the tacos. Go straight to the salsa station and try a variety of flavors, you'll be back for more! Margaritas are big and Micheladas are bigger. The walls have great art too.

This place is amazing; really everything on the menu is good. My favorites are the Cabo shrimp Tacos ( peanut salsa is a must for these) and the Chilaquiles (breakfast).  The quesadillas are also out of this world. The only downside is the dining room is very small and it tends to get busy.

The food was amazing and the salsa had a lot of verity. They have a peanut salsa that had a lot of spice and a great after taste that I highly recommend. The only problem was I had to wait 40 mins for my food but the salsa filled my time waiting.

Fellow Yelpian reviews finally got me to visit this place to try it out. I am going to keep this short and to the point.... the food was yummie.... the salsa choices were very good and I now love the strawberry salsa..... the price was fair.... the service was ok!!...  The only thing I did not like was the portions were a bit on the small side.... the pulled pork is yummie/messy.... the dogfish shark tacos were yummie.... the art was interesting... the place was clean....

Summary... I will visit it again but I did not think it was out of this world great..... but over-all a good exp....

Everything is so good. I love the salsa bar and their unique take on Mexican cuisine. Get a horchata, you won't regret it. The alcohol can be a bit pricey if you're not getting happy hour, but worth it. The margaritas are so fresh and I really love how they add a teensy bit of grapefruit.

I have tried to eat here so many times and the wait is always RIDICULOUS! There's always empty tables and the line waiting is longer than people are seating eating. It's at least a 30 min wait even though more than half the restaurant is empty.  I have come on both weekday and weekend and early around 5-6 pm.  Being a pregnant mother of a toddler waiting is just not an option. Seems like a bad business model. Go to Taco Sahuahro instead excellent cheap street tacos.
Met up a few friend here for brunch, this place in chill, nice and up beat. Art work inside of ten restaurant and on the walls outside were great.

What a awful night! I am not only ending up with a stomachache and going to the bathroom every 2h! I can't see even a picture of those plates because will make me sick again. We ask for burritos and the meat inside looks like a canning meat, the taste wasn't impressive. We asked for not spicy soup and they brought it spicy! Poor plate presentation! Although the services was good! I highly recommend not to go there!
My favorite Mexican food in Phoenix. This is a must try. The salsas for the chips are outstanding also the burritos. I always get the gaucho, is to die for. Great job, thank you.

I was excited to try this place out but after the bad customer service I walked out after 15 minutes of waiting there. I went with my husband and 6 year old son and as we walked in we saw it was busy. I didn't mind it being busy or waiting but after 5 minutes of waiting and none of the waiters greeting us and just passing by over and over again I started to get annoyed. So we stood there another 5 minutes as another group of people came in.  A couple minutes later the waiter went to them and sat them in an empty table he had just cleaned off. I was in disbelief and told my husband that it was time to leave. It was a waste of 15 minutes just standing there. I have never written a bad review before but how we were treated was awful and I hope they see this review.

We finally had an opportunity to check out La Condesa and it lived up to all the great reviews we had read.  We overordered as we wanted to try several things.

The salsa bar was fun.  It was nice to try a few different flavors.  My daughter who doesn't like spice really enjoyed the peanut salsa.  The tomatillo was exceptional as well.  

I did not think the guacamole was well executed.   There were onions, tomatos, pineapple and cilantro but it was more pico-ish than guacamole-like.  And where was the avocado?  For $3.95 the portion was relatively small.  I would definitely pass on this in the future.    

For main courses, we had the mole chicken quesa and an assortment of tacos.  

The mole was exceptional and wasn't at all bitter.  The quesa itself was flaky, crisp and delicious.   If you are a mole fan, this is a must try.

For tacos, we had the baja shrimp, slow cooked pork and carne asada.  The shrimp was cooked perfectly and the breading light and didn't overwhelm the flavors.  I loved the pork which was moist, flavorful and satisfying.  The carne asada was very good though pretty typical street taco fare.   

I will definitely dine here again.   The setting matched the food... casual, comfortable but not your typical mexican fare.  It's definitely a step above.

Very nice atmosphere. There is a good selection of coffee and pastries. The drinks are made pretty fast, even when it is crowded. There is plenty of space to sit and enjoy your beverage. Many people go to work on their computers or study. It is a fairly loud environment, so if you're looking for a quiet library setting you won't find that here.
I've been all over the web to find out how much you charge for your fancy tacos. Can't find your prices..code for toooo high for me. Sorry.

Best tacos I've had during my week in Phoenix, with a literal buffet of well-made salsas to match. 

Busy and a little disorganized at lunch (they needed one more person to help handle the crowd), it's worth seeking out.

Get the horchata with fruits and pecans, too - it's great.
I love this place. Very welcoming staff and authentic food. Every time friends visit from out of state, this is always a dinner spot request. The name change has in no way changed the flavor. Thanks.

The food is simply AMAZING. Some of the best pastor and chicken mole I've tasted. The margaritas as so good that its all I've ever had to drink there lol. I've heard the horchata is good. The place is small and the place is super small but that still won't stop me from going. I wish the staff members were more friendly or even attempted to greet you. When they see you they kind of look away and its awkward. The service is not fast at all, and you will be lucky if you get a full sentence out of the waiters, especially the lady. They are lucky the food is literally AMAZING!
Yes!! Go here! Order anything and it will be delicious. Guacamole and horchata are highlights!
Definitely one of favorite restaurants ever. Everything from their margaritas to their burritos to their salsa is so awesome. Their speciality burrito is my favorite.

Authentic Mexican food made with quality ingredients in a comfortable setting. Salsa bar has great variety from the usual to ones with strawberry. Munch on salsa and chips while they make your food which does take a little time as it's cooked to order. I like my food spicy but like to counter it with their horchata which is chock full of fruit and pecans. My favorites are the chicken mole and grilled veggie tacos.

This is my FAVORITE taco shop! Every salsa is unique and delicious. Margaritas are some of the best I've ever had out - not too sweet, yummy citrus pulp for flavor. Amazing horchata. Beautiful artwork. Kind of small inside so you may have to come at a slightly odd hour to be sure you get a seat. Oh! I almost forgot about the guacamole! Very fresh and very tasty!

Had the Mole and it was great!!!!!  I had the horchata it had great flavor but I wasn't a fan of the extra noise on top of it, next time I will hold on the extras and just ask for the drink. My wife had the fish tacos and LOVED them.

I'm in town from a place where we don't have Mexican food (how could I live in such a place?). We went to three taco shops in three days. This was the best - rich flavors and tortillas which held up to salsa!! My friend had a Norteno green chile burro - she couldn't stop talking about it, either. I can't wait to go back on my next visit to AZ!

La Condesa is amazing.  I'll keep this review short and sweet...

Short wait is well worth it. 
Horchata is amazing
The Mahi Mahi Burro might change your life... if i wasnt already in a relationship with the Jalapeno Cilantro Hummus from Pita Jungle, i might actually try to make love with this burrito.  

Everything about this place is great.  Eat here... if you don't, you are probably crazy... maybe you are the dude at Circle K that is always talking to himself by the dumpster...  That dude creeps me out a little bit.    So, i guess the moral here is:  Eat at La Condessa, so you don't end up talking to a dumpster.  That is all.

First time visit, late Saturday night. Food was good, though presentation wasn't too pretty. Ordered a burrito and when served, that's all that was on my plate. A little sauce and maybe a sprinkle of cheese with some garnish would have painted a prettier picture, but it nevertheless tasted very good. We shall return.
My advice would be to try and go at a time other than customary meal times, so you can find a table.
We LOVE this place. All of the ingredients are really fresh and delicious. The unique salsa bar is a nice touch as well.
Oh my the namesake taco was fantastic!   Salsa bar was good but the tacos and the burro's are no joke either!  Worth the wait!

This is one of the best mexican restaurant that I know of. I was visiting Phoenix for a week. I had bookmarked this place because lots of "vegetarians go nuts for it".

On the first night in Phoenix, my friend and I drove here for dinner at 8 PM. Neighbourhood is very quite/rundown/sketchy. However, the restaurant was fully packed. Just when we entered through the door, everyone looked at us. May be this is what people in Phoenix do. It felt a little weird as if we were crashing someone's party. We were seated at a table just emptied by someone else. That table was not very clean.

We got a basket of chips and started getting salsas. I was in salsa heaven. I like spicy food. This place serves it very well. We ended up ordering their La Santisima burritos and quesos. Another order of chips. Decided to come back again before we go back from Phoenix. I liked the burrito better than the queso.

I don't want to spend more time in Phoenix. However, this will be go to spot for one meal when I am there. Definitely worth the wait and experience. Price is very reasonable.

So bummed. We have been going to this place for years which is why I gave it 2 stars over 1. In the food biz service is everything and this place has broken my heart. We brought a friend here from NY ranting and raving about the food the whole way. When we arrived we were quickly embarrassed as the entire staff treated us as if we were invisible. We stood by the "please wait to be seated" sign for almost 10 min. as the staff worked hard to not make eye contact with us. We ultimately had to ask the busser if there was a host. Half the restaurant was empty. They easily could have acknowledged us, sat us, offered chips and told us the kitchen was behind. Instead they chose to completely ignore us making us feel as if they wanted us to just turn around and walk out. We took the hint and went to Pepe's Taco Villa where they made us feel at home.

Oh my gosh. What a totally different experience from my last visit.  I will come back during the week to eat, but the staff on the weekend was horrible.  I sent my food back twice and it still came back to me wrong.  The waitress didn't speak a word of English and could not understand at all what I wanted. I ordered the exact same entrée I had the last time I was here but it was a totally different meal that was delivered to me. I even showed them the picture I posted in Yelp as to what my food should look like. They tried to match the picture, but they had no clue. So disappointed! I could go on and on, but I won't. Again I don't recommend going on the weekend.  The thing that shocked me the most was even after the horrible experience with the food being sent back, I had to pay the full check. If a customer sends something back twice and it still comes back wrong, they should not be charged.  The food should be the same no matter when it is ordered.

I've been to La Condesa three times this week for the mole chicken tacos. I think about them all the time. This place is cozy inside with a big salsa bar which I'm working my way through.  Be sure to try the cilantro cream! The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because service can be a bit slow, even when there are only two tables of people. And also, I nearly lock myself in the bathroom every time because that darn latch is so hard to open.

Tiny, tiny place with food to die for!  The burritos are outta this world.  Lots of salsa to choose from with tasty chips.  Everything we've had has been delicious. I usually get the al pastor burrito and finish it later at home.

DELICIOUS TACOS! I loved this restaurant. The margaritas were BEUNO!!! I would definitely suggest visiting here if you are coming from out of town. It is a great hole in the wall. Be patient, just be patient and enjoy the experience here. They do a great job managing the wait and the food hardly took long for how busy they were.

Wow wow wow wow wow
Best Mexican around. Only reason I tried this place was because of all the reviews. Doesn't look like much from the outside but it was amazing. Awesome salsa bar! The guacamole is different but awesome! The street tacos with great too. I'll be coming back to try more stuff!

WOW!!!!  Arizona already has the best Mexican food around, but this place is truly a gem.  All the sauces are homemade and present a wide spectrum of flavors.  My favorite unique items from the salsa bar were the peanut salsa (spicy, most likely has habaneros in it), pecan salsa (similar but very mild with interesting flavor), strawberry salsa, and jicama salsa.  Everything was incredibly fresh.  After sampling everything from our group, I would recommend getting one of their mole dishes (the mole is stellar) or the mahi mahi fish tacos.  Also, their house made guacamole was amazing; very unique and chunky with lots of different veggies in it.  I will be back again and again.

Three visits before the last I would have reviewed much higher.  

As a self proclaimed salsa snob, I like that I can try such a variety and found several that were spot on.  From Hot! to exotic.  I could just go in for chips and salsa bar and savor one of the jalapeno, cilantro margaritas! Caution, they use fresh jalapenos so sometimes they are much spicier than others.  My friend loved the tamarind margarita. 

Prices look high but you get a lot for the money.  Their burritos are HUGE and most of the tacos are made with full size double corn tortillas. There are many choices to fit all tastes.  However, I would not recommend the fish tacos.  I ordered the baja style and could not eat it.  It tasted as if it had been frozen for a long long time.  The other tacos tried were very good. 

Our last trip in, there were 4 of us, no problem getting a table on Friday at 4pm but the service was terrible..  Not sure if they were breaking in new staff or what.  In three visits, I knew their menu better than the waiter did and he had no knowledge of their "special house margaritas".  Service as really slow and they kept making mistakes on the drink orders.  

I will give them another try.

A great taco spot can be judged by the salsa. I pony up to the La Condesa salsa bar and prepare to judge. Today's salsa varieties included strawberry, cilantro, guac, and my fav a spicy salsa with tamatillios. Spicy, complex, AUTHENTIC, developed flavors exploded in my mouth as I sampled a rainbow of salsa with the chips that arrive before my tacos. Instantly, I could tell,  La Condesa Gourmet Taco Shop knows what they're doing in the kitchen, they care about quality, and are super fresh.  

If Mexican food can be judged by salsa, a good Mexican restaurant can also be judged by the frijoles. These beans did not disappoint. Great flavor, perfect consistency, delicious salty cheese on top. MMMMM! 

The Main Event: Tacos. Yay! Roasted Veggies: Awesome! Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco: WOAH! My lunch buddy declared: "This is as good as my favorite taco stand in Mexico!" (She lived there for 6 years!) How's that for authentic?! The Horchata may be the best in town. Definitely homemade, with strawberries, mmmmm. Not too sweet or watery. I can not wait to try the fried quesidillias.  

With food this delicious, decor may not matter, however the inside is cozy & clean with heavy wooden tables and contemporary chicano art. I especially love the doors to the banos. 

Prices are completely fair, cheaper than a combo at a chain restaurant. Meal for two with drinks was $20.

Taco Row is one reason i struggle with the thought of leaving the southwest. Salsa and tacos this phenomenal are difficult to recreate too far from the border. La Condesa, the new kid on the block, is worthy of praise & adoration.  i look forward to a long, delicious affair.

I enjoy both authentic Mexican tacos and excellent variations of the originals. The restaurant offers both. The simple and delicious street style tacos are as good as the ones cooked on the carts on the side of the streets in Mexico. The shrimp taco was also divine. The salsa bar was a treat. The chips were just ok.
Spicy and amazing food! Kinda want to keep this one secret, yes it a place you def don't want to turn into a tourist joint. Also the name has changed on the exterior signs.
Aztec Tinga Tacos were amazing, service was acceptable. The salsa bar is great too. I did't try any cocktails but the food was amazing I will be back.

You'll want to legalize immigration, for sure, once you try this food and salsas. The salsa bar brings strawberry, pecan, cilantro and other 8 or so collection of salsas to be savored with your basket of chips.  An array of hotness, so sweet, yes!  This food will make you question what the heck was that other Mexican food you once thought to be delicious.  This is true Mexico City cuisine. 

I've been to Mexico City and have tasted el sabor verdadero, now here in Phoenix, is a family owned restaurant that brings this authentic Mexican flavor to you and yours and you will say thank you its here.  Provecho!

Keep up the good work to be great Condesa!  Gracias.

I'm visiting from San Diego where we have the best Mexican food . The menu , I didn't really get so I ordered the soup which was great ! A little bit of direction on where to order would be good . The line was long the people in front of me didn't know where to order, they just passed me a menu . I stood in line hoping that that was what I was supposed to be doing . My star rating is for the salsa bar , I'm very impressed. It's hard to find places that offer a hot salsa

AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME!!!
The place is small and if you have to wait, don't worry it is worth your time.
Great tacos, delicious micheladas! Great selection of sauces, love the decor. Service was friendly and prices are good.
This place is Tha sh*t!! Im glad I stopped by great food amazing flavor ! The chicken specialty tacos best tacos I've ever had in my whole entire life no joke!

Holy. Cow. This place is the real deal. From their salsa to their margaritas- i can not get enough of this place! The portions are great and the food is spectacular melt in your mouth Mexican. It's a tiny place with great service. Definitely check it out.

I'm not one to review very often, but this place is hands down my favorite restaurant I've ever been to in my life. I'm an arizona native and like to think I know a thing or two about Mexican food and this place has perfected it.

Must try: cochinita pibil taco 


Their whole menu is great but that taco alone I could eat every day of the week. 

Don't pass this place up!

I was nervous about the location (not the safest looking part of town) but was quickly and pleasantly surprised to find we made the right choice. This restaurant is tiny (maybe 10 tables), so the one waitress would seem like enough, but with the popularity of this place she could have used more help. I orders the vegan burrito and was so happy. Wrapped in a freshly made tortilla, veggies delight with all the right spice.

Like everyone else said, the atmosphere and artwork are what really make the place! We ate around 7pm and luckily we only had a 5 minute wait but I could see there being a long wait during the dinner rush since there's limited seating. I highly recommend the guacamole dip, I have no idea what's in it but it's so unique and delicious (I think it has mangoes and cranberries?). I also had the shark tacos which were good!

This is hands down one of my favorite taco shops ever! The restaurant itself is pretty small inside, but it is always packed because it is a local favorite. There is a salsa bar with around 15 different types that you can sample for your chips and dinners. Every time I go I get two fish tacos, and they always hit the spot. The different alcoholic drinks look amazing, and I will have to try one of those the next time I come! I have tried taking every person I love here just to share this favorite of mine with them!
Everytime I go, I am reminded just how good the food is. Not to mention the quality is fantastic. If you haven't been, you are missing out.

OMG this place is simply amazing. Delicious gourmet shrimp & fish tacos and the best salsa bar in town. I've been here a dozen times and I've yet to sample all of them (mostly because the "salsa cilantro" is ridiculous). It gets a little crazy during lunch time. The only knock on this place is the side of rice amount (the amount of beans is good - not fan of beans though) you get when you spend the extra $1 and get the taco "plate." But you can always get a street taco for $1.25 MORE you would spend other wise on the "plate"... If you're not a fan of beans.

My parents came into town last month, and they always want me to take them out to eat.  I, however, don't go out to eat, so it makes it really hard.  La Condesa isn't far from our house, and I've been wanting to try it, so we went there.  The food was amazing!  Even my mom - who is the pickiest eater I know - liked it!  The different salsas at the bar are great, and the food is delicious.

The fresh salsa bar is the featured attraction.  20 - 30 types daily with differences nearly every day.  The food is great-to-fantastic.  Decor is nice and the space is small and tight.  Don't expect table service - go to the counter, order and pay.  They will bring you your food.  If you are looking for white linen napkin experience, go to The Barrio.  If you want some of the best salsa and tacos in town - come here.

The food is some of the best Mexican food in Arizona.  The service is terrible though.  They have recently expanded their seating, which is great, but it doesn't seem that they have expanded their Kitchen capacity.  The wait staff is not very friendly.  Not unfriendly, but they don't add anything to the dining experience.  Food takes a long time, usually 30+ minutes to get your food.  This makes it hard to take our kids here, as they find it hard to wait for their food that long.  We go here a lot, because the food is amazing, but that is the only reason.  If they had the service aspect of dining, it would be one of the best restaurants in the state.
Delicious vegan tacos. Lots of vegan/vegetarian options. The salsa bar has lots of variety. The staff are friendly and the place looks really cool. The plates are earthenware and look cool too

This place was awesome.  From their website: 

Our aim is to deliver everything that is exciting and fresh about Mexican cuisine to the people of Arizona, banishing old perceptions of heavy, greasy, taste bud-searing, so-called "Tex-Mex."

And they nailed it.  There were 13 different salsas when we went, and all differing with heat and ingredients.  Not a traditional place.

Be aware: there's not too many tables, and waiting seems to be expected by patrons.

Been wanting to try this place for a while and finally did. Had the carne asada street taco plate with jamacia. It was delish -- took me back to Rocky Pointe vacations. The beans are authentic and the rice is white Salvadorian style. Great art work and service. Can't wait to go back.

The food and drinks are by far one of the best I've had. But if you are a patient then this location might not be for you. Although the food and drinks are very good, the service was not so good. We waited about 30min for our drinks...2 micheladas, a sprite and a horchata. Another 45 min after for our food. I probably won't come back to this location, but definitely to the phx one.

Their quesas are the bomb.com!  They're very big, so you can totally split one with a friend.  The salsa bar was great and had different varieties of salsas and guacamole.  We went there around 11:30 and it was pretty busy, but that's not surprising for a place that has really good food eh?  I'll definitely be back to try more! :)

We were excited to try this place bases on the reviews.  I am giving this 4 stars because it was kind of a long wait (35 minutes) and there aren't a lot of benches outside to sit, (also it was hard to get water refills during our dinner.) But once inside, it is totally worth it!  The salsa bar is very unique and I liked how I could sample so many different kinds.  I got the mole tacos and would recommend trying one and maybe a different kind.
Food was fantastic, had the Marlin Kay-so-dillas. Horchata was off the chain! going to be going back soon. Our server was great and friendly.
Amazing food! You must try the horchata and the mole tacos! I could eat here twice a week.
Probably the best tacos in town. Please don't move!!! Also, being Hispanic I've had my fair share of Horchata's in my life...this one tops them all, it's more like an Horchata Salad, just brilliant!

Amazing salsa bar! There wasn't one that I disliked, although there was a chipotle one that I loved the most. The pastor tacos were the best of the street tacos we tried. Amazing flavor! The carne asada was okay; not great. Would go back for the salsa, pastor, and to try other things.

Amazing food! I haven't had quality Mexican food since moving out if So. Cal, but La Santisima is delicious! A plain chicken burrito is a bit pricey but anything unusual (shark or smoked marlin) is the same price.

Just left this "Kitchen Nightmare" on Cinco De Mayo. The moment we walked in we could tell the food would be good. Unfortunately, the vegetarian Quesa was basically a pocket of air and tasted like it was fried in something that fries fish.The place is being run without strategy or organization; staff wanders around aimlessly without purpose, empty tables everywhere, bussed and not, and the bar was full of dirty dishes so no where to sit on CINCO DE MAYO on a Friday night. Meanwhile, patrons were left to wait for up to 45 minutes while the incompetence continued. The manager (ponytail) has no clue what he's doing, seemed to make his staff uncomfortable, and makes customers uncomfortable. The guy is really unprofessional and we couldn't wait to leave.  Not going to return here until changes are made. Also to the manager: stop touching the arm of your waitresses, it's creepy. -Former waitress of 4 years.

I saw 450 plus reviews and almost 5 star rating. Well here is another 5 star. The menu is a little overwhelming at first. So I tried the Cabo Shrimp taco. Amazing. Then the smoked marlin taco. More amazing. Then the tinc a chicken taco. OMG. The salsa bar is extensive all made from scratch. I tried six of them and they were all terrific.  The salsa peanut and salsa strawberry really stood out.

Okay.... Where was the strawberry salsa? The Guacamole was gone too.  I went here with my sister and was so confused with the menu. It was posted on the wall and it was so hard to read. Why was it posted on the side and not in the front? The place was okay. I ordered the the shrimp tacos and got fish. They messed up my order, but they were busy...oh well. The fish was good though, so I didn't complain. I'll try it again and give it another chance.

Amazing house recipe horchata.
Salsa bar to die for. 
Street tacos: the BEST. 
Will go back as often as we can. 
Tamarindo Margarita AMAZING!
The service was a little bit slow but worth the wait after visiting here from the East Coast it was great to get some real authentic Mexican food I had the shark tacos & recommend to everyone
Steak tacos are awesome. ..so is salsa bar! Make sure you come by early, for no wait.

Wow! We pulled up to this place with some skepticism, but after entering we  immediately knew we were in for a great lunch. With a salsa bar in the corner, we were given chips and first tried 3 different salsas. We ordered two types of tacos and a chicken mole quesadilla to share. The tacos were good, and the quesadilla was like a fluffy fried calzone. Absolutely delicious! The only bump was the fact I ordered my taco with no mushrooms and it came with them, but I didn't mind that much. 

My husband had a hornitos margarita which was good as well. Next time we're in Phoenix we will certainly be back!

This was a great find! We enjoyed the homemade horchata which was bursting with flavors like cinnamon, nutmeg, fruit and nuts.  Equally as delish was the guacamole. This is not your typical guacamole. It was more chopped than mashed and had dried cranberries in it. Very tasty. I had the cabo tacos and the beer batter was too thick for my liking, but my fiancé ordered a chicken taco and it was much better. When I come back again, I will try non-beer battered tacos!

As much as I love their veggie quesa and amazing salsa bar, I am taking them down a star because I found out they use lard in their rice and beans.  As a vegetarian, this really limits the menu items I can eat.  

Veggie quesa is pretty much the only thing I can get.  It is fantastic so it is worth going just for that.  Actually, I'd probably even go just for the salsa bar.  But I wish I could explore other options too.
Hole in way gem,not to be missed. Great tacos ..good serving size..salsa bar is great..margaritas with real alcohol. Super value for money

I really want to give them five stars. I love: the art, the atmosphere, the super friendly servers. 

I think I would have loved many of the salsas, but they ran out of cups & had small plates to put the salsas on instead. Dude, it's really hard to dunk a tortilla chip into a plate of salsa. I tried the cilantro & the tomatillo & both were great, but couldn't muster the effort trying to scrape another flavor off the bottom of a plate.

The Mayan pork taco was damn near perfect, but I thought the chicken mole was a little too much on the sweet side.

QUE BUENO!!!  Been to this one and the one in Flag and both have been INCREDIBLE!  The food is beyond fantastico!  The tacos, the burritos, and the salsa bar are just awesome!  The salsa bar alone is pretty amazing, with all the different types.  The drinks are great, too and not at all stingy on the pour.  Love this place!

This place is one of the best experiences in the city! They opened up years ago under a different name without a liquor license but with the same sexy, sexy salsa bar. They got awards a few years in a row from The New Times seven or eight years ago when they were new. (That's actually how my college friends and I found about about them in the first place.) I think they've had to go through some phases with the salsa bar-everyone used to come in and just take twenty salsas home, so they went from limiting how many salsa containers you could get to how many lids you could get to at least limit take-home, and recently i've seen them just allow you to grab as much as you want again because no one has the time anymore to take ten-there are too many people crowded around you! If there's one thing that's constantly changed over the years I've been going here, it's that every year that goes by this place gets more crowded. One day, they'll need a bigger restaurant. Until then, I'm sure they'll continue to add gorgeous decorations like the fly paintings and the beautiful bar. OK: on to the food!

I've noticed a few expansions in the menu in recent years, but I'm going to stick to describing the basics here because they're what make this place so good. (Well... basic foods done impressively well, and intriguingly not-basic salsas.) The menu is great here because they have regionally themed dishes for various mexican states-not all 31, just a handful, but each one is starkly different, comes with different toppings and it's possible to have each meat various ways. basically you can get your meats as tacos, burros or as a quesadilla. You're going to have to just think about it before ordering-they'll make you whatever you want, but some combinations are better than others. For instance, a Mole burrito is baller, having Cochinita Pibil is just brain-melting in a quesadilla, and I could eat their fried shark tacos any day of the week. (The steak is good every way.) Don't blame the restaurant if your Mole quesadilla doesn't make a lot of sense, haha-they'll give it to you the way you ask for it. Just pay attention to the toppings when you're picking your mode of dinner. You won't regret it. I seem to have mentioned the best things in my personal opinion already... the cochinita pibil is perfect and I only know one other restaurant in AZ that makes it right, and it's much more of a fine dining place than la santisima here, so I give them a lot of points for correctly marinating the queen's dish, one of the best meats I've ever had. It's easy to describe the meats: perfect. Time to move on to the salsa.

The award winning salsa bar is second to nothing in the city. If you don't try the peanut salsa, you're missing out. Even though it's changed over the years from a spicy cream salsa to a spicy salsa and back to a spicy cream salsa, it's always been phenomenal. The pecan is more of a cream since it's not spiced like the peanut. The "red pepper" isn't exactly salsa-it's red pepper oil, and if you have a leftover side of it, fry pork chops in it... you'll be all set to go back to santisima the next day to start it all again! There's everything from pico to several types of vegetable salsas, and the cilantro cream is good at cutting the heat you've added to any dish. 

If you want to taste some of the food people leave Arizona talking about, look no further than this fun little hole in the wall. One of the plus sides is probably going to be that you could come back to this place on every visit, and bring your kids and grandkids here someday: hopefully this gem never leaves the streets of our spicy valley!

Best tacos in town. It's a very small restaurant so you might have to wait but it's well worth it. The food is fresh and reasonably priced. The salsa bar alone makes it worth the trip. The Margaritas are also very good if a little pricy.

I was brought here for lunch by a co-worker, and it's now my go-to dinner on the way out to Coyotes games.

The tacos are out of this world, but even better is the salsa bar.  Peanut salsa? Cilantro salsa? Pico? Yes, and more; over 10 salsas made fresh daily on site. The place is small and decorated brilliantly in a Dia de Los Muertes theme year-round. 

Sometimes the waitstaff can seem a little disinterested, but during lunch you order from the bar and sit down whenever something frees up. 

Don't go here for the service, go here for the amazing food and enjoy a little taste of Mexico in Phoenix.

La Condesa was the final push to convince me to sign up for Yelp.  I've been using Yelp for years to find everything from local cuisine to family doctors but now it's time to share.  So here goes...

La Condesa was excellent.  From the moment we entered through the heavy spanish doorway, to the smart and humble decor - we knew we had found something unique.  

Our server was polite, engaging, and insightful.  We've been searching for the ultimate Baja-style Fish Taco so we chose a-la-carte tacos this time and will return later for the full meal.  What we did experience this time was a dream come true in the land-locked state of Arizona.  The two pieces of fish in each taco were huge, hot, and crispy, wrapped in a light corn tortilla with a liberal covering of cabbage and white sauce.  With the first bite I was instantly taken back to memories of lounging beach-side in Mexico, or more recently the taco shops of Southern California.  My second and continued bites were adjusted to new heights of flavor with the plethora of home-made salsas available.

I can't wait to return and plan to bring friends!

Troy.
went to the one on 16th st...food was great but place too small.

Food let's just say it was  OK ........had better but the waiting time worst I've had in years we waited 45 to 1hr  just for our food 

I DON'T RECOMMEND THIS PLACE unless your willing to wait.

I wish they had better service they have a lot of staff but only one server for all tables

My family's first time here. We heard great things so we HAD to come. We had a 20 min wait unless we wanted to sit at a dark (no light)table. We didn't want to wait so we accepted. It was darker than I had expected. The table wasn't cleaned so we grabbed napkins to clean it and the hostess finally comes and cleans it for us. We got our chips and was told the salsa bar was behind us. There was no salsa at the bar. We asked for the salsas to be refilled 4 times.  Our food came out at separate times. We had no silverware. I asked for flour tortillas for my soup and didn't get them. It wasn't a great experience. I'm not sure we'll be coming back.
Truly delicious gourmet mexican food.  Don't miss the house guacamole with mangos and raisins and the burrito El pastor.

Is there a secret door I don't know about? My expectations were way to high I guess. Definitely won't make a special trip back over and probably wouldn't stop back by even if I was hungry and close. Pickled red onions in a burrito doesn't constitute next level Mexican cuisine. I think the high rating is for environmental authenticity.

Is this real? Are they serious with this? The ambiance was small, cozy, and art was hung on the wall that was really very good. Unbelievable service and food. All the salsas at the bar were stellar and my shark tacos were dynamite. I'm kind of a sucker for rice and beans and I think it's hard to mess up but I've still had some awful rice and beans at some other spots. Luckily, this place had some of the best I've had in a while. The prices were great, helped by a wonderful happy hour. I will be coming back for more because everyone loves tacos and La Santisima does tacos well.

Holy delicious batman! 
These tacos were amazing! Very very filling. I only ordered two and walked away completely satisfied. They have a cornucopia of salsas! 

I wish I could tell you what I had but I could not choose so I asked out server to pick two  out for me. My coworker did the same thing.

However with his, we asked about one ( his favorite) it was the shark taco.

It's quite small so lunch time it gets very packed. I would recommend getting there a bit earlier or later than noon.

This place is delicious. The Sur Baja Shark taco and The Gaucho taco are the bomb. Plus the Pecan Salsa with the Strawberry Salsa are amazing. Also they make their margaritas with tequila not the margarita mix. We will be coming back!
Great tacos... its a small place. But the food is great. Careful with the salsas, some are super hot!

Horrible. I don't understand the ratings.  Chips we're  flavorless, salsa bar was sad and everything almost empty, after saying I was gf brought me a burrito obviously messed my order up and when they finally brought correct dish out it was cold. Seriously what a disappointment! Waitress had an attitude and just did not care. If you are used to good quality food and good service do not come here.

Best tacos I've ever had. Ate the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco (pork shoulder taco) as well as the Baja Surf Dogfish Shark Taco. The pork shoulder was my favorite because of how well the marinations blended with the pork as well as the small hint of cinnamon... Fucked up good! Both tacos came with a plate of rice and beans.  As mentioned before the pork shoulder taco has cinnamon in it which my girlfriend is allergic to so she switched if for the Sonoran Carne Asada Taco. The carne asada was well done and you could taste the mesquite charcoal it was made on. The salsa bar is another reason why this restaurant is good, due to  how diverse it was. There were so many salsas that we couldn't test them all before the chips ran out; can't remember the names of all of them, but the peanut salsa was awesome.
Man this place is BOMB. They have a ton of salsas. I highly recommend it.

This place is just amazing. Good prices, consistently excellent food and friendly/helpful staff. 

First off, you pick your own salsas, whaaa!? the salsa bar - strawberry salsa! pecan salsa! cilantro salsa! so so so many to choose from and always fresh. 

My favorite burrito is the Mahi mahi specialty, but the Mole, and veggie are also a hit. 

I have been going to this restaurant since I moved out here over 1 year ago and continually recommend it.

Make sure you get a Horchata if you are in the mood for a sweet drink. It has melon, strawberries and pecans in it! Delicious and worth trying!

Now go and tell all your friends about this place.

Current favorite Mexican place in Phoenix. Will have a spot on the permanent rotation. Have tried 3 types of their tacos so far and none of them disappoint, but the fish tacos have to be my favorite so far.
Great tacos.  Burrito was good but bit salty.   Doesn't look like much from outside but we had great lunch there.
The food here is excellent.  The atmosphere is fun and they have a great salsa bar.

It is the superlative bean and cheese burrito in Phoenix! Classic taste and the refried beans are not cooked in lard, which is nice for vegetarians to know and whatever oils they use give them a good savory taste. No bland beans here! If dairy is not your thing, the Ghandi Vegan burrito has fresh guacamole and black beans matched by no other. And if the entrees weren't enough, there is also THE best salsa bar of all time. The red chipotle salsa must have some sort of addictive substance in it, as I cannot stop at just two servings. 
The service is top notch and the atmosphere is mellow. 
My only issue is that it's kinda hard to see from the road. But you can see the sign pretty easy if you're looking for it.
This place was such a pleasant surprise. The food was absolutely delicious, the salsa bar was great, and the grapefruit margarita was super refreshing. Will certainly be back!

1st time at this restaurant I was surprised they make you wait outside the building for a table.  Because it's  really small inside, 10 total tables... 30 minute guarantee wait.  Noticed two dirty tables were available while we waited, those 2 dirty tables only sat 2.   Decent food, probably an 8/10.  Those 2 dirty tables were never cleaned until we finished eating.  By the time we were done eating 6 groups of people were waiting outside and there were 6 dirty tables waiting to be cleaned for these 6 people.  Only 10 total table in this place and they are making people wait 30 minutes just so they can get around to cleaning them.  Customers kept coming in and they would tell them 25 minute wait.   As a customer eating in the restaurant this will drive you nuts and make your experience a 4/10 and not want to come back.  Just because they make people wait outside in the heat when tables are sitting dirty for 30 minutes.

Lunchtime is very hard to find a seat, but once you do you're treated with a great selection of unique and well-known Spanish staples. Worth the drive for lunch or dinner if you're not from the area, check out the shark tacos!

Of the countless Mexican restaurants in Phoenix, it's hard to find one with an authenticity to it that brings back memories of Mexico City. Fortunately, La Condesa, an excellent taco shop in an unlikely location, succeeds. The first time I went there, I wasn't quite sure what to expect, as I had been recommended numerous times by family members and friends. 

What I noticed immediately was the eclectic selection of homemade salsas. From smoky peanut sauce to deliciously sweet avocado salsa, Condesa has just about everything a chips & salsa lover could imagine. As for the chips themselves, they're actually warm and delicious even when not dipped in one of the many salsas offered. Condesa makes you believe that the chips are being made in the kitchen right before they bring them to your table, even if this isn't the case.

The restaurant's atmosphere perfectly matches the food, with excellent music playing at all times and fascinating art adorning every wall of the room. Based mostly off of classic Mexican art and architecture, La Condesa is beautiful to look at it if you decide to dine alone. Even if you are with friends or family, the many art pieces hung around the room will surely spark a conversation; they're all gorgeous and full of Mexican history.

For the main course, I had a Veggie Burrito with a side of rice and refried beans. Just about everything was absolutely delicious, and pouring a little bit of salsa on it made it even tastier. The beans weren't very full of flavor but were definitely enjoyable especially when eaten with the rice and burrito. 

Since my first visit, I've tried a variety of foods at Condesa but my favorite so far has to be the Shark Meat Burrito. Before trying it there I had never eaten shark meat before and always wondered what it could taste like.
