To my surprise, it was actually delicious and made for the perfect filling to an already delicious burrito filled with mushrooms, spinach, melted cheese, and garlic.

To drink I only had a pink lemonade, but the person I came with had Condesa's famous Horchata. While I'm used to the delicious and legendary Horchata from Mexico, I did enjoy the Horchata at Condesa, even if it wasn't as perfect as some of the more authentic renditions that I've tried over the past couple of years. 

The fountain drinks are served in large cups, the kinds that you see in gas stations directly off the freeway, complete with a plastic lid and straw. Of course, the presentation wasn't anything fancy, but the cup is so large that needing a refill is unlikely, something I enjoyed (especially when the place is extremely busy, making it near impossible to get speedy service).

This brings me to my final, and only entirely negative, point. Where Condesa is lacking is in the service. While all the servers are very nice and accommodating, the food has a tendency to take a while to get to the table, especially if the restaurant is busy. With room for about 20 or 30 people at the very most, Condesa is a small restaurant, one that operates with a maximum wait staff of about three at all times. 

The best advice I can give you is to take your trip to Condesa before the lunch rush, or before the dinner rush. The enjoyable experience of the food and atmosphere will be quickly deflated once the restaurant reaches 65% capacity or more. The tables are far too close together and eavesdropping on another group's dinner conversation is entirely unavoidable. It's best to not come with massive groups, as the restaurant prides itself on its intimacy. 

Anyone looking to try authentic Mexican food should come to Condesa immediately. While I'm one to enjoy places like Filiberto's almost any day of the week, the experience you'll have at Condesa is one that few other restaurants in Phoenix can offer. The prices aren't extremely high, and the food is worth every penny.

This place is delicious we got tacos and a burrito both came with plenty of meat and choice of rice and beans. The salsa bar is amazing so much to choose from and the staff is super friendly. This place is also family friendly which is a plus since it's very difficult to go out with a baby. Will definitely be returning.

I love the food here, ans their salsa bar is always kept stocked and clean.  Every time I have visited the restaurant there is a bit of a wait time, but it is worth it.  Portions are pretty well for price of food (which is reasonable).   I live closer to their location in Glendale but will rather drive to this location due to better service, food and cleanliness.

Small joint, delicious food. You must try the Mole Quesadilla, I've never had anything like it, and it was the best thing I have ever eaten, maybe in my life! We thought about ordering a couple to take home, but we didn't (but we should have!!). We also tried 4 of their tacos, you can't go wrong with any choice. On the way out, we ordered the horchata and it was great. Lots of cinnamon, just sweet enough, good for a dessert. There are some fruit bits in there, and I am usually not a fan of stuff flying up the straw like that, but it was fine. There is also a large salsa bar, many varieties to choose from. I'm looking forward to going back to this place.

I came here expecting yummy food after a long flight from Miami and I was so disappointed! First of all, let me start by saying this is not a $ sign place, I would say more like $$. We ordered an horchata, which was pretty good (but then again I've never had one before so... no comparison there). We ordered the mix and match tacos and all I can say is I don't ever want to try mexican food again. I'm cuban, so I know about flavor and good hispanic cooking, but these were not blah! There was no flavor, out of the 3 mini tacos I ordered the only one with SOME flavor was a chicken one that was loaded with onions and spicy sauce. So you can guess, it simply tasted spicy. Overall, if you find another place with good reviews go there. I thought this place would be great due to the 1000+ reviews and the 4.5 rating, but I was greatly disappointed and ended up paying $40 for 6 mediocre, small tacos and a drink!

I loved the ambiance and the different salsas but the food could've been seasoned a lot more. I ordered one of the veggie burro and it had great potential, just lacked seasoning until I added salsa. I will definitely be trying this again though.

It's a good little place with a nice authentic vibe. Certainly plenty of salsa options - ranging from acceptable to pretty good, but you can't argue with the variety.

I thought the roasted pork shoulder taco was flavorful and delicious. Found the black mole chicken taco to be a bit too bitter, but the meat was tender and good. Enough salsa verde on top got the job done.

$2 negra modelo on Sunday was a bonus.

Certainly worth eating. Especially for $10.

This place is AWESOME! My husband and I were in the area and decided to stop simply because of the Yelp reviews, it didn't disappoint! The service was great - we were immediately greeted and our drink orders taken right away. We both ordered the horchata - wow! Such a delicious twist to the already yummy drink. I ordered the mole quesadilla and my husband had a pastor bowl, both delicious, seasoned perfectly and pretty darn close to being authentic Mexican food. This place is a must - parking is limited as is the seating space inside, but worth it. I'll be back!

Well I went to GOAZMOTORCYCLES and purchased another bike from these guys. you absolutely cannot go wrong dealing with these Guys and Gals. Best deal in the valley and I would not even waste a day going any were else.
Total pros and awesome deals. I think they have a dealer to sell and service any make and model. I purchased a new 2016 Kawasaki Vaquero.(GREAT BIKE)
And if you know you want a bike but not quite sure if its the right bike for you thay have lots of experience and WILL LET YOU TEST RIDE.

Yum! I wish their space was bigger and had something further on the northside but that is honestly the only thing I can say negative about this place. I have never had anything that I didn't like. Everyone who's visited me has wanted to come back to Phoenix to eat these tacos. If you go during a normal meal time expect to wait probably at least an hour. But it's all worth it!

I have been here a few times and always felt satisfied after each visit. I love the atmosphere and the design of the dining area, great art. The baja shark tacos and quesadillas are to kill for. huge variety of different salsas and the horchata is a one of kind with pecans and pieces of fruit. The waitresses are always attentive and polite. Nice selection of beers as well.

I thoroughly enjoyed my visit here.  The layers of flavors in my Al Pastor, Tinga and Carne Asado Tacos were awesome!  My only complaint was I was expecting it to be less expensive based on the single $ on yelp.  I think this should be updated to $$.  (I didn't mind paying what I did at all, it was totally worth it, but the expectation based on what I had read here was in my head.)

This place is hands down awesome! 

The salsa they make is really tasty and unique. They have flavors I've never dreamed of like strawberry salsa.  Every time I go there they have something new and exciting to try. 

I've had the tacos and burritos (which were both amazing), but I think the tacos are a little better (plus you get a side of beans which are about as good as you can get anywhere). 

My only complaint is you only get one basket of chips for free and they charge for additional refills. Oh well.

The things I like best about La Condesa (other than the decor - I love the imagery of Dia de los Muertos and Catrina):   their delicious homemade horchata, garnished authentically with bits of melon and pecans;  their many unusual varieties of homemade salsas (jicama, peanut, pecan, berry, every type of chile/tomato combination... All of them tasty); and their thick-rolled, flavorful quesas.  In the land of a thousand Mexican restaurants, they bring a fresh spin to the cuisine and the food is awesome.   Totally worth bumping elbows with one's fellow patrons a bit in the tight dining room.

So I get why this place gets 4.5 stars, the tacos are fabulous!!!!! Yep, 5 exclamation marks good. The tacos are gourmet. I tried the mahi mahi (grilled, I'm not sure if there is a fried version) and the veggie taco. Hmm, they are both equally good; I can't pick one over the other. I can say that the Pecan salsa helped out the fish taco with a nice spiciness and gave it that pizzazz it needed to set it apart. 

This is my first visit to La Condesa so, I'm not sure how the place works, but from what I gather you just walk-in and grab a seat then a server will eventually get to you. It was a Sunday evening when we stopped by and there was only 1 SERVER!!! Poor thing was running all over the place. I don't blame her for not getting to us with the first few minutes we sat down. After a little bit she regained her composure and was friendly and accommodating. She really shouldn't of been the only person serving the place was hopping as one group left another entered. There was no one standing around waiting for a place to sit, and honestly I don't know where they would wait. 

The paintings on the walls are amazing. Great art work to look at. However, I was seated at the bar and faced empty bar shelves and the light above me was out, so it was very dim. So as far as ambiance, it just wasn't quite working for me. 

Back to the food.. The refried beans could use some improvement. Okay, so I am Hispanic and have been eating beans since birth and I have never had beans so watered down. It was more of a cold bean soup. Maybe that's what La Condesa was going for, but that didn't work for me either. The rice was good and warm.  

I enjoyed the salsa bar. So many salsas, Cilantro (like), Pico (like), Pecan (like), Peanut, Mexican (like), the list goes on!!

I would visit this place again with the hopes that I get a table next time!

Do yourself a favor and start eating here (if you're not already a fan).

#1. Hands down best salsa bar on the PLANET!!!

If I can help it, I eat here at least 2x/week. I literally order the same thing every single time and it never gets old: veggie tacos and horchata, both of which have ruined any other Mexican restaurant for me... nothing comes even close to their glorious flavors, and it's always fun picking and mixing the different salsas with the food.

The super chill and friendly staff and unique atmosphere are also worth mentioning.

Seriously, I hesitate to leave Phoenix because of this place.

My husband and I had dinner here this past weekend for the first time. We had been wanting to try it, but hadn't gotten around to it. We are glad we finally took the time to have dinner here. It was really good.  The tacos were fabulous, the margaritas were good and the choices of salsa were great. The service is a little slow, so if you're in a hurry pick another time to visit this wonderful establishment. I definitely will be returning and bringing friends and family!
Amazing tacos, full of favor. Also have a great salsa bar.

Liked the artsy decor and slightly unusual taco selections.  Would have preferred 3 rather than 2 tacos in the combos.  I had the Cabo shrimp and the conchita pilbil tacos.  Both very good but neither knocked my socks off.   The various salsa were indentified by signs while I was there and lots of fun to test against my tacos (even though I ended up preferring the most standard versions).  The strawberry salsa is a definite must - astounding to get strawberry taste and heat at the same time and it works!

Been driving by this place for some time, and finally I decided to try it. I was skeptical at first because the parking isn't very inviting. The restaurant is somewhat small but yet quaint. I was very excited to try all the salsa's but was utterly disappointed when the chips they brought us were hard, stale, and just not suitable for eating. I think they were some of the worst chips I have ever had, I had one.. I requested another basket and they kindly bought another basket of chips but they were the same, Stale, hard and dull. I ordered the Aztec Tinga Taco, and they were very good. The salsa's were all great. The service was great, and the waitress apologized for the chips, and stated that they had ran out and had to buy some etc, etc.. Overall tacos were great for the money, just disappointed with the chips.

Street Tacos - Yum!  Friend had the verde burrito and it was HUGE for her!  The three street tacos I had were really flavorful (not too spicy).  Rice and beans are great... next time I am thinking request extra rice and beans!

These are not your buddy's street tacos.
La Condesa hits the nail on the head when it comes to flavor. Cochinita Pibil that tastes like Cochinita Pibil... though I would be fine with a little more achiote.
The tinga is great, with citrusy notes on top of slow cooked beef full of chorizo and onion flavor--don't worry, the onion sweetens it up.

My personal favorite is the baja shrimp taco. Big juicy pieces of breaded shrimp stuffed into two corn tortillas with cabbage and mayo on top.

My only point of contention; they should warn people that more than two tacos is actually quite a lot of food. It would help get over the sticker shock. Beans and rice are unnecessary.

A suggestion: Provide people with suggestions for salsa/taco pairings and make everyone drink the fruity horchata, it's awesome.

My family decided once a month we will try a new place. We came across this restaurant that was right down the road from us. They have the best horchata in town!!! Their Azteca soup was so delicious and their portions were enormous. The service was perfect. Attended to all of our needs while also letting us enjoy our meal. We will definitely be coming back.

I went there for the first time with family and friends last Saturday. We all got something different and delicious. The salsa bar was really fun to explore and we ended up sampling all the different salsas. The guacamole was delicious and chunky and you could see all the fresh ingredients - no fillers here. 

There were so many different burritos and tacos to try and you could even make things into bowls. While not everyone in our party was a vegetarian, we had two and I'm vegan. They had multiple menu items for both, which was amazing and extremely rare for an authentic Mexican restaurant. I tried the cauliflower taco and Gandhi taco (black beans and more) and they were delicious!

We'll be back again to continue exploring the menu.
The best Mexican food I've ever had. The street tacos are the best. Good friendly service too. Small though so hard with big groups.

Oh My Goodness!!
Husband is Mexican - we're from Chicago - have NEVER had such fabulous food outside of Mexico City! Were there on vaca and went one night - loved the tacos (the Tinga chicken was SOOOO tasty!) and the salsas are so fun and interesting and tasty!

Had to go back one more time before we left and ordered the DEEP FRIED QUESADILLAS!!! O.M.G. pas deaux - it was AH MAY ZING!!! One of the best fried foods I have ever tasted - and the cheese, and the chicken tinga..... mmmmmmm - 

Booking another flight to Phoenix as I write this....

What a great hole in the wall.  Cool vibe, very clean and an AMAZING burrito!  Had the Mahi Mahi, it was awesome, and the descriptions of the ingredients in the other items will grab your attention.  For what it is, plus some, it does not get any better!

Haven't been here for a while, and they've expanded their seating since last time.  So, we didn't have to wait long. Everything still tastes good, but you really have to bring it for tacos in this town, more so every day. Service is still slow.

This place makes the best horchatas, we  had Their tinga, carne asada, and pastor tacos and they were dang delicious all the meats had so much flavor, if I wasn't so full I would have ordered 6 more tacos, I also ordered their house lonche. It's pretty much a torta. 

That one so good nice crunchy bread, and the Oaxaca cheese was so soft and full of flavor.
Will definitely be coming back for more 
Thank you guys for the great service
OH....MY....JESUS. Ya'll mind if I praise God real quick?! This food is amazing!!!! Literally in shock of how amazing everything tastes! The best Mexican food I've ever had!!!
Worst service u can ever imagine and what type of Mexican restaurant can't make guacamole because they ran out of tomatos?!?

I discovered this place on a whim when we were driving around central Phoenix a few weeks ago. It had a cool Dia de los Muertos skull on the sign and I thought someone had told me about it so we stopped in for a weekend lunch. 

Our server was super nice and explained about their awesome salsa bar as everyone else here has commented on. I loved the chipotle tomatillo salsa, while my husband preferred the pico de gallo and my daughter (who is 2) could not get enough of the creamy cilantro one. I had the Condesa special tacos which were awesome, especially when topped with some of that chipotle tomatillo salsa. 

What was really outstanding though was the horchata. So outstanding that after finishing mine in the restaurant, I ordered another one to go. It's not like any horchata that I've ever had before as it was kind of light brown in color and had lots of chopped up fruit and nuts in it. I would go back just for the horchata!
OMG....love this place! Best salsa bar and the burritos are grilled and delicious!

The food is amazing! Fresh ingredients & great taste! The quesadillas are my favorite, filled with cheese! My One Complaint: I was seated by the salsa bar next to the wall & somehow ended with white all over my jeans & jacket! Very inconvenient since now I have to go back home before going to work because it doesn't come off easily!

It's small and cramped inside,  but the food is great. The tacos are huge and delicious. Also,  the quesadillas are gigantic,  easily shared by two people. And of course the salsa bar is the best in the valley.

Went there yesterday around 6 pm!! When we went inside there were maybe two other tables seated!! They made us wait for five minutes before they set us!! I'm not sure how they have so many good reviews!! The best thing they have is the salsa!! Not sure if they don't have help or they don't hire because it was the worst I have seeing!! We waited about 40 minutes for our food!! The steak tacos were disgusting!! The beer was hot!! My son only had couple of bites of his burrito!! And he can eat!! When we left there were at least 10 tables open and  there were at least 20 people waiting inside and outside!!  I just don't get it!! I have so much to say but I'm going to leave it at this!! Never ever going there again!!
Unbelievable tacos... Some of the best I have ever tasted.  I recommend the pork and carbs asada.   Service and employees were friendly.   Highly recommend

This is an awesome, quaint artsy restaurant nestled just slightly off the Historic Glendale strip with a casual vibe and truly delicious food. 

We visited on a quiet night and had attentive service, since we were the only other guests other than a large family gathering in the center. The number of patrons, however, is no reflection on the food or experience. 

We split two, two-taco plates for maximum sampling--chicken black mole, la santisma with shrimp, chicken tinga, and pork pibil...all of which were delicious. The la santisma, loaded with veggies and cheese was the overall winner (and was the one recommended by our waiter). Also, being a mole fan, I was excited to eat a REALLY good mole! 

I only wish there was one closer, because I would eat here wayyyy to often. The salsa bar is out of this world if you are a salsa nut like myself. Sooo many options, all for the tasting. Ever had a delish jicama and cilantro salsa? How about the less common radish salsa, which was outstanding? Not to mention the other 10+ salsas on the bar, including a spicy guac. Many of these have quite the kick, so this may not be for the faint of heart. 

Lastly, the house margarita was tasty and we both loved the mixed citrus, including lemons, limes, orange and grapefruit. This is not a "knock-you-on-your-a$$" bev, but probably the tastiest mixed drink I've had in a long time. So fresh, crisp and well-made for enjoyment. 

I will be making the trip back again and again. Yum...
Great tacos and the rice tasted great.  Had the 3 tacos rice and beans.  The chicken tacos were very tasty the one meat taco was little on the chewy side but still very good.  Would recommend.
I have been here a handful of times and always enjoy the food. My only complaint is the service. Its not horrible but definitely not great. I would still recommend it for the food.

Street tacos were good but a little overpriced. Ordered a Yerba Buena tea whatever almost choked on the stem of the lemon. So not so Buena after all. Salsa bar was cool but they were pretty much out of everything. Not the best experience. Place is very aesthetic lots of art. Food and drinks ok.
love the salsa bar but service can be WAY slow during peak hrs. THEY NEED MORE HELP!! Food is fantastico!! Try it but avoid peak hrs.
Long wait, but VERY worth it. Chicken mole was divine, a wide range of fantastic salsas, excellent house margarita. The absolute best Mexican food I've ever had. yum!

I'm a salsa fan, and this place must have had 20 fresh salsas just waiting to be enjoyed. I tried most of them and they were excellent. Five stars for the salsas alone. The tacos were great - mole, shrimp, etc..

Had the 3 Street taco plate, Al Pastor, Carne Asada & Cochinita Pibil. Delicious! Wife had the La Santisima veggie taco plate. Very hardy for veggie only. The salsa bar selection was awesome, all very tasty. The wait staff was attentive, knowledgeable on the dishes. Used a Groupon for this introductory visit. Will so be coming back.

I grew up in the SW but have loved in the NE for 20+ years. Also worked in a Mexican restaurant during high school and college. This was the best Mexican food I can recall. I had Queso Fundido with Choizo and Poblanos, paired with a 3-taco platter of Baby Shark, Tiger Shrimp and Mahi.
i love this place great serviice great food could be cleaner though , its always so busy there isn't tim to clean up lol but other than that it great love coming here :)

Ok, some of the salsa sound a little strange. Try them. They are awesome. Mole tacos are delicious, so are the dog fish ones. The burros are huge. Great service, even when busy. The horchata is a nice way to finish a meal.
We have been coming to this place a bunch lately.  At least 15 trips to eat and it has been unbelievably good every time!
We drive across the valley to eat here.  Very good food.  Simple, warm tasty and friendly people.  Good work!!
Amazing tacos. I've hadn't taste such a delicious taco for a long time.

It's nice and spicy with hand-hewn wood decor and interesting recipes and salsas, but after two visits I have to say it's just not all that fabulous.

The tortillas are factory, not freshly made.

The salsa bar has a lot of options, but nothing on the bar stood out as much better than anything you'd find on Baja Fresh's salsa bar.

Service was confusing and wait staff was confused. Transition from counter service to table service after the lunch hour wasn't handled well. I was seated and given a menu but no one took my order, so I ordered and paid at the counter. Then at the end of the meal, other waiters kept asking if I wanted to pay my check.

La Condesa is good enough, but I'm not impressed.

I'm updating and improving the review. 
According to the proprietor, the cause of my last bad experience is gone, so I decided to return with some coworkers today. I was offered a free meal, but I declined it. 
The service was much improved, efficient even. The food is very tasty. It is a taco experience that is quite a bit better than most Phoenix locations. A lot of their food tends to be on the spicy side, but not all. The house-made beverages (horchata and jamaica) are very good. The guac is chunky and very citrusy, which I approve of. Do not hesitate to check this place out, but be forewarned that parking can be challenging and the location is small and crowded. Nonetheless it has one-of-a-kind ambiance and outstanding Mexican food and drink.

Thank you Yelp. I just received an email with Yelpers' reviews of Burritos. Usually the recommendations are far and away or not fitting my food mood. However, La Condesa was right in my wheelhouse. 

The location is ok, but the interior is spotless and fun. Lots of Day of the Dead and Luce Libre to enjoy while you choose salsa from the 12 or so available. Did I mention that there are a lot of salsas? For a condiment king like me, this is heaven. Peanut and Pecan Salsa, WHAT!?! Both were tasty and new flavors. Mayan Cochinita Burro jumped off the menu. I had beverage ordering anxiety and caved to the Horchata. Best Horchata I've had. There are nuts, strawberries and other tasty floaters in it. The burro came, and it was lava-esque. I couldn't touch it for 20 mins. Luckily I had salsafest 2011 to keep me busy. The burro finally returned from the sun and it tasted delicious. Melt in your mouth stewed pork and refried beans in a possibly homemade tortilla. I'll be back. 

$12 Food, drink and Salsafest.
Holy *%#*!!! The mole is legit! Best I've ever had. Everything else is also quite tasty, but the mole is what's to write home about.
Got here at around 2pm on Sunday and had to wait a hour to get seated. So get here early! Food was awesome only down side is they need more staff. Overall we had a good experience

We live in  Glendale and was excited to go here. Akward small salsa bar. No one greeted us as we came in. Self seating I assume. Who works here? No uniforms.  Nasty standing water by salsa bar. This food better be good! Weird way to get to the salsa bar where you have to twist and turn. No utensils or napkins on tables. You have to ask and wait.  

Positive.  Music and atmosphere is good. The outside patio looks nice. The prices are decent and they look to have a good vision. They have really nice art work but walls need painting.  Seating is good and looks nice wooden tops and cast iron details.

A bit more attention to details and some training will have this a destination for Glendale folks who want authenticity yet do not want to go near the hustle and bustle of Westgate.

I tried both the machaca and shredded chicken tacos - barely edible!  The shredded cabbage looked to be a week old on the overcooked beef, which did not really qualify as machaca.  The shredded chicken was swimming in a tasteless red sauce. 

The combo platter promises rice & beans - more like thimble-fuls of white rice and bean soup.

I will say that their chips and salsa bar was great, but the rest was awful!

Omg! The specialties tacos were to die for!  I want to try everything on the menu! The prices are just right, you are paying for quality food!  The Chile Verde burrito is big enough for 2! Very tasty! Lots of art to admire as well!

OMG, came 2 weeks in a row.  I had to bring the rest of the family to try this place. My favorite was the specialties tacos! The burritos are fabulous and the salsas are to die for,  be careful they will make you cry!

Great tacos and amazing horchata! 

The salsa bar was fresh, and it was really fun to try out different salsas. The Horchata and the Jamaica come in huge cups and are both excellent. I had the Mayan pork and Chicken mole tacos. They were delicious and filling.

La Santisima is easily one of the best taco shops in the Phoenix area. The menu is fresh and interesting,  with dishes taken from various areas in southern Mexico. If you want to try new and authentic flavors, this is the place. 

It's simple and unique, with a minimal staff and barebones table settings, but you somehow feel a sense of "rightness". It's no frills, no fluff, just great Mexican food for a price you can't match. I'd rather pay 9 bucks for an amazing burrito and eat my salsa out of a plastic bowl than visit a snazzy upscale place with food that's no better but have to shell out twice the price. 

Go. To. La. Santisima.

This place has at least 3 different names: La Condesa on Yelp, La Santisima on the front of the building, and Santa Santisima on the menu.  Call it whatever you want, just find the place.  It's so good, my friends and I came here twice during our trip, on the word of some locals we met at JoBot Coffee.  It's a really small place, so expect a wait unless you happen to get lucky and pop in at a slow time.  The guacamole is stupid good, as are the shark and pork tacos.  If you're really hungry, skip the 2 taco platter (just adds rice and beans) and get a third taco, or order the guac.
EXCELLENT!! Regular sized tortillas, really authentic and tasty! $3.99/taco. 2 Taco Plate  w/rice & beans $8.97 plate.

Los peores tacos de mi vida, yo soy de México en específico de la Ciudad de México y vaya que conocemos de tacos los de la ciudad y en lo personal yo como muchísimos tacos.Desconozco que calidad tengan el resto del menú pero en lo personal los tacos no fueron de mi gusto en lo más mínimo el suadero no sabe a sudadero, el pastor no sabe a pastor en fin etc etc.Tuvimos que esperar un poco pasado de 1 hora para que nos entregarán la orden de 6 tacos 4 para mí y 2 para mí novia que por cierto está vomite y vomite y con mucho dolor estomacal.En lo personal no volvería jamás

Service is absolutely dismal. First we waited 40 minutes on a Sunday night because they barely have any seating. Once we did get a table they were quick to bring chips. Only chips. The waiter never mentioned the salsa bar. I knew it was there but still. Then they didn't take a drink order. After waiting for 5 minutes we walked up to the bar area and begged for water. Last thing I wanted to do was eat chips with salsa without something to drink for over 45 minutes. Another 10 minutes went by before they finally decided to take our order. Then the wait began to get our drinks. It took another 15 minutes to get our drinks--sodas, nothing fancy. This was after we watched the waiter make plenty of other drinks for other tables. He made 3 margaritas for a table that got there after us. Finally after one hour and 45 minutes our food arrived.
Great Mexican food in a quaint setting. Excellent  tacos and burros. Horchata is original, well worth the try.

The mole in this place was orgamical!!!' My eyes rolled back in my head and I almost screamed out!!! The salsa bar?!?!? Forget about it!!! Crazy Mo fo good!!!  If I lived in Arizona I'd live in this place!!! Jesus our waiter, the f$&kin best!!!

Amazing food, I had the three street tacos plate with rice and beans. The rice and beans are some of the best I've ever had. I had Tinga, Al Pastor and carne asada tacos and they all were delicious. Salsa bar is also great and it has a wide variety of options. Definitely recommend this place when in the area.
Love this place! We go here every chance we get. I've lived in the neighborhood for 5 years now, and haven't found anything better. Le Santisima is as good as it gets!

Best food this side of the Colorado. Al pastor Quesadilla and mole tacos were off the chain. And their tamarindo margarita was the best ever. Will drive from San Diego just for it. Salad bar has so many options

We dined here last night and I can't say enough good things.  The menu was full of delicious options, with a flexible ordering scheme.  Ala carte tacos are large and come with two tortillas, so they are easy to share.  Plates come with two of the large tacos with wonderful refried beans and tender rice.  We had the Gaucho, which is an Argentine marinated steak taco with fresh avocado, and the Oaxacan chicken mole taco- unbelievable!  The best part is the salsa bar- amazing flavors and textures.  Light and tasty tortilla chips are complimentary.  The decor is quirky and fun, with really nice furniture. The service was friendly and attentive, and the price was very reasonable- lots of food, one drink each for 5 people for $60.

Thank you yelpers! I was searching for mexican late at night and was really craving something authentic. I struck gold with La Condesa.  It is a true diamond in the rough part of phoenix.
I ordered the carne asada burrito which is simply meat and beans. Anywhere else that would be boring and plain, but it was seasoned perfectly and full of flavor. A perfect vessel for the salsa bar from heaven. Every bite was different depending on what spicy concoction I chose.
I also couldn't resist trying the maya conchita pibil taco, which was packed full of juicy shredded pork. So juicy in fact that I had to eat it quick because the corn tortillas were getting a bit soggy. Did I mind? Oh no. I just sopped up any juice left and sighed with pure contentment. They topped the taco with nothing else but pickled red onions that were delicious. Simple done right.  Can't wait to go back and get that horchata!

Walking into this small restaurant, i could image I was in a nice part of Mexico City.  Showing up with my customary crew of three little boys, you can imagine some people would be annoyed, but our hostess greeted us kindly and found us the space to sit down. They didn't mind at all that we had to park the stroller at the small bar.
The boys were hungry monsters and we got baskets of chips right away. I found several lovely non spicy salsas for the boys, including a pecan salsa, cilantro salsa, and strawberry salsa. We ordered a mole taco, shark taco, and pibil taco with a side of rice and beans to share among us. It was plenty for two adults, two little ones and a very picky 8 yr old who just ate chips. Each taco was awesome.each was  Realy  unique in flavors. The beans and rice were both boring and bland. All salsas were delicious. It almost didnt m atter what we ate because it was all so delish.
The decor was very appealing, although the walls were pretty dirty. The service was good, the music good and rather loud, which helped to drown out the baby pulverizing chips with his fists. This is not wat I would categorize as a good place to take kids, but even so, they were tolerated, and I am just not going to miss trying a place like this because I have my kids with me. 
The only drawback for me was that this is a SMALL place, and it was hot and airless inside. I don't know if the air conditioning was broken, but just a room fan would have helped a lot. We were sweating by the end of the meal, and not from the pico de gallo. I hope they get that worked out before summer melts the asphalt.

The food was very good and very fresh.  Trying out the different salsas was cool - I have never eaten anywhere that had that.  The price was right!  I had a huge meal, beer and horchata for $20.  That said, the food did not blow my mind. 4 stars seems about right.

Keeping this brief..


Went for lunch on Monday after a co-workers recommendation and was blown away by how good the Cochinita Pibil Burro was.  The pork shoulder is marinated in achiote, orange and a bunch of other stuff and was unbeleivably tender.  Great tortillas as well.  My Mexican buddy declared it some of the best meat he has ever eaten.

The salsa bar had some pretty interesting stuff in it and everything I tried was great, including marinated onions and two different salsa verdes.  A plus was the Pico was pretty spicy, with large chunks of Jalapeno in it.  

I will definitely be back.

Loved the salsa bar - we went with another couple and we ate 3 baskets of chips because we had so much fun sampling all the salsas. My wife and I shared the burrito and she wasn't even able to finish half of a burrito - great serving sizes. The only downside was the place was packed and nowhere to wait for a table inside. Looking forward to going back though!

I absolutely love this place! it has become one my fav spots since I moved to AZ from Cali. The horchata is amazing!!! and so is everything else. I highly recommend the cabo shrimp tacos. And you can't beat their signature margaritas. And last but not least their salsa bar. OMG delicious!! My go to is the pecan salsa. So many to choose from.

My mouth just died and went to heaven. Great atmosphere.  Great salsa bar. Great margaritas. Great tacos. When I'm on my deathbed in the distant future I will die happy. Knowing that I indeed experienced life!

Good "upscale" mexican fast food, if that makes any sense.  Lots of great flavors to be had.  Mixing and matching with the unique salsas (peanut, pecan, cilantro and jicama salsas are standouts) allows for some pretty awesome flavor combinations.

Sort of an odd place, because it the menu feels like it should be a takeout or order-and-take your seat kind of place, but it has a beautiful wood bar that seems wasted on the environment.  If they do carry beer, it isn't in an obvious place (no taps, no display refridgerator).  And they appear to only carry one type of wine.

Just think of the drinks as afterthoughts and enjoy the variety of food you are able to enjoy...

My boyfriend and I are here visiting in AZ for the holiday weekend and we found this AWESOME place!!!! So stoked when we walked in and saw Guy Fierri's photo Nd signature. The place did not disappoint (although I'll admit we did question it at first because of the way it looked on the outside and the area...) The meat and salsas from the salsa bar were D E L I C I O U S !!!!!!!!!

Love this place. It is always crowded but we go early to avoid the wait. Street tacos with fresh ingredients and so many options!!! Everything is yummy here. I also love the salsa bar and like to have several different salsa to go with the complimentary chips.

Great food awful service.  Looked like only one waitress and one helper. So I felt sorry for her but I was completely forgotten after being there for over 30 minutes had to go ask for her to come out and take my order. The only reason I waited is because I was starving and when I got there I did order a beer from The Host and that did come right away. No one ever checked to see how my food was and when I was finished I waited another 15 minutes and no one came so I went inside and got my check.
Delicious food. Service was just too slow. Waited approx. 20mins just to order my drink. Otherwise it was good

In area for personal reason. Asked a local where to find some good eats. Without hesitation he said "La Santisima"! Easily found the building using smartphone maps. Walked in on a Saturday afternoon to a bustling restaurant that is so small I had to chuckle. Without looking at a menu ordered 3 fish tacos and a bottled coke. While waiting, i loaded up on the condiments. Got my order in a reasonable time and bicycled to Coronado park to feast. Hands down, the best fish tacos i have had. California, Hawaii and New Mexico cannot compete with these fish tacos. Did not know this "gem" was featured on D,D & D. Any person who fails to give 5 starts is just being a pinche pendeho. And the neighborhood is NOT SKETCHY!!! Brown people don't bite. You can't ask for better food, faster service or tastier condiments.

Dogfish tacos: legit. 8 out of 10. (FYI - Dogfish are little sharks.)

Shrimp tacos: also legit. Also 8 out of 10.

Carne asada tacos: Dry, and I didn't pick up on much seasoning. 5 out of 10. My points of comparison here are Aqui Con El Nene in Tucson, and El Guero Canelo, also in Tucson. They're much better at carne asada tacos. Also, America's Taco Shop is far better with this, which is their specialty.

The homemade salsas are awesome. In particular, I was blown away by the salsa cilantro, and the strawberry salsa. Yes, they have strawberry salsa.

Our new place to go for Mexican food. The  atmosphere reminds me of a small restaurant in Mexico. I decided to try all five of the street tacos, they were all really good. My favorite was the brisket. The service was great, we will definitely be back!

One of the best Mexican spots in town. The food is great (salsa bar!) and so are the margaritas. That said, it is crammed - try to go on a night when it's less busy to avoid feeling the full brunt of that.

If you're a salsa lover, this place is for you.

If you're a taco lover, this place is for you.

If you're a living, breathing human person with taste buds, this place is for you.

The chicken tinga tacos are by far my favorite - super robust, smokey flavor pairs perfectly with the acidity from the pickled onions. Mmm! Plus, their salsa bar is one to write home about - get the peanut salsa, you won't be disappointed.

This was my first time here. I was glad to see new blood come into the downtown Glendale area. I spend a lot of time in this area and I'm always looking for a new spot. 

The decor and styling of the restaurant is great. I loved the paintings and lighting throughout. There is ample seating although we came on a very busy night. 

Now for the bad news. We waited nearly an hour for a total of 8 tacos between 4 people. We were told by the manager that he was sorry and he was missing two servers and a cook. Sadly I did see people leave prior to getting food due to service. I can only hope this gets addressed. 

On the good side the tacos were excellent. I ordered two steak tacos, while my friend ordered one steak and one shredded pork. He also described the steak taco as good but he said the pork was delicious. 

Great menu with lots of choices. I will go back and hope the service issue is fixed.

My first time here was really good the Horchata had strawberry in it and cinnamon on top. I got the shark and shrimp burrito and it had lots of flavor. The Burrito was big enough to probably share with two light eaters. The salsa bar was great I tried somethings that were outside of my normal but it was a good experience all around. Other than the place being small I have no complaints. Great place.

This review is based on a catering order with David. I tried to place an order for take out and that didn't work out. So, David, who I am assuming is the manager, worked a bit of magic for our out of town clients to get their damn lunch on time. Thank you, David! It was very much appreciated!

I love this place. It is small, casual, great food, they have Victoria beer, margaritas are just okay, salsa bar is really great, prices and portion sizes are more than reasonable. I definitely recommend this place.

So today I took my family to this place based on what I had seen on Yelp and the photos. So we get there and we are told there would be a 30 min wait but there where a lot of empty tables so we wait. After 20 min we were seated and are drink order is taken! My beer dos xx it was warm and bitter. We were given chips so we went to the salsa bar only to be disappointed with the salsas taste some where even a little spoiled. Are food arrived it looked really good on our plates my wife got the chicken mole tacos  meal. The tacos were really good! The beans were also starting to spoil and the rice was less then average. For my order I got the "santo Plato" pastor burrito and a pastor taco. With calabas on the side the calabas was the only thing good on my plate! My pastor burrito meat was burnt and I know they do it intentionally to give it a little flavor but they over did it. It tasted like I was eating coal. As for the service it was good they came to you with a smile. As of now I will maybe try there other location in the hopes that it will be better.

I hate to write this review, but what happened on July 21st, 2012 at lunch has made absolutely sure I will never eat here again.

We went in for lunch, and it all went wrong on so many levels.

1. It took them almost 20 minutes to get us chips and drinks.
2. It took another 20 to get our order.
3. Then just as our food was coming out, they had the audacity to ask us to MOVE TO ANOTHER TABLE AS OUR FOOD CAME OUT!
4. We had the Lonches, and the bread was so stale that you couldn't eat it.

I have never, ever had this happen anywhere in the world. Its considered sacrosanct in the world of food service that once a customer is seated, barring an emergency, that you don't move the patrons. Yet, a group of 8 land roving manatees with bad prison tattoos garnered enough respect in this place to get the manager to force us to move.

Now if you do fuck up this badly during a service, you comp the meal and you apologize. This is scripture when it comes to food service, and you don't defy this logic.

Yet, no apology, no offer to make it right, no nada.

I will never go back to La Condesa. We've been eating here loyally for two years, bringing in others to eat there, going out of our way to vouch for this place. Things have changed, and not for the better. 

I suggest you skip this place at all costs. Just not worth the BS and rude treatment to even risk it.

Pros: Full bar, salsa bar

Cons: No bartender, watery salsas, poor service.

We visited this shop for a weekend lunch.  We were starving and didn't have a lot of time, so we opted to quickly sit at the bar.  We waited 5 minutes, and a server brought us chips.  We then went and picked out a few salsas from the salsa bar.

Out of the 4 salsas I tried, I liked none of them.  They were very thin and watery, and the plastic containers are smaller than the chips - so you can only dip the corner of a chip (but the salsa won't stick), and you can't pour the salsa onto a chip (because it will run off).  The only chips that sort of work are the 'defective' folded ones. I have no idea why everyone raves about the salsa bar, perhaps for the novelty of it, but chips don't work as a salsa-delivery vehicle for watery salsa.

After 10 minutes, we still did not have water, and 15 minutes into us sitting there, we apologized and left.  Their tacos may well be amazing, but we didn't have time to sit around.  Waiting for 15 minutes (literally) with no water delivery during an AZ summer should be criminal.

There appeared to only be 2 servers for the entire restaurant, and no bartender, and they clearly couldn't handle a lunchtime rush by themselves.  Luckily, there are many other excellent taco shops in the area.

I decided to try this place on a whim. We looked through the pictures on yelp and the tacos looked great. As we walked in we immediately noticed that the place was like really small but the atmosphere was laid back. The menu had a huge selection of tacos, burritos, tortas and quesadillas. I had the specialty tacos with Mahi mahi. Pretty good stuff since it came with rice and beans. The salsa bar had a wide variety of salsas to choose from too.

Outside appearances, ho hum. Inside, interesting, but not spectacular.
But the food, ...what a surprise!! Now THATs the secret of these two places.
The food is Oahacan-leaning and terrific, and a large range of salsas to try. 
Not at all your traditional southwestern fare. 
Been to both places, and will continue to do so from time to time.

Oh my god, these tacos are the real deal. The mole was incredible!! And I would come back just to eat at the salsa bar! This isn't just any taco shop, these are truly gourmet. I would bring any foodie here.
It's a good local Mexican restaurant. Good server and lots choices of salsa. We'll come back if we visit Phoenix again..

Great shark taco, mole quesadilla, salsa bar with peanut and pecan salsas, decor, and best goddamn horchata I've ever had. 

Thanks for the find, yelp!

Diner's Drive-ins and Dives location...  known for their tacos and salsa bar.  Everything was tasty and the prices were good.  Service is basically counter service, but good.  The place is small, but they seem to move quickly.  Don't be surprised with a wait for a table.

Make sure to try as many salsas as you can.  The tacos were very good - I had very high expectations, and while I wasn't blown away, they were very good.

Found this place on yelp and with as many great reviews as it has.... how could it be anything less than amazing?!? Boy was I wrong! It was Sunday evening about 5 pm so I can understand the 30 min wait to be seated. I figured I would get a drink while we waited, so I ordered 2 michelada's with Tecate Light. I will confess, they were good which accounts for one of the stars I have given. By this time, I have noticed how unhappy all the employees seem to be. Would it hurt to crack a smile? Once seated, we placed our order and were given a half empty basket of chips... the chips were good and the salsa options were great! The salsa bar is what earned that 2nd star! Unfortunately, chip refills will cost you $2.70 - may have been worth is since it took some 30 min plus to get our food. The food was meh. Dull, over-priced and served cold.... like it had been sitting a while. To top it off, when we got the bill - the michelada's were $12 each!!! This place really missed the mark for me and my husband and we will NOT be returning.

The food was Awesome! I'd definitely come back. We sampled about 3/4 of the salsas on the complimentary salsa bar and they were all excellent, the chipotle salsa being my favorite. My burro was also excellent and very filling! Service was mediocre. I needed to ask for a refill on a fountain soda and the server forgot our order of chips to go with all of our salsas. He did eventually get us our chips and soda and made it right, so I felt satisfied when it was all said and done. Adding one more server would do wonders.

I am giving this place 4 stars because it is unique. The night we went it was crowded...but we went because of all the hype on Yelp and my quest for Fish Tacos. The service was good. I tried all the salsa's and only liked a few. And as for the tacos...they were ok. The Shark Taco needed a better sauce and I would have enjoyed it much better. Truthfully, I didn't find the shark tacos as great as everyone else does on these reviews, but then again, I am new to Fish Tacos. I also tried the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco, I found this flavor strong (unlike other Mexican places I have tried), so that is good, but I didn't really care for it.

The bad, my son ordered the steak Quesa. He didn't care for it at all, I did like this, but then the waitress took the entire thing away when we weren't done with it and Dave didn't even get a chance to try it. So that was a bit disappointing, given he didn't eat hardly any of it. 

Overall...I am glad we went.

You may need several visits to try all of their different gourmet tacos.  If you are indecisive about choosing among multiple great menu items like I do just get the 3-taco sampler (comes with beans & rice) and whatever three tacos jump out at you.  Then go back again and try different ones.  We got the chicken tinga, cochinita pibil (done right), Oaxacan mole negro (a flavor explosion), 2 Andalusias (chorizo and potato - hard to find a better combination), and chile en nogada (a chile stuffed with fruits, nuts and meat, topped with a sweet, creamy sauce - very different).  All were great.  Each taco has a double corn tortilla and is a pretty good size but not enormous.  I was stuffed.  Some of the more gourmet tacos are a small upcharge, but for 50 cents or a dollar per taco go ahead and splurge!
The help-yourself salsa bar had about a dozen different house-made salsas including pico de gallo, peanut, pecan, cilantro, guacamole, and many more.  My two favorites: chile de Arbol (smoky & a little spicy) and seven chiles (mild, chunky chiles and charred red onion).
Horchata: is a large 32 oz and has strawberries & almonds to make it more festive than your normal horchata.
Because this place advertises itself for "gourmet tacos" we didn't even look much at the rest of the large menu. A lot of people around us ordered burritos.
Location: the few parking spots out front on the main street were full so we parked down the side street, slightly nervous about the loudly-arguing people across the street, then the crazy-talking-out-loud-to-herself person with the shopping cart on the corner.  But the food was worth it and our rental car was still there and intact when we returned.
Customers included a combination of locals and tourists.  We had a twenty minute wait for a table of two around 6:30 on a Saturday night.  It was well worth the wait.  Will make it a point to try this one again when we're back in Phoenix.

Food quality is incredible. The flavors are exceptional! They are very busy but despite that the service is still very fast and efficient. Margaritas are delightful as well; we will definitely be back!

Love Love Love this place! ALL of the food is amazing! I am a salsa freak so the FRESH salsa bar is wonderful! I always get a refreshing Michelada when I go here! If I had to pick a favorite item on the menu it would be the carne asada burrito. I love that it has just GOOD quality meat, pinto beans and thats it! Oh and they toast the out side of the tortilla to give it the perfect amount of crunch. just know that this is a small place and if you come right at dinner time especially on the weekends you will had to wait but it is soooo worth it!

This place is awesome! Great salsa bar - I could eat their chips and salsa alone as a dinner. Yes, it's that good! Their tacos are delicious! I love taking out of town guests here because everyone is always impressed with their salsa bar selection and great food!

My boyfriend and I went here for the first time today. The food is great, and so is the service. However, if you don't like fried food, don't get the quesadillas. My boyfriend had the horchata, and he says it is the best that he has ever had. The horchata is sweet, but not sickly sweet, and it has strawberries and pecans in it.

The salsa bar is awesome. You receive complimentary chips, and you can choose as many salsas as you want.

The menu has a wide variety; there is something for everyone! Even vegetarians. The dogfish taco lives up to its reputation on Yelp.
Great stop after getting off the plane from the airport. We were looking for something casual and delicious and this place at the spot. Great mole tacos and gordito burritos.

This place is hands down a hidden gem. Food is always amazing. Don't forget to order the 
Horchata! It is the best in town.
This is one of our favorite taco places! Once in a while we get some bad pieces of meat in our gaucho tacos but generally ok. The space is very small but it's worth it.

I wouldn't know. After sitting at our table for 20 min with no service, i left. Thank God you can throw a rock and hit good Mexican food in this town. I went down the street to La Frontera and got real tacos

By far one of my favorite Mexican restaurants to eat at in Phoenix.  I recommend it every time i get the opportunity. Everything from their exceptional salsa bar to their Quesas! You will not leave disappointed.

This place prompted me to leave only my fifth Yelp review in like five years (shame on me, but oh well). The food was just SO good. I had the chicken mole burrito and it was about as close to "perfect" as it gets. They took the simple finishing step of grilling the burrito lightly, which gave it some crunch and made it taste like a non-fried chimichanga. Why don't more places do this?? The salsa bar had more options than I had time to test, but each one I sampled was delicious in its own way.

I wasn't expecting a full bar, but yep, they have one of those, too.

The atmosphere is better on the inside than you would think by looking at the outside. It's small though, so don't be surprised if there's a wait.

We will be back many times in the future!
Unique, great Mexican food. Certainly not your typical, heavy tacos. The smoked marlin taco is amaz.
Great food! Great salsa! Did not realize it was featured on Diners Drive in and Dives! Good margaritas too!

Wow where to start...
If you decide to give this place a try based on their "good" ratings and reviews you're better off looking elsewhere.
Me and my girlfriend were looking for ordinary tacos and when we noticed the awesome ratings and good reviews this place had achieved, we thought it would be at least decent.
When we got there and ordered our drinks, I ordered the horchata because according to people on Yelp, they had the best one could taste.
As soon as I got mine, I noticed it had some kind of canned fruit on top, if had some sort of strawberry syrup and to top it off, it had a brownish color instead of the usual white.
When I tried it, it was so sweet that one sip is all I could take before I decided to tell the waiter to take it back because I was not going to pay for that.
My girlfriend's Jamaica also had a purple color to it and she told me it tasted like grape Kool-aid.
When we were attempting to order food, all I wanted from the start was a few simple tacos...
Their tacos were $2.97 each!!!  That is absolute madness!!!
For the size of the tortilla and the quality of the taco, the MOST those could have been worth anywhere else was $1.25.
When everything was going bad and our night had been ruined, me and my girlfriend started looking around and we noticed that only white people were eating there.
Then everything made sense; white people don't know REAL mexican food, so they assume this crap quality was the "best they had ever tasted" and thus very good review on yelp came from white people.
If you know what real mexican food tastes like and are looking for just simple tacos, DO NOT GO TO THIS UTTERLY AMERICANIZED MEXICAN JOINT!!!!
You will be sorely disappointed.
ANY cheap taco stand in Mexico can beat the taste of these so called "street tacos" AND FOR A THIRD OF THE PRICE!!!
If I could I would give this place 0 stars.

I've had all their Tacos and they are all excellent.  My favorite are Cabo Shrimp & Oaxaca Black Mole Tacos.  The best way to enjoy the tacos in this place is to put them into rotation like in baseball and do the same with the multitudes of creative salsa.  The worse thing about La Condesa is their tacos made you wonder what the hell did you eat at Taco Bell.

Small dining room and no waiting area, so hard to get in at peak times, but worth trying more than once to get in.  The meat is deliciously flavored and the salsa bar makes every meal fun and personalized.  Inexpensive, high quality food.

This is a hidden gem, nestled anongst fifty more taco shops it really stands out. Their menu features dogfish shark a fliet mignon tacos that really live up to the name gourmet. The salsa bar is features approximately 20 different salsas that range from peanut to classic pico. They are however lacking in the service department as well as quality beverage choices.
Been twice. Authentic, high quality & great price for what you get. Salsa de Chile de Arbol was the best!! Loved the decor. Orchata tasted fresh, which is a rarity in most Mexican Restaurants.

I'm writing this review in hopes that management sees it or even the owner. I've been coming here for a couple of years now and my visits have been ones to remember. I was a loyal customer coming in once a week at least. The previous staff this restaurant had were amazing. You can tell they really enjoyed their job. They made me feel like I was at home. I was always taken care of by one particular server every Thursday night. Stacey, she was an outstanding employee and I enjoyed her attentiveness with us. Stacey was a hard worker and she put dedication to her job role. I decided to continue to go after she resigned but it just wasn't the same anymore. The new servers aren't polite with you. They don't listen to your concerns. They simply take your order bring your food and never check on you again. They don't ask if you need a refill or another basket of chips (most simple things a server can do). They are simply rude. It seems as if they simply want your money and want you out of there quick. Even though their food is delicious, if you don't have good service then it makes your experience horrible all around. For this reason I will not be returning but I hope this gives them a heads up to make changes and improve their service.

This place has jumped to number one on my Phoenix taco list.  For real, OMG, we got a Groupon and decided to redeem it today.  The salsa bar... it's freaking amazing (strawberry, chipotle/pecan, cilantro crema, and many others).  Don't even get me started on the horchata.  I had NOTHING bad, or even average here, it was all amazing.  Cute, trendy/rustic decor, and the food is outstanding.  The mole was so smokey and rich and flavorful and the Mayan cochinita pibil taco was so tangy and tender.  Seriously, I ate until I literally could eat no more.  America's used to be my go-to for cheap tacos a la carte, but this place has edged firmly into first place.

I can't say enough good about this place.  I found it on Yelp as we were on our way home from the airport.  I am vegetarian, and good Mexican vegetarian food is hard to find.  I must say this place is a treasure.  I had the potato/nopalito taco and a black bean taco with mango salsa.  Both of them were the best I have ever had.  I would definitely go here again.  There is an amazing salsa bar with all kinds of delicious salsas.  Definitely a keeper.
The best tacos in Phoenix! This place is fast, consistent, clean, and they have beer and a huge fresh salsa selection!

Just ate lunch here after the Home and Garden Show....great place! The food is fresh and delicious and the salsa bar was delightful! My husband's margarita came with slices of fresh fruit which added a yummy dimension. The decor is pleasing to the eye. The place is small, but the wait was short. Even though we live in the East Valley, we will definitely be coming back soon!

This place was an incredible find. We trusted Yelp on this one and it did not disappoint! The only knock (and it was no surprise if you read the reviews) was that it was pretty small so they run a pretty small crew.  With the 15 or so different salsas at the homemade salsa bar and the late amount of food we got, we were not in any hurry to leave!

We will definitely be back here soon!
Food was absolutely delicious - we ordered the shrimp tacos and a beef burrito- and very reasonably priced! Comfortable atmosphere, polite servers, and amazing horchata!

I had a whole hearty meal. It wasn't heavy which I loved. It was nothing out of the ordinary but I did like the quality of the ingredients used. I probably wouldn't attend again. 
The customer service was not that great and our drinks were never refilled.
The 3 star is pretty generous of me.

Loved the salsa bar with all kinds of fresh and unique salsas! Pecan, Jicama, Peanut, and Radish to name a few and I'm not usually a fan of tomatillo but it was really good. I had the steak and the black chicken mole tacos- the steak was on the dry side and lacked flavor but the salsa helped kick it up the few notches to where it needed to be. The space is small and tight, but with a cool modern Mexican decor. It looks like there is room to expand which I hope they get around to soon. We went for lunch and it was crowded and cramped. Service was good and attentive.

After seeing the great reviews on Check Please and DDD, I was excited to give this place a try but after our recent visit, my family and I will never come back to this restaurant. 

1. The sign stated wait to be seated. We patiently waited about 10 minutes before a woman finally came up to us with a menu and told us to go cash register to place our order. 

2. The tacos were nothing special and far from "gourmet." The salsa bar, however, had a wide variety of salsas, but not one was memorable.  The tacos were overpriced for what you get and there are definitely better tacos in the area and much less expensive. The rice was good so if you prefer rice over tacos, then this place is for you.

3. Lastly, the ladies room was filthy and visible from the main dining room. Not that we could see the door to the restroom while we ate but the door remained opened with the toilet clearly visible to my and other tables. Gross, yes but to make matters even worst, it appeared as if the restroom hadn't been cleaned in several days. 

Very disappointed!  I truly hope this was a one off experience, however, I don't think I have it in me to try again after such a lackluster and frustrating experience.

We get here get greated 5 stars 
We sit down they bring us chips 5 stars 
They ask us if we are ready to order we say yes I'm about to ask for a torta and the waiter tells me nope don't order than they aren't that good if you want tortas you should go to a torta shop. My reaction 0_O really grade 1 star.
We finish our chips server just looks at us doesn't bring us chips I get up give him the basket to see if he can bring us more he says yes grade 1 star.
He comes back I want to order some tacos he says no you should eat the quesadilla my reaction o_0 grade 1 star. 
We ask for napkins he responds "oh they are in the hallway next to the restroom my reaction "wtf" I get up and grab them myself. Grade 1/2 star 
The deep fried quesadilla was so chewy I couldn't cut it "this is what they are known for" yeah.! They need another cook.! Grade 1star 
The meat was delicious.!!! 5 stars 
The salsas 5 stars 
The tacos were too big my advice keep them small and don't do double tortilla we get it you guys want us to leave satisfied but are doing a mistake serving your tacos with two huge tortillas.! We will not be going there anymore want so good tacos 7 ave and camelback next yo Charlie's "tacos Yakis" delicious tacos and not as pricy! Oh and why do you serve tacos with beans and rice wtf that's too American! Good night people.!

My dad & I were in town for the day. We were sooo hungry & in the mood for anything so yelp helped me find this place & of course we were kind of iffy about it & expected it to be like every other Mexican restaurant, BUT we were totally mistaken! My dad is from Mexico City, but has been living in the US for almost 22 years. This is the FIRST place ever to actually have tacos that tasted just like from his hometown! He even teared up because of the memories that filled him (no i'm not exaggerating!), & when my dad says the tacos are authentic then they are! This place will be the only reason why we will come back to Phoenix! Hopefully this place lives on for good! :)

Loved their Mole Burro. The sweetness of the mole mixed with a nutty spice flavor was the best. Our waiter was very prompt. Their salsa bar is worthy. At least 12 different types of salsa. So soooo good! Great place to eat for the price. Come here.
Best tacos in Phoenix, hands-down.  They have a great salsa bar, and delicious mole.  A great place to bring visitors from out of town.
Best Mexican food!!!! Love the salsa bar food is always fresh and amazing !! Have had everything on the menu and absolutely love it !!! Everyone in downtown Phoenix must try this place !!

I had heard many good things about this place so I finally decided to eat there. The restaurant is small and cozy with lots of mexican art on the walls. On to the food... The salsa selection was very generous and I liked most of them. The beans were great and so was the rice. Now about the tacos, the mole was not that great, they went overboard on the chocolate imho, the carne asada was good. The chicken tinga taco changed my life, it was amazing! Overall it was a good experience. I will be going back soon.

Unassuming spot for legit tacos. Salsa bar had a plethora of options, the couple that I tried were fresh and very good. I had never seen shark on a menu before - so I tried the shark, shrimp, and steak tacos with a side of rice - did not disappoint! Contrary to other reviews, I thoroughly enjoyed the rice. Next time I'm in the area, I will be back.

Great food but boy..... the wait to get served is so long. And forget getting your appetizer before your entree. We waited 30 min for appetizer only. 

If they continue with this horrible service I'm sure they'll go out of business, no matter if they were featured in Food network.

The very best tacos in town. The Aztec Tinga is fantastic...but the real star of the show is the Napoleon taco. 

Also fantastic are the quesadillas...and they will forever change the way you think about them. You'll never order a quesadilla from Taco Bell ever again. You've been warned. THESE quesas are puff pastries filled with gorgeous things, and then topped with Mexican sour cream. 

Also check out their salsa bar. Too many to choose from; and there are no wrong choices to make.

Run to La Condesa. Run past every other mediocre Mexican restaurant to get here because THIS place is the real deal.

Nice place decor. Presentation is nice and ordering process is different. 

You grab a menu take a set if you need a moment like I did as a first timer and when your ready you order at the counter and pay which is good to get it done and not have to wait for your bill when your finished eating. 

The girl next to me had a quesadilla and looked good so I decided to try it. It's called la quencha and food presentation was nice topped with cotija cheese, red onions and avocado and green sauce but I did not expect the tortilla to be as thick as it was. It reminded me of a quesadilla chimichanga. I was full fast and the flavor was ok. I think for me next time I will try one of the specialty tacos. 

They have a nice salsa bar with a variety selection . 

Overall it was a nice experience and a nice first try

Really disappointed with this place. Some friends and I sat at the bar tonight and were there for 15 minutes with no acknowledgment what so ever. No menus. They didn't bus the bar for us. We were passed by several times with no eye contact. I've been here before and the food is great but the service is terrible. We had to walk out 15-20 minutes after sitting down. Sad because I really love the food here but this makes us not want to come back

Great food. 
Only negative is the seating space. Very little, and what exists is very cramped, particularly the seating adjacent to the fixings bar area.
Get theire early for lunch or wait until after the lunch crowd has come and gone.

Tacos are yum! Went a couple of times and ordered between shark, beer battered shrimp and white fish. Each bite... never disappointed. My daughter ordered the a pork burro that had pinnapple.... wow! Service is slow at times but the food and drinks more than make up for it. Definitely would visit again and wait longer if needed.

Almost missed this place, because Yelp still shows no alcohol, and a mexican meal without a beer or margarita is not complete.  Glad I went!  We split the shrimp, veggie and pork tacos.  This is the only place where I would consider ordering a veggie taco over the meat ones.  The grilled vegetables were packed with flavor, and the cheese was perfect.  Add an awesome salsa bar and mexican beer, and you have the perfect meal for before or after the ball game.  I would have given 5 stars, but the pork tacos didn't wow me.  Don't get me wrong, they were good - but just above average.

Visiting Phoenix for the first time and we tried this place for lunch - from the outside we weren't so sure about heading in but boy are we glad we did!! 

The decor inside is very cool - when we sat down they brought out fresh tortilla chips and we went up to their salsa bar and tried our way through at least 6 salsas leaving many more we didn't even get to try!  My hubby got 4 different tacos to try and couldn't pick a fave he liked them all so much!  I got the veggie quesa, a twist on quesadilla made with a crispy corn shell - it was delicious yet huge I couldn't even get through half!  

I'd highly recommend checking this place out!

I love this restaurant. It can sometimes be difficult to find solid mexican food, but this place nails it, bringing dishes from various regions in mexico, but mostly central and southern. 
The salsa bar is fun, it is great to find a dish you like and experiment with new salsas.
The negative of the place is also its charm, but it is small and usually very busy, so expect a 10-15 minute wait. 
My favorites are the burritos, with a grapefruit margarita.
Salsa bar alone is worth it.  Awesome artwork is worth it.  Best tacos/burritos are the cactus ones.  Not overpriced.  We love this place.

I love this taco shop.  They offer a wide variety of tacos and they are all good.  My favorite are actually the vegetarian tacos.  They come spilling over with grilled veggies and cheese.  They are amazing.  The salsa bar offers a huge variety of different salsa including unique salsas made from fruit (strawberry) and nuts (pecan).  I took away a star because the seating is super tight and it is hard to move around in there.  The seats themselves are really uncomfortable (heavy wooden chairs).  I agree with a previous reviewers that I can do without their rice and beans.  But the tacos are so filling, you will not need them.
Killer tacos and the salsa bar is unparalleled. Get there early, nut if your late it's worth the wait.

Wow.  Mind, stomach and taste buds blown.  Mexican is my favorite cuisine and hands down La Santisima is the best Mexican food and carne asada I've ever had.  I'm still craving it -- it's that good!  

I'm a Southern California native and am blessed with great Mexican food, but La Santisima is a different category.  They serve Tex-Mex and their quesas (their version of a quesadilla) -- straight foodgasm in my mouth.  I just wish we had more time in Az this time around to go back and try their fish tacos.  (Yes, it was that good that I would've gone back consecutive days!)

So many salas to choose from, all were spicy but delicious and peanut was my favorite.  Thanks for upping the bar and you've made the quesa my last wish meal.  Can't wait to be back --- or open up in Cali, haha.

Stopped by for the first time for lunch and got the 3 street tacos Al Pastor and a large Horchata. The Horchata wasn't your typical kind... It had pieces of walnut and other stuff. So damn good!! It was really good. There's also a lot of different styles of salsa to try.  The 4 different salsas I tried were all tasty spicy and deliciously good. They had about 12 different salsas to try. Service was on point! We will be back for sure.
If I lived in Phx I would eat here every day. I am vegan, my boyfriend is not. We both agreed the food is the best Mexican fare we have ever had. My mouth is watering just remembering our meal.

Really good tacos. The Cabo Shrimp tacos are excellent and very authentic. They are sooo similar to the tacos we loved in Cabo! 

I'd highly recommend this place for great food cheap.

Found this little gem from Yelp reviews and it was AMAZING!! The food was outstanding! The salsa bar was unreal with so many choices and so delicious. We went 2 times in the same 4 day trip because it was so good. When you pull up it's not the nicest area of town and it seems a little sketchy at first but don't let appearances fool you, the food is OUTSTANDING!

Chicken Mole tacos are so delicious. Great art, not too busy on Saturday evening, small place... Every good Mexican place has great salsa and beans...and they bring you chips...they are doin it right.
Chips were stale. Service was slow and in frequent. I got the 3 street taco entree. Cochinita Pibil, Al Pastor and Carne Asada were 3 out of 5. Beans weren't hot.

I have had the great pleasure of working with Suzy and Bruce at Inter Valley Escrow. As a lender that has worked with countless escrow companies I can say with absolute certainty this is one of the best you will ever find. It is because of Suzy and Bruce. They go WAY above and beyond what is expected to make a deal come together. I highly recommend them to anyone who wants an escrow company that is fast, courteous, and willing to go the extra mile!

The salsa bar IS the best in phoenix. Just tried the Napoleon taco made with filet mignon: loved the sauce with mushrooms and crunchy onions, as good as what you would find in a fine dining restaurant. This will be my new favorite along with the cabo shrimp taco: big fresh and juicy shrimp fried to perfection! I also love their quesadillas...not like anything you would get anywhere else.

Delicious food and reasonable price. I like Mexican food so much, La Santisima 
is great Mexican restaurant.

Pass! No kids menu. Expensive and very different from the typical Mexican restaurant. 

Although the margarita was great, the food was not. We asked for a burrito for each of the kids containing just chicken and cheese, and they charged us $25 for the two of them. My husband and I ordered a chicken burrito that was so-so, for $10 each. 

I would have been fine with the prices if the food was good but it wasn't. The chicken was almost all rubbery dark meat. 

The salsa bar was fun but the chips were stale. The service was okay but I couldn't believe they charged us more for two burritos that contained less ingredients for the kids.
Oh the mole!!!!  It is a treat to come here and have such amazing flavors, salsas and variety.

Love this spot, I drive from Chandler all the way to Glendale to enjoy this restaurant 

Cochinita pibil tacos very flavorful 
Tried the chicharron quesa was awesome 
Definitely recommend this place 
Small little restaurant with a whole lot of flavor
The Horchata drink is delicious, my favorite by far, it's like no other!!

Tip: When it says 3.99 a la carte, it's actually only 1 taco. Only the taco plate has 2 tacos. We made that mistake and our bill ended up tripling in price. 

On a brighter note, the horchata was fantastic! This is the first time I've seen horchata filled with so much fruit and it was such a large size, perfect for sharing. We ordered the slow cooked pork taco and I thought it was a little too messy. I enjoyed the fish tacos the most, light and crispy.

Also loved the extensive salsa bar and the fact there is cilantro salsa!

This place has a very unique atmosphere. My family owns the oldest Mexi restaurant in Scottsdale so I know a few things about Mexican food. First off, the food was awesome however the waiter was not very helpful for first- timers. Second of all, he snuck guacamole into our order. My dinner partner was upset they weren't up front about that. She is less experienced and thought the guac came with the chips. Shame on you for that. Be more upfront and helpful to new patrons. Probably will not be back but thanks for the amazing tacos!

BOMB! LIFE CHANGING! DELICIOUS! A lot of my visits to restaurants happen just by chance. I googled, "Restaurants near me" as my husband and I were driving up 7th St. This came up and I thought the name was interesting so we decided to give it a try. MAN! This was a good pick! 
The food was so delicious and freshly made. They had a salsa bar with many different salsas. All were delicious and none too spicy. I should knock it off a star because the service was not great (they were slow, but it was because they are busy)  but I can't because their food was that great. I got the 3 taco combo with rice and beans (1 taco barbacoa and 2 shrimp), my son a traditional quesadilla, and my husband the Mazatlan burrito with shrimp. All of it was amazing! The beans were not out of a can, the rice was do tasty and...man! Honestly, greatness! 
We are from out of state and I joked with my husband about coming back before heading back home, but honestly, I was not joking. I would definitely go there again, and again, and again, whenever I see my way back to AZ.
