The food is very good, but probably not "gourmet". The entrees and salsas won't disappoint, and there are great choices for everyone. In all honesty though, La Santisima is just a cut below the Taco Guild or Barrio Café. It is not that they are doing anything wrong - the other places are just a little bit better.

The food is inexpensive, the drinks are good, and you won't leave without a smile on your face.

Saw this restaurant on Diners, Drive ins and Dives and realized it was down the street from my work. The salsa bar is off the charts. Didn't even realize there were so many types of salsa. The ones I tried were delicious!! Restaurant is quaint but adds to the feels. Art work on the walls is super cool and also adds to feel of the authenticity. Highly recommend!! Loved it!!
Extremely poor service! The location on N16th street in Phoenix is better in terms of service. Food tastes the same.
Best quesadilla I have ever had and hands down best margarita! Staff was super friendly. Will come back if ever in Phoenix again

What a great, quaint place!  The salsa bar is amazing!  We have not been disappointed anytime that we have visited.  The food is always delicious.   The seating is limited, so I would avoid the prime meal times.
Great food, very slow service.  I can't imagine what it would be like if they were busy.

Holy hell, their Arab-style burrito (a tahini sauce, al pastor, etc., in a burrito) is the best burrito I've ever had. I got a few of the cochinita pibil tacos as well based on another yelper's comments, and those we indeed excellent, but the burrito for me was the real standout. The pairing of tahini and smoked pepper sauce is a total winner, and is very interesting given the history of middle eastern food in Mexico. 

Also, don't skip the horchata. It has strawberries and nuts, and is devoid of the chalky horchata mix that many places had. Best horchata I've ever had - and like burritos - I've had my share. 

My only complaint was the chocolate mole taco - it was far too sweet for my taste, and had too much mole on it and ended up being overpowering. However, if you love super chocolately moles, you'll probably like!

This place is so small and always packed. The first time we tried to go they only accepted cash. The second time it was so packed that we couldn't even get out of our seats to check out the salsa bar. Food was delicious but the place was uncomfortable and too overcrowded to enjoy.
The black mole chicken taco's are the best I've had in Phoenix.  I've eaten black mole from Mexico City to the Yucatan, and these will rival any of them; except for our Aunt's in Mexico City.
Awesome food, good service and a super salsa bar.  The place was little small but nonetheless it was great!..

We'll as a taco shop it's ok it's a self serve salsa bar and get your own fork kinda
Place not overly impressed with the food beans runny rice was
Good tacos ok  prices are fair Service was good need some help on there tables they all are wobbly tried several lol give it a try.

I lived on the U.S.-Mexico border for a good portion of my life. Everybody claims to sell "street tacos" in the Southwest, especially AZ. After TWO years of looking for decent Norten~o Mexican food in the Phoenix area, I found La Santisima (formerly La Condesa). They have a wide range of salsas and condiments to add to your food. So check it out and try it. The salsa has heat and flavor that is lacking in 99% of "Mexican food" places around here. Be advised that it's a small place that specializes in tacos and burros and, at times, there's not enough room to sit. However, it's really worth the wait. I drive all the way from northeast Mesa/AJ to just have some of their fare. As far as the latter not so favorable review (9/6/2015) on here questioning authenticity, I don't understand how something isn't "authentic," when northern Mexicans regularly use mayo and mustard, due to U.S. influence. Ever had a Sonoran hot dog? The menu does state that the owners are from the northern state of Sonora. Regardless of these types of reviews, La Santisima is a great place to go have some beer and tacos in a dark place reminiscent of a taqueria on the Mexican side of the border. Besides, where else can you see posters of "El Santo" movies in the men's restroom? If you've been watching "The Strain" on FX, this is the movie hero upon which the "Silver Angel" character is based. Without a doubt, wholeheartedly recommend this place for tacos and beer... btw, if you're looking for margaritas, the ones we had were far from "watery."

My favorite thing about this place is the fact that you have more than the usual carne asada, al pastor, and (insert third typical meat), instead you have a variety of different tacos, some which I've never heard of but all very delicious. Alongside this, you also have many salsas to choose from, ranging from not so spicy to spicy. I definitely plan on going back soon.

Delicious tacos, lots of variety to choose from! They also have a salsa bar with a ton of different salsas to pick from. We got a glass of Sangria and it was huge but delicious. It's a small hole in the wall type place, kinda sketchy area. Parking available in the back. Would def recommend this place to anyone. Will be back for sure!!!

I've been coming here for years, since it was named La Contesa.  I've also referred numerous business clients and friends.  Never again!  Not only has the service gone downhill, the prices are outrageous.  The one server brought us stale chips, unsalted.  There were at least 4 bussers working the place, but only one server???  Very odd for a 5pm dinner rush.   The guacamole and cilantro salsa taste as though it had spoiled.  Ordered queso fundido with mushrooms, a chicken taco plate, and a chicken burrito with enchilada sauce.  Never got the queso - no big deal I guess, somewhat expected when you have only one server and it's busy.  Rice was cold for both entrees.  The kicker was the final bill.  They now charge you for meat on your tacos and burritos.  It cost $20 for a chicken burrito with a side of cold rice, no beans!!!  The menu says extra charge for shrimp or mahi mahi tacos (2.95 to be exact), but nothing about a chicken charge for tacos.  They charged me $2.97 chicken on the tacos!  All in all, based on the quality of the food, the horrible service, the prices, the weird smell, and the stagnant air (A/C wasn't working in the first dining room), we won't be coming back.  Very sad, as this was one of our favorite restaurants in town.
Fabulous and unique burritos.   No wonder we stand in line to order.
Best Mexican food. Their margaritas are also amazing. Be prepared to wait, however it's well worth the time.

Food and drinks were amazing..I enjoyed the black mole` taco.  The salsa bar had a variety of flavors and spices...The guacamole was rediculously hot, but yummy!  The service was a little rough, it was very busy and i think they were understaffed.  They forgot to set our table and once served did not come around often to check on us.  If you dont mind waiting and sub par service come check this place out...The good food definitely outweighs the bad service.
this place was ok not as good as people make it seem one thing I like is salsa bar. dislike the location.
If you haven't eaten at this place, you're missing out! The tacos are some of the best in the valley. Not much seating and fills up fast, but well worth the wait.

I went by myself on a Saturday evening. I got there around 6pm and the place was pretty much totally packed, with a wait. However, they have a very tiny bar with a few chairs, so I was able to grab a spot there.

Parking was a bit stressful. There are only a small handful of spots in front of the building. The nearby neighborhood does allow free parking but some of the locals seem to have put up their own "no parking" spots in front of their house, so the neighborhood seems a little less than friendly.

The menu itself features a wide array of tacos, including some great fish options (I had a shark taco which was quite good). They also have some typical street tacos such as carne asada. The highlight may actually be their salsa bar, which features over a dozen unique different salsa flavors (there are some typical flavor and then some strange ones like peanut, cilantro, etc.). But beware, almost all of them are pretty spicy! The chips are pretty standard, but having such a wide array of salsa choices (and the ability to just go get them yourself whenever you want) really makes it a great experience.

My favorite part of the meal may have actually been the horchata. I have had tons of horchata in my life, but La Santisima features a very unique combination that includes real chopped fruit. It was very refreshing, and the portion size is a huge 32 oz.

All in all, this was a great meal. It is definitely worth trying to find a parking spot (and waiting for a table)!

We tried this place due to yelp.   We were impressed with the atmosphere as it has beautiful art hangings and the place is clean.  I ordered the guacho burrito and the horchata due to the yelpster's recommendations. I usually don't go for beef so I wasn't crazy about the burrito, but it was good.   I was freaking crazy about the Horchata though!  I am a salsa snob so it takes a lot to impress me.   Rule number one - it must cause burn or don't call it salsa.   The seven chiles was so good that there wasn't much left at the salsa bar.   What was left, I took!  Second best salsa was the salsa peanut!  It was creamy, hot, flavorful and the best salsa peanut I have ever had!  So happy that they serve real salsas. My only recommendation for them would be to improve on the chips.   The chips are a bit thin, but cover them with salsa and all will be alright. When in Phoenix-go to this place.   It's a bit small, but hang in there and grab a seat and set your tongue on fire then cool it down with the horchata!
Great food and service. Huge salsa bar with so many options. Will definitely be back many times!

Been here twice now. Think I have sampled a bit of everything. Tried three different kind of tacos (chicken, beef, and fish), a burro (carne asada), and a quesadilla (ground beef). Everything was really good. 

The quesadilla is quite a bit different then other quesadillas I have had. Much thicker. More like a stuffed gordita. Was really good.

Small place. No wait was I was there, but I can easily see there being one. Salsa bar is fantastic.
Holy cow, this place is great and very accommodating for vegetarians and vegans. The poblano quesadilla was incredible. Be sure to hit up the salsa bar and order some horchata, you won't regret it!
This food is phenomenal...best salsa bar, tacos and burritos! El gaucho and the santisima special are the best!

Stumbled upon this place and I'm so glad I did... This is the best Mexican food hands down in all of AZ! From the family recipe for horchata to all the different types of tacos you can see that they pride themselves with only using quality products! Cant wait to go again.

They have 3 items: tacos, corn quesa, and burritos.  They are all first rate!  They also have the best salsa bar with really creative salsas.  We've been here many times, tried almost the entire menu, and the food is always delicious.  The horchata and jamaica drinks are also a must!  Our only complaint is the noise level.  It's a small venue and they play the music loud enough that it interferes with having a conversation.
The asada meat smelled bad and tasted worse when we informed about it, not even an apology and they still charged us for the street taco. I won't be coming back.
This is one of my favourites Phoenix restaurants. The food is delicious and very authentic.

This place has been a tradition of sorts when I'm in town for work but unfortunately I contracted a nasty bout of food poisoning after eating there this past Monday night. I can't say with 100% certainty that it was the Guacho Burro but the only other thing I had eaten that day was a frozen breakfast sandwich and a coffee. Never again. Shame, I enjoyed it.

Hands down, the best Mexican food in the valley! This is the first place I saw the use of cactus in Tacos and it was yum! I am so glad that they have good vegetarian/vegan options. 
They have a kickass salsa bar as well. My favorite one was salsa mexicana. 
The food was so good that I forgot to take pictures. Sorry, hehe!

LOVE the food here and the atmosphere is quaint and authentic with great artwork.  Plan on being there a while- I think they have such an eclectic menu preparation time is long (no matter which location you go to).  The food and margaritas are well worth the wait though.
Shrimp Tacos are out of this world!!! So fresh and tasty. The horchata is great also!
There's nothing I can say that hasn't already been said about the GEM of joint... without a doubt my go-to for great Mexican food!!!  Small and quaint with an awesome salsa bar and delish food!

Greatest happy hour ever!  Cheap beer and street tacos.  We did not get any of the specialty ones but it did not matter, everything was fresh and amazing.  They have the best mole in the Pheonix, we searched multiple spots and this one is special.  Salsa bar is crazy!  I am taking my family here when they arrive!

This place was good!  I ordered 4 tacos to-go: dogfish shark taco, carne asada taco, cochinita pibil taco, and the chicken mole taco.

The shark taco was outstanding, it was not too greasy and topped with cabbage and crema.  The carne asada was some of the best I have had.  It was juicy and seasoned perfectly.  The chicken mole had great flavor and was very rich.  I wasn't too crazy about the cochinita pibil but that is most likely just a matter of taste, nothing was wrong with it.

The salsa bar is very overwhelming with close to one million different selections.  

By the way, parking is a nightmare.

Fantastic. I had gaucho borro, was delicious but I should have added rice and beans. Margaritas were tasty too. Guacamole was from perfectly ripe avocados, which I really appreciated.

If you go at night, don't be discouraged by the total lack of lighting outside. Inside the food was great and staff was welcoming.

This place is simply the best. This is my favorite Mexican food in Phoenix. I have sent MANY people here and every single person has been amazed. I moved to Seattle and boy do I miss this place. The service, atmosphere, and most importantly the food is GREAT. It is all fresh and I don't know who is back there making this heavenly food but they definitely know what they are doing! 

The salsa bar is huge and all of them are amazing. I can't wait to visit Phoenix so I can go again. They used to be call La Condessa.. not sure why the changed their name but who cares as long as they still have those amazing tacos, amazing burritos and that amazing salsa bar.  

Side note: I am a vegetarian and have had no problem with the selection of vegetarian food. Definitely worth it.

I ordered a steak burrito and really liked it. The quality of the ingredients were very good. The salsa bar has a large variety of different salsa's. I am docking two stars for service. I asked the cashier for a couple extra lids for salsa and she said that "it's three per order".  I told her I needed more salsa and if I had to pay so be it.  I really hate when places do that. That kind of thing makes me not want to go back.  Then after that incident, I had ordered to go and while I was waiting this man kept calling the to go order for  "ranchero burrito" and I didn't pick it up because I ordered a steak burrito. A few minutes later he asked me what I ordered and when I told him, he said "that's the order I've been calling!" How am I supposed to know my order was called a ranchero burrito when the menu doesn't even call it that?!  
Service is important to me when I go out to eat, as good as the food was, I probably won't be returning for this reason.

Came here with my cousin for some HH.

We in total had 4 margs ($3 on happy hour, can't beat that). And they were actually really good!

We both also had the Al Pastor burro which was good portioned and delicious.

Our server was friendly, however, the petite lady with dark hair when we entered was NOT. Dunno what her problem was. We "may" be back, but hopefully not when she's there. We got such a snotty vibe- and its not a good look. Maybe cause we're cute girls & she's a hater?

When we walked in, no one presented themselves as a hostess so I ask snotty do we seat ourselves? NO response. Ignored. Lol! Ok, so we just sat ourselves. 

I agree with other reviews, that we just sat there with no water, a basket of chips, and no service for like 10-12 minutes with workers wondering around knowing that we were sitting there. We had never been here before, so we didn't know about getting our own salsas until we were sitting for 10 mins and finally were able to ask. Even a "thank you!" on our part to snotty woman was ignored.. Ok lol. Just cause foods good doesn't mean you should lack in service.... And your SERVICE is what I will be telling people about if they ask about your restaurant.

since I cannot show my face in Gallo Blanco ever again, this has now become my fave gourmex establishment where they will trade food for $!

the tacos are good. the salsa is better. the only downfall, is NO ALCOHOL! ...which may be why I am still able to show my face in here...and perhaps why the hairspray is not sticky... NO ALCOHOL!
I had a groupon to this lovely place and since then I've visited this place TWICE! I absolutely love the horchata and have definitely not tasted anything better.

Great place, if you're looking for excellent unique Mexican food rather than the plain old run of the mill rice and beans being served every half mile in Phoenix. My wife and I love new and unique, we had one look at their salsa bar (all made from scratch) and had to try them all. The tortillas alone are fantastic, but then filled with shredded chicken, mole, shrimp, roasted peppers, fried cheese, cochinita, all blended with traditional spices and cook to delicious Mexican perfection and add to that the accompaniment of ALL THOSE SALSAS! The decor is beautiful, it has a very rustic cantina feel to it, with some amazing artwork on the walls. Over all the only disappointing thing is that we didn't discover this place sooner.

La Santisima could hold its own in any city. In Glendale, this place is a shining beacon of food  goodness. It's a temple of deliciousness in a culinary scene of soggy white bread. The guy recommended the tacos. They were all tasty, and the burnt cheese on top really sealed the deal. Yum! Definitely worth a return trip. 
As a bonus, it's next to a drive through liquor store, which seems like it should not be entirely legal.

Posted Sunday, December 15, 2013, but was deleted....

Rice and beans, just like Nana's house. Over 15+ tacos you can choose from. Each has its own flavor and distinction. Atmosphere is basic and modern. Paintings hang on walls. The simplicity of the restaurant is only supported by the flavorful tacos. This is a must to go spot in downtown Glendale.

We went based on Yelp reviews and are very happy for it.  The restaurant has an authentic feel to it and some interesting wall art.  Not a single sombrero in sight.  We both had the tacos,  which are amazing. I recommend you get 2, unless you are really hungry.  The guacamole we had was also very good.  All the staff were friendly and helpful.  We recommend this place.

Went here on a whim after passing by. Super happy we did. My husband had Carne Asada tacos , I had the Pastor they were amazing! My husband is supppppper picky about Mole. I make him try it everywhere we go for the past 14 years . Never found a good one till now! Amazing!!! But the most incredible thing for me was the Horchata holy good lord I loved it. I will be stopping by just to get that on my way home from work on many occasions. The waiters were a bit shy but very attentive without being annoying. I will defiantly be bringing everyone I know here!

I was so looking forward to some great Mexican food in Arizona. The stellar yelp reviews and visit by Guy Fieri made me think that this was just the place. Unfortunately, I was disappointed.

The restaurant is incredibly small. You have to try to snag a table, which makes lingering not an option. Plus, it makes it feel a little bit like people are watching you eat.

I ordered the Tinga Chicken Burrito. I was disappointed to find the chicken to be all dark and lacking flavor. The burrito had no cheese or spice. It was an okay burrito, but it was heavy and certainly not one I would crave.

Overall, I wouldn't come back.

Yeah, so, everything everyone else is saying about this place is true.  Marvelous tacos, great salsa, cozy and cool.  I had the tacos with chimichurri and pabil (sp?).  I would have ordered more but I had to run back to the hotel for a work meeting.

I died and went to taco heaven! This place elevates tacos to another level. The meats (I had pork, mani and steak), were seasoned and cooked to perfection. The chips are the real deal and compliment the amazing selection of salsas at the salsa bar! Decor is welcoming and has beautiful art. Service is friendly and prompt. Love this place!

Not sure if I agree about them having the best salsa in PHX but everything was pretty good and there were many salas to chose from. If your in the area I would definitely recommend it but, not really worth a long drive.
Yum !! The Mayan burritos are amazing ! Slow roasted seasoned pork in a delicious flour tortilla. So good. I ordered them to go so I don't have an opinion on the service this time. Go get one !!

Excellent food, excellent service
The restaurant is always clean and presentable. The owners are very warm and welcoming. Lots of different salsas to choose from. Fantastic horchata (probably the best i've ever had) 
Tacos are amazing!!

HANDS DOWN THE BEST TACOS IN PHOENIX. 
They have ruined any other taco shop for me. 
Dont think abt it twice and go.

Food was awesome! Went on a Saturday night about 6 and had about a 5 min wait. Right away got chips and water so we could try out the abundant salsa bar! Nice fresh Margherita while we waited for our steak, chicken and chicken mole tacos which were amazing!  Son had a steak quesa Dillard and hubs had steak burrito ALL AMAZING! Nice, fast service! Food was a bit more of a wait than normal but so worth it since it all tasted so fresh! Definitely a "come again" spot!

The food is excellent; great flavor (Aztec tinga chicken taco, Tlaloc cactus taco, La Sanitsima specialties taco with chicken). The salsa bar was great. The ambiance was fun. The waitstaff were friendly and helpful. The chairs scraping on the floor were annoying. The pink mold in the water container was vomitus. 

I would give the food 4.5-5 stars. Because of the water issue I am bumping it down. That is just gross. 

If you are gluten free, be careful: they use soy sauce in their cactus tacos. (Our waitress was apologetic and made me something else.)

All-in-all, we would come back and just order something bottled and skip the water.

Tacos were amazing.  Period. Very tasty and flavorful. The refried beans were house made and delicious. This review is not for the drinks. My margarita was ok. And for the price of $8 it was meh. Next time I'll have a $5 Mexican beer and I'll know what I'm getting. The Service was great and they made the most of the small space and were flipping tables as fast as they could. The salsa bar had an array of about 15 flavors ranging from super spicy to very mild. I'll be back for more tacos soon.

This place is so badly managed it's almost unbelievable.

The dining room has literally, 36 lights.. 34 of which are burnt out and have never been replaced.. 
it's a simple matter of replacing GU 10 bulbs,  it's not trying to find the location of the Ark of the covenant.

Instead they opted for a clip on style flood light ..with extension cords running through peoples table .. when they turn the flood light on the blinding beam felt like we'd been spotted by border patrol crossing the US Mexican border at night. 

Also here's a tip ...if you run out of guacamole every single day maybe you should make more guacamole in the beginning..just a thought..

That being said the tacos are tremendous!
The variety of salsas is pretty damn good. They will have everything from the most unoffensively bland salsa for gueros to a chile de arbol salsa that could make my daddy sweat.

Visited on Thursday February 23rd at 6.30PM. It had been a while since our last visit and i noticed the restaurant had expanded. Great expansion because i did feel in the past that this restaurant was rather cramped. We arrived at the door noticing at least 5-6 empty tables and room at the bar. We were greeted by a young hostess who stated that she was not allowed to leave anyone in because the waitresses/waiters were too busy and she did not have enought menus for everyone. We asked if we could sit at the bar and drink water until they were ready. We did state that we drove 45 minutes to get here. She stated that it might be anywhere from 40 min to 1 hour wait. My frustration with this whole scenario was that there were plenty of tables open and we were not allowed to sit down. Why expand a restaurant if you cant staff it correctly and get enough menus for each seating space in the restaurant. I will never visit this restaurant again based on this experience.
I thought the food was really good. It was a little busy because it was lunchtime, but thats ok because that means the food was fresh.

Salsa bar was great.  Some of the salsas were extremely hot and kinda wish they would label the heat index somehow.  The tacos and horchata were fantastic.  Two young guys as the servers who were extremely friendly and helpful. I didn't realize the quesadillas were fried which I didn't like.  I am not sure if it is listed on the menu, but that really is a slight complaint.  

I would go again and just stick to the tacos

I'd give it zero stars but that's not an option. The food was mediocre and lukewarm. Service was relatively slow. I have no idea how they have 1500 reviews and are graded at four and a half stars out of 5.

La Condesa, I give up on you. We try and try to excuse the terrible service, but no more. It's not worth it. It's too slow and inattentive and they just don't give a damn, so I'll take my $33 elsewhere.

This time we were disappointed by the food, too. We returned our horchata for being too thin and tasteless, and you brought us new ones after we finished eating. You drizzled a pretty crema all over the top of my torta (sorry, lonche). How do I pick it up and eat it? 

In the past we forgave the dirty tables and loudness because your cochinita pibil was pure bliss. But not even that makes up for the service. :(

I had to finally give La Condesa (recently changed their name to Santisma Tacos) the five stars they deserve. THIS PLACE IS MY JAM. We eat here all the time and believe me when I say that their santa condesa veggie taco is the best you'll ever have in your life (if you're vegetarian) and definitely awesome even if you're not a veggie. My go-to lunch/dinner is the 2 taco plate with one santa condesa and one ghandi vegan taco (their guacamole on this is divine). If you haven't ever had a horchata with fruit and nuts in it, it's about time. Theirs is delicious. 

They also have brunch (!!!!) and it's so fabulous. Just make sure to add Oaxaca cheese if it's not already part of the option, trust me.

Based off the salsa and margarita I'm in love. My food isn't even out yet and I'm a happy girl. Fresh quality taste. Service is great although my mom and I are the only people here. I will definitely be updating after I eat my quesadilla. Yummy yum

One of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix!  LOVE the protein-style tacos and yummy salsa bar.  I love condiments, so the salsa bar is a definite highlight for me.  Also, they recently expanded the restaurant so it is about double the size of what it used to be. I will be back again soon!

Waited for 10 minutes at the bar without so much as a hello from the staff here. I understand being busy, but to not even be acknowledged while waiting is pretty rude. I didn't try the food because I tired of waiting and left. Probably won't return.
Their tacos are fantastic!  Margaritas fantastic.  Seating could use some help. Crowded, Too many taters in the bag.

Thee best tacos and salsa bar in Phoenix, hands down. Service, not so much. I went about an hour before they closed one night, completely full house cleard out about 30 min before closing. With 30 min till closing they started cleaning up, turned off music and brought us the check. Kinda irritating to feel kicked out after I spent money at your establishment....but ill just have to go earlier I guess.
Outstanding wish I had this place in Utah the quesadillas are amazing, great selection of salsas

they have 2 taco orders and i was stuck between two kinds so the waitress said, you can get one of each. perfect. i love problem solvers. the tinga and the cochinita are great. they come with picked purple onions. they pickle them with lime so it comes through strong, but i like lime.

Cravings during pregnancy is no joke. So when my pregnant self wanted some Horchata and Mexican food, yelp offered this restaurant as an option. I was half way out the door when I saw a picture of their Horchata. Although this establishment is almost 30 min away from where I live, I will go to great lengths to satisfy my cravings. 

The restaurant was small - fits like 25-30 people small. But it was cozy and vibrantly decorated in Dia de Los Muertos theme. My friend and I had a hard time figuring out whether we were to seat ourselves or if we were to wait for a host/hostess to seat us. There was no hostess stand and the staff looked to consist of about 4 people (all extremely busy). After much confusion and waiting time the man who we can only assume was the owner sat us (we walked up to the register to ask). 

The Horchata was excellent; and the food was even better. I will say my most favorite was the Pacific White Fish taco but the Black Mole Shrimp taco was just as delicious. My friend ordered the Maria Sabina Quesa which consisted of Oaxaca cheese and sautéed mushrooms deep fried in a corn quesadilla topped with Mexican sour cream and queso cotija. I am not used to eating a quesadilla this way but I don't think I can go back to the flat, boring quesadillas that I used to know. 

I love that this restaurant is authentic to Mexico and incorporates flavors from all regions of the country. I believe the reputation of the food is true to other yelpers' reviews however I have to comment on the under par service we received. I realized at one point that the service took a hit probably because the owner and sister/gf/wife (???) were noticeably feuding. I hope it was just an off day and am most definitely looking forward to my return.
Hands down, the best Mexican I've ever had. Ate there in Feb 2014 and have been talking about the place ever since!

Best Mexican restaurant in Phoenix manos down. Be patient with the service since it's soooo small but their food is the best. Their take on a quesadilla is delicious. Their salsa bar keeps my wife and I coming back time and time again. Just be careful not to get too full on chips before the meal comes out.

The food was delicious and the margartia was the best one that I have ever had. The service however was poor. It took way to long to be addressed by the waitstaff. I believe it was because they did not have enough employees. We will be back!
We love this place. Delicious food, quaint atmosphere, and delicious food. Recently expanded to double the space, there may still be a wait, but it's worth it.
Went here for lunch - it was packed but service was quick and we were able to share a table with another group. Taco selection is excellent. Highly recommended.

I ordered the el pastor and carne asada tacos, and they were great. The wife got the shrimp tacos. They had great flavor, but the shrimp was a little small with a lot of batter. Unfortunately the batter became a little soggy and diminished the great plate. Overall, good food. The freshly made horchata was the most amazing drink I have had in years.....a must have every single visit. The dinning room area is really small, few seats which means it fills up fast. Service was mediocre, not a very personable experience.
Simple, best shrimp taco's! Love this place!
Love their salsa bar and margaritas. The avocado salsa is my favorite. I don't eat meat, just seafood, so the menu is a little limited for me but I can always find something tasty.

Meh. This place came highly recommended, but it wasn't anything special. The food was okay and very overpriced for what you get. We ordered a three taco sampler plate,  and, while the presentation looked colorful and different, each taco tasted pretty much the same.  I will say, however, their guacamole is fantastic! With that said, it was $6 for a small bowl of it. Also, they have a nice selection of salsas at their salsa bar. 

I give it two stars for the lackluster food and also the environment. There were flies in the restaurant competing with my every bite, and the women's bathroom was horrible. Everything was broken!  The toilet paper dispenser, paper towel dispenser, door lock, and even the toilet seat.  

The restaurant was very busy for a Thursday afternoon at 2:00 so I may have hit them on an off day.

I've had my share of Margaritas and I must admit that these are the best in town. However, the new Glendale location needs to catch up on the quality of Margaritas as the ones they serve at their parent location (16th street and McDowell). I have faith that they will as they begin to settle down at their new location.

Though the food was decent, not amazing, the service was poor enough to not ever be back. I felt bad for the servers, there was 2 of them and they seemed overwhelmed. There was no sign of a manager or even a busser or greeter, so I think they just had way too much on their plate to give good service or even to smile. Like many of the other reviews the best thing about this place is the salsa bar, however most of the "good" salsas were empty and never refilled during our visit.

It worse than what I thought. La agua de horchata is way too much. Trying so hard to change it and add more to the original receipt it just makes it messy. Food wasn't good enough to recommend and the service was the worst. Dennys employees are way friendlier and way more professional. This place looks cool but the parking, service and food is not worth it.

Had a Groupon - went there today...  It was fantastic!  

I had the Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken Taco plate. Loved it!  I normally don't order rice and beans but since It was my first time visiting here, I did get them.  The beans had a nice flavor and they were moist enough to dip my chips in and eat that way.  The rice had bits of corn and cilantro and was very flavorful.  

The salsa bar was also delicious with several options to choose from, including a strawberry salsa that was very nice for the sweltering Phoenix summer day.  

I liked La Condesa so much, I bought another Groupon while eating my lunch!  :)

It says something when I've gone to this place 3 times in two weeks. It's a gem. The tacos are amazing. I love the fish tacos but the salsa bar is a huge plus. They have something for everyone and everything is delicious. Everyone I've taking there has enjoyed their meal.

La Santisima Gourmet Taco Shop is my favorite place in Phoenix to get fish tacos and Mexican seafood.  The ingredients are really fresh, and everything tastes yummy.

Service can be a bit slow and seating is limited.  So, I recommend calling and placing to-go orders.  If you try to eat inside the restaurant during peak hours, prepare to wait 30 minutes.

I usually get the Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Tacos, but I also like the 
Cabo Shrimp Tacos.

My boyfriend prefers beef, pork, and chicken dishes.  So, he usually gets the Sonoran Carne Asada Tacos or the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Tacos.  He also likes the Aztec Tinga Tacos.

Oh hells yes!  I had driven past this little gem several times and never really gave it much thought.  That is until a friend of mine invited me to join for a bite.

Some may say this place is small, but I say it's quaint.  The menu is pretty big, lots of veggie options:)  I ordered the veggie burrito (mushrooms, spinach, cheese, rice,  etc.) and my friend ordered a few different types of tacos.  I was excited to see how amazing the salsa bar was!  I opted for a creamy cilantro sauce.  It totally kicked up my burrito!!  I could order that burrito each time and use a different salsa and never get bored!  

The service was top notch and the prices were very reasonable.  Two very enthusiastic thumbs up!

Just had lunch there and as for being a major taco fan i have had better(Los Angeles Tacos still rule) , but overall its pretty good compare to other places near by. I had the Argentine Style which thats were my dad is from.. was not as great the meat needed seasoning and the chimichuri was bland , not to mention a little cheap on putting the sauce on , so i had to ask for more. But the one that got me was the shark tacos , now thats a taco ! Just wish the would recomend the sauces/ salsa to put on it that would help bring out more flavor. They have so many salsas I WANTED TO TRY ALL OF THEM !  Great place for a good lunch and awsome concept ! if you have'nt tried it , you must go once its a fine meal for $10. Happy hour prices seem to be reasonable also. I will be back again i must say and will ask more questions about the sauces.
Some of the best tacos we have ever had.  Had a great assortment of flavors, even vegetarian options.  Fast and friendly service. Loved all of the options to chose from.

I've been here a few times. Its small and always crowded when I come. Food takes longer than usual to come out but it's worth the wait. They have an awesome salsa bar but if you get there at the end of the night you might find it empty, which is disappointing. Don't come here if you're expecting street taco prices because they are far from that. Carne asada tacos are good but not worth it for me.

Anyways I go here for their AWESOME fish and shrimp tacos. They are pretty big and are delicious. Their food stays pretty consistent in taste. One of my favorites in town that I have found so far (my quest for good tacos never ends).

Food here brings you back to old tradicional Mexico , the food is really implemented with lots of the tradicional spices of Mexican cuisine, there's great selection on the menu , the service is top notch , and definitely the taste of food is excellent, I will definitely put this place on my bookmarks of places to come back .... btw there's a salsa bar :)

I wanted to like this place but I go two different tacos and they seemed so bare and tasted very similar and only had meat on it. The salsa bar was amazing. I'll probably try it one more time and skip the tacos.

Yes. Just yes. If you go, do the carne asada tacos. They were delicious and very decently priced. The beans tasted like homemade, honest to goodness refried beans. The salsas were all really interesting and the chips were nice and crunchy. I will definitely return!

Edit: went back a second time with my husband's family and even though there was 6 of us, we were treated very well by staff and I'm assuming owner. Great experience once again!!!

This place delivers excellent gourmet tacos, delicious horchata, and Mexican bottled sodas. I can't wait to go back. It was so delicious and they had over 10+ tacos to choose from as well as other Mexican entrees. They don't have a kids menu, but the waitress helped find some tacos my kids would like. Definitely recommend and will return!

Heard about this place from an out of towner believe it or not & had it bookmarked for ages (like 12+ months). Then the hubs & I saw a DDD review & being a mole freak fan had to come & try the Chicken Mole Taco. Boy freakin' howdy. The best mole I've had well since EVER. I sincerely loved it. The hubs got the fish burrito with Mahi Mahi & it was divine. The tortilla & fish were super fresh. The molie I want to take a bath in & eat my way out. Just amazing. We tried a mango margarita we shared. It was sweet but not the usual margarita mix sticky sweet grossness by any means. We loved the salsa bar too. So many salsa choices & not 14 varieties of green & red traditional salsa. FYI a chip refill is $2.40 but worth it. Very creative delicious salsas. Loved the entire experience. The place is small so it is a bit cramped as it you feel like you're sitting at a few tables at once & the whole restaurant has only 2 servers on a busy Saturday night. They seat you, take your order, refill your drinks, deliver your food, bring your check, they are the cashier & bus their own tables as well. So it's not like you're waiting because they're flirting with a busser or on FB behind the drink stand. They are BUSY! So be patient & kind. The food is worth the slowness. Now run & enjoy the taco deliciousness!

Had a wonderful lunch yesterday. My daughter who works at a hospital nearby took us to this small restaurant with great quality food. Try several different sauces that are available to choose from a "sauce bar".  I highly recommend the quesadilla which is more like what I call a Mexican calzone. You may have to wait for a table, but it is well worth it.

soOO yummy!! 
the best vegetarian tacos around!! 
fantastic salsa bar too  & the Horchata soOO delicious! mmmm

i have been to this place a few times now.. in the beginning it was amazing but last time i was a little disappointed.

the salsa bar has lots of great flavors, but the best was the guacamole which used to be free.  now they charge $3.75 for a tiny container..!

the quesa (although tasty) can be VERY greasy.. took it to go last time and it was literally swimming in the container by the time i got it home.

the art on the walls and bathroom doors is lovely and tricks me into liking the place more than i would otherwise, i think.

not bad.. but not good.
The art work is groovy.  The guacamole salsa has a nice sweet touch too it.  Delicious! Great atmosphere & nice people.  What more could you ask for.

I keep coming back because the I simply love their tacos. I'm pescatarian (seafood only, no other meat), but I've shared meals here with vegetarians  and my dining guests always say they plan to come back. I love the veggie taco and the vegan option, and usually pair one of them with either a shrimp or mahi mahi. Always delicious (and, of course, the salsa bar if great!)
Unbelievable food, friendly and helpful staff, great vegan options. This place seems to get packed so plan ahead but I think it's well worth the wait.

Why can't I give this place zero stars?  This place was honestly horrible.  Our lyft driver recommended this place, because we were visiting Phoenix.  The service was slow & not friendly. The food came cold & was overpriced.  They don't even have tostadas?!...That was crazy to me.

Best carne asada tacos in Phoenix! I love that their tortillas are freshly cut and grilled. Everything is always delicious. However it is in a super sketchy part of town so you will get some unusual characters around.

If I can give negative stars I would. I have never been so disappointed in an establishment in my life. The food was alright. The service was horrible. Not enough parking. Had to ask multiple times for drink food boxes. Some we never got.  Would never set foot in this place again.
Great place, not fancy but good food and awesome drinks. Can't beat $3 margaritas during happy hour. Waiter was funny & friendly. I will bring friends to enjoy this place. Prices on food are decent.

The best Mexican gourmet restaurant in Phoenix. It used to be really small but they took over the party store near door so now its not crowded at all. The restaurant has a nice atmosphere with beautiful handmade Mexican paintings. The best part is their huge salsa bar. Extra orders of chips are not extra though by the way.

I understand that Saturdays are busy, and more bc I know the food is good but it is really disappointing and disheartening that I sit for 40 minutes and no one comes to take our order yet everyone that came after had already had theirs taken. Also waiting until the hour and our drinks weren't even at the table. The service needs 100% improvement. It would have been alleviated if someone at least came to acknowledge that we were patiently waiting instead of passing by. Or when they finally took our order an hour later, could you at least apologize for the wait??!

If you LOVE Salsa then this is your place. Great Mexican food. Best hole in the wall ever.
16 different Salsas...so your going to find a few FAVORITES!!!!! Great place to go with friends. 
I am sure it will become a favorite meeting place.

Finally you got back over here first time was excellent tacos were very good especially the shrimp tacos I love them tempura batter on them this time try to roll a burrito and wasn't all that good 2 much I think still love their salsa bar a lot of choices and they're all delicious the service was not very good I don't really blame her they are having a employee meeting at 5 at night I would think that's a wrong time to have one especially when the place is filling up and no one's being helped  so I will be back but I'll get the shrimp tacos once again hopefully service will be better next time
Best tacos in town. No doubt. Always on point, take out option makes always eating their tacos super easy. It gets pretty packed late nights and weekends. Still worth the wait. Always.
Strong margaritas... Fantastic good... Good service... Great vegetarian options... Veggie tacos were off the hook... Chips not so hot but this hole in the wall place has a lot going for it.

This is my first time in Phoenix and decided to try this place this evening due to all the yelper reviews. I was not disappointed. The salsa Bar had many different flavors of salsas-- yum!!! I was really pleased.  So many varieties and all complimented our meals very well. I got the al pastor bowl (perfect low carb option) and I was absolutely delicious! The kids had a chicken quesadilla and they were very happy. If I'm ever up this way I just may come here again. We had a wait for 30 minutes to get a table and we also had to wait 30 minutes for the food to come. It is fine except for little kids having to wait was not easy.

This location is on a dark corner bit excited to see the crowded restaurant. We had to wait (15 minutes for someone to clear the one  table that was not being used. The Bar tender was the waiter bus boy and he said "we all do everthing
Delicious street tacos. The salsa bar was great. So many different unique salsas. I would diffidently come back

The food was amazing, and so many choices. I had a al pastor street taco which is probably one of the best ones I've ever had. I also had the pacific white fish taco, two big pieces of fried fish, very crispy and tasty, and my friend and I shared the poblana quesa quesadilla, very untraditional but so good. You get chips when you sit down and theres a self serve salsa bar with a big variety of all kinds of salsas. Limited seating but we got a table right away. Can't wait to go back!
Awesome salsa bar. The Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco melts in your mouth. The horchata tastes like a liquid cinnamon bun.
This place is so unique. Everthing is a little different in a good way. I LOVE the pecan salsa! The tacos are great!!
The first free basket of chips was a great way to sample their salsa bar. Portions were huge! I loved their rice with a few corn kernels .
Specialty taco and margaritas are great. The Mayan taco is also good. Mole and Marlin were interesting but not as good.

Tacos were just OK. The wait was awful. The service was subpar. The restaurant doesn't seem to be able to keep up with the hype, in terms of service or quality. But I like the idea. Just wish it was executed better.

I've been eating at this place since it opened.  I'm not going to stop.  In fact I don't think I could stop if I wanted to- it's too good.  All the tacos are great (I especially like the La Condessa special taco with shrimp) and the El Gaucho burro and Bullet burrito are always a good choice. The place is clean and the staff are nice.  It's not always the fastest place to eat, but hey rushed eating isn't healthy!

The tacos are $4 a pop (I guess that's why they call themselves a "gourmet" taco shop), but they're worth every cent. I came here twice and tried much of the taco menu. My favorites were: cabo shrimp, fish, mayan pibil, arrachera and guacho. This place has the best salsa bar I've found in Phoenix so far, too. Great house margarita as well!

We have been here on three occasions so far, and I really like the food. The quesa poblano (Quesadilla with poblano chili's and oaxaca cheeese) is awesome.  I have only had the carne asada and al pastor street tacos, with beans and rice, and have no complaints.  Perhaps my favorite thing is the salsa bar, I am really partial to the Seven Chili's and the Salsa Mexicana, but there are so many great choices.

My only complaint is that on 2 of the three occasions we have been there, they have been understaffed on the front end.  Food comes out quickly, but not always the best service.  We never had our water refilled, and it took three requests to get a beer brought to the table.  Can't blame the server, they have been busy, but management may want to reconsider how they staff. 

Overall, this is becoming on of my favorite go-to spots for tacos.  If the service improves, I would bump it up to 5 stars.
The tacos are excellent and the salsa bar is fabulous.  Need to continue to go and the staff is friendly and helpful.

I've technically been to La Santisima twice, but have only eaten here once. I'm so disappointed because I live nearby and wanted this to become one of my regular spots.

Tonight the restaurant had a disappointing mix-up with me. I ordered pick-up from them using yelp. I waited 15 minutes then drove the 3 minutes it takes to get there from my house. The place was packed, and there were people waiting outside as well (on a Monday night at 8pm). I tried to get someone--anyone's--attention, to no avail. The staff do not seem friendly and will ignore you and try not to make eye contact with you, even when they are just standing there. I decided to ditch the crowd and wait in my car, refreshing my order status on the yelp app; even after 25 minutes they still hadn't confirmed my order. Soon I got a call from yelp concerned that they hadn't confirmed my order. 

I finally mustered the courage to go back in and push through the waiting area to speak with a staff member. They gave me a dirty look but I had to ask why they hadn't confirmed my order after such a long time. They quite nonchalantly explained to me that their yelp interface doesn't work. I told them I had prepaid and they said they couldn't do anything for me refund-wise; they didn't even think to ask if I wanted to re-order the meal I had pre-ordered via yelp. They were happy to take my money but not find out how to give me the food I had paid for. All the while, the staff member was more intent on doing something with the cashier computer than giving good customer service and talking to me. 

Previously, I have ordered the gandhi tacos. They were really rather pricey for some pretty basic ingredients and flavors. 

I hear this place has a great reputation; I am very frustrated by the terrible service offered. Also, if you know the yelp interface is broken, why not contact yelp to make sure no one pays for something that they inevitably will not receive? Thankfully, yelp is issuing me a refund (unfortunately I have to wait a couple days for processing). La Santisima did not own up to its mistake and made no apologies. Very unprofessional and very frustrating.

So I went to lunch here on a Friday and the place was full, but then again it isn't all that big. The interior is fairly nice for a Mexican food joint and what first caught my eye was the salsa bar. At least 10 different kind of salsas for the taking. This is a good omen. Gourmet Taco's feels incredibly insincere. It is like when MacDonald's have "a la carte" on the to of their back lit wall menu. It becomes a joke. 

I had the shrimp tacos that comes when ordering some cheesy slur that most surely contains the words 'baja' or 'cabo' or something silly to that nature. I also ordered the horchata to go with my lunch. The order is two decently filled tacos with both double corn tortillas. The shrimp wasn't the long monster that I expected but instead three minor in each taco. This was OK. Then it was filled with some kind of cabbagy mass that was completely raw and tasteless - but would look good on a  picture. This was not OK - tasteless filler is pointless. The horchata was tasty, but way too much ice in the glass. The salsa bar did not disappoint - they have hot and mild and spicy and seasonal, in this case some strawberry salsa that was strangely tangy. But I love the variety. 

I liked the food. Not all of our party did enjoy their meal, but I did. But it is too pricey for Mexican food.. because it isn't that spectacular at all. The price would be the discouragement for me, when it comes to my return factor. I have had better tacos for cheaper. that is the bottom line - but it wasn't bad. Not at all. 

In summary; meal was good but too expensive.

Haven't been to this location yet and decided to try it out since the original place my boyfriend was trying to take me was closed. Still delicious! Staff was light and there wasn't very many people there but it took awhile for the food to come out.
The wide variety of tacos here are the perfect vehicle for the inventive salsas! Would recommend to people who like eating at good restaurants.
Veggie Burro + Salsa Sesame = Heaven. Salsa Chipotle is a close second

Go early to avoid a long wait. But even with a wait, it's worth it! All four of our meals were superb. We sampled the fish, pork, shrimp and steak tacos, and all were delicious. We tried two with the "protein option", which had griddled cheese instead of tortillas, and I don't want to eat them any other way ever again. One of us had the lonche (like a torta), and there wasn't a crumb left. The salsa bar at the beginning of the meal (you help yourself) was unique, and it included 8-10 different kinds of salsas to sample (peanut, pecan, chipotle, tomatillo, etc.)  Definitely worth the trip. Bonus is the little party store next door with pinatas and all the fun fillings.

Veggie taco was awesome and so was the chile verde burro.  Service was good and the server took time to explain several items which was very helpful.  Salsa bar was excellent.  The only negative is the limited seating.

I've had nothing but good experiences with the food at La Santisima, and minor frustrations with a particular attendant can be easily overlooked when the cuisine was that good. 

My real love for this venue is from their simple, lovely drinks--including the best horchata I've had in Phoenix.  Chopped fruit and walnuts? Are you kidding me? Delicious.

Loved the food at the Flagstaff location but when we went to the Phoenix location we were unable to find parking  and the surrounding neighborhood was very scary. I felt it would be easier to score some crack or pick up a prostitute than get a taco.  I traveled all the way from N.California looking forward to trying them again on our vacation but I felt the risk of getting mugged and or raped was simply not worth a burrito.
Small place but good authentic Mexican food. The tacos r bomb and different salsas at the salsa bar. Moderate price.

I've tried a handful of different plates. Everything I've tried so far is good. They have a great selection of salsas. Some have a kick some don't but they are all good. Besides the constant reggae playing in the background the atmosphere is good. One thing I will say and hope you take my advice on is ORDER El Gaucho Quesadilla. If you ordered anything else you gone screwed up. Leave, come back and order El Gaucho Quesadilla. As you consume the best thing on the menu you will instantly feel regret for ordering anything else as well as regret for never being able to order anything else on the menu. I wanted to give this place 4 stars but El Gaucho is well worth the 5th star alone.

(Update 3/21/16) They seemed to have ditched the reggae for Spanish Rock! I mean Jaguares/Caifanes etc.  Definitely a 5 star establishment.

So fantastic! The salsa bar alone is worth going to see, unique tasty salsas. The tacos are big not street tacos, found out after I ordered 5 of them, but had plenty of take homes. Their horchata is the best I've ever had. The place it's self is small so make sure you get there before the rush. But absolutely check it out!

We were hesitant... Rolled up after dark ... Tired from a lengthy road trip... Exterior was scary.  Interior was delicious.  So glad we were brave enough to walk in.  Amazing menu... Delicious gourmet salsa bar.  Great margarita.  The salsa Fresca with strawberries was incredible... Seating is a little tight, but so glad we discovered this Guy-Fieri-approved 'dive.'  We'll be back.
The food was pretty tasty, but the service was not. I was ignored by the waitress for ten minutes until she asked if I wanted a menu.

Don't let the exterior fool you! This is such a great place. I had 2 Mexican street tacos, Aztec tinga and al pastor. The al pastor was amazing. But plan to get a few - these tacos are tiny! My boyfriend had the Aztec quesa and wow, I will never eat a more delicious quesadilla in my life. The chicken was so well flavored and the tortilla was fried and so delicious. 
The salsa bar was fun. I really enjoyed the strawberry salsa. But I wish there was a more traditional salsa at the bar as well. Highly, highly recommend a visit here.
Service is very, very poor waited for at least 1 hours for food n the server to see you. Not coming back

Great food, but the service has gone downhill since expanding.  We like the expanded menu. The waitstaff is pleasant, but inattentive.  Example, we came in and a staff member was leaning on the bar chatting, and didn't acknowledge us until another person came from around the bar to seat us.  Great food though.

When they call La Santisima a gourmet taco cafe, they're not kidding- there are so many different types of tacos on the menu, it's overwhelming and difficult to decide what to order! Add in the massive salsa bar and I was a fan before I even tried a bite.

This place is tiny, so go off normal dining hours or expect a wait. We lucked out and got seats at the bar, and ended up getting to try an extra margarita that was accidentally made for a large party. While you wait for your order, cozy up to the salsa bar, where they have ten different options ranging from mild to mouth-on-fire. The strawberry one was my favorite, but the tomatillo was really good too.

We ended up trying five different tacos, and they were all good in their own ways- this is a place to skip the generic fried fish tacos and go for the stuff that's really out there, like chicken mole and things you have difficulty pronouncing correctly. Will be coming back next time I'm in town to try more!

Overrated 
Overpriced 
Long waits 
Very small location 
Jam-packed
Elbow to elbow tables

Now with another location opened in Glendale, this taco paradise is truly become a staple place to eat in the state of Arizona! Inspired by the flavors and ingredients of Mexico, you can explore a variety of meals I've already fallen in love with. As you can expect, all ingredients are fresh and flavorful. One of the key things that sets this taco establishment from other larger brand competitors is that they try their best to help you forget about unhealthy, heavy, greasy style Mexican food you've had in America. It's time you experience what actual Mexican food is all about and perhaps you'll never go back to the rest. Popular items such as Quesadillas, Tacos and Burritos come to life with the help of fresh green tomatillos, Oaxacan cheeses, chipotle chiles, flour and corn tortillas. Other amazing things to try include the Horchata beverage, Carne Asada, Baja Sur Shark Tacos and more.

Oh. My. God. This place is so amazing, even the rice is delicious!!! We had the shrimp with veggie tacos ( I can't remember the exact name of the dish), Sonoran Carne Asada Taco, and al pastor burro. Every bite is better than the last, and my cousin and I had takeout! I can only imagine what it would've tasted like fresh out the kitchen. We also had strawberry margaritas (non-alcoholic to go), and we added our own tequila at home :-) An amazing last dinner to our weekend trip to Phoenix!!

Hour wait to get food served!
Yes it's gourmet , but way to long of a wait!
Appetizer Arrived with meal. Had to flag someone 
Just to ask for check... maybe they were short on staff. I don't know ,we only had service contact  when ordering.

If this place only served chips and their salsa bar, I would still give it 5 stars!  As a salsa and hot sauce (they're different, people!) fanatic, I tend to judge Mexican food joints based on their quality of salsa - and La Condesa ranks high!  Last time I was there, I counted 10 different salsas and 2 or 3 different condiments (limes, onions, etc.).  They offer a wide range of salsas from their exotic strawberry salsa, to spicy chipotle, or creamy cilantro.  It looks a little silly with 8 little cups on salsa at your table, but you have to try them all! 

The horchata here is also 5-star material.  Don't be a cheapskate - shell out the $4 for it! Its giant, it will make you happy. And, when you're done with it you can eat the fruit and nuts - the drink keeps on giving! 

I have been here twice and have only eaten the veggie tacos, 2 of them are enough to fill me up and they are very delicious!  I must say I am not a huge fan of their rice and beans, which seem a bit bland to me.  But, the tacos, salsa and drinks all make up for some plain 'ol rice! 

I was very  happy to see a decent sized crowd here on my most recent visit and that La Condesa is applying for a liquor license.  This place needs to stick around for awhile!

So I finally got off my yelpn butt and made it on over to La Condesa for lunch today. I got there around 1045, so I was that creepy taco stalker in the parking lot for about 15 minutes. I ordered teh La Condesa Shrmip Burro and the Oaxacan Mole chicken Taco. As I waited, I was able to check out the 8 or 9 different salsas they had there. Great stuff, I only packed up four. My fave, by a mile, was the creamy cilantro salsa. I wanna bathe in that stuff, like now. My food was ready pretty quick and I was in and out, which is nice.The taco was great, I really liked the flavor in the mole. I decided to add some of the peanut salsa the had, which was pretty good. I do have to say the Burro did fall a bit flat for me. there were tons of ingredients in tehre, but somehow it seemed to be a bit bland without adding any of the salsas to it.  Kiinda like that girl you see at the club, and y ou get home and...well, you get the picture. It was a good burro, but the shrimp were somehow flavorless and the bacon was non-existent. Not that I'm total food snob but when you tell me there's bacon in that mug, I wanna taste me some bacon. Overall my meal was good, I'm going to go back another day and try some other things on the menu, like the dogfish taco. Two thumbs up for the creativity on the food and the salsas, it's hard to stand out in teh Phoenix Taco/Burro scene.

There really are few words to describe how perfect the food is, how delectable the salas are, how great the waitstaff is, and how awesome the vibe is. Sufficeth to say, we come here at least twice a month (we have to hold ourselves back!).

Since my husband's from SoCal and I'm a born and bred Austinite, we both grew up eating delicious Mexican food. But I have to say that La Condesa truly beats out even my favorite spots in San Diego or Austin (sorry, hometown! you still have the best migas!). They are truly Taco Royalty.

Our favorite tacos: Mayan Cochinita Pibil, Arrachera (carne asada), the El Guacho, and the shark taco. Also, you must try their margaritas and horchata!

My friend and I decided to come here for cinco de mayo thinking it was going to be good. It wasn't. Horrible service who failed to tell us they were out of pastor and horchata. Came to our table once. And our server didn't know what kind of margaritas they served. The tortillas seemed like they were microwaved and the tacos were mediocre. Don't recommend it.

This restaurant, and the one on 16th street, are both outstanding.  The best, most interesting Mexican food in the Phoenix area.  And, reasonably priced.  The portions are so large that we  always end up taking half of it home for another meal.  The dishes are very unique and stunning.  The salsa bar is incredible.  I hardly go anywhere else anymore when I go out to eat, because other restaurants seem so boring and lack imagination, compared to these restaurants.  I just wished they sold their dozens of salsas in carry out jars/bottles.  I would buy all of them!
This place is awesome!! So many salsas to choose from!! If you want a taste of authentic Mexican food... Come here!!!
I could go there just to eat chips and salsa, very good! The tacos are really good too. Small little place with great service and great food.

This place is really wonderful
They have several options for vegans. And the salsa bar is great. I mean theirs so many different salsas to choose from and its all self serve take as much as you need or want.

The only thing missing at La Santisima is fresh hand made tortillas. That would make this place even better.

The inside is very nice. Rustic wooden tables and seats Mexican made. And lots of Mexican art and cultural motifs on the walls. Theirs a bar too.  Its more dimly lit so it gives the cozy feel
Waiters and waitresses are all friendly and attentive. Nice place for lunch or dinner and conversation no need to feel rushed.

I was in Phoenix on a one day business trip and found this place on yelp. I'm glad I did. The restaurant is small at first but has a variety of home made salsas at the salsa bar. I didn't get a chance to try them all but the ones I had were very good. They have really good service with a friendly server and prompt service. I had the mahi fish taco which was grilled and I also had the chicken taco. Both were excellent with the rice and beans. They give you soft drinks in a to go cup so that was convenient to take with me in the 100 degree weather. 

The food was really good and was better than similar tacos in CA. I'm glad I chose this place for my one meal in AZ before my flight home! One more thing the price was very reasonable and the location was only a couple miles from the Sky Harbor rental car center. Will go back if I'm in AZ.

So many taco and salsa options!! Met up with a friend and we got one of each on the taco Tuesday specials as well as all the salsas. Absolutely recommend you come here if you like options. We also got the margaritas and they were good. Service was a little slow but we were fine because of the bowl of chips and large salsa selection available.

I was in town for business and tried this place out based on previous yelpers. There is a salsa bar which has multiple options to supplement the flavor of your dish. I tried the carnitas burrito and it was probably the best burrito I have ever eaten. The presentation was very good as well. Also - I was there during happy hour and got a YUUGE margarita for less than $5. I'll be back next time I am in town
The food was amazing! We loved the salsa bar. I can't remember the names of the dishes we had, but everything was delicious. We will be going back for sure!
Excellent service and atmosphere!!! Great salsa bar. Fish tacos are some of the most delicious I've had anywhere.

Service was poor and it was empty too, around 8:30 pm. I ordered my grandson a bean and cheese burrito. He complained that the burrito was spicy and I thought he was just complaining. Come to find out, it had chili pods in it. We pulled out a couple of pods and the server replied, "They are added for taste." If we wanted a spicy bean and cheese burrito for him I would of added salsa from the salsa bar. The food wasn't all that and we NEVER got offered a refill on our drinks. I will never return to this place as I come back every year to see the Dodgers during their spring training. Save your money and go to a fast food restaurant. You are much better off not to mention their prices...

Had another awesome experience here at La Santisma last night. Although they were super busy, they managed to serve us promptly and the street tacos were great. I couldn't believe their house margarita was so tasty (and just $6.) Only bad part was I found out which salsa is the hottest for me (the peanut lit my mouth on fire) but all were delicious.

First time coming here! It sounds like they expanded a few months ago to accommodate for the traffic they were getting. There was constant people coming in and out even with the odd time we were there. Even though they were busy the service was fast and friendly. 
They had tons of different Taco options. They had a good variety of vegan, vegetarian, seafood and a salsa bar to woo any salsa lover. I got the 3 street Taco plater the flavor was good only complaint was that some of the meat was dried out which I had to pick out. My husband got some seafood Tacos that he picked here and there. Overall it was a fun experience but I think there are better restaurants to try. 
Environment B
Service B
Food C 
Location D

I VERY rarely give 5 stars flat out...but the Torta that I had today for lunch blew my mind, so I had to give 5 stars. Honestly this place is amazing and I'm already craving more. 
I ordered the Mayan cochinita pibil Torta (which they call something else) it came with just pickled red onions on top and rice and beans on the side. I was initially worried that I would be too dry or boring because it was so plain, but one bite and I was hooked. That slow roasted pork was to die for. I basically inhaled the entire sandwich. 
My family also ordered some tacos and those were incredible as well. The only thing that was a little disappointing was the beans, they were just a little too watery for my taste but they were still good. 

Highly recommend for satisfying cravable Mexican food fix.

I was so high on this place by all the great reviews, sad to say is that the majority of these people don't know great tasting meat, well, whatever small portion I received. I ordered the al pastor burro and was disappointed, little meat with alot of al pastor sauce, and to much secret sauce. I like the whole concept of mixing spicy with sweet as I got chunks of pineapple in my burro, as stated on the menu. And my michelada also came with a sweet and spicy rim, which i loved. The michelada was delicious but a bit pricy, $18.00 for two. Overall I was disappointed, would I go back? Sure, just for a couple drinks.

I've been here twice and both times I thoroughly enjoyed my meal and experience. This last time we waited awhile for our order but the server took an item off the check to make up for it! He made great recommendations and was very attentive. My absolute favorite was the shark taco but everything was good. The salsa bar was great and had a bunch of variety from hot to mild. They also have a fab Bloody Mary from what I'm told. 
Can't wait to go back!

This places quality has fallen off bit time. After this last tapatio burro I won't be back for a while. Old not well shredded pork,  not fresh cheese, made me feel bit sick to my stomach. Used to love this place, shame, not at these high prices.
Delicious food with an amazing salsa bar! Their horchata is not your average horchata - I highly recommend giving it a try.

I've been here twice now and I just don't see what all the fuss is about. Yes, the salsa bar is amazing, and the margaritas are yummy, but the food is heavy and somewhat bland. My friend ordered a chicken quesadilla and they brought her a cheese one instead and it had so much cheese in it that it was almost inedible. I got a veggie quesadilla and it was ok. My husband got steak though and it tasted and smelled phenomenal! I would try this place if you like chips and salsa and are looking for huge portions, but wouldn't suggest going out of your way for it.
We wanted to grab lunch before heading to the airport, and La Santisima was the perfect place. The salsa bar provided many tasty options to add to our already delicious lunch. Highly recommend!

OMG! La Condesa, I love you! 

If you drive too fast down 16th on your way downtown, you just might miss this little, neighborhood taco joint...and it will be your loss. 

La Condesa is a delightful little 10-12 seat restaurant with seating also available at the bar. The wait staff are courteous, helpful and knowlegable about the food. There is a salsa bar with no less than 15 freshly made salsas.. everything from your standard pico de gallo to a strawberry jalapeno and a spicy chipotle peanut. We've been here a few times and have not been disappointed. Try the Sonoran Carne Asada Arrachera steak marinated with Mexican herbs, fresh garlic & olive oil, charbroiled with mesquite charcoal or the Mayan Cochinita Roasted Pork Shoulder Taco with marinated onions and salsa habanera. If you order the "taco plate" for a few dollars more, you can get sides of their slow cooked beans and rice.

This is a place nice enough to take your mom and trendy (and inexpensive) enough to take your out of town hipster friends. 

Total neighborhood foodie heaven on a budget.

Came here to meet a friend of mine yesterday. We were seated in about 10 min around 8:15pm, so it wasn't super busy. We waited for 15-20 min for a server to greet us, which didn't happen. So finally, I walked up to the the bar area and informed the staff. One lady, who was probably the server in our area, said she'd be with us in just one sec! I went back to the table to wait with my friend. 5 min goes by and still no one came so we got up and left. What an absolute waste of time and no care in the world for their customers. Messing up an order is one thing and fairly understandable, but not a total lack of care and disrespect.
Omg amazing! I had the La Santisima burrito and it was so good!! The horchata was the best I've ever had and the La Santisima margarita was so good! I will definitely go again!!

Great sign.... Um couple of the salsas were ok.... Chips were spot on...Service was great! Food not so much. I think there trying too hard to be like barrio cafe and honestly fall short. Guy Fieri was too nice. If you like a gringo taco u will love it. I prefer real flavor and authenticity.

Food was great they even serve vegan food  , customer service not so good you have to wait 25 to 30 min to get seated even if they have tables available waiters just walk by you don't say a word to you, salsa bar was pretty much empty at 6pm come on people.... they also serve food in  earthenware dishes you can even smell right in to it...

Checked out this place about a week ago because I wanted to try some new Mexican food. I was pleasantly surprised with how good everything was. The guacamole with mango, cranberries and jicama seemed odd but I was intrigued. Ended up being the best guacamole I have ever had.

The beer battered shrimp and baby shark tacos were delicious. So good. And last but not least, the quesadilla was amazing. Very similar to an empanada in that they took raw tortilla, stuffed it, then deep fried it. Blew my mind. So good. I might order from them again tonight. It's a little bit of a ride from where I live (25 minutes) but definitely worth it.

They claimed to have mighty good horchata!!
The Horchata was indeed great!! :)
 I liked It! 
But not the best in my opinion, no place like Mexico could ever offer amazing Horchata to me thus far, nothing like the one's you'll find at street taco stands late at night in places like Cuernavaca, Chihuahua, Mexico city and or Acapulco! 
_ Anyways, coming back to La Condesa this place is super tiny, and should consider expanding to make it a bit more comfy, just my opinion! 
The taco platter I had included the Carne Asada , Pacific Fish and Cochinita Pibil taco. All three were okay, and just okay. The rice and bean were also A-ok, nothing too extravagant nor elaborate. I really think this taco shop could do better, they have the potential to, like their amazing salsa bar is a huge kudos to consider, and the staff too so you got that down Condesa, Keep up the good work and plenty of room for improvement if you care to know!

After almost 2 months of visiting this place, I am still fantasizing about their food!

I trusted my fellow Yelpers when I was taking a road trip with family to Tucson from California and had to stop for dinner on the way.  The Yelpers' raving reviews did not let us down.  When we got there it actually looked closed from the outside especially since the OPEN sign wasn't lit, but we took a chance and opened the door anyway to find that it was indeed open.  

It's a tiny little place with a Dia de los Muertos theme, so it was rich with color and culture.  There was only one server so it was a little slower than we'd like, but in her defense, she was pregnant. 

We each had to order the horchata with pecans and melon because it sounded so good.  The cup it came in was HUMUNGOUS and thank goodness for that because it was awesomely delicious!  We also pigged out on the chips and variety of salsas at the salsa bar.  The salsas are seriously amazing and there were a lot to choose from and taste.  I especially loved the jicama salsa.  

I ordered 2 carne asada tacos with rice and beans.  I was already so full from eating all those chips and horchata and usually it's hard for me to enjoy the taste of something after I'm super full, but the tacos were so good I finished them.  I only tasted a little bit of the rice, which was okay... probably my least favorite thing I ate there, but the beans were very good!  

I was soooo full afterwards and I left with a smile on my face and a new favorite restaurant that I'll have to stop at whenever I'm in Phoenix, which isn't very often, sadly.

OMG! Second time I've been here and will try to go everytime I'm in Phoenix! Most incredible flavors, fresh, wonderful salsa bar - can't say enough about this little place that you could miss if you simply driving up or down 16th St.  Don't miss it!!

Had a late lunch here. The mole chicken tacos were easily the best I've had north or south of the border. The food quality and flavors are second to none. A welcome departure from the standard tex-mex. The salsas were so fresh and interested four immediately jumped onto my plate. A cels toro, peanut, strawberry , and chipotle. Can't wait to return.

If the food and salsa weren't off the hook incredible, I would have given just 1 star.  Apparently I went to LCGTS on a really bad night.  But they pulled off a tasty miracle.  My pal and I went to LCGTS on our way to see Cheech and Chong at the Dodge Theater.  So we were up for some good Mexican food munchies.
