We walk in and there is a line... okay no big deal.  BUT there were no forks (we had to eat with spoons and fingers).  There were no napkins, and the salsa bar was bone dry.  I mean the salsa trays looked like they had been licked clean by a starving dog.  They were able to replenish the salsa but they completely ran out of forks.  We got no chips and no drinks.  We had to beg the poor, nice girl who was completely stressed out.  They were a tad understaffed.  It was a "trip".  

But somehow they managed to bring out my dish.... a Chicken Mole burrito and a Carne Asada Steak taco.  OMG were they amazing.  The flavors of those dishes and the flavors of the AMAZING salsa were just super.  The meat in that taco was cooked to perfection.  Crusty bits of steak that had a crunchy sear but were still very tender on the inside.  I didn't mind not having a fork.

While we were there, they LOCKED the door, just like Cheech Marin did in the Vampire den in "From Dusk till Dawn".  We were locked in as prisoners.  Apparently they were closing down at 6:45 p.m. due to being understaffed and not having forks or more salsa.  Luckily, my buddy and I were the last people to be served.  I will definitely go back.

Came here after my boyfriend had done seen it on Yelp. It is not by any means a large spacious restaurant. However, the best Mexican restaurants are primarily a hole in the wall. 

We split the House Margarita. We had asked for no salt but it still came salted. It was good,  although I don't like salt on my margarita when I am trying one for the first time because I want to know what it tastes like without anything added.

I got a lot of food (because I couldnt decide what to get). I got the traditional Quesadilla which is ironically not a traditional quesadilla. It is a corn tortilla  folded over that has Oaxaca Cheese inside and its fried. Its kinda like a Calzone but better. If I had to pick a cheese that could possibly be my favorite cheese in Mexican cuisine it would be Oaxaca. The Quesadilla was amazing but it is HUGE. I was expecting something around the size of my hand.  Nope, one half was probably the size of my hand. We did ask for no crema but they still put it on there. I also got the Conchita Lonche, the meat was delicious but the bread was kinda hard. It does come with mustard, which I was not expecting. It would be a great thing to order for Lunch for anyone who works downtown (which I do).  My boyfriend got the shark taco but I was not up for trying it mainly because I barely eat fish tacos when it is cod inside. It did look good displayed on his plate. I didn't get to try the beans but the rice was good. I have a hard time judging rice because I still believe my Nana makes the best white rice. 

The service wasn't bad but the woman was the only one really taking care of tables and about 4 tables including us walked in probably within 5 mins. So she was running around taking orders, running food and then touching back to the tables to see if anything was alright.  

In the end, I definitely am coming back.

The food is delicious.100% authentic Mexican food. Me and my co workers always choose to go there for lunch. Their salsa bar has many great options and their horchata is delicious. 

I do have a couple of complaints to say; during lunch time the place gets packed and has very limited space. The dining area is very small. Some portion sizes are unreasonable for the prices they charge (ex: torta below charged at $9.00) And the waitress/cashier during the day, skinny with black hair is extremely rude. She has no customer service what so ever. She seems bothered when you ask her questions about their menu or just in general. If you read through the reviews I'm not the only one who thinks so. She makes our visits  very unpleasant. 

Other than that I recommend the quesadillas. I gave this review 4 stars because of the food but if I had to go by service then I would give one

My burrito tonight was not the same as the many I have had before here. It was mostly rice not meat, so disappointed.
Please go back to your roots or you will lose your loyal customers!

Salsa bar had so many delicious choices and flavorful options that I was beside myself with excitement! The street tacos were so tasty and unique flavors has me come my back for more!!! Can't wait for my next trip back to this restaurant!!!

BEST TACOS EVER!

Gourmet tacos are fantastic but these are the best of the best.  The al pastor tacos as well as the al pastor quesa are amazing.  The pork is marinated and has great flavor, the inclusion of pineapple adds sweetness which works great with the savory flavor of the pork.  My personal favorite is the chicken mole which is not for everyone but I love it.  The mole sauce has great depth of flavor.  It is made from unsweetend cocoa and chiles.  Unusual but delicious!  

The salsa bar has a great selection.  I recommend the chipotle salsa with its smoky flavor.  The tomotillo and guacamole are excellent.

There were 4 empty tables open......and plenty of people waiting to be seated......this lasted for over 20 minutes. The staff just kept staring at us, leaving dirty empty tables. 

We finally Sat down after an hour of waiting. No water for 20 minutes. They finally come by to give us 1 glass of water and chips (80% crumbs) and they didn't come back to take our meal order for 17 more minutes. 

Over 2 hours of being in the restaurant, they tell me they have no more horchata. Wtf.  8pm on a Saturday???? No sorry but we ran out of what you already ordered and have been waiting on.....nothing. Everyone around us had one. Even people who showed up after us. 

Finally gave us our food---which ended up tasting pretty good.....but NO UTENSILS. I had to get up, go to the front and ask for some. Duh. 

Then our bill came and they charged us for the horchatas that we didn't even get. 

Absolutely horrible. They were so rude. I will not be going back.

Everyone loves the salsa bar, but I find it mediocre. Sure it has more salsas than most places, with a wider variety -- but it's just not what I expect from salsa. It's fun to try, but it's not something I would do it again. 

With the above average prices, and the mediocre salsa bar, it's definitely 3 stars for me.

I've been coming here for years for the food. It's awesome. The service might be the worst of any restaurant I've ever been to though. Saturday night, 8pm. The restaurant is 40% full with 15 people standing by the bar waiting for a table for 20 minutes. Their famous salsa bar is half empty and has been for 30 minutes. Not one person working there is hustling. I ask who the manager is. Oh, they're at the other store. No owner or manager on on your busiest night at dinner rush? Whoever runs the show here is leaving a lot of money on the table and regularly disappointing your patrons.

Probably not much I can say that hasn't already been said....La Santisima has delicious food and a killer salsa bar. I really enjoyed the chicken asado taco. I also had a fish taco that I wasn't the biggest fan of, but I could see how others might like it. In my opinion, it had too much breading on the fish. 
Oh, and the margaritas...yummy!  
Will definitely be back.

I came because of the ratings.  I made a stop in Phoenix prior to Sedona.  

We had breakfast tacos and breakfast burrito with yellow rice and black beans refrito.  The agua de Jamaica was perfect!  Chilled and not so sweet!!!  

The decoration is so colorful.  I saw many locals here too.

My friends love this place (seriously one of them has gone there like 10 times within a few months) and I have to say, it was pretty good. I love their salsas. There is this one, I can't remember the name of it, but it was so delicious.  If I remember correctly, The peanut one was not tasty at all. Their tacos was unique and tasty. I also got a burrito, it was good too. It is a little pricey, $$ for sure.

Came here to check out a New Mexican spot and it is definitely my favorite. Everything is fresh and tastes amazingly good!! I tried their shark taco and my brother had their fried quesadillas  Great service too. Can't wait to come back.

Went with my family for a birthday celabration. We had a bad experience. First of all the service was horrible, the food was overpriced for the portion served. They forgot one of our orders and still  charged. The waitress was rude and never returned to the table. The fastest thing we got was the check rather than the food. I do not recommend this restaurant unless u like overpriced food and bad service.

This was my first time here. I will definitely be returning soon! The horchata was the best I've ever had. Not too sweet but comes in 32oz portions. The casadillas are insane! More like a deep fried calzone. Delicious. Gaucho Burrito was also incredible. 15 salsas to choose from. Parking a little tough but don't let it hold you back from visiting this gem.
The saddest thing about this place is that it's more than 2,000 miles from my house. Hands down, best street tacos I've ever had! Mix and match them if you go.

The package is beautiful and the gift is thoughtful . The giant quesadilla is awesome to look at as it sits down in front of you but lack the big punch you would expect the dough lacks flavor . The salsa bar is large and has unusual salsas that are all good in there own way. The sandwiches are great the bread top notch. Hands down the tacos or at least the fillings are very very good wish they took the time to made a hand made tortilla to support the amazing fillings .

Food is consistently amazing.  Service is consistently deplorable. There is absolutely no efficiency, management, or organization. 

 Last time we had to order cocktails 3 times before we got them and ask for the check 4 times until we threatened to leave. So, here we are. ...

Today, we waited 40 minutes within their new expanded dining room.  3 servers, a hostess, and a bartender overseeing 8 tables and shooing customers off tell them 45 minute to an hour wait for a 3/4 empty restaurant.

There was a sauce covered bean in the bottom of our chip bowl and a shard of glass on the table when we were seated. Both pictured.

Ordered drinks and meals immediately upon being seated;  knowing the glacial pace witnessed so far and after another 20 minutes, we have an empty chip bowl, empty cocktails, and still no entrees or even a visit from a moving person.

What a success this place could be if anyone cared or even knew what they were doing attempting to run a business.

I'll start by saying that the food here is usually great. The pacific white fish taco is perfect. The salsa bar is just alright. My real complaint here is the service. Every time I walk in the servers all just ignore me until I actually say something like "uh hi I'm here to eat food" it's very awkward and makes you feel unwelcome. I'm an industry person and I really can't imagine letting a table sit for that long without at least checking on them. Bad vibes.

First time here we stopped because this place has vegan options. You do have to read the menu carefully because some tacos/burritos have cheese and cream.  I had the coliflor al pastor it was very good. Large portions and the have a great salsa bar as well

Food is good, atmosphere is good, but service is lousy.  We were seated and waited 15 minutes to get a menu.  The hostess that seated us was more concerned with her broken nail than giving us menus.  We ordered but never saw our waitress again until we were ready to leave.  We had a couple of beers but we had to go up to the bar and get it ourselves.  When our dinner was served after quite a wait, we had to ask for silverware.  Not sure we will go back.
My favorite place in the entire world. Amazing salsa bar, fruity margaritas and a very friendly staff. Always great service. Tell ya friends and fam, La Santisima is the best.

Stopped by for a quick lunch - the salsa bar was superb. Lots of selection - none were very hot though including the "de arbol". It took a while for the server to take my order and even longer to get a drink of water. I I ordered the Sonoran Arrecheta tacos and they were delicious - basically carne asada with cabbage. The server let my food sit in the window for a while and never came back around to fill my water. So because the food was ok but the service was terrible on many fronts it gets a two star review.

Small place but its delicious, I cleaned my plate. Arrachera, mariachi,asada,chilango tacos were amazing. served with white rice full of flavor and beans (wish there was just a bit more beans) but plates are fulfilling. 
salsa bar has so much selection, cilantro,peanut,sesame,pecan,jicama...and so much more. Definitely recommend  this place.

I had this restaurant bookmarked for a while after seeing it on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives. We were attending a show in Downtown Phoenix, so we went by La Santisima before that. It was around 6-ish in the evening when we arrived and there were only 1 or 2 small tables open, so we were seated immediately. Getting to the table was kind of like walking through a maze since the restaurant is small and crowded.

It was very obvious that they were super busy and there were only 2 people taking orders, delivering food, etc. It took a while for them to take our orders and then even longer to bring us chips to snack on & our drinks. When they did, however, we were more than happy to wait for our food as we were were enjoying all the different salsas with the chips!

The salsa bar they have is very unique. They had very flavorful salsas that I've never had before. My favorite was the peanut one. It was kind of thick and creamy with a bit of spice. Other salsas that both me and my boyfriend liked were the pecan salsa, the salsa roja, the guacamole, etc. There were a total of maybe 10 or 12 different ones, all that tasted great with the chips and also on our tacos. I'd come back here just because of the salsa bar!

As far as our food goes, I ordered the Tinga taco and the Cabo Shrimp taco plate with rice and beans. My boyfriend ordered the La Santisima Speciality tacos with chicken. Both the tacos I ordered were completely different from each other. The Tinga taco tasted good as it was served but I thought that the shrimp taco needed a couple of salsas to enhanced the flavor of the breaded shrimp. The La Santisima Speciality tacos were much like the Tinga taco in that there were a bunch of different toppings on them, so they tasted great as served. My boyfriend couldn't help but to add the delicious salsas on them anyways, however!

Next time, we come in, I'd probably skip both the rice & beans and instead order one more taco! It's not that the rice & beans weren't good, it was just that the tacos were SO GOOD! It's great that everything that can be ordered a la carte or as a meal. Some tacos are bit more expensive than other ones, but the whole menu seemed fairly reasonably priced.

Overall, like I've said, the food was great but the service is where there could be some improvement. We'd recommend this restaurant to others!
This was me and my wife's first time to the Gourmet taco shop. We absolutely loved it. Great salsa bar, best horchata ever and classic take on Mexican food. Definitely recommend this place.

I wanted to love this place. The chicken mole tacos are killer and the only reason they're getting two stars instead of one.   A confluence of negatives brought what should have been a five-star review down - fast.

1. Our waiter didn't have his heart in it.  He barely smiled, didn't share any pleasantries and was drier than toast.  No offer to refill water, to show us the dessert menu.  Just overall lacking in basic customer service skills.  

2. When was the last time you went to a Mexican restaurant and didn't bring home a doggy bag?   The portions here are for a bride-to-be trying to lose weight before a wedding.  The shape of the rice was a 1/4 measuring cup.  The refried beans were about 2 tablespoons worth.

3. The wait for menus.  The wait to be acknowledged.  The wait for drinks.  The wait for the meal.  The wait for the check.  i wanted to belt out that tacky song: "Cuando, cuando, cuando?!?"

4. The temperature.  Lukewarm food is not cool.  It sat somewhere for some unknown reason.  I'd usually send it back but damn!  I thought I'd eat next week.

5. The outside at night.  What's up with the no lights?  We drove by the first time because we had no idea it was open.  

6. The margaritas are creative but DAMN!  Inordinately expensive.  We are not on the Upper East SIde of Manhattan.

7.  The plates.  I guess they're reminiscent of Mexican pottery but they looked like they could contain lead.  No bueno.  

The salsa bar is killer - they make their own unusual and tasty concoctions (pecan salsa?).  Quite lovely.  

But they really need to step up their game and stop resting on the laurels of Diners, Drive Ins and Dives.

Came across this place on yelp and needed to fill up after our flight in. The food was beyond my expectations; I ordered the mole burro and it was amazing. The mole was the best I'd ever had - chocolatey, nutty and savory/sweet. The accompanying rice was a standout for me too. We ordered the caramel flan and that was amazing too. Go here.

This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in the city. I love the salsa bar which has a revolving variety of seasonal choices. I love the pecan and strawberry. There is a great variety of Sonoran style tacos as well as street tacos. My mom loves that they do protein style tacos where they cook the filling in cheese rather than tortillas since she is on a low carb diet. The atmosphere looks like a restaurant you would find in Mexico with old wooden doors and dia de los muertos decor.

Lovely downtown restaurant
Right off the I-10
Old school magic
Love the atmosphere
Single girl can walk in have a great
Dinner
Amazing margarita that was fresh
And unique
Chips and salsa bar
Exceptional
And the tacos
Loved
Had the poblano with raisins and beef!!!
To die for)))
And a barbacoa taco,
Meat was tender and just the right amount of heat!!

I'll be back with the troops

Embarrassingly upset that I lived in the Phoenix area for a few years and had never tried this dive. Heresy. I am ashamed.  I am bitter.  But when i think about the food I suddenly feel better, willing to let bygones be bygones.  It has some simply amazing street tacos and probably the best salsa bar I have ever encountered. 

Easy to miss (when driving and also after not eating there for a few days), so prepare! If only their cool Dia de Los Muertos t-shirts came in big guys sizes.  I would've bought the pink one, even.

I decided to try this place again. It's a lot bigger than before the food tasted great! I am in love with their horchata but it's a little pricey. The only negative thing I have to say is to move the salsa bar away from where the restroom is at, kinda gross.
SO good!  I love the enchis and how there is a salsa bar...a little pricey in my opinion but it was delicious!!

Dear 16th Street,

Please continue to bring it!  Just yesterday a colleague at school told me he thought Barrio Cafe's food was diminishing in oomph.   I disagreed, but that evening, I just so happened to bike over to La Condesa to try out this new gourmet taco place on 16th.

The cursive red neon sign, that word "gourmet" and the dozens of Yelp endorsements ushered us in on a Tuesday night.  Warm walls. Original paintings. Furnishings from Bellas Artes de Mexico.  The most substantial wooden tables and chairs in central Phoenix.  When we had opportunity in our conversation to "knock on wood," we felt a bit shamed by the feebleness of our gesture and the robustness of the table.  Order at the counter from a cheerful and demure young lady, whose accent we could not place.

I linger on the ambiance because others have noted the stellar food.

Your food food for thought:  Come for the two taco meal (with beans & rice (with corn!)), and stay for the fresh and diverse salsa bar.  This isn't Baja Fresh.  This is Condesa cuisine.  Think jicama and orange salsa.  Think peanut salsa. And the creamiest, zingiest cilantro creme salsa!

I must disagree with Lali about the beans: America's Tacos' are more memorable, but you are still right, Lali, on a technicality -- the beans at America's are not pinto...It's a secret. Not really. Ask them.

We were traveling in Arizona, found this place on the show website of Diners Driveins and Dives

The number of vegetarian options they have is second to no other mexican restaurants we have dined in. You can eat here just for their salsa bar if nothing else.
They have about 15 varieties of salsas most of which are awesome!

We got the chicken mole burro, beer battered avocado and cactus tacos, all of which were great.The food took a while to arrive, it gave us plenty of time to try their salsa bar

The service was great. Will definitely recommend this place to others.

Mexican style food in Phoenix is both varied and plentiful, so any restaurant that can lure me in to being a regular is doing something right. 

La Condesa is a hip little taco shop on 16th street, close enough for me to walk to. The decor is a trendy/traditional mash up that works well. Honestly, the food is good enough that I'd probably buy it from a guy in an alley. 

I've sampled several different varieties of meat based products as well as the beans. Everything has been well prepared and fresh. The Mayan Cochinita Pibil in particular is drool-worthy. It's mildly sweet and super tender. Adding a little of the chipotle salsa really sets it off. 

Ah, the salsa. There are some truly interesting varieties, from tamarind to pecan. The pecan salsa was a great surprise, with a nice amount of heat. It really sits well with the carne asada. 

My only negative comment involves the parking situation. The parking lot is situated in such a way that in order to leave you have to back out onto 16th street. If a big ass SUV with tinted windows happens to park next to you (which always seems to happen) then pulling out can be...invigorating. 

La Condesa now has a well earned spot of honor in my restaurant rotation.

Looooove their salsa bar. The food is good too and the prices are reasonable for sure. The service wasn't the best though. It might have just been that day, but I had to get up 3x to ask for things because the waitress didn't return.

I ordered the arrachera and the mariachi tacos. I feel the hype was too much. The arrachera tasted like it was seasoned in a pound of salt. To me, it wasn't such a pleasant taste. The mariachi tacos tastes like they were missing salt. One of them seemed like it even had way too much oil. However the beans and rice were real good. Aside from an angry lady behind us, the atmosphere was pleasant and really really enjoyed trying all the different salsas that they have.
Amazing Mexican food really good place. Service was very good all the staff is very nice. I would definitely come back and recommend this place! Five stars!!
This place has a great salsa bar, and it's veggie/vegan friendly!  The tacos and burros are delicious!  It's a small place with great food and friendly service.  I love it.
The food is amazing, salsa bar is bangin, and they have delicious and original vegan and vegetarian options!

I had the chicken tinga and dogfish shark tacos. The tinga was packed with flavor. My companion had the chicken mole taco, and I have to say that's what I'll get next time. It was the perfect combination of heat and sweet. Victoria beer rounded everything off. Service was adequate.
If you're looking for Mexican food off the beaten path, try La Santisima.

I stumbled upon this place not knowing it is a trendy eatery that is usually over crowded and full of wanna be foodies.
The menu has some moments of brilliance but often lacks sensibility. Take the strawberry or peanut butter salsas. Nice try but not ready for primetime. 
The corn Quesadillas are made with masa and rice flour to give the turnovers a nice crispy crunch and fantastic flavor. 5 stars for the taste!
Loss of two stars is simply for the stupid furniture that is packed in like you would with a moving truck. Just too dammed confined. They would be better off putting a couple tables out front to serve. Trying to squeeze into one of their small tables I almost knocked one of their priceless works of art that are just hanging balanced on a nail. 
If the chef can mature and work on some of his experimental flavors this little eatery should have customers for years. 
However if they continue to operate under such cramped conditions people will stop coming in just because of the logistics.
Super good food!! I went here a month or so ago! Great selection!

Excellent !!! looked up the place before our trip to Colorado, decided to stop in Phoenix for dinner.  We had a 30 min wait, but it was so well worth it, the food was amazing!!.. the owner was very kind and started us on drinks while we waited for a table.  The staff is very courteous, the food is phenomenal.. the price is a little up there, but then again it's not your local Taco shop, this is definitely gourmet tacos at it's best.  I loved their Shrimp tacos!! and of course their cochinita pibil quezadillas were lickity good.. everything on the menu looks very very good.

After moving from San Diego, CA I found the best Mexican food here. Vegetarian/Vegan is just awesome. Food quality is great, clean and variety of sauces excellent. They just need to improve their setting chairs. It's very old and foam coming out.

There is the salsa bar with around a dozen house made salsas.  I am truly amazed by this place. It is small so not recommended for big groups.  Maybe a second date if you notice a parking spot open as you are approaching.  Horchata with chopped nuts, fruit, and cinnamon for the win.
I don't know how you say amazing in Spanish but that is the only way to describe this restaurant. It gets better every time I come. Muchas Gracias!!!!

Might just be the best Mexican food in Arizona. Not exaggerating by even the slightest. Their flavors are so bold and incredible. Whatever Mexican dish you like they make the best version of it I can guarantee it. I love this place.

Petty expensive for ordinary street tacos. Our server was friendly, but service was slow and disorganized.  Half of the many salsas at the bar were empty. Not a well run operation. Food had good flavor, but for the price I am sure there are better options. Will not be back.

The food was excellent. Whatever you do plan on ordering a Cabo shrimp taco. Trust me.

Update - second time back had the Baja Shark Taco and the traditional quesa. 

You can't go wrong with anything here but I would highly recommend everything I've mentioned so far.

And the service was much better this time, came on a Saturday.

With it being a long wait, that might have been what boosted this from 4 to a 5 star.  That said, the salsa bar and the gourmet tacos were spot on.  Oh yeah, if you are a man and see a bathroom door open next to the salsa bar, that is not for you.  The men's room is hidden over by the bar and kitchen.

Its great food.  I tried not to waste any salsa so I just got small cups and kept going back and trying new stuff.  Most of which were good, but one of the chili ones tasted kind of fishy for some reason.  As for my entree I went with 3 tacos with beans and rice.  I ate the fried shrimp tacos first as I didn't want the batter to get soggy.  The mole taco was spot on as well as the especial.

I don't live in the southwest, so I can't really compare to much, but I thought it was a great meal for not too much money.

Overrated and expensive. The food seems "toned-down" to me. It can be loud and cramped, and parking can be a pain. The best thing about it may be the extensive salsa bar. There are so many better options here in Phoenix.

I, unfortunately, rarely make it out to this part of town. When I do, I tend to go an binges, scarfing down food from one or two of my favorite spots, and adding a new place that has been on my must-try list. This time, it was La Condesa. 

Everything about La Condesa took me by surprise, regardless of the high expectations I already had. I loved its interior--the small space, the rustic wood furniture, the artwork, everything. A big departure from the usual feel of cheap-mexican restaurants/taquerias, it felt homey, warm, inviting. I was expecting to just shoot a quick order to the girl at the counter, but instead got table service, and extremely friendly and attentive service to boot (sounds like it's usually an order-at-the-counter place, though). 

On to the food: don't expect the usual suspects at the salsa bar--these salsas and toppings were phenomenal. I didn't ask, but I suspect they were all made in-house, and seemed incredibly fresh and were really a unique assortment. A great mellow, nutty peanut sauce, smokey chipotle salsa, creamy/salty cilantro, an awesome Mexican (or was it Mayan?) salsa (my favorite of what I tried)...my only regret was not sampling more.

What I loved about the menu were the unique options that branched far beyond the usual suspects. I went with three tacos: tinga, mole, cochinita pibil. When they arrived, all of them looked beautiful, and were surprisingly and thankfully chocked-full of meat. I took one bite of the mole and...HO...LY.....SHIT. Ever go to a restaurant and casually take a bite of something without giving it too much thought, only to be immediately punched in the face by its deliciousness? I love it when this happens. It's one of those pure joys in life, and happens far too infrequently...but it happened here. I'm a sucker for any type of mole, but sometimes they fall a bit 'flat'. This one did not. It had a fantastic bite and complexity to it that really elevated the mole to one of the best I've had. The tinga and cochinita were both equally great. The meat in all three was insanely tender and flavorful from the great sauces they had simmered in.

I paid the bill--$9.80--and realized that it was an awesome deal. Sure, you can find tacos in town for less than $3/ea, but they will not be like these. Not to mention, the portions were generous, I got free chips and a run at the salsa bar. 

I drove home feeling like I was teetering on the edge of purging...this was, after all, my second substantial meal in the course of 1 hour. But it was well worth it. Adding yet another spot to my list of places I have to hit when in the area. Already searching for an excuse.

I have enjoyed La Condesa numerous times. I am stuck on the La Condesa Shrimp tacos. Awesomely fresh and I love the spinach instead of lettuce. Beer is cold, service is slow, but very good. Before my trip last week I would have ranked at least 4 stars, but the shrimp were NOT deveined. Not only mine, but my friend who went with me. I had 2 shrimp tacos & she had one with a carne asada. She loved the carne asada. I don't know that I can eat the shrimp again...what a bummer.

This place is epic. The menu is extensive (almost overwhelming, you have to read it slowly) and offers so many awesome combination. Taco lovers: meet your new favorite place. In addition to awesome tacos they even have a great salsa bar where you can try all sorts of salsas with different heat levels which really add flavor to your tacos. I HIGHLY suggest the La Santisima taco with steak: it's out of this world!

I'm so disappointed and sad.  Saw this place on Check Please and saw that the Yelp! reviews were raving, but I can't give a great review. 

1.  Service - poor.  Had to ask for a menu, way too long of a wait time for every.thing., did not get attention I expected, such as a water refill..., had to ask about my food (which conveniently "just finished", but it had been sitting based on the cool temperature of the food).  Literally there for over an hour on 1 plate order.  

2.  Food - mediocre.  The rice was good.  The tacos were nothing special.  The salsa bar is impressive, especially the pecan salsa, but unfortunately there is only so much salsa and chips you can eat.  Plate was less than $10, but I wanted gourmet tacos.

3.  Atmosphere - not enough room.  Someone actually took my tot's seat when we went to the bathroom...?

I'd like to assume this just wasn't my day...
Don't miss out on this place! The food is delicious and authentic, and the atmosphere is hip and comfortable. Their salsa bar is awesome!

Came to La Santisima for some authentic street tacos. Read the reviews on Yelp and had to check it off.

The selection of tacos and salsa is ridiculous. They have so many!! 
I kept it simple and had adobada tacos with beans and rice. Really really good. 
Definitely authentic! The beans reminded me of my mom's beans.  
I appreciated all the gluten free options as well. Decorations were cool! 

I gave it a 4 star because the gourmet tacos were a little over priced. Somewhere between 3.95-4.80 a taco. Other than that, everything was great.

Get here early! Parking is tight and the line gets long. But it is so worth it! The rice & beans are fantastic. I got the Mexic burro, it has a mango salsa inside that ands a little sweetness that was unexpected and so yummy. They have a ton of vegetarian options, so I will be suggesting this place to my Veggie friends!

It doesn't look like much from the outside but the food is outstanding, and it's a great place for lunch. It offers free chips and a salsa bar, and the hardest part was limiting myself to just a few salsas. The 3 I had were great. Chicken mole torta (though they don't call it a torta) is rich and tasty, just right. I'm glad they offered a Groupon; I'll be back.

Absolutely delicious.  This small place doesn't have a lot of adequate seating but it has an amazing salsa bar.  Let's get something straight.  A salsa bar consists of more than the standard 3 to 4 salsas.  This place had about 20.  You can tell that some of them were experiments that went well like Peanut salsa and I believe there was a curry salsa.  There were so many.  

We ordered the famous baja sur dogfish shark taco, an El Gaucho burrito and an El Gaucho quesadilla.  I am not a big fan of quesadillas because of the flour tortilla and there is usually not a good filling.  This one was deep fried goodness.  Oh man, it was so good that I could only get down half of it.  The filling was steak, cucumber and just hell goodness.  My husband's burrito had majority of the same filing as mine with a little tweaking.  He enjoyed it a lot.  The fish taco was really good as well.  I only had one bite because I was aggressively attacking my quesadilla and fighting off the stares of people watching me enjoy.

With all that being said, customer service is once again an issue.  The small place was pretty packed.  Only one small table was open right by the door.  This table had to be misplacement because who would want to sit by the door and every time someone opens the door, they get smacked in the back of the head?  Our waiter was so non-existent that a waitress would come over to only end up doing the same thing.  Sigh.  The food was so good; I couldn't even dock any points for that.  Be aware that the first bowl of chips is free.  The second bowl is about $2 more.  The chips are good and hot so, I willingly gave over my money for an extra bowl.

Great little place.  Could tell it would be fantastic by the lineup to get in.

Very good tacos and an even better salsa bar. Decor is spot on.

Pricing was very reasonable as well.

Food was very good, actually. The only thing I didn't care for was that the salsa bar wasn't very full, and they didn't pay much attention to it. They were busy though, so it wasn't a deal breaker. I still enjoyed my food, though.
Looking for something different when you crave "Mexican?" Try this little gem. You will never be disappointed. Promise!! (Start with anything al pastor.)
My hands down favorite Mexican restaurant in Phoenix. The dishes are complex & very flavorful. Great salsa bar too. The horchata is out of this world.

HORRIBLE service!!!! They have good food, but the service is so awful that it's truly not worth your time.  The staff is unprepared and rude. Sat for a while without being even noticed and once we were served they never came back. Horrible service! Other people around us got their food to go due to the service and the staff was ignoring other tables as well! Numerous customers were upset. Go to their other location, it's much more friendly and the staff is on top of things.
salsa bar alone is worth visiting, types you wont ever see anywhere. the pork shoulder and quesadilla's are so good! enjoy

Amazing! Found this Place through Yelp while trying to find a good place to eat with a good Vegetarian selection & We're NOT DISAPPOINTED! The Energy/Environment inside is Very Pleasant, the Paintings inside are Stunning. Our server was Alan, he was very helpful & nice, answering our questions. My Fiance had the Steak Tacos & Margarita. I Ate the La Santisima Veggie Burrito, I'm in LOVE with it! Also I would Recommend try the Cilantro Salsa, the Guacamole one is GOOD but it is also Very Spicy. (There are many kinds of salsa) Service A+ Food A+ Energy Just a really Good Place  We Will Definitely be Coming Back, Regularly.  I Wish I could give MORE STARS!
This is one of the best taco/burrito places in Phoenix. Tiny place so it gets packed quickly but well worth the wait. Love the salsa bar and Margs too.

I love this place! The service is quick and friendly and the food is great! There are more than enough vegetarian options and too much good salsa to try! My favorite was the cilantro and the pecan dressing. They are so fresh and the food didn't take long to come at all. I will definitely visit again next time I'm in Phoenix

Got to be my favorite place in Phoenix!!!

I've lived here 12 years, and La Santisima wins. Best Margaritas in town!

The quesadilla is amazing (enough for 2), definitely unique and delicious!

Love this place! So don't go there, I need to keep it quaint!!! Just kidding of course....

I went here with my family and it was a really good experience. We waited only 10 minutes for a party of four, and we got seated promptly after that. 

The assortment of salsas are incredible, my favorite is the avocado and the strawberry salsas. I had a burrito that was one of the most popular ones and it was absolutely delicious. 

Check out this unique place if you're looking for a great taco spot!
Tacos were awesome and such a large selection of salsa at salsa bar. Severs were very nice. All around great choice!

We drove down from Prescott, for the day, to do a little shopping and found this place via Yelp. 

SO glad we decided to drive the extra 20 minutes to get there (despite being surrounded by restaurants at the mall). 

This place is good for vegans, vegetarians, and meat eaters alike.  I chose the Ghandi and the veggie tacos (cactus), while my friend had meaty street tacos. The food was fresh & delicious and the portion size was perfect.  

Loved the salsa bar!!  Other reviewers mentioned the dried cranberries in the guacamole. It was a delicious sweet addition and the guac was perfect!

We will definitely return for a meal next time we're in Phoenix hungry for Mexican food.

Love how their menu basically blasts TexMex as giving Mexican food a bad representation. Now this is authentic Mexican food. Not some heavy just because we're Americans portion. 

Ordered a lonches. Because they wanted to be different from a torta. But even in the mindset of what a standard torta is, these lonches are WAY BETTER. Bread sustains itself to the fillings (instead of falling apart or soaking up stuff like a torta bread does. Ordered shark. So that was different. There was a freshness to it due to a cucumber to give it a nice crispness to each bite. Brother ordered the al pastor lonche and he thoroughly enjoyed it as well. Girlfriend ordered the mole quesadilla. And yes yes yes! Delivered on the multiple layers of spices within the mole. Man, have I always only had flat moles (such a sad fact). Now, I can imagine not being able to order mole from anywhere else ever again! Eeeek! But do give it a try. Oh, and this quesadilla looked more like a dessert. But nope. A nice balance between the spices of the mole, meat (chicken), and cotija cheese that's sprinkled over it. 

Also tried their horchata. Once again, flavors up the Ying-yang! Theirs nuts, melons, freshly mashed strawberries. So definitely not your typical Americanized Mexican restaurant. 

Tip: don't park in the front. It's extremely difficult to back out into the busy traffic street. Especially if you're alone. Somewhat more doable if you have someone standing outside the car giving your a thumbs up.

Remember: food adventures are out there. So eat 'em up!

Everything here is exceptional. Full bar with a decent beer selection of domestics and Mexican. Huge salsa bar. My favorite was the strawberry salsa. The salsa Mexicana was good, a little on the spicy side for me but I couldn't stop eat it!

I had the white pacific fish tacos with rice and beans.  The tacos were delicious with lightly fried fish, cabbage, cilantro salsa, and a delicious creamy sauce.  Everything was so good, I wish I leaved in the area or could take this restaurant home with me so I could try everything on the menu!

We arrived around 1130am on a Friday and around noon the place was packed, and it's a small place with limited seating.  Definitely worth it.

Their tacos did not disappoint! I had their mahi al pastor, chimichurri steak, and chicken mole tacos. The chimichurri steak was just whatever but the mahi al pastor was really flavorful. Their black mole was silky rich and I appreciated the pickled onions that came with it to brighten the flavors. They had a spicy avocado salsa with a real kick and you really can't knock the huge basket of fresh chips you get while you're waiting! Can't wait to come back and try more tacos!

This place is a must!  I was craving good Mexican food and this definitely hit the spot.  The Horchata was TO DIE FOR!  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the restaurant set up. We arrived around 12:45pm. When you walk in its crowded with tables, so you're scanning for an open seat to grab before ordering.  While I waited at the table my friend stood in line to order. After standing in line for 15 mins they told her at 1pm they change to serving the tables.  Eventually a waiter came and we received our food. While sitting there a group of 3 came in, waited in the doorway for a solid 5 mins.  They weren't acknowledged in any way; no direction on what to do. This was clearly their first time there as well. Another group of 2 comes in slides right by them as they were finally receiving instruction from the waiter and took the last table.  I would have been very irritated but they kindly left quietly and took their business elsewhere.

Wanted to take my family to a authentic Mexican restaurant for tacos in downtown Phoenix and came across La Santisima. I like the decor with day of the dead theme (think Disney's Coco) and family like atmosphere. I ordered their Horcata and it is one of the best I ever had (had fruit in the drink as well). Prices are average if ordering tacos individually, I ordered 3 street tacos in a combo and it was under 10 dollars with rice and beans. I tried 3 different flavors and they were equally as good, their Carne Asada taco was on point. Even the plates were unique, like sand-carved style. Overall, the portion size was good, started off with complimentary chips and your choice of salsa from the salsa bar, it was a feel-good plate and experience.  Highly recommend if you visit the Phoenix area..

We moved to Arizona about 4 months ago and had driven past this place several times, but last night we saw it on an episode of Triple D and decided its time to try it. This place was amazing! Who doesnt love tacos, especially for breakfast/brunch! But they do serve actual breakfast on the weekends too. We will definitely be back.

This place would match, if not beat, any taco shop in LA.  Good service and amazing tacos with a complexity of taste.  The Salsa Bar bar is delish and the salsas add a whole new depth of flavor when added to a taco.  

I one star off because the place is pricey for tacos.

Offers a style of authentic Mexican food that varies from the northern regions of Mexico (Sonoran Mexican food) to the food that is found in deeper Mexico like mole, peanut salsa, etc. they have a very good vegan/vegetarian menu. Very authentic and very unique. Great art pieces to look at as well.
Mole' taco was a little bit on the chocolatey side... Cochintia pibIL was not spicy as usual  and Al pAstor was on point.  Salsa bar was great!  Great service!!  Reasonably priced!

Depending on what time you go you might have to wait. But it is absolutely worth it. I got a soup and a burrito. Both were delicious. They also give you chip and they have a selection of salsa choices. My favorite being the chipotle.

For those who are less adventurous I'm telling you to get over the rough look of the neighborhood and go eat!  The food is fresh and excellent every time.  Yummy horchata that my 2 year old loves.  The salsa bar is fun as well. This is our second time and we are already planning our next visit.

The salsa bar alone would make this place phenomenal! Our favs were the Salsa Strawberry and the Salsa Cilantro. My only advise for this place would be to just order one taco al a carte because we had so much chips due to the quality of the salsa we were stuffed. The horchata is home made and the best I've ever had! They top it with cinnamon, pecans, strawberries, & cantaloupe. It sounds weird, but it was very good. They also use extremely fresh, crisp cabbage on their tacos. It was very impressive! My boyfriend had the pork shoulder "quesa" which is actually a fried quesadilla and that was also very very very good. We will be back.

My ONLY complaint is that I ordered two different tacos & got two of the same tacos... But it was still very delicious & we will go back to try anything else that sounded good.

The food here was absolutely amazing, and the Horchata was delicious!  The only complaint I have is that the service was super mediocre. The waitress never came back to refill our waters, and we would have to waive her down to get a refill on any of our other drinks, and she did not seem to know how to split a check (it took her almost a half an hour to get our checks to us after we told her we were ready).  We were also told that there was no guacamole, only to see a couple seated next to our table (seated after us and ordered after us) served guacamole about 20 minutes after we had ordered.  When we inquired about it, the waitress rudely told us "oh I guess they made extra there might be a little left".   Despite the service, I would definitely recommend this place.

Based on my first visit, I would have happily given La Condesa a 4 star review. My veggie tacos were delicious, and I loved all the fun salsas. I couldn't get enough of them! Really, the only negative was the cramped quarters.

My second visit, however, was not nearly as good. On the positive side, I got guacamole this time which was studded with dried cranberries and tasted great with the strawberry salsa. I was impressed with the service too because my friend's order came out the same time as mine despite the fact that we ordered separately 10 minutes apart. 

The tacos this time were awful. I decided to get the vegan tacos since the description of "no pintos, no rice" lead me to believe that the beans and rice in the veggie tacos weren't really vegetarian friendly. I'm a pretty strict vegetarian so I try to avoid food that's been prepared with meat-based stock. The vegan tacos come with black beans which were absolutely flavorless. I'm not sure these beans encountered even a grain of salt during their preparation. The tacos also had iceburg lettuce in them which tasted dreadful of course. 

So now I know I can't have their veggie tacos, and the vegan ones suck. No reason to visit again.

Been here 3 times the quality of the food is so good. The best tacos I have had since moving from LA. The quesadilla I got was so good I ate the whole thing! The asada street taco and mole taco is just the best. The horchata was very good and unique. The salsa bar is good and clean too.

First, the chips and salsa are great with the salsa bar and variety of flavors and heat.  That's where the good goes wrong...

There is something wrong in the restaurant plan: it took over 25 minutes, for example, for the check to be picked up after it was dropped off.  It took way too long for nearly every aspect of the dining experience: water, drinks, food, check.  

We were in no rush, so contrary to some of the pushback on this nearly unanimous criticism, this isn't an entitlement issue.  This is a baseline comparison to other great local restaurants (such as El Comedor Guadalajara or Cocina 10 at Crescent) -- the service here is very poor.  I don't know if it's a structural problem, but it is indeed a problem.

The tables and chairs are too close together even for thin people, which makes it difficult for customers (and STAFF!) to maneuver in the expanded dining room.

This place has potential, but not until some of these baseline issues are addressed.
I'd recommend this place a million times over! I had to knock a star off for the waiting, though. It can be over an hour long at peak times, but the food is well worth it.

Lived up to its rave reviews!  Love vegetarian options and rice and beans were some of the best we've had, so perfect in flavor and texture.  Great vibe, great service and a hell-yeah salsa bar to boot.

My favorite taco shop in all the land! Great tacos, amazing salsa (my favorite are the green salsas, and especially the Salsa Pecan), and great drinks.  I love consistency in a restaurant- I've been coming to Santisima since it was Condesa, and each time, it's the same, great food. I always get the 3 taco plate with rice and beans- their rice is soooooo good! I usually have the Santisima Especial (I hope that's what it's called!) and it is the best! It is a smaller space, I would recommend going in off hours.  I always want to try the horchata, but I'm always way too full! The margaritas are delicious, but pricey and not as strong as they cost.  Mmmmm... Santisima!

Had lunch with a friend of mine after dress shopping and this is officially one of my best taco spots in town. I've struggled in finding an authentic taco place in Phoenix since I moved from Mexico (ironic, considering the amount of Mexicans living here), but I found it! The salsa bar is my favorite part, but try the shrimp tacos, the gaucho taco and the maya taco, you won't regret it. No sour cream or cheddar cheese non-sense here! Pure authentic Mexican fare (I lived in Mexico for 27 years, I know what I'm talking about!) Make sure you're here early, lunch time is packed, but is totally worth the wait.  Tip: It's easier to park around the corner.

This place was difficult to find because it was night time and I believe their sign is suited more for the daylight. It is a small restaurant with some very authentic details, which were really cool. The door is the old Mexico style (very popular in New Mexico) and the bar is really beautiful carved wood. They restroom in the back have awesome art on them, and the door for the mens bathroom is labeled "Santos" with a painting of El Santo on it. (Old time famous Mexican wrestler my father looked up to and actually my Grandfather had the pleasure of wrestling many years ago.) This was very cool for us. 

The food is really REALLY good! I loved my tacos! I tried the Chicken Mole, and mine was some sort of slow roasted pork with a hint of sweet. (I can't remember the name, but it was toward the bottom of the menu.) 

The people were nice, but we waited a very long time for our food. My biggest turn off was that it felt a little TOO authentic when our food came to us on real traditional Mexican pottery style plates. They seemed to be very old terra-cotta with the paint chipping off the rim of mine. I couldn't help but feel that they might not be lead free. Don't get me wrong, I still enjoyed my food 100% but I think it would be a little better if they upgraded to some ceramic.
Salsa bar is amazing! I had the pork and it was also perfectly cooked! The service was excellent, it was 5 stars all day. I liked this place a lot.
Awesome quaint taco shop with excellent food that has real flavor.  The staff is warm and are a treat!
Best horchata I've ever had. I crave it weekly. The salsa bar has options for everyone. Only down side is its a very small building so there's always a wait but it's worth it.

This is a great little hole-in-the-wall mexican joint. Overall I'd say while service can be a bit iffy, the food is great and reasonably priced.

Chips and salsa is one of my fave foods, and it's complimentary here. The self-serve salsa bar in the back is extensive, with about 8-12 different salsas at a time. I've been here twice and my favorites are their jicama salsa, pico de gallo, and chipotle. I wish the salsa cups were larger, but that's a minor peeve ... and let's face it, I'm not someone who's ashamed to go up to the salsa bar 5 times. (Given the rate at which I inhale chips, I probably need to fit in some excercise laps to the salsa bar anyway.)

On my most recent visit (around 5:30pm on a Thursday) we ordered standard margaritas. I wasn't super impressed with them (and think they were just made from a mix), but when I got the bill and saw they were only $3 each, I wasn't too upset. They did have a proper drink menu, so next time I'm here I may try one of their other cocktails.

Just as a menu tip for if you're debating between tacos, the "street tacos" near the bottom of the menu are smaller (~4") than the "gourmet" ones listed at the top (~5").  I've gotten both kinds and prefer the smaller street tacos, but maybe I'm just biased toward miniature foods. The first time I visited I also ordered rice and beans, which were better than I've had at most places, though I'm not a huge fan of rice & beans in general.

I love mole and they have mole tacos and other mole dishes which I would LOVE to try, but alas thanks to my nut allergy I can't ... I'll have to live vicariously through my fellow Yelpers' reviews & photos on that one!
Awesome place, and so much better now that they have expanded. The salsa bar is the highlight!

About a month ago my daughter and I were looking for a new spot to eat. We stop at La Santisima on Glendale Ave. The service was good, the chips tasted old, but the salsas they 
had at a mini bar were not bad at all. I order street tacos and they were not as good as I was
expecting them to taste. Hardly nothing of cabbage for your 9.00. My daughter ordered a green chile burrito with enchilada sauce. Was not worth the money at all. The sauce was cheese sauce!! Also their was hardly any green chile in the burrito that cost 13.00!!! The only thing we agreed on was the rice it was really good. I have been a Mexican chef close to 22 years and I seem to think that my green chile taste better than this. Step up your game!!! I will not be returning to this place again!!

My wife and I found this place when our friends moved to the area. We love it! It's small and a little cramped but the people who run the place ( I believe it's family-owned) are always pleasant to us. Being Caucasian, this isn't always the case when we go into other Mexican restaurants. I love El Goucho Burro. The salsa bar is fantastic. I like that they bring you a glass bottle (about a liter) of water at the beginning of the meal. My wife is pregnant so we usually go a little early so we don't have to worry about seating but when normal dinner hours role around the place gets pretty packed. Great food - my mouth is watering as I write this. 

The could probably splurge to fix their front door. It does slam when people go in and out.

Lunch at the bar on Sunday.

Best Salsa: Chipotle and Tomatillo - the traditional ones are the best. I also liked the cabbage and jicama varieties. Peanut, pecan and others were more like dressing than salsa. Pico was tasty too.

Tacos: Chicken Mole was great, sauce was not spicy, but this taco sticks to your ribs.
              Carne Asada - had fatty pieces and chunks. Picked through this one.

Beans/Rice - Did enjoy the beans, free chips and rice wasn't really Mexican, but more white with veggies. 

Horchata - Glorious beverage here. First horchata I had to use a spoon for to get all the fruit and nuts out from the murky cinnamon depths.

Price: Two tacos platter for almost $10. wanted crispy shells, but only corn here. Horchata is 4 bucks so price can be $20 for one person almost.

Their salsa bar is the best I've seen in Phoenix... I love them ALL. The Al Pastor burrito is my favorite... The burritos are HUGE here. I've tried almost every type of taco they have here and they are all great. Be prepared for a LONG wait if you're not going at an off time because they only have a few tables but it is seriously worth the wait. The prices here are unbeatable, too. They only have 2 servers usually who double as bartenders so you have to kind of grab their attention sometimes but like I said, there are only a few tables and it's very small inside so they can always see you.

Not impressed at all. We had seen some pretty good reviews on yelp but we were really disappointed. The food was dry and not very enjoyable. The salsa bar was nice because there were a lot of flavors to choose from but even by adding tons of salsa the food was still dry. 

We won't be going here again.

The best horchata and salsa bar ever!! When you come here, you have to try the horchata, unique and oh so tasty. Also, I'm a salsa lover, I love to make it, I love to indulge in it, salsa is my middle name.  So when I come here, its always the best part of the meal. My favorite is the pecan salsa, so creamy and not what you would expect a pecan salsa to taste like.  The burritos are delicious as well and I've had the tacos too, everything is so eye appealing as well as tasty! I wish the restaurant was a bit roomier, but it stays consistent in the number of people coming in and doesn't get overcrowded. I wouldn't recommend to big parties. But overall I love this place and recommend you try it out.

horrible.....
I went to la santisima on a friday after lunch time. it was not crowded but we still had to wait for a table, we got a table and the service was horrible, soda was flat, they sold my husband coke in a bottle and didnt even ask if we wanted fountain soda or that mexican bot
tle soda. taco bar was in Tupper ware and no big deal on flavors, my tacos carne asada was saltyyyy couldn't eat that sh.... husband burrito was salty and full of beans mind full that it was carne asada burrito. I would not go back or recomend to friends. need to get a bigger location and get rid of the dusty xmas tree and junk around it or take time to dust and clean.

I've been to this restaurant before and was told previously to sit where ever I wanted. So I did the same thing tonight when I arrived. The restaurant is very small to begin with. Maybe 5min after I arrived, a pregnant girl walked by and held up a finger in my direction as if to say "I'll be with you in just a minute". After about 15 min, I was finally acknowledged by someone and given some chips. At least 30min after I arrived, I still hadn't been greeted or spoken to by an employee. I counted at least 4 other tables of people who had arrived after me and already had drinks on their tables. One of them even had their food already. Still, no one came by to take my order. I felt like I was on a hidden camera tv show at this point. There appeared to be maybe 3 servers, and the restaurant has maybe 10 tables inside, with a handful outside. It was busy, I understand that, but this experience was ridiculous. I finally gave up and left. It's hard to imagine a business that operates this way being able to survive.

Fantastic.  The real-deal.  Each dish was prepared flawlessly, huge portions and the BEST salsa bar on the planet.  Initially - ordering at the counter was a bit of a turn-off (we almost walked out) but we were very happy we stayed.

First time here.  Liked the atmosphere and decor.  Ordered the La Santisima specialty burrito.   Was very good!   Very tasty and perfectly cooked.  The pecan salsa was also good.  
Now the bad. Was told that they ran out of carne asada.  And it was 5pm on a Friday!   Very unacceptable!   Only like ten different salsas out of the advertised 20.  Family didn't care for the chicken or fish tacos.  Was also kinda on the pricey side.

Almost as good as the original (OK, not sure if this is the original location or Phoenix is but 16th street is original for me). I'm not sure what it is about that location... The food is a tad better, in my opinion, but this location is much closer when I'm at my office. 

Food: I usually get the el pastor burrito... It's delicious. All the tacos are good and I haven't had any complaints on anything from the numerous people I've brought here. I always fill up on chips and salsa because there are SO MANY - my favorites are the cilantro and chipotle salsas and guacamole; tip: mix the chipotle salsa with a spicy one for a kick because it's not at all spicy! 

Service: usually good. The credit card machine was out once... Not a huge issue for us or anyone I saw walk in but would have been disappointed if we didn't have cash.

My only complaint is that they serve the food in baskets and I would prefer plates (I think this is new... I can't remember) but I can work around that if I must... And I haven't asked for a plate, which I could also do

The place has changed quite a bit since I have reviewed it.  Now there is a bar and a wait staff.  I ordered an horchata, a cochinita pibil taco, a shark taco, a smoked mahi mahi taco, guacamole, and also tried the al pastor taco, and pollo asada taco.  (I didn't order this all on my own.  I had a group of four and we shared.)

The decor is dope and makes you feel like you are about to have a great taco experience.

The horchata is 5/5 hands down the best horchata you will have in your life.  I'm talking nuts, strawberries, cantaloupe, cinnamon, and more.  Devine.

The shark taco is boring.  Not much flavor at all and needs lots of salsa to give it some taste.

The cochinita pibil is 5/5.  Tasty, mouth watering, juicy, flavorful.  Excellent.

The smoked mahi had some nice flavors but was lacking on meat big time.

The guac was average.  They put fruit in it and pomegranates to try to kick it up and be creative but it didn't quite come together.  It needs some more work.

The al pastor was very disappointing.  I am a huge al pastor fan and this was poorly done.  Dry, lacking flavor, very boring.

The pollo asada was exactly the same as the pastor.  Boring and dry.

The beans and rice were above average.  Nice flavor, moist, and good texture.

They also changed out the tortillas and now have dry boring corn rather than the awesome soft ones I had before.  

I stand by my opinion on the salsas as I had on my first experience.  It's cool to have 20 options but only four of them are worth your time.  Two of the reds, and two of the greens.  Sesame salsa?  Peanut salsa?  I tried them all.  No thanks.

It's obvious this place is knocking it out of the park.  It is very trendy, always packed, and holds over a few hundred reviews.  If you go and you probably should. Mark my words.  Order the horchata, two cochinita pibil tacos, and stock up on the traditional salsas.

Second time here. The first time, they had no cold beer for the michelada I ordered, the girl had to come back 3 times before she could get it right with a cold beer. The second time they got our order wrong. Asked for eggs over easy with chorizo, she came with scrambled eggs and chorizo. We sent it back and she brought the same exact thing. They had it on the menu with over easy eggs. However the servers don't understand what over easy means. The food is "ok", but when I ordered a street taco it was way over priced for the size and quality. Not recommending or going back here again.

Okay, work meeting got bumped an hour so went to look for lunch with my wife in Glendale. Came across this restaurant  and wow, this is by far the absolute best Mexican food we have found in AZ. Really a great atmosphere and our server is all over it. Bottom line, this is the small little hole in the wall to find. The absolute best I've found. Will definitely be here again, and again.

Definitely best gourmet taco place.  We tried street tacos plate and o.m.g., super good.  Thump up for salsa bar with variety of salsa choices. Some are very interesting combination.  House special horchata, one size only,  but worth to try.

I really like La Condesa.  What stands out is the variety of fresh salsas on their salsa bar, and the great variety of tacos to choose from. I've had the shrimp, and a couple of different versions of their steak tacos.  I've also had the mole chicken, which was great as well.

Service can be a little sketchy here, mostly because they're often very busy.  But if you're in the area, it's a great place to try.

The food is amazing. I would give it 4-5 stars, however,  this restaurant is barely concerned with a positive customer experience. 

A decision should be made if this is a full service restaurant or a cash and carry establishment. There is little to no regard for patrons entering the front door. Be prepared to be treated as an afterthought as they either do not have enough staff or are too busy playing multiple roles. It appears that take out orders are the priority.

The salsa bar is great. It also serves as a distraction from the fact the service is slow and food order/delivery is 30 minutes away. Make sure you order drinks, food,etc. all at once. My experience was "piece ordering" compounding the wait. 

Overall, I will return for the food.. Take out only

Visited La Santisima for the 2nd time today.. not impressed.. AT ALL! The place was full, which is fantastic for them, but they could not handle the amount of people in there. They had one waiter who was trying to take orders for all of the table. I won't speak on behalf of anyone else so our experience: it took our food 45 minutes to come out and when it did, my tacos were so dry I could barely swallow it. As the waiter set down our food she asked if everything was OK. After that, we didn't see her until I had to send my food back. My mom and I both had to send our plates back. In the 45 minutes we had to wait for our food, we asked for chip refills.. those took roughly 15 minutes each.. and they charge per basket. When our chips came out, we had little pieces of chips and our basket wasn't even full. The ONLY positive was the salsa bar.. when you had chips to eat it with. 

Bottom line.. not a great experience.

One of the best Mexican restaurants I've been to. The taco bar was awesome...we went crazy over it! Special mention for cilantro, pecan, guacamole salsa. Th e main course was also really good. Tried the fish taco and I wasn't dissapointed and hubby was happy wi th his chicken taco. Portions are generous and best part about this place is that they have a lot of options for vegetarians.we will be coming back here for sure :)
This is the diamond in the rough type mexican food you'd expect out of Phoenix. Fresh tacos. Love the salsa bar. Guacamole is fresh and tasty, almost a little sweet. Give it a try people.
Omg I love this place! They have the best tacos and salsa bar. Oh and the humongous horchata is to die for!

This unique Taco Shop in Glendale offers a large menu with many vegetarian choices and specialty meats including fillet mingoin and mole! I love fish tacos and this beer battered shrimp taco hit the spot. The salsa bar has many choices the fresh varieties to go with any meal. I have to recommend the horchata it is a huge serving with nuts and fruit and it is worth stopping in just to order a fresh cold nutritious drink! It's easy to pass it by and parking is a little tight however the service is great and it has a full bar!

Love this place.  The carne asada tacos are our favorite.  The salsa bar is the best I have ever had.  Wonderful flavors to add to the tacos, so that we never get tired of the the same flavor.  The home made flan is to die for (different flavors) and so is the chocolate cake when they run out of flan.

The food here is absolutely amazing! Our group had tacos and a quesa, with every single item being delicious. We had to wait a short time for a table, but even a long wait is so worth it. We loved their salsa bar too.

I recently went to La Santisma when I saw that their Pacific White Fish taco was on the list of "Top 100 Dishes to try in Phoenix". This taco was one of the worat tacos I have ever tried. The fish was covered in a thick beer batter and was so dark and smelled awful. I should have known better when the server said she'd never tried it because "she's very picky about her fish". We also tried their Gaucho quesdadilla based on a suggestion from the server. The quesadilla tasted like a deep fried blob of cheese with some pieces of steak.  The strawberry salsa from the salsa bar was the only thing that made the quesadilla palatable. The salsa bar should be labeled by spiciness. There are tons of options, but most of the salsa is so spicy, that you couldn't taste anything else (I imagine that whoever said the fish taco was a "top 100 dish" smothered the fish in a salsa that made tasting the actual fish impossible).  The horchata was very good with fresh fruit and nuts, hence the 2 star rating.
Food and service was good. We will definitely eat here again!! The tortilla soup and the tacos were bomb!! You have to order the horchata! We even took one to go!!
Soooo yummy. Great variety. Come early to avoid the crowds in the small confines. Great salsa selection and the horchata is to die for.

Suggest getting street tacos
Chicken mole
Shark and whitefish Baja style
Pork pibil

Chips and chiles sauces incredible!! 

Partners had the gaucho:: awesome

The mole ........ Food of the Aztecs gods... Yummy
Short and sweet....AMAZING. Creative taco and salsa combinations but more importantly....BEST HORCHATA IN THE STATE OF ARIZONA!!!!!!!!

Restaurant..... You had one job to do, in fact it's your only job to cook proper fully cooked meat, and how hard can that possibly be!! Apparently beyond the capabilities of the staff. If I had wanted dried out tasteless chicken with the consistency of a rubber ball I really would have asked. But that's what I got.   anyway, Smokey (my cat) liked it but he's not much of a connoisseur so that's not much of a recommendation.

It was ok. Server was not very keen on anticipating customer needs. I had never been there, and wasn't familiar w the menu or anything. Maybe because I'm Mexican, I wasn't falling over myself about the salsa bar  Horchata was good, although I'd recommend asking for light ice since its 4$ for a 32oz cup, and they throw in nuts and fruit in it also. Finally got  a quesadilla. I basically paid 24 bucks including tip for a soft drink, Horchata, rice and quesadilla. All of which weren't outstanding, service wasn't and since this is my hood, I know that the surroundings aren't worth the price tag either. Recommend you NOT go here and seriously if a salsa bar is where u get ur rocks. Then u obviously don't mind paying for it w the normal tasting food, that is waaaayyy overpriced.

Just as good as the original location.  I recommend the cochinita pibil tacos and a horchata.  The salsas are very tasty.  The place was dead when I came so hopefully more people will come to check it out.  It is a little pricey but it is worth it.

It is much better than La Perla next door.  BLAH.  No idea how that place is still around.  

Check out La Santisima if you are near by.

Yes! Finally made it here and it was DELICIOUS! Queso fundido, tacos (carne asada, mole Oaxaca con pollo, y de puerco) chips y salsa bar, & tloloc burro (nopales, black beans, veggie) was all exceptional! The mango margarita .. perfect! For sure, were returning!

It was a little hard to find and went past twice!  However, although small, it had nice and a very interesting decor (loved the padded chairs).  The menu was large with very different types of tacos and burros you don't often see.  As mentioned by others,  the salsa bar was excellent with lots of choices with a surprising (and tasty) fruit salsa!  I was slightly put off as we ordered our iced teas at lunch and they were delivered in wax paper cups which was not what you would expect in a sit down restaurant. Then the meal came in baskets like you might get at a Sonic drive-in which was also a little disconcerting.  However, the meal certainly made up for these drawbacks (which in the end is the most important quality!).  We had the lunch plate with a small paper cup of beans and another with rice but believe it or not, I was very full at the conclusion of the meal and even took one of the corn tortilla off one of the tacos as I was 'stuffed'. Overall, I wish they had served on regular plates and regular glasses but the food was excellent. The service was also attentive but not intrusive. Will definitely return!

Tremendous food that has only gotten better over time since the restaurant opened a few years back.

The tacos are the best item on the menu, and the quesadillas are a close second, in my opinion.  This is not the typical Az-Mex quesadilla.  It's deep fried and incredibly delicious.  I'd go with anything including arrachera.

The salsa bar is as good as hyped here on Yelp.  My personal favorites are the cilantro, the pecan, the peanut, and the strawberry (when they have it).  A couple of great typical molcajete blends are there too.

Don't miss the house margarita.  The happy hour price of a few bucks is a total steal.  It's a ruby red grapefruit blend, and it's absolutely delicious (and well worth it even at the regular price).

You can eat like a king with a huge helping of food, great salsas, a quesadilla to split, have a margarita, and walk out for $15-20 per person including tip.  Delicious food and one of the best places on Calle 16.

This place is probably paradise for my white/non-hispanic friends! I was born and raised in Mexico, so I know La Santisima is NOT authentic mexican food. But it is tasty food and for a good price. Yes, they have a salsa bar with about 23,594 different salsas (ok, maybe I exaggerated a bit) but only about 2 are pretty tasty. 

I say this restaurant consists more of "Mexican-American" food. But if you're hispanic and want to take your non-hispanic buddies to a "mexican" place, then La Santisima is the perfect spot where their minds will be blown thinking they're eating "authentic" mexican food and at the same time you'll be satisfied too with the tasty Americanized version of a torta or quesadilla. But shhhhh... you know the secret, they don't!

Wow! I am truly amazed by this place and it is now one of my favorite places. It is small so not recommended for big groups but the food is OUTSTANDING. I had the Pacific white fish tacos with rice and beans Amazing 
My boyfriend and son had the carne Asada style burrito and a rice and beans burrito both said thy were amazing. The guacamole was delish and the horchata was really good. My boyfriend even said it tasted like Christmas lol 
This place is really good and I was very impressed service was good can't wait to come back again
Super good place with fantastic chicken mole (if they don't run out). The wait and organization of the order/checkout can be obnoxious but it's worth it for the mole and dogfish tacos!
Great food and service. Carne Adovada was awesome. Has a kick and great flavor. Thier salsa bar has a varity of flavors. We'll be back. Also has a full bar.

This place is amazing, once again, this place rocks. Today I had the Quezadilla with Argentine beef and chimichurri sauce, fresh avocados, just to die for!!! I would ditch any overprice mexican restaurant for the oportunity to eat here, they kick butt!!

If you like the gourmet food from Cancun, then you will not be desapointed!!!

We almost did not enter as the place was empty about 7pm, but I had read about the 16 salsa's and we pushed forward just as one other car pulled into the dimly lit parking lot. The Mexican restaurant next door was packed, so we probably should have went over there. This regional brand of Mexican food might appeal to non-gringos as most of the food was quite unusual and hot and some food was just downright bad. The 1/2 order of guac had large chunks of avocado, but also has raisins and a liquidy kind of taste. It was not what you would expect in a normal Mexican joint. The steak tacos I ordered had to be sent back due to excessive fatty pieces and the chicken tinga tacos were way too spicy for a normal palette. The spicy theme continued as nearly all 16 salsa's had a version of heat that ran too hot. This was a sweaty experience, so gringo's stay away. On a positive note, the pregnant waitress was very nice and helpful.

Finding someone who can make better mole than I can deserves 4 stars.  My absolute favorite is the chicken mole burrito.  The chickens mole burrito is just that- loaded with lots of shredded chicken, minimal rice in a flour tortilla.  The burros are gigantic and the drinks are gigantic.  I cannot comment on any other items as I am extremely satisfied with the mole and don't venture far from it.  I think you can order chicken mole tacos but I am unsure.  The salsa bar is tasty, too.  

Apparently there is a Happy Hour on weekdays.  I noticed Tequila behind the bar but didn't see any beer and am unaware of what the Happy Hour entails.

Oh. My. Goodness.  I realize that I just reviewed this little-slice-of-Heaven last week, but our latest visit deserves an update.  

We brought my visiting mother-in-law to La Condesa, so we could share the Mexican-food love with her.  For the last two days, I've heard her on the phone to at least 3 different people, raving about the "amazing" Mexican food she had on Saturday.  

On this visit, they had the Carne Asada (they were out last time).  My husband liked it, but actually thought the Tinga chicken was even better.  He swears there isn't a better chicken taco in town, and I think I'd have to agree.  My MIL had the chicken mole tacos and loved them.  She orders mole whenever she gets the chance, and rated it way up with Barrio's dish.  I was blown away by the deliciousness of the mahi-mahi burro.  Oh, goodness... I'm having a flashback of it's amazingness...  luscious chunks of fish, smokey bacon, mushrooms (which I normally pass on, but they were fantastic!), and their velvety cilantro-cream sauce.  Ahhhhh.... so good!  

Another 5-star visit!

Love this place but the service sucks. I sat for 7 mins and did get any service. No water, just chips. They ran out of the cups for salsa and I just sat there. What a joke. I asked if I could place my order, the waiter just said yea, then walked away. So I continued to sit there. After what seemed to be 5 more minutes I just gave up. I left. What a shame too, I used to like this place. They need a better wait staff. Fail.
O... M.. G... This place is out of this world amazing! So many types of salsa.. The chile verde burrito I had was ridiculously yummy!! The reviews are pretty accurate here.
