My favorite place for tacos in all Phoenix! Try any meat or vegetarian "La Condesa style"... . Everything is fresh and tasty... Service is also friendly and quick...i highly recommend it if you have visitors from out of town.

I seriously love this place!!! One of the best taco places I have ever been to. Everything is delicious there. I would go there weekly if it was closer to where I lived. I recommend everyone stop by, you won't be disappointed!

Great food. Loved my tacos. Salsa was great. Alot to choose from...

Great michelada.  Service and decor is weak

Amazing tacos! Seriously, they're some of the best I've had anywhere the valley. They don't slop a mountain of cheese on them or drown them in sauce like some other Mexican food joints. Just flavourful filings with a small amount of garnish; simple and delicious.

Rice and beans are OK. Skip the rice and beans and just order 3 or 4 tacos. Space is very small and seating can be an issue but the food comes out pretty fast.

I can't believe I haven't written a review for La Condesa yet.  I have never been disappointed here.  Ever.  

Here is the deal:  

-you start with a side of chips.  And then you get to feast on the humongous salsa bar.  My favorites are the pecan (creamy, thick, and with a kick at the end), cilantro (thinner but delicious), and the tamarindo (sweet and spicy).  Sadly, the tamarindo one seems to be quite elusive and is not always available.  You could spend hours trying all the different salsas.  I agree though with Iain, the peanut was the weak link.

-next comes the real food.  I have only had the tacos, but I imagine everything to be of the same quality.  So these tacos come with double tortillas to hold all the ingredients.  These aren't skimpy by any means.  Two should be sufficient for most people.  The Cabo Shrimp is amazing.  Huge shrimp beer battered with a creamy sauce on top.  The chicken mole taco was also great with that special chocolately flavor to it.  Today, I tried to Mayan Cochinita taco and it was stuffed to the brim with tender as can be pork.  I have had the rice and beans before with a combo and I would say the beans are better than the rice.  Though in my opinion after four or so visits, it's best to come enjoy the chips and salsa and then indulge in two tacos.

This place is really hard to find, but if you find Palm and McDowell, it's right there with a few parking spots along the street.

If you like tacos, you need to come here.  It's just that simple.

This place used to be so delicious. We loved the tacos and the salsa selection back in 2012-13. It's so not the same now. Service was disappointing. Food was bland. The horchata was still yummy, but our server never came back so we couldn't order another. The 4 ice cubes in my water melted and our tortillas went cold and still nobody came to check on us. The salsas were still good, but there wasn't  any jicama salsa. The tortillas were like Guerrero brand I think. Def not made in-house. I'm sad that I will never go back again.

"Oh wow, what did I get myself into?" was all I thought as I pulled up to La Condesa.  I'm not familiar with Phoenix or the surrounding neighborhoods, so I was a little taken aback at first.  The business looks like an old house, as most of the businesses in the area do, i noticed lots of bars on the windows, and the majority of the business signs in the area were in Spanish.  THE ONLY reason I noticed this is because I'm unfamiliar with Phoenix and was traveling alone.

First impression, the restaurant is tiny! I would say that at capacity, the restaurant is pretty loud and I had a difficult time hearing my server. The tables were very close together, all the chairs were mismatched, and the lighting was really dim.  It was very difficult to get to the back of the restaurant where they put the salsa bar.  

The house margaritas were made with fresh grapefruit and lime, and that was perfect for me. Unfortunately, the food wasn't as good.  I had the shrimp burro, and it was really sloppy.  It melted out of the sleeve and fell apart while I was trying to eat it.  Plus, some of the tails were left on the shrimp... let me tell you about shocking!

The service was sub-par, in my opinion.  My server was inattentive and didn't ask how my food was.  I had to flag down the server like an air traffic controller in order to get my bill, and it took a while to get my bill back.  

This one is not a revisit for me.
Always a line out of the door but the service is quick. Great tacos but you could head somewhere else for far less time. They have a salsa bar and good margaritas.

The self serve salsa had a great variety and was a lot of fun. The margaritas weren't amazing, but the food certainly was. I enjoyed a few street tacos, but particularly enjoyed the refried beans. I was visiting Phoenix, but it is definitely the best Mexican food I've had in a long time.

I can't say enough good things about La Santisima. Best Margarita I've ever had! Get the house (Santisima) Margarita.Tacos and Quesas are beyond delicious. Everyone I've taken there has fallen in love with it too.

Love the food. Wife and I visit her ever so often and I've tried a few different dishes. This place is not your run of the mill regular meat, cheese, tortilla and red sauce Mexican cuisine. Plenty of seafood and veggie items. The salsa bar alone is something to visit for as there are so many delicious items.

What is there to say about La Condesa? It's simply amazing. 

I'll admit, we found this place searching for more of a day-to-day, less expensive version of Barrio Cafe. We found that and more. In our one month since we've moved to Phoenix, we've eaten here three times. By far the best item we've had is the fried quesadilla with mole chicken. Oh, and the horchata. Best. Horchata. Ever. It's not your typical horchata, so watch out. Mole poblano tacos are also heaven, as is the cochinita pibil. Salsa bar is to die for. 

I love the hole in the wall vibe. Only bad moment was that I got trapped in the bathroom, but that was my fault. I swear the door opens out, not in. This place is super casual. Plastic cups and nothing fancy, but the vibe is uber awesome. It is very small, and seating can be limited, but it always seems to work out. I don't recommend this place for very large groups. 

We'll be back, about once a week.

I was hungry for tacos so I went onto Yelp and found this hidden gem! I've lived here my entire life and never heard of this place! Wow... best tacos in the west valley! Definitely go here if you are craving an authentic flavorful taco - you will not be disappointed!

The food here is amazing and has been for years. There are more salsas in the salsa bar than I've seen anywhere else, more types of tacos (and they're all great), and a special house horchata with granola and fresh fruit that I've never had anywhere else.

HOLY SH*T this place is good. Shark Taco plus peanut salsa is great. I love this place, will be better once they add more seating. May check out the Glendale location if their is more room even though I live all the way in Chandler.

Best al pastor street tacos in the U.S. I visit Mexico City 5 times a year and this is the only place that come close to a real street taco. The gourmet ones are good for gringos but not this gringo. Try the Jamaica and horchata waters. Don't forget about there happy hour deals. The service is mostly bad, they have one good server, but the food is worth it. Come with an open mind and don't come if your used to be pampered.
It was okay, I'm not sure if it was the style, but the beef was chewy and the shrimp seemed overcooked as well. Horchata is definitely recommended!

As many close to me know, I hold Carolina's in very high regards as it is cheap and delicious and I have claimed many a time that it is my all-time favorite. However, until I tried La Condesa, I had no idea what the hell I was talking about. La Condesa Gourmet Taco Shop has surpassed Carolina's - nay - EVERY restaurant I have ever known. I write to you with a mind blown and blurry with recent memories of an unreal salsa bar and horchata topped with pecans, melon, strawberries, and cinnamon...  I can die happy.

The wife and I were visiting from Georgia. Saw great Yelp reviews for this restaurant. Food was fantastic wife had the the margarita that won many awards it was the best margarita we ever had. We had excellent guacamole as well as tacos first time I ever had a filet mignon Taco it was outstanding. Would highly recommend this restaurant if you're looking for authentic Mexican food.

Wow!  This spot is legit!  Just went their on Father's day and was blown away!  The salsa bar is killer, some many tasty varieties.  The quesadilla is what won me over and is worth the trip alone.  The street tacos are very tasty.  If you are a Mexican fan this is a must go.
This place is small but totally worth it. Guac has mangos in it which just makes its all the more amazing.

This place is just like a trip to Mexico City. 
The food it's good, the atmosphere here is great the music it's a little too loud but hey for lunch time it's just perfect, no one wants to think about work at that time. 
What can I said it's just a great place!

As you read this review, please keep in mind I am a conservative mother of two small children.

This place is so effing good.

Since moving to Phoenix two months ago, I have been in search of a down and dirty taco place, but one that didn't leave me feeling like I had just eaten a corn tortilla full of grease. This is that place. Authentic Mexican food with a gourmet twist. So so yummy.

I ordered the el gaucho steak taco and the cabo shrimp taco. Add in a $2 Negra Modelo, and life was good. If we didn't have two kids in tow, my husband and I could have kept ordering tacos and beer. 

Be prepared to go early, and the place is small...so seating is limited. Not good for large groups. 

Such a great place. If you aren't happy with your order here, then that just might be a personal problem. And I can't help you with that.

We got there for an early dinner.  Place didn't look that busy when we arrived.  They took about five minutes to great and another five to sit us.  I was not impressed by the way place look.  Floors were dirty with food.  But then I saw waiter cleaning tabla and dumping crumbs on floor.   After we sat down waiter left and didn't come back to take our drink order for a long time.  We almost got up and left because of how long they took to take our orders.  We had the al Pastor mahi fish and mole tacos.  They were super good!! I also had a michelada and it was delicious!! Food wise I give them Five stars.  But service and cleanliness I give them two stars.  
Next time I'll give the one in Glendale a chance. Hoping food is as good as here but with better service and a more clean environment.

Today we had a meal par excellence at Condesa!  My sister and Mom raved about the restaurant and I was excited to go.  I noticed some of the prior reviews had so-so service but my experience was very good. Our party of 5 was seated promptly and chips and drinks brought out pretty quick. The salsas were great but I liked the pecan salsa the best. My wife had chicken mole tacos which were tasty and even the beans have that authentic mex taste that is hard to find. Quesadillas were interesting and almost pastry-like in presentation, I had the Argentine beef w
Chimichurri sauce and it was awesome. A overall great experience and we shall return. Oh and margaritas were NOT from crappy sweet mix. Fresh lime juice and authentic!!
Horrible experience ordered a Vegan Salad and was given a salad with meat. Customer service is horrible
Their salsa bar is very inventive, and tasty.  Food is excellent too.  I will definitely return.

My favorite taco place in Phoenix! Some people complain about the prices but I'm from the east coast where the prices are similar and the tacos aren't even on the same planet as these.

You can definitely get buy with three tacos, four if you're super hungry like I always am and feast in all the deliciousness! The salsa bar is fantastic here as well as the guacamole. 

Ignore the fact that they've been on Food Network and have gotten a bit more touristy; the food is still legit and isn't that all that matters? So stop by, have a margarita and chow down on some delicious tacos.

One of the best Mexican restaurant experiences I ever had. It was a party for my taste buds....literally. Their tacos were the highlight of my meal. Especially the chicken mole and shrimp tacos.

I live in New York area and I plan to come here again just to taste their food.

Love love love this place..... I am in town with my fam vacating for a week... MY husband found this place in yelp. When arriving, didn't know what to think of it... From outside doesn't look that much of a restaurant and going inside it is too small of a space. Only 2 servers working 12 tables... 

I had Gaucho Burro, it was more than enough.. Perfect portion. And I recommend trying the horchata too. 

Authentic Mexican food!! Tasty food, and nice servers. Simply this place is officially my favorite new place...

This is one of those places that have lots of potential but are not managed well. My boyfriend's dad was in town and he wanted to have some authentic Mexican food and since we were starving we ended up coming to La Santísima since the reviews seemed good and it was closed to where we were.  When we got there the place was fairly busy, they only had 4 chairs in he waiting And my first impression of the place was not great. There was water spilled in the floor and food crumbs all over the place. Anyways, there were several people standing waiting to be acknowledged. When the host finally came she didn't greet us and we had to ask her if she wanted to take our name. We waited about 10 minutes for a table and then were seated in a booth. 

The room where we were seated was decorated very nicely with paintings of "La Santisima Muerte" but none of the lights in the roof were working, so they had a light in the corner of the room that was very bright and poorly placed. We then met our waiter who was very nice but quiet (It seemed like he has whispering the whole time), we asked for a drink menu and guacamole and sadly we were told they didn't have any Guac. Anyways, at this point we were just "meh" about the place and we just ordered our food. I had carne asada tacos, my boyfriend had a mole burrito and his dad had a burrito as well. They brought our food and I had to ask for utensils since there were none at the table. My tacos were tasty, the beans and rice were well cooked and delicious. I asked for a lime (since I'm Mexican and I can't really eat my tacos without lime) and I never got it :( so I stole my boyfriend's lime from the margarita he ordered (without a drink menu by the way cause he was never given one) we finished our food, we payed and left.



Pros:
Food seemed authentic and tasty.
The artwork in the place is beautiful.
The salsa bar is great.


Cons: 
Poor customer service 
The place looks like it needs better maintenance 
NO GUAC?! 


Customer advice:

This place has great potential. I think that if they had more waiters the customer service would improve since everything seems quite disorganized. 
-Greet your clients when they come in.
-Clean the floors constantly. 
-Fix the lighting.
-Go to the store and buy some Avocados for God's sake.
-Have utensils at the table. 
-Expand your waiting area.


Honestly, I'm a little bummed cause the food was good but I don't think I'll come back to this place.

The Chicken Mole tacos are phenomenal
The salsa bar is the best I've ever had.  By far.
La Condesa is a must try.....then you will be back...
- M

Love the concept upgrade Mexican food with authentic flavor, I am not a big fan of beans but the black beans here are delicious!! I have tried the taco platter and also went for brunch and had chilaquiles super good as well.
Best street tacos. Salsa Bar is full of variety. I could tell everything was fresh. My New Mexican spot for sure

Incredible!  It's not too often a native Arizonan, raised on mexican fare, finds a new mexican restaurant this good.  I'd put it up against any, in CA, AZ or TX.  Their Quesadillas are the best!  And we really enjoyed the salsa bar - wow!  That's a lot of different kinds of salsas!  We're definitely coming back to this place.

Man we had 3 moms and 3 kids and 3 babies for lunch! The place was packed so we waited about 45 minutes for a table. The food was good and the staff did the best they could to walk around us! Thank you for understanding!

He estado en este restaurant algunas veces, pero queria ir con alguien de Mexico, y tener su opinion y  a ella le gusto mucho. Si estas  en Phoenix y quieres comida Mexicana este es el mejor lugar al que puedes ir.

You would miss this place if you drive by it in a random small strip mall on the side of 16th st, but the muerte that is so beautifully decorated outside will catch you! My first trip to La Condesa was great, the music is very authentic, almost like Latino pop. But the FOOD- lets talk about it... First you get chips and you wonder, where is the salsa lady?! But then you realize that amazing salsa bar at the back of the restaurant is where you get to pick out your salsa! My favorite was the strawberry salsa it was so unique, I've never had something like that before- and it was fresh fresh fresh! Then there's other usual salsas and more fun ones, probably about 12 or 14 to choose from and lots of lemons and limes.

I had the tinga chicken tacos and they were very spicy, but I like spicy! But if you don't like spicy do not order them, they have an after burn and don't require salsa. The amount of chicken on the two taco plate was amazing for $6.99! 

TIPS-

Try the strawberry salsa
$2.00 Modelo Sat&Sun
Happy hour M to F 3 to 6 looks great

Margaritas are amazing!

Tacos on point. Baja shrimp a must. 

Gourmet tacos are your thing it place is a must in Phoenix

The bomb! Huge selection of Sala on the salsa bar, fresh and cool. Some really different and imaginative. The pork was almost like a BBQ, delish The margaritas were delicious and very tasty! I will be back

Omg this is my new favorite taco place in Phoenix. There is a wait during lunch so call in your order or be prepared to stand in line. The horchata is also amazing. I got a lot of different tacos but couldn't decide on a favorite. They also offer other foods as well. We went for a business lunch which was great. Atmosphere was nice, not too loud. The cheese dip appetizer is really good.

A truly great casual and authentic Mexican restaurant with a gourmet twist. La Santisima sports great artwork on the interior. They have a salsa bar with a wide variety of interesting flavors. The food is delicious, unique and interesting. Less traditional, but flavorful and satisfying. So are the portions.

Good food keeps us coming back but overall services is not good and definitely not friendly. The hostess was absolutely horrible, not one smile and made us feel like we were inconveniencing her! One bright spot was the bartender that took our drink order well we waited for a table. The restaurant was enlarged recently but still a long wait and tons of open tables well we waited so either the kitchen or service wasn't ready for the larger space. Not sure how much longer we will keep going back if the service doesn't improve!

There's a reason they have so many reviews. I've been here multiple times and my favorite thing is "la santisima veggie taco" so good! My husband gets the "traditional quesa" and that is also delicious. Not to mention their music is fitting and fun ;) I'm definitely a foodie and 99% of the time I look at reviews before eating somewhere, sometimes I go back to places & sometimes I do not. But La Santisima has a special little place in my heart. If you're looking for a fun, colorful, comfortable place with super good food this is a must.

La Condesa is in a rather unassuming location in Phoenix.  But has a nice atmosphere when you get inside.  The first thing I noticed was their huge salsa bar.  We sat down and were brought menus and chips.  I tried most of their salsas.  They all had their own very unique flavor.  the peanut salsa was really interesting.  My favorite was their tomatillo salsa.  

I ordered the Oaxaca Mole taco and a carne asada taco.  The mole was excellent with great flavor.  The carne asada was bland and flavorless...huh?  I dumped salsa on the carne asada taco and when finished was rather disappointed in that particular offering.

Also ordered their calabacitas.  They were seasoned well and tasted great.  

I had a bite of my partner's pork taco and it was amazing.  

I am glad we found La Condesa and I will definitely visit again to try some more of their menu offerings.

Phoenix has so many great destinations for Mexican food, but I have to say, La Santisima is amazing and authentic.  The salsa bar is stunning with as many as 12 varieties from which to choose.  The promptness of service at the lunch hour could be improved, but it is a small spot with limited seating.  About to go there for the third time...I think I'm hooked.

While my friends and I were in Phoenix and in search of a lunch place, we found this place on diners, drive-ins and dives. We came here on a Tuesday and arrived a little after it opened. You order at the counter and then find a seat. 

We ordered an assortment of tacos. A unique option that they offer is to order a protein taco. Instead of the tortilla, it was replaced with an egg. It was delicious, but filled us up quickly. If you go this route, consider ordering a taco or two less than you normally would. Not sure how many eggs they use per taco but it's probably between 1 and 2. I don't think this extra protein option widely advertised. My friend found this option somewhere on the menu, and we didn't know about it until he received his order. We were perplexed by what he ordered because he was the one who was enthusiast about tacos, and it didn't look anything like a traditional taco. Great option if you would like to go with the no carb option. I've never seen this at any other Mexican restaurant before. 

Our favorites were the Sonoran carne Asada taco and the shrimp tacos! They also offer a salsa bar and complimentary chips while you wait for your food. Fast service and delicious food!

This place was amazing! The only downfalls would be the parking situation and the service is freaking SLOW. We came on a Saturday a little before 5:30 pm and a 10 minute wait. We ordered 2 margaritas as soon as we sat down and didn't get them until maybe 30 minutes later after flagging our waitress down. Pretty sure she forgot, but still c*mon. They were pretty dang good too. I love the complimentary salsa bar and the variety of flavors! Salsas definitely can make or break the meal and you have so many to choose from! The chips were fresh and tasty. 1st basket is complimentary but I think like $3 for more as it states on the menu. The fried fish taco was fabulous, light and crispy! The refried beans were creamy and smooth. Rice was simple, so it was a refreshing change from other restaurants. The whole dining experience  took 2 hours! So it's definitely a place you need to go to when you have the time to spend. We had time to look at the menu and decide what we were getting before we sat down, so we weren't taking our sweet time or anything.  The line was out the door at 6 pm and the service is on the slower side, do be ready for the wait. However, I was impressed with the food and will definitely be back!
Wow what a disappointment here. The rice was Day and the chicken tocos we're not tasty at all. You also have to get your own salsa. I would totally pass and go to another place close by.

Oh where to start. So often places are over rated, but not the case here. We've been many times. This is probably my favorite Mexican food in Phoenix. My reasons for this statement? 1) best burrito I've ever eaten (I only wish I could recall the name; it was a special I think). I've had many of the tacos from fish to shrimp to beef to shark and all are good. 2) salsa bar. So many choices! All delicious. Seriously see the pics this is not your average salsa bar. 3) Quesadillas- a unique take on this dish that seriously takes it to the next level. You will not regret ordering any of these! Tip: Come in early or late to beat the rush. The space is small and can fill up quickly. Service is typically good.
This is the second time my family has eaten here! It's a GREAT hole in the wall restaurant! The tacos were AMAZING!!  My husband had the burrito and said the pork was incredible!! We'll be back!!
This is an excellent small restaurant.  They have great vegan options and huge salsa bar providing a wide range of flavors.  We will come back here in an instant.
Amazing tacos!!! The salsa bar is like nothing I've had at any other taco place. There were so many to choose from and each got better. The portions are huge and the staff is awesome!

Fiance and I went on a week night to come out this restaurant for wedding rehearsal dinner.  We were seated and given chips.  Was a relatively busy night. Only one waiter appeared to be working. Lady from behind the bar came and gave us water after 10 minutes.  Waited almost 20 minutes before walking out without ever having our order taken. Two other couples came in and their orders were taken right away. Very poor service for a nice looking place.

The mole tacos were disappointing after all the wonderful reviews of them. They were very sweet. Don't get the rice or beans. The teaspoonful they give you spreads out from being watered down. The salsas are good. The waitress seems like she must be the entitled child of the owner. Also, I think I'd also rather eat off of a paper plate than the questionably leaded & chipped Mexican plates. 

Guy Fiery must have been drunk or hungover. Also they surely knew he was arriving so the place must've been cleaned that day. I have seen cleaner food trucks than this.

Was driving by this restaurant and saw loads of cars so I figured it must be good and it was. The horchata was the best I've ever had (and I lived in Austin and ordered it frequently). It had a spoonful of sweetened strawberries in the bottom and loads of cinnamon on the top. Yum!  The chips were basic, but the salsa bar was a great surprise with some very unusual offerings (e.g. a creamy cilantro salsa, a pecan salsa, a jicama salsa). The burro was loaded w rice and chicken mole. The mole sauce was rich and complex, but I wish there had been more in the burro. As a final note, at lunch, you order at the counter and the line can be slow. So don't find a table and peruse the menu (like I did) or you might look up and find that the short line is now VERY long!!

Pleasantly surprised at what i found after walking through the doors. Yum. I underestimated the 2 taco plate size and got two additional street tacos (happy hour 3-6 m-f), leaving me stuffed.  The fried shark was great - awesome crunch with perfect texture while not being fishy. I've had better mole but it's worth the try if you've never had it. Carne asada and cochinita were also good.  Experiment with the different salsas to make each bite different.  This place is not cheap for tacos but def worth the groupon when available.  Good luck parking in front if it's busy.

Hot food hot. Cold food cold. Yep, delicious. Horchata was full of delicious fruit and nuts. The place was very clean. Sat at the bar and saw the food come thru the little window. No rush, no fuss, just cranking out quality grub. Salsa bar would take a couple of trips to truly savor, lots of choices.

I met a friend here for lunch and it was both of our first times. When I arrived, I parked next door at a mexican party shop. I am not sure if I was supposed to park there or not. Luckily I didn't get towed. Parking is not so fantastic there and you have to drive slowly down the street so you don't miss it. The restaurant is in a non-descriptive block. 
When I walked in, I loved the big wood chairs and tables. The feel was authentic mexican inside. We grew up going to Mexico every family vacation and my parents always liked to go to the non-touristy spots, especially in Cancun downtown. This restaurant reminded me of the Yucatan-inspired restaurant we visited that was right next to the bull fighting arena. So did some of the items on the menu. There was a mini bar for the salsas, and I think they had about 6 out. I wish they put a name card out for them so you knew what they were. I decided to grab a few different ones and see which I liked best. None of them were outstanding, but I did enjoy the unique, but hot strawberry salsa. I  decided to try a corn quesadilla off the menu, looking forward to real mexican queso in my meal. I ordered the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Quesa. It had Oaxaca cheese, roasted pork shoulder with achiote rojo and Mexican herbs. It was delicious, though, it was so filling, I could only eat half.  I was unhappy about the tortilla chips.  They tasted old and stale. I figured they'd be fresh and hot from the fryer since I got there right when they opened. 
I need to go back again so I can really get a feel for more of the food and atmosphere. I think this is a review-in progress situation...

I really enjoyed the food at this restaurant! It was very authentic, delicious, and the menu had an abundance of vegan/vegetarian options. I would eat here if I lived in Phoenix! However the seating is pretty limited for bigger parties and the hostess is not very accommodating.

Used to love this place but they expanded and apparently the kitchen can't keep up. I tried to call in an order but the phone just rang continuously. So I went to the restaurant to place my order to go and was informed their phone isn't working. I said I wanted to place a to go order and the guy points to the kitchen and says "see all those tickets up there (there were maybe 7) it's going to be a 45 minute wait for a to-go order." I worked in the food service industry. That is horrible customer service. He then told me I could place my order online through Yelp ($10 delivery fee). I was planning on ordering a mole bowl with a side of beans. All of those items are already prepared and take less than 5 minutes to put together. I took my business elsewhere. Learn how to speak to your customers.

They weren't kidding when they said they had an extensive salsa bar!! I tried most of them and they own had their own distinctive flavor and it made my burrito great!! 

Ok so this spot is in a sketchy part of phoenix. That's the first thing I noticed when I got off the freeway. Transients mostly around BUT I've learned that the best food spots come from restaurants that are in places you wouldn't think to go. Hence the term HIDDEN GEM.

It's SUPER small here. Luckily it wasn't too busy. But it's literally a small box of a restaurant. It looks like it can hold up to 25 people safely. 

I ordered a carne asada burrito, chicken taco and one of the houses popular burritos. I can't remember the name of it but it was delicious!! My burrito had lettuce, tomatoes and their own house sauce. It was so delicious! My burrito is on steroids!! It was so big too!! You have to come try this spot out if your near Phoenix!

Walk in and the waiter insisted on the wait being over 45 min and that we had to wait outside. Then we where seated but the same waiter gave us attitude and very poor customer service waited over 15 minutes for a server to come up to us to ask for our order but we weren't ready and the serve never came back after waiting serval minutes ( 20 minutes) paid for our drink and left very disappointed at the service we where looking forward to trying it for the first time it was very upsetting the way we where treated so poorly.

So myself and a coworker passed by this joint and loved the outside decor for the sign. Yelped it, and bamb! A whoppin 4stars huh, so today we stopped by to try it. 

Let's just start off with the entrance to the place. Line to the door. No tables open. One cashier, during the lovely lunch hour. 

The tables weren't bussed yet so we sat at a dirty table till it was cleaned. Can't blame them as the line never stopped from growing and to go orders were huge as people walked out. 

Food arrived and then the taste buds had an awakening. I tried the Cabo Shrimp taco, Mayan Cochinita Pibil taco, and Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken Shark Taco. All are very delicious just as is. Did not need the salsa bar they have but tried them for the chips the give while you wait. 

Only downside to the joint is the tortilla. The tacos seemed like they served them on some you get at Frys and or even a knock off, definitely nothing gourmet or authentic about those. 

Overall spent $16 on three tacos priced 3.99 each and a drink. Will I return??? Probably not, maybe to try others from the menu. But not worth the 4/5 stars!

The tacos here are delicious!! They have a great salsa bar also. It's not a huge place, so  just be aware of that in terms of time, they aren't in a hurry but def take care of you. Very flavorful food!
Excellent mole! The home made horchata with fruit & pecans. Great place to take out of towers for authentic Mexican food.

La Santisima is not an ordinary taco shop like a hole-in-the-wall Mex restaurant. This restaurant offers vegetarian dishes on the menu. This time around, I tried the cauliflower taco, its a bit dry. But with an amazing selection of salsa and it a sure thing to make dining enjoyable. I tried the salsa La Mexicana it was  a good compliment with the taco. The variety of style and uniqueness of the food is a sure five stars!

I grew up in a Mexican household so I tend to be super picky about eating at Mexican restaurants. I can't stand generic places like On The Boarder and Mi Amigos. 

It was around 8:00 pm on a Wednesday when I showed up. It was super busy but we were seated within ten minutes. The servers were attentive throughout the night. :D

That said: I love the idea of a salsa bar but I wasn't a fan of all of them. Personal taste.

Their food was awesome! It didn't need the salsas at all. I ordered three different gourmet tacos with beans and rice. All of them unique and on point.

Plus, I ended up with a food coma. Enough said.

Pros
Great salsas at the all you can eat salsa bar! Loved the guacamole salsa and the peanut salsa. Good tacos and horchata!

Cons
The guacamole is not that great. Avocado was minimal and not worth 10 bucks.
Hands down, best tacos in town.  The salsa bar is the bomb!

What can I say that other reviewers haven't? This place is awesome for vegetarians (there are like 8 different vegetarian taco choices!) and the salsa bar is awesome (strawberry salsa!). I really liked the guacamole, which was chunky and light with refreshing chunks of jicama and tomato with the avocado.

This place is awesome. Wife had the shrimp - I had the Cochinita. Both effing delicious and reasonably-priced. And after reading some reviews, I'm really excited to go back tomorrow and try their horchata. The chips were a little salty for my liking, but the salsas we tried (especially the watermelon) were great. Cool art on the walls.

Seriously - La Condesa is the real deal.
Love the idea of a salsa bar.  The three I had  were all good.   The Norteno burrito with red chillies, beans and pork was best burrito I have ever eaten.
The food was great. Huge servings. But sadly the service was not good. Maybe a few more waitresses would help?

This place seems to be universally loved in Phoenix. It makes sense because the food is excellent. Every person I was with raved about the food afterwards. The salsa bar was also great. Lots of flavors to pick from and most were just the right amount of spicy. 

You really can't go wrong on the menu here. The burros (get them enchilada style) and the fried quesadillas are probably the most popular things and I'd recommend either of them. 

The reason I'm only giving 3 stars is because the service was extremely underwhelming. They were clearly understaffed (which seems to be a common theme for this restaurant), but it was extremely difficult to get hold of our waitress and we waiting close to 50 minutes for our food.
Nice place very small but great food.  However it is always packed so you may have to wait a bit to get a seat.  But it is packed for a reason

Based on Yelp we decided to try this place. I can't figure out how this place has 699 reviews and an average of 4.5 stars?? I am not sure what the hype is about!! Simply because Guy Fieri graced this place with his presence; I love him as much as the next person but that doesn't make this place entitled to 4.5 stars. Everyone else who rates it 1 or 2 stars nails it!! The atmosphere is down right disturbing, a twilight zone experience! I kept thinking the entire time "How does this place have 4.5 stars and 699 reviews?" "How?" "I just don't get it?" "Please explain, somebody explain it!!" 
Service: They have the approach of we have an outstanding reputation and you can take it or leave it attitude. 
Food: The salsa bar is unique in that there are a variety of combinations, some strange, peanut, some good, pecan, most have a good kick! But the salsa cups are so small you can barely dip your chip! I got the cheese quesadilla, just not my idea of good, at all! Looked beautiful but too much cheese and I LOVE cheese; cheese is one of my top two favorite foods! That should say a lot! I ordered a side of beans and rice and the beans were really good! That is why I gave two stars for the beans and beans alone!!! 
Atmosphere: The tables are not level, extremely dirty, the chairs are upholstered and covered in stains and filth! I am not hard to please, I'd be up for a good hole in the wall joint, as long as you felt like it was clean and they cared about you being there! But this place is just down right weird! I love the other girl that said this place is schizophrenic! Pure craziness!

the food is good, the service is not good sometimes. in fact sometimes the service kind of ruins the experience when i eat in so i always order to go. and even when i order to go i must wait 30 minutes for my food, even at times when they are not too busy. i have tried multiple times to call in my order ahead of time so i dont waste my time with this restaurant, but many times their phone just keeps ringing and they never answer it. funny tho, because when you walk up to the counter, there is their phone right next to the most encountered area of the restaurant. when i have the patience to put up with the lack of decent service here, i come and enjoy some good food.

I went here at about 11:15 today for lunch. There was a line. that had already formed. Its a very small venue, no bathroom, so make sure to wash your hands and do your business before you get there. Only about a dozen or so tables on the floor, and the cashier is also your waitress delivering food to your table. If your expecting great service, forget about it, you focus strictly on the food here. Their is barely any parking. Everyone that seemed to come in was new to this place checking out other patrons food and asking them what it is and how they like it. Im sure they were all fellow yelpers as well considering where this place is and how everyone appeared to be new to this place.

The address is a little confusing with the map being shown on their website. Its off 16th street as the address implies, and the crossroad is Palm and 16th. There is a sign for another business there that says FAT PAD which is easily visible. Blink and you will miss this restaurant. The inside has a lot of cool mexican art. They also have a fresh salsa bar.

Wow this has some very flavorful food. Its not greasy or fatty at all. You can really taste all the ingrediants. I ordered the Dog Fish Tacos, the mahi mahi burrito, and the Carne Asada Taco. Everything was absolutely delish with lots of flavor! I liked the Dog Fish taco best. 

Make sure to get there before noon. They do take a while to make it, so be sure you have the time, especially if they are busy. You can call ahead or fax your order in as well.

La Condesa not only has two of my favorite tacos The Baja Sur Shark Taco, and The Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken Taco but the hole in the wall feeling you can't get a chain place. 

The seating is community style with large tables and smaller ones. It's a little tight space wise but it works for the style of the restaurant. Prices are reasonable, food quality is great, and they have one of the best if not the best salsa bars I've ever experienced. There's also a full bar for those that drink.

This place is awesome and I love that I can support local business while getting my grub on!

Sauces are great! Guac has cranberries in it but so good! I got the steak, shark and pork taco. All were good but the pork was my favorite.  Horchata was good! Chicken Quesadilla was something I never seen before but lacked flavor.

Specialty burrito was amazing. Veggies were still crisp, marinated chicken was tasty and rice was great. All wrapped up in a light nicely toasted tortilla. 
The salsa bar was phenomenal!
Quaint atmosphere - I don't live in Phoenix, but I will be sure to eat here when I am in the area.

I was incredibly impressed with the food. So much so that I probably will be back. Unfortunately the service. The waitress was the only one, so I was forgiving when it took her a while to take our drink order. At least the bus boy had given us water. By the time she came around we were ready to order as well. It didn't take too long before our order was out but it was missing a few things. My boyfriend had asked for his burrito enchilada style and it was not. He was also missing the rice he ordered. Since we had never been there before I ordered 4 different tacos to see which one I liked the most. Our waitress only brought 3. We told her our issues and she went to fix them right away. I was almost done before my boyfriend's burrito came back with sauce. When she finally brought the 4th taco it was the wrong one. By then I gave up and just took what she had given me. I was just super disappointed that the service didn't match the food. Hopefully next time will be better.

What a surprise! Not only do they have strawberry salsa, which made my toes curl, their mole burro was fantastic. It's very different from the mole we get in Los Angeles, richer, more of a heady chocolate flavor with a hint of sweetness.

Delicious.

The tortilla soup was also quite yummy and their salsa selection was outstanding.

Parking is horrible.  There were two groups ahead of us . Plenty of tables open waiting  to  be cleaned.  It took about 20 minutes to get seated. There is a salsa bar  but several were almost out. Guacamole  was entering. Quite different we did like it. Our meal did take  about 30 minutes.  Their was no napkins or silver were. The tacos were good . We did like rice and beans. Service again was a little slow

The food here is delicious! No matter what you order everything is always fresh but my favorite is their salsa bar they've got a wide variety that is sure to satisfy anyones palate. Also the art on the walls is awesome!
A-freeeeeaking-mazing!!!! Everything's sooooooooo good!!! Seriously authentic and flavorful!!! Mix the pecan salsa with the chipotle salsa - it's bomb!
Place is hella bomb ... so good can say nothing bad about this spot ... good tacos , rice , beans and beer what can you say . Service was on point today .

This place is blowin' up on Yelp and for good reason!  I have a strong desire to knock one star off every review I have for other Mexican spots after eating here.  The salsa bar is fantastic, and with so many choices (upwards around 10!) it was really hard to stick with four or five little cups.

I decided to go kind of random with my taco selections and picked the Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco and the Cochinita Pibil - marinated pork.  I seriously think the Cochinita Pibil was the best taco I've ever had, at least north of the border anyway.  The Dogfish Shark taco was very good as well.

I think my search for the best tacos in Phoenix has come to a close!  It's going to be really tough to justify going to another place after this experience.
La Santisima has an excellent selection of salsas. The food and especially the various burritos, are unique and taste excellent!

Service sucks. Took over an hour for my 3 tacos and my friends burrito to arrive on a Thursday night with only 4 other tables of small parties who also looked like they had been waiting awhile. But food is good. Just not an hour wait good.

Wow. I was in Tempe for 4 days - aside from hitting up the usual faves like In-N-Out since I made the mistake of living in a state that doesn't have one, this was my other highlight.

Space is limited, but going early (i.e. 4:30 pm on a Sat) seemed to beat the rush, we left past 5pm and it still wasn't packed yet, but did hear it fills up quickly.

My only complaint was that I wish I had a bigger stomach to try all the different tacos. The friend that took me said they never has ordered off the first page (Taco Page) because its so good, and now I can see why. 

Tip: Once you get your table, make your way straight to the salsa bar and start filling up your little cups. They'll bring chips to your table ASAP.  Don't waste time sitting there waiting for your server, go get your salsa! 

Also, I'm not a huge Horchata fan, but the Horchata there was super tasty. It's also 32oz, so share, or go pee a lot.

I went to this location as I was driving down 16st saw it out the corner of my eye and I'm glad that I made the stop, it was kinda packed but my party only waited about ten minutes. I ordered the gaucho taco that was recommended by our waiter that was one of the best tacos I had ever had and trust me I've had tons of tacos and don't even get me started about the shrimp tacos they have

In a single word this place is... AWESOME!

We were up in Phoenix on Wednesday afternoon and stumble upon this little gem right at the end of happy hour. Their happy hour tacos are delicious, especially the tinga tacos. SO GOOD.

Helping ourselves to the fresh salsa bar was a blast. There are so many unique and yummy flavors up there. I think we tried 12 different salsa and absolutely loved four of them. (Not to say that we didn't like the other flavors.) 

We then went on to order the the shark, the mahi mahi, the mole and the pibil pork shoulder tacos. I can't say enough about these. The mole was tasty and rich. The pibil pork shoulder was sooooo good. The meat in that one had so much flavor and was just perfect. The shark taco was more like a shark taco with a LARGE side of more delicious shark. Seriously, too much shark for one taco. (Not that such a thing is a bad thing!) The mahi mahi taco was more like a scrumptious mahi mahi pizza. The portions for these tacos are more than enough to keep get you full by the end of the night!

I really liked every little taste that this place offered up. Why isn't this a five star review? Honestly, the service isn't the greatest. It isn't bad service, it just isn't five star service. Seriously, I would over look this little point time and time again if I lived close to this place. The food is AWESOME. Seriously. Check this place out and you will leave full and happy!
Authentic and delicious Mexican food! Plenty of veggie options and absolutely yum. Would love to come here again. :)

Excellent quality! This may be the very best food for the value one can get in the valley!  The carne asada was incredible and seldom do I eat the beans and rice, but they were both amazing too!  Very good - I can't wait to return.

I was so excited to go here after seeing an episode of Check Please! Arizona but my high hopes were quickly dashed. We arrived on a Sunday afternoon (around 4ish) and found several couples waiting to be seated and were told that there was a 20 minute wait for 2, which was odd as there were several empty tables. The AC was not working and it was over 100 degrees outside which made the wait even worse. I was pleased with the Grapefruit margarita while we waited but then my hopes were dashed again as our waitress was very...forgetful? Ditzy? Lost? The menu was enormous and too confusing, the salsa was all very spicy (some people who enjoy Mexican food do not like super spicy), and the service was just pitiful. We waited 20 minutes to order, and then another 20 for a beer. The food was good, but overall it just was not worth everything we had to go through. I was looking forward to trying the Flan and having a nice, cool horchata for dessert only to find myself being disappointed again because they were out of flan and the horchata tasted like watered down milk. Needless to say I will not be coming back here again. My advice: if you have a few hours to kill: try going on a weekday in the middle of the day and hope for the best.

Don't blink because you can easily miss this place when you drive by! It is certainly not the place to go if you are looking wear a shirt and tie (but who wants that?).  Very vibrant spuper casual atmosphere.  They have a salsa bar that has so many choices, I was pretty full just trying them all.  I personally liked the strawberry salsa...it was sweet AND spicy.  Had a couple of regular margaritas...be careful, they sneak up on you but were tasty and went very well with the various salsas.  When we first walked in and were waiting (very small waiting area) they gave us some type of orange margarita which reminded me of something you would expect on the beach somewhere.  It was good but I like the traditional ones.  My guest and I both had the fried quesadilla (one pork and one beef)...WONDERFUL!  I recommend this place if you are in the area.  I am not sure I would drive down from the North valley specifically for La Santisima but it is reasonably close to work so I will be back!

Love the salsa bar !!! Basically this is the hole in the wall that was featured on food network diner dives and drive ins. We had to wait in a sketchy neighborhood for 30 min so was it worth it?

I would say yes since i haven't had too many good Mexican salsa bars. This one had about 10 salsas one was even strawberry !

The smoked marlin bowl was delicious as well as the beef steak tacos.

Stopped in to have dinner for my brothers birthday.  Our party was a bit too large for the small dinning area, there was 8 in our group.  However, after a short wait they were able to accommodate us.  

Everything I tasted was great, the only thing holding me back from giving a five star review is the small dining area.  I had two tacos and rice and beans.  The cochinita pibil taco was very good but the star of the show was the Aztec tinga.  So flavorful, so fat, so hot!  Man, good thing I had a horchata to cool the flames.  The horchata was very good but around halfway through it became nearly impossible to drink through the straw because of the fruit and nuts.  It was no big deal though.  All in all it was a great meal at a very reasonable price.

Some of the best tacos and burritos in Phoenix! Convenient location, but be prepared to wait at busier times and be a little creative about parking. It's hard to miss the giant sign/sculpture on the building, and the restaurant has a great character.
always crowded, which leads to slow service, but the food is awesome.  The salsas are quite interesting and I try a new one every time.
Wow lots of choices for Salsa at their Salsa bar. Food was very well done-good flavor and decor is really fun here!

yes another review of awesome accolades to a great taco shop. With all my repeat visits I thought I had written a review on this awesome taco shop. Apparently not. So, this is why I'm a fan of La Condesa... it's simply their beer battered dogfish shark tacos!!! they are soooooooooooooo good, it's like beachside fish tacos without the freaking beach, the taste, smells, and overall experience eating these totally delicious fish tacos can give you a mindf*** yes it's that good! and dipping them these beauties into my favorite salsa of all time.... confetti machine razzle dazzle... the salsa cilantro! it's soooooooo good so creamy, so perfect with their fish taco, and afterwards enjoying their horchata with fruit and cinnamon on top.... HEAVEN! love their quesas, the fish taco, La Condesa you have a fan!

I have heard so many great things about this place (It was on Diner's Drive-Ins & Dives!) and we finally decided to get our taco-loving booties over there to try it! Ohhh my goodness, I am so happy that we did!! 

They have the most amazing fresh salsa bar with at least 10 different salsas made daily. Being a sauce lover, this was a complete dream come true. I recommend getting the two taco plate with rice and beans. I got the Aztec Tinga Taco (Shredded Chicken, Tomato, Onion & Aztec chipotle sauce) and it was SO juicy with the perfect combination of spices. I also got a Carne Asada taco that was delish! The restaurant is small and I hear it gets busy so I would recommend dining here during off days/times. We went on a Thursday night at 7:30 PM and it was perfect!!! We will for sure be back, i've been daydreaming of their fabulous salsa bar ever since we left!

Honestly, the best burrito I've ever had. Not to be drama-lama but I think of it often. LONG and LOVINGLY. 4real. I had the Sonora Carne Asada Burro (definitely not the most adventurous but the most classic). It was HUGE and honey I ate it all. Full of tastiness. 

Small intimate restaurant kind of off the beaten path. My friend took me here and she loves the tacos. Next time I'm back I'll have to try them- but my burrito was so good I will probably just get it again.

Salsas GALORE at the salsa bar. I'm a woman who loves options and boy do they have salsa/sauce options! 

Service was good. No complaints.
Awesome selection of tacos and great salsa's... the restaurant itself it very tiny though! When its busy good luck finding a seat. You can always carry out.

My rating is based on experiences from previous visits to the sister establishment on 16th St.  The service and quality do not hold up here.  I hate to be so blunt but that is the way it has to be.  I have watched people walk out due to lack of service.  Watched a father and son dine without silverware!  THEY DID IT.  Will they be back???  Watched my uncle clean a dirty table that had been sitting dirty long before we had decided to sit outside and just before we had decided to leave.  All in the same day.

The food has been really good here, but they definitely have some growing to do.  We have come to love La Santisima's and would have no problem going back to the 16th St. location.  Get it together.

I ordered La Condesa shrimp burrito and it was delicious. The salsa bar was okay at best, the salsa was similar in flavors despite their various options and it felt like it wasn't fresh. The service was terrible and slow. It took an hour to get my food and my waiter only spoke to us when I ordered my food and to drop it off. I had to get out of my chair and look for my server to get the check. Not impressed with this place. Will not be going back.

I ordered La Condesa shrimp burrito and it was delicious. The salsa bar was okay at best, the salsa was similar in flavors despite their various options and it felt like it wasn't fresh. The service was terrible and slow. It took an hour to get my food and my waiter only spoke to us when I ordered my food and to drop it off. I had to get out of my chair and look for my server to get the check. Not impressed with this place. Will not be going back.

Have to eat here when I'm in Phoenix. Delicious, especially the salsa bar. I went back so many times, that I told the waiter just to bring me a soup bowl and a spoon. Who knew my favorite was the radish salsa? Not me.  The quesadillas are like none other: made with fresh corn masa, kind of puffy, and loaded with your choice of filling.  La Santisimima, mi corazon, I'll see you in November.

Some of the best Mexican food I have had in AZ. Only thing I would love for them to do is give bigger bowls for your salsa in case you really want to dunk a chip but I still managed anyway! Amazing drinks! I will be back again and again!

OMG, we had NO idea this place was so freaking tiny!  Had to wait outside no more than 10-15 minutes on an early Saturday evening (many more people were waiting when we left).  Didn't have anyone at our table for quite some time (he apologized and we noticed they don't have a large staff at all).  HOWEVER...

The food was EXCELLENT!  The house special tacos, my husband's Mayan pork tacos, the rice was flavorful, the MANY salsas at the salsa bar were great, the horchata was bliss, and the bill was pretty darn spot on!  We will return....just during an off time OR via a delivery service!

I visit my family here in Phoenix at least twice a year for the past 12 years.  All the food here in the Phoenix area so far has been mediocre to say the least.  Till I ate here, the carne asada is on point and the alpastor is very good.   I also tried the veggie quesadilla which was out of this world.  The salsa selection is so good that I would have gave it more than 5 stars just because of the great assortments of salsas they have.

I know most people just love this place...I can't get into it...tried it a few times...always a stuffy vibe with a staff that stopped caring who showed up a long time ago. Great tacos are a dime a dozen in Phoenix...if you want to experience a better vibe w/o wondering why you are sitting on top of the table next to you there are several other great options.
Food was delicious. Margaritas BLAH!!! Definitely will go for food and then venture somewhere else for cocktails!!

My co-worker walked in from lunch the other day with their horchata and I liked the bit I had so much I demanded to know where it was from. It took a bit for me to get used to the sheer number of salsas they had available, but once I got comfortable trying things (I was afraid I might burn my tongue off accidentally) I was hooked! 

I'd recommend the peanut salsa to anyone. It was some seriously good sauce.

Delicioso! 

This is a neighborhood hole in the wall that serves some pretty great mole. I am a mole fiend. Love the stuff. Can't get enough. Their's is dark, rich, spicy, and the right amount of sweet. (Also how I like my men, hey-o). 

(Just kidding.) 

Also, who doesn't love a salsa bar? I've never even heard of most of them: pecan salsa? peanut salsa? Um, why are you only giving me 4 lids for the to-go cups? Like I'm not going to try them all ...

I was very glad to stop here. Lots of vegetarian and vegan options. You can truly eat at your heart's content. 

I came with the wife and we both ordered the 3 taco platter. I got mine vegetarian, she got fish tacos. While the tacos were being made, we got some salsas from the salsa bar. This is a very nice feature, we tried a few and I really liked the tomatillo salsa and the jalapeño salsa. Then the tacos arrived, and they were pretty good, accompanied with rice and beans. This is not a typical Mexican restaurant, it is what they call Tex-Mex cuisine, but good nonetheless.

We also had margaritas, agua de jamaica and calabazitas (eggplant).

Not quite sure about the hype...we stopped in on a Sunday evening and did not have a great experience. They had good foot traffic and we were seated within 10 minutes or so. That's when it went downhill... 

We received stale chips, the salsas were just ok, and the service was very slow. After one hour and 15 minutes, we still had not received our dinners. We finally asked them to pack ours to go because we needed to leave. 

The business is very aware their service is slow. Apparently they expanded their dining room but not the kitchen.

When we finally got to eat, the food was just ok. Maybe it would be better when fresh.

At first I thought I was in a nursery, every table in these cramped quarters had an infant (with strollers and baby seats) crying and whining. I hate our society now that this is acceptable behavior of bringing your crying baby to restaurants ...how about taking that kid outside for a stroll like a responsible adult than totally ignore them and put us through this stressful situation (you're just waiting for me to snap RIGHT?) 
Well back to the review...
Food was fresh, unique, authentic. Plus, Plus, Plus. Salsa's were plenty, yes tried them all. But I'm a foodie and I need flavor, though I thought it's a bit on the bland side for my taste, I'll instead rave about them being unique and not your 'ordinary' mex-restaurant. The night we went, there was a line and busy, and they do treat you as family/friends (another Plus) but maybe too crowded. We had the center table and everyone, servers and patrons jammed right in there. 
I ordered up the Sonora Carne Asada Burrito (it says: A char-broiled mesquite Arrachera steak with homemade beans) unsure what Arrachera Steak is but gobbled it up with extra salsa from the buffet. Jodi had the Fish Tacos and well... they smelled fishy. Not the best either one of us ever had ...but was now check off our bucket list. Mission complete
Love love love.  Favorite thing on the menu is the gaucho burro - it's so good I don't waiver from that.  The salsa bar is an obvious plus too.
So good.  I've eaten lunch here a few times and always go back to their veg taco.  So yummy.
The guacamole is incredible-- big avocado chunks, cilantro, onion, tomato, mango, dried cranberries.... amazing. And the El Pastor Burro our recommendation. Great place for fresh Mexican food!

I don't tout many restaurants especially Mexican food but La Condesa is by far one of the best taco shop restaurants I have been to in the valley. 

It is hard to believe that with almost a Mexican restaurant on every corner in Phoenix that most if them if not all of them are disappointing or overpriced.

If you want a Scottsdale vibe with overpriced drinks and unauthentic food then this is not the place for you but if you want home flavor cooking with fresh ingredients with an authentic smile, then don't miss trying out this great new hot spot. You won't be disappointed!

The food is excellent. The salsa game is strong. Do not go to this shop if you are in a hurry quality takes a little time.
All of their margaritas are $5 all day Tuesday. There house margarita is one of the best margaritas I have ever had.

My wife and I waited over 2 minutes when we walked in and no one even acknowledged us even though a waiter walked by us. We had to grab her on her way back to ask to be seated as she didn't seem to want to even acknowledge our presence. The place was maybe 60% full, so it wasn't busy by any means. After a while, she came back and said it'd be at least 5 min before they could seat us as they had to bus a table. While waiting, another couple came in behind us, was helped immediately and was told the same table would be available soon for them. The waiters were chatting away and a couple of them were even flipping through their phones. For being behind, there was no sense of urgency from any of the staff to catch up. We left as there were way too many warning signs that it'd be very poor service for our meal. I shouldn't have ignored the other reviews that said the service was going downhill--don't make the same mistake.

Well, as this place is 4.5 stars after 144 reviews, it's not like I am going to share anything that will ruin the secrecy of this place and just how great it is!

I had plans to bring one friend here who is Dia De Los Muertos obsessed.  She blew me off, but I was so looking forward to it, I talked two other friends into joining me to check out a new spot.

The gal is a jamiaca fiend, and was thrilled with the drink.  Having read reviews on the size of the horchata, I convinced the guy to share one with me, we could always get another if we needed it.  (We didn't)  WOW - no other horchata will ever measure up!

Yes, the salsa bar ROCKED!  We sampled 6 or 7 of them.  I could live off the jicama, cilantro, jalepeno and lime tastiness!  And the hot red one that looked greasy had the most amazing heat/flavor ratio I could imagine ever encountering.  Truly, the acme salsa!

Being indecisive, I went a la carte with the tacos.  One each of the cochinita pibil, one chicken mole and one carne asada.
I was busy having a foodgasm with the cochinita when the gal freaked on her carne asada, making the guy have some - and they both agreed it is better than America's Taco Shop!  (Mine had to sit and wait while I was having quality alone time with the last bites of the pork.)

I will say I wasn't thrilled with the mole.  This is NOT a knock on how La Condesa does it - and if you're a mole fan, it may be amazing.  I'd never actually had mole - turns out I am just not a fan of the overall flavor.  But I love almost all Mexican food, and I love chocolate!  How is this possible!  Two rights making a wrong?  Weird!

That said...I will be back.  Over and over!  This is definitely on the short list of places to have a quick, great meal in my hood!

This place is amazing.  The cochinita pubil and chicken mole tacos were unforgettable and the salsa bar alone is worth the trip.  The salsa cilantro was a great choice.  I'll be telling all my friends about my new favorite taco stop

Eh. Food was very average and service was pretty bad- we were shortchanged and forgotten about for a solid amount of time. Got 3 tacos and a burrito. Burrito was mostly rice and the taco meat was very dry except for the fish. Overall a very overhyped place. If you're looking for tacos Mucha Lucha is 1000x better.

What took me so long to get to La Santisima?  Not much to add to the myriad of great reviews about this place other than to say Yelpers are dead on with this one.  The food, drinks, atmosphere, and staff all make this place a valley favorite for good reason.  Tonight my brother and his wife took me here as a late birthday present.  They've been here dozens of times and love it.  So I was confident what I was about to get would be pretty money.  And it was.

Let me first confirm what so many are saying about a specific drink here.  The Horchata.  Yes, its enormous and yes its awesome.  Has a nice light texture with accents of cinnamon and nuts.  The salsa bar here is also as extensive as advertised.  My brother and sister grabbed cups of each and every salsa for me to try (which was hilarious to watch since they were carrying full handfuls of salsa cups).  My favorite salsas were probably their cilantro and tomatillo.  As for the main course, its a taco shop first and foremost so I went the taco route.  The two that Yelp suggested most were the Mayan Cochinita and Cabo Shrimp.  Outstanding choices.  The cochinita pork was out of this world tender and delicious.  And the cabo shrimp was delicious and the portion on the taco was VERY generous (I could barely hold it on the tortilla).  The other thing that stood out to me was the rice on the side.  Seriously.  This isn't your run of the mill rice.  It's got a creamy savory thing going on.  Not sure exactly what they put in there (though I did pick up on some corn notes), but that rice is good stuff.  We didn't do dessert this time, but I'm sure I'll give that a try next time I'm here.

The service we received was super friendly and on point.  The place is small with seating for no more than 20 and it was pretty busy on a Saturday night.  So on most nights you might have to wait just a bit for a table.  Parking here is also pretty scarce so keep that in mind.  Its quintessentially traditional and delivers a wonderfully tasty experience.  I'll be back regularly and that horchata will likely accompany each of those visits.

Walked into a small crammed room with dingy white walls and Day of the Dead themed wall decor. The place seemed to be in disarray as a regular. Food was basically $10 and up. Quesadilla is good, was like a mexican calzone type thing. All in all, not worth going there. Guy Fieri did them a solid giving them more credit than they deserved. Food was tasty, but perhaps the customer service, seating and cleanliness can be better?

There's a reason this place was on the TV show Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. The al pastor fried quesadilla was amazing, and there is a salsa bar with many options which you can serve yourself. The quesadillas are not typical, see attached photo. There aren't that many seats, so you may experience a wait at busy times. It's worth it.

Service was absolutely horrible. The waiter barely spoke to us. I felt like I had to beg him to do anything. No one asked if we wanted water.. Had to flag the guy down. Then I made the mistake of ordering more chips and had to ask several times for the waiter to bring them out. When he finally did he looked annoyed w me. He never asked us how our food was. The final straw was when it came time to pay, I told him we were paying separate and then he let out this long sigh that included his lips flapping loud as if I asked him to do the hardest thing in the world. I didn't want to leave a tip.. Because that's how bad it was.. But ultimately I couldn't do that. I just won't come back. I didn't feel welcome in the first place.

For starters, let's just start off by saying yummy!
The cuisine was absolutely melt in your mouth good. I had the taco platter with al pastor and carne asada tacos, so crazy good. Great staff,  Great restaurant, and amazing food! So very highly impressed! Thumbs up!!!
This place is great.  I love the salsa bar.  They have so many types of salsa.  Small and can get crowded but worth it.

Adore this taco joint! They have a huge selection and great service. Try the shark tacos!! A very authentic feel, with a salsa bar in the corner. This is a smaller place, without a waiting area so we had to wait 15 minutes outside before being seated. This in no way detracted from how great the food was, but if you go at a busy time, just be prepared.
Great mexican food.  Favorite part was the salsa bar

Love this place. Been coming for years and they don't loose the touch. Love the array of salsas everything from traditional pico to strawberry salsa and definitely my favorite is the "jicama" Obviously the food is amazing. Love the shark tacos, the gaucho and the fillet mignon burro being my favorite. For sure you'll have to try their guacamole. It's so tasty and refreshing with diced mango it will surly stimulate your taste buds. All in all my favorite places to go for gourmet Mexican food.

It's good and all if you're into the new infused Mexican style food, my mom ordered the tacos en chile enogada and it was a little too sweet for her, my quesa de cochinita pivil was flavorful so that was a plus. I guess it depends on what you order it's a hot or miss. The service was not all that great, the tables were messy. Not worth the money, a salsitas or Federico's would be better. 

Save your money

went here because I was excited at their vegan reviews of how great their tacos were. When I got here I had no idea how popular this place actually was. There was a 30 minute waiting period, but I expected long wait since we came at 6pm. We wanted to try out their guacamole, but they were already sold out? that kinda saddened me lol.. especially since they ran out of the best salsa in the first 20 mins of us sitting down (least spicy and most flavor). I tried many other ones but none compared. They never bothered to fill it back up either which I didnt understand, but maybe since it was later at night they thought that would be pointless. they were also very busy the whole staff is always running around catering to everyone which I actually loved. The people who work there, work their asses off. I could tell. Plus none of them were rude at all, which is always a great thing because most restaurants dont treat everyone the same. The food was great I cant complain too much. Definitely recommend this for meat eaters though. It caters to vegans with a large selection of options unlike most restaurants, but not the healthiest if you are a real vegan. Corn tortillas aren't exactly healthy, and I have had better fried cauliflower. If you came here with family that wasn't vegan Id say you are safe here for everyone!

This place is DELICIOUS. The food outstanding and the salsa is on point. But there is only one server every time I come. It takes 20 mintues for my order to be taken and another 30 mintues until my food arrives. By then my drink is usually long gone. Please get more servers!
Great food and service, which is key. Horchata is off the hook!!!!!!! Plus it's been on DDD's. Worth yo time!

With all the great places to get tacos in Phoenix -La Santisima is a must visit. Be prepared to fight for limited street parking or save yourself a headache and park in the neighborhood behind the restaurant. This former hole in the wall, now full blown restaurant offers a wide selection of gourmet and street tacos. Their salsa bar is first class and will please every taste. Customer service is a bit slow ( I guess due to the high demand?!) the meals are always hot and correct! The ambience along with the diverse food flavors makes you feel just like in Mexico.
Great place for tacos and every kind of salsa you can think of. Must try the horchata and michelada. Glad they expanded the location on 16th st.
Excellent Mexican food with amazing salsa bar. They doubled the size of the restaurant this year.

my friends convinced me to give this place another chance. 

the salsa bar is SO good. I don't really recall what I ordered to eat but i do remember not loving it. it was decent though. 

the salsa on the other hand is amazing! salsa all day long!

I was going to meet a friend for lunch at Barrio (one of the only places you can get "real" Mexican in Phoenix, which I could never understand -  we are less than 4 hours from the border!!). Unfortunately, it was before I yelped much, so I neglected to notice that they were closed Mondays:( Dejected, we drove down the street looking for someplace else to go. I can't remember if it was the Catrina that drove us in, but as soon as I saw the salsa bar, I knew I was in heaven. It was like actual food that I've actually eaten in Mexico (rather than assorted patterns of tortillas, rice, beans, and cheese). Now we take all visiting friends and family to this place. A visitor from LA said they were the best tacos he had ever eaten and I'm sure he wasn't lying. 

Many people have commented on the salsa bar. My favorites are the creamy ones (pecan, peanut, and cilantro) and most of all the sesame (to me, the spiciest one on the bar), and usually I try to sample some of each one - but taste is in the eye of the beholder. The important point is that you don't want to fill up on the chips, because you will be sad when your huge plate of food comes. So I'd like to share my strategies for maximizing the salsa enjoying experience without getting uncomfortably full.  I start by limiting myself to 5-6 chips which I break into smaller pieces for dipping. Once the food comes, I take the second tortilla from each of my veggie tacos (the tacos themselves already have just the perfect type and amount, so it's pointless to try and add more) and use it to scoop up the salsa. With only the one remaining tortilla, you do get some drippage, but you can add more salsa to any veggies and cheese that fall out and eat it with a spoon. Then for dessert, I pour the cilantro salsa on my rice. Mmmm, salsa. I would buy this stuff by the tub if they would let me. BTW, I asked - they just laughed. 

The only draw back is that my poor husband tries to order a margarita every time we go, and they still don't have any. I hope someday they will take his advice and add it to the menu.

This place is tiny and often packed. Great salsa bar, my favorite is the cilantro and 7 chiles.  If you like texture, you have to try one of the quesas.  Its a type of quesadilla/empanada/tamale.  Made of a corn masa, it is filled with cheese and other ingredients, folded over and pinched closed.  Then it is deep fried.  My favorite is the shrimp.  

They do have a full - but tiny- bar.  

I've been here at least a dozen times an d always love it.  ALWAYS.

I have to say my experience today was an extreme disappointment.  And it had nothing to do with the food. Unfortunately the service was so bad. It was like pulling nails to get someone to take our order. And to get a refill on my water took entirely too long. 

But even worse was the smell of sewage in the back dining room. As soon as we walked in I smelled it. I don't know if there is a leak or what's going on back there, but it was very distracting and made eating there very difficult for me. I thought it was coming from the women's bathroom since it's RIGHT THERE (gross) but it turned out to be coming from the back storage room that opened up into the dining room. 

Again food was great, ad my Blue Demon Margarita was sensational.

Excellent food.  We ordered 4 different kinds of tacos and all were simply superb.  You must hit the salsa bar in the back wow there are some great creations back there.  We must have made 5 trips.  Service is super friendly and fun.  Margaritas not bad.  Come for the food the decor is fun but overall not over impressive. When back in Phoenix I'll be back soooo good!

This is a cool little place to try. I think the best thing on the menu are the quesadillas. They are traditional Mexico City style which are not in the flour tortilla as most places serve but are maid out flour ( I think they are from Mexico City because we were brought up eating them this way). They are deep fried which is worth trying just because of how deliciously amazing they are! There salsa bar is unique with lots of choices, but I do wish they had at least one spicy one. I think their service can improve, ( maybe our server was just having a bad day). But overall good place.

Have driven by this place daily for years. Finally stopped to try them and I'm so angry at myself for waiting so long. Very impressive menu but I just stuck with the 3 Taco mix & match plate for my first visit. I will have to say the flavor in these tacos were the best I've ever had. I have been craving them ever since I've tried them. The salsa bar is beyond flavorful. Probably the widest variety I have seen. The artwork and atmosphere is very welcoming. This is definitely a MUST TRY place. Lunch rush can be busy, but that's a good sign!!!
Amazing tacos! The seating and parking can be a little dicey, but the food is worth it.

I ordered the green chili chilequilles with poached eggs and a margarita with a corona. The food was awesome and the drink was superb but what really impacted our first time experience was the wait. It took about 5-10 min to get water but she did bring our chips out first. They have small plastic to go cups for salsa which is an inconvenience to keep going back and forth for refills, not to mention half of the sauces were bland, (had no flavor). 

At this point we ate two baskets of chips and still didn't get our drinks we ordered from the bar. Our food actually came our first then finally my margarita and two mechiladas came. We ate half our food as the chips filled us up from waiting so long. The food was delicious but the service needs immediate attention.

Another issue I had was that the ladies room had no hand soap so I decided to let the staff now. Shouldn't they check this prior to opening? It's unsanitary if the staff goes to the restroom and touches food.
