All in all, I'd give it one more try but I'd go if I'm not in a hurry to go anywhere. If you are on a short lunch break, don't come here unless you're ok with showing real late to work. Hopefully I can leave a better review next time I visit. Great food, bad service when it comes to timing. Otherwise our server was nice.... btw there was only a couple dining and three girls. They place wasn't packed so I shouldn't have waiting about 25-39 minutes for my drinks and food (-_-)

Arrived here for lunch off peak (2:00) and the place showed signs of being super busy, and was a wee bit dirty.  There was only us and another party and they did start catching up on the bussing while we were eating. First off, BEST Mexican I've had in a long time. Anywhere. The guac is something special and different.  See the photo. The pork shoulder and steak w/chimichurri sauce were amazing, even the simple rice side was great. I did like the steak taco better than the pork but the favors were very different.  The salsabar was a real treat!  So many things to try. Will be back next time in town.
This is authentic and delicious food. I am so happy we found it! The food possesses layers of flavor and I cannot wait to try more!

Just passing through Phoenix and stopped by this place for lunch, I can honestly say my meal was very good. Great flavor and reasonably priced; with even better service. Would definitely go back and recommend to others. Tried all the salsas didn't think any were really spicy, I had the burrito and it was delicious.

It's been almost 11 hours and darn it if I'm not still thinking about that mahimahi burrito. So fresh. So tasty with the various salsas. So awesome that it's just down the street and I can come here whenever I want and spend WAY too much time choosing the salsas I think would best compliment my meal. It just don't get much better than La Condesa, and that's coming from me, and me has a pretty serious taco/burrito issue, as in I always want them and I always want them.

The salsa bar with complementary chips is a blast.  Not truly complementary as the food and drinks are not cheap for a taco shop.  Husband had the pork with banana leaf, rice and beans on side.   He left the rice alone (too full). His burro was excellent with a good flavor to the slow roasted pork.  I got the chicken burro with moles sauce.  It was not great, no taste of nuts or orange.  I took the flour tortillas off and mixed the chicken with a little salsa.  Still not great.  Five stars because my husband's pork was good and the salsa bar was really fun. Place was really busy.  Will come back to try something else.

I have to admit that it is a great restaurant. Its service attitude is not only very friendly,the taste of food is also very delicious. The environment is so clean that I have a warm feeling. I recommend you go but DON'T be too late because it might take you some time to line up.

Love the vegan tacos and all the variety of salsas offered.  But the service leaves much to be desired.  We have been waiting for our tacos for over 30 minutes and its not even full. Its way past the lunch rush so we are not sure why it is so slow... w are about to get up and leave...

The day we went it was so hot inside the building you could literally see sweat on people's faces. It took 15 minutes to get someone to ask what we wanted to drink. And then it took 10 more minutes to get our food order in. Overall service was slow and the heat made us all so hot we didn't want to stay. But the food was good, just had to take it to go cause it was just so hot inside.

If there is anything I'd miss if I were to leave Phoenix, it would have to be the Mexican food.  That's what we're good for (and to think we're trying to get rid of the Mexicans!).  There's awesome greasy hole-in-the-wall, everybody-speaks-Spanish places like El Tlacoyo and Moreno's in Mesa; there's a variety of fast food places like Filiberto's and Someburros; you have you generic family restaurant Mexican like Macayo's, Garcia's, and Tia Rosa's; and then you have your niche places.

La Condesa is one of those niche places, and one of my favorites.  Here, their niche is a slightly fancy take on really simple items like tacos, salsa, and quesadillas.  

The tacos come in several varieties, with meats including chicken, beef, pork, whitefish, and even dogfish shark, and different spices and toppings on each one.  My favorites are, of course, the shark, as well as the black mole, and one of the beef ones (not the Sonoran).

The salsas are also a big draw: prepare to be blown away as you dip your chips in peanut salsa, strawberry salsa, cilantro salsa, or even my personal favorite, pecan salsa.  There are typically about 20 choices, so if you want to try them all, come with a few friends (it does get crowded, though).

The quesadillas are also delicious; they're a southern Mexican fried style.  They're quite heavy, so don't plan on being able to eat two or three tacos *and* a quesadilla.

Oh...and GET THE HORCHATA.  You won't regret it.  I won't describe it, just because I don't want to ruin the surprise.  But it will blow your mind.  Whenever I get it, which is always, someone always asks me what that delicious-looking beverage is.

Great gourmet tacos, great salsa bar, and huge portions!

Was hoping for better street tacos though.
Great spot, the food is amazing, try the horchata it's delicious!!  Friendly staff and cool decor.  Also excellent options for vegetarians.  I will be back!
BEST TACOS.....EVER!  was visiting phoenix and found this place on yelp.  great food, great atmosphere, and AMAZING SALSA BAR.

Wow talk about authentic Mexican food!! Amazing tacos amazing salsa!!! Amazing horchata!!! The food here is pricey but so worth it!! I'm in love you can tell everything is made with love!!! From the second we walked in to when we left they had people coming in and out of the doors! Food came out fast and service was fast for how busy it was! I will be back and so will my party! Best Mexican food in the city hands down!!!
The food is wonderful! Salsas galore! You might have a bit of a wait because this ain't fast food so be sure you bring some patience! Will eat here again and again!

Stopped by for lunch with coworkers, boss's treat, wasn't sure what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised. I ordered the Arabe Burro which is basically a Gyro/Burrito fusion drenched in hummus. I loved it so much I had to remake it at home. Will be back with the family for sure!

I thought I was going to give this place 5 stars. I stopped by for dinner last night with a friend, and we both seemed to have a great meal. I ordered the al pastor quesa, and she ordered the tapatio quesa. We both very much enjoyed the salsa bar too. However, a few hours later, we were both puking our guts out. Update: 12 hours later, still puking.

It was a very decent place. (I still live/die for Ritos)

--Price:  It was $6.99 for my burro.  For its size, it was about average.

--Food:  I had the Oaxacan Black Mole Burro. I was good, but not mind blowing.  I would say it was worth the visit.

--Service:  Alright I guess.  I could take out my balls, rub them on the table, and the waitress would never know.  Take what you want from this.

I read so much about the chips and salsa: Chips sucked my shaved anus but the salsa was good.  I had better at Costco. **Strawberry salsa was good**

Overall it was a good experience (hence the 4 stars), but I will continue giving my money to RITOS.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE this shop and have never had anything there that wasn't delicious. They have tacos, burritos, quesas, and tortas. I've had tacos, burritos, and quesas (think thicker, deep fried quesadilla) and have never been disappointed.  I really love the tacos because you can get two tacos with rice and beans for about 10 bucks and be completely filled. Their horchata is really delicious and soaked in nuts and fruit for an interesting take on typical horchata. They make an AMAZING spicy margarita and a magnificent michelada---I can't even tell you how great they are. Of course, their salsa bar is my favorite part of this restaurant: 15 salsas that are unique and flavorful. The only reason I give this a 4 instead of 5 is because the last few times I have come (at varying times/days), they have been swamped and they only have 2 waiters. I recognize the space is really tiny (only about 8 or 9 tables and the bar counter) but there's also no real waiting area, which can get annoying in the summer.
The burro was fabulous. Hard to describe how wonderful the food is. The horchata was the best we ever had.
I always get the street tacos and my boyfriend always gets the quesadillas. You can't go wrong with either of those.  They have a pecan salsa that is absolutely amazing.
Food is amazing I recommend the tiger shrimp tacos or the arrachera tacos. Salsa Bar is amazing. It's small and there is a wait but there's a reason why. It was worth the wait.

Holy cow!!  Easy the best taco joint I've been to in AZ.  Unbelievable variety.  Shark, marlin, mole, al pastor, grilled cactus, million-hour slow roasted pork shoulder, on and on.  Three of us tried about 10, and every one was incredible.  As good as the tacos were, I would go back and eat nothing but the chips and salsa bar.  The salsa variety was amazing.  Never had anything like it.  And to top it off, they have a specialty horchata with strawberries, cantaloupe, pecans and who knows what else.  Not a huge horchata fan, but this was magic.  Can't wait to go back!!!

I have only been here for brunch, but can't wait to try lunch or dinner on for size!  We were the first table in on Sunday and were greeted right away by our server and felt at home with its cozy interior.  It's a small place but has lots of character with the heavy solid wood and wrought iron furniture.  Love the Dia de Los Muertos art and heavy wood bar with cowhide bar stools and authentic Mexican glassware.

We sampled quite a few of the salsas at the salsa bar and there is a little something for everyone including those that can't take a lot of spice.  This is a big plus for us since our family has spice tolerances from 1 to 10+.

What was on our menu? we tried the divorced eggs (which I added avacado), black mole chilaquiles with chicken, and an egg scramble with side of bacon; all of which were served with black beans.... Delicious and full of flavor! I'll have to post the brunch menu next time since it is not currently on their website.

Each of us would order the same thing again, but so want to try the other items of delicousness on their menu.

I guess we will have to make La Condesa a staple on our restaurant list!

I went back to this place this evening and it was not even close to being as good as it was the last time. When we arrived (7ish) they were out of steak and guacamole! We went ahead and ordered other things but it was not very good. Last of all, we had to wait over An hour for the food to arrive! I won't go back. Ever. I think Guy F should take his sign off his wall!
Love this place.  Had the street tacos.  They were amazing.  Prices are good, variety is great.  Love the gluten free options.  Missed good Mexican food.  Will be a regular here.

Dinner at La Santisima is becoming a Friday night tradition and I have to say I'm pretty happy about it! My husband has become obsessed with this place. If it were up to him we would be here at least 3 days a week. We had no idea this place was on Trippe D we just knew Jason V. and many of my fellow yelp friends really liked this place. We decided to give it a try and now it's our go to spot. Not only do they have some really great taco's as advertised but their, burritos, salsa's, margarita's, and horchata are some of the best I've ever had. So far my very favorites have been their Cabo Shrimp Taco: Corn tortilla stuffed with beer battered shrimp. Shrimp was giant, crispy, and tasty. Their Green Chili burrito and their horchata! I usually dont like horchata at all but this one is addicting. It is topped with a drizzles of caramel, strawberries, and pecans and you can just taste that it's home made. We have a had great service, and I find it strange that there has never been a wait. But hey I'll take it, more for me!! We recently brought my mom and her husband here and they too loved it. So I will be seeing you next Friday!!

Wow...this place is so good it is ridiculous!  The Azteca Chicken Tinga quesa was amazing and the carne asada burro was to die for!  The food is so flavorful.  The salsa bar is fantastic...so many choices and they all have such good flavor.

My parents taught me, "when you don't have something nice to say, then don't say anything at all."

Yelp has taught me, "when you don't have something nice to say, tell it like it is."

Sorry mom and dad, Yelp FTW!

I like my restaurants how I like my style, un-cramped; unfortunately, this place is packed full with wall to wall tables and chairs leaving about 3 inches in between you and the guy at the table next to you. Don't plan to come here during the lunch rush with a big group, you're lucky if you can fit one or two people through the door. The parking isn't that appealing either, you are practically parked in the middle of 16th street traffic. :-/

La Condesa makes a pretty good taco, and their salsa ain't bad either. To their benefit, they do have some fairly unique salsa's to choose from, such as strawberry, peanut, and pecan; but in my opinion, unique doesn't necessarily = awesome. Any of their tacos will do you right, but my favorite is their pork.  

In my opinion, and lets face it, if you're reading my review, that's exactly what you're looking for right? La Condesa over stated when they went with Gourmet in the name. Sure, everybody likes their taco's but who wants to pay $9 for two tacos and leave feeling like they were packed in like sardines in the middle of a seedy neighborhood? If it isn't obvious yet, I don't plan on coming back soon, I can take or leave their salsas and tacos and wouldn't be bothered either way.

Happy Yelping Phoenix, hope you find that hidden taco gem you've always been searching for.

I was hard core craving Mexican food and had previously bookmarked this place so we decided to check it out. 

Parking was no issue and we were seated right away. We received a bottle of water and a bowl of chips without even having to ask for it. The salsa bar was extensive but many of the salsas had run out. The available salsas were amazing. Especially the pecan salsa, which I had never had before, was awesome. Creamy and rich. 

I got the Tlaloc cactus burrito (can be made vegan or vegetarian). My first time eating cactus! The Tlaloc was yummy but made with too much oil, I had grease dripping down my hands while eating it. The oil was a definite turn off and 1/5 of it would have sufficed to pan-fry the veggies. That's why I'm deducting a star. 

I'll be back to try a fish taco or quesadilla.

Man, I've never given such a low review... where do I start?
So I get an hour long lunch everyday. I work extremely close to La Santisma, so I figured that this would be a great place to check out and that I'd have plenty of time to sit down and enjoy my food. Wrong.

I showed up with a coworker around 2:30pm. There were maybe 18 other customers MAX in the restaurant. It took about 15 minutes for us to get cups of water and it took 30-35 minutes for someone to take our order. And had I not approached a waitress requesting to have our orders taken, it probably would've taken longer. There were plenty of waiters and waitresses standing around, chatting. Customers that came in after us were served before us.

The menu is huge. There is SO much to choose from. This is a huge plus! It's a little overwhelming but I LOVE variety. I couldn't decide so I asked the waitress to tell me what the spiciest burrito on the menu was. I ended up requesting the Mayan burro.

While we were waiting for our food to arrive, we checked out the awesome salsa bar. I LOVE salsa and tried every single one of their options. My favorite was definitely the cilantro one as well as the green chile one. We visited the salsa bar 3-4 times (seriously, we loved it), and our food still hadn't arrived.

Upon its arrival, we had to wait an extra couple of minutes for utensils and napkins. By the time we had everything, we had maybe 10 minutes left to eat our food. I ended up eating a fourth of my burrito and took the rest to go. I was late for work.

The burrito itself was not spicy, but it was good! It was a good portion, it was $9.99, and it was very flavorful... after I drowned it in salsa. Honestly, I probably wouldn't get it again. And I know this place is known for their tacos and not their burritos, so I'll be sure to check them out if I ever come here again. And to be quite blunt, I don't know if I ever will. I'm not sure the food is worth the wait and the horrible service...

As much as I loved the salsa bar and the ambiance, I definitely feel like there's some other place out there that has better service and better salsa.

Until the next time I decide to visit this location and update my review, this place gets two stars for me. I might even consider just doing take out because there is no way I'm waiting again. I can only imagine how long the wait is during lunch hour...

There are so many areas for improvement. I truly do hope some of these concerns are addressed. I really wanted to like the place, but I just can't get past the horrible service.

MMMMM!!! Love this place! The Salsa bar is awesome. They have updated it since the last time we went so they now have a full bar! YAY!  The prices are great and you get sooo much food. My boyfriend and I was always have left-overs that heat up wonderfully in the toaster oven . There is not a lot of seating but that's down town dining for ya.
Really good - fresh food!  Lots of variety in what to order and what salsas to get.  Even my 2.5 year old loved his ginormous quesadilla.  We will be returning.

My absolutely favorite place to eat tacos in Phoenix... wait, make that Arizona! So happy they got the expansion done because more people should visit this little gem when visiting. Don't let the neighborhood discourage you from coming - the tacos are worth the drive! Get the al pastor and tinga... don't forget to have a margarita too as they are oh so good!! Enjoy the salsa bar in the second room too.

I am not a huge fan of Mexican food so when my sister took me to this restaurant, I was not expecting to me blown away. Except I was! I loved this place, from the beans to the different types of salsa and the to-die for carne asada tacos! My boyfriend had the al pastor burrito which he loved as well. Service was great however my only complaint is that there aren't enough servers. We found ourselves waiting a lot but I knew it wasn't our server's fault. She was just extremely busy. 

5/5 stars for sure! :)

Small restaurant, really good food. The Shark taco and Horchata are the best I've ever had. Don't care too much for the name of the restaurant (theme) or the dark artwork displayed. The food was worth me tolerating these images of the  SPIRIT of Death....he...he...

Visiting Phoenix and thought this might be a worthy try. Opened the front door and BAM a large party was seated exactly in front of the door. Awkward! I waited at the 'wait to be seated sign', right in front of the party of 15...took the host a bit longer than I like to wait... With all of the diners kinda staring at you. Iist not like they didn't have space in the restaurant. It's really a good size. But for some reason they thought it was smart to put a large party right in front of the entrance door. I ordered to go and it's taking a while for me to  get my meal. So much for to go. Not a great part of town, just a bit of blight. Safe, tho', just the environment of this part of town leaves a lot to be desired.

This is by far the best Mexican I have had in a long time! They have a great salsa bar with tons of variety (I like the Mexican salsa) and a great guac that has chunks of jicama, tomato and mango. So delicious. The tamarin margarita also was tasty!

We visited here on a Saturday afternoon and we immediately knew this was a place that we would be returning to regularly. The food was wonderful and the salsa bar was just plain fun. The wait staff was extremely helpful in understanding their menu and her recommendations were spot on.  We're looking forward to working our way through their entire menu, one visit at a time!

This is a unique place. Your first impression is "sketchy".  Type of place you would only go in with a recommendation or if you were local. I'm glad we got a recommendation because this was a good eat. I had the burrito norteno with green chilli; very good. Shark and shrimp tacos for the rest of the table and it all looked good with good comments. 

This is a small place with only ten tables and a small bar. The service is quick despite obvious take out orders and a full dining room. Salsa is homemade and presented in Tupperware on an ice bar, with a ton of different choices. 

Ambiance is interesting, true to its name. 


Tip o the hat - coke served in glass bottles 

Wage of the finger - find a better presentation for your awesome salsas.

Have I really not reviewed this place?! I've been coming here for years & just love it. Their salsa bar is bomb.com...you must try the pecan one! It's sweet, unexpected, and has a good kick. Quesas are wonderful. Try a taco protein style. You can thank me later...

I came to Phoenix for a business trip and didn't want to eat near the arena so I looked up any nearby triple d restaurants. I randomly chose one to yelp and from the reviews and pictures, we chose this one. The whole ride there I was salivating over the pictures of the deep fried quesas. I knew I wanted to try that and the fish tacos. It did not disappoint. Soo good!! And on top of that they have a salsa bar with like 10 different salsas you can try! Super friendly staff. One of the waiters gave me a bag of chips no charge to take to go with all the yummy salsas! I would definitely be coming back here when I visit Phoenix in the future!

This has to be one of the best places my wife and I have ate at. I definitely recommend people to check it out . The agua frescas were so taste and the salsa bar had so many options. Definitely check it out if you are a local or just visiting the city.

The food is wonderful the margaritas are top notch service was good. My only problem with this place is that it's too small for the amount of people that come in here. I seen a signed picture of Chef Guy that was signed for diners,drive inn ,and dives; from 2 years sago. I wonder with all the business that they have seen why not expand? But anywhoo, everything was great I just don't like feeling rushed due to others coming in, starring waiting for a table.

What a cute place! Its small but cozy and I have yet to be disappointed with their menu. The only thing I don't like is the tiny cups and location of the salsa bar. Make sure you come in at an abnormal time if you don't want to sit compact. I recommend the tacos and the enchiladas topped with Mole sauce

Great little restaurant with very tasty food. A good variety of Mexican favorites with a gourmet treat. Servings are large, plates could be shared.  Not a huge venue and gets filled up quickly. Great salsa bar to try different salsas

I absolutely cannot describe the amazingness that is La Condesa Gourmet Taco Shop. Gourmet it is. From the top to the bottom. Service, Style, Food, the whole 9. Do not be fouled by the neighborhood... this place SHINES like a diamond in the rough. 

I am SOOO bummed that we were only in Phoenix for the night, cause I would have set up shop here every night. THE SALSA BAR!!! AHHH! We tried EVERY ONE. AMAZING. 

Our amazing bartender/server was David. He killed it. He even made me a Skinny Margarita. They make their own juices there for the Margs...mmmmm. Yep. 

They are authentic. The fish is fresh. They put up with me wanting no oil and after ordering 1 taco... he put up with me ordering 2 more, after the place should have been closed. This was all done with a smile and kindness that is unfortunately rare these days. 

Even just thinking about that taco... Grilled Mahi w/ a ton of veggies, spinach, onions,  wrapped in a homemade tortilla, guac, TONS of dipping sauces... literally melted in my mouth.

If you are EVER in the Phoenix area--- YOU MUST STOP BY. If I am even an hour with-in it's radius I will be running back.

Not. To. Be. Missed.

They have so many different salsas to pick from...(Mango, Strawberry etc etc) 
We tried almost all of them with the homemade chips as we waited for our food. 

I ordered the chicken Quesadilla, but this one came with a deep fried corn tortilla covering all of the goodness in the middle. It was great because it was gluten free friendly. It was a big meal and well worth very bite.
Service is a bit slow at peak times but food is great! The mole chicken quesadilla is where it's at. My advice is to order ahead of time then show up like 15 minutes after they say it will be ready.

The Yelp rating is what made me drive out of my way to pickup a late lunch. If I were just driving by this shop I would have never stopped. 
I ordered a three taco plate with three different tacos. I do not remember the names, but they were ALL excellent! I ordered a Quesadilla. It is different from the Americanized version but I did not care for it. Love all the salsas!

The portions were huge at a great price.  You have all types of sauces to chose from but the taco entrees were flavorful enough that you didn't need to sauce it up.  

A great casual joint to fill yourself up.

I love the artwork.  Its a tiny little restaurant crammed with a bunch of little tables and chairs.  You go up to order at the counter, there's a salsa bar in the corner with a LOT of different salsas (most are not that great).  They do bring you the food and you do get a basket of chips on the house.  The tacos are pretty heft - about 3 bucks each.  They are "Gourmet tacos" after all..  

All in all, its kind of uncomfortable service/restaurant wise (self serve) but the tacos are very good and you do get chips and a variety of salsas.  Not the most friendly staff and the cost is kind of high for a place like this but its pretty dang good.  Get it to go if you don't mind packing a bunch of salsa cups.

Disgusting! Dirty. Lame service. 
After waiting 20 minutes, seeing plenty of empty tables and still not seated,  we watched one of the workers throw down two big bags of ice (to bust the cubes loose) onto the floor. Then the bags were opened, lifted, laid on the bin, and raised up until empty, shaking all the ice into the open bin. 

here's the problem - -
The bag protects the ice, but as soon as it is thrown on the floor, the outside of the bag gets contaminated.  The floor they were thrown on was already soaking wet, in a very dark area behind the bar.

After I witnessed this huge mistake, it made me think we should just leave. So we did but I told them why. The person in charge pretty much brushed me off, and the bag-dropping guy mentioned how it's "just the bag"... that got dirty...

I didn't feel any change would really take place after pointing out what we just saw, and how the guy so casually brushed off my concern. Wow!

We've been here five times before, and I'm wondering what kind of sanitation problems they have in the kitchen, where nobody can see, if they so openly soil the ice in my drink. 

Disgraceful.  I trusted them, but now I don't.

I was really excited to try this spot as I drive by it almost every day. My boyfriend and I decided to check it out on a week night. The place was very busy so there was a thirty minute wait. Once we were seated to took more than 15 min to have our drink order taken. We ordered our food and proceeded to wait another half hour. The tacos were "specialty", but I didn't enjoy any of them . The chicken mile was not good at all. There was a thin layer of beans which was almost comical. The pricing was ridiculous to top it off. I will NEVER go back there again and strongly discourage my friends from even trying it.

Found this place while traveling in Phoenix on Yelp.  We were in the mood for good Mexican food and this is the place to go.  It also was a featured place on DDD and so I was happy to visit a place that Guy had visited and recommended.  Loved the Art Work on the walls there.

Driving down the rough streets of north phoenix, I have never really taken the time to look at the many restaurants that adorn the streets. I thought north phoenix was really only pawn shops, tire shops, and smoke shops, but my gf had heard of this place so we made a special journey out to La Condesa. After checking to make sure our doors were locked 4 times, we entered this "gourmet" taco shop...and boom all my misconceptions were erased.

This place is extremely clean and friendly. The tacos I ordered were overflowing with flavor and ingredients. I was thoroughly filled after two tacos.  I had the Shrimp tacos - not the cabo ones, i think they were simply grilled and guess what? that's right, no diarrhea afterwards. Also had the the sonoran carne asada tacos....which were arrachera steak marinated with fresh garlic & olive oil, charbroiled with mesquite charcoal. The tacos were amazing and the salsa bar was mind blowing. The yhave about 12 salsas to try from and I had to try them all. My personal favorites were the cilantro, chipotle and the surprisingly  yummy peanut salsa.

I REALLY wanted the horchata, but they had just run out..i won't ding them for running out because we did come in 5 minutes before closing. Can't wait to go back here, you gotta give this place a try.
Love the salsa bar with so many different varieties from sweet and fruity to hot and juicy

What more can you ask for from a legit Mexican restaurant? La Santisima has the tacos and salsa bar that make up Mexican food euphoria, and even offers serious vegetarian options. 

My friend and I had dinner here. Driving from El Paso to Los Angeles, we had become sick of Chex Mix and energy drinks. I didn't realize La Santisima had been featured on Food Network's Triple D, but the Guy Fieri memorabilia gave it away immediately. In a fantastically awkward moment made possible by fourth generation cellular technology, we watched the restaurant's Food Network VODs right as the server came to take our order. The server let us finish watching.

There were more tacos available at the restaurant than its online menu currently displays. The veggie tacos I ordered were a classic guac, black bean, pico, and lettuce combination. They also offer a grilled zucchini type side for those that are looking to avoid eating rice. The food was fantastic. The freshness was palpable and the flavors were balanced. With so many salsas to choose from, I felt like a child in a candy store. Did I mix salsas? You bet I did. Maybe people should start saying, "I felt like Chris at a salsa bar."

The restaurant had an odd atmosphere. Maybe it was the mermaid skeleton with dollar bills clipped to it. La Santisima wasn't quick - despite being an odd hour in the afternoon, our food took quite some time. They also charged for every basket of chips past basket numero uno. I'm sure the United Federation of Restaurants that Proudly Serve Chips and Salsa was furious at the first member restaurant to offer unlimited chips - that restaurant set a ridiculous expectation!

La Santisima was pretty tasty, and I would return for the salsas and tacos. I'm excited to see if Los Angeles has similar options.

Great food great art fair service ...
The service could be better
The short little guy up front has a terrible attitude.
Food is great the staff needs to Up There GAME !!!
Amazing! I go here weekly. Love tue cilantro salsa and the steak tacos my fav! The paintings are a great addition to the local culture.

This restaurant was recommended and I'm glad we checked it out! Variations on traditional faves and new offerings I've never heard of. So many choices we'll be back for sure. The tacos were melt in your mouth, I could have had a dozen. Salsa bar has unique flavors and everything was delicious. Could have been 5 stars but service was great, but painfully slow.

My husband and I drove out to Glendale to wander the shops and discovered that many of them are closed on Sunday. Oh well, we were hungry so made that our priority! We got out our phones and decided to check Yelp reviews for a good Mexican restaurant. La Santisima Gourmet Tacos popped up:)

We were welcomed immediately when we entered and received outstanding service. The restaurant has a cool vibe with colorfully striped chairs and large, vibrant paintings of Frida, Diego, images of Dia de Los Muertos and other iconic images. 

A lot of Mexican restaurants have salsa bars, but not with this many freshly made salsas and in such flavorful varieties. We had to stop ourselves from eating chips so we would have room for our lunch! I tried the combination plate of three street tacos with rice and beans. All were fantastic, but the spicy pork was my favorite! My husband had a quesadilla that he raved about. And he grew up in AZ, so he is picky about Mexican food! We'll definitely return...with friends:)

Best horchata EVER!  The salsa bar is great, they have a huge variety to try.  The shark dog fish tacos are great...a MUST try.  The place is somewhat small, but if you come at the right time there is no wait.

We had a party of 13 on a quiet Saturday noon. Sure they have the Salsa Bar but the food doesn't measure up to what I have been reading. We had everything from Burro's to Street Taco's to SPECIAL Taco's.  The overall opinion was just OK. Let me speak on my 3 Carne Asada street Taco's with beans and rice. Taco's were not even close to being hot. Not even warm. Meat quality and tenderness was poor. Beans were GREAT. What the hell is white rice doing in a Mexican restaurant? Had better at the same price. Had to ask for chips and more water. Poor teenage waitress was worked. I realize they add 18% automatically but then don't ask for another tip on the check. Service and food was not worth 18%. Would we go back NO. Too many Mexican restaurants in the valley to have poor food. Oh well you go you might enjoy it. It's your money .

Warning : this place WILL knock your socks off so either wear flip flops or proceed cautiously with your toes curled.   Really can't go wrong with any of their tacos. Probably my favorite is the LA Santissima specialty taco with the toasted cheese on top. The shrimp taco is also really good.   Their burritos are delicious. Salsa bar has huge selection and some very unique flavors. Beans and rice are also top quality. Prepare to leave absolutely stuffed because good luck holding yourself back from eating their generous portions. And after it's all said and done make sure you try their horchata (perfect end to a fantastic meal!)
Best Horchata EVER!  The Tacos and salsa were also some of the best I have ever had.  Try the mole taco.

Absolutely sensational food! For example, the best guacamole we've ever had. Raisins and mangoes in guacamole? Who would have thought of that! Marvelous! Everything we ordered was prepared from fresh, high quality ingredients, and was served almost as soon as our orders were place. The black mole tacos were wonderful; earthy, smokey and rich mole sauce balanced off by pickled red onions. Our server, Louis, was attentive and informative. We'll be taking friends to try the place soon. It's the closest thing to the Barrio Cafe you'll find on the West Side of town.

My profound love of Mexican cuisine and a bevy of shining Yelp reviews of this place led me here last Saturday night. My BF and I arrived just after 7pm, which was perfect because just after we ordered the place filled up- fast!

The salsa bar is fantastic! Some of my fave's were the peanut, chipotle, strawberry and a chunky dark one who's name escapes me..... But really they were all good.

The very best taco that we tried was the Cochinita Pibil (sp?) It was heavenly- packed with meat that had a kind of smokey, kind of mole/chocolaty taste- it was incredible. All the taco's we had were great though. To start with- the tortillas are so freaking good on their own, and they pack the meat inside of them. I'm getting hungry just thinking about them.

Lastly, my BF is a lifelong connoisseur  of quesadillas, so we ordered a steak one to split. Holy crap- it was a monster! They split it up for us but it looked like we ordered two of them! Humongous! It resembled a strudel pastry! Big, flaky and lightly drizzled with something white, sour cream maybe? I dunno, but it was to die for!  Even the next day when we reheated our leftovers this cheesy doughy meaty concoction was still fantastic! The chicken tinga burrito was almost BETTER the following day! (Maybe because it didnt have to compete with any tacos)! 

All in all we were very satisfied and will definitely be back. I would like to wait for a bit cooler weather though, because the place is quite warm inside. That is why I only gave it four stars.

I so wanted to love this place. I was in the area to get a haircut with fave barber but told he was on break. So I decided to venture out in the area for lunch. The beautiful entrance door caught my attention and decided to try it.

Since I broke my foot, I'm crutchin' along with the dang boot on my left foot. I must have arrived minutes before the lunch rush. I sat at a little table in a corner. Waitress took my order.  Because the tables are so close to one another and filled, I couldn't go to the Salsa bar to try a few sauces. 

I ordered the guacamole which was yummy -- love guaca guaca! When I ordered two chicken tacos, I expected two nice size tacos. Instead I felt as though I ordered two tacos off the menu section for kids.

Waitress never returned to refill my glass of tea. I may return and give this place a try when I'm no longer in need of crutches. Nothing grand here...now run along kids...

PS...They do not accept AMEX!

La Santisma has great and unique tacos (plus a bar full of different salsas you can try with your chips!) And the food is why you go to a restaurant--but so is the atmosphere. Unfortunately, that's lacking here. The place is small and not in the best part of town. We had to wait outside for a long time and saw some questionable characters. Go for the tacos, not the atmosphere, and not during prime time so you don't have to wait.
This place is amazing!!!!!! In my opinion, the best thing on the menu is the chorizo and potato taco!!! Can't wait to come back this place! Service was great as well!
Delicious Food, great service, and amazing Salsa Bar.   Only complaint is this place is always crowded.  It's hard to get in and out on your lunch break.

Service is taking too long lately. I don't like waiting for 15mins just to place a Togo order, mostly because no one pays anY attention to the customers at the register or waiting to be seated. Also the bean burrito was good but not worth $9.00. Tacos use to be packed and for a great price. Now they are chincy even with the calabacitas. I paid $7.00 for a Mexican squash sliced and grilled. I could have paid 65 cents for the squash and pan grilled like they did. Very sad. I wish they made tacos like they use to before they went on triple d (food network). They still have good salsa (strawberry is delish) but they have lost the taco. I don't wanna pay $4.00 for a chincy taco that has no filling. Btw give more beans and rice, it doesn't cost much to make either so give at least 2 tablespoons instead of one. I'm very serious about the serving size.

Got to come here for the salsa bar.  Awesome.  Good prices for food items too.  The service is also excellent.  The server even game my daughter a complimentary horchata.  If La Santisima was within an hour from my home I would go there every week.

The food was very good.  I don't like the paper they use on the wicker baskets they use for plates, because the food is soo juicy it soaks through the paper and attaches to my food.  Also, because the baskets have paper covers on top there is no way to use as vessels for their amazing salsa bar, so you have to use the tiniest little plastic cups to try out the salsas and make about 10 trips to get enough of every kind you'd like.  I would have given this place 5 stars but I do not like paper bits on my food.

Excellent food. Kinda steep on the pricing, but the size of the tacos is by far one of the largest portions you can get. This place is great if you want to eat some good ole unadulterated tacos. The salsa bar is outstanding as well, a lot of different styles and heat levels.
Place is a bit overrated.   Good salsa bar but tortillas for the tacos were pretty average and the meat on the arrachera tacos not particularly tender.  The fish tacos were very good.

A unique taco place set in downtown Phoenix. The menu is diverse and they use fresh ingredients. I can't stress enough how much our city has needed a special place like this. It features something for everyone!!! The salsa bar alone will have your taste buds wanting more!!! 
The veggie quesadilla is to die for!!!! The fried touch they give to it adds something you can't get anyplace else. Oh and before you leave you have to try their Horchata!!! If you like Horchata then you haven't tasted anything like this one!!!! It could win awards, seriously!! I was a little nervous when I heard they add fruit and nuts to it, but then I tried it....it was gone in minutes!!!! 
Anything you order here is going to be fabulous and fresh. You don't leave feeling heavy like when you eat Mexican food sometimes. I can't rave enough about this place!!! Try and enjoy!!!

After Dos Molinas (food is spicier) this is my second favorite Mexican Food place. Lots of variety.  I have only had real mole at two places, unfortunately, their version did not grab my taste buds (probably why there is your favorite potato salad (in my case my mom's) and everything pales in comparison). I avoid lines, by eating early say around 3pm.

Love this cute little place, love the food, servers are nice and helpful, and OMG, the salsa bar just makes me so happy, how many kinds of salsa do they leave out for everyone to taste?  10? 20?  I don't know, but I get excited thinking about it.

Now I'm just never going to suffer ambiance without the tastiest of food, because I do go to restaurants for the food, primarily.  I like one-of-a-kind, personal restaurants, because you know you are in the kitchen of someone who fed people they loved first, and then spread it out.  But I've taken a date there because its a fun slightly chaotic festive-feeling place while still feeling like its neighborhood,  it's not particularly quiet, but not at all too loud to hear, tables kind of close together, which kind of forces everyone to smile at and speak to strangers more than your average dining experience.  We love to bring a crowd from out of town, as it feels really homey, and is colorful, tasty, friendly, can be hard to get a table because its small and they do get busy, but just wait.  Worth the wait. Their Al Pastor makes my mouth really happy.

This place is located on the old strip drag of Glendale, AZ. The food is very good and uniquely paired together tacos! I had the Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Tacos Yum!! My daughter ordered Cabo Shrimp Tacos (We had to share!;)) loved them both! And I loved the the decor and I enjoyed the ambience. We have been a few times our dentist is located down the street, we went once with my fiancé another wth my daughter and youngest son, and both times was fantastico! Keep up the great food! Happy eating! I gave four because it took our server a longer than normal wait to come take our drink order and food order.

First off thank you fellow Yelpers for leading me here!! 

So far I've been here twice and I will definitely be back...again...and again...and again! ((And again)) Both visits were for lunch, round one was a to go order of Al Pastor street tacos ** we will start here. 

I walked in (the fancy shmancy wooden doors next to the Tienda) and it was jam packed. And this was around 2:30 on a weekday and it really is a little restaurant AND the character and ambiance are unique. So inviting. Anyway, I first attempted to order the Asada tacos...then mole however they were sold out .... Hence the al pastor. The flavors were amazing. They weren't (in my opinion) traditional, however they were delicious and I WILL order them again in the future. 

My second visit was a sit down lunch around 1:00 on a Wednesday with the hubs. We were able to sit, eat, and relax before my one hour lunch was finished. So they are very quick!! The place got packed closer to 2:00 by people of all ages which is a really good sign. Anyway, I ordered the black mole tacos and the hubs got a trio street taco plate. *{Holy Moly}* Yelpers!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 

Everything this restaurant serves could be considered magical bursts of flavors that rock your Mind!!! 

Just come here and eat. The food is to die for. The salsa bar is something to be rivaled and their margaritas look heavenly (I need to go when I'm off the clock!!)

//cheers//
This is by far the best place in phoenix for Mexican food. they have yummy chocolate tacos too! Their variety of sauces was unlimited. The ambiance was perfect for Halloween :)

Wanted to try this place so bad. Ordered $45 worth of food for 2 people. Problem was that we never received our drinks or chips. We told the waitress after 15 minutes and just watched 5 tables after us get their drinks, chips and food. Waitress finally came around and gave us chips and then told us it will be a few more minutes for our 2 cokes. We then told her that we just want to get our money back. Then instead of her giving us our money back, dhe made us stand in the long line again and didnt even apologize. WOW... unbelievable. We ended up total spending about 40 minutes there and didnt even eat anything. I understand that the food is great but not gonna spend a dime if they dont provide good service....

Food is good but service is HORRIBLE!! Slowest greeters and servers ever! One hour wait from seated to food on table. Good thing they were not busy because it would most likely have been 2 hours! Asked for an Horchata 20 minutes and still nothing. Had to get up and go ask for it. I won't be back such a turn off to have bad service. If no stars possible I would have selected that.

I came here to eat with my co-workers at lunch time and it was packed!!!!! This was obviously a great sign, but know it's packed during the lunch hour. 

The place is small but seats quite a few people. You may also sit by the bar to eat (which is what we did since we didn't want to have to wait forever to eat). 

I had 3 carne asada tacos with rice and beans. The meat was well seasoned and they double up on tortillas so they def won't fall apart. 

The highlight for me was the salsa bar. Omg it was yummy! They have your traditional salsas, like salsa verde, salsa bandera etc, but also have very inventive yet delicious spins on the ordinary, like their salsa siete chiles (7 types of roasted chiles with red onion and it was super chunky) or another salsa made with a base of chopped radish.  

It was great that they also gave us a basket of super crispy chips to enjoy with all the salsas. 

The ONLY thing that I did not like was that I saw drinks poured at the bar and the bar tender grabbed the fruit out of the open bin with his bare hands. I had a bottled drink, but would have not asked for a drink if the bar were the only option. Just to be clear, the kitchen staff had gloves and you could see into the kitchen, which was organized and clean.

I used to love this place. My husband, daughter and I used to come here once a week. Then they added the extra vegetarian options. Yay! Because I'm a vegetarian.

Definetly TRY this place at least once. It is good. And if you are vegetarian or vegan you will loooooove it. I promise. It just isnt one of those "eat once a week" kind of restaurants anymore.

I'm not going to give it 5 stars now, even though 6 months to a year ago I would've given it 5 stars (is 10 possible?) For some reason the prices went up and the quality of the food feels like it has been steadily declining. Everytime we go its just not what it used to be. Maybe there's new management? A new cook? I'm not sure. But if you had asked me 6 months ago about the place I would not have hesitated to recommend it. 

Its definetly authentic though I'll give them that. I love this restaurant and really hope that the quality starts going back up because I miss eating there. It was the only restaurant my family and I would go to. And with the new vegetarian options. My goodness, I would eat here every day!
I had lunch at La Santisima today. Food was great, their horchata is awesome, and I loved the salsa bar. They were packed so the service was slow but totally worth the wait!

Somewhat of a rip-off! Another one of those Mexican places for White people that do not know better. I can honestly say I have never had a spicy flavorless burrito, now I can. First we were given a can of soda and charged $3 for it. 2017 let's get a fountain system you cheap bastards. We tried the tacos and I was really excited after reading the other reviews and wah wah, flat and not filling. After we left we went to another taco place because we were craving good tacos. I love to spend money on good food and this was not it. The quality of the food does not match the high prices. If you are a foodie you are better off at a taco truck, any taco truck.

Wife and I came during vacation and arrived about 10 minutes after opening. There were already 3 parties there at 11am. Promising.

Orders were taken at the cashier, then sat down with a number. The menu was a little confusing with all these caveats and pricing schemes, but at the end of the day, we got some tacos and we liked them.

*** FOOD ***
They allow you to create "meals", so we got two - one with 2 gourmet tacos and another 3 street tacos. 

Cochinita Pibil Street Taco (5/5)
Mouthwatering and delicious. Pork was super juicy and well worth it. You'll see this in many other reviews and there's a reason for that. 

Al Pastor Street Taco (2/5)
I have a habit of always trying my favorite meat everywhere even if the reviews suggest otherwise. Wasn't really a fan, flavor was a bit lacking. 

Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Gourmet Taco (4/5)

Cabo Shrimp Gourmet Taco (4/5)


*** DRINK ***
I have two categories of Mexican places. Places that serve horchatas and places that don't. (The latter contends with Taco Bell.) However, living on the east coast most of my life, I haven't seen anything other than a normal horchata... I had a pleasant surprise here.

Fruit & Pecan Horchata (5/5) 
Topped with strawberries, pecans, and a healthy dose of cinnamon, this had enough body (i.e., not watered down) to take on the sweetness delivered by the fruit and still taste like an horchata. It was novel and delicious. Highly recommended.

*** BOTTOM LINE ***
Check it out. It's worth it. Get an horchata. And one to go.

I first saw Guy Fieri's visit on TV. I have Family in Phoenix so I said I had to try it out on my next visit. I was just there with my Family this past weekend. I was blown away by the decor and delicious food. It was everything that Guy Fieri said on his show and more!! I can't wait to go back to Phoenix so I can eat there again!!

i drove from avondale expecting something worthy of such a long drive. salsa bar was very good. the chips were nothing above normal as was the food. the worst part of it all is while i was midway thru a taco a bug scattered across my plate. when i went to go pay i mentioned this to the waitress which only shrugged and took my bill. didnt apologize or even seem remotely interested in my complaint. i wasnt expecting a free meal by any means but a sign of concern was expected.

Oh Food Network, how you have let me down. Honestly, I should have known better because Guy Fieri seems to always think everything that goes into his mouth in his show Diners Drive-Ins and Dives is "dynamite." Seriously, I mean, has he ever said anything negative? I've been to many restaurants he had endorsed on his show and have generally been disappointed... La Santisima would be on that list as well. I can't just blame Guy though, because Yelp also has raving reviews for it. Perculiar...

I came here an hour before closing time on a Wednesday. No wait. We were given a complimentary basket of freshly fried tortilla chips. I was impressed when I was told by the waitress of their selection of 18 sauces at the sauce station. Who doesn't love sauce?! Unfortunately I tried nearly half of them and none of them really stood out. For my meal, I decided to order the tacos since that is what they are known for. I got three a la carte gourmet tacos which were $3.99 a piece: pacific white fish taco, aztec tinga taco, and el gaucho taco. They all tasted just okay which was a disappointment because from all the reviews I was expecting some sort of out-of-body experience when, in fact, I've had way better tacos just about everywhere else. I had a taste of my husband's chicken quesadilla (I think the La Santisima Specialities Quesa) which I thought was actually better than the tacos. Still not awesome, but better. The crust was thick which is unlike any quesadillas I've had before. The quesadilla comes in a rather large portion and is very hearty. 

Overall, this place is definitely overhyped. I rather have Taco Bell.

You want me to review La Santisima? 

What're you, stoop'id? 

 They're beyond review; they're beyond contestation. 

Any reviews in attempt to describe La Santisima, or otherwise are as follows: Effutiation. 

It means "Useless words", before you ask.

They've been hit on by the platinum porcupine himself, Guy Fieri, or whatever his name is. He, like Pamela Anderson, is only famous for His Triple D's.

Ive eaten at both locations, hell I've eaten here before they were "La Santisima" and were named something else. Didn't know that shit, did you? 

Yeah, huh, Little trivia for ya. 

Ive opened both locations  & and I've closed both locations. I've had every Salsa the bar can offer and I've had 16 menu items -- multiple times -- and fuck what I'm saying and just fucking go here! 

. . . 

Why are you still reading? 

Go! 

Ok, still don't get it? 

So i'm giving you another word ( It's real before you ask ). 

I'll just call La Santisima eellogofusciouhipoppokunurious. 

( You can look it up. I'll wait. )

Luckily we learned about the small taco shop on Groupon. We drove past the Glendale location and we thought it was closed. Had to call to double check the hours. Once we walked in, we were greeted by the manager or owner, very welcoming. He offered us some chips and guacamole. Came to find out there was no refill on chips and we had to pay for the guacamole...  I would have liked to enjoyed some chips throughout my meal, not just the first 10 minutes. Me and my boyfriend don't drink soda, so he offered a drink we took water. He brought us the water, but in a PLASTIC CLEAR CUP. Like the ones Circle K gives you. However the tacos we ordered were AMAZING. I had the Carne Asada street tacos. They were delicious. We ate and talked. about 20 minutes later, still no waiter for a refill. I had to get up and walk to the bar for more water. Finally the check comes... we paid in cash and we had decided what the tip was going to be. The change came and the waiter/manager/owner took some of the change as his tip... 

So if you can get past the bad service, getting offered something that should be free, small plastic water cups, then you'll have a great meal. We're going to go again, but to the other location.

Great  salsa bar
Gaucho taco and burrito are the best
And the Mahi Mahi 
Horchata is also pretty good
Definitly coming back

We tried this spot last night for dinner. First impressions were not good. The lighting is horrible. The restaurant layout is over crowded and the lack of ambience is just sad. Now with all of that said, the food was delicious! The salsa bar was a lot of fun. We enjoyed trying several types of salsa while we waited for our food. Unfortunately, the waiter did not put our two courses in properly, so after waiting an hour, everything came at once. This was only after we asked about it. The waitress apologized and did comp our beverages. We are our entrees and wrapped up the first course to eat the next day. We will try it again and hopefully they won't be as busy or their kitchen will have their act together.
I love it here. It is the place that I take out of town visitors. I love the salsa bar. It is small and often you have to wait but I think that the food makes up for those things.

The food is amazing, the salsa bar is awesome!  The seating situation however is a bit cramped.  The staff are friendly, and the food is definitely worth going for, but maybe consider getting it to go, or go on off hours.  The lunch rush is hard!

Really great salsa bar, tacos, quesadillas and burros.  This is 'authentic' mexican; not Macayos.  
A few downsides though, it is really small & not really built for families or large groups; plus, I wouldn't park in the neighboring streets.  I got yelled at by one homeowner saying if they saw my vehicle again they're having it TOWED!.

My husband and I met up with some friends here for lunch on a Saturday. There is limited parking at the restaurant, so we had to park in the neighborhood next to the restaurant.
We went to La Santisima in Flagstaff last month, and had a great experience. There are still lots of great options here, but the service isn't as friendly, and the food in Flagstaff seemed to taste better. Not sure if the food here was not as great due to the long wait and several customers present today. 
Again, this place isn't bad, but I'm sure there are better options for Mexican food in the area if you look a bit more.

We came by for a late lunch, around 3-is and were served immediately-there were maybe 3 or 4 other tables seated. 

We ordered a horchata to drink, and it was one of the best I've ever had-with fruit and nuts added in. 

They have a salsa bar with a multitude of labeled salsas you can try, our favorites were the peanut salsa (creamy with a hint of spice), the tomatillo and the chipotle. 

We got three tacos and a enchilada style pork burrito. The pork was so tender it was falling apart

Beau and I enjoyed a burrito and fried tortilla with chicken mole this past weekend. Ate late and avoided the dinner rush - there will be one for many a nite! Loved, loved the tasty salsa bar and down home service. Thank you La Condesa.

This was my first time trying this local eatery. The food was great!! I had grilled chicken tacos with rice and beans. The horchata was exceptionally good, a must have if you visit this establishment. 

They also had a salsa bar with several different salsas to choose from. They were not spicy at all, but that is never a bad thing in my case. 

The service was friendly and prices were fair. The only downside is that it is very small and not enough tables for everyone. I would recommend coming here with your significant other and that's about it. Leave the family and kids at home or just take it to go. You might end up waiting a while for a table to clear. 

I would definitely be coming back to try different menu items.
Really Good Food! Had the shark taco, it was interesting. This is probably one of the best taco joints I've been to in phoenix.
Chicken Mole taco and Salsa Bar to D-I-E for...just sayin! sick happy!
Always perfect!!! Everything is fresh and there's lots of salsas to choose from. Pastor and the quesadillas are my favorites but everything is good!

It took forever to be seated, food took forever to come out by the time we received our food  was cold. 2 people in our group left due to the poor service and the fact that there apparent fish tacos weren't even cooked. The waitress clearly knew that the food was cold and still brought It out, when we asked her about it she admitted guilt to knowing it was cold. Overall terrible service, probably won't be coming to this location again off of 16th ave and mcdowell.

We came here twice on our visit to Arizona- the tacos are that good! Huge selection of very tasty tacos, awesome service at a more than fair price. They also have a huge salsa bar with a flavor for everybody. This place was great!!

Delicious food, I love the salsa bar. I haven't counted exactly how many salsas they offer, but certainly at least a couple dozen of them. And they're all great. Their margaritas are huge and definitely do the job, and the food very flavorful, though it does take some time to come out. The dining room is small and this place is popular, so do be prepared to wait. I've seen the line wrap clear around the building. Parking can also be a challenge.

La Condesa is an amazing little spot that has more than food, but charm as well. I really enjoyed the way that the restaurant was decorated; it definitely creates its own vibe, and it's not painted with a lot of loud colors (there are a ton of pictures of the decor if you look at the pictures). It's very classy to say the least.

The salsa bar is the first thing that I have to mention. It was overflowing with variety and flavor. Every time that I thought I'd found one that I liked, I tried another and pushed the previous aside. My girlfriend and I managed to polish of two baskets of chips without a problem or remorse because we had to try every salsa. The tamatillo and cilantro were two of my favorites in the mix. 

We also ordered the Mayan Conchinita Pibil tacos and the Aztec Tinga tacos. I'm usually hesitant about chicken on tacos because I usually always have bad experiences, but not here! The tinga taco was great. The meat was tender and well marinated - I could taste the sauce in every bite. The conchinita though is what really won me over. The pork was so good! Imagine the tenderness and juiciness or your favorite BBQ pork sandwich, but replace the flavor with a bevy of delicious Mexican spices and we'll pretty much be on the same level.

I'm pretty baffled that I didn't see a lot of my Yelp friends raving about this place. As a result, I will send this review out to you all (go try it =) ). This is a great little place that isn't pricey yet brings great flavor. The next time I got there I will be getting a quesa, no question, and hopefully I will be going back very soon.

We stopped by for a quick bite to eat. i was told to come try the tacos.  its a really cute but very small place.  Clean and organized.  Very good salsa bar.  The seven chili and mexicana salsa were my favorite.  We ordered queso fundido...i liked it. One of my favorite dishes to try at new places. It did not dissappoint.  Only bad thing was...they could have given a few extra pieces of tortilla with the queso.  We tried the guacho and white fish tacos.  The guacho was excellent.  The white fish wasnt anything special.  Needs some extra seasoning or maybe a spicier sauce instead of the cabbage and white sauce.  I would come back and new stuff because i was pleased with my first try here.

Been here a few times now and this place is amazing.  Like many, I am in love with their salsa bar which has at least a dozen different options for dunking your chips in.  While I wish they would provide bigger containers to fill your salsa in, it is meant to be a sampler and not a meal.  The choices are great to have and everyone will find something they like.  What keeps me coming back are the amazing tacos.  I order the shrimp and the mahi fish street tacos each time and they are some of the best in town.  Really great flavor and healthy portions.  Can't wait to eat again!!

A few particulars - this is a very small little place on 16th with mostly street side or residential parking, no actual lot.  During peak times, good luck finding a seat and the line at the register where you must order will leave you waiting a bit.  It's worth it for the taste, but just be prepared.

Love the Santisima Salad with chicken.  I'm not usually a salad person, but this is fully-loaded and quite a large portion.  I love using the spicy green avocado salsa instead of the salad dressing.  Also, love the unique flavors and wide selection at the salsa bar.
Good tacos not the best I've ever had. Then again I'm spoiled living in California. Margarita was also too sweet for me. Good way to kill two hours during a layover at phx.
mmmmmm.......the quesadillas are A M A Z I N G!!!!! who doesnt want it deep fried?! lol, also their salsa bar is delicious....try the pecan salsa!

My boyfriend and I were craving Mexican and wanted to try a new place so we decided to come here! Since all of the Yelp reviews talked about how amazing this place was we thought it would be great. But it was far from that. The service was fine, the food however, was not. I was charged $13.50 for a bean and cheese burrito al la carte, which wasn't on the menu, but it was more expensive then the majority of the burritos on the menu which included meat, quac, rice, salsa, etc. On top of that, my entire burrito was filled with just cheese. I literally had to unfold my burrito to find it was a tortilla wrapped around shredded cheese. No bean inside. Extremely disappointing especially when our order was so simple and the food was so over priced. Would not recommend to friends and would never consider coming back here.
Amazing!!!! My favorite taco place, period. Oh my god. So many salsas! Herbs in their tacos!! Veggies in their tacos. Super super good. Everything is crazy good here, I super recommend it!!!!

This place is well worth the drive for some amazing tacos! 

I love the fish tacos and my husband is a huge fan of the El Gaucho taco. 

This place is a great little shop in downtown Glendale. 

If you are feeling adventurous try the Chile En Nogada Taco... it will blow your mind!

Being from Los Angeles I pride myself on having discovered some great taco shops and trucks. La Santisima was a Yelp driven decision right before driving back to CA.  The food was absolutely amazing..........an explosion of flavor that is second to none. You can taste the attention given to the preparation and the quality of all the ingredients. I'm going to always make time whenever I'm in Phoenix to stop in.........however the food is so special that I may actually drive back every so often for a fix.

Talk about a salsa selection! Don't even get me started about their Horchata! 
I take my friends from out of town to this place. Try it. You will not be disappointed!!

My best friend first suggested we go here for the strawberry salsa, which is amazing.

I love tacos, but as a vegetarian, I hardly ever get to eat them. They have a few different types of vegetarian tacos here.

$5 extra to put green enchilada sauce over a burrito. The waitress didn't mention that so I was surprised to see it on my bill.
The margaritas were good.

So Sunday rolls around, and I'm hungover and day dreaming of someone to drop off a wheel chair for me to get around my house in the most lazy way possible. Then I see La Santisima on TV and I freaked out, and realized they're open on Sundays.

I managed to shower and get dressed in record time to make it there by noon. They tell me it's a 40 minute wait, and my stomach plays a symphony of sounds only okay in a hospital to be heard, I say "that's perfectly fine" and then go drunk sweat outside in the sun. 40 minutes went by and I prayed the tacos would be amazing and worth the wait.

We got seated inside and helped ourself to every single salsa at the salsa bar. There were a few that lit my threat on fire, but,  whatever, alls fair in love and salsa with this gringo.

I got the three taco plate with the mariachi loco, Cabo shrimp, and chicken tinga as well as a half order of the guacamole. I LOVED the guacamole, the tinga, and the mariachi... I felt the Cabo shrimp could've used something. But one thing that kind of was lacking was the service, not that I minded. I was content with my horchata to nurse my hangover. But our server forgot about our guacamole and I think the table next to us may have gotten the wrong order (the owner corrected it). I'll let it slide because they are crazy busy at all times.

Driving from Palm Desert to Albuquerque and wanted some awesome tacos. Came here after the great reviews on Yelp (Thanks, Yelpers!) and it was FANTASTIC.

My husband had the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco Plate. Tender and moist meat, he ate it with the Salsa Pecan from the Salsa Bar. The rice was OUTSTANDING. And the House Margarita was one of the best he ever had.

I had the El Gaucho Taco and a Carne Asada taco ala carte. Both ON POINT. And the horchata? ENORMOUS. The melon, berries and pecan at the bottom were such a treat at the end of a satisfying beverage.

I read some complaints about service. This place is small and every table was taken when we arrived. The two wait staff people were great. They were busy, the restaurant was full, and they were sharp. If you are in a hurry, don't come here. If you aren't and you are willing to stand at the bar with a drink and wait (which we did), it is ABSOLUTELY WORTH IT.
BEST chips and salsa in town!! I usually get the 2 taco place with rice and beans. DELICIOUS!!!

Oh man, I need to go here more often! So delicious and that salsa bar! Heaven. Go early because this cute little restaurant is tiny and there is not a lot of seating. Have the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco- You're welcome!

This place is amazing. The pastor tacos are out of this world. Like a fiesta in your mouth. I would recommend you trying them with the chipotle salsa  from the salad bar. I enjoyed every last bite I even wanted to lick the plate. The last time I had pastor tacos this good  I was in Mexico City.  This place is very small they have a little bar and it is dark. But when you have pastor tacos this good who needs light anyways;) the salsa bar was impressive I would recommend this place to anyone . I will be back with my mother, sisters, brother, aunt, uncle, Cousins neighbors friend :) AMAZZZINNNNGGG !!
Gross and expensive!! Don't waste your time, money, or tastebuds!!

Tiiiiiiny little place, but with very cool decor[ artists exhibiting their paintings], day of the dead theme.Not that it -matters-, because with the food that is served here, it could be all paper plates and plastic cups and I do not think anyone would -care-.
  We came here on a sunday evening, with a -very- hyperactive 5 year old in tow-as the restaurant itself is -very- small, even the smallest sounds he made felt like they would bring on an avalanche- or maybe I was just self conscious, as no one seemed to mind.
 The staff were very attentive and kind, the food arrived super quickly.
 And now onto the food-O M G
I had the Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken tacos- they were incredible.Rich, thick, delicious, amazingggggggly good. My son had Mayan Cochinita Pibil tacos[banana leaf roasted pork shoulder], and though usually I do not like pork, but from what I had of his, was delicious.
 Husband had Aztec Tinga[shredded chicken] bowl, with a fresh tortilla the size of a UFO saucer.
  There is a salsa bar with about 12-16 different, freshly made salsa;from pico de gallo to more exotic offerings such as strawberry salsa[the bomb], creamy cilantro salsa, creamy cashew .etc etc.All were super fresh and very tasty.

We will definitely be back-the mole sauce alone was worth the drive!

A dump of a place with amazing food!
We came here before a concert at Gila River. I ordered a sangria and the waitress brought out a bottle. I took this as a very bad omen! The waitress however made me a delicious huge sangria at the bar when I complained. I ordered mole and it was amazing and moist on wonderful corn tortillas. The rice and beans side was also delectable. My husband ordered green chile burro and he also said it was very good. Maybe one of the most impressive aspects about this place was the salsa bar selection! They must have had 15 types of salsa. Some I've never imagined. The entrees were both under $10 so it was a cheap night out as well.

Really good food, decent sized portions and good customer service. A tad bit high priced, $30 for two people and only one beer. However the hotchata was so amazing it made it all worth it....there are nuts and fruit in it, what?! I can eat my delicious horchata as I drink it? Yes please.

Awesome restaurant! We were stoked to find this after flying in from out of town. Plenty of options for the vegetarian/vegans and meat lovers. Incredible salsa bar. Allow yourself time to look over the menu, definitely not your "American Mexican".

I have updated my review after my last visit. They have expanded seating now so they are able to accommodate larger groups now! The service is still a bit slow but eating chips with the excellent salsa from the salsa bar helps pass the time.
This place is great.  I really like the food and the atmosphere.  It's a pretty straightforward place that's got a bit of flair tossed in.  So it's a good spot for the foodie and the not so foodie.

Went to La Condesa around 630PM on a weeknight and drove right by it a couple of times. No lights on outside at all. The parking was kind of scary as well.

On to the food. The Shark Taco was good until I ran into a huge piece that was so tough that I couldn't get my teeth to sink into it.
The carne asada tacos meat was a bit tough and cold.
The pork taco was pretty good and the meat was tender.

The salsa bar was the most interesting and yummy thing in the place. I loved the cilantro salsa the most.

If you go there you may want to pick a time when it's a little more busy. Not sure if my food was at its best since it was just before dinner? Not sure. I will give it another try though. Each taco was about 3.50 each. There are a lot better taco joints in the area though.

Well.  Hmm.  I suppose I should start by saying I have never had any issues with the food here.  It is always delicious and incredibly satisfying, and the salsa bar (especially the pecan salsa) is friggin' capital A Amazing.  I also really enjoy the atmosphere, and the servers themselves are great.

However, every time I visit I notice that the speed of service is slower.  Today was by far the longest wait, at almost an hour to order and get our food.  They've also recently expanded, so their dining area is roughly 3x the size it used to be (which definitely puts a dent on the already long wait time).

In the end, I'll keep coming back.  The food is worth it.  However, I really hope this isn't a precurser to negative changes for this restaurant.  It would be such a waste of a great thing.
Chicken mole taco on corn tortilla? YUM!! Top it off with one of their many homemade salsa options for a truly unique food experience! My favorites include the jicama salsa and the cilantro salsa!

Amazing!  Get the chicken mole tacos and don't forget to order a horchata!  Hayyy!   Delish and great service.  Oh, and load up on salsas because they are all really good.  Cute decor and amazing cuisine.   That is all for now................

Place was super cool. Great food. Sat in the patio... Could've used some umbrellas for shade. Would've liked to see some drafts but nonetheless, the bottled beer selection was great. The wait staff seemed a tad unprofessional. But I'm sure with time and good promotion this spot can be a hit. My husband and I will definitely be back for the great fish and shrimp tacos :)

It's Monday, people! What are you all doing here?

That's what I wanted to scream as I asked the gentleman at the bar how long the wait was.

There aren't that many tables stuffed into this small establishment, but apparently they really are that good that people are willing to waste time that they will never get back, to eat here.

So, I stepped outside and summarily informed my wife as to the long wait. I also reminded her that the other places she chose the past two days had prolonged delays for seating. I felt like I had lost precious moments in my life waiting to eat. On the upside, I was spending time with the only person that matters, so it was not even remotely a total loss in time. I was simply exaggerating.

So we waited outside, and tried to engage all the other customers. But, everyone was agitated for having to wait, and no one was wanting to engage in random conversation. In fact, the leaders of each party kept going back inside asking how much longer they would have to wait. I thought it was funny because we were all blocking the front entrance and we would've seen anyone that would've left. So, why bother asking how much longer? Duh!

I also thought how funny it was when a couple would leave, and the groups would go back inside and check in. Lemme do some basic math for you, okay? 2 people leave, and there are 10 of all you all! How many seats do you think will be available? :)

So, I go inside (not to ask how much longer), but I grabbed a menu (why waste time waiting in line and not be prepared), and I commandeer the only remaining flan in the house. I go back outside, and I tell my wife that I reserved the flan. She was a little perturbed because she didn't think I could do that! Well, everyone else is harassing the 2 servers (and one of them is pregnant), and I was just being polite and proactive. I kindly asked if I could have the last flan, and the gentleman set it aside for me.

So, about 50 minutes into the long wait, we finally get a seat. I must say, we really did experience how small this place was because as mobility was definitely impaired when you eat here. There is no chance that you won't bump into ANYONE! 

Let's get to the food part. The variety of Salsa that this place offers is amazing. Their unique flavors, and various combinations thereof are fantastic. You can mix and match them, and they just make you that much hungrier with every bite. 

We had the Sonora Carne Asada Burro and the Street Tacos. Additionally, we also had the Oaxacan Black Mole Chicken Quesa. 

The verdict? Definitely worth the wait. The meats and the sauces were just phenomenal. Each and every bite was wonderful.

Then for the finale, I had my flan. By that time, everyone in our original group was seated and were still in various stages of being served with either drinks or their food orders being taken.

When the pregnant server lady brought out our flan, EVERYONE looked at it with envy as it really was a delicious masterpiece. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed it. Then everyone wanted to order it, but alas, they all found out that I ordered the last one!!! (Evil eyes across the room)

More evil eyes came because I quickly learned how to multitask the server lady. While she was getting our flan, I went ahead and gave her my CC, asked for boxes for our leftovers, and also asked for refills.

So, while she was gone for quite some time preparing our flan, she left the only other server to take care of everyone else. When she returned, she had our box, our refills, our flan, and our check all done.

All we had to do was enjoy the flan, drink our refills, box up our leftovers, and sign the check / fill out her tip. 

And we walked out of there, while everyone was still wondering how to get served in here.
