A few things that may detract from future experiences that you may want to be aware of. There is minimal parking, so you have to park on the side street but don't block the homes. The wait is long, and the service is slow unless you learn how to stack your requests so they get stuff done in one trip.

Otherwise, what a wonderful dining experience, even for a Monday night!

(Gosh, how I missed it when Monday Night Football was going on. I never had to endure this during those times)

In Phoenix for 2 days so wanted some good Mexican food..this place is the best. Wanted to come again the next day but I would've missed my flight..get anything on the menu and it's good. Very clean, friendly waiters, a hole in the wall restaurant but definitely not bad..might need a bigger parking lot though as it's very cramped
Ordered Uber eats from these guys today and mannn their tacos are bomb!
Excellent food, and a wide variety of choices, among both the entrées and the salsas.  Good service.  Parking can be an issue, but the food is well worth that small hassle.

I used to really like this place, But I always seem to get bad service. Now that they expanded it seems worst. I came to dinner tonight and it took 15 minutes just to get water and chips. We finally were able to order and we both had the quesadilla with meat. We had to ask for napkins, silverware and more water. Our food was made wrong, didn't have what the menus said it did. There was tiny pieces of meat. Not sure I could even use the word tiny. There basically was no meat inside. It was over loaded with cheese. There was No flavor to it at all. We were never greeted on how everything was. So I never got a chance to change my order. I was just greeted with the check faster then the service in this place. I was extremely unhappy to pay for shitty service and bad food.

Totally worth the crappy parking situation here! My girlfriend and I came in on random weeknight for early dinner and the place was already full. Wow! Could be due to the limited seating or maybe because the food is terrific. Both? Likely. Chips arrived promptly straight from the oil pan - nice and toasty. And we helped ourselves to the salsa bar - which is completely fresh, creative, and whets your palette at the get-go! We loved the cilantro salsa and salsa mexicana the best. Zesty! The servers were quick to take our order despite being busy and minutes later my tacos de arrachera arrived. Sooo good! I mean. Wow! Meat was tender and juicy ....and the combination of spices and flavors was heaven. My friend ordered the Condesa specialty taco. Another winning ticket! Condesa has nailed the right way to make beans too. And..don't get me started on the deliciousness of the horchata. I've had me some horchata many places ..but this really rocked my world. Rocked it! 

Condesa, I have just two requests: Please do something about the sitting area so we can actually fit in this place. Also, please don't be out of flan next time I come in! Thanks!

You are better than this Santasima. We have been loving your food for over 3 years but your service the last several times has been to the point of embarrassing.  We understand that servers and cooks come and go but if all you can do is offer excuses then don't offer anything. Just stay quiet and try to bring the delicious food you serve as best you can. 1 hour on a Tuesday night just to get chips and order a drink? 3 tries to get an order of mole tacos correct? Order a mojito and get a margarita? Anyone that has spent time in and around the service industry understands that some nights are tougher than others. This now makes 4 tries in a row where your service and professionalism were quite frankly....disgusting.  We love your food but until you can somehow prove that your attitude towards service and quality relationships has changed we will not be back. Very disappointing.

Great place, good atmosphere, a little on the small side but what they lack in size, they make up in flavor. The salsa bar was great and the food came out in less than 15 mins. There are no televisions or loud music to distract you from good conversation and good food. Parking is quite tight but don't let that detour you! A solid 8/10. Only "complaint" is the dish called the "Mexican Flag". If you don't like nuts and sweet dried fruit in your tacos, don't order this dish. Took us a little off guard lol 
Highly recommend!

On an extremely hot June day,  I was in the mood for Horchata and had read about La Condesa's with the Fruit and nut pieces.   I enjoyed my drink sitting at the empty Bar area while I waited for my To Go.   Its worth just going for the Horchata.   I ordered One Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco as my Appetizer which was lightly battered and fried perfecty in obviously clean oil.    My Entree was the Oaxacan Black Mole Chicken Quesa.  The 2 Quesas were crispy, pastry like and filled with Mole Chicken.  Oaxaca cheese was sprinkled on top and was a nice compliment .   Although, The Mole was just a tad bit too sweet, for me, I am looking forward to trying the other Quesas on the menu.   I was not familiar with "Quesa's" prior to my visit.

I came here for my Dads 50th bday. My parents had always told me they loved this spot but I thought it was okay. It has some really cool vintage features and i love the eclectic feel and the awesome mozaic statue out front. I just found it to be cramped inside. The service was disorganized and the food came out at different times for everyone. They also need some sound absorption inside its pretty loud. I hope it got better because it has great potential.

Been coming here for over a year now, ordering the same thing. The "El Gaucho" burro. Probably the best Burro on their menu... the Burro is amazing. Sadly, since coming here they decided to expand their restaurant. With clear notions that they have zero clue how to run that many tables. Seeing 8 people waiting over 40 min to be seated with more than 8 chairs available is not how you run a business. Considering I've run a successful restaurant with about 5 times the amount of capacity, one must consider an expansion before making one. Being understaffed and the kitchen being behind is absolutely zero excuse for letting people stand and wait to be seated while your kitchen catches up when the room for seats is available. I'm seriously appalled with this place after the last two times being here. If you're going to have the audacity to add $$ to your prices then justify it with the knowledge to know how to take care of your customers. Here's a tip. Tell your servers to seat people and offer them chips and perhaps a drink on the house if it is in fact the houses fault for being behind. Probably will not spend a dime here anymore which is sad considering I thought they had the best burrito in Phoenix. Get your kitchen together. Best of luck.
Food is good, really good. Service is atrocious. It should not take half an hour for a box so I can leave.

Today I got back with my girlfriend. And it happened to be Tuesday. So taco Tuesday right?my mom doesn't let me go out often unless it was prom or some sort of social gathering...but she's on vacation in Dubai, and I wanted to feel dangerous so I decided to take my chick to the hood and found La Santissima. 

The neighborhood that the restaurant is located in gave me a sense of impending danger and my girlfriend say she's into bad boys so I think I turned her on when We came into this joint. 

The food was OK. Nothing out of the ordinary. Just Mexican food, you know?

Walking out of this restaurant, I feel like a man for once in my life. I took a selfie with La Santissima in the background and sent it to my friends. 

When I was walking to my car a homeless person slapped the glasses out of my face...I mean I didn't need them to see, those were sunglasses. I probably shouldn't have worn them at night anyway. I just wanted to be cool and also I wanted to call the police but I sensed some heat coming from between my girlfriends legs so we ended up making out in the parking lot next to the shipping container. Nice placement.

Oh my god their salsas and margaritas! They're priced very reasonably. They have a killer selection of all kinds of fancy tacos that are very exciting. The staff is great, attentive but not pushy, knowledgeable about the menu. The decor is pretty too, I liked their posters on the wall. Clean, good food, many options, great service. No complaints!

In our search for a more authentic Mexico City style taco, we came across this restaurant.  I'm happy to report that the tacos here are about as authentic as one can hope to find north of the border.  The Horchatas are fun and tasty as well.  I enjoyed the food and the small dank dining space brought back memories of the small eateries way down south.

So why only 3 stars?  The price is not right.  For a family of four (with two kids), we walked out with a bill of $55.  All we ordered was one round of tacos and some Horchatas.  Ouch.  Down in the DF, one can find better quality and quantity at a full-service sit down restaurant for 1/3 that price.  Maybe I'm looking for something that doesn't exist in Phoenix and I should just be happy to have this food at any price (or perhaps I just paid the "Guy Fieri tax").

No... I'll keep searching.

I have tried La Santisima only once and I am already anxious for Round #2! You know when the line is out the door that is the food is delicious. Every meal that was brought out, I wanted to try!! 

For my meal, I stuck with all tacos and tried the Carne Asada, Al Pastor and the Baha Fish Taco. They were all so flavorful with their own distinct tastes. All the salsas were different and I believe we tried all of them. They do have a pretty full bar so if you are in the mood, you can try it out. Many people were ordering the Horchata which I made the mistake of not ordering, so this will on Round #2's menu. I did stick with a Mexican Coke and it hit the spot!

I was very intrigued by the artwork, it made me feel like I was somewhere else outside of Phoenix. As I said, I cannot wait to return :)

We stopped in for the first time based on a recommendation of another Yelper.

The chairs are extremely comfortable, but the artwork on the wall is very strange. I don't get it. It seems like they just decided to hang ugly paintings instead of actually painting the walls, they are very dirty. 

Our service was ok, but I assume she was new. I ordered 2 tacos a la carte and my boyfriend ordered a meal which comes with beans and rice. We then headed up to the salsa bar to accompany our chips. There were sooo many to choose from. I loved the green salsa and who would have known salsa made from radishes would actually be really tasty??

Our tacos were great, the beans didn't taste like they were from a can and the meat was cooked perfectly. The only issue I had with my lunch were the taco shells, I feel like they were a little too soggy.

This place is a local gem, and we were introduced to it by a local.  I hesitate to review it, for fear that the out-of-towners will find it.  You'd have to know where it is though, because the tourists are not going to accidentally stumble upon it.  It's in the middle of the hood in Phoenix.  The only thing setting it apart from the other old-school business fronts with barred windows is the giant mosaic Day of the Dead Catrina above the door.

Known as a "gourmet taco place" to locals, the menu also features burros and quesadillas.  Where else can you get a shark soft taco or a Mahi Mahi burro?  I have no idea, but you can get them here.  My husband loved his Mahi Mahi burro.

I had a more traditional Carne Asada soft taco.  All their flour tortillas are hand made, and fresh.  And did I mention the salsa bar?  About 20 different kinds of salsa for you to try, with the chips that keep coming to the table.  My favorite was the creamy cilantro one.  There are also peanut and pecan based salsas, so those with nut allergies, take note.  You may not expect nuts in your food, so pay attention.

Seating is limited, (maybe 10 tables) and the restaurant was full when we were there, for lunch, in the middle of the week.  If you have a group larger than 4, it would probably be wise to call ahead.  Parking is also limited, just the few spaces on the street in front.

The only slightly disconcerting element was the giant mural of Frida Khalo.  It's a little odd to be stared at by a giant portrait of a mustached woman while eating such wonderful food.

We liked it so much that my husband took my dad there.  My dad is a notoriously finicky eater (which means I probably came by it naturally), and he is still talking about it a week later.  Yum!

Good food, bad service

First thing which is fun about this place is the salsa bar. Food is always good, simple, flavorful. I have been going here for many years. The drinks were added later and do not disappoint.

The food attracts lot of people, but finding parking is always an issue. Once you walk in, you quickly realize the noise level because of the way the place is constructed and set up is very high. Last but not the least, the service is always poor. We had rude servers where we walked out without ordering one time. That is the reason for 3 stars.
Love coming here! Their food is always fresh and I love snacking on their chips and salsa while we wait for our food.

We must have arrived at an odd time for them to be busy because the service was lacking. The kid was super sweet, but we waited and waited... and then waited some more. The food made up for the wait, but we were HANGRY when we got there and it almost got ugly. 

We got street tacos and they were awesome. We wanted to go back when we were flying back out of PHX, but we totally would have missed our flight and no tacos are worth that. 

That being said, one of the reasons we came here is because Yelp said that vegetarians go nuts here... and that was just not true at all. Veggie options left MUCH to be desired, so beware.

I have eaten here twice and it is consistently excellent. I have had a shark taco, mahi mahi taco and veggie taco. I had to bribe my meat-loving-high-cholesterol-fighting mother into "splitting" the mahi mahi and veggie taco's with me. She loved them, too! The horchata is like nothing I have ever experienced. Love the fresh fruit and nuts in it. The salsa bar is a tastebud orgy of sheer delight and a playground for foodies who love complexity of flavor. But best of all... for 2 tacos, a little side of rice and beans, chips, two BIG drinks, it was only $16! Plus, we listened to The Smiths and old Mexican folk music. This place rocks. Oh, and for those reviewers who were frightened by the neighborhood, get over it. I live 5 blocks in a historic neighborhood and it is as safe as a city can get. If you come for lunch, you just might take a walk a couple blocks up to get a poleta for desert. 16th st between McDowell and Thomas has successfully embraced its roots to create a truly positive cultural experience.

Things Evolve over time, so has La Condesa, There now is a big fancy bar and a somewhat different menu.

What really matters is that the flavor, ans salsas are still here.

I had a burrito with Mahi Mahi in it, it came loaded with spinach, mushrooms, cheese and rice. The cheese was a bit much but was still great at 10.59 with tax it should be.

What really mad it great was the salsas. Everything from a peanut salsa, to a strawberry to many of the classic favorites. I really enjoyed the roasted peepers and onions salsa.

Yes the inside is small and the parking is suicidal when you leave, but if you need a flavor shot give this place a try.
First time here for Mexican food, really like them food Oaxaca was so beautiful. will come again soon...

Really great Mexican food in Phoenix.  I highly recommend that you visit.  Everything I tried was fantastic.  We shared the Queso dip with Chorizo (which came with thin "tortillas", which felt very traditional).  The 1/2 order of guacamole we shared was extremely tasty.  They throw in some dried cranberries to liven up the flavor and texture profile.  Per other Yelp reviewers' recommendations, we shared the giant horchata; 1/3 of an order was the perfect amount for me, and their twist of it with fruit bits was a nice departure from the traditional horchata.  

I ended up getting the gourmet Mayan Pibil taco and one of the food truck style tacos (but can't remember which protein).  They were both fantastic, and the perfect amount of food.  I really enjoyed the expansive salsa bar with over a dozen varieties of salsa.  It was fun to try most of them.  My girlfriend ordered the Quesa which was ginormous; with the chips and queso that we shared, she barely touched the quesa, it was so big, but it looked delicious.

I'd definitely come back to visit next time I'm in Phoenix.  I'm confident they won't disappoint!

Really good service, really good food and the Best Mango Margarita I have ever tasted. Highly recommend place to eat. 

P.S the paintings they have are amazing.
The salsa bar will invade your dreams. If I could I would bathe in their cilantro salsa.
have been here several times - love it.  authentic, good food always. their salsa bar rocks the house, great variety and savory choices.  had dark mole egg dish with black beans  LOVED IT

Top 5 taco spots in my books. Double tortilla with ample amount of succulent meat with juice dropping on the plate. Each bite is mouth watering and goes great with my margarita at 11am after a hike. The salsa bar was impressive with over 10 different types. It made me want to salsa dance my way back to my seat and taco about how good the salsa was.
My favorite is the Al Pastor Quesa. A bit spicy and I don't normally do spicy but for this, I'll suck it up! Their yummy Horchata with fruits in it,  cools it all down for me  Great food!

I love La Santisima!  I've been here a million times and never been disappointed.   The veggie tacos have so much flavor,  some of the best I've ever had.  The Puebla Quesa is amazing with the cashew salsa from their crazy huge salsa bar.  Their homemade jamaica and horchata are great.  Honestly there's not a bad thing I can say about this place.

My grand finally in Scottsdale came the evening I went to La Santisima.   I wanted to some good Mexican food before I left the west coast,  so I looked this place up and based on the Yelp reviews I made the journey.   It was about a 35 minute drive from my hotel in Scottsdale,  but well worth the trip.     The place isn't that big,  but it's very clean and pretty traditional.   The whole time I was there I heard bob Marley playing.   It was odd,  but cool at the same time since I expected mariachi music playing.   Anyhow,  me and my friends placed our orders and came to the salsa bar.   This had to have had the most variety in salsa that I've seen.   Tasted a few salsas for my chips and ordered a few alcoholic drinks which were fantastic.   I tried the peach margarita and my friend had the strawberry one.   The food was also delicious!  I had the asada burrito smothered and my friend had the chicken quesadilla.    The quesadilla is pretty stuffed and filling.   I would definitely come back and have lunch or dinner here in the future.

cool place! I really enjoyed myself at La Condesa Taco Shop. The food was fresh, and the place was very relaxing. 

The bar is impressive with unique styles of salsa. 

I ordered a shark taco and the cochonita pork taco. Great choice! The food was very tasty and fresh. I highly recommend this place.

It's a small location but HUGE in flavor. 
Make sure you try the quesadillas with carne asada.

The wait can vary due to its small size. I have waited for almost an hour. It was definitely worth it.
Holy guacomole!! I found Mexican food heaven! We were so excited tasting everything. The Salsa Bar is awesome! We loved everything.  Great service. We couldn't even finish because portions are huuge!

Another Diner, Drive-Ins and Dives spot. GREAT gourmet tacos. SO MUCH FOOD. They have a small bar, but we didn't have drinks. Just lunch on this Sunday. Chicken so good, You can get a 3 taco (mix and match) plate with rice and beans for $13.98.   RICE SO GOOD. 

Tried the horacha, not sure it's for me, but it was all gone before we left. Great prices, the waitress was very friendly. GREAT FRESH SALSA BAR. We will be back for sure.

I sure would love to give this place 5 stars. I promise myself Im coming back so perhaps you may see an update.

I have been hearing about this place even before I saw it on Triple D and I am not quite sure why yesterday was my first visit, I will tell you it wont be my last.

The menu is massive and somewhat confusing it's very wordy with such authenticity that it was just overwhelming. But it is primarily composed of appetizers, Lonchas, (sandwiches) Tacos, Burritos, and quesadillas. thousands of words filled that menu of 100 choices. I snagged a paper menu on my way out and will be ready next time.

Once sat we were greeted with a welcome, and some chips and directed to the salsa bar. Now The salsa bar has a reputation, and I feel it didnt live up to the hype. 4 of the 10 bowls were empty and it wasn't neat and fresh looking. I did try many of what was available  and they were great, if not super spicy!!!!! Strawberry salsa was a stretch but it wasn't bad, and the pico was good, just a basic pico, chipotle was tasty and there was another that was pureed and very hot that's was my favorite. The creamy cilantro could be epic, but some one thinned it out to the consistency of milk, if it was more of a creama I would still be there.

I ordered a burrito because I couldn't comprehend all of the taco choices, upgrades and extra charges for this and that. Tacos range from 4 to 10 dollars ea ala-cart. My choice of the Norteno with green chili was a hit. so very good with a great combo of moist roasted pork, rice, chile, sour cream and cheese. I didn't opt for the enchilada style $5 upgrade because I am fussy about enchilada sauce. I realize now I could have trusted this kitchen. I was a bit surprised to find my plate unadorned with anything but a fair size burro cut in 2. after a few bites all was forgiven.

My buddy loved his street tacos I tasted his beans they were amazing but the rice! The Rice was simply perfection, served on the side and just a little off white. There was something in that recipe caused those flavors to soar!!!! Most Cravable menu item.

It's a cool dining room with lots of quality art covering all of the wall space, along the walls were long naugahyde covered banquettes and loud chairs that sqauwked if you moved the feet across the floor. Felt pads are greatly needed for the chairs.

Restrooms were a mess and poorly stocked, and I could go on and on about that but it doesn't seem to do much good, owners and managers just don't seem to care about them any more, and that was the missing star in this review.

The food isn't as good as the location on 16th street. The Glendale location is either understaffed and can't accommodate busier days or the staff isn't that great. Either way my biggest complaint is customer service. We waited a good 15-20min and no one ever came to give us menus let alone take any drink order. We ended up leaving and I'm pretty sure no one even noticed. It's disappointing as I was really excited to see a location open closer to my house. The service is great at the 16st location but normally has a wait for seating as it is a smaller location. Needless to say, I won't be returning to the Glendale location.  I'd rather wait for a table and have better service and food.

The taco selection is amazing! Sure, I'll wait in a long line on taco Tuesday just to get my hands on the mix & match deal served with rice and beans. You can also swap out one of the two and get two rice or two beans. They also have a salsa bar and additional items you can top on your tacos, etc. NOM! If you're coming on a weekday (during noon time), I'd suggest you to grab a menu a overlook it while you're in line because the menu is huge and it gives you second thoughts on what you're ordering. There's also a water dispenser with cups near the register when you're waiting in line. 

Five stars because...
- Tasty tacos.
- HUGE menu.
- Vegan/Gluten free options (the section is pretty big).
- Friendly and excellent customer service.
- Salsa bar was clean and filled.
Great tacos and Mexican drinks.  What a hidden gem

First of all, we love coming to this place, but last night service was really badddd as they only had 2 people waiting on approx 10/11 tables. It was a disaster for a Saturday night. . We tried to be patient and understand that they are short staffed and actually felt sorry for the servers, we even had to go get chips and water on our own because we were not waited at all.  Customers kept coming and we noticed that 2 different tables got their food before us even though we were there wayyyy before them, so  we asked the server what's going on with our food and stated that the kitchen was just grabbing tickets randomly.  One lady was  clearing tables while food was waiting to be served.  We were obviously disappointed!  Not sure what kind of management they have or I wonder if they even have one.  The servers are new ( that's  what we were told) and I am not blaming them for last night's disappointment,  the OWNER hopefully is reading this.  Will not go back ; as note to owner- Hire some help and train your staff .  We left after almost an hour of waiting.  No, we did not get our food after all that wait.

I won't beat around the bush. This was hands down the best Mexican food i've had in Phoenix so far. The salsa bar was incredibly varied and interesting, the street tacos at happy hour were delicious, the house margarita was perfectly balanced and the handmade quesadilla destroyed any preconception I had of what a quesadilla was supposed to be. Highly recommended. On top of that, staff was attentive and the atmosphere was unique, and unpretentious.
The burrito I had was the best burrito ever. I'm here on a 6 hour layover and was told to visit this place.  Very good food

tasty menu with lots of variety, twelve salsas at salsa bar, seafood options, table service, handmade tortillas, giant basket of chips included free, no lunch rush.  all this AND priced similarly to america's taco shop, which can't hold a vela to this place.

As many have mentioned, this place is freakin fantastic.  I vote for La Condesa Shrimp tacos as my fav.  Best horchata I've ever had and eating the fruits and nuts when your done is a tasty dessert.  The Rabano (radish) Pibil salsa was so amazing I almost killed their supply of little cups going back for more.  That's one I'll be trying to recreate at home forever but will never get quite right.  Slightly sour, slightly hot, it's like a Mexican kimchee . . literally, I just drooled on myself thinking about it.  Viva La Condesa!

One of my favorite taco shops in Phoenix, with a vast variety of salsas and menu items, new school and traditional tacos, and a deep-fried quesadilla. Yes, you read that correctly. Surely you'll have a heart-attack immediately after, but it's worth it. I almost think it's time for them to update locations, and get into something bigger since it's a nightmare to try and eat there around the lunch rush time, also its sort of rustic appearance doesn't quite match how good their food is. If it wasn't for recommendations from friends previously, it's the kind of place where you'd walk in, take a quick look, and walk out. Needless to say, don't allow that to deter you from exploring their menu, you surely wont' be dissatisfied.

It was ok but not great. We are use to authentic not Tex Mex or Southwest or whatever most places here in AZ are making. It seems so strange to be so close to Mexico but not be able to find really good Mexican food. Tacos are small. Salsa bar sounded good but mostly weird stuff like strawberry salsa. Parking is impossible. No pork green chili?! What the hell is green sauce? Yuck

Hey! Anybody who liked the art in this restaurant should let the REAL artists know! Manuel Gilavalos y Garcia and Ricardo Ramirez are LIARS and THIEVES, and those with actual talent are getting ripped off.

The owners and managers of this restaurant really need to do some research before giving money to supposed "artists" for their work. Countless news articles have now been written praising those thieves. The idea is deplorable.

Anybody who gives two craps about doing the right thing needs to show support for the artists who have had their work stolen and then displayed with credit given to another.

http://www.sylviaji.com/
http://kirimoth.com/blog/

Now we're talking! There is a reason this place gets rave reviews and multiple "Best of" awards. This authentic Mexican food, no Tex-Mex here. Incredible offerings and a blending of flavors you'll be hard-pressed to find elsewhere.

We've been to both locations, but for whatever reason, prefer the 16th Street location over the Glendale location. Same food, same wonderful service - just personal preference.

Tacos: Al Pastor, Carne Asada, Oaxacan Black Mole, Chicken Asado. All excellent, super flavorful, seasonings not overpowering and well presented. The mole is probably the best I've ever tasted. Hint of cinnamon/spices, chocolate & chilies. Just the right blending of flavors to bring you back for more. Looking for something out of the box? Try the Arabe Burro. Al Pastor pork with hummus lettuce, cucumber and even some Tzatziki! Very refreshing. They also offer quite a number of vegetarian offerings.

La Santisima also boasts a homemade salsa bar unlike any you've seen. This really gives the customer the opportunity to try flavors and you just may find you've discovered a new favorite! The salsa made with peanuts is very good - really! And don't forget the adult beverage - the hand made house margarita is very good, too!

Restaurant is very unpretentious. Small in size. Glendale location has parking in the rear, street parking in Phoenix.

Neither location is close by our neighborhood, but worth the drive for great food.

My wife and I use this as our go to quality taco spot. But I could spend all my time just sampling the salsas. Great midtown PHX spot. Parking is somewhat difficult if you come during busy hours but don't let that deter you.

I recently enjoyed delicious beef and chicken tacos as well as the plentiful salsa bar at La Santisima. The establishment is small and the service proved acceptable. If I lived in the area, I'd likely explore their menu on a more regular basis.
Been here twice now and I am in love with this place. The food is amazing and the salsa bar is sooooo good.
Truly great tasting food and cocktails are amazing.  The restaurant itself is very small and they should figure out another layout.  The wait staff that day was sort of mediocre.
Obsessed with the white fish tacos! I've never really liked fish tacos but they've won me over and salsa bar is amazing! Go there hungry- you won't be disappointed
Great food and salsa bar. Get there early or late for lunch. I've been there five times had different items each time and loved them. Mole is awesome.

My new favorite medium scale Mexican restaurant in Phoenix. 

Very high quality and simple. 

The oxacan cheese, fresh herbs and spices, grilled chiles, the 10+ salsa bar options and the homemade horchata with berries and nuts are all you need to know. Vegan and vegetarian options!

WOW, DELICIOUS FOOD!!!!! 

Sauces were okay...didn't come across any I loved, but then again I only tried about 5 different flavors. Well, the cilantro sauce would be the best out of the 5 I had tasted.

Their quesadilla was indeed their own signature style, It was very appetizing, with their golden brown crunchy exterior layer all around, I give it 5 stars!!! 

The Fish tacos were delectable, and they were not scarce on the portions either! small & crowded interior, so we ordered to-go! but next time, if we decide to dine in, I'll be sure to sample all their sauces!! Yum!

Best Mexican food in Phoenix!
Went with my family, we are total foodies and were blown away by the flavors! Service was also very good.

I could have made a meal just from the chips and the great variety of salsa at the salsa bar.  Strawberry and peanut salsa were unique and expertly crafted.  They could have seemed gimmicky but the flavor was no joke and went great with the rest of the meal.

The salsas set the bar high while waiting for my tacos and the tacos had no trouble clearing that bar.  I had 3 different tacos and wish I had room for about 15 more as every variety sounded good to me.  I'll definitely be back to work my way through the menu.

Luckily, Kevin H. put this place on my radar and actually took me there a few weeks ago.  I've been back a couple times now as it is dangerously close to home and so delicious.  

The cilantro salsa is perfectly awesome.  Your taste buds will love you.

The veggie tacos are everything I could ever ask for- I don't miss meat when I eat them and that is awesome sauce.  The beans are probably loaded up with things a vegetarian shouldn't be eating, but lets pretend that isn't the case and just enjoy them.

Service is kind of odd, but I really don't care because the food is amazing.  Go- go, now.

I'm from out of town and happened to see this restaurant on Diner's Drive In's & Dive's, and it was just as good as Guy said it was!!! The food is ridiculously good, super unique but still authentic. You have to wait for a while to get the food, but it's so worth it because of the quality. Make sure to try the Horchata.

I went multiple times during my time in Phoenix and luckily did not have to wait too long each time. The streets tacos are hearty and well seasoned. The best part are all the salsa options you get to choose from and the included chips that come with your order. It is really fun trying all the salsas and they go great with the food. The margaritas are also pretty delicious based on the sips I had from others. The horchata is pretty unique with the added fruit and is not as creamy as other preparations but is still refreshing!

A nice spot for lunch or dinner!

All delish! Burro Taco recommended by waiter was a great choice. The fish taco was excellent as well as the shrimp taco. Salsa is done right! Can't wait to visit again! Great atmosphere and service. The decor is interesting!

If I could leave zero stars I would. It literally took us almost a whole to get our order taken. At 5:30 finally after we were asked what we wanted to start with, the restaurant ran out of guacamole, which I just don't understand. I don't even know who our server was because One girl helped us but the whole time she did it she rolled her eyes and complained how she wasn't supposed to be our server. Very poor service very poor management. She did apologize at the end for the poor service but I really think that we could've at least been accommodated with a free drink or a free dessert. We were so excited when we saw that guy from the Food Network came here, but we left so disappointed.
Amazing selection of tacos and salsas. Reasonable prices and great service. I have to come back and try all of these options and have a margarita.
Awesome guac, if you like it fancy.  Really great tacos, small quaint dining room.  Reeeaaaallllyyyy long wait.

Was craving some tacos and saw the reviews here so decided to give it a try. Place is a total dive, but in a charming way. Got the chicken mole tacos and they were outstandingly good. Also got a La Condesa Taco w/ chicken and thought it was just okay. I asked to make them really spicy and they definitely had a bit of a kick to it. The tacos are huge so I was full. The salsa bar is pretty interesting and has a diverse selection of salsas (try the peanut one, it's very good). Service was friendly and the prices are really fair.

Welcome to the neighborhood!  Had the marlin tacos and the carne asada, and they were some of the best I've had.  Great atmosphere.  They serve beer and margaritas so they are perfect as a late afternoon destination.  The salsa bar is well equipped with different tastes from all over Mexico, and the owner Felipe is a food guy at heart.  He made it a point to come over and say hi and introduce himself.  We ended the meal with a Horchata to go, and I have to say I couldn't have left any happier!
Tacos. Ammmaaaziiiing! Try cochinita pibil!!! Try the salsa Mexicans for sure and lonche w cochinita pibil fantastic too. It was a great experience

Gourmet tacos!  Try any two gourmet tacos you will not be disappointed. These tacos aren't your regular small street tacos these are some serious tacos. I tried the la santisma taco with arrachera carne and the shark taco. Both were incredible. Really like the shark taco with its sauce.  And the santisma taco was right on. Real Mexican sodas with real sugar straight from the glass bottle. And don't forget the salsa bar. Seriously, so many salsas to choose from. Try them all, I did and simply went back for those I liked, no loved!  Oh. Did I forget even the rice and beans were good and I only know this because they mistakenly added them to my plate, the chef was being generous the waiter said. Thank you I said!  These are definitely better the average rice and beans.

Gourmet tacos!  Try any two gourmet tacos you will not be disappointed. These tacos aren't your regular small street tacos these are some serious tacos. I tried the la santisma taco with arrachera carne and the shark taco. Both were incredible. Really like the shark taco with its sauce.  And the santisma taco was right on. Real Mexican sodas with real sugar straight from the glass bottle. And don't forget the salsa bar. Seriously, so many salsas to choose from. Try them all, I did and simply went back for those I liked, no loved!  Oh. Did I forget even the rice and beans were good and I only know this because they mistakenly added them to my plate, the chef was being generous the waiter said. Thank you I said!  These are definitely better the average rice and beans.

I ate here a while ago but want to leave a raving review as I've told more people about this place than any other restaurant. My boyfriend and I ate here and we both can't wait to go back. Although the wait was long, and I almost died of hunger, I would go back any minute. The food was amazing and hands down the best Mexican food I've ever eaten. I hope they stay tiny, don't expand and ruin it so I can go back and eat here for years.

Probably the BEST tacos I have ever had. 
Impressive selection of salsas.
Lot's of character. 
Awesome staff.
Just moved to Phoenix, and am SO HAPPY that we live near La Santisima. The salsa options alone make every trip back well worth it. Highly recommended if you like great Mexican food.

Amazing food & the absolute best horchata that I've ever had! The atmosphere is great including the paintings inside and new calavera they put outside. The food is always fresh and there's a variety of different salsas to choose from at the salsa bar. Great little place to have around the neighborhood, great addition. :)

The -1 star is only for the atmosphere, bad lighting and sound system (with loud music). Their veggie tacos were tasty, with fresh tortillas and yummy salsa. Tasted like Abuelita was in the kitchen. Our server looked like he wasn't a day over 18, but seemed like he had years of experience, and very nice. Almost hope they don't spruce up the place, it would be difficult to get their delicious food!

YOU MUST GO HERE. The salsa bar was so good! I kept getting up to try pretty much every one, and refilled on the strawberry salsa! My waiter helped me pick a combo if three different tacos and I really appreciated it because they were so good! Don't be deterred from the image of this place, its local, its homey and probably one of the best mexican restaurants I have been to - and I am from Texas!

Great place for food. The décor is very nice. The bartender here makes the best Margarita as I've ever had. I like that it's not typical tacos or typical Mexican food. It is very authentic Mexican food from central Mexico.
Be prepared to squeeze in close to your neighbors, but the food is certainly worth it! The salsa bar is fantastic!

Thanks Yelpers!  We were in town Sunday - trying to find something new and close by.  Yelp provided the answer - over 1,300 reviews with a score of 4 1/2 stars ... gotta do it.  SO GLAD WE DID.

5 of us showed up for some Gourmet Taco's.  A bit of a wait - but not bad.  Not a lot of room to sit/wait inside - and it could be a hot wait on the sidewalk out front on a summer day - but - once we were inside and seated...Happiness ensued.

A pretty comprehensive menu - various taco preparations - from a traditional Barbacoa (Mariachi), Chicken Tinga, a Sonoran Arrachera steak, to my choice - the Sonora Carne Asada Burro.  Wonderful!  Very flavorful, tender and moist meat.  My dining companions had a variety of taco's and quesadillas, and everyone was completely satisfied.  Lots of wow's every time someone tried something new.

The salsa bar was great - only complaint - I like to really dip my chips, and the small cups provided just enough room to put the tip in, and just enough for a taste.  They were all very tasty - some much more hot than others.  Loved the sweet/slightly hot fresh mango salsa.  I could eat just a bowl of that and be happy!

Too full for deserts.  Well be back again for sure!  Enjoy!
Unbelievable food, service was lacking but worth the crappy service to get the food.  They need more staff.
Salsa bar is HUGE but not maintained.  I sampled 5 tacos. None were that great. I was disappointed by this place. Service was 4/5. They really need to clean the place and the salad bar more often.

Chicken tinga burros and grilled zucchini, oh my!

So I've been here a few times and figured it was about time to give it a review.  It's easy to pass by this as it's squeezed in between a closed down car repair shop and a Mexican party shop, complete with pinatas hanging outside.  The only giveaway is the fact that however nice your ride is, there's at least two other vehicles here way classier parked beside you.  You open a large wooden door to a cacaphony of fantastic smells, dizzied by this olfactory blast and pupils adjusting to the darkened lighting, and stumble to find an open table to sit down at.  The furniture is all heavy wood an iron, a signifier of the quality of the place, but the placing is not the best, leading to endless bumping and apologies, the only thing that could be considered a bad point to this place.

If you love salsa, this place hosts a bar with at least ten different types of salsa including ones made from ground pecans, which became addicting after the initial shock of eating salsa made from nuts.  It's hard to find for those coming with quite an appetite I recommend the Santos Plate.  It's a choice of one taco, one burrito and a generous helping of grilled zucchini.  

I tend to slather anything I get in salsa to raise the spice level, the chicken tinga in a burrito does not require it at all, by the end of this huge burrito I was starting to feel sweat droplets forming but I couldn't pull away from how delicious it was.  The taco choice recommendation is the pork shoulder cooked in banana leaves, the flavor was amazing and the red vinegared topping added just the perfect amount of sweet and sour.  I'm not a big fan of chocolate but if you are, the mole taco will definitely hit those key notes with you as well.

I've never personally ordered the horchata but one of my co-workers did.  It only comes in one size, LARGE.  Be very thirsty and take your insulin beforehand.  Thirty-two ounces awaits of what was originally horchata, now spiced with cinnamon and nutmeg, ground pecans and strawberry.  Definitely not your average rice drink.

Overall you can't go wrong here, everything is made fresh, hot and delicious.  This place has become a monthly ritual spot, it should be for you as well.

I've been here about 4 times now. I love this place. The name has changed, they've been serving alcohol for a while now, there's a new location in Glendale (I need to go), and the menu has expanded but isn't quite represented online yet. Even the physical menus can be different. The one I had had a few more items on it than my friends'. The horchata is still the best I've ever had. The margaritas are so freaking good.

I tried the marlin taco that wasn't there last time I visited. I love trying things I've never had before. Marlin is an odd fish. Their preparation makes it look and taste almost like pork. It's just... different. Still good though!

My friend got the veggie burro. She said it was pretty tasty, but a little on the bland side. We agreed that it can be hard to make vegetarian food flavorful at times. She liked the salsa bar because she could add a different flavor between bites.

They get slammed on weekends. I was here at 7pm on a Friday. They need more than 2 people serving and clearing on weekends. When every table is packed there's almost no room to move. Getting to the salsa bar can be pretty awkward.

I've also been to the Glendale location but this was our first experience with La Santisima. My wife and I just can't get over the food and salsa bar here! So many amazing flavors of salsas to choose from. My favorite salsas here were the Guacamole salsa (has some heat) and Mexicana salsa (salsa Mexicana, lots of lime flavor).

I had the Dogfish Shark taco based on reviews, as well as the filet mignon taco.
I wasn't overly impressed with the shark taco, there weren't any flavors that distinguished it from just a regular fish taco. However the filet mignon taco was incredible. The beef was cooked medium and tender, and the dressing/fixings was an avocado salsa with cranberries. It was delicious. There was way too much food to fit onto the tortilla (a good problem to have) so the tip is to eat a lot of the filling, then try to roll it up as a taco.
The one sad thing to note was that they ran out of grapefruit juice so the house margarita wasn't as good as I've had it previously. But you definitely need to get the house margarita, it's so good. Plus it's only $5 during happy hour!

Had to ask for a water refill since the server wasn't paying much attention to our water status. That's the only constructive feedback I have.

My wife found this place based on reviews while she was traveling earlier this month. It just so happened that we were already coming back to this area for vacation, and this was the first place we ate at in Glendale because she previously had such a good meal.

So my expectations were very high because it's all she has been talking about.

And I was not disappointed! First of all, the salsa bar is huge and offers so many diverse flavors. Pecan? Peanut? Radish? Along with the more traditional salsas. Here's a tip, try mixing the Pecan with the Rabano Pibil (Radish) for a great combination. My personal favorite was the guacamole salsa, it definitely has some heat.

I had the El Goucho Quesa and it was amazing. It's like a deepfried quesadilla, with amazing argentine seak with tons of other goodness inside. The Oaxaca cheese is so good sprinkled across the top along with avocado slices.

Another thing that beat my expectations - the house margarita. A little sweeter than the usual margarita (flavor comes from grapefruit juice) and if I weren't driving I would have had 2 during the meal.

I ordered take-out, which isn't their forte. I was not offered a seat, nothing to drink, and generally had to figure out whom to address to place my order. There is a salsa bar, but when I got there - around dinner time - the salsas were mostly gone. There are at least two salsas worth writing about, but there were no cups/lids to take the salsa with me. Upon request, they provided me four one-ounce cups with four lids, so I did get to try a bit of four types of salsa, period. The fish tacos were odd, but the smoked swordfish actually tasted yum. NOT for $9+ though, which is part of the reason for the low star review. Overall, you couldn't convince me to give this place a second try. Bad service - the servers/staff seemed too busy to help (service is a biggie). Recommend you go into the insurance business with your people skills.

My definition of Central Phoenix ended at around the 12ths on both sides, but this place and Urban Beans have taught me the folly of my ways.  Condessa is a simple and beautiful spot, serving a different, more expansive menu than most of the other Mexican restaurants I've been sampling.

First impressions won me over on first step in, I am in love with the Dios los Muertos art aesthetic and they have some beautiful works adorning their walls and doors.  The self-described gourmet menu was enticing, many selections I've never seen in person, only read about in my food travel readings, so I was intrigued.  I really wish I was more hungry, I settled on the Queso which was recommended by my server.

The food takes a bit of time to prepare, but that does give you time to enjoy the salsa bar, which this day included 10 varieties including strawberry, chipolte, a creamy cilantro, guac, pico, can't remember them all.  When my Queso came I was a bit shocked by it's size and relativity to fry-bread, not that this is a bad thing.  The pork inside was unbelievable, comparable in portion size and taste to that of much more expensive places.  Fried cheesy porky goodness, topped with rotating different salsas, each bite was another slice of heaven.

My gripes:  I have much respect for the work they put in to make this food outstanding, but they are shooting themselves in the foot with the plastic silverware,  cheap baskets and togo cups.  I know doing dishes is annoying, but you need to match your great food with great accoutrement.

After writing this, I'm going back today.  Yum.

This is soooo much closer to where I live than the original location. Awesome :) I'll be back. The only kink is service and signage. The people are new and are being trained so that should improve. I swear one of the servers also works/worked at the original. This location is just as hard to spot though. Small building, but plenty of parking in back.

I'm a huge fan of the original. Been there multiple times. I was much more impressed by the mole being served here, but not so much the dogfish. It was still good, but seemed to be more batter this time around. Cabo shrimp and marlin are good at both locals.
Two taco plates with rice and beans and two horchatas = $25-30

I finally have enough experience with these restaurants to complain just a little bit.
1. Go back to putting the rice and beans in cups or bowls please. I am begging you! I'm so tired of my tacos getting soggy from my beans spreading across my entire plate. Get plates with ridges and sections or something. Something! Anything!
2. The music IS REALLY LOUD at both locations. I'd like to not have to yell at my dining partners.
3. No pecans in the horchata anymore? Did I miss this menu change or was it just a hiccup at the newbie?

I am beyond picky when it comes to Mexican food, having grown up in Phoenix. I eat here weekly since I work down the street. The meats are seasoned perfectly, the salsa bar is amazing (try the creamy cilantro), everything including the guac is fresh and the price is right. Waitstaff is very pleasant. Eat here.

What a great find. Lots of salsas you never have seen before. Lots of menu choices & the margaritas are excellent. A great lesson to not judge a book by its cover! If you want a change to the traditional tex-mex, this is the place. It's also near the airport, so it was great to get something quick, delicious, and convenient.
Love LaSantisma starting with the amazing ceramic tile sculpture over their sign to their mmm Margueritas, their food in general, and best of all, their guacamole often made with mangoes.

This place is good for tacos! I think they way they pack them might be a little too heavy for me but I'm sure a lot of people appreciate it. More bang for your buck to some people. They have a salsa bar which I loved a lot. Different flavors... nothing wrong with that. Our service was a bit slow though. It took for ever to get our margaritas which wasn't the best. I only order the classic margarita which is usually my favorite but maybe they have something that they are known for. I'll def be back one day. Thanks again!

Well this place is stinkin delicious.  The service is a bit slow, and the restaurant is not that big, so expect a crowd- but the fresh food definitely makes up for anything the former was lacking.  We enjoyed the specialty burrito with steak, and it was mouth wateringly good!  The salsa bar is a nice touch, and everything tastes really fresh and well made.  I'll be sure to stop again when I'm in the area!

Best Mexican food in town.  Hands-down.   A locally-owned, authentic gem!  The mole is phenomenal, and you can have it with either chicken or shrimp.  The house margarita has a lovely blend of lime and grapefruit juices and it just plain delicious.  There are tons of veggie options here that are not just lame, meatless dishes.  The La Condessa Veggie Taco has a mix of Oaxacan cheese, mushrooms, smoky poblano peppers, onion, spinach and garlic...and it is to die for.  The all-you-can-eat salsa bar adds a fun touch.

MY FAVORITE place to go for authentic tacos. LOVE their salsa bar too.

I always get their santisma burrito with shark. Grilled (special order so it's not on the menu, but just ask and they will accomodate). I feel like it brings out the flavor of the shark better.
I also love getting their tacos (any of them) with grilled shrimp (also special order and not on the menu). 

I just don't like deepfried stuff haha but this place is amazing.

Everyone says their guac is great but I think it's overrated. I love that it's chunky and tastes fresh.. but it's sometimes lacking in flavor because they make this in bulk. When making things like this in bulk, it can be hard to evenly spread the ingredients. Skip the guac and invest in another taco!

I had high hopes for this place given all the great reviews, but after eating here last night, I really don't understand the hype. I ordered the mix and match tacos, and they were so flavorless I almost couldn't eat them. Honestly the most bland Mexican food I've ever had. Super disappointed.

I spent only a few hours in Phoenix waiting for a flight and came here for a quick dinner. I will never forget this place... Great tacos and the salsa bar was really fun. Tried all sorts of salsas I'd never had before. Some interesting nut ones

Soooooooooooooo good. Packed even at 2pm and people continuing to come. Expect a wait but it's worth it for sure. I got the 3 street taco plate with rice and beans. Chicken, al pastor and beef. All delicious. The rice and beans were great too. We also had a half order of guacamole which was phenomenal and more than plenty for 2 people.  The salsa bar has a crazy variety and we didn't try any we didn't like. Try this place out. It's not in the best part of town but who cares.  If you're about good vittles you will leave full and happy.
I am a bean and cheese FANATIC and this place is it! I will absolutely be back and the servers were exceptional as well!

Chips and salsa before your meal: Yes
Self serve salsa bar: Yes
If you are looking for some daytime tacos this is the place to go. Tica tacos, carne asada, cochinita pibil, shrimp and even shark tacos. Vegetarian choices also available. If you love real horchata you'll love it even more here. They have the best horchata ever with fruit and crushed walnuts. This place is perfect because you can walk off the calories at Papago Park, Indian Steele Park or check out the sites downtown which are all within 10 minutes or less away.

The beans were watery and too salty for my taste.The rice is plain white rice just as you see in the picture with corn no flavor to me, both rice and beans were warm not cold.The salsa bar is decent. Not a fan of the cilanto cream salsa or guacomole sour cream salsa. I love simple good cooked foods. They do have vegetarian foods.

We had the mix and match taco plate. I had the Jamaican Rose Shrimp Taco, the La Santisima Specialty with Shrimp, and the Tamarindo Mahi Mahi tacos. They were very inviting. The chef infused so many ingredients to ensure that when you took a bite into the taco all the flavors burst beautifully onto your pallet. I also particularly liked the texture of the tortillas used to wrap the creative goodness of the tacos. My wife and I also shared the poblano queso. It was also rich with a vastness of melted cheese and poblanos that tasted as if they were dried weeks ago and aged perfectly. We will definitely be back....numerous times!

This place has gone done hill, and their prices are ridiculous now. Today is the last time I think I'll be patronizing this joint. I'll miss their amazing salsas, but not the dirty tables and floors, or or the really loud music, or the slow service or the ridiculously overpriced food items. Too many choices when it comes to yummy Mexican food in this town, and this place got a little too big for their britches IMHO. You gotta try harder people! I hate when places get popular like this, and decide it's cool to gauge people and not put their best foot forward.

Waited a while to get our order taken 4 tables total of 9 people in various stages of dining.  Service was bad food was average and a little on expensive side.  Had high hopes... Will not return nor recommend.

I don't give 5 stars. But LS deserves it-- amazing, life changing food. Good atmosphere and nice staff. But the food is phenomenal. They have 30+ different kinds of tacos alone-- even vegan ones! But the clincher is they do protein style tacos. So low carb people delight!!! They wrap their tacos in crispy Oaxaca cheese and omg it's amazing. I'm not on a low carb diet and I still order it. Yum! I'm Hispanic so horchata is staple. But their horchata is out of this world. I stop by just to order one and leave. Try it. You will not be disappointed.

Best choice of tacos from different regions of Mexico! They even have vegetarian and vegan tacos! The simple bean burrito (bullet burro) is to die for. My favorite option they have is that you can order the tacos "protein style" where they come literally wrapped in ooey delicious Oaxacan cheese-- keto friendly if you stick to the meats etc! Homemade salsa bar with 8-12 different salsas. And holy balls, do yourself a favor and order an horchata. It's like nothing I've ever had before and I want to be submerged in it when I die. So. Good. I'm craving it now, as I review.

 The atmosphere and staff attitude is a little lax but I don't go to a restaurant for that-- it's all about the food.

When you come here, the best thing you can do is order a plate of tacos, more tacos then you can comfortably eat (but you'll eat all of them, damn it) and build a fortress with the salsa cups.  There are so many different kinds of salsa here.  Just keep going back until you have a cup of each different kind and stack them so you create a barrier and no one can see you stuff your face with that delicious food.

Don't be afraid to wipe with your sleeve, because no one will see you.... the wall of cups of salsa will be blocking you.  Eh?  See, I think ahead.
Best food  everrr and the place it is amazing...
Can fill up on the salsa bar and out of this world horchata alone! The street tacos and bullet burrito are all amazing. Margaritas are mixed well.
They seemed to fix the sewage smell but the salsa is still better at the Glendale location.
Great local place.  The food is amazing, but the service was only ok.  Great place to go with friends, but this would not be my first date location.

I've driven by La Santisima many times but never stopped in. The decor on the outside intrigued me so I Yelped it and was impressed by the reviews. We decided to give it a shot on my moms birthday with a party of 5. We were seated quickly got our chips and drinks and started trying the various salsas from the salsa bar. It was pretty cool having more than a few choices and some were really good.

There is almost to much on the menu. All 5 of us had a hard time deciding on what to sample. I decided to go with the shark quesa. It did not disappoint. It was great. All 5 of us enjoyed our food immensely and were talking about when we could get together to go back. 

The service was good. Not great but the one waitress was pretty taxed because of how busy they were. We ordered my daughters quesa with no sour cream and it came out with sour cream. It was noticed by the waitress as soon as she put put it down though and she took care of it. My wife's tacos and my daughters quesa were brought out quite a bit later than the other 3 meals. No clue why the tacos took so long but it is what it is. Also it took a bit of effort to get the chips refilled and I still haven't got my drink refilled. 

Notice I've mentioned that we had a party of 5 quite a few times... La Santisima automatically adds 18% gratuity to parties 6 or above. Well when we got our bill it was marked as a party of 6, with gratuity added. The waitress took my card, ran it, and low and behold the itemized copy that showed the added gratuity was gone when she brought the customer/store copies back. You know, that's the part when you fill in the tip. If I wouldn't have noticed beforehand I would not have had any idea that the tip was already included. Because we didn't have a party of 6, only 5. I kind of felt like someone was trying to get over on me and get double tipped. Just a suspicion. I don't tend to be the conspiracy theory type but it just seemed a bit fishy to me. 

I would definitely go back. The food was fantastic, 5 star territory, but the service snafus and the gratuity mystery cost them a couple stars. When I do go back, and I will, I'm just going to keep a really close eye on my receipt.

We arrived at 11am and left at 1:10pm.  The food came out extremely slow (12:30) and service was very slow.  The food wasn't bad, but not worth the wait to eat.  The Margs were good, but again, not worth the wait.  The salsas were good and liked the variety.  It was our first time there.  It wouldn't come up in our minds to go eat here again.

Oh man, this was a good dinner! There were rumors about La Condesa: awesome salsa bar, tasty cheap tacos...I am glad to say that both of those rumors are TRUE!

I had a chicken mole taco which had just a couple too many red onions on it (which were easily dispatched). The mole was rubbed into the chicken rather than glooped on top, so the fragrant smokiness really soaked into the chicken. I liked this taco even better with a spoonful of the juicy strawberry salsa on top.

I also sampled the carne asada burro. Simple handmade flour tortilla (I could eat them plain for days), filled with black beans and beef. The meat had a deep flavor and was slow-cooked tender. Again, a dollop from the large assortment of salsas, this time the creamy cilantro, made good taste great.

My calabacitas were grilled just right: nice char marks, but with some body still left to the slices. 

La Condesa only loses a point because the chips could have been better (fresher) and the parking in front is rather harrowing. Otherwise, it is going in the regular rotation. I hope they have t-shirts sometime soon with some of the amazing artwork!
This place is delicious. The food was very authentic which is rare to the Phoenix area. We look forward to trying everything on the menus.

La Santisima has unique taco combinations that you will not find at just about all of the fast Mexican-American food joints. Their salsa bar is the best that I've ever had, allowing the patron to make some delicious flavor combinations! Definitely go here!

Visited La Santisima for first time last week w/sister for lunch,I had el pastor sandwich, FABULOUS, going back 10/3 w/5 friends for dinner. Servers are very knowledgeable, easily explaining the menue,atmosphere very comfortable, CAN'T WAIT!!
Sharlene,
Phoenix top notch GO TO PLACE

OH K, Tues at Santisima with 5 friends,just FAB,food,friends,conversation & a wait person that knows the menue (Jose).
Pete had fish taco plate, Agnes had 3 taco plate, the same for her daughter,Donna,Dave & Elaine a soft taco each, they all had the Margaritas,my GO TO plate is el pastor burro, followed by coconut flan!
SUPERIOR! On my way to la santisima on 16st & Oak for lunch wed.10/11 who wants to join? Twice to Glendale now, can't wait for lunch on 16 st

Sharlene

La Santisima is a Mexican Restaurant with a unique menu that features many tacos some interesting and hard to find Mexican Foods like the Stuffed Chili with Walnut Sauce and the Mexican version of stuffed calzones called Quesa. Another one of the other unique features is  a very large salsa bar that has about 15-20 different salsas to try. The restaurant offers indoor and outdoor seating and it's done in a really cool Day of the Dead kind of theme. This location is in Old Town Glendale and they have their own parking lot.

I've been here a couple times since my first visit and a few things I loved before have been slightly different so I have to get that out there.

The Marlin Taco I had on my first visit tasted very similar to the Marlin Tacos I had in Mexico. They have a unique smoked flavor and were delicious with a similar flavor. On my most recent visit the Marlin Taco was still good but lacked the smoked taste and had little flavors on it's own. It was still good and packed with a very generous amount of filling but not the same.

I also tried the Whitefish taco. It was also packed with a generous amount of crispy battered fish and lots of cabbage dressed with a very mild cilantro dressing. It was good but also needed to be kicked up with things from the salsa bar. I added a squirt of lime juice, a little cilantro salsa and some strawberry salsa and then it was really tasty.

For me and the majority of people out there two tacos is all you can eat because they are double shelled and fully packed.

My husband had a three taco platter that comes with rice and refried beans. He got a pork taco, chicken tinga and a brisket taco that was grilled. The most perfect and favorite taco was the Chicken Tinga. It was very flavorful and made with moist dark chicken meat. The brisket had good flavors but it was stringy.

We were both really full so we took out a vegetable quesa (like a calzone but the dough is made with masa and it might be fried) to have latter because the quesa is usually really delicious and is a treat here. I don't remember what vegetables came in it on past visits but this time it was mostly just onions. I did find traces of spinach and mushrooms but it was filled with mostly onions and cheese and was still a tasty treat but it wasn't the same.

I still really like this place and service was ok too but some things aren't up there where they were before so I had to get it out there.

3 stars according to Yelp means A-OK

Great Salsa Bar!!! Awesome breakfast burritos made fresh :)
We also got to try the tiger shrimp tacos, steak tacos.

The service was very friendly and attentive, will definitely come back to try their margaritas!

My second time here and the food had been fantastic both times!  I got the Jamaica Rose Shrimp and La Nueva Ensenada and my husband got the shark taco.  We enjoyed everything very much and the service was speedy and friendly.  We also love the many selections at the salsa bar!

Oh.my. God. I have died and gone to taco heaven. Finding decent Mexican food as a vegetarian is hard, but I have succeeded! Not only were these the best vegetarian tacos I've ever had, but the best tacos I have ever had. Also the salsa Mexicana is to die for.

This location has much potential however do not expect any type of service here, the burro arabe was delicious but besides that my experience her was subpar. I wanted to visit this place because of the great salsa bar I had read about but once I was there, the salsa bar was sad and low stocked. None of the salsas looked fresh either. 

However, the fact that there's no customer service or organization of any kind, that is what ruins this place. 

Wish it was better, would be such an awesome place.
It was good. The only thing we didn't like was the wait time. Come early if you want a seat. Taco's were really good. I highly recommend this if you are in the area.

We went hiking the day after Thanksgiving and after that we were starving. I have been wanting to try this place out for a while, we loved it!! Not only did we enjoy the atmosphere & music, the food was seriously good!! I have to watch my carb intake and my husband discovered they had tacos protien style SCORE!! they were beautiful, looked like enchiladas.  I had the chicken tinga and gaucho steak tacos, the taste was an explosion sooo good!! Even the kids loved them. We really liked this place, the pictures of skeletons were awesome, our teen girls really thought it was cool! We will be back for sure!

This 4 is more like 4.5 stars and that's only because of the size and the 45 minute wait (which never end up really being 45 minutes.. and as a NYker.. this is not such a big deal.. it's the norm). When we had our food.. we understood why the name.. we reacted with "ay santisima" lol! 

The salsa bar is very creative and gave us mad options like the "peanut chipotle" and more. Now let's talk about these margaritas.. man oh mighty.. best margaritas I've had! and I've had my fair share of em! It's strong enough and they throw in a slice of grapefruit that really gives it a nice zing! The service was great, yes the bar is tiny and they clearly are understaffed but that didn't stop our server from giving us 5 star service! Drinks came quick and so did the food! Now the menu.. it can be a little intimidating and overwhelming with the immense options.. but definitely go for something you haven't had before, you won't regret it! I can't wait to go back!

as tony would say....'Grrrrreeeeeat' little taco shop 
just a little north of McDowell on 16th st, drive slow or else you'll miss it 
the shark taco were awesome, perfect crisp 
i did tried the carne asada meat, which could of used a little more favors 
the salas bar was pretty cool, lots of chooses 
the best part about the meal was the horchata....Mmmmmm 
my mouth waters just thinking about it 
it's about $4 or $5 for a 32oz horchata....better share it with someone 
they put fruits and peacan.....yummmm 
i would drive there just for the shark tacos and horchata

Love the margaritas, extensive tequila menu & the food is great! Great salsa bar! A great place to bring family & friends when visiting Phoenix. Only downside was that they are a little short staffed & takes a little while to get yr drinks & food. Plan to be there a little while, but in the end, it's all worth it!.

The food was phenomenal but overpriced. I took off one start because I felt like our waiter overhyped menu items, like the guacamole, which he told every table was selling out. It was a tiny cup of guac for $10 and was good, but not a must have item. 

The menu is unique and my friends and I enjoyed the flavors- best molé I've had!

Wow! 

I was pleasantly surprised when I stepped into this joint. The decor was fun, the restaurant was super clean and the food was so great! I am so excited that this is within walking distance of my home. 

YOU MUST TRY THE HORCHATA! It tastes like my mom's except better. Wait? Is that even possible? Yes! I swear to little baby Jesus that this is the best horchata in the universe. 

The Cochinita Pibil taco was great, the mole chicken taco was great and the salsa bar was killer. I tried 5 or 6 and they were fresh and uniquely flavored. 

The best part? Three people ate for 20 bucks! I could have eaten cheaper if I had not gotten the plate. I took half of the food home, if that is any sign of the healthy (but not overly large) portions here. One taco would have done it for me. 

I will be a regular at this place!  You should try it too! :)
I grew up in Arizona and this is the best horchata I have ever had. Salsa bar is fun and free. Artwork is gorgeous.
This is my new favorite taco shop! Cool vibe and excellent food! Order the protein style tacos! Low carb and super yummy! Load up on the salsa bar!
Good food best horchatas. Staff is good. I think the food became a bit greasier over the years. I would still go, but a little on  the greasy side for me.

Considering salsa is my favorite food group, La Condesa is a small piece of heaven. The carne asada and cabo shrimp tacos are delicious. This place gets very busy during lunch and is pretty cramped. Wouldn't recommend for large groups. Mmmmm salsa.

Not what i expected. I got a quesadilla and there was a puddle of grease on the plate. Not just a little grease, it was tons of it. I took a bite and it dripped down the side of my lip. Could only take 2 bites. I showed the waiter and he just shrugged his shoulders and apologized. I know he didnt cook it, but he didnt offer to remake it or worst case scenario take it off the bill. 2 street tacos and 2 bites of a quesadilla, that looked nothing like advertised for $21. Never again, lesson learned.

This place just keeps getting better and better. They have updated their menu which now includes red and green chili. I tried the red chili and it was amazing and truly unique. Also, great margaritas! Still one of my favorite places!

I'm convinced this place has THE best margaritas in Phoenix. I came here with some coworkers for happy hour once and discovered their amazing grapefruit margaritas. Then a few weeks later I went back for dinner and got their veggie quesadilla which was insanely good. Actually, it got really busy while we were there and our orders got misplaced so we waited about 30 minutes to get our food. We weren't in any sort of rush, so it was fine, but the server actually comped our meals which was unexpected, but totally awesome.

Be warned this place is TINY so if you've got a big group, prepare to wait. But trust me it's worth it. They also have a salsa bar in the back - my favorite was the pecan. Amazing.
Absolutely first rate, best Mexican (Oaxacan) food in town. Best I have ever tasted! Incredible flavor profiles. This is not your typical Mexican fair, it is bistro chef quality. Highly recommended!

Meh. The best part of my order was the rice. I had a taco combo plate with 3 tacos. The taco shells were way too crispy and dripping with grease. I could hardly bite them. Not really impressed with the flavors of the different meats I chose. For what I ordered, over-priced and the flavor was underwhelming.

Four stars for the tacos and salsa. Three stars for everything else. 

Coming here on a Tuesday night, it was packed. Oddly enough, there was a whole other room that seemed like a "group table" room, even though there was room for other people. I got seated fairly quickly since I was solo, but a group of four literally sat at the waiting area the entire time I was dining. I started off with their horchatas. I didnt like the fact that they only serve a 32 oz but I went with what they had. The horchata came off more like water than rice milk. They add alot of fresh fruit, which is great, but is hard to drink with skinny straws. Many of times the straw got clogged. Id recommend packing a boba tea straw. The flavor was mostly cinnamon, lacking a cream flavor. 

The chips are nothing special, but that salsa was something special. Not only do they have a wide variety of great flavors, but its all self serve! It was hard not to devour all the chips with that salsa. 

Service wise, it was lagging. The waiter didnt bring me water until 20 minutes after I sat down. At the time, i wa swell, hydrated, so I wasnt evem mad about it. I will say that I had to flag down the waiter everytime I needed something. 

I ordered the Santisima Taco and the Gaucho Quesidilla. the taco was superb. Great ingredients, great tortilla, and the shrimp was a nice addition! The salsa only made it better. The quesidilla was not exactly what I was expecting. They deep fry the thing, but its more like corn masa than flour. Its not bursting with flavor, but its decent. The ingredients inside of course were really good. the avocado and cheese they had on top of the quesadilla only enhanced the meal. 

I would be curious to try their Gaucho as a burrito. i wouldnt mind coming back here again, but I really hope they get better service. I know I wont be ordering that horchata!
Best margaritas I've EVER had. Tacos are fantastic, salsa delicious and authentic. Everything is fresh. Only downside is that it's quite small. Worth the wait and prices are great

This is as amazing Mexican restaurant that defies the idea that the only good Mexican food must use lard and have meat. They audio have a new team that provides great customer service.  Louts of vegetarian and vegan options, plus lots of meat and seafood options. Everyone can eat together without being an award existence. This is what eating out with friends should be!
This place is great... Thanks yelp for this place in town for a convention. Needed to find a lace with margaritas and tacos. Both exceeded expectations. Best place in phx that I have tried so far.

THE GOOD: cilantro crema salsa is still divine. salsa bar is still fun. drinky drink bar has been opened and liquor license granted since my initial 4-star review.

THE BAD: la condesa has gone well downhill in terms of food quality since i visited years ago. the crispy, delicious shrimp tacos i raved about previously are no longer the same menu item. they've replaced the large, succulent shrimp with smaller specimens that were decidedly not tasty or even beer battered. service still spotty.

THE UGLY: the food doesn't taste like there is a thoughtful process in its creation any more. have they changed owners? everything we ordered here was run-of-the-mill, not ravingly good as we'd experienced previously. the fish in their tacos was fishy, which is never a sign of freshness.

so disappointed because a meal here used to be worth a special trip.

Very under impressed.. Food was average and that is being generous.. Not to mention there was a hair in my food and they took it back, came back out and claimed it was "cheese" and still was charged for it.  The bathrooms are also disgusting.  Save yourself the time and go down the street to Carambas.
Believe the hype, yo. (And order the mole.)

I wanted to like this place ... I wanted to for it 5 stars but I can't. First off it's cramped and while it's possible to look past it if it was slightly cramped this place was trying to be the poster child for cramped. Don't come with a party of more than 2 for that's not gonna happen. Dropped a star for the cramp factor 
Another star goes for the restrooms.. Let's just say it's best to avoid it all together for there is no coming back once you go in...
Now that the negatives are out the door the food was good. By good I mean they have a real unique selection of salsas and the tacos are good too but really the seating takes away from the experience ... For me it did .. Your mileage may wary ..happy yelping

Salsa Bar, Mole Quesadilla, Chochinita Pibil, Tacos Al Pastor and Sonora Arrechera Tacos where really tasty and perfectly balanced. I loved every single bit. I cleaned the plate like never before my family did 2. Great horchata and decor of the restaurant, can't wait to comeback for more!!
