I've always passed by the place but didn't take notice until I got a groupon for it and wanted to try it out. I really liked the decor and the restaurant looks clean. The food I ordered was great and fresh, and the horchata was quite different from other places but it was pretty good. They had a wide variety of salsa, my favorite was the salsa pecan. I would most likely come back again for the food and good customer service.

This place is awesome the pastor tacos are delicious. The homemade salsa bar is authentic and has something for everybody. Would recommend this place if you like good Mexican food especially the street tacos.

Love La Condesa!  They have a fantastic salsa bar with delicious, interesting salsas and a range of fantastic tacos (something for everyone).  The environment is cozy, albeit a little small.  The only thing that would make it better is if it were BYOB (they recently started serving alcohol).  Phoenix needs more restaurants like this one!
Great service--Nick is stellar! Margaritas were great, food was delicious, salsa bar is fun, and all very inexpensive.

Here's what you'll like.
The salsa bar. 
It features about a dozen types of salsas, ranging from traditional to the more obscure pecan.
The cochinita quesadilla, which really doubles as a Mexican stromboli only deep fried and not baked, is a culinary triumph.
And the artwork, all of which macabre -  depicting 'Dio del muerto' scenes -  is erie to say the least, but colorful and provocative.

Here's what you won't like.
Your missing car if you don't lock it and set the alarm.
The chairs - likely designed by an orthopedic surgeon whose life's mission is to rid the world of scoliosis, one taco aficionado at a time.

In their defense, the chairs look to be some kind of Mexican relic, something they found in an old Mission or something. They're artsy and very heavy carved wood. 
One problem.
They're so heavy, when you stand up, attempting to furtively sneak to the salsa bar for the fifth time hoping no-one will spot your sloth-ass in the process, they'll give you up in a New York second as they make the most God-awful racket scraping the bare floor. 

I don't like it when I'm trying to be sneaky and some inanimate object signals everyone, warning them of my intentions to abscond with the entire salsa bar, greedily hogging it all to myself.
Customer service sucks!!! Waited 15mins just to get the menu. Food is good tho

One of my favorite Mexican food restaurants in the valley! I have been here a handful of times and always bring my guests from out of town! Love the salsa bar and they have great vegetarian options! Great atmosphere and a great location just north of downtown!

I ordered the shrimp and carnitas tacos (both delicious!)  and washed it down with an ice-cold Mexican Coke (the only soda I'll drink).  

The salsa bar is GREAT - variety. The walls are covered with local art. 

Con: There is nowhere to wait if the modest sized restaurant is full. No one wants to wait in the heat during the summer.
I've have now experienced the best steak taco in my lifetime!!! Hats off to you folks!! I will Def be back!!
Had a sample of tacos. The mole is amazing and so is the tinga!  The salsa bar is amazing with many delicious and spicy options. Don't be fooled by the guacamole...it is spicy but delicious.

Let me start by saying ..... This restaurant is hyped for NO reason. 
The horchata is definitely a fail in my books. There was too much going on in the horchata that I lost the taste with all the fruit in there including walnuts. It should just be called "Fruit Drink". You can't even get a sip with something coming up your straw. Also ABSOLUTLEY not worth 5$ !!!! FAIL

 To eat I got 3 Tacos (Carne Asada & Chicken Tinga) and rice and beans
The carne asada tacos were basic and tasted the same as any other place . I did enjoy the tinga taco it had a lot of flavor but nothing was good enough that would make me want to come back. 
My boyfriend got a deep fried carne asada quesadilla that he said was "good" but nothing amazing. 

All in All it's all hype 
You can get better tacos and Horchata at Ta Carbon!

Popped in here over the Labor Day weekend after reading the Yelp Reviews.  One word....WOW!

The tortilla chips were fresh and not soaked in grease, the 20+ salsa's were fresh and flavorful, the burritos and street tacos were some of the best we ever had.  To top it off, our server was wonderful.

It's a small place with 20 or so tables, if their busy I urge you to wait it out.  They turn the tables quickly and it will be with the wait!

This was a great spot. It looks a little sketchy but the food was so gooooood. My friend and I each got three vegetarian tacos and they were delicious. The salsa bar was great too. The mojito was the best I've had.

For the last several months America's Taco has ruled the downtown Taco scene.  Now just across the neighborhood a new rival emerges.  Not since Magic and Bird graced the hardwood have we seen the seeds for so tasty a rivalry.  
From the great Mexican artesenia laden decor to the great service to the impeccable salsa bar- try the strawberry or peanut salsa- the place is top notch.
The menu is diverse so it merits several repeat visits for purposes of exploration.  I'm still a novice but I am completely sold on the cochinita pibil.  The pork is as tender and flavorful as anything you will get up the street at the Barrio Cafe.  
The place is still young.  But the rate at which incredible reviews surface on Yelp , it is testament enough that it deserves your patronage.

If you're a fan of big fancy, red carpet joints, this is not the place for you. The service is not good, it is understaffed, the restaurant itself is small and there are a boat load of people there. If you like eating some kick ass Mexican food though, this place tops the list. I had the pork and bean burrito with a side of their chipotle salsa. The meat was so tender and the flavor was so developed, I wept a little with each bite. This is on my radar for the next time I come out to Phoenix.  Just hope they find a bigger location or open a taco truck.

The food is 5 +++ Stars! Completely unique and so flavorful. I can't say enough about the Quesa's (except I really hope they are fat free...hehe) Their tacos are even great after a 15 min car ride back to my home. Everything I have tried has been very tasty! 

The Salsa's are 5++++ Stars! The cilantro cream, holy moly can I have a gallon to put on anything and everything...I really  think it will make everything taste amazing!

Over all La Condesa is a great Gourmet Taco shop and the quality of the food definitely  puts the Gourmet in the name. I love using La Condesa as take home food for out of town guest, they are always impressed!

What knocks my review down a star, difficulty parking and the lack of AC in the summer. I much prefer to get it to go!
The absolute best Burros and street tacos for a great reasonable price!

This place was always good, except today was not too good.  It's bigger now.  Took 15+ mins to get seated although place was only half full at 2pm on Saturday.  Service was slow too.  Ordered large Guacamole it was small portion didn't look fresh, tons of other ingredients like cranberries and not enough avocados.  I had chicken burrito, but it was mostly beans.   My friend was way hungry but didn't finish his plate.... didn't like his plate either.  Maybe just an off day for them, not sure.

Worst service ever. I had chunks of bone in my chicken burrito, and no one came to check back to ask us how the food was. On top of that the place was small and claustrophobic, there was 3 groups of screaming kids that echoed the entire time we were there. I would not recommend this to anyone!!!
Love the salsa bar and the burritos are always great... not to mention the house margaritas.  Only wish the wait wasn't crazy but that's what happens when a place makes great food!
Just ok.  Not sure all the hype is about. I have a taco and chili verde burro ... eh.

I came here by recommendation from a friend and I couldn't have been more satisfied!! First off, it happened to be Taco Tuesday when I went so that meant $2 for all street tacos. Secondly, they have an unlimited salsa bar with ALL kinds of salsa (everything from traditional salsas like pico de gallo to interesting dips like peanut butter salsa). Thirdly, to top it off, margaritas are $4 all-day everyday...whaaaat?? These deals are almost too good to be true.

My boyfriend and I decided to order and share all five street tacos plus the "gourmet" baby shark taco. Each taco packed bold flavors in it - the al pastor was possibly the best spicy pork taco I've had (loved the pineapple bits in the avocado salsa!), the brisket in the chilango suadero was incredibly juicy, and the chicken tinga with pickled onions made a perfect combo. The star of the show though were the shark tacos. The fried fish had a light crispy beer batter, and each bite had delicious, tender, flaky baby shark in it. So good.

The only taco I probably wouldn't order again was the chicken asado. Not that it tasted bad by any means, but after eating all the other tacos, the flavors in this one were rather underwhelming.

Good service and great food. Absolutely will be back next time I'm visiting Phoenix.

Awesome Quesadillas. They are more like empanadas than quesidillas but they are so good. Try the mahi mahi, it was so fresh and the sause was wonderful. the salsa bar will show you a dozen different salsas. Really fun to try them all.

I love this place. I have been eating at the original one on 16st and palm ln for about 2 years. This one is even better!  I love the quesadillas. Not your moms quesadilla!  I almost always get th he chicken mole in the quesadilla.  Love it. I have tried almost everything.  I would also recommend chicken Tinga. Shrimp tacos are awesome. Try all 20 of the salsas. Including,  pecan, hicima.  Green toatilllo is awesome. The Margaritas are fresh with chunks of fruit! Yummy! Enjoy.

Terrific little place. The salsa bar is fabulous as others have noted. Everything looked fresh and distinctive. Had the Oaxacan Mole Chicken Queso. It was a large stuffed, perfectly fried stuffed tortilla. The chocolate mole was one of the best Mexican sauces I've had. A little spicy, a little bitter, and very savory. Haunting.

Recently some of my colleagues from Spain were visiting and on their last night in town, I offered to take them to dinner.   They immediately told me that they NEEDED to have authentic Mexican food and they really wanted tacos.   After searching through pages and pages of Yelp and Google, and polling my friends on facebook...I finally chose La Condesa over many strong recommendations of Los Dos Molinos, Barrio Cafe, Aunt Chiladas, and many more....   Now, I realized that never having been there myself before I was taking a bit of a risk...but my fellow Yelpers surely couldn't lead me astray, right?!   

Happily, they did not!   The food was delicious.  The four of us all ordered different kinds of tacos and we all loved our dishes!  I had the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco, which I DEFINITELY recommend!  The flavor was amazing! a little heat, a little citrusy....mmm mmm mmm!!   Two of my co-workers had the Carne Asada and they both raved about it the whole way home. we all shared an Horchata for dessert -- wow!  very good too!  It's a big drink, so I do recommend sharing - it's totally worth it!    Their bellies were content before the long flight back to Espana!   

The portions were good.  Not too big, not too small.  Two tacos were filling - I always like to know what to expect.  Nobody had any leftovers, so I think the portions were just right.  

Of course, the salsa bar is a key feature of this place.  I think we only made it through 5 or 6 kinds and I liked them all.   The mango one was one of my favorites, which is a surprise b/c I'm not usually a huge fan, but I loved the sweet and spicy combo - it was done just right.   

I've already sent the link to my foodie brother in law - the whole fam will be visiting for the holidays, we will definitely be going back!   This will be a MUST visit place for my future recommendations!  

Yeah!

Great spot!!! Artwork was amazing the bartender was so fun!!!!! Local hanging out .....the food was bomb diggity i had the carne asada plate wow! The margs off the chart ! Kudos guys welcome to the neighborhood!!!!

First time at this restaurant, love all the vegetarian options. The downside is the small parking lot. 
The cauliflower al pastor taco is amazing.

Honestly, if you like Mexican/Latin American food, eat here. The food is great!! I didn't care too much for the salsas because most were too spicy for me or just not to my liking...but I'll give them a pass-who needs salsa when the food is that good! The restaurant is small, and can be uncomfortable when full. But the place does have character, and our server was more than wonderful.

Great food can be served anywhere. My wife and me got lost couple of times while on gps!!duh! Who thinks of such a neat and cool place in this neighborhood. The food is great , really really great and their salsa bar is seriously awesome.thanks to all my yelp family for giving me this place!

Not worth the hype... waited 30 mins and got bland and flavorless fried pork quesadilla... Yuck. Unfortunately me and my pregnant wife we both ordered similar item she had chicken in hers and I was lucky one to get the deep fried chewy like gum fried pork which was Very bizarre. Horchata was again over hyped I felt. All in all it was 40 minutes wait time with my pregnant wife and garbage like taste at least what we ordered. The salsa's are not so great I can make better one in my Vitamix @home or you can get canned salsa's from food city which are far better.

May be the burritos and Tacos are good and I am writing this review if there are someone like me who might dislike deep fried chewy pork in Quesadilla.

It was $33 with tip $38 (I don't know why I tipped... lol)I  wish I wouldn't have gone there and would buy some food for hungry people on the streets with the same amount of money that would have given me much satisfaction. Will never go here again... If in FL try Senor Taco in St Petersburg and try all the items it's worth every penny. I am an Indian and trying to find a good Mexican restaurant but it's bland taste in Phoenix including this place.

The food was delicious! I ordered a margarita, the Fundido dip with chorizo, and tacos. Flavors were delicious and the quality was great! The menu is slightly overwhelming (in a good way), but provides GF, Vegan, and Vegetarian options as well! The open salsa bar was great!

This place has to get all five stars. Ok, the area is a little suspect I will admit; that can be countered with the excellent food and excellent prices. This is the kind of food that goes for $12 - $15/plate if it were located in an upscale area.  They have done a great job with the interior and the food is really wonderful.

5 Top reasons I love La Condesa:
 ~ Beautiful food. Unique flavors. 
 ~ Great salsa bar: aver a dozen lovely hand made salsas; I liked them all
 ~ Price: you can spend under $7 and have a really good meal
 ~ Convelient: It is only a 2 minute drive from 24th & Camelback.
 ~ Atmosphere: the interior and the service create a great place to dine.

***We eat out several times a week, and this place is now at the top of the list for my wife and I both.***

I will lead with saying that this place has awesome tacos. That said, the service is awful, at best. They seems to run 1 waiter/waitress at a give time which seems odd since they are always busy. Granted the place is small, but still too much for 1 wait staff to run, at a non stop pace. 

My bigger issue is how the act towards or treat customers. Below are a couple of lines I heard today a lone "you're going to have to wait at least 30 minutes, if you want to wait", almost seemed like they didn't want me to to stick around. When I sat at the bar which is supposed to be first come first served, I asked for a drink as I waited for my table. "Everything is first come first served, so you're going to have to wait for that too" is the answer I received. For a drink? 

Overall this was a strange and disappointing experience, and it was the second time something like this has happened. I really enjoyed their food, which makes it more disappointing that I likely will not be coming back.

Oh, La Santisima. I had this placed bookmarked as one of the places to check out when I was in town. I knew about the downtown location, however due to the parking and the location I was pretty iffy about it. When I learned that there was a second location with a private parking lot behind the shop, I jumped at it. I came here with some coworkers that were hungry for something new so as always they accompanied me in my food adventures.

So let's see, this building is right off a main road and it basically looks like a house. I got a little lost and turned a street early and had to get back on the road to turn again.  Inside the restaurant there were a lot of portraits of Dia de muertos (Day of the Dead) artwork and other artworks such as Luchadores on the walls which I thought was very interesting and it's something that I usually see when you go to a Mexican restaurant. It gives the restaurant an identity and something memorable when I think of the restaurant. There's indoors and outdoor seating, we sat inside as it was getting dark and it was still 100 degree weather outside.

I ordered the Al Pastor Burrito, which I can say wasn't really on the menu because I basically asked for it and wanted to see what they had. They obliged, and when it came out it was different as it had pineapples in it which was pretty interesting. I think even if they left out the pineapple, it would've been tasty. It was good. The restaurant also sported a full salsa bar, and you could get as much as you wanted and there were so many options. I didn't really use it other than to add some heat to the burrito. However, this burrito was pretty awesome, and one of the best that I had when I was in Phoenix (out of the limited amount of places I went to).

The Mahi Pastor Taco, was just okay. This was ordered after I finished the burrito, and we were just talking. Why not keep eating? So, the taco was pretty simplistic which wasn't bad, but I think it lacked a little bit of flavor. There wasn't really any special about it, but I keep thinking about the burrito. So if you're deciding to get this taco compared to the other ones, I say pass on this as you're probably missing anything.

And well, a margarita is a margarita. Nothing unusual or special there.

Overall, it was great. I think I would come back here if I was in town. The amount of food that you got compared to other places were comparable. We came here on a pretty empty night so the service was pretty good. I can't say for all times during the day, but my experience it wasn't bad.
This place is worth the lunch rush, the line always moves quickly & you can't beat the food. I've ordered the street tacos & El mariachi burrito enchilada style. Love the Jamaica.

As always, GREAT FOOD AND MARGARITAS. But service was the absolute worst. We received our margs after our tacos (which took 50 min) and they still charged us. Server didn't even apologize. Sucks to leave so disappointed from a favorite restaurant.

The best Mexican food around.
Salsa bar has too many options - cilantro salsa got me like crazy.
The classic lime margarita ( superb tasty), gandhi bowl, gandhi taco, vegan burro ( I don't remember the name) second one on their vegan menu- these are the things we ordered and every dish stands top.

Really liked it. FYI the waiting time is crazy. Entered at 8:10 and we seated by 9:00. I have no idea if they actually take reservations but a must try place.

Provender: tacos! On Saturday mornings they have both a breakfast and lunch menu. I ordered the guacho, espana, and mayan chochinita tacos, which were fantastic. The michelada was also delicious.

Prices: reasonable, the specialty tacos are about $5 each, but they have combos.

Parking: there are spaces on 16th and Palm lane.

People: fun for all ages.

Perks: the food is amazing. The artwork inside is dope. They also have a salsa bar with a wide variety of salsa. Oh, the wait staff are excellent. Jordan was such a cutie. If I lived here I would've asked her out . . . on a taco date!

We were so impressed with this place and so surprised we had never heard of it!

Salsa:
There are something like 20 different salsa to choose from in their salsa bar but our favorite was the salsa mexicana which was nice and garlicky with chopped cilantro. You scoop the salsas into little plastic containers similar to what you'd find in a taqueria but this is definitely a cloth napkin type of place. Luckily, there are free chips with which to try the many salsa so you can pick your favorite before you food arrives. 

Food:
So fresh, warm, and just plain delicious. We split the Santo Plato and Traditional Quesa. The Santo Plato comes with your choice of burro and taco with a side of calabacitas. We chose the fish taco which conveniently came with two pieces of fish and two tortillas so it was like having two tacos! It was traditional fried fish "Baja" style but it was light and crispy instead of greasy and came with a savory white sauce. The La Condesa Veggie burro was filled white Mexican-style rice (but not that orangish "Mexican rice" you see at fast food joints), Oaxaca cheese, mushrooms, spinach, poblano pepper, onions and fresh garlic. The burro is grilled after its assembled which enhanced the mouth feel. Crispy outside, soft inside. The calabacitas were just grilled green Mexican squash, nothing special. The Traditional Quesa was unlike anything I'd ever seen. They're made with a THICK, dense corn tortilla, stuffed with Oaxaca cheese, and then grilled for a nice crunch. These bad boys are HUGE and have so much cheese which made me relieved to be sharing. You have to eat it with a fork and knife but it was amazing with different salsa varieties drizzled on top. 

Drinks:
Try the Horchata! Best we've ever had. They put real fruit and pecans in it. There was some sort of strawberry syrup in the bottom but it was not overly sweet. The serving size is 32oz which was a lot bigger than we were expecting. We didn't get any alcohol but I overheard the guy next to us tell the waitress his margarita was amazing. 

Atmosphere:
Be prepared because this place it TINY! We got there at the right time because when we were leaving all of the 10 or so tables were full. People didn't have room to wait and some turned around and left as soon as they came in and saw how crowded it was. There is an itty bitty bar that a few people chose to wait at. The decor is cute but the custom made chairs were a bit fragile as I had to switch mine out due to the bottom falling out. 

Overall:
We know Mexican food and this may be the best we've ever had. We'll have to go back for a few more visits to be sure but for now we certainly left smacking our lips with the delicious flavors we had just tasted on our lips and on our minds.
First i wanted a quesadilla and they didnt have any cheese and then the waitress skiped our table and gave food to 2 other tables that got there after us.. never going back..

Hands down yum and fave taco place in town!!!!! Haven't tried the burros as I'm in love with the tacos... Love love the salsa bar as well! Cute inside, nothing fancy and a great place to take friends. If you like barrio, you will love la condesa (so will your wallet).

Oh. My. God.

Best taco I have ever eaten in my entire life. No lie. My husband and friend said the same thing when they took their first bites.

The salsa bar is great, too, but OMG those tacos.......

So whenever former Phoenix Yelper Jim W arrives or departs, you can count on a dust storm, a big one.  It's like he's got his own set of haboobs.  But when he suggested La Condesa, I said to hell with a clean car and clean hair.  It was about time I met La Condesa.  And the pleasure was all mine.

First off, the salsa bar is more like a salsa buffet.  And the guacamole..yum, it had mango in it!  Not sure if that's a seasonal thing, but it was tasty.  The carne asada taco was good, but the Mayan Cochinita Pibil taco (let's just call it shredded pork) was so far beyond good, you have to taste it to believe it.  And I suggest you do, soon.

Feel like I'm just repeating what everyone said but it's that good. We went on a Saturday about 1pm and the place was packed. We waited about 15 and got seated.  Great service and salsa bar. Got the carne asada tacos and they were delicious. With the many salsas that they have you can really add many different flavors to your tacos. Loved it but I think next time I will go during off peak hours

The salsa bar is "all that and a bag of chips!" "Since when do you go to a salsa bar, where the salsas are actually really full of flavor, thick (not watered down), and unique?!" as my friends put it so well! It's sounds strange, but the pecan salsa was delicious! The peanut salsa was still spicy but had a hint of peanut in it, so it wasn't overwhelmingly "peanuty." There was a strawberry rhubarb pepper type of salsa. This may sound a little too strange for most, but it was almost like a spicy dessert type sauce. Don't forget to order some margaritas to wash those salsa and chips down. I would say you could get filled up on salsa, chips and margaritas alone here and be more than satisfied, but I'm not sure the owners would be too happy about that! The salsa variety was nothing less than astounding! And don't worry your precious little heart. There are traditional ones too: green tomatillo, chipotle red pepper, jicama, and cilantro... just to name a few!

Slow roasted cochinitas pibil (pork) tacos, slow cooked chicken mole tacos, beer battered Dogfish shark tacos, battered shrimp tacos, el gaucho steak in chimchurri sauce tacos with guacamole. Oh gawd, yes! And affirmative... these were all eaten in one sitting.... well, with a little help from Bryan too. He's so thoughtful for that too. I might have died from eating too much. We live so far from here that I just wanted to "stock up," and I came oh so close to having to be rolled out of the place like that "blueberry girl" from Charlie and the Chocolate Factory!

The fish burrito here is my favorite and don't forget to try the horchata--best I've had! They load it with extra cinnamon, pecans, cantaloupe and strawberries. 

The salsa bar is amazing and the quesadillas are deep fried--yum!

I like this place... there are a lot of interesting salsas to taste and the people were very friendly. However, the meat taco I had (it was recommended) was dry and not very flavorful. The vegetarian one was pretty great though- both could have used more spice. All in all- the location is cool and small- I like that it is unique for Phoenix, and I would definitely come back if I was in the area- I just wish their food was a little more spicy.

Excellent and unique!!  The steak quesadilla is huge...a meal in itself.  It was fried to crispy, flaky perfection.  The tacos - el gaucho steak and cochinita pork - were very delicious.  Prices were very reasonable, especially considering the quality of the food.  It's a smaller place but we went at 4 pm before it got crowded.  It's a must for taco lovers.

Simply put - if you don't think this is 5-star food I don't know what to tell you.  Salsa bar is amazing and had things I've never seen before - and it was amazing.  If I could only drink and eat chips and salsa , I'd still give it 5-stars.  Tons of taco options. Their quesadillas are more like empanadas and fried (super delicious.)  Go here...and prepare to come back often...

I like this restaurant because the street tacos were very good and all of the different salsas to pick from were very tasty. I especially like the chipotle salsa, It took me to flavor town. The restaurant was very colorful and nicely decorated. The plates were neat and the staff was very nice and helpful.
Worth the wait. The quesadilla is the best. It's like a Mexican calzone you need to try it. Delicious salsa bar and food.

Salsa bar is second to none.  They must have 20+- Salsa's to choose from.  The food is quite good as well.  That being said, and it just may have been an isolated incident, but our car window was broken out while dining.  We informed the workers and they did not seem surprised.  My guess is this has happened before and will happen again.  If I go back, it will not be in my car.

I almost feel useless writing this review, I think everyone has said it all.  But still, I liked it just that much that I want to have my say anyway!

I had one shrimp taco and one pibil taco.  The pibil was...... just... so, so so so good.  It made me want to exit through the kitchen and shoot the chef a la Johnny Depp (*i will not shoot any chefs, please do not report me).  The tortillas were just right, and I already want another one.

The shrimp taco.... I hate to say it but it WAS bland.  Not bad, just not very flavorful.  I poured on a bunch of the Cilantro Cream salsa, which didn't add much.  I'll stick with the pibil!

On to the salsas:  Believe the hype over this strawberry salsa.  Who the heck thinks these things up??  Regardless, it's brilliant and I hope they start selling it by the jar.  I was super excited about the cilantro cream, but it fell a little flat.  Like the shrimp tacos, it was good, just not filled with flavor.  The only other salsa I had was the plain old salsa, and it was really great as well.

And as for the horchata, I have never had horchata like that.  It really was delicious, but just so sweet and rich that I don't think I even finished 1/4 of it.  And for some reason, you can't get a smaller size.  But for a few sips after your meal, mmmmmmmmmm.

Dave B is right about the price.  BUT, we each got 2 tacos, and neither one of us finished them both.  I really think that splitting a 2 taco meal, combined with the DELICIOUS tortilla chips, is more than enough for 2 people.

As others have mentioned, the artwork is just stunning.  I love Day of the Dead art, and these were beautiful.  

In short, the Yelpers are all right.  Just go, and thank us later.

My husband and I stopped by on Sunday for lunch. We were both blown away by the quality of the food. My husband ordered the carne asada street tacos.... He ate everything and loved it. I ordered the Gandhi vegan burro with red enchilada sauce over it. I highly recommend it to anyone. It was huge so I had to take half home. However, it was so delicious I ended up eating the remainder several hours later for dinner. The house margarita is definitely worth the order as well. Mixed perfectly! We were both truly blown away- well for two gringos born and raised in AZ who've had our fair share of trips to numerous cities in Mexico. This place is small- roughly 32 people can dine in. While we were there there was not one empty table. I'm glad we stopped in- we will be back.
You know you are the right place when the abuela's are waiting for a table and the drinks taste like the Mexican Rivera. Bonus points for vegan and veggie option that taste great!
Delicious! The quesadillas are a must have. Loved the salsas, had many to pick from. Highly recommend this yummy place.

This is one my favorite taco places but today was a disappointment.  Service was bad, the tacos were super dry and over cooked.  I ordered the street tacos.  Even the rice was dry out.  The caldo de mariachi was too salty with flavor. The margarita was too sweet. Had to ask for flatware, napkins and water refill.
The chile en nogada taco is unforgettably amazing.  The salsa bar is delicious.  The mole was underwhelming.

I was looking forward to trying this place and was disappointed. Apparently they have recently expanded and could definitely not keep up with the demand. My husband and I ordered two margaritas after we finally got greeted by our server. The margaritas took about 15 minutes to reach us. Food took a very long time also, the servers were doing what they could but they are definitely understaffed. If you are going to expand your location you should also hire more employees to keep up with the demand.

By far the best mexican food I've found in Phoenix, and trust me, I've eaten at almost all of them :)  I tend to get their street tacos with either pastor or carne asada, but everything is good here.  They have an awesome little salsa bar with like 10 different kinds of salsa.  I live in Anthem and we drive out of our way 30+ minutes to eat here it's that good!

All of these years I've been living downtown just down the street from here and I haven't been until today. Everything here is amazing. Amazing. Amazing. Except the service. In their defense, the restaurant does warn you that the dining area has recently expanded and they are relying on a small kitchen. Too bad our food and drinks were out right on time. Our server was hard to find and not very friendly. That's a shame. 

Now that we've gotten that bad stuff out of the way let's talk about the fun stuff. First, the salsa bar. Oooo girl. There's something like 15 salsas and sauces here. They're all amazing but I'd recommend the pecan salsa. You do get a free bowl of chips, but it is 2.70 for another one. A little disappointed about that since there's so much salsa to try but that's okay. 

Second, dranks! We ordered the blue devil margarita, which was full of fruit and sweetness almost like an amazing marg-sangria hybrid. My table also got a huge michelada and some other regular margaritas. All were absolutely delish. 

Last, but not least, those tacos tho!!! There are just too many to list here but out table ordered some of the best looking ones, mahi al pastor, baby shark, tiger shrimp, battered and fried avocado, cauliflower, and Barbacoa. The Barbacoa was certainly the least exotic but my favorite. The tortilla was softly fried and just tooooo good. The vegetarian and vegan choices were numerous if that's your kind of thing. Much appreciated to see a restaurant that serves lots of options for those with dietary restrictions other than just another damn salad! 

Get here now because you are missing one of Phoenix's greatest hits!
The Queso Fundido with the mushrooms and poblano peppers was delish.   Loved the mole tacos.   Outstanding food.

My husband and I came here for a late lunch/early dinner today (Sunday). It's pretty small and kind of feels like you're at a friends house which is a nice change of pace. 

Pros:
The food was GREAT. I had a veggie quesadilla but it was more like a Mexican calzone- I had to eat it with a fork. Seriously so much flavor and it was big enough to eat half and save for later but I'm a bad ass and ate almost all of it because that's how I roll.

My husband (the picky one) had a carne Asada burrito- just steak, beans and cheese plus he added sour cream. Two bites in we were already making plans to come back.

There were plenty of vegetarian and vegan options so I'm excited to go back and try something different next time!

They have a huge salsa bar but half of the salsas were missing descriptions so it was kind of a guessing game.

The horchata was huge and came with fresh fruit, nuts and cinnamon on top. It was good but not as thick as expected (I'm just a white girl from Kansas so I'm not an expert).

Cons:
Parking can be a pain- I tried to come on a Saturday night and eventually gave up because I was already in a bad mood.

The chips were nothing special and salt would not stay on! They were free though so not holding that against them. 

From the one $, I expected the prices to be cheaper. I wasn't even sure if there would be waiter service. For a burrito, quesadilla, horchata and two negra models (on special) it came to $32 and change plus tip.


Overall, we were very satisfied and will definitely be back.

This place is not for people who are looking for fast food experiences...... it's slo-mo in every way and well worth the mouth watering delicious food they bring to your table ..... so many different salsa selections even one with a peanut butter base maybe my favorite..... so unique and delicious..... it's unbelievable!!!! Please take the time and visit!

Worst experience, this place has gone way down hill. Called ahead to see if they had guacamole before making the 45 minute drive was told yes they had plenty and weren't close to running out. On arrival was told they were out of guacamole. Food took 50 minutes to get the table and two of the orders were supposed to be 3 chicken street taco plates server came to the table with brisket when we told him that we ordered chicken he came back 5 minutes later with undercooked chicken tacos. Server changed twice and more than 10 servers were standing around while cups and chips were empty.  The bar tender stood in the bar and was eating while behind the bar. One of the servers stood on a bar chair and the bar top to refill the horchata. Super gross super bad service very disappointing no refund was offered.
Ok this place is definitely over rated! The food sucks and the waitress couldn't make a margarita to save her life. It is also very pricy and you are better of going to a taco stand!

This is about authentic as it gets. Amazing salsa bar, margaritas, rice and beans are worth it too. When we were here, the fire department stopped to eat here so you know its good. The wait was worth it for sure. Its nothing fancy in here but the food is really good.
My wife brought me here for my birthday last year I'm going to tell her to bring me again just because the food is great

My boyfriend and I visited recently because we both wanted some good authentic Mexican food. It was my first visit but he's been many times before. 

Even on a Monday at 130, which we thought would be after the lunch rush, we still had about a 20 minute wait. And then when we were seated, we waited another 15ish minutes just for someone to wait on us - no water or drinks in that entire period. However, we made about 3 trips up to the salsa bar, almost just to pass time, but also because he is addicted to the peanut sauce.

But luckily it was all uphill from there. Once our server did come to us, we placed our order right away. I got an orange Margarita (funky, but good) and he got the gigantic horchata, which was sweet, but just not really for me.

I decided on the street taco plate - 1 chicken, 1 carne asada, and 1 chilango, plus rice and beans. My boyfriend got a chicken quesadilla.

For street style tacos, it was definitely a good amount of food. And his quesadilla was gigantic. But oozing with cheese, so we knew it was going to be good.

It was my only meal of the day, but we both finished our plates and didn't have a single regret in the world after that.

It's worth the wait and you get a good amount of food for the price you pay.
Amazing! The best Mexican food I've EVER had! Get the horchata, you'll be thanking me later!

I absolutely love the food here as I am an avid Mexican food enthusiast. Everything I've had here tastes delicious - from the tacos, burritos, tortas, and quesas (like a quesadilla but made with a fried corn tortilla) which are a must try! The only reason I didn't give a 5 star review is due to the mediocre service. It sometimes takes over 10 minutes to have someone come over and put your name in and the table service is average every time I've been. Nonetheless, I continue to come here regularly because the food is so tasty!
Been there not so much anymore s***** food was great people think they know what they're doing not so much

First time visiting here. Got there about 1130am and it wasn't packed yet.

You grab a menu as you enter and order at the register. They give you a number and bring the food to your table.

We got a variety of tacos, chicken tortilla soup, fresh guac, etc.

Everything was very good. The salsa bar had a lot of items and red/green sauces, pico, etc.

I enjoyed all the food and will definitely be back when we're in Phoenix again.

Life is all about creating a balance. This idea translates to a restaurant with its elements of food, service and decor.

The gourmet taco shop La Condesa is still trying to find its own equilibrium, but the line of customers nearly out the door isn't giving the new establishment much of a chance.

La Condesa is located on 16th Street, just north of McDowell, in a neighborhood that's no stranger to tasty Mexican food, including Tortas El Guero and the popular Barrio Cafe.

With no shortage of good Mexican food, how does a new place stand out? They do things their own way.

You'll notice striking artwork on the walls. The art is beautifully lit, and from a visual standpoint it's hard to look away, that's until you see the salsa bar.

Once you place your order at the counter, you're given a number. Then have a seat and a staffer will deliver a basket of crunchy chips. This is when the fun begins, tapping that salsa bar.

On each of my visits, the salsa line up was never quite the same, with at least six to choose from. Standouts include an Avocado Salsa that was vibrant and flavorful, the chunky salsa Mexicano and the Creamy Cilantro Salsa.

If you run out of chips they will refill your basket, but try not to fill up on chips while you wait for your food, because you will indeed wait, and wait, and wait... On each of my visits the kitchen took from 15 to 45 minutes to deliver my order. But don't let this discourage you because some things are worth waiting for.

The tacos are served on two 6-inch corn tortillas. You can order tacos ala carte ($2.99 each) or as a two taco plate ($6.99) with rice and beans.

The beer battered Cabo Shrimp version was hot and fresh, yet perfectly crunchy while leaving the shrimp moist and tender. The Sonoran Carne Asada had a great flavor but was more like jerky, tough and dry.

Burritos were mostly a miss, while paying a premium ($7.29). You can choose shrimp or mahi mahi. Mine were filled with too much rice and not enough seafood.

However the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Burro ($6.99) was an absolute killer. Filled with luscious roasted pork shoulder, it was so tender you don't need teeth to eat it.

The handmade Corn-Quesa is going to bring me back. They take fluffy corn masa and fold it around your selection of fillings, then use their deep frying to create a unique and substantial alternative to tacos and burritos.

Being a purist, the Traditional Quesa ($5.49) was one of my favorites, simply filled with gooey Oaxaca cheese.

The same Oaxaca cheese is paired with the earthy flavors of mushrooms in the Maria Sabina Quesa ($6.99).

For me, the thing to order is the Azteca Tinga Quesa ($7.29). Stuffed with shredded chicken, tomato, onion and chipotle sauce, the flavors were complex and each bite was sheer bliss.

Service is friendly and on some nights you might even see the owner's kids helping out.

This place would be five stars, but the service is slow.  If you see a nearly empty restaurant, do not assume that things will be speedier.  The servers are friendly and you will be seated promptly, but beyond that  expect a bit of a wait. 

Atmosphere is not the best, its actually a bit dull.  But I do like the decor, which is dia de muerta and graffiti type canvases on the wall, and beautiful solid wood doors that I wish I had at home.

So why four stars?  The food is good!  I have had the Sonoran Carne Asada Taco, Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco, Cabo Shrimp Taco, and the Sonora Arrachera Quesa.  They were all very good, but my favorite was the Sonora Arrachera Quesa.  Very fattening, but well worth all the calories.  They have a salsa bar with a diverse array of choices, and I do enjoy the all the exotic options.  Oh and the Horchata is decent.

Unfortunately, I believe they will not last too long.  It is always empty, and they are closing earlier every time I visit.  Maybe location is not the greatest, and the service is sluggish, but I really hope they stick around.

I love the different kinds of tacos here. You can get fancy tacos or simple street tacos. The al pastor street tacos are delicious. The salsa bar is very fun! I am glad they expanded because there was always a wait.

The food is great, the local area is a little on the sketchier side but the salsa bar makes it worth it.

Get the tacos: steak and fish are the best

Ppl do park in the dirt lot next to it if they run out of space. There's also an asian market you can park at and walk if need be.

We came here because of the great yelp review the restaurant have but I think I may have visited this place at a wrong time. First of, we weren't acknowledged when my family and I came in. We wasn't sure if we were supposed to choose our own seating or someone would assign one. Took about 5-10 mins for the server to ask if we wanted something to drink. She the brought the chips and most of the salsa are out and not being replenished at the salsa bar. All three women servers are walking around and passing us like we have not been waiting for 40 minutes for one order. I had to really wave at the server to get her attention. The order finally came in after waiting for 1 hour and to top it off, the server handed us our food without any apologies for the long wait and not even an eye contact. I'm all about customer service and if I was to based my rating on their service that night, it would be a 1 star. The food was great tho, but definitely not worth waiting an hour especially when the restaurant is not even pack.
Best Mexican food I've had in a long time. Good atmosphere.
First time here tonight. So delicious! Loved the salsa bar. Loved my tacos and husband loved his burrito! Wish we lived closer and could add this place more often.

The food is always great,  I have been here maybe 5 times and only one of those times were we waited on in a timely manner.  They drop the menu off and then go away for at least 10-15 minutes.  For some reason the wait staff refuses to write down any orders.  I'd rather they write them down instead of getting them wrong. The lack of staff is the downfall of this place.  Can't deny the meat and the food is fantastic.

I absolutely adore this restaurant and thought it was time I gave a review. The Santisima shrimp tacos are to die for - simple as that. Everything I've ever had here has been flavorful and uniquely delicious, and the homemade salsa bar is the icing on the cake. The only criticism I can offer is that they're a bit on the slow side in terms of bringing out food, particularly for to-go orders if you don't call ahead, but I can't blame them for being busy or successful!

The La Santisima Specialty Taco was delicious. Best ever.

The Salsa Bar is amazing. 

I'm going to bring my friends back here.

The owner called me by name, that felt good. This was my first visit.

ordered:
- taco trio
- quesa
- burro
- horchata w/ fruits and pecans [best drink ever]

pros:
- amazing salsas, the pecan salsa and one of the spicy ones stood out to me
- quesa was crispy/ cheesy goodness, can't have a normal quesadilla again
- portions were large

cons:
- located in a seedy area
- service is a little slow
Great service. The best actually. I'm not familiar with Mexican food and the staff were very helpful and and polite. The staff, as well as the food made this eat out trip great.

Santisima is still a great restaurant, though the wait times are still long and they could use some improvement with increased wait staff. The mole quesadilla with chicken is delicious as is the horchata which delightfully has cinnamon, fruit and chopped nuts to accent the flavor. The prices have gone up, which is a pity. The expansion next door has opened up the space which makes seating easier though you still have to wait a bit too long to get your order (worth it though...the food is delicious) Still love the artwork and decor which is based on Mexican La Lllorona and Day of the Dead themes. Alan our waiter was fantastic, personable, and hard working. Would give place 5 stars if they could just get more efficient between seating time and getting served the meal.

Dropped by La Santisima on a Friday afternoon around 1:00 pm to grab a late lunch. Initially, I had a bit of a hard time finding the place, but it was bit easier to see once I located the parking lot behind it. There was plenty of seating inside and we were given water and a giant bowl of chips after we were seated. In terms of food, I literally cannot start talking about anything else before I rave about the salsa bar. There are literally 10+ selections of salsa from guacamole salsa to sesame salsa and more typical salsas like salsa verde. I went berserk getting a bunch of the salsas and tried a good deal of them. It also helped that they gave us a giant heaping pile of chips to try all the salsa with. 

In terms of actual food, I got the La Santisima Veggie taco and the Mexica Ahuacatl taco. My friend on the other hand had the 3 taco plate with rice and beans. Both of the tacos I ordered were guuureat though I did like the La Santisima Veggie taco a lot more than the Mexica Ahuacatl. I did steal a bite of my friend's rice and beans and it was also super delicious! My friend enjoyed all 3 of his tacos (2 meat, 1 fish) even though his order was slightly incorrect. Overall, the food was great and service was good. The only downside was that they didn't have the guacamole when we went! Definitely need to go back and try it!

we love fish tacos, but find it hard to find good, "authentic" ones near our house without paying scottsdale prices. i've heard of La Condesa, but since it's out of our "circle of convenient driving distance" we never think of it. 

thanks to the wife, we were all set to meet some friends here last night. we first noticed that is an actual sit-down restaurant. i assumed with all the hype, it would be a grungy, post-soviet area looking eatery (re: carolina's), but no....it was nice inside, replete with some beautiful dia de los muertos paintings. 

we had to wait about 30 minutes for a table to open up. once seated, we were brought a jug of water and some chips. then the fun began! trying out each one of the approx 15 salsa's at their salsa bar. i liked many of them, but wound up going back to the traditional salsa and pico. of note, the cilantro, pecan, and strawberry salsa's were good, but only for a few dips. 

i ordered one each of the shark, the shrimp, and the veggie tacos. they are small but packed with flavor. so juicy, they come stacked on 2 small corn tortillas. i actually savored the veggie and the shrimp instead of wolfing them down. both very tasty with that mexican sauce they put on them, and the fried shrimp were perfect...not caked in batter, but just a light dusting. i didn't get to the shark ones because i was so full, so it's in our fridge waiting to be eaten. i also ordered a margarita...it was rather delicious!

there are so many choices of tacos, burritos (with/without the tortilla) and fajitas...and several for veg heads. it's difficult to pick 2...which is why we must definitely go back!!!!!

Best fish taco in Phoenix by far! I have ordered other things on the menu but the best thing is definitely the fish taco. Chips and salsa bar are great as well. 

Also, one of the best horchatas I have ever had. The restaurant is pretty small though so sometimes its hard to get a seat if it's busy.
We tried three different tacos (chicken/shrimp/veggie) ... they were great !!! Also the margarita mamasita was amazing.

Between the friendly atmosphere, the cost seating, and the to die for tacos - this place is truly five stars. You would be lost in Phoenix without their salsa bar. I absolutely recommend making your way to this taco haven.

food was pretty alright.  the menu is quite extensive, it can overload people if they don't really know what they want.  I had to ask for suggestions since there was so much going on.  the hostess/server made a couple suggestions for me though, and i was pleased with what i received.

the organization with staff though really needs to be improved like others have said.  all the servers and hostesses appear to be college aged girls yet they don't seem to know what's going on when the place gets crowded.  after i had been seated, we still waited 20 minutes for someone to take our order and it wasn't even the server that's supposed to take our table.  it was the hostess that took our order and told us "our" server would be by with out food.

i like the food, not the disorganization though
Seriously fantastic. Friendly. Delicious. Salsa bar. Enough said!
Really good street tacos, the spicy chicken and spicy pork were awesome! Def a true az Mexican taco shop! Will be back again for sure!

A happy series of events led me here when I had initially planned to go somewhere else and I am so glad that I did. The tacos are amazing, of course. My personal favorite was the mole taco but it's hard to pick just one because everything I had was so good. Wonderful interior décor and a very relaxed and intimate atmosphere. I fully intend to come here as often as I can. Oh, and the horchata was phenomenal. All in all, easily the best taco place I have been to.

In town for the weekend and my girlfriend found this little taco place. The tacos here are pretty darn good. She and I split a shrimp taco, carne asada taco and a pork taco. They were all pretty tasty. They have a bunch of homemade salsas but none really knocked my socks off. I tried five different salsas hoping one would catch my attention but I was kinda disappointed. Luckily the tacos were really good.

I'm not even sure why this place has so many reviews. I try to be nice about reviews cause I know how this effects various businesses. We went here on a Saturday night (group of 9); and before I even decided to rate this place.... I went around asking the entire crew what they would rate this place ... all of them either said 1 or 1.5 out of 5 stars.. When we got in, we had to wait for 45 mins to get a table... I mean that's understandable given the fact that we were a large group... once seated.... everything is just so slow. We ordered and the food literally took about 45-50 mins to come out. That's way too long. The waitress was nice. (only reason why I'm giving them a one star). I advise this business to give chips for free since the wait is so long. Anyways, overall ... not too happy with the service.. and the food wasn't all that at all. There's a lot better Mexican restaurants around!

The menu is overwhelming and bursting with options. My friends were disappointed that quite a few of the selections weren't available. The burritos were mostly rice and the quesadilla was deep fried which was light on filling and mostly fried dough. BUT. My tacos were great. Really really very good. And the salsa bar was a really cool concept full of many different flavors. The service was poor and at times we though our server was kind of rude. I would go back for sure. But o my to stick with the tacos. Take the service with a grain of salt and you'll be fine

Amazing tacos and Mexican food in a very small settings.  The only limitation is its size which adds to the charm. The food is amazing service is good and the salsa bar will help you explore aside to salsa you never knew existed.

I had a pastor street taco and it was damaging! Very tasty! I also ordered a steak quesadilla but it was nothing like the quesadilla I know...it looked like a calzone...the dough tasted a little weird but the filling was delish!

This place is amazing. We had the horchata, a burrito, and an assortment of tacos.  As mentioned by others it is a smaller space, but the service is fast and good. They also load you up with chips and the salsa bar has a great variety of things to try. You can snack away some of your hunger if you are starved.

I stumbled across La Santisima as I was street art hunting nearby. I had read some reviews so I decided to drop in. The salsa bar is a lot of fun with a ton of options. I had 4 tacos. The grilled shark, delicious. The specialties, fully loaded. Mole, rich chocolaty goodness. And Gaucho, Argentina steak with a vinegar twist. Everything was a delight and modern. The tortillas were excellent and I ate way too many chips. I highly recommend going.

Delicious food and excellent service!! If you plan on coming here during your lunch hour I recommend you call ahead. Wait time can be a bit lengthy if you have limited time. The people here are friendly and very professional.

Yum, tacos... Ok the thing that stood out the most was how fresh everything was. The salsa bar..a definite plus... I love a good salsa... My favorite the Strawberry Salsa.  Wholy cow was that good! The quesadilla was bigger than I've ever seen I couldn't finish it!!  Loved, loved loved the artwork, The only negative I could find was that the furniture for some reason felt a little awkward like I was in everyone's way while they were trying to get in line to order, but that really has nothing to do with the food.  I'm givin' this place a thumbs up... authentic and delicioso!

yep...pretty much my new favorite taco shop in the valley...I tend to stay away from beef so carne asada holds no appeal for me...BUT this place has a little bit more of a variety of tacos-I had the Oaxaca black mole chicken shark taco and the mole was the perfect mix-just spicy enough....and the salsa bar made me giddy!  I can't wait to go back. YUM!

Another review by BAM
You got to get in here Homes!

I had the namesake taco plate with chicken and and the sides of black beans and rice. 

All these great tastes...let me start with the sautéed Spinach...Spinach, What? That's right.

I'm RUINED. I can never have another taco without thinking of this beautiful gastronomic experience, deep in one of the hood. I will never be the same.

When you find this gem, don't see it and pass it by, turn around. "IT'S ALL GOOD..."

Family recipes. I asked the owner of these recipes were from "Abuelita" and he said yep. From the Family all the way.

Killer Homes. Your mouth gonna be broke!

Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco
A Baja Sur specialty! Corn tortilla stuffed with beer battered dogfish shark.

Cabo Shrimp Taco
A Cabo specialty! Corn tortilla stuffed with beer battered shrimp.

Sonoran Carne Asada Taco
A Sonoran specialty! Arrachera steak marinated with Mexican herbs, fresh garlic & olive oil, charbroiled with mesquite charcoal.

Aztec Tinga Taco
A Mexico City specialty! Freshly made shredded chicken with tomato, onion & Aztec chipotle salsa.

Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco
A Yucatan specialty! Roasted pork shoulder with achiote rojo, wrapped in banana leaves and slow-cooked until fork tender. Topped with lime marinated onions & Salsa Habanera Maya.

Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken Shark Taco
A Oaxacan specialty! A legendary blend of spices, chiles, nuts and chocolate made into a rich and flavorful sauce, mixed with shredded chicken.

La Condesa Veggie Taco
Toasted Oaxacan cheese, mushrooms, Poblano pepper, onion, spinach & fresh garlic, grilled with olive oil.

Me and my girlfriend were watching Diners, Drive ins, and Dines when Guy stopped here. We realized they were about 15 minutes away so we thought to check it out. It's a tiny little hole in the wall place that has about 10 tables. It can get kind of cramped but it is definitely worth it when that food hits your tongue. This place has the best mexican food! The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because of how tiny it is and the fact that you have to pay $2.40 to get extra chips. Aside from this, this place is awesome!

Ok so my friend hyped this place up pretty high. "Best tacos ever". I thought, yea right. But he wasn't kidding. Awesome salsa bar. Vegetarian options. Only drawback is the seating (our table was uneven/wobbly and it was a bit crowded- close together tables and pretty much full)

My review if for take out only, I have never dined in, this is the place for some heavy duty take out burros.And when I say heavy duty, be prepared for a couple of burros in that bag to weigh about 3-4 pounds. The burros are so big, you will have 2 meals in one (so it makes up for the price)  AWESOME food!!! Best bean and cheese burritos in town (The Bullet Burro) hubby orders the Mariachi Loco Burro. I love their guacamole salsa.

I had heard a lot about this place and was excited to try it. Went for lunch on a Sunday, wasn't too busy. Was promptly seated and brought chips and order was taken. Very nice salsa bar with a lot of different salsas and big vegetarian menu. I ordered 3 different vegetarian tacos. 40 minutes later, food had still not arrived. By the time it finally did, the food looked great, until I noticed there were 3 pieces of hair in my food. Ended up leaving hungry. Can't believe that after a nearly a 50 minute wait, I was served food with hair in it. Will not be back.
Absolutely the best Mexican food that I have had outside of Monterrey, MX! We were waited on by the owner and we had 5 star service. We will be back as soon as possible.

O M G ! ! !
Not what I was expecting. An absolute delight from the moment I walked in the door. Do not miss the salsa bar. What amazing flavors they concocted. Each one unique and complex in flavor. I had the steak sandwich. I understand they make the bread there. It was fresh with a moist and firm inside and a crisp yet delicate crust. The meat was prepared in a way I have never had before but dying to go back and have again. A balance of flavors. I can't wait to go back !!! This place is AWESOME!!

Visiting from California for the weekend. We found this gem on Yelp and thought we would see what the hype was all about. 

We ordered a cadillac Margarita, skinny Margarita, queso funido, fish taco, shrimp taco, carne asada burrito bowl and EVERYTHING was amazing!!!!!!!!!!!

We can't wait to come back!

Small little restaurant w/ parking in the back. Great food, cabo shrimp tacos are amazing and they have one of the most unique salsa bars for any mexican restaurant i have been to. About 15 different varieties of salsa to try. Will definitely be back to try more of the menu.

I was totally blown away with La Santisima. 

The salsa bar was top notch. Over a dozen to choose from, each delicious. The pico de gallo was some of the best I've had. A creamy guacamole and a cilantro sauce were highlights as well. 

The tacos were phenomenal. Each topped with salsa and garnish that complimented perfectly. Even the beans and rice were incredible. So much flavor in such traditionally simple sides. 

The interior is fun and quirky, decorated with luchadors, sugar skulls and other interesting Mexican art.

Hands down my favorite mexican place of all time! Big cheesy chimis, huge burritos and tacos with the tastiest mexican fillings. My favorite is the Mayan Cochinita Pibil, so good Johnny Depp would've shot him dead in Once Upon a Time in Mexico! haha Seriously so good, plus they give you chips with endless salsa! My secret is to mix the spicy green salsa with the creamy cilantro! I love this restaurant so much I would marry it! lol

Are you tired of, or bored with, the typical Sonoran fare that surrounds us on nearly every corner in the valley?  If so, then you need to put one of the two locations of La Santisima on your list. The only things that you would recognize are the usage of the words: tortilla, taco, quesadilla, and burro. It's that unique. 

I've eaten more times than I can count at 16th St, and several times in Glendale. Here's what you need to know between the two. The original 16th St is small, almost cramped. Parking is literally ON the street edge, and around the corner. It can be dangerous backing out of your spot into the northbound flow of 16th St. You will often find a wait to be seated, and there is no indoor waiting area, just a bench outside, and seating for perhaps six at the (full liquor) bar. You will more than likely be privy to your your neighboring diners' conversations, as well as bumping into them at the salsa bar. It's got wonderful ambience, certainly, but it's not for large-parties, or those having issues with claustrophobia, or anxiety that might be sparked due to tight quarters. Those using wheelchairs or scooters should go directly to Glendale. There is ample parking in the rear, and at neighboring venues. The dining room is at least twice, or thrice, that of 16th st, and there is patio seating along Glendale, outside. I've not ever had to wait there, due to the extra seating available. 

The salsa bar gets much praise from other reviewers, and I'll get that out of the way first. Yes, there are a dozen, or perhaps 14 choices there. However, batches are kept small for freshness, and they may not have a couple of your faves once you've discovered them. However, there will certainly be ample remaining choices to top your light, airy, housemade(?) chips. Your first basket is gratis, but they do charge for extras (sometimes, LOL). It's very, VERY easy to ruin your appetite with these, due to the wonderful tastes and combos that you simply have not likely seen elsewhere. Chopped jicama, lightly salted w/cilantro? A roasted combo of several different peppers, and onions? Watermelon salsa? Peanut mole? You get the idea....

The menu lays out their special recipe combos pretty well. You can certainly get a standard type street taco plate, with or w/o rice and beans, with several of their takes on the standards, such as carne asada, al pastor, etc. The rice is simple, yet not your standard rosa-colored 'Spanish' rice. It even appealed to a former Asian g/f, who ate plain white rice as a staple. Beans are on the creamy side, more 'refried' than charro style....again quite tasty for their type. However, I almost always succumb to one of their bowls. All can be ordered as burro wrapped in a large tortilla, but I always get a bowl. Afterall, I know I will be semi-full from those chips! I've had the House Special bowl more times than I can remember, and it does not disappoint. But, I've explored out of my comfort zone a time or two, without disappointment. 
Quesadillas come in a large fresh corn tortilla, unlike anything I've ever seen at another restaurant. That adds a unique texture and flavor to their already delicious fillings. However, if you think you would be put-off by it somehow, be sure you specify that you wish to have a traditional flour tortilla.

I have to make a special plug for their guacamole. Like other recipes, this one is unique, and  darned yummy. They add cranberry, jicama, and I believe mango to your standard avocado blending. It's creamy green nirvana. Well worth that second basket of chips, for sure. Don't plan on sharing a small serving with any more than one other diner. Otherwise, violence could very well break out at your table. 

Well then, it's time for dessert. This is perhaps the only reason I am hesitant to provide them with 5-stars. Frustration! Their take on a leche flan is quite different than what you're used to (that's the theme here, right?). Picture more of a tres-leches sponge-cake, because that's what it is (in my book), and what it should be called (to my thinking, LOL). Suffice to say, in the many times I've eaten here, it's been sold-OUT all but ONE TIME!!!!  I even ask for it BEFORE I ORDER MY MEAL, just in the hopes of reserving one for myself at the end. No such luck, LOL. 

Alright, it's time to go eat!
Their quesadillas and shrimp tacos were amazing!  The horchata was almost like a fruit cocktail...very different, but still delicious.

Amazing experience! Loved their unique gastro tacos. 
Gluten free friendly - they have GF on the menu for all their allergy friendly items. 
Solid house margarita on the rocks.
I got the andalucia taco, pork tapatio taco, and the Azteca tinga taco. 
*Loved* the andalucia taco: chorizo & potatoes is an amazing combination. The azteca taco was a very delicious & unique chicken taco.

The food was delicious, I got the Tapatio quesa which is a deep fried quesadilla, with adobo pork. There is a salsa bar which is nice and the first basket of chips is free and then if you want chips after that it's $2.79. The service was not great, we were sitting down for a long time before anyone asked us if we wanted drinks or anything, I had to ask someone to take our order and my friend had to go to the drink area herself to get her margarita because the waiter never went to get it. Poor service, good food.

While there is very little to be said that hasn't been already, you simply can't go wrong with tacos. Just point at random at the taco section and you'll be happy.

The salsa bar is full of types that I didn't even know existed. Almond salsa? Load it up! 

Make sure you come before lunch/dinner time if you want to get seated/don't want to eat off your lap.

La Condesa Gourmet Taco Shop 

After a long break from Yelp, I knew that eventually I would find myself in a situation where I could no longer hold my tongue, and my need to share would overpower my desire to remain silent. La Condesa GTS created just that situation. 

I entered this space wound tighter than a spring ready to pop. Surely there could be no way that it could meet the lofty expectations set forth by my fellow yelper's reviews. But there is something very pure about this place, and as I stepped through the over-sized wood door, I knew this southwest girl was home. 

The best way I can describe the atmosphere is Southwestern Minimalist. Monique H was dead on with her praises for the artwork - The Blue Demon (long live Alejandro Muñoz Moreno) proudly intermingles with Diego and Frida and the acid treated floors feel natural. I also liked that this is clearly a community effort, with the art work provided by two exceptional Mexican artists (Manuel Gilavalos y Garcia and Ricardo Ramirez) and the furniture/décor provided by Bellas Artes de Mexico. I love that there is already a partnership, holding this little gem up until it can take flight. 

The food is clean. The flavors crisp. The portions more than adequate, and the prices less than I would expect to pay for such quality. Most selections can come in the form of a taco, a quesadilla, or a burro, although there are one or two additional options under both the quesadilla and burro menus. Each flavor combination is clearly described and in a handful of situations, there are salsa suggestions outlined on the out of this world salsa bar. The best way I can describe this is to think of a wine pairing with a food that will make flavors pop... in other words, just try it because the sum of the parts is way better than the individual components! 

The Mayan Conchita Pibil and the Oaxacan Black Mole Chicken are two of the finest examples I've had of either. Both are mouth wateringly moist and fairly melt. I would suggest the Peanut or Mexican salsa as additional choices for the MCP for the spicy recommended habanera. The guacamole and cilantro salsas were both mild choices and if the mole were not already a mouthful of perfection, might be the additional layer of flavors that bring you to the tipping point. Personally, I found the pickled onions severed atop with some of the Jicama salsa, tossed in for a little crunch, just enough to make my eyes roll back in to my head. I mean seriously, if I could wiggle around naked in this stuff, it would be a really good night! The Aztec Tinga is deceptively simple. Your first bite may seem relatively ordinary, but then start the countdown. Within a few seconds, the flavors hit you like a wall of emotion. Your lips and tongue begin to tingle with the heat of the perfectly balanced peppers. My BIL has tried the Sonoran Carne Asada and was unusually quiet as he made his way through his plate, so I have to assume that was good as well. Finish things up with those out of the world beans, or some of the grilled Mexican Calabacitas and a meal just can't get much better. 

So much has already been said about the iconic salsa bar, there really isn't much I can add, except to say, try them all! You will find two or three that send you to your happy place. 

The staff was super friendly and more than ready to answer questions or make suggestions. It's an order at the counter and take-a-number kind of place, but you can generally expect several service passes through the dining room. 

My only cautions / suggestions would be to grab a takeout menu so you don't have to stand and look at the wall menu with your mouth gaping like a cod fish and be prepared to park along Palm if the street inset parking area is full. 

This is my new love. I will definitely be adding this in to the regular rotation. At a dinner plate with drink running you between 8 and 9 dollars (with enough food to make two decent sized meals) this is one indulgence I can fit in to my life with little or no rationalizing. Please take the time to check this place out and support yet another wonderful family owned business. Look around when you come in, because I may be joining Joel L on one of his weekly visits. : )
Nice variety of salsas. I had the shrimp tacos and they were delicious. The place is very small and only had two servers for dinner. They were nice though. I would definitely return.

Lunchtime out with a relative on a weekday, and La Condesa has a seat by the window. There is really nothing like its saloon-artsy walls for us to gaze.   The Dia De los Muertos motif and wooden furniture make it perfect for easy conversation.  
Most folks seated around us already know where to go for lunch that's not too pricey and homemade.  
The Horchata is nothing short of liquid dessert, filled with pecans, fruit and rice milk.  You can avoid dairy all together with this and a special bullet burro with guac and lettuce.
The salsa bar sets the standard for good restaurants.  It's wide variety of salsas leave little doubt what creative people run the place.  My hope is that only a few people read this and try it. Otherwise, to my chagrin, the next time we park on 16th Street, we may have to WAIT in a line outside.

The tacos were amazing!!! When you step inside you'll think you are in Mexico. Everything from the art to the bar is authentic. The salsa bar has so many exotic selections that you will salivate over. The menu even caters to vegetarians. The tacos and burros are amazing. I will be a regular here and you should be too! Oh yeah and Alfredo makes killer margs!

Delicious Food and I'm a harsh critic since I only love authentic Mexican food! The fresh waters are to die for!! But the great music and amazing art to top it off to make this a great choice to eat!!! Oh and more choices it salsas you can imagine and they are all finger licking good!!!
My favorite place to take people for tacos. Great vegetarian options as well as great variety of traditional and contemporary Mexican food. It's small inside but the service is quick.

Went in on a weekend, was pretty busy, but got a seat pretty quickly, about 10 min wait tops. We were very impressed with the salsa bar, makes it so whatever flavor your looking for to enhance your food with that this can be self-done :P
Ordered the chicken shark mole taco, wow! that was yummy, had this two weeks ago and the flavor is still etched in my taste-buds memory! Over all the dinner was excellent, will definitely be back.
Absolutely delicious. Fresh ingredients that don't hide under heavy sauces. Great alternative to the regular taco shops.
Best Mexican food in town!! Their traditional Quesadillas are delicious and are the Chicken Mole tacos & Al Pastor tacos!!!!! This is making me hungry now!!!

If you have all the time in the world and love to be ignored by your server then go here. 
Seriously, I've been to the Flagstaff location and hands down it deserves 5 stars. Phoenix location, not so much. 
We expected a bit of a wait on a Friday night. What we didn't expect for a party of two after waiting 30 minutes in a half full restaurant was to finally get a table only to be ignored. It took another 40 minutes for someone to take our order. This was after the bar couldn't understand we wanted two drinks. 
The food is good but not so good that you can't get equally good food along with good service elsewhere. 
The cauliflower, peanut salsa taco is good. My second taco wasn't the right order. I waited some more. When the beer batter avocado taco arrived it was a bit bland. Good texture but not a lot of flavor. My boyfriend ordered the pork and pineapple burro. It didn't have any pineapple in it. Pork was minimal. It relied mostly on the filler of lettuce and onion. 
Disappointing.

Food if excellent; unique and yet authentic flavored. It's all oversized burritos and quesadillas (corn masa and fried, excellent!) as well as many variety of tacos. Well worth the $, and the margaritas are excellent to match with some unique offerings. The  tamarind is a good one.

Drop what you're doing and drive here. After I ate here I had to go back the next day for more.  The food is that good.

This cute little green building may have gone competely unoticed if I hadn't been driving down Palm Rd to avoid construction.  While waiting to turn onto 16th Street the "Grand Opening" sign caught my eye and my little yelping soul leaped for joy!  A new place to try!

It looked desolate from the outside but when I opened the door I was put at easy by the decor, smell and cleanliness inside.  I ordered dinner for two, to go.  The menu was awesome.  I loved seeing all the variety: poblano peppers, mole, mahi mahi, mushrooms...something wrapped in banana leaves.  It made it difficult to choose something.  Here's what I've had so far: La Condesa Shrimp Burro and Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco.  They are both were very delicious meals but the shrimp burro stole the show.  So much flavor.  I snagged some bites from my hubbys mole and mahi mahi burros- mmmm such a delight.  The salsa bar is endless.  I really stocked up.  I was excited to try the strawberry salsa but it was too hot, in fact it all was, but I'm a big wimp when it comes to hot peppers. The horchata is handmade and delicious.  They throw pecans and some fruit in there too which is a yummy bonus!

As if the good food wasn't enough to win me over the art in this restaurant sho did!  I'm a sucker for Mexican folk art and Frida Kahlo is my Oprah.  There's a painting of her and Diego hanging over the salsa bar, it's amazing.  All the paintings are great, love the artist.

The La Santisima Quesa is absolutely delicious!  I crave it all the time.  Order it, you won't be disappointed.  

In my opinion, this is the best restaurant within a 10 mile radius of downtown Glendale. It has the best margaritas, tacos, salsa bar and service.  I tipped off my buddy Jason V. to this place and now he's the duke.  It's goooooood.

Have been here several times as it's within walking distance to my home.  Service and food has always been good.  Some evenings it gets pretty packed and things slow down, but, it's not fast food, so take your time and relax.  This is definitely one of the better quality Mexican places in the valley and it's nice to not have food completely covered in oil and salt, which is what many of the Mexican places think Americans want.
It good tasty fair where you can actually taste the ingredients.

Was is good.. Yes
Did it blow me away.. No

I arrived here about 4:45pm Monday evening. It was me and the photographer for AZ Republic. 

I look over the menu and the salsa bar and man did it look good. I was hoping there was a sample platter or something but the best I could come up with was the 2 Taco meal.
