I opted for the Chicken and the pork, one of each. 

What I liked: 
-Chips with out having to order them separate.  
-Tacos full of meat. 
-Staff was nice
-Rice and Beans were good. 
-The salsa bar...way cool

Meh:  
-Corn shell was overcooked on 1/2 (one side)
-meat was boring without salsa, good thing there is like 20 to choose. 


It seems like the upscaled two hippies and it worked! 3.5 out of 4
Amazing tacos, especially the street tacos. But the bell of the restaurant is the mole- Yummy - as good as mole from Oaxaca! The salsa bar is to die for, you got to try them all.

Came as a recommendation by a friend that visited here when he was in Phoenix.
I also had to come because there was HAPPY HOUR and UNLIMITED SALSA.

TINGA STREET TACO ($1.25)
- wasn't too spicy
- very well marinated
- I originally only ordered 1 but couldn't resist and ordered another one soon after I finished the first one!

CARNE ASADA STREET TACO ($1.25)
- meat was relatively tender
- good but definitely preferred the Tinga Street Taco more

MARGARITA ($3)
- not too strong that it tasted like alcohol but there was definitely alcohol in there.
- good drink to help celebrate the beginning of the weekend. 

HORCHATA ($3.99)
- VERY GOOD
- different from any horchata I had before; it had dices of cantaloupe, honeydew, and strawberry
- super large thirst quencher

UNLIMITED SALSA BAR
- any salsa from strawberry, cilantro, pecan, or pico de gallo
- I almost tried everything because well I've never been to a place with so much variety
- it also helped that I had unlimited chips so I just kept trying

SERVICE: nothing too special. Staff members were friendly and refilled my water appropriately.

ENVIRONMENT: a bit hidden in a not so great part of Phoenix. There is the large signage that you know it's not the wrong place. The place doesn't get too busy which was good.

Overall, great place for tacos. I can't compare it to other places in Phoenix but I did enjoy my visit. They are a bit different than the tacos I have in LA Taco Trucks mainly because I get different kinds. The price is reasonable and well UNLIMITED SALSA BAR! Also try the horchata...it's so refreshing!

Awesome salsa bar and SHARK tacos!! You rarely see the words "gourmet" and "taco" in the same sentence, but La Condesa somehow makes it work. However, La Condesa isn't in the best part of town, and I'm glad we came here for lunch versus dinner. We tried:

-Different Salsas from Salsa Bar (Pecan Salsa, Pico de Gallo, Mexican Salsa, Sesame Salsa, Cilantro Salsa, Grilled Peppers, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/la-condesa-gourmet-taco-shop-phoenix-2?select=ytgVAxv6hFuPzqsPxwQmhg#ytgVAxv6hFuPzqsPxwQmhg): I liked the Pecan and Sesame salsas although I didn't get much pecan taste. The cilantro was too watery, but the grilled peppers were really good (and had a nice spicy kick). The pico de gallo was solid, as was the mexican salsa. Their tortilla chips are really good, and thin and crispy, so make sure you try them!
-Tacos (From L to R: Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco, Carnitas Street Taco, Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/la-condesa-gourmet-taco-shop-phoenix-2?select=ytgVAxv6hFuPzqsPxwQmhg#Wah_j9kHBXGf2NluqFZB_g): 
-Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco (Roasted Pork Shoulder w/Achiote Rojo, Wrapped in Banana Leaves, Slow-Cooked Until Fork Tender and Topped w/Lime Marinated Onions & Salsa Habanera Maya): I ordered this since a lot of other people seemed to like it, and it was a "Yucatan specialty". However, it was just ok. The pork was a little dry, and the flavors didn't stand out. I wouldn't order this again.
-Carnitas Street Taco: Pretty good! The carnitas were very flavorful, and I liked how bite sized this taco was. 
-Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco (Corn Tortilla Stuffed w/Beer Battered Dogfish Shark): DELICIOUS! I've had shark meat before and am used to it being tougher and firmer than regular fish. However, there wasn't a big different in the texture, but there seemed to be more of a sweetness to it. I guess I enjoyed the "Baja Sur specialty" vs. the Yucatan. This is a must order if you go to La Condesa!

I only saw a small strip of parking available in front of the restaurant, but it is shared with a convenience store. I think street parking was also available, but I'd recommend making sure you don't have any valuables out! I definitely plan on coming back to La Condesa and trying their other seafood tacos, but will make sure it's during lunch. Dining in is the way to go so that you can sample all of the different salsas. The staff was nice, but weren't the quickiest.

So recent trip to Phoenix and I was craving Mexican food.  Turned to YELP and they pointed us towards this little gem.  Uber took us out there....ummmm a kind of sketchy area but what the heck.  Put our name in and waited about 45 minutes to get seated (place is small). Once seated we ordered margaritas and had chips with the amazing salsa bar!  There have to be 30 salsas freshly prepared.....from mild to OMG that's hot.  My favorite was the Pecano......sooo yummy. 

        Ordered food and I chose the Mole (Black Oaxacan Mole) in burrito form.   I will say that was a damn good Mole.....probably in my top 2 that I have had.  Burrito was big and I love that they make the tortilla crispy by flattening the burrito on the flat top.  Wow soooo good. Came with rice and beans.  A wonderful plate for sure.  

       So if you go it's tiny.....there will be a wait BUT it is sooooo worth it.  I'm from San Diego so I do know great Mexican food and this was GREAT.  Inexpensive as well.  Give them a shot.....you won't be disappointed.

My new "Comfort Food" favorite! If you like varying the taste of your favorite dishes this is your place! Light up your palette with multiple savory salsas and match them up to a plethora of uniquely prepared gourmet tacos, burritos, and quesadillas. 
I had the Mayan Conchinita Pibil Quesadilla, which is pure decadence all by itself. However, I paired a few bites with their fresh guacamole and one of the kickin salsas.  (Something with Cabo in the name, or the other one that looked very similar). While the presentation was beautiful, I started to break through the paper lining the basket. That grosed me out a little, but by then I was full and bagged the rest for later.
The horchata is remarkable!!! No one makes it like this place!!! I love that they also have a huge salsa bar.
Off the charts delicious and menu is extensive and unique. Best occixicana tacos ever. Can't wait to come back.
The food is EXCELLENT! The salsa bar is outrageous. Hands down best mexican food we've had.
The best - Salsas, Flavors, Fast Service.  Most excellent.

This place was so totally awesome and unique. My girlfriend and I are visiting from Colorado and this place was recommended by a local and damn did we get lucky. The food was amazing and our waiter Abraham was super kind and took great care of us even though it was busy. The burritos and the salsa bar were out of this world amazing!

I went for breakfast on Sunday.  The huevos ahogados were an absolute life changer.  I recently relocated from Dallas to Phoenix, and was looking for a change of pace, as far as Mexican food is concerned.  This place is so authentic and the people there are really helpful.  

This place is now a staple in my short list of amazing spaces.

Overall, a great experience. 

Friendly customer service. The server talked to us for a good while, telling us the whole Guy Fieri story. 

Good food. I ordered my usual Carne Asada burrito. No complaints there.

Fantastic salsa. Yes, a whole stand with several different and innovative salsas to choose from. From strawberry to peanut butter to mango, that really was the highlight of our visit.

I recommend this place to all Mexican food lovers.
My only complaint was the guacamole was not how I typically prefer it. Otherwise, this was delicious food and we loved all the salsa choices! There were so many and each one was delicious.

I have to say, this was good- the dead lady on top was not inviting, and the inside was very modest and small, but for the price and food, I will go back. Can not go during rush hour, so go either earlier or later since the place is as small as a broom closet. 
Food: 5 stars
Parking: 5 stars
Service: 4 stars
Atmosphere: 2 stars
Value: 5+ stars

overall 5 stars

Great little gem for authentic Mexican food tucked away in a small building on 16th Street.  They have great service, a comfortable atmosphere and an amazing salsa bar! We tried the smoked Marlin and El Gaucho tacos. Yummy!

Amazing salsa bar selection, fresh ingredients, very flavorful, mouthwatering tacos. A great dining experience for me and the work gang. Totally worth the drive from downtown Tempe. Can't wait to return. Mmmmmmmm!
Holy $#!+!! Best tacos and margarita I have ever had... get the Cadillac, baby shark tacos and mariachi loco. Wow... wish I had this place near my home. #Legit

This is the first time I have tried horchata, and it was delicious. I love the cinnamon taste of it. They serve the drink in a plastic cup, so you can conveniently take it togo. 

Before the main course, they give out complimentary chips you can munch on. The chips are quality chips - they're not the thin ones like from Rubio's. The best part is the salsa bar! They have a wide selection. Watch out for the extra spicy ones. I'm definitely returning to this cute hole in the wall place for good tacos and horchata.  

A heads up that parking in front of the restaurant is limited.

I was very excited that today was my father's birthday as it gave me the opportunity to spend quality time with him....oh and try out this great restaurant. :) After inspecting many of the great reviews, I was thinking that this establishment could not be as good as advertised but it was. From the amazing salsa bar to the great fish tacos, the food here was very, very good. As many have mentioned, the salsa bar has many options to choose from and each has its own authentic flare. For lunch today I ordered the carne asada and shark taco, that came with beans and rice. The fish and carna were so flavorful. In my opinion, you know when you are eating good Mexican food based on how tasty a fish taco is and theirs was great. To go with my meal I ordered their horchata that many yelpers have raved about. I love horchata but sadly I can not list theirs as a favorite. I am more of a simple guy when it comes to this speciality drink and having pecans and strawberries in it just was a little much for me. You may ask how I could still give it five stars but if you had the opportunity to try all of the other items that I tasted they more than made up for it. Overall, very good food and a place that I will definitely be going to in the future. There are many seafood dishes that I look forward to enjoying in the future.

what a disappointment! i've had this place bookmarked for a looooong time, so i was excited when i finally convinced a large group of my friends to dine here.

the salsa bar did not disappoint, so i had higher expectations for the food. my fave salsas were the peanut, the mexicana, and the pibil something or other. the strawberry one tasted like... crushed strawberries. surprise? 

i had the 2 taco plate (~$10).... i had one la condesa special w/ shrimp (spinach, cheese, onions, peppers.... other things?) and one chicken mole. the chicken was tasty, and the tacos are pretty decently portioned.... it was a good thing the shrimp was smothered in cheese because it was SUPER overcooked. you get a teeny portion of rice and beans on the side.

husband got a burrito and taco plate (~$13)... the burrito was the much-hyped cochinita pibil, and the taco was the el gaucho (skirt steak w/ avo and chimichurri). eh. the cochinita pibil was ok, but not "melt-in-your-mouth".... and i dunno if beans were the right accompaniment for it. the skirt steak was TOUGH and dry... and there was hardly any chimichurri (if any?) to redeem it.  this combo only comes w/ some calabacitas (squash), no rice.

our table's consensus was that the majority of the meat was dry/overcooked. there was definitely some pleasing flavors, but were made unenjoyable by overcooked, dry meat. 

perhaps it was because we were a large party (9) and it was busy (fri night)... but the service was kinda spotty. they were kind enough to split our bill for us, which was great. it is a very small place, so i wouldn't recommend going in a group larger than 4, maybe 6.

i might be willing to give this place a go again... but for the high prices and based on my lackluster experience, i'm sadly placing la condesa in my "phoenix over-hyped" list.
Just had half of a shrimp burro and half of a mahi mahi burro and it was absolutely fabulous. The cilantro sauce and mushrooms made it! A+ Also - best horchata on the planet!

Yesss. I. Love. Tacos. So I got steak and shrimp gaucho tacos and a mahi taco and wasn't disappointed. It's really pricey and the service was slow, but they made me special salsa that was reaaaallly hot after I asked which salsa from their expansive salsa bar was the hottest since it's all clearly made for gringos. Oh and the sound of the chairs screaming across the floor made me cringe. I seriously doubt that I'll ever eat in the restaurant again. I would totally get to go orders since the tacos were bomb and I want to try other stuff!!

My wife and I love this place. We go to their location on Glendale Avenue.  Love the Salsa bar. We enjoy the burritos. Some people may think the prices are high for tacos and burritos. The quality is worth if!

Not sure if we went to this one or the other one, but let's just say it' s tiny and rustic on the inside.  We got lucky with parking.  The margs were good, not strong enough, but after 2 I was fine.  The salsa bar was very very good, I wish the containers to hold the salsa were bigger. The lighting is kind of poor, but that adds to the charm.  I had conchinita pibil quesadilla, which I really loved.  My boyfriend had a chicken mole taco and an al pastor taco, which he only liked, not loved.  We would never have found this place if it hadn't been for the locals, so we were grateful.  I would go back, my boyfriend would too, but would order something else.

Just go here. You won't be disappointed.

The atmosphere is cozy and hip with rustic tables and chairs and dia de los muertos artwork lining the walls. The staff is FRIENDLY. I can't emphasize that enough. I have been for lunch and they handle the crowds well. At dinner, and during slower traffic times, they are very attentive and ensure that you have everything you need.

The food. Where do I begin. I will start with the amazing salsa bar. They have about a dozen salsas per day. Fresh. My favorite is the seven chile salsa which is simply roasted chiles and red onions. They are all amazing though.

As far as the tacos, I have only ever eaten the pibil and the mole, and that's because they are so good, that I can't branch out yet. Every time I go, those are the ones I am craving. The pibil is so good that it makes me fully appreciate Johnny Depp's character in "Once Upon a Time in Mexico" having such a love of good pibil. 

If you go at lunch, go before 11:30 to beat the crowd. This is one of my favorite places to eat. Hands down. Get some horchata to go as well. They top it with fruit and pecans. Yum!

My friend told me this was best Mexican food around. I wasn't hesitant at first because I always believed the best Mexican food in Arizona was in Tucson, but she may be right. La Santísima is fantastic. I had the Azteca Tinga burro, and I don't remember the last time I had chicken that was so juicy. I think their secret is in their sauces/marinades. The burrito was huge but I ate it all up because it was so good and I could not stop. I also love the salsa bar - they have a large variety of salsas and it's fun to try all of them. My favourite is the strawberry one. 

The only downside was that service was slow. I think we waited 15 minutes just for someone to greet us and take our orders. I heard that the restaurant increased capacity so I hope they will increase staff too in order to meet the increased needs.

We came to this restaurant because every time we go to a new city we try new places. We like to watch Diners, Drive ins  and Dives and we try some of the places that they mention. This was a mistake. When we first got there, we had to wait even though there were four tables available two partially bussed One was completely cleaned and one was not at all bussed. There was a couple in front of us waiting and they seemed irritated as well. When we finally get seated we go to the back of the restaurant and there was a few tables available. They explained to us that they ran out of ice so that's the reason they were so behind. I'm sorry I don't understand how a restaurant pretty much shut  down because they ran low on ice. So they show us to our table the hostess sets the chips down and says help yourself to the salsa bar. We make our way to the salsa bar and are greeted by a sign that says extra chips are 2.40 or something and a salsa bar that was almost completely empty. We waited 10 minutes decided to go back there was a man standing there and he had mentioned he asked for cups for the salsa a few minutes ago and they still have not returned. Also the salsa was still not refilled. So we ate or chips with no salsa. We also asked for some guacamole prior to going to the salsa bar the second time the waiter said he thought they might be out of guacamole but he wasn't sure he would let us now. 10 minutes later he comes back to take order completely forgetting about the guacamole and when we asked he said yes they were out of guacamole. It was odd the would be out of guacamole and they can't refill their salsa bar but they give you chips and tell you to enjoy the salsa bar. So we order our food and if I'm being honest it's pretty decent the beans are amazing definitely The best beans I've ever had. The rice was really good. I ordered a margarita with a Corona. Usually those come in a margarita glass the Corona upside down in it. This came in a  tall highball glass Filled about a quarter of the way and the corona on the side it was absolutely terrible. And then the server who I will say it was pretty decent gave us our check came back and picked up our cash and the first thing he said is I don't have any change you guys. And I don't know why but  that bugged me really bad because first of all it was only seven dollars and you're a waiter how can you not make change for a customer. We actually didn't want any change but what if we had. All in all it was not A good experience and there were several people in the surrounding tables there also unhappy especially with the salsa bar being so crappy. And I don't understand and I cannot wrap my head around The fact that just because you're out of ice you can't seat people I don't even understand. Maybe they just had a bad day who knows!

I really wanted to give this place less stars, because the service took so long. It literally took an hour to get our horchata but it was so worth it. It was like nothing I've ever had before!!! This Horchata had melon, strawberries,cinnamon, walnuts and other fresh ingredients that all came together perfectly. They also serve Mexican Coke Cola which is better than regular Cola.

The quesadilla was far from a traditional flour tortilla. It was some kind of a pita tortilla. It was delicious. 

The shrimp tiger tacos were so authentic and cook to perfection. The street tacos taste just like the taco shops in Ensenada Mexico. The rice was cooked with a buttery taste which my taste buds could not refuse and beans were good as well. They have the salsa bar with such a large variety of salsa. The cream salsa, cilantro salsa and the chunky salsa were all wonderful options to put on the shrimp and fish tacos together. 

Believe me I wanted to hate this place, But everything they did wrong like take 40 mins to bring food
Was so worth it. The place is truly a hole in the wall, crowded with many folks from different walks of life. Worth your time and inconvenience to taste such perfection!
The best salsa bar in life. Delicious vegetarian options, love them.

Tried coming here once. No parking!  They have like 3 parking spots. Its hot as hell outside no one wants to drive around looking for a place to park on a regular Wednesday night.  Maybe if you can walk or ride a bike or a horse it may be worth trying.  Get a  building with more than 3 parking spots and this place could be legit.

Incredible!  Stupendous!  Filling!  And then there's the Margaritas.  

My friend, Kenner Bob, from up Iowa way, was in town for her annual visit to Aridzona and it's my most excellent pleasure to choose the joint for us to brunch and have a smart cocktail, or two ("Let's all have a little drinkey!").

I'd spotted La Santisima via Yelp about three months ago and knew immediately I wanted to try it. I'm so glad I waited for Kenner Bob's visit as it turned out to be the perfect place.

We started our culinary journey with the joint's Guacamole. Admittedly, I'm not one for bastardized guac, but this guac was da bomb. Chunky with diced mango, dried cranberries and the usual salt, pepper and garlic. Every bite equated nuclear yummy noises from both of us. 

Kenner Bob chose two tacos (all street sized) from the Mix-n-Match menu:  Mahi-Mahi,  Chicken Tinga (I think) and one from the Specialty section:  a beef brisket number that was sublime. 

I chose the Tiger Shrimp, Chicken Tinga and a Pork taco that escapes my memory.  I loved the Pork number. 

Sides for both of us were the included rice and beans. The rice was buttery and tasted like cream was involved in its making. Scrumdiddleyumptious, it was. I'm a rice fanatic so I could've eaten 20 or six tubfulls.

Trust me when I say it would take at least 20 visits to this joint to work one's way through the menu. Kenner Bob and I took 20 minutes -- whist eating the chips, salsa and guac -- to decide on what to order.  Everything -- and I mean EVERYthing -- sounded delicious.  We could've read every choice's description but we finally had to "shoot the engineer" and place our order.  The waitrons are incredibly patient and understanding of dyed-in-the-wool foodies trying to decide which goodies to order. 

The added drawing ticket to this joint are the Margaritas. There are about 10 choices.  Kenner Bob ordered the Award Winning Margarita and after one sip she said, "I'd vote for it!"  For Kenner Bob it was the perfect Marg:  sour but not overly so; sweet but not treacly.  

My Marg was incredible. To save my life I can't remember the name of it but it contained an herbal liqueur.  Truly, if this danged ol' cocktail doesn't cure you then you weren't sick. 

If you're seeking true Mexican cuisine in a super casual restaurant -- and killer-diller Margaritas -- corer  rápidiamente to La Santisima.
All I can say is that sht was pretty dang good! And the Salsa bar is amazing! There is actual spicy salsa options here. Pastor burrito and Guacho tacos were delicious.

Not my favorite. Service was ridiculously slow, couldn't get water (I think every cup in the restaurant was dry), it took over an hour to get a burrito and 3 tacos. The burrito was decent, the shrimp and Al pastor taco are good but not to the point where I would return. The fastest service we received was when we asked for our check.

This place seems to be going downhill. The rice recipe seems to be only good with one cook.... Cross your fingers. 

We ordered the guacamole and it was watery and had a few chunks of avocado... It wasn't "made". 

The service is ALWAYS SUPERIOR. Love the front staff. 

Please get good again!!!

This place was great. Started with the guac which was probably the best I have ever had. The party I was with had a combination of tacos, burritos and sandwiches ... All which were winners. Too bad I love so far away it this would be a go to place.

This place is fantastic - amazing tacos and eclectic decor.  We tried one of the quesos and while delicious, found it to have a bit too much pastry to it.  The flavors were all excellent though, and the salsa bar had a number of excellent options.  Next time we're gonna try a burrito.

This place has really really really (did I say enough really)good Mexican food. The only negative I have for this place is their location. 16 different kinds of salsa`s kinda makes it up for it though. 
They have strawberry salsa, pecan salsa and the list keeps on going. 
I tried their mole chicken tacos, they are hands down one of the best I have had. If you are big foodie like me and follow Dinner Drives and Dives this place was featured there. The food will not disappoint you here. 

Must try this joint.

On my way home from the baseball game I decided to stop in here and see what all the excitement was about.  I drove past it and then turned around and got a parking spot right by the door.

I ordered the dogfish shark taco and the cochinita pibil taco combo with rice and beans.  I received some chips as I left the order counter and stopped at the salsa bar to get some pico de gallo.  When I got to my table I scooped some pico onto my tortilla chip and wow, what great fresh taste!

I also had some tomatillo, jicama and chipotle salsas that I tried on my tacos.  The shark taco was good and the cochinita pibil was even better.  Even the small cups of rice and beans where really good.

I grabbed a menu on my way out and am already trying to plan what I'll have on my next visit.  I especially can't wait to try the horchata.
The quesadilla was huge and unlike any other quesadilla out there.  Big margs with tons of different varieties.  Gonna go back and try the tacos.  Great staff and cool atmosphere too.

Delicious! :-)
There are so many salsas to try.  Each one is so good.  The street tacos are great.  I tried 3 flavors but found the chicken mole...now, that's my favorite if all.
Great prices.  Service very good.  
I can't say enough except..go check it out.:-)

I read all the great reviews on here and in the 'Phoenix's 23 of the Valleys best new places to chow down' and was excited - both my sister and I love street tacos.
Maybe I missed something, but I have never been more dissappointed in my culinary adventures. The chips were alright...the array of salsas was impressive and all the ones I sampled were quite good. We ordered 5 different tacos a la carte - Cabo Shrimp Taco, Sonoran Carne Asada Taco, Aztec Tinga Taco, Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco, La Condesa Shrimp taco. 
The Cabo was tasty, but nothing to write home about, the carne asada was tasteless and overdone, the Aztec Tinga was not bad... but very one note and we were over it after the first bite. The Condesa Shrimp taco had  WAAAY too much garlic and the shrimp had zero flavor - I came across at least 10 full slices and I still have the taste of garlic in my mouth hours later. 
Overall it wasn't horrible - it just wasn't good - definately not 25 dollars worth -  this is not a place I would return to nor would I recommend it to anyone else
If you want good street tacos see my reviews.

I was very enthusiastic to finally eat at this place because of all the good reviews, but was disappointed.
First of all the place was filthy, tables were dirty, food on the floor, I felt bad because there was only one server but based on appearances i would not recommend this place. 
The food was ok nothing special I was expecting better. I ordered a quesadilla, it looked delicious don't get me wrong but it had no flavor. Mom ordered chicken tacos and was quiet upset that they served her food on a broken plate. If your looking for authentic Mexican food then this place is not for you.

I came here on a Saturday for brunch around 11am and were seated in the front room which is kind of dark. I saw the main room on the way to the bathroom & asked to be moved because it's so much brighter & nicer in there. Not sure why we weren't set there to begin with considering it wasn't super busy at the time.

La Santisima's main room is decorated with Dia De Los Muertos inspired artwork -- pretty cool! There's also a salsa bar that has a great variety of sauces! I tried them all & my favorite was a smokey, spicy salsa roja; it was hot but not over-powering & still had fresh acidity which I love.

Their taco trios have a lot of different protein options - I chose their Mayan Cochinita Pibil, Sonoran Carne Asada, & Aztec Tinga. So unique & delicious in their own ways but my favorite was definitely the Tinga. 

Chilaquiles in roja & verde salsas with scrambled eggs were so tasty with generous portions.  My dining companion said it reminded him of his grandmother's chilaquiles which seems a pretty strong endorsement! Next time, I'd probably opt for an over-medium egg to add some yummy yolkiness.

Overall -- a great experience with tasty, authentic food, & lots of variety! Definitely would recommend :)

Fresh chips and salsa with a temporary unidentified object in my "margarita tamarindo".  Our waitress graciously explained that this was a tamarindo in my drink, which gave the margarita flavor. I have been driving past this restaurant for years, admiring the beautiful sugar skull mosaic glistening in the Phoenix sun as I drove by.  Well tonight was the night. I pulled into one of the limited parking spaces located directly on 16th street, momentarily pondering how I will pull out later, but consumed with curiosity as to what was behind the big wooden door. I apprehensively opened the door, and was pleasantly surprised with what I found. A quaint mom and pop restaurant with a true southwest feel and experience. With the likes of a visit from Guy Ferari (?) And Best of New Times awards plastered on the menu, I was feeling pretty proud of my mystery choice.  My sister and I ordered and split the bean and Oaxaan cheese burro, mole chicken taco, an the al pastor tacos.  All were excelente!!
Ok, thats enough for now as I am feeling the nice mellow effects of my magnefico tamarindo slowly wear off.  We will be back!!

This is for the new Glendale location- we've never been to the one across town. I'm definitely a fan of this place, and we'll be back for sure. This place fills the niche for good Mexcian food that isn't heavy and greasy. It was empty when we walked in but there was a steady trickle of people in and out. The waiter was extremely friendly. He explained portions of the menu to us, chatted a bit, and the service was prompt and polite. 
The salsa bar wasn't all that I'd hoped for but it was interesting. Lots of different salsas but many of them were spicy and I didn't really love any of them. Hubby did though so that might just have been my issue. The food, on the other hand, was delicious. Hubby had mole and it tasted like mole is supposed to taste. Like chili and chocolate and all sorts of yumminiess rolled together. I had an Arabic burrito which was much more delicious than it sounds. They happily made it without onions for me and it was awesome. 
Oh, and order the horchata. Trust me. They make it in house and if horchata tasted like this all the time I'd drink it way more often.
Parking is in the back and there is a surprising amount of space considering they're on the edge of downtown Glendale. I also appreciate that the parking area is VERY well lit.

If I could give this place 10 stars, I would. This place has the best tacos that I've ever had in my whole entire life, ever (seriously, they're THAT good). I also love that they have a variety of self-serve salsas, so you can try as many as you'd like. The place isn't huge, so it can get get packed pretty easily. It doesn't look like much outside, but that's okay because all of the magic happens inside. You should definitely check this place out!

My new favorite Mexican joint in the Valley! I'm working my way down the menu, but at this point my favorite tacos are the cochinita pibil (so very, very flavorful), the Oaxacan black mole, and the gaucho (or whatever they call it --- it's the steak taco with the Argentine flavors). The salsa bar, with about 12 selections, is mind blowing. I especially love the pecan salsa --- never had it before coming here but now can't get enough of it.

We drove from Mesa & it didn't take too long on a Sunday afternoon. It was our first time so we parked right off of 16th Ave. but I would not recommend it because backing out is dangerous due to limited visibility.

Atmosphere:
There were paintings on every wall. Most of them are themed after Dia de los Muertos--the Day of the Dead which is the restaurant's theme. There was a small bar with about 4 bar stools. I would say maximum seating capacity is about 35 because & that is packing every table full & there is barely any room to scoot your chair out to walk around. The muzak reminded me of Jamaican music but my husband said it sounded "chips & salsa" music to him. lol

Food:
My daughters are picky & do not enjoy spicy food. Both of the enjoyed the burrito, the orig. quesadilla & the rice. The cheese was unique & flavorful. I am 42 & don't remember ever having eaten it before. Here is a bit about it (Oaxaca cheese  is a white, semi-hard cheese from Mexico, similar to unaged Monterey Jack, but with a mozzarella-like string cheese texture. It is named after the state of Oaxaca in southern Mexico, where it was first made) y husband said the 3 street tacos he ordered were DELISIOCO. In other words, if it had been served on a plate that was sitting on the floor he still would have eaten them. We also enjoyed the Mexican Coke & strawberry soda while my husband had a Corona with lime. For dessert we shared a slice of Tres Leche Cake (4 ways) which was topped with a bit of whipped cream, drizzled with caramel sauce & pieces of pecan. 

Overall:
The food was very good but I felt bad for them & the customers who left because there was nowhere to sit. I suggest they do what they can to buy out the business adjacent to them & knock out the wall to expand at their current address or, better yet (unless they have other parking I don't know about) relocate to a building with more parking & tables.

So glad we finally got to try this place! The salsa bar is awesome and our tacos were so good.  The veggie taco had so much flavor.  The service was also very good. Two very nice attentive servers! Can't wait to go back.

We ordered pick up the other night from la santisima. We arrived and it was just being put together so we had margaritas which used to be great... they have since started using brand x margarita mix where they  used to squeeze fresh citrus.  The real problem with this place is the inconsistency I asked for them to make sure the order is proper because I do drive 50 minutes round trip to get get there food which I believe is some of the best in the area. I got home and opened the order and it was incorrect we ordered 8 tacos a quesadilla and. The correct items where the quesadillas 2 tacos and the guacamole. I called immediately upon  opening the wrong food and they asked me to bring it back I let them know that's not a possibility and I informed them what was wrong and asked if they could just credit my Amex. They said no and that there manager would call me to review the issue. Well they haven't so hopefully this review will garner attention so I can speak to them about there awful customer service and inconsistency. After being a valued customer for 6 years including the location at 16th street I will no longer come here and I will stop telling people to go here. It's unfortunate but it's the truth this place went straight into the gutter.

I bought a groupon here last year and finally got around to trying the place. My son and I are pretty picky eaters, so we kind of created our own. I ordered a chicken and bean burrito enchilada style, with rice and beans on the side. I don't know what the heck was in that burrito, but pretty sure the meat was not chicken. I had a stomach ache before even walking out....I honestly should have asked for a different item. I don't know what was wrong with the meat. The portion itself was huge. Very large plate. The salsa bar I liked, lots of different options, Inside was cute. Warning though, parking is a hot mess, its literally on 16th st. Good luck getting out of there during traffic. Waiter was nice, but slow. Over all I was disappointed. I will say, the beer battered fish taco sounded good. May go back to try that, but other than that based on what I ate, we wont be returning.
Love this place!  Salsas are excellent the beans could use a little something but other than that it's great!  Must try if you love tacos!
Amazing food. Loved the inner city vibe. This place couldn't have been any better. Gourmet at very reasonable prices. I'll be back again.

So my sister and I decided to try this place out, due to YELP reviews, and man are we happy we did. It was sooo good. 

Loved the salsa bar (the pecan, surprisingly, was my favorite) and we both got different versions of their quesadillas. She got the pork pastor and I got the chicken mole. Both were outstanding and different than anything else we've had. 

They hand make their own corn tortillas, fill them with cheese and your filling of choice, and then deep fry them. This gave them a crisp outer shell but a light and almost creamy masa interior. So good!  

FYI - the neighborhood seemed a little questionable (lots of bars on the Windows) but we went during the day and felt perfectly safe. The place was bumping with other happy diners and we'll definitely be back.

My husband's choice. He loved it.  I, on the other hand, thought it was just ok. For a taco shop, it's a bit overpriced.  I think our total meal came out $40-$50 and we didn't have any alcoholic beverages.  I've had better in Phoenix for the prices (Barrio Cafe) and would rather visit a real taco shop and eat for $10 than go back.  That being said, the staff is very nice and the food was good.  Their salsa bar is very enticing.

Best quesadilla I've ever had, I wish I could get it back home. It had that really fresh Mexican style cheese, between a very war and flaky tortilla.

You can never go wrong with a salsa bar, particularly one that has a creamy almond salsa, yeah.
Tacos are so good!  Laid back atmosphere and good service. Was looking for some good tacos and it definitely did the job! Highly recommend coming here for some solid tacos!

I brought my Mom to eat here since I heard their Quesadillas were the best and different. To my surprise the food is made where I'm from, Guadalajara. We had a great experience. The Male server attended us the whole time. Sometimes when it's good server they tend to overdo it a bit but not him. He was perfect amount of attention and courtesy. Quesadilla was a bit crispy more than I like it but my experience overall was the best. I definitely will be back with more customers! Thank you Santísima Team!

La Santisima is a gourmet taco restaurant located about 3 miles away from downtown Phoenix and was featured in Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive-Ins, and Drives (http://www.foodnetwork.com/videos/la-santisima-gourmet-tacos-0246581). In fact, I noticed the signed Diners, Drive-Ins, and Drives memorabilia hanging near the front entrance of the restaurant. There is actually another La Santisima location at Glendale, AZ and one of my friends mistakenly drove to the Glendale location due to miscommunication. Our waiter was someone who just started the job a day ago and he said a lot of people ordered guacamole - I took his advice and it was definitely a great recommendation.

Menu: I have tried plenty of street tacos in Los Angeles, but oh boy the La Santisima's menu completely overwhelmed me. There are just so many regional tacos (Yucatán, Oaxaca, Ensenada, Mexico City, Sonora, Baja Sur, Guadalajara City, etc) to choose from! In addition to tacos, the menu also includes lonches (pretty much like torta), burritos, quesadillas, and botanas / sopas / caldos / ensalada.

Salsa Bar: 14 different options such as pecan salsa, peanut salsa, cilantro salsa, Cabo salsa, Mexicans salsa, pico de gallo, etc. Each table gets a basket of complimentary chips and extra chip will cost $2.70. HOWEVER, you will also get another basket of complimentary chips if you do order a side of guacamole.

***

[Mix & Match Plates (3 tacos with rice & beans) for $13.98 (extra charge if you choose any tacos from the La Santisima Gran Reserva Tacos) - all tacos had two layers of corn tortilla]

[Taco 1] La Santisima Specialty (toasted Oaxaca cheese, mushrooms, poblano pepper, onion, spinach, fresh garlic grilled with olive oil, special salsa cilantro served with your selection of meat - steak; extra $0.99 for plate): Excellent and flavorful steak with crazy toppings - this was the best one out of the three I tried. (4.75/5)

[Taco 2] Mayan Cochinita Pibil (12-hour slow cooked roasted pork shoulder until fork tender marinated with Achiote Mayan rojo, Mexican herbs, wrapped in a banana leave topped with pickle onions; extra $0.51 for plate): It was one of the Yelp recommendations, but I thought this pork shoulder taco tasted just okay. This was my least favorite taco out of the three. (3.5/5)

[Taco 3] Baja Sur Baby Shark (Corn tortilla filled with beer battered wild baby shark cazon, cabbage, salsa cilantro & mayo; extra $0.51 for plate): Well seasoned and tender fish taco. I liked La Santisima Specialty just a little bit more, but I will not shy away from ordering this taco. (4.5/5)

[Rice & Beans]: Rice tasted slightly sweet and bean had a slight spicy kick. Both were very good. (5/5)

Guacamole (aguacate, cilantro, chile serrano, onion, tomato, mango, jicama, cranberries; half for $6.99): It also came with a basket of complimentary chips. One of the slightly sweeter guacamole that I have tried and I really like it. (5/5)

Horchata (Family recipe fruits and pecans; $4.50): Talk about a huge bottle! A very unique horchata with strawberry and a hint of cinnamon. It was a very solid horchata and just slightly sweet for my taste. (4.25/5)

***

Recommendations: Don't eat too much chips and get hook on salsa bar or guacamole because you will not have enough room to finish your tacos. Tacos aren't exactly cheap here, but this is really the taco shop for foodies in general.

Very good. But packed during lunch. Messy tables are unsightly, and the wait is long.
The food is awesome, though my order wasn't entirely correct, I ordered shrimp mole taco's and received chicken. Though was charged for shrimp (I think).

Service is friendly, and being such a small place I think they try very hard to deal with the lunch rush, but seem slightly understaffed.

I will go back as they have a great and varied menu and an awesome salsa bar. I just would probably wait until a non-peak time.

Only reason i cant give them 0 stars b/c its not an option.Never stopping here ever again....stopped on a Sat 1/21/17 asked for table of 8, I get it its a small place and tables are scarce but was told 20min wait....waited 1.5hrs for nothing. Multiple parties of 4 went ahead of us. When I asked why the wait was taking so long and having multiple 4 people parties go ahead when  their tables could have been combined to accommodate us, the waitress gave me attitude and back peddled b/c she couldn't come up with a reason why others were being seated before us. If they weren't going to accommodate us just communicate and we could have gone elsewhere without wasting 1.5hrs of time. Can't rate the food b/c we were never given any service.

Drive by here all the time, based on mostly good Yelp reviews, decided to check it out.

First, their parking situation is pathetic.

Second, the service is pretty horrendous. The server was actually nice and was doing her best, but she had no help and was running the entire restaurant by herself. Seating, serving, busing all done by one overworked server. We waited 45 minutes just to get our drinks. About an hour to get out food.

Third, food is not bad, but not worth the wait.

The horchata and the salsa bar are the only saving graces to this place, but honestly it should be shut down.

Someone suggested this place to us and were warned that their customer service was slow, but goodness we weren't expecting THAT slow for a restaurant. My boyfriend asked for a local beer from tap and called it by the brewery name instead of the beer name and that apparently confused them even though it was the only Huss beer they had up there (never has that happen to us before at other places since every beer tap has the brewery name). The thing I hated most was that they don't split the bill by the individual if asked. Only way to split it is by splitting it in half, which sucks if the other person orders more than you. Luckily, we basically ordered the same thing so half worked for us. The tacos were yummy so that made up for everything else, however they weren't yummy enough for us to want to deal with that again.

I used to come here when most people wouldn't venture this far down 16th. Now you can expect an hour wait on the weekend. It is well written it, though.  I rec the Gandhi taco on corn tortilla, with addition of fried oaxaca cheese. Obviously not vegan anymore, but yum!!

A hidden gem down the street from my work. The salsa bar is ON POINT! So delish! And the Ghandi burrito (ironically with chicken added) is very fresh and so yummy. I definitely recommend going here. The service is sometimes slow at the high times, so try to avoid that if possible. They have doubled their business side, which has definitely helped. 
Don't miss out!

Whhat? I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet. It is by far, one of my favorite taco shops in all of Phoenix. Authentic. Quality. Delicious. 

When you first come in you get chips and can start experiencing the amazing salsa bar. Each flavor isn't just thrown together, but put together with thought and care. I have favorites, but they are all pretty tasty.

Follow that up with some amazing food (I personally love the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco plate with double rice). Then you can wash it down with a, not-so-traditional, but in a good way Horchata. 

They will then drop the bill off and you will be pleasantly surprised that you had such an delicious, fresh meal for such a reasonable price.
My first time here and I am still waiting on 4 tacos, 35 minutes later. These tacos better be worth it!!!! Great horchata.

so my mom is in town and wanted some good mexican food.  i ran through the list of places that i know in my head and have frequented.  i stumbled across La Condesa and suggested it.  but i wasn't sure, i mean, i wanted to take my mom somewhere nice and i wasn't sure about La Condesa's atmosphere or food.

after much deliberation we decided on going.  and boy oh boy, we were not disappointed in the least!

to begin with, i'm a big fan of dia de los muertos imagery.  so to walk up and see a big mosaic sculpture above the door, i was already biased that this place may be my new favorite mexican food spot.  inside was decorated much the same with beautiful paintings of dia de los muertos portraits.  stunningly beautiful (i wish i had asked if they were for sale, but they had just finished up a remodel, so i was assuming they were not available).

their salsa bar is amazing!!!  my personal favorite was the jicama salsa.  but i could seriously sit and just eat chips and salsa.  

i had a big sur dogfish shark taco and a carne asada burro.  the calabasitas (mini-squash, kinda like zucchini) were amazing!

the service was great too!  she was very friendly and was willing to chat up with us...always nice when i'm trying a new place.

this will definitely be my new joint for tacos and burros, hands down!

One of the best burritos I have ever had! I ordered the Santisima burrito with shrimp and after waiting impatiently for it to cool down enough to eat it, I was amazed at the complex flavor explosion...I had a cute waitress who was made sure I had everything and checked back often. The salsa bar is THE BEST I have ever encountered, I tried 4, which was about 1/4 of them, and was blown away by the Pecan Salsa, WOW....I wanted to try a marg but went with a beer, gives me a reason to come back....Very cool interior and a decent variety of beers and Tequilas...
Seriously outstanding tacos.  Not sure why we waited so long to come here.  Will be bringing everyone that comes to visit us in Phoenix here! Thanks!

This place has classic tacos from Mexico D.F. and a really great salsa bar. The peanut salsa is unexpectedly spicy, and the cilantro salsa is a personal favorite of mine. 

I'm a fairly unadventurous eater. Once I find my favorite, I like to stick to it, but that's pretty much impossible here. I want to try everything, and think that over time, I'll eventually get there. Until then, my top recommendations are the street plate with at least 1 mole taco. You'll be upcharged, but if that's your only reason for not trying this piece of delicious, message me for a stronger sales pitch. The point of this place is that if you know what you like, or even if you don't, you'll find something here. Everything tastes like a really good version of what you'd expect at a price point that can't be beat.

Pro tip: toss some cilantro salsa in with your rice :)

The menu is kind of big and many items may be unfamiliar to many.  They have a baby shark taco and numerous other items that sound unique and exotic.  Even the horchata is quite large and they sprinkle all sorts of toppings to it.  The salsa bar also contained items I usually don't see in other taco shops.  The green salsa was spicy and delicious.  I was surprised at my bill being over $21 (3 tacos + beans/rice + horchata).  Regardless of how fancy a taco is the price shouldn't be so high per person.  It's a freakin' taco.  Also I wouldn't recommend parking  on the main road facing the restaurant.  Some are signed for another business in which after I opened my car door someone popped out and sternly let me know they will be calling the tow on inappropriate parked cars.  Also these spots when you back out is super dangerous as cars on the main road are racing by pretty fast.  There is a parking lot on the side of the restaurant that is much safer.
Great food. Had the Gaucho Taco which was good. However the breakfast I had with Spanish sausage was really really good. The Chipotle salsa was one of the best salsas I ever had. Highly recommend it.

A great little taco spot hidden in Phoenix. The pastor tacos have a nice hit of spice, which contrasts well with the sweetness of the pineapple. Prices are reasonable. This place is seriously small, we went on a Tuesday afternoon and it was empty, though I can see La Santisima filling up quickly during the evening. Our waitress was reserved, but not rude.

It's not in the best neighborhood, which is kind of sad, because there's an elementary school across the street, but I feel like the best eateries are usually in someplace sketchy. Often, you must venture outside your comfort zone to experience the sublime.

Also, I neglected to try the salsa bar, I was so memorized by the pastor tacos. I'll definitely return on my next trip to PHX.

Great food, however cramped seating, and service that could use some improvement. I love the salsa bar, but quite a few of the salsas were empty, and not being filled up. Definitely enjoyed what I ordered! I look forward to eating here again, while hoping for an improvement in the service.

I didn't realize this place was on Diners, Drive- Ins and dives until we got there and saw a huge picture of Guy Fieri. Trust me when I say you need to go here if you visit Phoenix. There is a salsa bar that you can go to to get any sorts of salsa they have made for the day. They were delicious! The food was absolutely fantastic. I ordered a pork burrito that was so good every bite, and there was a lot of food. I couldn't finish it, and I can eat a lot! My husband and friend both really enjoyed their entrees, too (shrimp Jamaican burrito and a roasted cauliflower burrito). It wasn't until after I ordered that I decided to ask the server what their most popular dish was, and I wish I would have ordered what she described to me! Our server was really friendly, too. I'd be in trouble if I loved in Phoenix because I probably frequent this place more than I should.
The absolute best Mexican food! Everything is made fresh to order and delicious! The mole is unforgettable! The drinks are top notch too.
Very pleasant surprise!! Food is outstanding, great portion sizes and service was great, will definitely eat here again!!
I always bring friends and family here to have good real Mexican tacos. They always  want to come back here. The horchata tastes the way my mom and grandma make it.
Every time we visit Phoenix we take an Uber straight to La Santisima from the airport! Our favorite Mexican restaurant ever and they have an amazing salsa bar!
Some the best taco I've had. I had the Al Pastor (pork), Carne Asada & Chicken mole. The service was friendly and a salsa bar was amazing with 13 different salsas.

Hands down best tacos! They have quesadillas and burritos as well (I think they added sandwiches recently but I don't know for sure). Anyhow, the quesadillas are fried, so if you shy away from fried food, don't even go there. The salsa bar is the best I've ever seen and I enjoy mostly all of what they have available. I like the arracherra taco, the tinga taco and the guacho taco. Perhaps I have spelled those incorrectly, I'm not sure but whatever you get it's going to be good. I do not however, like the beans. I don't know what it is or why, I just don't like them. I do like the rice with the corn in it but generally speaking I just get the tacos a la carte. OH and the Horchata? OMG, get it I promise you even if you don't like Horchata you will probably like this. It is huge though and has fruit and nuts and wow, it's just good. I like the Jamaica (sp?) juice too, but who doesn't :-P... Obviously, I don't speak spanish sorry for my awful spelling. Everyone should try it here, but they are small and get busy so try to find a time not everyone will be going to eat.
Love the salsa bar!! Kind of a tight squeeze but worth it.

Mexican food that's as good as everyone makes it out to be. The tiger shrimp tacos are the best I've had and I'd highly recommend them. Salsa tasting is also a fun and unique experience, though you quickly realize that there's really only 1 or 2 that you really enjoy. Be ready for a wait cuz this place is poppin'

Went here for happy hour after work (5:00pm) on a Friday night and my party (of 2) was able to be seated right away.  I really liked some of the artwork hanging in the restaurant.  We ordered several types of tacos and loved them all.  Even more impressive was the well stocked salsa bar ranging from cheese causes and mild salsas to some that really make your mouth burn.  I had a great time here and will definitely go back.
Best Taco place in the valley. Great selection of salsas and hands down best Horchata in the world! Small and not the best seating but who cares! Carnitas are  tops.

If you're Mexican do not come here. It smells. We had the hostess tell us multiple times are server was coming then she would end up helping us. The waters are not natural. The meat was probably microwaved or re-heated. Did I say it smells? The complimentary waters are faucet water.

Update: this the next day. I had to leave work early today. I have the stomach flu. My little cousin was crying yesterday his stomach was killing him and he had never felt such pain.

Ok. This place was great. But I had some issues with my girlfriend here. She's an executive chef and is madly in love with Guy Fieri. When she saw the autographed poster she instinctively tried to climb on the table and smell it. I think she even tried to lick it. After the manager had to threaten to call the cops she settled down and after the shakes and sweats stopped, we were able to enjoy the best damn tacos we have had in a loooong time. The salsa bar kicks ass and we mixed a few together to get even better sauces. I do recommend this place to everyone, but not Guy Fieri. He's a dick and almost ruined our vacation.

I was realllllly craving horchata and was phyched to be in the area, so I did a quick run in to go order at lunch time on a week day.  I was impressed with how they handled the crowd, they had a flow.  I also ordered some al pastor tacos, while waiting I filled some to go cup from their salsa bar, then waited at the bar. They gave me water and were very friendly even while busy as can be.  When I left and dug in to my al pastor I was sooooo impressed.  It was tied with the best I have ever had.  So amazing! Street tacos are the way to go!  I won't wait so long to come back next time!

A quaint lil' taco shoppe, with an assortment of DEEE-LISH salsas, my favie is Peanut Salsa and Orange Salsa.... and a menu paralleling Al Varado Street, Downtown LA... and HORCHATA to make your eyelashes curl! 

LEmmmmmE just say.... it's YUMM-4-DAYS......

This is the greatest Mexican restaurant I've ever been to.  The salsa bar offers more choices than I've ever seen.  The meat was perfect.  Even the rice was filled with flavor--which was a real surprise since I don't remember ever having rice I could actually taste.  And the margarita was much better than anything I can remember.

Outstanding food at reasonable prices  in a non-pretentious atmosphere.  What more could someobody want?  I'll certainly come here again the  next time I'm in the area.

Excellent.  You could never get tired of the large variety of salsas--that seem to change every time I come in.  The menu is overwhelming and the food is top notch.  They also have excellent margaritas that are really inexpensive during happy hour.  The staff is friendly.

Okay, so I literally live a few blocks away from this place. There are so many Mexican options in the area, but I knew this was one we had to try. 

First of all, the place is tiny inside. We had a 15 minute wait on a Sunday afternoon which was a little annoying, but also proved that they aren't lacking in business. The worst part is that there is literally no where to stand. So we kind of tucked our bodies into a corner and tried to stay out of the way. That was kind of awkward. I was surprised that this was a sit-down restaurant. I was really expecting an order-at-the-counter type of place. In fact, I still think that would've probably worked better. 

Once we got our table, we were brought a complimentary basket of chips and a tall bottle of water to fill our own cups with. I like that the chips are free (especially since they have all the delicious salsa options), but I was disappointed that you get charged for chips after the first basket. We ordered the guacamole to go with all the salsas and were pleasantly surprised. My husband makes guac at our house all the time and I'm a bit partial to his, so I was excited to try such a refreshing, different take on guacamole. Pretty tasty! 

For our main course, I ordered the veggie quesadilla and my man ordered the bean and cheese burrito. Both were delicious! I have to admit that I wasn't a fan of the fact that the quesadillas are fried, but the amazing cheese made up for it. I was worried that I wouldn't have enough cheese with all the veggies they stuffed inside, but I was so very wrong. I seriously could not get enough of that cheese! I am craving more right now...

I guess one of the downsides to this little place is the fact that it is so packed inside. We literally were just a few inches away from the table next to us (and the guy nextdoor was so annoying!). They also only had two servers scurrying between all the tables so the service was not the greatest. We had to wait awhile for drink refills and the check which was a little disappointing. The food does come out quickly though so if you're hungry, you wont be kept waiting. 

So yes, I was quite pleased with our first visit to La Condesa. We will be back.

Came here with a friend who would not stop raving about how amazing this place was. It had so many great reviews, so I was pretty pumped to try it. They have a rather large menu, and I was pleasantly surprised to see how many vegetarian options they offered. They have a nice, fresh salsa bar, however many of them contain ingredients that are smoked, which I do not care for, but they were still rather delicious. The strawberry, peanut and rabano (radish) salsas were surprising and tasty.  I ended up ordering the Azteca tinga lonche and a Pacific white fish taco. The taco was good, but the breading was a little soggy, and came with way too much mayo. The fish flavor overpowered pretty much everything, even when I drowned it in salsa. The first bite of the lonche reminded me heavily of manwich...something I have not eaten since I was a small child. The flavor was too tomato-y, much like manwich, and was tough for me to finish. The birote it came in, however, was delicious and crunchy. It pains me to give a low rating, when other diners are dishing out 4 and 5 stars. I would be willing to give this place a second chance, but good bread and salsa is not enough to entice me back just yet.

This place easily gets a 5 star for amazing authentic Mexican food - some of the best I've had.  We had a group of 5 and all ordered different dishes - all were extremely flavorful and well prepared - difficult to choose the one we all liked best.  The service was barely a 3.  People were nice but we didn't see our water much and took long to get a drink, the check, etc

This place flipped a 180 on me! I am a regular and I sometimes I used to ask myself why. The food is great but the service is guaranteed to suck. However me N the girl were hungry so we decided to eat some huge burros. On the way we joked about bringing a book while we wait. But this time we were seated right away,  bright drinks and our order came out in record time all thanks to JUAN our server. I felt like I was on that show Bar Rescue and they cleaned how and got service as good as their food. It was a nice change to not have moody, disrespectful waitress girls that they usually have. I hope it stays like this or perhaps Juan can give lessons.

Great but overpriced, maybe for a good reason. I'd say some of the best taco's in Glendale, but they are kinda stingy with salsa to go. Paid $100 for 7 and the kid only offered us 4 salsa's to go. If I wanted more, I had to pay extra. At least 2-3 per person, jeeze (Trust me, they are tiny) Would have given you guys 5 stars if you weren't so stingy. 

Also, bring back the strawberry spicy salsa, why remove your best?

We were in the mood for Mexican food while in the Phoenix area- so we decided to head on over to this place.
It's located in a crusty part of town...just FYI. We went in on a Thurs night and the extremely small restaurant was packed.
There really is nowhere to stand if you're waiting for a table. The place is so tightly packed that you kind of awkwardly stand with your butt in a diners face while waiting for someone to seat you.
There were only TWO people working the entire floor that night. From seating, to serving, to bartending. TWO PEOPLE.
It was an extremely long, awkward wait and we kind of ended up seating ourselves at the bar once it cleared out because no one else offered us a seat anywhere.
I felt bad for anyone who came in after us because they all had the same look of awkward confusion on their faces as they stood by the door for 20 minutes waiting for SOMEONE to let them know what to do, where to go....
We got margaritas, which weren't very strong- and we're extremely expensive ($8 ea???). And even though the service was the worst I've ever seen in my LIFE- the food completely made up for it. I wanted to hate the place, but my burrito was so good- I never wanted it to end. I got the La Santisima Specialties Burro with arrachera  . Heaven on a PLATE. So flavorful, filling, delicious....i'm like...daydreaming of it now.......
The final bill was pretty pricey for only 2 burritos and 2 drinks- $50?? If I were to visit this location again (which I will)- I'd most likely just get my food to go. The inattentive lack of service makes you feel more like a bother than an appreciated customer.

*edit* Moved to Phoenix, been here twice since then. Food is still super amazing. I mean seriously...that La Santisima Specialties burro dipped in pecan "salsa".......to die for. Service hasn't changed. If it's busy, goooood luck. Your service will be horrendous. We went today and it was FINALLY slower...we actually got a table and not the bar stools for once. And we were served a lot faster...much more pleasant. Wish they'd expand.
But whatever. Awesome place, just go.

I love this place. The Pecan Salsa alone is enough to keep me coming back. The Horchata is divine and the brunch offerings are filling and hearty. We shared a Traditional (Cheese) Queso which was filled to the brim with Oaxaca cheese. It was not one of those flat Quesos you find at most places. It looked more like a turnover with it's flaky tortilla dough. We each had a burro and should have split one as they were enough for a meal by themselves. We noticed their Happy Hour Street Taco deal right after ordering so that will have to wait for another visit. Pecan Salsa oh how I love you.

First timer and heard great reviews about this spot so it was only fitting to bring my nephew vision from NY. For starters the Paloma drinks were probably the best I have had from any location, the freshness of the fruits mixed with the tequila was tasty! Now the salsa bar was a surprise but a good one with the vast selection of salsas ! The pork burrito was phenomenal, must say the flavor can't describe but the picture I post can speak for itself ! I will be back very soon to try out the tacos !
The food is as authentic as it gets. The specialty tacos were amazing. The salsa bar was out of this world. Loved the peanut salsa

Had to wait 40 minutes for a table despite there being half a dozen open tables. Never got a water refill or offer for a second drink. The waiter literally took our order, dropped off food, and then brought us a check. Nothing else. 

Food was good, but service was so bad I'll never be back.

I have to say the drinks here are very good, service is great but the food was fair. I got a Torta but the meat was very chewy and didn't put much meat in my Torta. It had a lot of cueros. It's very expensive here just for 2 Michelada it was total of $18 it was one of the best I've had but other than that, I couldn't enjoy my food.

So, mi media naranja and I were flying out of Phoenix early in the morning: we were headed to Boston for a couple of weeks. I didn't want to get up at the butt-crack of dawn to drive up to PHX from Tucson, so we decided to stay the night close to the airport. Of course the normal "what do you want for dinner" conversation started, and we decided we wanted some good Mexican food before we left the desert Southwest. Yelp led us here; when was the last time you saw a 4 1/2 star review with 500-some odd reviews?

Those 4 1/2 stars weren't lying. The salsa bar is ridiculously fantastic! Strawberry salsa? Yes please! I had four helpings of the robano pibil salsa. Chips were sorta warm, nothing incredible; the real star was the salsa. I ordered a couple of al pastor tacos and a Mayan Cochinita pibil. The pastor was delicious, and the Mayan taco?? The pork was mouthwateringly tender and perfectly seasoned. I felt sad when my plate was empty. 

My better half had the cabo shrimp taco, which she didn't seem super excited about. The mole taco, however, got her talking; incredibly, she shared a bite with me. I agreed; it was phenomenal. 

Service was fast and courteous. I'd take off 1/2 star for using the restrooms as a storage area for extra dining-room chairs. Kinda gross. Overall, though, it was excellent and I am glad we went!

Jim W was in town and that was all the reason needed to party, well at least have dinner.  Heather C and Ryan C also were able to show up.  This was my first visit here.  I arrived last and there were chips, guacamole (thanks Ryan) and several salsas already on the table.  About half way through the second basket of chips we placed our orders.  Most of the table got tacos and I got the Oaxacan Black Mole Chicken Quesa.  I also ordered the Horchata which was very tasty with the addition of nuts and fruit but when done left a pile of stuff in the bottom.  The Quesa was delicious, quite filling and actually made two meals for me.  Just a note: mole does not do any better in a microwave on high than gravy, but it still tasted fine.  Service was fine and she split the checks after she had already given us a single one.  We were dining fairly early but as the evening wore on it got pretty busy on a Thursday even with a major Haboob going on.  Definitely a place worth checking out!

I've been here a couple of times now for lunch.  I had been to the other location previously known as La Condesa once so I knew the food was going to be good.  And it certainly is.  Parking seems like it could be a hassle at times.  Another Yelper says they park at the school when it is not in session.  This time I noticed the back gate was open with an empty lot on the other side of the alley but my server could not tell me if it was ok to park there.  The salsa bar is always a delight and I try to limit myself to two per meal so I can keep track of what I am having.  Service both times has been OK but sort of an afterthought.  I will certainly keep this place in the lunch rotation.

Food was good as always but it took an hour to get. It was kinda busy but they have no flow. If any of the owners/ managers are reading this..contact me if you need another server/ manager to help sort out this mess. Im a closer at a restaurant right now and would be willing to help you guys out. This happens every time we are there. It's painful to watch, your servers are running around like chickens with their heads cut off whenever more than 5 tables are there.

Nothing more than average at best. Other than the Awesome and extensive salsa bar , it was pretty mediocre..especially for the 4 1/2 stars they have. 

We had two burritos and they were decent! You could taste the individual ingredients and the vegetables tasted fresh, which I liked but it wasn't a BURRITO. It was more like a wrap you would get from Whole Foods. Not to mention, it was way, way, way too small. It was similar in size to a McDonalds snack wrap. I legitimately left lunch at La Santisima and had to get a bite at another place...Mexican joints are supposed to fill you up!

Either way, the place has a lot of potential and it could be very good but I wasn't a fan.

If you've ever been to Lucha Libre in San Diego, it's very similar in style, just not as good in my opinion.

I could have only eaten chips and all the salsas from the salsa bar and I would have been a happy camper. I wish I could have packed the salsa bar home with me, but unfortunately, it doesn't work like that. (TSA has a limit in liquid ratios). 

I tried almost every salsa from the bar and I have to say, the best one is actually a combination. Mix the guacamole and peanut salsas together, and you instantly have salsa crack. I could have eaten tubs of the mixture and still wouldn't be sick if it. The heat of the guacamole salsa balances quite well with the umami of the peanut salsa.

Street tacos were good too but my mind was on the richness of the salsas. They should just change their name to Salsa Heaven. 

Other than the salsas, please note the service was subpar and the prices on the menus and what they actually bill you is inconsistent, but only by a few cents so no point in arguing.

I was not impressed with this place even though it received good reviews from a local news source. The staff was not very friendly and the food was ok.  The price was steep compared to other local mexican food restaurants.  I had to eat the chips with no salsa since they were out.

An airport shuttle driver recommended this restaurant, as it was fairly close to the Thunderbird School of Global Management, where I was headed for the week.  Though, in reality, it feels like nothing is close to anything in Phoenix.  She said that she sends people there regularly, and she gets good feedback from those she sends.

One of the things I loved about it: it's not just another Tex-Mex restaurant pretending to represent the cuisine of this vast country called Mexico.  Their menu features dishes from all around Mexico and unless you can't break your non-adventurous self from burritos, then you'll probably experience something new and delicious.  

By the way, our party of four did not experience any of the others' comments about poor service.  The young woman who served us was prompt, cheerful, courteous, attentive, and was happy to take a group photo of us using my phone. She was even rather easy on the eyes for us four men.  I'd recommend the place.

I'm sure you have heard my stories how I have had to drag my son to try some places in the valley, well my son had been very annoying telling me I need to go with him to La Santisima, he just loves that's close to his house. 

It was 9:30am on a Saturday and I was in the mood for breakfast and told him ok let's go! He had already warned me that it was a small place with a long a wait but that they were worth wait. We walked in and saw we were the only ones theirs, YES! No wait for us!

I was in the mood for a breakfast burrito, but after checking out there breakfast menu I went the Chilaquiles Rojos with Chicken, toasted tortilla with salsa roja, chicken, cheese topped off with over easy eggs & with black beans severed with bread & avocado.  Oh my gawd, this was an excellent breakfast! It was a lot of food, I couldn't finish it all, it was flavorful, and it was the perfect amount of sauce to tortilla, so good!

I am glad my son talked me into trying them out, now I have to go back for some Tacos!

I can't say enough good about this great little restaurant.  Honestly.

I always eat out when the general public isn't out in force, and I love going to La Condesa in the middle of the afternoon on weekdays.  Many good restaurants have the afternoon restaurant "limbo" period where they close until dinner, but it's great that this place doesn't.  

Every single thing I've tried there is so good I wind up benchmarking most other Mexican-style restaurants against La Condesa.  Starting with their tortilla chips and salsa, the chips are always super fresh, and their salsa bar is the best I've ever seen; all home/hand-made gourmet salsas, TWELVE in all, obviously all made fresh.  Each one by itself is incredibly great, while I have about 5 favorites I always focus on.  

I got addicted to their mole sauce.  That's surprising for me because I'm not a big chocolate fan at all, and the first time I saw mole sauce, just the idea sickened me!  Plus the first time I tried it, the person who made it really didn't know what they were doing -- but that all did a serious about-face once I tried La Condesa's.  It's hard to not order their mole chicken, but if you want to try another truly interesting and great gourmet taco, burro, or bowl, try their Pork al Pastor, it'll blow you away too.  I recently tried it burro style, and with some fresh tortilla chips and a half dozen cups of various salsas, it was almost too much to eat -- I chose to just have ice water with the meal, and the whole tab came to about $9-bucks.  Even when you just want water they bring you a glass filled with ice and lime wedges, and a stopper-type liter sized bottle of ice cold water.  

Service is always fantastic too.  There isn't a whole lot of room in the place, maybe 15 tables and bar seating as well, which is why I also like going there when the crowds aren't around.  They're open for breakfast on Saturday's and Sunday's, I haven't been there during those times but I'd bet my bottom dollar they make a killer Huevos Rancheros!  

This is certainly a must visit restaurant if you haven't eaten there before -- I almost don't want to write such a great review because they do enough business as it is, and I don't want to ruin one of my favorite places to go!  I'm picky, but not unrealistically so -- it's not often I'll write a 1-star review, and the same goes for 5-stars.  This place is absolutely a solid FIVE STAR restaurant, hands down IMHO.

MUST go! So glad I found this place on Yelp, otherwise I would've never spotted it just driving by. The La Santisma veggie tacos are amazing! I tried the veggie tacos with the cactus too- also good but I preferred the others. Service was friendly and the food came out fast. Check out the salsa bar for a plethora of yummy salsa options. Can't wait to go back!

Ok, I finally got a chance to come back with some coworkers. They changed their format. The first time I was there, it was go to the counter order and they give you a number. They have waiter service this time. I got the Sonora Arrachera Quesa (Oaxaca cheese & char-broiled Arrachera steak). It was so good and too much for me to finish. I looks at my fellow lunchers and their tacos looked so GOOD. The salsa bar is filled with all sorts of varieties. I tried the strawberry salsa, too sweet for my taste... but more to favors to try!

Really enjoyed the food and the salsa bar. Everything I have tried here so far has been great. The mole is very tastey and I have to say you must try the quesadillas they are awsome (but mind you they are not for those watching the waistline).

The salsa bar here is the best! I really liked the food. The tacos are small but filling. Many dishes come with a side of beans and rice and they are delicious! Had a quesadilla before...not quite like Mexico city but it had good flavor just thicker but a huge portion. Service has always been fast and friendly so no complaints there.
A total hole in the wall, but so good!  Tons of different salsas to choose from.

I was so hyped on my way here, I brought a coworker to order for the whole store. It was so busy, everything looked great. I said I've never been here and I'm starving. He ordered for me and it literally ended up being a beef burrito with only retried beans and nothing else. I'm sure everyone else enjoyed there's but man was that confusing

We have been to many Mexican places (around the nation) & found this one on yelp.. it's very authentic (not Americanized), it has the right amount of heat. Loved the salsa bar, their tacos (loved the Jamica shrimp one but Mahi fish & Mexic Mignon were ok). Beans & rice had good flavor. My husband really liked his burrito...I was a little skeptical about getting their tramarind margarita but was one of the best margaritas I've ever tasted. Waitress & their service were equally good. Definitely going back here and trying other things on the menu.

After coming to this location for a very long time I decided to treat my parents since they had never tried it. Unfortunately their first experience and now our last was a very disappointing one. The food was great as usual but the waitress lacked any customer service skills. We never even got her name because she never introduced herself. But she was the only server at noon on 1/26/17. She Never once acknowledged us when she took our order. It was very uncomfortable as it felt like we were a bother. If you're looking for a great experience this place is not it. Not anymore.
