It seemed the table next to us was also upset and placed a complaint but she disregarded it and even joked about it the her next table. So I figured it was pointless to complain instead id rather save the bad experience for others.
Excellent service, servers were very kind. food was average. I will probably be back to try the lonches.

OMG. This place is killer!  They have a great salsa bar but be careful my friends - don't fill up on the chips. Save room for the gourmet tacos!  For about $15 you can select 3 gourmet tacos + rice and beans. They have authentic tacos and several interesting vegetarian options. The taco plate will fill you up for sure - lots of food (and very yummy).

Absolutely love this place! Tacos are amazing and salsa bar is creative and diverse (the cashew salsa is truly delicious and there are a number of options to choose from). The gaucho taco is a solid staple with charcoal grilled steak, sliced avocado and pickled onions, and the arrachera taco has subtle complexities of flavor despite its somewhat simplistic presentation. There are also an abundance of other delicious/unique menu options (such as the deep fried Quesadilla for example), and the wait staff is very helpful and kind as well. Would definitely recommend this place to family and friends in search of a local one of a kind hole in the wall Mexican restaurant. Definitely a must try if you are in the area.

What else can I really say about this place? 
1. Their service is good
2. Food is great, super fresh & has various varieties. 
3. The Salsa Bar is to die for! 
4. They give warm chips right when u sit on the table 
5. Small & very intimate 

It also made me feel better that this place had a lot of credentials on their wall from being the best of Phoenix to one of the neighborhood gems!

Very good Al Pastor Burro. It's a little hard to find right away from the road and parking can be a hassle but this is such a great place! Their salsa bar has flavors I've never even thought of that go way beyond green, mild, medium and hot. The meat in my Al Pastor Burro was so juicy and flavorful and the pineapple was actually in there for once! Will absolutely go back with friends next time for sure!

Now we're talking.  Fabulous tacos -- the Chicken Tinga is amazing, as is the Cochinita Pibil.  The salsa bar is amazing; lots of choices, some of them specialized for your taco/burrito.  Reasonably priced hole-in-the-wall.  Service is just o.k. and it gets hot in the summer (no/weak A.C.), but the food and the value are excellent.
Wow. Not a huge fan of beans but theirs are so good would make a meal of beans alone. This place is a must go.

Found this place on Yelp last year during our vacation and had to come back. The food is delicious. Street tacos and burritos are a must try. And the salsa bar, so many options if you like spicy try the one with nopales (cactus). The classic margarita is so refreshing, my kids love the horchata.
This place was featured on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives .... What a great  Taco and the spin on the Orchata with pecan nuts and cinnamon. .. great flavor!

Guac has dried cranberries! Salsa bar superfun. 

Drove across town to return. The corn quesadillas are phenomenal. HUGE! Mine came with shrimp and poblano peppers. 

Art on the wall very engaging. Seems like each had a story to tell. 

Service very friendly.

This is a hidden gem in Phoenix. Their Jamaica Rose Shrimp burrito is A-MAZ-ING! Prices are reasonable, lunch rush hour can get a bit crazy but there's always room to sit and their food never lets you down.
Wait was over 30 min for 2 people. Numerous tables were open but waited to sit people. Food was not good and not worth the money. Would not recommend this place.
Ate here for dinner tonight and this place is amazing. Grass fed beef carne asada, amazing drinks (Margaritas) and delicious tacos. I would recommend this place for sure!

Street taco were excellent. The rice and beans that came with the tacos were very good. Tastes very authentic. The shark tacos were also very good. They also have a fantastic salsa bar. It's a small place but you can usually get a seat with a short wait.

This place deserves the hype. I asked the waitress to surprise me with with a couple tacos. I was impressed by the three she ordered for me, but the special shark taco was unreal. It was the best taco I have ever had the pleasure to consume. This is a wonderfully unique eatery. I would highly suggest dining here.

Great service- server was friendly and attentive. Small place, will probably have to wait if you could at a typical busy lunch or dinner time. Food was on point, even a few options for vegetarians! Good sized portions, not overly pricey. Love having the salsa bar there!! The jicama drink was similar to a berry juice, was a little too sweet for my liking but once it was watered down a little, it was delicious. Will definitely come back here next time!

Kool small joint, reminds me of the Mission District in my old San Fran hood.  Authentic street food. Cheap prices, strong salty Patron Margaritas. Insane horchata in 
a huge glass ?40 oz???   Ridiculous slow service on Saturday nights.  Chips not salted but thats ok because of the kick ass salsa collection.

Food - OK. Had cochinita pibil tacos with beans and rice. I found bone and thhe flavor wasn't all that great. Husband had a quesadilla - way too greasy. Napkins couldn't soak up the grease fast enough. Salsas available, because some were empty were quite tasty.
Ambient- sound bounced of the walls and couldn't really have a talk with out contributing to the already loud room. Lighting not great. Beautiful mexican culture inspired art. Loved it.
Service- not good. Sat us down and then disappeared had to stop them and ask any of the employees to put in our order, refills, and our check. The worst part was... there wasn't that many people.
Other- loved there terra cota plates. Cups were paper cups, and they had nice silver wear. Couldn't figure out whether it was nice dinner restaurant or just a dive.

UPDATE:  They raised their prices by A LOT, and also the lady made me sit down, when before you just ordered at the counter. Always loved how this was a cheaper spot where you didn't need to tip. NOT ANYMORE!  I've been a loyal customer for years but now im going to my other go to taco place if prices don't change back to what they used to be!

We go here at least every few weeks. Very Authentic.  The prices are pretty average. I do wish that they had some bigger bowl of salsa as they give you these small little tester cups to try their salsa bar out with. You also have to pay for your second bowl of chips which isn't exactly ideal. This place is usually very very busy. I believe they had a bench to sit outside and wait. The staff doesn't seem to have any sort of order or manager there to help them out. You definitely will sit at your table for at least 15 minutes before minutes before being asked what you want to drink and then get your drinks probably 15 minutes after that.  The staff may ask you if you would like to order your meal enchilada  style but just a heads up- it costs an additional five dollars or more to make this happen. I think they should let people know that as they are ordering or add that price on the menu.  Overall we love this place because the food is so good but we do think they could make a few changes to benefit their business and customers.
Update: Ate here again as we do every few weeks, the service is TERRIBLE but the food is delicious. The place was not very busy but again, the service was the worst service you've probably ever experienced. Not a place to go if you are in a rush, with guests or if you are trying to accommodate etc. we sat at the table ready to go with drinks empty for a solid 20 minutes at least. They need to hire a manager and get this staff up to speed on acceptable service.

I love this place!  We have been several times and it never disappoints.  Great food and the salsa bar is fantastic.  It can get pretty busy so sometimes you have to wait for a table but they are always moving fast and it is always worth the wait!

Luchadores, sugar skulls, and amazingly flavorful spicy cuisine of Mexico. What more can you ask for. Be fore warned however, the salsa bar is full of spices salsas. This is not for the weak of heart!

La Santisima is on the top of my list for tacos in AZ.  It's not in the best part of town and the parking situation is a little tough if it's busy, but the food is out of this world!  My hubby and I came once, and decided to bring my parents here for an early Mother's Day lunch.  

I go weak in the knees for restaurants with salsa bars, but this place has a salsa bar on steroids.  They cater to all tastes and all heat levels.  I am in love with at least 5 of their salsas, including the pico de gallo that is so lime-y and delicious that it's the first one that ran out during both of our lunch visits.  

My hubby ordered the Norteno burrito both times and I got a variety of street tacos.  The carne asada is soft and juicy and not the least bit tough like you'll find at most Mexican places.  The beans remind me of the ones that my BFF's mom makes in Nogales.  Delicious!!

Went to La Condesa this past week, WOW!!!  Loved it!  Great atmosphere, cool hole in the wall type feel with excellent food and outstanding service.  Between a family of 4, we had street tacos, quesadilla , and the pork burrito with some great seasoning ( can't remember the name of it).  All of it was super tasty.  Don't forget to try all the salsas, each one of them offer a great addition to the food provided.  Finally I leave with this.... My kids asked if the restaurant had churros, so I asked and they mentioned they recently took them off the menu.  Waiter very nicely apologized and said sorry we don't have them anymore.  2 mins later the guy came back as we were signing our bill and told me he could make them for us.  They had the ingredients.  Within 5 mins my two kids had not only churros, but churros with strawberries, chocolate, Carmel and pecans on the plate.  Well presented and very delicious!! To top it all off I asked them to provide me a new bill for the dessert and he said its on the house.  There not on the menu, no need to charge u.  :) :).  Please don't use this against;).  What a fantastic experience!!  10 stars!!

Great great great food!! Best guac we have had in a while. Nice and chunky. Had cranberries in it, which I would have though would take away from the taste, but actually made it so much better!! Street tacos are delicious and their salsa bar is amazing. Great food!!!!! Definitely a memorable place.

Amazing salsa bar! Loved the cilantro variant... 
Excellent tacos, great prices... A gem hidden in Phoenix.

te encontre! 
I've been reading yelp reviews of this for a good two weeks and was dying to go here.

After a long day of not eating, I forced myself to go here. It's completely out of my way but boy was it worth it.

I ordered two things:
Carne asada tacos combo plate and a Tinga quesadilla.

The fact that they have tinga makes me very happy. It wasn't as "tingaish" as I would have liked it, but then again, no one has ever made me tinga like my Tia guty. 

The bad:
- teeny tiny parking. I came here at 4pm on a friday and was the only person there for a good ten minutes. I can't imagine finding a parking spot when there are more people around.

- The tortillas weren't great. They're not bad, but they aren't anything special. A taco should have a good tortilla in case the meat sucks (not that it sucked here).
- The rice and beans portion is small. WAY small. I get that a restaurant needs to make some profit, but these are tiny. 

The good-

- The quesadilla is huge. By huge, I mean I ate half of it and had to save some for later because of how filling the doughy tortilla is. This is not your average quesadilla. Not only do they use the right cheese (not your Americanized mozzarella and monterey jack or even, god forbid, chihuahua cheese), but the tortilla is flaky AND flavorful. That's a quality tortilla. This tortilla is nothing like the one used for the tacos, you can tell they make these themselves.

-The variety of salsas is pretty damn good. They will have everything from the most unoffensively bland salsa for gueros to a chile de arbol salsa that could make my daddy sweat. 

- La horchata. Now this is what horchata should taste like. Other restaurants take note because people may come here solely for this. The fruit is a cute side trick, but the horchata really is good.

I give it five stars because it reeks of unpretentiousness and we all know how much I loathe pretentiousness. The artwork is simple but quirkily Mexican, there is nothing fancy about the decor (which I like) and the cook looks like my Tio Memo (except he can cook whereas my Tio cannot). 

Overall, I hope they don't change a damn thing here. Let it become as popular as they can but please, please, don't change what you have! Finally, some authentic (and I hate using that word) tacos in Phoenix.

An excellent experience with great food and service. Without a doubt the best tacos I've ever had. The tacos are thick and filling. Don't forget to pick up salsa at the salsa bar.

All the tacos are loaded. I worked out before and was full with 4 tacos. I tried:

La Santisima Special taco: again loaded with cheese, and steak. A juicy satisfying mess. Would come back for this.

Mariachi loco taco: crispy, toasted shell with tasty barbacoa and onion filling. My second favourite after the La Santisima Special.

Cabo Tiger Shrimp taco. Loaded with juicy battered shrimp. A really good combination with the cilantro and cabbage

Anda Lucia taco: This was my least favourite but it's because I'm not a huge fan of beans. But the chorizo and potato are juicy delicious.

I love this place. Been here quite a few times now.

I love this place because it stands out among the hordes of Mexican food places serving smothered in cheese and sauce Mexican food. That's not my Mexican food at all. La Santisima is. 

The location is across 59th. Ave from Old Town Glendale so not exactly walkable from Old Town because who wants to cross Grand and risk death by car. There's a small parking lot in the back of the restaurant though. 

It's never very busy when I've been for a weekend lunch or dinner. La Perla next door can be packed with patrons and 20 tables will be empty at La Santisima some weekends. That simply means less hassle to get some of the best food you can find in Glendale.

I would recommend trying anything with arrachera in the description and the al pastor tacos. Their seafood choices are bangin' too. 

Their salsa bar will challenge your ideas of what a salsa can be made of. 

If you want to go for lunch or dinner at La Santisima and you can't find a date, I'll go with you anytime.

I use to go there and the food and salsa bar was excellent! I don't know what happened! They either sold the place or got different cooks or changed their recipes on their sauces, but things have really changed for the worse! I am really disappointed! It use to be the best place in town! I  am really sad! I see they are opening other places! If they don't get better they will lose business!

How can I possibly start this review? I'll just say it. This is my new favorite Mexican food restaurant!!!! Really really. It's THAT GOOD. I've been eating Mexican cuisine since I was a baby-so I like to think I know the good stuff when I taste it. This place it "IT" for me. I'm so happy with my experience, because I had really high expectations. 
I could go on and on about La Santisima, but I'll just cover the highlights so my review isn't painfully long. 

*Horchata-amazing (I like that it was served to me in a to-go cup because it's so large)  
*Tacos-unique and exceptional in every way (Lots of meat!  Insane flavors.) 
*Salsa bar-most impressive I have ever seen 
*Menu-large and intriguing (I want to come back to try just about everything listed)
*Atmosphere-great artwork  
*Service-stellar 

This place is so good that I was telling my waitress I can't wait to come back, and I hadn't even finished eating. L-O-V-E this restaurant. Wow. Wow. Wow.

There is no question this place has the BEST Mexican food in the valley. My problem is with the way it is ran, I have been a patron here since before it was on tv, before anybody heard of it, before it was popular. I have raved on yelp  how delicious the breakfast is here. It is only served on weekends and it is to die for. The past three times I have come for the desayundos, the waiters told me that I missed brunch hours. The first time, I did get there pretty late, around 230 so I understood. She said 2 was The cut off. The next time I got there, it was 1, and ironically, they weren't serving breakfast, I had just missed it. Now this time, I came at noon, and there was no more breakfast. What a Shame, I haven't had my favorite breakfast in almost a year. And it seems every time I get ther, is when they stop serving it. Also, the salsa is picked over before noon. They make a wonderful salsa seven chiles that I could eat as a main course, but it is always out when I get there. Ever since it has become popular it seems the customer service is poor, and the rules keep changing. The food is wonderful, everything else is horrible.

Great variety to choose from. Salsa bar with plenty of options.  Queso fundido could of been melted more, it was like it had been sitting for a minute and was a little difficult to eat, got it with pablano chili's and it was flavorful. Home made tortillas were the best! Loved the tacos! We'll be back.
No Bueno! Rude waitress, cold and bland food. If it was busy I could understand..... it wasn't busy...I will never go back. A high priced pseudo Mexican food restaurant.

The Cabo shrimp tacos were amazing.  The shrimp is fried in beer batter.  It was crisp and delicious.  They have a Salsa bar of over 15 different homemade salsas to choose from. The pico de gallo was my favorite. Everything was fresh and well prepared.  There isn't a lot of room inside, so call ahead if you have a big group.
This place is fantastic. Great salsa options and it's nice to have good tasting vegetarian options. The staff was friendly and the overall vibe is great.

SOOOO thrilled to find this place! The food is excellent - not the heavy cheese-laden Sonoran style that the Phoenix market is used to, but a lighter, more flavorful Mexican style. Lots of things to choose from on the menu. Loved my chicken mole burro. Margs were delicious and I cannot wait to do happy hour there - an afternoon of $3 margaritas and the amazing salsa bar with a great variety of salsas. I particularly liked the pecan, peanut, and chile arbol salsas, although they were all really, really good. If you love horchata, you'll love the one here.

Tasty tacos, great decor, pretty mediocre service.

Setting: I was pretty excited to try out this place, because I'm a fool for good tacos. This place definitely stands out in its neighborhood--the facade does a great job of making it do so. The inside has a great-looking bar area, the artwork is really nice (I dig the Dia de los Muertos theme), and the furniture is nice and colorful. It's a cozy little place, with tables very close to each other to fit in as many as possible in a relatively small area.

Food: The food is pretty excellent. I ended up trying 4 different tacos during my visit, and they were all very good. I tried the Mayan Cochinita Pibil, La Condesa Veggie Taco, the whitefish taco, and the Gaucho taco. I was most excited about the cochinita pibil, because it's one of my favorite dishes, but I ended up being most impressed by the gaucho taco. The steak in it was very well done, and the flavors went well with each other. I could have used some more chimichurri, but it was tasty nonetheless. The cochinita pibil was very good as well. The whitefish taco was a little bland. I wouldn't have minded some stronger flavors in it. And the veggie taco was quite good--right up there with the cochinita pibil. The rice and beans, though not the star of the show, were really good! I liked that the rice was a little "stickier" than most rice you find outside of more Asian-type restaurants. And the beans had great flavor.

When I first opened the menu, I was very conflicted over what to order. There are so many great options! I'll definitely have to come back and sample some of the other options. The salsa bar is pretty great. There is a good range of selections, including a few options I had never seen before (e.g., strawberry salsa and pecan salsa).

Service: This was definitely the downside to the experience. Despite there being nobody in front of me waiting for a table when I arrived, it took about 30 minutes of waiting to get a table. Seeing as there is nowhere inside to wait, that's a long wait in the Phoenix summer heat. Once seated, it took a further 15 minutes for anybody to come over and ask for my order. And once I had finished, I sat there for about 30 minutes before I had an opportunity to request our check. Fortunately, I wasn't in any sort of hurry, but that's a lot of waiting.

All in all, I enjoyed the experience and will be back. It's a little pricey for tacos, but the ingredients generally merit a price higher than your typical taco stand.
The salsa bar is worth writing sonnets about. Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco with cilantro salsa might be the only thing I eat for the rest of my life.
Great food.  Not your typical Mexican place.  Multiple salsa options on their salsa bar.  Get drinks.

WOWWWWWWWW

Seriously, wow. We took the kids here one night when we were looking for someplace good to eat. We were going to go to America's but we used to live there, so we tried this place out instead. It's right down the road, so we were like "what the hey." Firstly, the outside is so cool looking. With that big ol sugar skull thing. So artsy. I was a little nervous we'd be out of place. But then we thought... "well, it's not in the nicest area, so it can't be too scenester" SO glad we made that decision. So we go in with the kids and sit at a table. The seating area is very intimate, I didn't mind that. The decor is really cool, gotta love a place with a great ambiance! The server was really nice, not overly nice. He did a great job. Omg the salsa bar is amazing. We tried them all! The kids loved trying them and naming them. The cilantro salsa.... never had anything like it in my life. 

I had the fish tacos that were such a relief. I have had some bad fish tacos in the past so I was a little nervous. But wow. We also had a margarita. They were both strong so I got to finish my husbands. Yay for me! :) 

I was a little disappointed that there isn't a kid's menu. I think they should make a small taco plate for kids, and maybe an option for a small burrito with a side of beans and rice. But the kids made due just fine. My daughter had a bean and cheese burrito and my son had 2 of the carne tacos. They both loved their choices and my husband swapped a carne taco with one of my Son's fish so they got to try it all. Yum. The chips were also great and made it nice to be able to dive right in to all the salsa options. 

The price might be my favorite thing. All four of us ate, got drinks, and my husband and I had a margarita all for about 40 bucks including a nice tip. You really can't beat that! We will DEFINITELY be going back to La Condesa!

What a lovely spot for a lunch consisting of Mexican fare of quesa, tacos, salsa bar, strong sangria. Superb flavors and I greatly enjoyed the paintings by Manuel Gilavalos y Garcia and Ricardo Ramirez. 

I finally had a chance to try horchata garnished with pecans, berries, cinnamon. I couldn't help but think about the tune by Vampire Weekend teehee 
Baja Sur Dogfish Shark taco of corn tortilla stuffed with beer battered dogfish shark - nice and soft.
Maria Sabina Quesadilla of Oaxaca cheese with sauteed wild mushroom melange - crunchy and cheesy yummy! I'm glad my friend took me here while I was visiting!

Was very disappointed with our last visit here. Now I can be very honest, they had two large parties but was not jam packed. I was in the restroom at the time of the drink order and my family did not order me anything. When the waitress came, she took my order but never came back with anything. I waited around 20 minutes for someone to come back and I once again placed my order. 
From the time we sat down we knew it would be busy but never expected we would have to wait over am hour for our food to come. Not once did a waitress offer to refill our drinks and when someone did come by to offer more chips, they were given to the wrong table. Okay, we understand that stuff happens and large parties can throw people off but once the food came, we asked for 2 small plates as we were sharing with kids. Once again, the waitress never came back and the kids ended up sharing our plates and eating off of napkins. A more seasoned waitress came, and we expressed our frustration, the most she could offer was an apology and to discount our drinks. 
My husband and I made an observation and the waitress who would leave a table after taking an order would go and clean tables instead of bringing what we asked for. It was a very disappointing experience.

I have only been here once but it won't be the last time. 
The food here is so fresh and the salsa selection; i have never seen anything like it and it's all so fresh and interesting. 
The ambiance has a lot of character but people come here for the food. I just had tacos and was blown away by the flavor. 
The shells were good but the meat was seasoned nice, the veggies were crisp and the staff were awesome. I will definitely be going back!

Wow, this place is truly amazing. I had smoked marlin, mahi mahi, and shrimp tacos. All fantastic. My friends and family all loved their food too and the mole is excellent. I also had a mango margarita with a chili rim that is probably the best margarita I've had in Arizona. Could not recommend this place more. I love Mexican food and Santisimas keeps with tradition while adding their own incredibly tasty flares! Love, love, love!

Best Mexican food I had ever had. Of course, this isn't saying much considering East Coast Mexican food has nothing on West Coast. Now I know.

I came here twice. This place was so good,  I dreamed about eating their shark taco that night. And the next and our last day in Phoenix we went back to get more. Nice way to round out our stay in Phoenix. Best meal for last.
 
First Night:
If you don't get the Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco, you are missing out. Perfectly crispy beer batter. Amazingly soft and tender fish. Topped with cabbage and some kind of yogurt or mayo sauce. Not sure where else you can get dogfish shark tacos, but I wish all my fish tacos could be shark from now on. Make sure you order the shark taco and not the regular fish one.

If you're not a seafood person, the Mayan Conchita Pork Shoulder is a good taco to get. The pork shoulder was cooked until tender and the sauce was delicious and flavorful. The pickled onions on top is a perfect combo with the pork.

Second Night:

The second time around I had the shark taco again. This time I also tried the Cabo Shrimp Taco. Another amazing taco. The shrimps were large, and I'm not sure what they put in their batter but it was so crispy with a nice tang to it. I also tried some of the Al Pastor Street Tacos. Order this if you want something strong in flavor and charred. The street tacos are also cheaper than the gourmet ones.

Sides:
The Guac was chunky and fresh with tomatoes, cilantro, onions, and I think cranberries. The salsas were all average until I tried the jicama one. It's so fresh with the lime and cilantro. Best salsa I had ever had. Each table gets a free basket of tortilla chips. We got two for our table of four.

I never had horchata before, but it seemed to be the recommended drink to get. I wasn't a big fan of it. Not that it wasn't good, but I'm just not a fan of horchata in general. The pecans, cantaloupe, and strawberries did provide freshness to the drink, but it was too overpowered by cinnamon. The drink is huge at 32 oz.

There is only one guy acting as a server, so service can be a little slow. But these tacos are worth the patience. The restaurant itself is a little bit cramped but there is enough seating. There's also one large table for a big group.

On a side note, I saw a picture of Guy Fieri on a board next to the salsa bar. He seemed to have signed it with the date 12/14. Future Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives joint?

This little place was recommended by my brother, we went on a Sunday and it was super busy we waited about 20 min to be seated which was not that bad. 
The food was amazing and the salsa bar is kept fresh! Cant wait to go back. I had a quesadilla with mushrooms and an horchata. It's probably one of the best horchata's I've had! Must try this little place in Phoenix you won't regret it!
For extreme flavor I would recommend this place.. the Salsa is so different prefect place to eat

Aw, what happen to you La Santisima? You used to be one of my favorite Mexican restaurants but the last few times weren't great and my recent visit made me not want to ever come back. 

I came to dine and service was awful and took forever to get us water. No kidding - it took about 15-20 minutes. I finally placed my order of the shrimp taco, chicken tinga taco and the steak taco. Our food didn't arrive until another half an hour. The restaurant wasn't even busy!! Our food arrives but we weren't given silverware so we sat there looking at our food for another 5-10 min. The shrimp taco was ok, the steak taco dry and I had enough that I didn't want the other taco. 

I'm so disappointed. Oh well, bye La Santisima.

Excellent stop for tacos and salsa's. Food is incredible - however I only gave one star due to price- probably because of the popularity and demand it is not necessarily cheap and there is no kids menu. But it truly excellent food and worth it. It could be inexpensive if you only by
one or two tacos a la carte. I didn't experience too long of a wait on my visit.

Holy Tacos and Salsa Bar!!!!!! This place is the real deal. We came here 10 minutes after opening and we were glad we did. This place filled up quickly and for good reason. The tacos were incredible. The spicy pork, the beef, the white fish all mouth watering. The refried beans and rice served on the side tasted awesome, I just wish the portions were larger. Right away we were served large baskets of warm tortilla chips and we tried every salsa at the bar. Some were very spicy!!!! I enjoyed the cilantro cream one on the fish tacos. The quesadilla came with avocado slices on top and the cheese was very tasty. These tacos were gourmet! I really enjoyed everything we ate here and would definitely come back. Prices are fair as well. They staff kept refilling our glasses of water and kept checking in on us. We had a great lunch here.

Wonderfully different tacos and probably the best beans and rice ever. There were so many things to choose from, but I thought a place that bills itself as 'gourmet tacos' should get a chance to live up to its name--and it did. I chose the 3 taco platter so I could sample different ones. Each was unique and tasty. The barbacoa was probably my favorite. There is very little parking and there was a line inside but it was worth the wait. Baskets of chips and orders were going out of the kitchen every few seconds. We got there a little before noon and I don't know if it was because they were so busy, but every table was cleared and cleaned within minutes, or less, of being vacated. My husband, who spends a lot of time traveling, kept raving about how good his was.

Damn, you want some awesome tacos, burros, quesadillas, or tortas?! This is your place! Ever since Guy Fieri stepped foot in this place, it gets really busy now. It's a small place, so expect a wait unless you go during off times (avoid lunch and dinner). The salsa bar is incredible, so many different variety of salsas from cilantro, pecan, to a delicious jicama or a bomb pico de gallo. The quesadillas aren't your typical ones, they fry them entirely that it almost looks like a empanada/quesadilla hybrid but they're so good! It's true about what they say about the horchata, it's the best I've tasted. They put pecans and chopped fruit in the horchata giving it some extra flavor a but its so delicious. My favorite tacos are the Shark tacos! Try them! Only reason why I give them 4 stars is because the service is alright. Sometimes they are not staffed adequately and it takes forever to get your order in, other than that, it's a great Mexican food joint!

Really good Mexican food. Very friendly service. Couple of things you should know. 1- you don't just sit down and wait for order. You need to go to cashier and place it then it will be brought to you. 2- park on the side of the building, easier to get in and out. 3- make use of the salsa bar. Very good and probably different from what you've had in the past. Food was very good and had great flavor. I did order a drink that took a long time to come out but the manager gave it to me on the house. Can't complain. No big deal and the mint drink was delicious. We enjoyed this restaurant

Very Disappointed.  We have been patrons since long before the triple D guy showed up. Last night was the last straw. They expanded the dining room without expanding the kitchen or staff. 2 cooks in the kitchen cannot keep up- according to staff they were both "new". No soap in bathroom, floors are dirty, chairs are dirty & stained all because they don't have enough staff.
Customers were trying to help make drinks because the 45min wait for our food was just too much. We left and will not be back.

Really amazing food. Salsa bar is impeccable. Wait is atrocious, but "they are working on it". 

Overall 9/10, but yelp doesn't let you do 0.5 stars and I like to round down

The food was incredible. The salsa bar is very impressive.

The wait was exceptionally long even considering it was the lunch rush.

Overall very good experiences.
Their horchata is delicious and has fresh fruit and pecans at the bottom. My husband loves their salsa bar and we both enjoy their quesas. Great vegetarian menu options too!

While I wouldn't recommend every pretentious hipster foodie come running to Phoenix (not that I would wish that horror on the lovely city of Phoenix- maybe a plague of locusts would be easier to deal with)- there are some great places to eat there. I say "there" because I am from NY and I am here now so there is there. Anyway- I loved it here (there) and went twice in my 6 days in Phoenix. Fantastic tacos- shark, smoked marlin, steak, slow-cooked pork, chicken with mole- most at $3.99 some near $5 but all nicely sized and overflowing with ingredients and deliciousness. The horchata was damned fine also. Love the décor, reminds me of Baby Bo's Cantina in NYC except obviously the food at La Santisima is much better.

Monday for lunch and people were waiting out the door. They mentioned 20 min, first time there not from AZ but BF said food is amazing.  We waited 10 min tops sat down.  Place is small but staff is working hard to get everyone in and served.  Right away you just notice how happy the people are to be there.  
I ordered the burrito special with shrimp and a Jamaica agua.  I was starving went I went in but could only finish half of the huge burrito. Partly because do the chips and delicious salsa bar.  Definitely coming back when back in town.
Small place. Great tasty food. Reasonable prices. Will definitely come back for the shrimp tacos!

Visiting from out of town this place had Great Mexican food. Not an expert on Mexican food but I have been around a lot of places in the USA searching for something good and most places have fallen short. For my taste buds this place is top notch. Thumbs up. I really don't like giving 4 or 5 stars reviews but it's hard to find good Mexican food on the east coast.

We order the steak taco, chicken chipotle and two shark tacos. The chipotle chicken taco was the best thing we ate.  It was saucy with the pickled red onion on top.  Yummm. They have a very unique salsa bar with lots of choices for salsa, some cream based, some vegetable  based. Very cool.

The food was excellent and the ambiance was really cool! Service was so-so. We were seated and our order was taken quickly. The server never refilled our drinks, which was especially disappointing after eating spicy salsa.
This place is the best. I'm addicted to their El Pastor burrito. So many flavors and they're all amazing! It gets really busy at lunch so plan ahead or call in your order.

The menu has expanded!  Got there early for  dinner meal.  There are only 10 tables in here so you may have to wait at high times.  We were seated quickly, ordered no the food was out in a flash.  We ordered the Marlin fish taco and and Sonora beef taco plates.  The fish taco was juicy and flavorful; one of the best fish tacos I have had.  hUbby also like his steak taco.  The salsas were low, a tribute to their goodness.  Once they got filled up, we helped ourselves to Jicama, guac, cilantro and tomatillo salsa.  tHe guac salsa has a good kick to it so beware.  We ate all the free chips.  Overall a great food experience in the heart of the Barrio.

I get to Phoenix a few times a year and I come straight from the airport to get the El Gaucho Quesadilla -- Argentine beef is so tender and flavorful and the crunch of the quesadilla is perfection. YUM!
So good!  Had a burro,  ate half took home the rest.  I'm now eating the other half for breakfast and have been brought back to a euphoric verde sauce heaven!

This is probably my favorite restaurant ever. The food is crazy yummy. Like out of this world yummy. I want to yell out in pure joy every time I take my first bite. This place is almost 40 minutes from my home but my boyfriend and I have already gone back four times (really!) They also offer vegan and vegetarian options which is hard to come by at Mexican restaurants. They recently expanded the restaurant and it is now a bit more casual but the food is just as good as it was before. I really like looking at all the interesting art work, too. I just love this little place so much. Don't forget to try the horchata, made with fresh strawberries and pecans. You won't be disappointed.

Amazing Mexican food and sauces!  I never have experienced such diverse foods. They have pulled recipes from all over Mexico and excel at reproducing some amazing food. If you love Mexican food you must go here. Their salsa bar is like no other. Pecan salsa, peanut sauce etc. And they have a good tequila selection!

Best fish taco I've had so far. On that scale I give it a well deserved 5 stars. I also had the pork and chicken street tacos, I would probably only order the fish taco next time. 
Authentic. Great choice of house made salsas.
This is mine and my daddy's place! We love the food, and the salsa bar is great. It's a small place and it's always busy. We love to come here every Sunday night.

I was in town from Texas. We know Mexican food and I can say this place is amazing!!! 

The salsa and chips are great! Good service!!! 

I had the smoked Marlin quesadilla!! First it tastes amazing!! Not like any I have had before! Great flavor profiles and the guacamole on top was second to none! 


I highly recommend this place!
Looking for a great variety and exceptionally fresh Mexican food, this is the place. Also has an excellent array of vegan and vegetarian options.

To sum up- the place was great. 
Food was tasty and served promptly. Our waitress made great suggestions, which can be necessary as the menu is huge and it can be overwhelming. 
We went with tacos- one street and one gourmet. They didn't disappoint. 
I do have to say that there are other places with more "street like food" that I prefer. However, this was still pretty good.

This place looks pretty rough from the outside, and is easy to miss. On the inside; however, it's quite comfortable and nice. I'm a fan of Horchata in general, but I have to say La Condesa has the best I've ever had. Also, they managed to change my opinion about Mole with their Mole Chicken taco. 

The salsa bar has no equal! Cilantro Salsa, Jicama Salsa, Peanut Salsa, the list goes on an on. You can experience what seems like enless and amazing combinations of flavors.

I'm definitely going back!

Food is good, but no the best I've tried, the best feature in this restaurant is their salsa bar. I was disappointed they don't carry enchiladas...really, a Mexican place selling as "authentic" doesn't carry enchiladas? Don't get me wrong, it's pretty good, although the prices could be a little bit lower.

Had really fantastic tacos at lunch today. The Cochinita Pibil was note perfect, and the Marlin brought me back to Mazatlan. Salsa bar is tremendous as well, my favorites were the strawberry, the pecan, and the chipotle. Get there early for Lunch!
Best burrito I've had in a long long time. At least two of the salsas are worth the price of admission alone and the horchata is world class with fresh fruit.

First off, the service was lacking. Our waitress didn't seem very attentive or happy towards us. She could have checked on us every once in a while...and maybe smile? 

HOWEVER, the food was delicious (which is why I had to give a least four stars). We ordered their carne asada tacos and they didn't disappoint. Their salsa bar has a lot of choices and yes, the horchata is good.

Great tacos and the salsa bar is a must try! Would not recommend for groups larger than 2-3 as the dining room is tiny. It feels a lot like all your aunts, uncles, and cousins jammed into grandmas kitchen.

I would say taco shop is a misnomer. It is a small restaurant/ bar. Very interesting food, not typical "Taco shop" fare by any means.

Ive been there a few times now, their quesadillas are more like calzones, very tasty!
Portion size is good.Their chocolate cake is a must order.

They have a strange salsa bar, a lot of "novelty" salsa. Interesting for sure.

The paper and plastic baskets instaed of plates is one thing, but, too nice inside for use of the cheapest plastic flatware ever made, (not even the decent ones) Please buy bulk stainless @ Costco. That plastic is useless, hard to eat with.

I would recommend this place for sure.

Holy Hell is this place fantastic!! Have already been back after the initial visit. I'm still in the process of forgiving the bf for not introducing me to this place before. I mean - seriously - we've been together over a year and he's just now taking me here. I'm still mad (jk).

Haven't done any plates - just a la carte tacos! Because. TACOS!  YUM! And the horchata was outta this world! My goal is to make my way through the taco choices! So far - each one is delicious! And the salsa bar - fantastic!! About 13 different types...peanut, strawberry, pecan, tomatilla, roasted, etc... 

The place is small. The staff hard working, friendly & diligent. XTRA tipping highly recommended as they are busting butt.
Great Asada tacos and a great selection of Mexican beers. They even have Mexican coke in 500ml bottles! Small restaurant but worth the trip!

What else is there to say about La Condesa that hasn't been said in the hundred other 5 star reviews of this place?  Not much, so I'll just add the following for extra emphasis...

1. The tacos.  Oh the tacos...  even living out in California, the Baja Sur Dogfish Shark tacos are made of dreams and sunshine and sugar plum fairies.  If sugar plum fairies came in the shape of delicious, beer batter fried dogfish shark pieces.  With just a little cream sauce and lettuce so you don't miss out on any of the shark.  And the Cochinita Pibil tacos... there's fall off the bone tender, then there's meat that's pretty much as  close to melting as meat can get.  But these are just my favorites... I've tried all the tacos on the menu, and they're all delicious.

2. The salsa bar.  If I can give this place any criticism, it's that they run out of salsas far too often.  Late in the day.  Just before they close.  Look... sometimes I'm in a peanut salsa mood, sometimes I'm in a chipotle salsa mood, sometimes I'm in a strawberry salsa mood.  I can't help it.

3. The horchata.  Just order it.  It's big.  Bring guests.  Share it.

I come here far too often for someone that lives 1000 miles away.  Love it.

I've lived in Phoenix for 19 years and this place is hands down one of the best burrito/taco places around. The Al Pastor here is to die for. Full of flavor and cooked to perfection, you will never be disappointed that you tried it! The chicken tinga is also delicious. The huge salsa bar is very unique and a fun way to spend your time by trying out the different salsas before your food arrives.

Found this restaurant on Yelp.  Visiting AZ for Spring Training.   You have got to try this place.   Absolutely delicious!  Great food, tons of choices and yummy house margaritas.  Loved the salsa bar. 

I ordered the street tacos.  3 different flavors with beans and rice.  I had the tinga, el pastor and chicken.  Super delicious.  Rice and beans perfect with the tacos.   We had a couple of the house margaritas during happy hour and they were sweet but tart.  Food arrived quickly.   Wish I lived here so I could try everything on the menu. 

Beautiful art on the walls and very friendly staff.

La Santisima is a great option for legit Mexican in Phoenix. The food itself is 5 stars; the only thing preventing a perfect 5/5 was the service. The waitresses were very friendly and by no means provided poor service, but definitely left some to be desired with only a 2-3 total pit stops to the table. In all fairness, it's a bit "divey," so it's part of the experience. 

This originally caught our eye as it was featured on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives, as well as great reviews. The selling point and highlight of our visit was the salsa bar. I consider myself a salsa pro (I refuse to buy jarred salsa, I'll only make my own), so it was fun to sample 15+ varieties. Pro tip: only the first basket of chips is free. Additional baskets are $2.40/each. 

Our tacos and burro were great themselves, but did need some pizazz from the salsa bar, perhaps by design? After we doctored them up a bit, we wiped our plates clean. The tortillas were especially delicious. Value was also great. With water to drink, our total after tax was less than $20. Overall, I would recommend La Santisima!

My husband and I ate here for lunch this afternoon after reading the "Eating 16th Street" blog in the New Times :http://blogs.phoenixnewtimes.com/bella/2012/08/la_condessa.php#more

We went for a late Friday afternoon lunch and though the place is on the small side had no problem finding a seat. The decor is great, and the food truly was delicious. I tried three different "street tacos" and they were all wonderful - particularly the Al Carbon. My husband had the Azteca Tinga Burro and he also said it was very tasty. We also indulged in some "we earned it" margaritas and they came complete with grapefruit, lime, orange and lemon slices. I've never had it that way before and it was delicious. We will definitely be going back for more soon!

We went here to give it a try as I love Mexican food. I am all for the whole-in-the wall Mexican food it's the best you can get. I will have to say this place left much to be desired. I'm always reluctant to give negative reviews but I have to be honest so that we spent our money in the right places. I liked in on a positive note so I will  start with what went wrong. As soon as we entered we were confused as to whether to wait by the door or see ourselves. Turns out we were able to see ourselves but upon sitting I noticed a lot of the chairs were stained so I felt a little uncomfortable. I managed to find a somewhat decent chair and my husband and I ordered tacos which is normally our first go to at a place where unfamiliar with. I like that they had so many different sauce the choices that was really great. We ordered cups of water with lemon which came in cheap throwaway plastic cups. When the tacos came our plates looked cracked like they were ready to be retired. I had three tacos And out the 3 I ordered I only liked one...same for my husband. We were pretty much done at that point. I thought it would be hard to mess up street tacos but apparently not. On a good note the salsa and chips were good and the waitress was kind.

I had an extremely hard time deciding whether to rate this restaurant three or four stars. It is a solid 3.5 stars, but I decided to raise it due to the free salsa bar and authentic food.

The restaurant is a small location with an all-you can eat salsa bar with various flavours such as cilantro salsa, peanut salsa, tomatillo salsa, and strawberry salsa just to name a few from the selection. The meal also came with a free bowl of tortilla chips, but extra bowls cost more. The tortilla chips were a little thin for me, but definitely tasted authentic.

I ordered the taco plate with two different tacos. When ordering it was a bit difficult to understand what the waiter was saying, but contrary to the menu, he said that you can have two different tacos on the menu instead of one type on the taco plate for $8.99. In the end I paid more than the $8.99 for my taco plate in the end.

I got to taste three different tacos and a part of a burrito after sharing with some other people eating with me. My wild white fish taco was extremely crunchy, but disappointing due to the fish ultimately being too big for the corn wraps. The traditional Mexican taco was very spicy, and the meat was fairly flavourful. The best taco was the pork shoulder taco which was moist and tasted great. I also tried all of the tacos with the spicy guacamole provided at the salsa bar for an added kick. The pork burrito used a flour tortilla and was relatively bland aside from the pineapple salsa which was a refreshing sweet flavour.

Overall it was a nice portion, but was a little expensive. The food is definitely authentic and provided a delicious taco.

Great place, great Flavours - 7 chili, cilantro and strawberry salsa are must try.  In my first visit, I tried chicken tinga and a burro, the meat was well cooked and juicy. 

Place was small, but nice ambience. 

The neighborhood was litle shady but  the quality of food defeats all those negative factors. 

Definitely recommended.

Ps - the place is open late till 11pm, even though yelp hours shows 9pm.
Breakfast was amazing! The salsa bar is the best in town! Friendly staff. Would strongly recommend it to friends and family.

The food was good but they didn't have any steak or cochinita pibil. The Jamaica did not taste natural. The service by the waitress was very disrespectful and did not deserve a tip at 18% which was included in the check.
Excellent food, service is okay, well worth giving this place a try!
Really good street tacos. Good service and affordable beer. Amazing pecan salsa - yes pecan, I'm not joking, go try it.

Food was great! The fish and the shrimp tacos might be the best in Phoenix. The salsa bar is just as good and has some great traditional options - just like mom's house! The drinks were generic but generous and well priced. I give them 3 stars because of the service, or lack there of. Every time I go in there, whether it is 6 or 9 pm there is a 30-60 minute wait and about 4 empty tables. There is a sense of confusion and priorities are not focused on customer service. The bathroom was a disaster. I've seen better kept facilities at night clubs and that worries me. You know what they say about the bathroom - it is as clean as the kitchen! 
Like I said, they had folks out the door by 7:30 and I had to go up to the register to pay because no one came by to pick up my tab/card. We had 2 dinners and 2 rounds of happy hour drinks - we paid $70. For that kind of money, I would at least expect to be seated at one  of the many open tables that were available when we left. Instead, they let people wait for over 30 mins while others (me) had to wait 20 mins to pay. I think I'd go back but maybe just do take out.

Well, living downtown teaches you a few things and one is that if a restaurant is in a sketchy area, it must be DELICIOUS! I take people here for lunch and always recommend the black mole chicken taco.  They first read the ingredient and make a face (the word chocolate throws them off).  Everyone loves it after eating it! They end up ordering more tacos and horchata to go!  The veggie taco is my other favorite. Don't expect nice tables, décor and easy parking - you might have to drive around the corner to park in front of a chained linked house with weed grown up to the roof but the food is worth a try.

Ate here with my wife several times, and have brought friends. The good is always great. I love the gaucho tacos (I order them every time), but honestly everything is good. The salsa bar is also a lot of fun. I plan to keep coming back!
the horchata is ok .. not the best. from what i read on the reviews i was expecting more.  Enjoy the variety of salsa and the meat was good too

I was very disappointed by my last 2 visits here. On one visit I was served cold beans and rice, like from the fridge cold. It took almost 20 minutes to get new beans and rice, and they were still barely warm. No apology, no nothing.

Went again to get my favorite chicken mole tacos, and they were barely warm. My husband had their marinated shredded pork in a burrito and got sick after taking the first bite. This must be an acquired taste, it was gross, really gross. Then I found what looked like a gray slimy booger in my rice. When I pointed it out to the server he took my plate away and came back saying it was an onion!! No way was that an onion, or even a close relative of an onion. No apology, no asking if i want something else, he just came over, slammed the bill down and said we didn't charge you for your food, so don't worry about it, and walked away. 

I know mistakes happen, but own up to it, and at least TRY to make the customer feel good about the situation.

We were in Phoenix for Spring Training (The Cubs) and decided we wanted Mexican food for dinner.  The food was good, the Atmosphere OK and the service was a little slow.  We enjoyed their Salsa bar and the guacamole was very good.We'll most likely come back next year.
A good friend refered me to this restaurant as we were on a Taco shop kick for the month. i had no idea tacos could be so amazing. The salsa bar is out of this world.

At the outset, I want to say that the rating isn't because of the food; the food is great. The service....well, they need to work on it. I ordered some food to take out and showed up to get it. I could see the bags behind the counter; I asked a number of times if they were mine. I got blank looks. Finally, someone stopped to look and told me that they couldn't figure out who took my order so they couldn't pull up the order on their POS system. You can imagine what cold tacos and burritos taste like. 
The salsas are the best ever; they serve them on a salsa bar and let you pick the ones you want. However, there were no lids for the containers for take out...

If you go there, expect to wait; it is popular. Expect slow service. Expect good food.

I was brought here by a local. I have to say, wow. This is the kind of place I've been craving in Phoenix. There is a large variety of tacos and I struggled to make it through four. I just wanted to try them all! 

I highly recommend this place. The mahi taco at the bottom of the menu is to die for. The shrimp one with like hibiscus was also good. 

We all ordered margaritas and they were fantastic. 

Service was slow but very friendly. They expanded and it seems they just don't have the staff to keep up. We weren't bored or in any rush so there wasn't any issue. 

I unfortunately won't be spending much more time in phoenix, but when I do, I'll be hanging at this place.

We LOVE this place and couldn't be happier to have them on the west side!  Fresh, unique, incredibly delicious food in a comfortable atmosphere and contrary to other reviews, our service has always been exemplary!  Not at all the typical swimming-in-grease-and-cheese Mexican food but fresh and interesting and an extensive menu!  We are regulars and have hardly made a dent at trying everything they offer!  The salsa bar is like no other and stands on its own in making this a must-go destination!  Give this great restaurant a try....you won't be disappointed.  Then, tell all your friends and family so one of Glendale's best restaurants stays here!
Cochinito tacos are so tender and tasty!!  Not your run of the mill Mexican.  This pleasures the palate!! Unique and fantastic.  I will be making the drive to La Condesa again!

If you can get seated next to the salsa bar, then SCORE!! Lol.  So many tasty salsa's to choose from.  Try them all!!!!!!! The veggie tacos are delicious!  I love the peanut salsa and cilantro salsa.   A new favorite is to mix the jicama salsa with the cilantro salsa. Sooo good.  My go to is the bullet burrito.  I love me a good bean burrito.  The house margarita is big, fresh squeezed, and swimming with citrus pieces to nibble on.  It is so delicious!  My favorite menu item is the quesa!! The Smoked Marlin, and the veggie quesas are loaded with flavor! Oh, and try the guacamole! They put cranberries and jicama in it.  I hope you'll love it as much as I do.   :)

What a great tasting Mexican joint. Went on Taco Tuesday. So I decided on the 3 taco  plate with beans and rice. The beans and rice were the standard issue sides. But the tacos!!!! I opted for the brisket taco, carne taco and pollo. (Chicken) All three were great. They give you the standard chips when you sit down to snack on. Nice thing is there is a salsa bar too!!! Our server was great, smile from ear to ear. I definitely recommend giving them a try. You will not be disappointed!!! Oh, and look for the famous guy on the wall!!!

Great divey burrito joint. I had la santisima burrito and it was fantastic! it looks a little sketchy from the outside but once you step inside this place is adorable and intimate. They have a great salsa bar where you help yourself. I am very excited to go back again and try more.

My boss bought the office lunch today, and la Santisima was the chosen place.
I ordered the La Condesa Veggie Quesa. The portion is huge! It was pretty tasty. But I wish there had been far more veggies. I regret not asking for a side of salsa. 
While a deep fried quesadilla is a novel idea, it was just too heavy and greasy. We ordered take out so had I known it was fried, I would have picked something else. 
I'll definitely give it another try since all my co-workers loved their tacos and burros.

I like the options of salsa, but the place was dirty. The table was dirty, the chairs were dirty and they have some type of fly clear along the edges of the windows. The service was okay, it took forever to get our food of tacos, which I do not understand the turnover time to make tacos. If their excuse for the wait is because its made from scratch, then this place is not the place to go for food. I gave it 2 stars because I feel this place might have been good at one point, they just needs clean house and retrain.

We were looking for some mexican food and I stumbled upon this place.  What a treat!  The food was really good, especially the Quesas and Tacos.  They have a great salsa bar as well and Real Coke.

The parking is a little tough and we had to wait 20 minutes for a table, but the food taste and quality was well worth the wait.

I have never loved tacos. This place changed my mind... The quality and size of their tacos surpasses that of America's (Sorry America's Taco Shop lovers) and it adds a strong local cultural vice that other taco shops lack with its Dia de los Muertos themed paintings. The meat is well-marinated (especially the carne asada) and the dozen-plus salsas are each different by tasty and made to perfection. You can spend ten-to-fifteen minutes just sorting through the salsa bar. I am lucky enough to live nearby and I take advantage of the shark tacos on most days :) I am so glad that it's caught on! I know that I will keep coming back!!!

Extremely busy on the weekends. Best time to go is during the weekdays or after the weekend afternoon rush. The horchata is quite unique. Love the salsa bar with a variety of different salsas! Everything on the menu is pretty good! I would recommend any of tacos.
Great decor, nice place. Food was okay but my perfectly made  spicy michelada made up for it. Defiantly recommend

Solid three and a half stars, rounded up because I am feeling magnanimous today . Others have already waxed rhapsodic about the high points of this little hidden gem: the decor (slightly kitschy, somewhat modern and a pinch of rustic), the salsa bar (over ten types, freshly made and flavorful without the tastebud massacre of straight hot chilis), and the horchata (yummy and light, made unique with the addition of finely chopped cantaloupe and strawberries and a sprinkle of pecans). 

Being a quesadilla fanatic, I got the veggie one. Now, mind you, I had not read any reviews prior to my visit, so I was somewhat disconcerted  by the three pound Mexican calzone that arrived. I'm not complaining -- it was quite tasty -- but the puffy, doughy corn "tortilla" exterior was a bit much for me. Oh yeah, and the five handfuls of cheese inside of it. Too much. The damn thing was so big, it eventually became three meals.

My SO, the ultimate Mexican food snob, dug his chicken burro, although it was overstuffed and gooing and oozing everywhere, requiring him to attempt to consume it with a (cheap, flimsy plastic) knife and fork. Try cutting a hot, goopy mess wrapped in a tortilla sitting on a single thin piece of paper on a wicker basket with bendy cheap utensils. Yeah. Total mess. Not first-date friendly.

The location, parking, and service are questionable, as others have noted. We beat the rush by going late morning; I didn't think the wait for the food was unreasonable, but I wouldn't be stopping in here for a bite if I was in a hurry.  While I loved the horchata, the fruit was chopped just finely enough to go shooting up the straw unexpectedly. Total choking hazard for the less physically coordinated (read: me). 

Overall, pretty, pretty good. We'll be back, although I'll pass on the quesadilla next time...

Came in at around 4PM on a Saturday, parking was terrible but we assumed it had to be good since the parking lot was packed. Walked in and the whole front room was packed with patrons so we waited patiently to be seated. The artwork was phenomenal and the full bar was inviting, but after five minutes of not being acknowledged in any way, we were starting to lose patience. Finally we were seated in the back room, which is much larger and at the time nearly empty except for two groups of 5 people.

We both ordered three tacos each, which were way pricier than we were expecting, they range between 3.99 and 5.50 each or you can do a mix and match plate. Many of their options are seafood so that limited us a bit since we aren't fans, though if you like seafood maybe you'll have better luck than we did!

The salsa bar is extensive so we were excited, we loaded up 12 mini condiment cups, filling them with everything from clearly pico to some more mysterious salsas. Tried out a few on the chips as we waited for our food and found that none of them were spicy in any way, the best was the Pico and another similar to it. 

Finally our tacos arrived and we dug in. Well we tried to. Instead we each ate about half of each taco (except for the barbiccoa which both of us got, I ate both of them after he discovered he hated it). Each taco ranged from bad to almost inedible. Each taco was miniscule, barely the size of my hand and barely filled except for the lack luster and down right gross tasting garnish. The meat quality on the other habd was great, tasteless but great quality so there was room for it to be delicious, they just failed that goal. In the end the only tacos I could suggest were the barbiccoa, which I found good enough to even crave again but for the price and how lacking everything else was, I can guarantee we will not be returning.

I would suggest this place to anyone with family or friends who like a great setting and casual drinks with some small bites, especially if they're not generally fans of Mexican food. The place is inviting and interesting with plenty of tasteless options to explore.

i reallllly need to come here more often. this is definitely a little gem of a mexican restaurant that fires on all cylinders. 

the restaurant itself is adorable-i love all the awesome dia de los muertos paintings on the walls and the unique decor. while it isn't in the greatest neighborhood, you'd have no idea once you walked inside.  

the salsa bar! oh my god, i don't even know where to start with how amazing this thing is.  i am a huge salsa fan (wouldn't mind eating it with every meal, or as a meal, whatever) and i've never known of a restaurant to have so many options! i could literally come here and only eat chips and salsa for hours and never get bored because of all the choices! 

horchata! they put an interesting spin on the horchata by adding pecans and fresh fruit to it.  i thought this might be weird since i've never had it that way, but it was totally delicious and refreshing.  

food! the menu is packed with delicious items that have some unbelievable flavors.  i recommend the carne asada burrito or the bullet (bean and cheese).  

i'll be coming back soon!
One of my favorite places to get real Mexican food for good prices. They dont take reservations so keep that in mind. The service is great. The salsa is great

the scoop: 
a) shark taco was really good. love the cilantro salsa in it. 
b) mole poblano with chicken burro was flavorful. and the way to make a burro is by shredding the meat. it was great! 
c) the oversized horchata was unique. expect it to be more like a dessert rather than a drink. it's large, so consider sharing it amongst your party.
d) the best salsa bar i've been too. love the cilantro salsa and pecan salsa.

Love, love, love this Phoenix gem!  I stumbled upon it when I was out house hunting & my husband learned about it from a co-worker, so we tried it one night & have been hooked ever since!  The salsa bar is awesome & the food is fantastic!  We are so happy to live just a few short miles from here & we go often!

I like the salsa bar!  Good to try at least once.  The horchata was yummy with all its chunky bits of nuts and fruit in it.  Those are the only good things I have to say!!  I didn't really like the food that much.  Not much vegetarian selection.  I probably won't go back.

I seriously can say that the foods are yummy and the customer service is excellent. If you are visiting, I can recommend their margarita in addition to their vegan taco. I must say I loved my visit here. I definitely will return here.

wow!  i have never been to a taco shop like this!!!!!!

outside of the restaurant looks like in the ghetto and a little hard to find.  there is parking in front, side and across the street of the restaurant.

the ambiance is really nice.  cool paintings on the wall and very small and only a few tables available.  since the restaurant is small it gets real noisy.  oh and plus a bar with seating.  during lunch this place fills up fast.

once you sit down someone will bring some chips.  next, you walk yourself over to the salsa bar to select from the 14 salsas available.  kinda cool and different.  i'm a wuss when it comes to hot stuff but gave it a shot.  i loved the strawberry salsa and it was dang good!

when you order you need to place your food order at the bar.  we ordered the mayan cochinita pibil taco and oaxaca black mole chicken shark taco.  for too adults i thought it was pricey for 2 tacos per plate with a small portion of beans & rice.  all freaking good but a little too spicy for our taste buds.  for the record we still loved it.

this place is AWESOME!

La Santisima is my fav! Just be forewarned the service is really, really slow. But everyone is so nice and the food and drinks are incredible. I recommend the tampico marg and the salsa bar is delightful!

Typically I am a person who only eats burritos with meat, pico, and some hot sauce.... Not anymore! Gaucho? Burrito is amazing! The combination of meat, cheese, vegetables and rice come together for an incredible symphony of flavors! Not to mention the tortilla had that perfect slight crisp but still chewiness. Don't pass this place up.

This place is a hidden gem!  The food is savory, genuine Mexican food that is reasonably priced.  We tried tacos, tortas & the cohinita pibil burrito - all were succulent!  The salsa bar is great, you can try several or all.  The place is not fancy and you don't really get a waitress, you get in line, order your food & pay, take a number & drink, then someone will take your food to your table.  Give it a try!  You won't be disappointed.  Parking is tough - limited.

Santi and I came to La Santisima looking for a good Mexican fare, and walked away pleasantly surprised by the overall experience. The small, squared-shaped interior included a small dining area, a full salsa bar, kitchen, and a small bar area in the back. The wall-to-wall paintings and artifacts were striking, and nicely added to the casual and festive atmosphere. The menu consisted of an eclectic listing of gourmet tacos, street tacos, burros, deep-fried corn quesadillas, and lonches. 

The Al Pastor Burro ($8.95) arrived with spicy pork, homemade salsa, pineapple, tomato, lettuce, guacamole, onion, cilantro, avocado, and al pastor salsa. The burro was tightly wrapped in hot pressed tortilla. The spicy pork was nicely seasoned with sweet pineapple to brighten the flavors. The rest of the supportive ingredients added subtle touches and kicks. The textures of the onions, lettuce, and tomato were noticeable, but I wished there could be more guacamole to round out the flavors. The burro was sizable, and good to share when cut in half. I recommend it.

The Aztec Tinga Taco and Maya Cochinita Pibil Taco ($9.39) came with rice, black beans with Oaxacan cheese, and two sizable double-decked tacos with shredded meat and red onions layered on top. The Tinga Taco encompassed tender shredded chicken, tomato, and chipotle salsa. I wished there could be more chicken, but the taco was mouthwatering delicious. The Cochinita Pibil was made with pork shoulder wrapped and slow cooked in banana leaves, lime marinated onions and salsa to add acidity and sharpness. Their distinctive taste from one another made the experience worthwhile. The rice and black beans were not simple fillers, but instead they were surprisingly flavorful and addictive. 

The Tialoc Veggie Burro ($8.95) was put together with mesquite-grilled cactus, caramelized onion, garlic, tomato, mushrooms, jalapeno, and Oaxacan cheese in a tightly wrapped hot pressed tortilla. Personally, I prefer the soft, spongy, and stretchable flour tortillas, but the firm and hot pressed version was surprisingly good, resilient, and held everything together quite well. The grilled cactus came in large pieces, and the pleasant textures nicely complemented the generous earthy mushrooms. The Burro could taste bland for some people, but the addition of melted Oaxcan cheese added nuances to the sweet and savory flavors. If I were to order this again, I would add guacamole and more cheese to the mix. 

Lastly, the Arabe Burro ($12.99) had plenty of al pastor, hummus, aguacate, pastor salsa, lettuce, cucumber, tomato, red onion, avocado, red pepper, and Tzatziki dressing on top. In this case, cognitive dissonance can be a good thing, as this Arabic-inspired burro was a hit. The sweet and spicy pastor coupled nicely with the smooth hummus, and the support ingredients rounded out the flavors by bridging flavors of the two worlds. This is one of the worthy items for those looking for an adventure, along with their great looking deep-fried corn quesadillas at many tables. 

The chips were refilled upon request. Among the 12-salsa options, my favorites were the chunky chipotle, smoky Cabo, sweet pecan, spicy Mexicana, peanut, and spicy avocado. Unfortunately, the cilantro salsa had an overpowering sour cream flavor, and some of the other options were too watery, didn't register, or live up to my expectations. 

The restaurant can get very busy throughout the day, so service was not their strongest attribute on each visit. The food took some time to arrive, but the salsa bar and complimentary chips were there to scale down the hunger pains. I thought the prices were a bit higher than San Francisco and Los Angeles. However, there was a nice mix of original and innovative flavors to set them apart. Quality-wise, the food was less greasy when compared to a traditional taqueria. Interested diners should come open minded, and not expecting the most authentic fare. I hope to return to try their Oaxacan Shrimp Mole Burro, Chicken Mole Street Taco, and Pumpkin Flan. 3.5 stars for the overall experience.

Omg - their Salsa bar is amazing.. A bit spicy but I like spicy.. Horchata was delicious.. their  guacamole has tiny pieces of mango and cranberries - it's semi sweet and just so good.. I hear mole sauce is just heavenly but since I don't eat meat - wasn't able to taste it :( do try their rice - it's flavoured with cilantro and garlic and has tiny pieces of corn.. Everything was just perfect..
Good food but service is lacking.  Self service, sort of.  No trash cans, no easy refills.  Food is well worth the experience, though.

We went to this place on Sunday around 12:20, and they only had one server. We could place the order 40min after we got the seats. How come do they have one server on Sunday? Waitress never came to take the order, so many people just left. Ordered horchata, and it was the worst horchata ever. They have various kinds of salsas, but tastes are just fine. Nothing really special. Price is little bit higher than other Mexican restaurants. I Do Not recommend this place.
FINALLY!!!!  Bomb street tacos!  YES!!!  Their salsa bar is awesome sauce (pun intended)!  House margaritas also fabulous!  An all around great find, I WILL be back!!!

We flew into Arizona, jet lagged and hungry. This taco spot was near by and food network featured it. 
Outside the place looked a little sketchy, but inside it looked like a typical taco spot. We got fresh chips to start. And then we ordered about 3 tacos per person (all of them were good!). 
The best thing about this place is their salsa bar. They have everything from pico to strawberry to pecan salsa. Some were spicy, some sweet. It's insane. And delicious. 
Pretty cool and simple taco spot in Phoenix. Small dining area though, so don't get mad if there's a wait.

So much deliciousness packed into just one restaurant .... Quality ingredients and superb preparation are the cornerstones here. The food is inventive enough to be unique, without adding cuckoo ingredients for flair or deconstructing everything. Service is friendly and helpful. The location is easily accessible, has nice parking, and is thankfully more spacious than the 16th St location.

Do yourself a favor and try the queso fundido appetizer (I added in shrimp), the bean dip (I mean whaaat, since when are refried beans good?!), literally any quesa, the shrimp taco, lots of rice (I literally never eat the rice at most restaurants) and, last but not least, the horchata!

This place is the real deal! Lots of "gourmet taco" restaurants around these days and they're for the most part good. But this place seems more like a gourmet taco place you would find in Mexico. Real  authentic ingredients put together in different ways. I had the shredded pork tacos. The pork was so tender and flavorful, they didn't even need salsa added to them. speaking of salsa, this place features a salsa bar with around a dozen different salsa varieties: jicama salsa, peanut salsa, radish salsa, just to name a few of the crazy ones. To top it off, there's some pretty amazing artwork on the walls. Even the bathroom doors are beautiful. This place is a must try! I'll definitely be back

I loved the food! It has great authentic food and it is all fresh. My only downside for not giving it 5 stars is the size of the place. It can fit probably around 20 people max. I think they need to move to a bigger location. Service was ok as well, give them a past because of the busyness.

Best tacos in Phoenix.  Parking sucks, the neighborhood is meh, and the dining room is a mess, but all that melts away once you eat a taco (the Tinga is my favorite).  They have all the meats, and all the salsas, and it is taco heaven.  Come midday if possible, because there is a line every night.

My buns and and I went around 1:30 pm and it was not busy, nice atmosphere, delicious food and $5 Tuesday margaritas? Perfect! The food was delicious and I would definitely come back when back in town :)
There are a number of Mexican food restaurants in the area, but this is probably the best one. Great fish tacos and plenty of salsa to choose from.
My waiter came to my table to take my order and came again to give me my check. No refills on drinks or nothing. Disappointing.

I've been to La Santisima twice, and it's definitely one of my favorite Mexican places ever already. It was what changed me from being someone who didn't like Mexican (though I grew up where the only Mexican was Plaza Azteca-level Mexican) to someone who loves it and is excited to try more!

PROS:
- The salsa bar: Great flavors and variety! My favorite was the Mexicana, but mixing the pecan with the jicama was also divine. We accidentally tried the strawberry salsa (it was unlabeled when we went, and we thought it would be spicy), but it was also surprisingly delicious!
- The food: I ordered the taco plate both times. I arrived starving and left stuffed beyond measure with a to-go box in hand (and I eat a lot.) I ordered the Cabo shrimp taco and the Pacific white fish tacos on separate occasions, and they were both fried perfectly, without being too fishy (which I like). I loved their chicharrones taco, but my boyfriend (who doesn't have general sentimental, warm and fuzzy feelings towards chicharrones like I do) found it a little tough. I can't currently remember the names of the other tacos I got, but they were all phenomenal. I've also heard great things about the burros. Just thinking about it makes me hungry again.  

CONS:
- The service: I'm not sure what about the service makes it so slow; the first time I went, it was packed, and understandably, service was slow. But yesterday, I went and there were probably 15 tables open, two groups ahead of us, and it took about 20 minutes for us to get seated, with no explanation for why we weren't being seated. Additionally, someone at my table ordered a bottle of wine and it took them about 10 minutes to come back and say "Sorry, we don't have that. Would you like something else?"

Tl;dr: If you have time to kill and good company, definitely worth going to. If you care about service quality and speed, maybe not.
