Tire of the old sonoran style Mexican food? Find a taste of deep southern Mexico food here! The rice is not red/orange YAY, finally! and the orchata is a nutty and fruit infusion! I drive from afar to this place because its definitely a different class of Mexican food. The wait is pretty long so I don't recommend if you are dying of starvation lol but it is worth the wait. I recommend coming during off peak time frames to grab a seat, wait and enjoy

I'll make this quick: the food is phenomenal. No, seriously. Every flavor is on point. Tacos; perfect amount of meat to tortilla ratio. Queso fundido; real cheese, real hot, real good. And their specialty, the Quesas; a fantastic crunchy but "doughy" masa filled with excellent ingredients. Like a big fried empanada made with masa, but much tastier. 

So why am I giving this a 4 out of 5? Well... simple; service. The young staff seems overwhelmed and not very knowledgeable. There is a sense of chaos, which is typical in this current "hip" culture of food dining nowadays. But there is chaos and organized chaos. This is not the latter. While friendly, they really need to get their act together cause I came back for the food alone just two days later. 

Delicious place....
Awesome food!! Really really good! Great atmosphere as well. Definitely recommend for Mexican food lovers!
Thank you, Yelp!  What a wonderful place.  I had three street tacos -  al pastor, chicken and cauliflower.  My friends had burritos and raved about them, too.  Nice salsa bar, too.

YUCK! Craving Mexican food so my friend and I decided to stop at this place for some burritos. We were impressed with the large selection at the salsa bar. When we got our stale store-bought, rubbery chips the salsa wasn't so appealing after all. We both ordered chicken burritos and were shocked when we got a basket with a tortilla filled with soggy chicken bits and bean soup. It wasn't possible to use a fork and knife in a basket so we tried to pick them up and the burritos spilled all over our hands. It was a mess! I asked the waitress to look at the menu again because we were not satisfied with the burritos. I hate to waste food but we could not force ourselves to eat them. She said we had to pay for the burritos and then she would give us "one" taco. She made us feel very uncomfortable as she waved her "one" finger in our faces so I told her we would pay for the food and then look at the menu again. She immediately brought me the check and waited over my shoulder for me to pay for it before she handed us the menus. Her angry attitude scared us, so we no longer wanted to look at the menu. We just wanted to leave and try out another restaurant. I would not recommend dining at this place. The quality of food was horrible and the service was even worse. Waitress with vile attitude and crappy food equals a no win situation. You're better off dining at Taco Bell.
Any trip to Phoenix is incomplete without a stop to La Santisima.  Their salsa bar is epic, and I don't use words as such lightly. Great, original veggie entrees as well. Well worth the short wait.
service a 2, food a 5!!!!! you need this experience at least. highly recommend shrimp taco, cochinita pibil and mole negro.....

Tacos are authentic! Salsa bar is awesome. There can be a bit of a wait but when you get to your table they already have chips there waiting for you ! Burritos / burros are huge and they grill the tortilla, nice touch. Servers are awesome but a little short staffed.
Try the tamarindo margarita!!

The tacos here were amazing! I had a shrimp taco and the black mole taco. It was great!! The salsa bar has a huge selection of fresh made salsas. My only complaint would be that they were out of guacamole when I came in which broke my heart. But next time I'm definitely going to try it. The margaritas are definitely spot on too, definitely a must try if you are in the area!

Ya'll are as high as our super sweet but (holyeffingshit) slow server with your 5 star reviews. Come on already. I've been twice, both experiences were about 1:30-2p in the afternoon, aka the end of most restaurants lunch rush. The first time, the waiter spilled Sprite on my husband and apologized but never came back to help with it because they were so busy. BUT THAT FILET BURRITO THOUGH. Took damn near an hour but it was so freeeeaking delish. So, I went again, with the same naïveté as most of you, hoping it was an off day. W R O N G. Today we waited 10 minutes for water, 15 minutes for chips and 50 minutes for food. 1.5 hrs in total for a (holyeffingshit) $17 delicious chicken burrito plate, some tacos and a horchata. 

Being in the industry, I was watching the people around me like a hawk-- I cannot help it. Restaurant management runs through my blood and is 99.8% of the time a curse because I notice every flipping detail and rarely enjoy myself when out to eat. Today, I noticed two servers in a packed restaurant. Maybe 3-4 kitchen staff. No bartender although a lot of booze was being ordered. I watched 3 customers walk out after not being greeted at their table and 9 (yes, nine) take off after waiting at the door for a table for way too long when there were clean tables inches from them. People were making their frustrations known and some were honestly pretty pissed. I am really confused why they don't switch to counter service, it make SO much more sense for their concept. 
 
No mediocre free salsa bar and damn tasty but super overpriced food is worth this kind of service.

Dude.

I love this place. It's walking distance from my house, that is baaaad news for my thighs. I've driven past it multiple times and it never caught my eye. Finally, I did notice their large statue thingy outside of the establishment. It was all lit up as I drove by during the evening. When I realized it was a gourmet taco shop, I knew I had to go asap. 

I went with my boyfriend and we both went to TOWN on their chips and assorted salsas. My favorite was the pecan salsa. Sweet and spicy! For our meals, he ordered 3 tacos and I ordered 2. The pork tacos were slightly bland and made me worry at first that I was going to be let down, but then came the chicken mole taco - oh my! Delicious! Sweet and savory, it was perfect. I know that sauce is difficult to make too, so, well done. Most of the tacos actually don't come with cheese - you know why? Because the tacos are so bomb you don't even need the cheese really. Their flavors are very carefully picked to taste a certain way. Save the cheese and salsa for the chips! You'll enjoy the tacos just as they are.

YUM!
Uusual selection of tacos, excellent condiment bar - at least ten different salsas - and some funky modern Mexican art. Worth the occasional wait.

Wow! What a great surprise, You can definitely taste the quality in the food! Great selection of salsa and the menu has a variety for all. The good isn't over done to the point where you can't finish your plate. I will most definitely be coming back here.

I just returned to this restaurant and now that they've expanded, things have changed for the worse. The service was abysmal, the place is so dark you can't see, it smells bad, and the lighting consists of some spotlights tacked onto the ceiling that shine right into your eyes if you are unlucky enough to sit at a bad table. 

I ordered my usual tacos and the cheese shells were burned, the tortilla chips were oily, and the meat quality was tough and chewy. The prices have also skyrocketed! 

My love affair with this place is officially over. Sorry.
Love there tacos... They have diff flavors then most tacos places. Deff worth trying you won't regret it
Small spot with beautiful original artwork hanging on the walls. Food was spectacular.

Incredible food. The kind of place you go to on repeat while visiting Phoenix. They have an incredible salsa bar! I ordered the Oaxacan Black Mole Quesa- it was unreal. The outside was perfectly crisp and the chicken, slow marinated in mole sauce, was life changing. Their margaritas are massive so you really only need 1. I got the spicy marg!! DEFINITELY RECOMMEND!

Great place to take out-of-towners. These are show and tell tacos, pricy and small portions surrounded by beautiful art and murals. You can definitely get cheaper tacos elsewhere without all the fuss. This is the BEST a-la-carte salsa bar in town, but the small plastic containers are inadequate.

This place is so busy it's ridiculous. I was willing to give it a try and understand that it was during lunch time but the bad experiences kept coming. Busy time means no chips unless you ask for it. One of the bartenders, who I think was the owner was, running around opening doors and wiping the sweat off his head and still had time to make a margarita without washing his hands and grabbing the straw right from where the guest was going to put his lips on. Good thing it wasn't my margarita... While I'm waiting I go to the restroom which was poorly cleaned. Pee... everywhere which again the person before me could of been the one to do it but get this... no hand soap. I hope the employees were washing their hands after using the restroom. So, finally get my food which looks good until I look at the basket which was holding the food and see there is dried gunk from whoever used it before me. Beans. Rice. Salsa. It was all dried on there. I took my wrapper out of the basket and set it aside. Already grossed out by the dirtiness I decided I was never coming back. As soon as I got home after my 20 minute drive I immediately began feeling sick... I wonder why. I really don't even wanna think how much germs I came in contact with.

The last 3 trips to Phoenix we've made have included a stop at La Santisimo.  The best street tacos I've ever had.  Their mole sauce is extraordinary, the steak gaucho tacos are killer good, the horchata is sooooo good.  On top of all that, the huge variety of salsas at the salsa bar will keep you coming back for more.  My favorite is the peanut salsa.  WARNING:the pecan salsa is HOT!

HOLD THE TACO! This place is legit! The restaurant is small, and cramped, but I get it... the food was carefully made with a genuine love of feeding people and they want to feed as many as they can in their small space. 

The tacos were legit, the fish tacos were amazeballs, and the veggie options were ridiculous. I had a shrimp taco, and a veggie taco, both were outstanding. The fresh salsa bar was ridiculous too, in a good way :)

Go here, eat tacos, thank me later.

Note, lots of pescie and veggie options! #veggie4life #veggielife #pescielife
I love this taco shop!! The salsa bar was great with so many options to choose from. The employees were very friendly too.  I had the pastor Quesa and it was amaizing!

So so awesome!! The salsa bar was huge and armed with more types of salsa than I could possibly taste in one sitting. Anyway the tacos were more than filling and very tastey. As far as the location lets just say I drove past it and had to do a u-turn. I was not expecting it to be "right next to" La perila. Which is another mexican food place but has been around for quite awhile. So here you go.... If you are looking for a mexican dish enchilada style that can be eaten with a soup spoon?? Go to La Perila, which is good don't get me wrong. But if your looking for a flavor party of some really good authentic mexican food go to La Santisma. There is a good chance you too will be excited to share this place with others. Don't want to forget the staff was very friendly and helpful. The layout of this place is cool and family like. Nice front patio that would be pretty cool come sundown. Welp Enjoy I sure did and will again.
I rarely rave about places to eat, but I'm telling you this is legit!  Drink the house margarita and enjoy the cochinita pibil burrito!

How much do I love this place?

Well I live in Washington state and I've made a flight layover in Phoenix just to run grab some lunch here. 

The salsa bar is amazing. Tons of unique flavors. My only critique would be the avocado salsa is a little too spicy for me. Otherwise I really enjoy almost all the salsas.

The main reason I come here though is for the Mole Quesadilla! Their quesadillas are not your standard fair, they are deep fried, and filled with whatever you order with them. If you are a mole lover, this should not be missed! I've yet to find another place that I can get this dish as good, hence the reason I will make alterations to my flight plans to eat here!

Also when you go don't forget to order a horchata, they are giant and filled with extras!
The food is what saves this place... AMAZING!!! staff is friendly but always seems to be "short handed", so drink refills and check backs are hit and miss.
Husband introduced me to this place yesterday and I was totally impressed. Donot pass up the cilantro or pecan salsas!

Loved the tacos. Def something different from your regular Mexican restaurant. My favorite thing is the salsa bar!! So much variety! And the horchata?!.... so delish! Only thing was the wait to order and food. Busy place at lunch. But I think the food is worth it. But don't come if your in a rush
Not impressed, after reading the comment i though it would be a great spot, but wish i didnt go there honestly

Great, cozy ambiance. Great service. Complex, unique, and absolutely delicious flavors on everything that I've tried (tacos, quesadilla, salsa, margaritas). The quesadilla is unlike any other I've ever seen or tasted, and absolutely the best. The margaritas are the best I've had in the valley, and the happy hour price for them is amazing. 
Their menu is so awesome too, so many things that are unique and not commonly found.
Hidden gem. Hole in the wall with the most unassuming store front but delicious salsa bar with great authentic Mexican food!
Really great vegetarian meals. Salsa variety is great, my favorite is the strawberry one. I had a vegetarian burrito enchilada style that I'm craving right now
Wow! This was an incredible experience! Staff were friendly and super helpful. The quesa was  the best thing we've ever tasted and the street tacos were awesome!
Best local Mexican food Ever!!!! Amazing service, Amazing Food, Amazing Salsa bar!!!!

Where do I start? We are on our trip out here from Los Angeles, California and on our way back home we stopped here. First , the salsa bar is amazing!!! Sooo many choices and different ideas than what I'm used to. I ordered a few tacos al a carte and the meats are sooo good and the sauces they use are super tasty. I will be definitely be telling my friends about this place when I get back.

Great place! Awesome food, best salsa bar in town. 
Clean environment and very friendly staff. We will definitely be back again. The breakfast menu is really good and pricing is reasonable.

I have to say, I thought it may have been a pipe dream to think that because Phoenix is closer to the Mexican border that we may be able to find better Mexican restaurants here. But the theory proved true. I'm from Minneapolis, where good Mexican places are few and far between, the only good one I can think of being Los Ocampo. 

This place had the best salsa bar I've seen yet. The steak tacos I had were excellent; the meat was moist and flavorful with no gristle and little fat. They would have been even better with a little cilantro though. The rice and beans were some of the best I've had; the rice was a tad soft/wet but the flavor was spot on. We had margaritas, apparently on special, for only $3 a pop. They were tasty but strong enough-enough that I had to let my husband finish mine off because I was driving.
The only thing I would say needs improvement is the ambiance; my chair was uncomfortable and difficult to scoot in and out from the table, which was a big pain and drew attention to us when I attempted to nurse our baby. The chairs could use reupholstering too.

Tip: their parking is out front but easy to miss when you're driving down 16th, which is a busy thoroughfare with a speed limit of 45 (?) don't quote me on that but people drive FAST.

Awesome taco and salsa choices, but no big crowds.

For a foodie, it's great there are no long lines and waits for seating, but peoples, YOU'RE MISSIN' OUT! In Saturday for lunch, had a seat at the empty bar. Tables mostly full, but not jammed with folks. Good for me though, service was quick, and room to kick back.

Ordered Azteca Tinga and Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken tacos, but oddly, was served Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco instead of the Azteca. I double-checked with the server 'cuz the Cochinita was absolutely mouth-watering! Over-the-top when paired with the Cilantro salsa (just a touch). A definite repeat item. Black Mole was certainly delivered as described, with dark, somewhat smokey-molasses flavor, but a bit too heavy for me.

Ti[p: Pick just two-to-three salsa to sample, and then decide on how best to enjoy them-some just with chips, others to top off a taco. How to be sure what's best? Duh, come back again!

The best in PHX. My favorite place to go to get food and eat a dope ass meal is here. Let me start off by saying that I fudging love salsa and this place has a salsa bar... case closed. You might have to wait like 30-45 mins but it's well worth it in the end. Trust me.

Peanut salsa (?!?) is insanely good. For veggie lovers, the veggie burrito is super filling and delicious with more than the standard rice, beans and fajita veggies. I'd go here every day for lunch if I worked closer

Third visit to La Condesa and that's enough to give it a review. I like the flavors, which are largely guided by your personalized salsa choices, but find it to be a bit heavy in portions.

La Condesa is really ALL about the salsa... not just for the chips but utilizing the bar during the whole visit to create your own perfect balance of flavors. Dishes are dialed into a low volume in order to let the salsa sing.  If your meal's not right, it may be that you're putting peanut salsa on charred beef rather than chicken or vegetables.

PORTIONS + VALUE
Two Condesa tacos are way too generous, while three truly street-sized tacos at Gallo Blanco are just perfect for this gal (one reviewer noted the lack of a "sampler" style plate, which is true). However my brother in law, the bottomless pit, packed away one queso and two tacos in a single sitting. So if you're a big eater and looking for value, its very fair and you'll get plenty of protein.

THE BEANS
Smooth, smoky, with just a little chunk. Thin enough for dipping, which is crucial for the doughy ends of your fried queso tortilla. I'm impressed at how consistent the beans have tasted across three visits. Portion size has been reviewed as small but when you have that much taco to eat, who has room for beans other than as a condimento?

THE RICE
Nothing to write home about. Pale, underseasoned. On one visit it was sticky. Not what we local eaters expect as "Mexican Rice".

THE SALSAS
This is what you come for: salsa on demand. There is an avocado cruda salsa that disappears quickly but is consistently green and fresh, never gray. Chile de arbol salsa has a faint nutty taste. Green tomatillo is delicious. Purple cabbagy condimento is great paired with cochinita as suggested. Salsa Mexicana is not mundane. Cilantro drizzle is a welcome accent. 

TACOS
Taco plates are generously portioned with meat, almost too much in my book but who's complaining? Whisper of selected vegetable garnish included. Tortillas are average quality and may not be steam-fluffed enough. I'll give them this: they don't break. 

BURRITOS
Messy but good. Thin wax paper can't withstand much contact with a knife and fork. The Bullet is a mild no-brainer favorite for kids. 

QUESOS
Decadent! Sinful! Beckoning! The fried dough is pastry-like. Paired with the cohinita pibil it was like having dessert for supper. The extra doughy bits on the seam are particularly yummy dunked in beans. Being a fan of the doughy huarache concept in general, the Queso takes corncake-ness up to eleven.

MOLE NEGRO
A true mole negro, not the sweeter raisin-y ancho-packed type we often get here in town. It's not smoky, but actually charred and a little bitter, with aromatic undertones. Chocolate tones not easily discernable. Different that what you may be used to, but good.

AZTEC CHICKEN TINGA
Adequately wet and seasoned. Tender and easy to pull apart without a knife. Mild on the seasoning, but easily remedied with that ample salsa bar everyone is raving about. This makes Mexican food accessible to all tolerances of heat, in a way.

COHINITA PIBIL
Delicate shreds of well braised pork. Low key on the seasoning but not flavorless. Nice paired with the purple salsa and anything acidic they have out that day.

SEAFOOD
Our bottomless pit had the Ahi and the Dogfish shark and said both were good.

CARNE ASADA
Crunchy but missing the smoke and sizzle I'd expect from a mesquite grilled specialty. It was adequate but lacked a bit of citrus acidity and kick. Competent, and even tasty.  Again, nothing not easily remedied by salsa.

VEGETABLES
How refreshing to have vegetables available for all dishes as entree or add-ons. I added spinach to my Queso in a meager attempt to satisfy a vegetable serving for my meal. It delivered beautifully and added crunch.

BEVERAGES
Horchata and Jaimaica live up to their previous reviews here. Horchata is way too huge for a child. Would love to see a pint-sized version. The full size is a commitment.

THE WAIT
Yes, you might wait. Even if the restaurant is empty. I went for take-out after the lunch rush and waited 20 minutes even though there was only one order ahead of me and there was no line at the counter.  If I had known they were going to pack me a mini-stash of chips in the to-go bag I'd have asked for it in advance to pass the time at the salsa bar while I waited. Post-lunch rush also showed some empty salsa bins but with 12 choices, it just means some of your favorites are in the process of being refilled. We're spoiled here at La Condesa. Most of my favorite true-mex restaurants only offer two, maybe three at the table.

THE ENVIRONMENT
Rustic contemporary/ironic and clean on the surface but not tidy to the  glance when abandoned baskets stack up. They need a self-service trash can like Baja Fresh or Chipotle so the baskets don't accumulate in public view. Would appreciate a commitment to wash cheap silverware. No indication if they recycle the consumables.

We came here on December 23rd, after failing to find a local kebab store that was open.  I remembered the amazing mosaic sculpture and told my buddy, let's try the place with the big Dia de los Muertos lady on the front....and we did.  The Mayan taco was ....well...to use the term orgasmic would be both an understatement and a poor use of the word.  I took my parents there 4 days later and had a similar experience. My dream dinner there is to have many friends, many hours, many many tacos, and many beers or margaritas.  I am impressed with the food quality, but haven't had the beans or rice, I figure why?  They have tacos.  Also, impressive salsa bar with a pink radish salsa that I wanted to drink out of the bowl.  Yes, this is a hedonistic review, but I had a hedonistic time.  Go eat here.  They must never go out of business.

I heard the food was good however service was poor.  I get that Sunday can be a busy day.  The staff should greet people as they walk in and let them know how long is wait.  Instead everyone is ignored.  I really support Latin business owners however it's important to pay attention to all the little things.  It truly does make a difference!!

This little Phoenix gem delivers everything you want from fine Mexican dining without all the touristy bullshit. The exterior has classic Dia De Las Muertas tile work and the interior is rustic, intimate and clean. The menus and prices are simple and excellent and the food is phenomenal.

The salsa bar is one of the best I have ever experienced. At least 12 different salsas. All different and all excellent, and I believe, made on the premises. We had, Pecan, Peanut Butter, 7 Chili, Mexicano, Pico de Gallo, and Cilantro salsa. If variety is the spice of life, what is a variety of spices?

The absolute, takes the cake reason for 5 stars is the Horchata! I am a fan of Horchata. I have never had Horchata like this! 32 ounces with what must have been muddled strawberries and apples and fresh ground cinnamon. So good, so good.

My family & I ate here for breakfast after the Phoenix heart walk. Being a weekend the place filled pretty quickly. We arrived shortly after the restaurant opened so we quickly greeted and seated. If you're a first timer the place is small, not much space in between table, be weary if you have younger children. We were given a breakfast menu along with the standard menu. Our daughters had pancakes and scrabbled eggs which they both loved. I am the biggest fan of their horchata. I absolutely love it and sometimes stop by for just that. I order the egg Benedict with the option of red or green chili pork. I told the waiter I wanted red chili and he repeated green. I corrected him and requested red chili. Again, this is a smaller place but busy, so don't expect your food quickly. When our food arrived my entire plate was cold. The side of beans were not warm, but cold. My Benedict, also cold and not red chili but green. The poached egg was more boiled as the yoke was solid and not runny. 

I've eaten here before and I have to say this visit was disappointing. I may only return for the horchata or dinner but never again for breakfast.

Not sure how to follow Julie P.'s epic review, but I thought I'd show some support.

La Condesa is a fantastic addition to Central Phoenix. Casual, nice people, amazing food.

Like other reviewers, I'm partial to the Oaxaca black mole chicken and the cochinita pibil. Everything is delicious in any delivery system -- taco, burro, or (gooey and vaguely depraved) quesa.

The salsa bar really gets me, though. Experiencing it is to suffer total cognitive arrest and disorganization; it's like love at first sight or stumbling upon a work of great art. Peanut, cilantro, de arbol... bring a sharpie so you can mark the little plastic cups and remember your favorites.

Bonus points: The server remembered that I'd asked for strawberry salsa (they were out) on my last visit eight days prior, and offered a totally above-and-beyond apology. Must be something in the mole that sharpens the memory. 

Great place -- a gem.

I've been coming to La Santisima for 8 years. The service has always been slow but the food was always hot and spot on.  Recently they switched management and now the food is going downhill. The tacos are smaller, salsa bar is always half full and quality is poor. My go to taco is the Mexi Mignon. It's a grilled piece of filet mignon with a homemade slaw and fried cheese. This taco is out of this world good. However, my last visit they used chopped steak, no slaw, different sauce and fried cheese. This is a $10 taco. I will not be coming back until they bring the quality of their food back. Shame on the owners for cutting corners on what was the best taco place in  AZ.

I'm a vegetarian and the options La Santisima has are phenomenal! I make it a point to try something different every time I visit and have not been disappointed yet. Everything is delicious,  authentic and real. Highly recommend you visit. Have the bean dip to start... you'll thank yourself for doing so.
Tried the tacos. Take the mix and match. You will not be disappointed. The ambience is perfect for a casual date or family gathering alike.

Soo good. The salsa bar is awesome; I've never seen flavors like pecan or peanut before. The horchata is delicious, comes with the lots of fruit inside. The quesas are good if you have a big appetite and like a ton of cheese. Also very tasty tacos.

All I got to say that these were the best taco's I've ever had. Found this place by chance on Yelp by chance on a visit to Phoenix for the Pro Bowl. The salsa selection is good. Next time I'm in town I'll be there again.
Love the salsa bar. 15 varieties. Street tacos rock.

Let me start by saying that I absolutely love Mexican food (so I believe I have good taste)  and these tacos were literally the best I've ever had ! 

So many salsas at the salsa bar, which is like candy land for someone like me! I had the chicken taco and a shrimp taco (with beer batter) and my sister had the cactus tacos. We born enjoyed our meals quite a bit although my sister liked the cactus tacos from two hippies beach house better (she's vegetarian). 

They were so good you must try!!! I am very picky about Mexican food and only enjoy authentic flavors. The beans were underwhelming , but it's a taco shop, so this rating is based on tacos. Will def be going back the next time I visit Arizona!

The only words that can express how great this Mexican place are...OMG yummy!  Once you dine at La Santisima you will be hooked for life!  Try to get there before 11:30am or after the lunch crowd 2:00pm or you might have a challenge getting a table.
YUM! Great salsa bar with lots of fun and innovative options. Only problem is you eat so many chips to try out all the salsas- it's hard to remember to leave room for the great tacos.

The salsa bar here is unlike any I've ever seen.. there are probably 20 different ones to choose from and you serve yourself. They even make a strawberry salsa!! My table always has about 8 different little salsa cups all over it for all the different mixings and options. 

Also, I've only ever eaten their tacos and there are two pages to choose from so I will probably continue as they are all completely different and unique. 

The interior is comfy and really artsy. I love this spot!!

What can you say about a place that has already seen the stamp of approval from Guy Fieri? Well, the positives are quite clear, good food at low prices and an endless salsa bar that pushes boundaries with creations like strawberry salsa. But with this success the whole-in-the-wall charm has been lost. My visit became a transactional act due to poor customer service by the sole waitress attending to all the tables in the restaurant.

I've been here twice and I was not disappointed either time. First of all their salsa bar as one of the best I have ever experienced as far as choices and taste. There are tacos and quesadillas are top notch. This place is one of my top five restaurants for Mexican food. I also like that when I get my plate the food is piping hot and you can tell the ingredients are fresh. I find their prices to be very reasonable and their staff was kind and attentive. If you've never been here you have to check this place out. I'm certain he will not be disappointed. :)

Sweet spot! Very cool ambiance. Food was great. Salsa bar was delicious. Pecan salsa was amazing. Never would have thought of and almost did not try, but was the best of the batch. Would have liked a little more spice, but all were good. Shark taco, colors of the flag burrito was stunning. Another combo (meat, raisins, and apples) that was great. Quesadilla was also great. Not the standard quesadilla but better in my opinion. Small with only 10 tables, and things were a bit slow but more than worth it!!

This place was terrible, I never leave bad reviews, but I was expecting high quality tacos and was very disappointed. After reading numerous articles we decided to check it out on Friday night. To begin with the restaurant is small and loud. We decide to get our food to go instead of waiting. Our order was messed up, I received a meat taco when I ordered something else (I don't eat meat). The rice is congealed and sticky and bland and the beans are runny and unbeatable. I was very disappointed with the customer service and the experience overall. We will not be back.

Food was really good. I had a Quesa and it was not the ordinary quesadilla. The horchata was also unique. I am definitely going back to try the shark tacos. 

I would have given it 5 stars but it was warm in there. In AZ you do not want to go from baking outside to eating in a warm restaurant. There was also only one server working.
This place is very good. Their salsa bar is great with many different selections. Whenever I'm thinking about eating Mexican food, this place always comes to mind.

The praise here is warranted. This is the best Mecican food possibly in the world. 

Service and ambience are awesome. 
You can tell that the salsa bar is clearly insane. I actually wasn't a huge fan of any, but I combined the peanut with some other chipotle salsa and the tomatillo with another green salsa and made two amazing new salsas.

The food is indescribable. You can only understand if you eat it. I've had the carne, pibil, pastor, and mole tacos. The only one I didn't like was mole but it's an acquired taste and I think if you like mole you'll love it. The beans are also super flavorful and the rice is pretty good. It's closer to an Asian fried rice than the Mexican rice I've had, but I'm not complaining! 

The horchata was also like nothing I've ever had. It had cantaloupe, pecans, And strawberries and somehow it still worked out?? You have to have it if you come here.

I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this place except that I wish they delivered to where I live (NY) hahaha

A huge selection of gourmet and street tacos.  The variety of fish options appeared to be a huge hit with other options, but we particularly enjoyed the cochinita and carne asada tacos. Decent prices, and fun to try the different salsas from their large salsa stand. Beware it gets quite busy during Saturday lunch, and the seating is a small area. Prepare for a short wait during peak hours or go during off hours. We will probably be back again.

The tacos here are to die for.. The dogfish shark tacos rock.. The salsa bar is absolutely insane, lots of real spicy options.. Kitchy, inexpensive, I feel a must for locals to take your tourists as that "hole in the wall" place with some real spunk and guster..Pack some heat.. Its the Ghetto:)

I thought I reviewed this spot already, but I obviously didn't. I came here  about 4 years ago when it had a different name (la Condesa) and it was my first time coming back since. I came here a month ago with some friends and we drove separately. Some of them got there first which was good because they were able to snag us a table for 6 in this small restaurant. Since it was a Friday night, it was busier than usual and several parties had to wait or go elsewhere. 

Their menu has a lot of options even for vegetarians, which is nice. I ordered a taco plate with three different kinds: aguacate, la santísima veggie, and the cactus one. I did like them, but I would've enjoyed them better if they were served in flour tortillas rather than corn. I'm not a corn tortilla fan. The salsa bar is fun to try, I got the strawberry one to balance out the spicier ones like chipotle. The beans were tasty too. 

Service was good and we got our food in a timely manner. I just wish they had more space and alternate choices for tortillas.

Love this place! Not super close to my house but always worth the drive, or a fun place to stop by if I'm headed to the Ranch Market. You have to be looking for it because it's in a tiny strip mall and could be easily passed up. I love the decorations inside it's Dia de los Muertos themed and all the art work is super cool. They have a salsa bar with tons of different salsas you can try out which is fun and gives you a good variety of spice and flavors (try the strawberry one!). All of the tacos I've had have been delicious but if you do get the plate with 2 tacos and rice and beans you're going to be really full or have half of your plate to take home. I haven't been for the happy hour tacos or whatever it is so I will have to make it by 6 one day for the deal. Highly recommend this place.

Huge and delicious Horchata!
Strawberry salsa!
Shrimp taco!

Those are what I had at my first visit. First it a little bit hard to find the place because we did not know exactly where this place is located at. Once we stepped inside, the artwork on the wall blew us away. 

We started off with the chips and 10 different kinds of Salsa. This is the incredible ideas since none of us love the same kinds of Salsa. I loved Strawberry one. My husband loved 7 chilies. Others also love different kinds, such as green chili and jicama.

Then our meals arrived shortly after. A basket full of tacos, rice and bean. They are all delicious and I have never had the shrimp tacos this good before.

I am glad that La Condesa is not to far from where we live. It is our new spot to go get some delicious food.

Ya'll don't understand.  This is it.  This is the place.  This is as good as it gets.

When people say, "Know any real Mexican restaurants?" take them here. When you have people fly in from out of town and say, "Take me to a hidden hole-in-the-wall spot" take them here. When you want to impress a date, your parents, or just have delicious meal... take them here.

If you go at prime dinner time it'll be a 15-30 min wait.  But it's so worth it.  You sit down.  They place a complementary basket of chips and you look to the back where there are 10 different salsas.  Yes ten.  And not this made-in-a-bag BS.  Real fresh stuff.  So you get to experiment with these while you wait for your food to come out.  Next, order the Horchata.  Get only one and share.  They are huge.  Their margaritas are also good. Finally, get something with the black mole and/or oaxacan cheese.  

I cannot overstate how amazing their mole sauce is.  All of their food is excellent but the mole... I have no words to describe it.  I have had their black mole tacos, their black mole sandwich and the heavenly Oaxacan Black Mole Chicken Quesa which is more like an empanada. 

I am from the Midwest originally.  Before I moved here, I swore off Mexican food.  It was greasy, disgusting, and tasted like hot and salty mush.  This restaurant is probably my single favorite place to eat since moving here 3 years ago.  Treat yourself to this place.  You deserve to know happiness.

I have been here twice and both visits were enjoyable.  The food is amazing and the portions are generous.  It is fun to order and share among friends since there is such a variety on the menu - definitely many flavors to suit every palate.  The salsa bar is eclectic and amusing and brings a great point of conversation to the table.

This is a great addition to downtown Glendale.

I was disappointed by the slow service provided at both visits.  The staff plays music from an mp3/iPod but we had to ask several times to turn it down because we could not even here each other talk over the volume of the music.  It was a feature that I could have done without.  These are easy fixes for the management and staff.

We were in Arizona for five days, including Sedona and the Grand Canyon, and we ended up coming here twice.  Don't miss: salsa mexicana, tomatillo salsa, rice & beans, el pastor street taco, chicken mole street taco, and cochinita pibil street taco.
Best gourmet tacos around with really interesting flavors. Salsa bar is so good. I crave the pecan salsa!!

Service is terrible. Asked 3x for tequila suggestions and got nothing.  People waiting out the door with 4 open tables.  Food is great just plan to wait.  AND I ordered a burro to go with FISH And was given beef.  Horrible!!   No mas!
Heaven,  the way Mexican food should be! Dogfish tacos are the bomb! Salsa and guacamole are great too.  If you want true tacos this place is a must.

We were driving around starving and stopped here. Seems they are famous for salsa and tacos. It was really crowded. That's a good sign. The tacos were freshly made and good. The salsa was great. Wish I could take it home. We tried a variety of sauces and wanted to buy one of each. It was fun just taste testing. Worth the trip.

Tried out this little place after trying their new location in Glendale. Man is this place small! There's limited parking up front and the whole restaurant can fit in my backyard. BUT the food is still as wonderful and delicious as ever! 

We arrived after going to Comicon and where immediately greeted and told the wait time. Once someone vacated a table, it was cleaned quickly for the next person. Our food came out at a reasonable time and so worth the wait! Our server was very friendly  and gave us some delicious suggestions. I would definitely come back! 

Just be careful where you park because during rush hour, you won't be able to get out easily.

My salsa prayers have been answered!! They have a ton of options for flavoring your chips, taco, or whatever delicious food you may be eating here. I tried their peanut salsa, jalapeño, chipotle, and all the others I could get my hands on. They each had their own distinct flavor and they are all uniquely amazing. I was so pleased to find a true delicious salsa bar on this side of town. 
I grew up with salsas from my mom and she makes some DELICIOUS salsas. These were all so good and up to par with my mamas. 

When we first got here, it was dead. But within 20 min, there was a big wait. We were lucky to have gotten there when we did. We were graciously greeted and served fresh hot chips! I ordered a coronarita and it was ok. Not the best but decent. A little too high priced for me at ten bucks. I asked the waitress what she recommended and she said the quesadillas since they are deep fried. I ordered the vegetarian one. Oh my goodness. That was the most delicious quesadilla I have ever had in my life. I probably wouldn't call them quesadillas. They were more like gorditas. But either way, AMAZING. 

I look forward to coming back and tasting their tacos, tortas and burritos. And stuffing my face with more chips and twenty different Salsas. :-) can't wait!
Love this place! It's a bit small, but the food is delicious and the salsa bar is always changing flavors.

This is NOW my fab taco spot. The portions given are more than any other place I usually go to. Their salad bar has so many salsas to choose from. Its so hard to think of something I didn't like. And the horchata is like no other, you'll definitely come back to this place!

Go! It took me forever to get around to eating despite being just down the street from me, and boy do I regret that. The food here is amazing! It may seem pricey, but I promise you it is 1000% worth it! The portions are pretty big, I couldn't even finish my plate! (If you like them a little smaller though, go for a bowl.) I can't say enough for the quality or taste of the food. I have since recommended this to everyone I know. So don't hesitate, go!

Awesome to see more gems like this on this area. Carne Asada is fantastic. Great selection of salsas and house margarita is the perfect stand by to cool things down. Only complaints are the wobbly tables, missing drink menu and absent children's selection

An oustanding, quality restaurant with reasonable prices.  The carne asada bowl that I had was amazing.  Enough for two meals for me, but it was so good, I ate it all at one time.  I did take out and while waiting saw all of the dishes come out to the customers.  Everything looked amazing.  I can't wait to return and try some of the other items.  The salsa bar was amazing with over 12 choices of different salsa.  I mixed the guacamole (hot) and cilantro (mild)  salsa and it was one of the best that I have ever tried with the perfect level of spice for me.  You can't miss this place.  Thanks again for a great meal.

Hmmm ... well it was good, just not great. 

I had the shrimp taco and it came super hot but relativity tasteless. My girl Jacquid had the same thing (two shrimp tacos) and the total came to $25... not exactly a bargain in my book.

That said the interior is small but beautiful (lot of art on the walls).

4 star food with 0 star service so I compromised. We walked in and questioned if anyone even worked there. We waited about 5 minutes before I had to walk over to the bartender and ask if it was self seating. I was told that they have to clear the tables which were full and that's why we weren't sitting yet. Thanks... I guess? So we finally sit and its 15 minutes before were asked what we want to drink and are given menus. About 10 minutes later the bar tender walks up and says "I'm not your waiter but I'll help you" the girl that was supposed to be our waiter was in her own world staring at the POS system like she was having problems creating people checks, but I think she just didn't want to face all the mad diners looking impatient around me. People that walked in 15-20 minutes after me are already getting Togo boxes and pretty much the same issue was present with the table next to us. We came in five minutes after him yet finished eating before he received his food. There was no order or massive issues in the kitchen or both. Even a walk up Togo order was in and out quickly, but the man was complaining about receiving the wrong food. The waitress seemed to argue back with customers or give excuses. It was very unacceptable customer service wise. I will never go back or recommend this place even though the food was good. Near the end of the meal we were told the food was great (which it was) but the service was horrible (also true) by a staff member. Why can't you fix it if you know it's wrong? If you order take out I would suggest the street tacos as they are all very good. If the restaurant isn't busy I'm sure the service doesn't struggle (as I've experienced the first time I went in) but when I returned on a date to careless and horrible service I know it's not worth my time to return.

Food was good, nothing to write home about. They have a ton of different salsas at their salsa bar, only about 3 are tasty & worth eating. However, their house margaritas are amazing. Staff is friendly. Only real complaint was their A/C was not cold enough which made it uncomfortably warm in the restaurant, especially when the temperature outside is 110+.
I'm from California and I would move across the street from this place. Fantastic tacos and salsa. The pork was great. My barbacoa was great. My chorizo was great. This is all you need to know.
Loved this place! I asked the cashier to order me her favorite thing and it was absolutely delicious!

This is the best food I've eaten in a long time. Eating a low carb diet can be difficult when eating out - especially at a taco place - but their menu offers a "protein style" option, where they wrap the taco filling in fried cheese. It was amazing! The tortilla soup was also incredible; I'll probably dream about it.  I'm super bummed I don't live in or near Phoenix, but that's probably good because I'd eat here daily.

I love going here for the gourmet tacos. They can be a little slow in service at times but that is because they are making things fresh. Their salsa bar is excellent with multiple salsas for every palette. I have brought many coworkers here for lunch and they love it too. I have yet to try their margaritas because I have only gone for lunch but they look amazing as well. I highly recommend the tiger shrimp, arrechetta (carne asada) and the tinga tacos.

What's most fascinating about La Santisima is that their three separate locations seem to vary greatly in reputation. There's the one in Downtown Glendale, which receives mostly positive reviews. There's one in Flagstaff, that strangely receives a lot of harsh criticism. And then there's this location, the flagship, which receives an exorbitant amount of Yelp reviews that are mostly positive, with the occasional one-star reviews complaining about their terrible customer service.

My feelings on Santisima have always been mixed. It's one of my girlfriend's favorite restaurants based on the quality of their guacamole, horchata, and rice and beans. Hell, they also make some pretty decent tacos to boot. But as many people have stated, Santisima is a primary example of a restaurant that's become incredibly popular, but has failed to adapt their model to accommodate the crowds.

Wait times are very common. Parking is horrid, there's hardly any room to wait inside, and rarely will you ever be greeted upon walking in. We usually have to hunt down a server in order to put our names on the list. What's also strange is that, you might see tons of empty tables inside that are unused, while crowds of people are waiting inside in order to get in. When we were dining there recently, a nearby couple finished up their food and left. Their table was left uncleaned for over an hour - all while a group of about a dozen people were waiting outside.

I've also learned that this isn't a restaurant where you want to spread out your portions. Order everything at once. Drinks, appetizers, and entrées. And as soon as they bring out the food, request the bill. If not, you'll be sitting around here for a long, long time.

Santisima's menu is kind of intimidating. They cover a lot of ground. Probably too much, in fact. I usually play it safe and just order some of their street tacos. They're good, but in the last few years with increased exposure to other options, I don't quite consider them to be as mind-blowingly amazing as some people are saying. Rice and beans are very good, however, with my girlfriend always citing how authentic the beans taste in comparison to that canned rubbish most people dish out.

Many people rave about the salsa bar, as if it's some kind of new, foreign invention that they've never seen before. Yes, people. There's a salsa bar. Any reputable taco place has one. Santisima might be considered a cut above the rest, however, because of the variety available.  

I ordered their traditional quesadilla on a whim, expecting the same thing I receive at practically every taco shop in Phoenix. Instead, I received a giant-sized, deep-fried quesadilla with oaxaca cheese and butter flavoring that's more on par with a gordita. I love the cheese, but the breading is a bit too chewy for my taste.

Their horchata is consistently referenced by many people as being one of the best you can find - provided that you're into chunks. The drink, which is far superior to the more commonly found pre-mixed rubbish, contains hearty cuts of strawberry, cantaloupe, and pecans. In my opinion, it definitely lives up to its reputation.

The place has a "dive" feel, similar to what you'd find at Barrio Café. Thankfully, they're a bit less arrogant about their prices - so the place seems more of an authentic establishment and less like a yuppie playground. However, watching clueless men unknowingly walk in and out of the "Catrinas" restroom always manages to generate some laughs. They've since added a "Women" sign above the door to stop this from happening.

The food at Santisima is very good - although I think my girlfriend is a bit more enthusiastic about it than I am. I don't quite see them as the five-star establishment that so many other people claim, but they're still worthy of a strong recommendation based on the food alone.

Recommended!

Ooooh, more of a 4.5 rating.

So many wonderful things to say about this place. Thank goodness for living social deals that introduce me to new favorites!

Unassuming from outside. It is located in a run down strip mall with limited parking. But once you go through those doors you are transported to a dia de los muertos paradise. Really cool decor with awesome art on the walls. Love the bathroom doors!

Service was warm, informative, and attentive. 

Salsa bar. Wow, what can I say? I consider myself an expert on Mexican food, as a Mexican-American myself and a native of Arizona. But I have never seen these sort of salsas in my life! Peanut salsa? Strawberry salsa? Yum. 

My husband had the dogfish shark taco dinner and I had the veggie taco dinner. Yummmmm. Hubby loved his tacos and I had the BEST veggie tacos of my life. The cheese in the tacos is delicious. The beans and rice were great too. 

I had their house margarita which was so different and refreshing. It had a hint of grapefruit juice which I loved.

My only (very minor) complaints? They charge for chips. Only a couple bucks but I wish I was warned before I saw it on the receipt. 

Also, I saw a tiny bit of unidentifiable meat in my taco. It must have gotten mixed in accidentally on the grill. Hey, it happens, but it can really unnerve a vegetarian.

Love this place. We will definitely be back, preferably during happy hour when I can knock back a couple of their margaritas at a discounted price. :)

I have been waiting to write this review until I was really inspired, because I wanted to do this place justice. 

Sitting at a coffee shop, a little wired, listening to some amazing Explosions in the Sky in my headphones, I finally feel I'm ready. 

The bad: North of McDowell. I mean, this place is supa close to me, so I'm happy, but I really wish this place had a sexy downtown location because it is so freaking good it would blow up if more people were near it. I feel the location, although keeps it a hidden gem, also repells people from going, although let me be the one to tell you, it shouldn't! You NEED to go here if you are chippy and salsa person. Bottom line. Not optional. The absolute BEST in Phoenix metro ever. If you disagree, hit me up and I will pay for your meal. I'm not kidding. I believe in it that much. 

The good: The Salsa bar. Jesus Christ himself would call this Salsa bar a miracle. From reds, to greens, to peanut, to hot, to mild, chunky and smooth they have everything, hand made from scratch and incredible. The flavors actually rotate so some times you'll go and get a new treat to try. Most of them are inspired by regions of the world and have salsa flares about them. I can't stop, thinking about it now. I may leave this coffee shop and go there for lunch today now... 

The gourmet tacos. Incredible, large chuncks of savor steak, giant shrimp (yah I know that makes no sense), and great corn tortillas make this no flour boy a very very happy camper. 

Obviously you'll need to choose the right salsa to add on top of your already incredibly delicious taco, but choose wisely. The flavors are already perfect. 

I hope this review has done it justice. It's incredible and needs to be in your rotation. Especially if like taking your friends out to new places they have never been before.

Wow.  This is a great spot.  After driving by two times, I finally parked near the party supply company and walked into La Santisima to find a small dining room full of satisfied customers...and a huge salsa bar!

Highlights include the Santisima taco with Oaxaca cheese, and the baja shrimp.

Terrific! We always take out of towners here to have a good experience with great food.
Even our Pennsylvania relatives that think taco bell is exotic have LOVED this place. And those of us that cringe at that comparison love La Santisima as well. The salsa bar has such a great variety of sauces that it alone is worth the trip. The horchata is decent (I've had far better) but every item I've tasted on the menu has been amazing. Pricey - but amazing. Worth the time and money!

First .. $14 for one burrito (smh)

Second .. Had NO clue this place was featured on Food Network / DDD. 

Third .. Gave away the other half (more like 2/3) of my burrito n I hope this was just an off kitchen day

Sooooo being on Food Network elevated my expectations when I saw the sign inside after I ordered .. The salsa bar is definitely nice but means nothing if they're not all on point. I'd rather have 2-4 really good salsas vs 12-14 mediocre ones. Much better tacos, salsas/salsa bars out there (Ta'Carbon or Tacos Sahuaro) than here. The staff is friendly, the space is small but soon expanding I believe. The burro (La Santísima) w arrachera (carne asada) was disappointing; everythg just seemed muddled as far as flavor, it was one note. The spinach came through n the carne was nothing different than what u may find at filibertos. A return is still up in the air.

In a nutshell: After 1 1/2 hr wait we left without other food in our stomachs but chips with salsa!
Place was packed, 2 servers for the whole hungry crowd, our order got misplaced, and with two hungry kids next to me I had to leave to a nearby Subway. I do believe the food a the two sister facilities is great. But the service at this location is close to the worse I've ever experienced. I was happy when I got to know this place had been opened in Glendale, since we just moved to the West Valley, but unfortunately I'm not planning to come back anytime soon.

Horchata was really delicious. Had a bit different taste with strawberries, other fruit and pecans. The salsa bar was fun. We enjoyed the Mexican salsa and chipotle salsa. 

We got the three taco plate with al pastor and pork. The tacos weren't amazing. The other pork was better than al pastor for sure. We also tried the second burrito down on the menu, enchilada style. It was yummy. Would recommend that over the tacos any day.

As the name implies, it's an eatery that specialized in tacos and wide variety of salsas.  Among 5 of us, three ordered tacos and were pleased with the food, and two persons ordered the Quesa: La Condesa Mahi Mahi and Sonora Arrachera Quesa.  The quesa is like a jumbo empanada  made with corn flour dough then deep fried. We ordered it at the waitress recommendation.  I'm sure the soft corn flour dough makes it very hard to stay together during the frying process however the creation is way too doughy and heavy, with little filling. Nobody ordered burritos. If we come back again, I'd definitely recommend my friends/family to stay with the tacos.

La Santisima is wonderful, one of my favorite local Mexican spots. The menu is unique (not your standard taco and burrito place) and they are cognizant of both vegan and gluten-free diets. 

The best part is the salsa bar! They have several typical salsas, but they also have several unique salsas (strawberry is the best) and sampling each is part of the experience.

My favorite menu item are the quesas, it's like a fried corn quesadilla, but better. 

It gets busy during dinner time, so plan accordingly!
If you're in the area and are looking for a refreshing drink this place is a must. Literally the best horchata I've ever had!

One of my favorite taco spots . Huge variety of tacos from shark to filet mignon. Love that they always have so many salsas to choose from . They have created a small but comfortable environment . Service is decent and the wait times are usually pretty long. Overall really good Mexican food would recommend .
Mole sauce and strawberry salsa! Show up early or come ready to wait. I will definitely come back next time I'm in the area.

Was staying downtown Phoenix so grabbed hotel bike.. easy ride.  Once "we" figured where to lock the bike all was great. The decor is nothing fancy but for me that added to its credibility.  Staff was friendly n helpful w my menu Qs.  The chips were served w/o salsa as I was informed "the 12 variety salsa bar is in next room, help yourself...".  I order a burrito 1 of 3 the staff recommended.  I got thru half.  Food was hot n very flavorful.  Seemed a favorite of locals as guests were plentiful.  Went to another yelp Mexican establishment earlier in week n while it was fine, Santi's was excellent.  Still trying to see if have time to stop for a go meal on way to airport.   For this guy on a Thursday it was a 5* !!!  Well done.

Saw this restaurant on diners, drive-ins and dives and am so glad we stopped here! We are in town for 2 days from Miami, on our way to Sedona! Service is amazing, food is OUT OF THIS WORLD!!! Great place! Horchata is the best I've ever had!

How can I not like this place? It has my name written all over it!

I came here on a Saturday night to sample this popular gourmet taco shop. I stepped into the dark interior which had a Day of the Dead décor and filled with ten tables for hungry diners.

The menu is divided into five sections:

Gourmet Tacos or Gourmet Taquetzin
Street Tacos
Gourmet Burros or Cazuela Bowl 
Gourmet Corn - Quesadillas
Lonches

I ordered the Al Pastor Burro (spicy pork, salsa, pineapple, veggies) $9 and Daniel got the Tlaloc Vegan Burro (mesquite grilled cactus, caramelize onion, veggies and cheese) $9. Both of them did not have rice or beans inside (a.k.a. fillers) and still kept it hardy but not overstuffed. My Al Pastor had the spiciness and sweetness which you typically find but what made this burro special, was it was grilled on the top and bottom and the fillings were made from high quality ingredients. And for you cheese lovers, you won't find it inside but I'm sure you can request it. The burro was a healthy alternative and the cactus had a nice texture. My only complaint was it needed additional salsa to add to the flavor. Be warned ... take a Beano before this meal!

All meals came with a basket of tortilla chips and unlimited trips to the salsa bar which had at least ten different types of homemade salsa to experiment. Most of them had a kick of spice to it and you can pick from chunky vs. smooth salsas. My favorite was mixing the Salsa Mexicana and Avocado Salsa. Talk about double dippin'! The Salsa Chipotle was also another favorite for us.

Personally, the lighting was a little darker than I preferred during dinner. I wouldn't call it romantic but rather adventurous!

Since it was a busy night, the two servers were on their toes and the wait for the food was reasonable. They had an extensive cocktail list with many of the diners enjoying their margaritas and homemade horchatas. 

I hope to return to try the mole street tacos and say I ate at "Santisima"!

The Guisados of Phoenix. 

Order the smoked Marlin tacos they are amazing. You will easily forget that you are eating fish. 

The salsa bar selection can be a bit overwhelming. You want to try everything but at the same time are afraid to because you don't want to make the wrong taco salsa combination. Ahh the paradox of choice. 

Horchata lovers will be enticed to order the house Horchata which goes for $3.99. The specialness of that drink all float on top in the form of pecans, diced cantaloupe, and strawberries. A girl walked in solely to order the Horchata to go.

My son recommended this place, I didn't know what to order, and asked the cashier for suggestions, he said they are well known with burrito and enchilada styles, we ordered a pork and steak, total is $40 for 2 burritos, If it tasted good then i would not mind to pay for the price, BUT It tasted bland, I could get more than 2 burritos and tasted 100% better than this,

Great food and salsa bar. Personally, I love the strawberry, 7 chiles, & Mexicana salsa. I had the crane asada (ok) and Mayan Cochinita Pibil Tacos (very flavorful!) combo with rice (mixed with corn - soft and yummy!). My friend order the burro with beef and chimicuri sauce which was soooo delicious. Prices are reasonable $10/plate.
The guacamole and the salsa bar are enough to make you happy. The tacos were hit and miss.

I'm a taco snob. These tacos were fantastic! The quesadillas are unique - something between a quesadilla and a tamale - and also fantastic. All the food and salsas in the salsa bar were fresh, and the service was great. I wish they would open a restaurant in my home town.

Fantastic yelp recommendation! I took my husband here for lunch before we flew out of Phoenix. This place gets packed for lunch and it maybe hard to find a table! No place to just wait and hangout, unless you want to wait outside. But they turnover tables pretty quickly. Best thing about this place was the salsa bar--so many varieties. My favorite tacos were the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Tacos...hands down!

This is a place where the hype exceeds the capability of the restaurant. 

There's nothing wrong with this place. It's just not exceptional, great or even noteworthy. 

When you throw in their exorbitant prices of 3.99 for a single taco, you realize that you're getting hosed. 

The salsa bar itself is good. The serving cups are too small so as to adequately support the dipping of the chip. Speaking of which, the chips are too thin and cold. 

The food itself is good quality. The shark taco was crunchy and tasty, the pork shoulder taco interesting and flavorful. Sadly neither was worth the 4 buck price.

Bomb.com
You're missing out if you don't eat here. Best taco I've had. Big portions and to die for salsa bar. I still think about these tacos, would definitely come back here if I'm back in the area.

Overall great food with a good selection of items. Both tacos I ordered were very good and extremely fresh. The chips were good and the salsa bar was the best I have seen. 
I would for sure go back and recommend this place to anyone having a taco craving. 
The only negative and reason for 4 stars instead of 5 was that parking was not good and it is a little hard to locate, even though it is right on 16th street.  
Again, overall great food with reasonable prices and makes for a great lunch.
Excellente! The food is amazing, the salsa bar rocks and the service is nice. This is the place to go on 16th Street. Hopefully it's awesomeness and popularity don't ruin it...

Nothing fancy; but tasty tacos. Salsa bar had many choices I have not experienced before. My $5 mango margarita was ok; didn't taste
like mango to me.

Yet another eatery I've put off trying for way too long! With a name that doesn't dissapoint this gourmet taco shop is appealing on the outside, and warm and welcoming on the inside. Seating is tight and scarce, so arrive early and be prepared to make new friends. My favorite part about this place aside from the food, is the salsa bar... who knew that many salsas even existed? I ordered the El Gaucho burro, packed full of marinated steak, then topped with avocado, cucumber, and chimichurri sauce which gave the burrito a crisp flavor. I then proceeded to drench it in chipotle salsa from the salsa bar! The horchata here is to die for, made fresh and topped with walnuts and sliced fruit! For the price, you'll be hardpressed to find an authentic Mexican meal this good anywhere else!

I really like this little place. Great bean & cheese burrito, good molé.  
Salsa bar - exceptional. 

The missing star is due to service. Everyone is really nice, but they just need more staff.

La Santisima is a taco oriented Mexican restaurant located in a blue collar neighborhood of Phoenix, which offers an impressive happy hour menu and a delicious variety of tacos.

I ate dinner at La Santisima on a Thursday. I arrived around five and was seated quickly. I did not receive any service quickly though. The restaurant was clearly understaffed. It took a long time to get a drink, a bowl of chips, and my ultimately my check. It was never clear who my server was either.

The food was excellent, but the service was overwhelmed. I would try La Santisima again, but hopefully the service will be better next time.
Outstanding food.  Very creative and unique ingredients.  Worth the hype.  Would prefer if they had table service during lunch.

Two things you must have: the Cabo shrimp tacos, and the cilantro "salsa" (it's at the salsa bar, but it's dairy-based, creamy, and delicious). I went with a vegan and even they found something to eat that was reaaaaally good (vegetable burrito). Some of the salsas were really spicy, but all of them were awesome. Decor is great (chairs are a little heavy and make a crapton of noise if you move them, but I don't really think that's a dealbreaker, come on now), and yes, it's in a bad area (really guys, let's keep posting about locking our cars. Shouldn't you do that everywhere anyway? Most of the people I know who have had their cars stolen had them stolen from outside their houses, or at work, in BETTER neighborhoods than this. Get. Over. It), but overall it was fantastic, servers were attentive and very nice, and the food was YUM and at a good price.
This place is delicious. Everything tasted fresh, service was great and tons of salsas to choose from. This is my go to spot when I'm near downtown!

Whenever we travel anywhere I use the "TV Foods" app and then cross check places on Yelp to find great places to eat. Well, this place was awesome!!! It's a small neighborhood like place with great food. They have a salsa bar with about 20 kinds to try. My favorites were the mango/strawberry one and a orange colored pecan one (had a nice kick). My wife and I both got gourmet tacos. I can't remember what all ones I had but all were great. Favorite was the battered shrimp one (top left option on that page of menu). The Horchata was the best one I've ever had (so said many others on their reviews). Had real fruit and pecans in it. Must go to this place!!!! We will go again.

Authentic. Original. And a salsa bar that has flavors that put all others to shame. 

Parking is limited and the neighborhood is not the best. Come for lunch on a weekday.

Over hyped I think. To me the tacos actually lacked flavor. Had a combo of 3 different types and thought they were all somewhat bland and lacked real creativity. Basically its taco truck food (not a bad thing) at probably triple the price (a bad thing). Now the salsa bar is awesome and this is where this place shines. Lots of unique flavors and it is clean and well presented. The chef/cook came out to check on orders so i think they care but the price does not justify the food....
Tacos and salsas were good, but the quesadilla we were not fans of.  It was too bland and the deep fried corn shell wasn't that good.

I've never eaten anything at La Santissima that wasn't delicious, and the portions are moderate to large. The salsa bar has some great choices and unique flavors. The prices are very reasonable. If you go early, the wait isn't so bad, but the service once you're seated could be better.

Aargh - the two reasons I come are the two reasons I can't give this place what could be it's due worth.  I came specifically to try their salsas and their horchata.  Unfortunately I never really got to try either b/c they had run out pretty much out of all of it.  Probably a good sign that they are busy and popular but at the same time, a big disappointment.  I tried their two taco plate.  The cochinita pibil and veggie tacos.  Both were ok.  The beans were ok but not nearly as good as America's homemade beans.  The rice was like everyone said - not your typical mexican rice.  Not bad though.  Apparently they were so busy they could barely keep up with "supply".  The salsa bar was pretty dismal.  They had just a little of the cilantro and peanut one.  Horchata was all out.   I'm disappointed that I missed out but at least it's a good sign that they are the place to go.  Will definitely be back to hopefully try again.

TIP: If you are coming at night, be very careful.  It was really dark and there weren't any real lighted signs.  I could barely see it so it's easy to pass it.

This is a solid dive place. Great tacos. Great food all around. Service was good. 

I tried 5 of the gourmet tacos. All were good.  The place is a little dirty, walls and windows but that almost adds to the place. I'll be back for sure. 

The salsa bar is nice. Too many to try on one visit. I like this place.

so lucky to have this place in my neighborhood

amazing menu, helpful staff, salsa variety is the best in phx

Regional Mexican at it's best, with something for everyone, from street tacos to mole. 

Salsa bar has an overwhelming selection of thoughtful and unconventional sauces. Pecan, peanut, sesame, and strawberry to name a few. 

I enjoyed cilantro, avocado, and salsa mexicana. 

Shrimp mole with TOASTED (amazing) cheese for main dish, accompanied by a house margarita. 

Only drawbacks were hours (close at 8) and dimly lit parking around the back. 

The staff was attentive and the music was good - come for an early dinner / late lunch!

Fond memories here at La Santisima. Every single time I come here for their La Santisima veggie taco plate, it feels like a great life decision. These tacos are heavenly with fresh sautéed mushrooms, spinach, zucchini and onions with melted cheese. Then there is the salsa bar with around a dozen house made salsas. They best is the Mexican salsa and the pecan salsa crema. Oh and can't forget about their massive horchata drink they serve with chopped nuts and fruit on top. For those who partake, they have a bar with several tequilas, and probably other things. Small place, but cozy and intimate. Good spot for a casual date night where you can be a cool Phoenician that knows of the perfect spot for dinner. Parking is on 16th street, kind of a weird diagonal situation where you hope you don't get side swiped by traffic... But hey. Totally worth it if you do. These tacos. Yum.

Dear Condesa,
I wish you had a few more vegetarian items, and that you didn't get all persnickety and confusing about the whole torta/lonche thing, because that led me into an ordering error. However, bygones. While I didn't love my veggie lonche, it was obviously very fresh and prepared with care. Also, please refill the salsa bar more frequently so that I won't be tempted to get too much of the really spicy ones and burn the he** out of my mouth. And put more tequila in the (non-happy hour) margaritas. Thank you!
Amalia C.
P.S. Your chairs are too heavy.
P.P.S. In reflection, maybe this was more of a 2-star for me personally but my husband really liked his street al pastor and carne asada taco plato and again, it all seemed fresh. So I bumped you up. You're welcome!
Really delicious tacos, and the salsa bar as about a dozen varieties, all unique and tasty (including strawberry?! Trust me--just try it)... This is a mainstay in the neighborhood for a reason.
Super slow service.  Make sure you don't get the ques and get the burros instead.  We waited for over 30 mins for the food and they messed up one order.  That's a long time for mexican food.

I have never been so disappointed in such a highly rated restaurant. The service and the food was under par, by far. The queso cheese dip is NOT dip, rather just semi-melted shredded cheese burnt onto a plate (for $8). It literally took 15 min for us to get a Dixie size cups of water. Our server 'Ambar' didn't know anything about the restaurant nor how to serve. I asked about margarita specials and she literally said "idk, Thursday's we have specials but idk about today." After finally bringing us our food and water, I asked for silverware and she told me "they're inside by the salsa bar." I've never been to a restaurant where you have to go get your own silverware. The food was under seasoned and chewy. Finally I asked for the manager and Ambar said "she doesn't speak english." I am a server too and I realize every place has bad days, but this experience was unacceptable and I will never be back.

Let me start by raving about the salsa bar!!!!  OMG!!!!  Pecan Salsa, strawberry salsa, YUM!  I had their La Condesa veggie taco...it was delicious.  And we got there around happy hour, so, the cervezas were only $2!  Everything about this place was great...food, drinks, prices, decor.  I'm giving them 4 starts because even though they only had one other couple there, the service was slow!  Speed it up...and you will earn 5 stars!!!  Please don't change the menu.  This is truly gourmet mexican food with a twist.  Gracias!!!!!

I went with a friend over here after work one night on a recommendation. I loved my food it was much bigger than I thought and more gourmet to. I was expecting a little cheese crisp filled with meat, but it was so much more than that. I had a margarita that was really good but I think it was grapefruit all it says on the menu is margarita's but no description of any of them.

The place was very tiny and cramped, but it was colorful in a good way and was not super busy. The service was a little slow and it was our first time so it took a while before they told us you get your sauce's from the little bar.

I will be back in the future, overall it was a good price and taste food.
Fun little restUrant! I like the food. Nice salsa bar!! Try the quesa!!!! I love the arrecha with pabolano peppers!!!!

The salsas in the salsa bar are uncommon and exciting, but satisfying, without filling you up. This is great way to start the meal.

There are many favorite tacos of mine at this place. Cochinita Pibil is a must.

Beer-battered seafood tacos, whatever the kind, are always a success.

Whether you drink booze or not, you will be happy beverage-wise (Horchata with fruit/nuts! Strong Margaritas!)

Go there!

I loved this place!! They have an awesome salsa bar, my favorite was the mexican salsa, it had a nice little kick to it.
The waiter's are so kind and had awesome service. I got the 3 taco plate which comes with rice and beans. And i am not really a bean liking person, but something about their beans had me eating them till gone. Their rice was unique too!! 
I totally see myself coming here again

It's simply delicious, especially if you want a meal. The chips and salsa were delicious and varied from peanut to salsa roja. I recommend Sopa Azteca it has a quick and you can taste the flavors of the broth, the Oaxaca cheese and chip strips topped off with avocado slices. The fish tacos are amazing, as they have a real Baja flavor; topped with mayo, beer battered fish! My fiancé ordered the Sonoran carne azada burrito. The horchata was served with pecans and strawberries (you can opt out of strawberries). The portions were great and therefore we didn't order dessert. Yes the wait is long, however they are waiting on the state to approve a new line of cooks(?) But trust me, it's worth the wait.
I have to say I think this place is over rated.  It's good but I wouldn't say top ten.  If you aren't from the Southwest u won't know the difference tho and it will be a great place.

The menu has lots of variety. As does the salsa bar. I got the street tacos, brisket, al pastor and chicken tinga. All were good. Next time I'll try a burrito. My coworker got a burrito and could only finish half.

Literally,  the BEST burrito we have ever had! The La Santisima burrito with chicken was absolutely incredible. You come for the food, not the service. They are a little slow, but the food is great! Completely worth it ! 

The mushroom quesadilla was also great! 

Small restaurant,  self serve salsa bar. 

10 tables and a bar. 

Highly recommended!

Great mexican place with some amazingly good tasting tacos. love their salsa bar. Love the new expansion they did, as it helped with the wait times. decor is a bit esoteric, but the food is great. can be a bit slow when busy, but worth the wait. Was visiting from Seattle and would surely stop again when in the area. very close to the airport.

The BEST in Phoenix:
Fish tacos (beer battered with cream sauce)
Horchata (contains fresh fruit and pecans, yum!)
Salsa bar (includes peanut and strawberry salsas)

The owner is this cute little lady who is always very nice

I've been here many times. It is one of the best Mexican restaurants in Arizona in my opinion.  

PROS: Delicious, authentic food, fresh ingredients, unique menu options, amazing salsa bar, perhaps the best Horchata in the state, delicious margaritas (and I usually don't like margaritas), good portion sizes for the price, nice atmosphere with the rustic bar, Mexican art, and light background music.
