CONS: The place is very small and definitely gets crowded because the food is so good. When it is busy, the staff have a hard time keeping up so service can be slow and you may even feel like you are being ignored. Parking is the worst.

OVERALL: One of my absolute favorite restaurants. It's a great place to take a friend or someone visiting in town who wants a taste of authentic Mexican food and a high quality restaurant that Phoenix offers.

I come to La Condesa quite often (at least once a month) because it's really close to my house. It's one of those hidden gems along 16th Street and I really wish I could give it five stars but I just can't. Here's my summary of the place:

Good:
-The tacos are delicious! My favorite is the Mayan Pibil taco. 
-The prices are pretty descent.
-The salsa bar is AMAZING! I can't get enough of the pecan salsa. 
-The chips are free and they go fast with such great salsa selections.
-The margaritas are tasty.

Bad:
-The service is really bad. I'm not they type of customer to really care too much about service at a restaurant but it's pretty ridiculous here. I took my bf here the other day and it took about 8 minutes before anyone came to the table to greet us. I would say this was a fluke but, unfortunately, it's happened a few times now. Also, I have had two occasions when they forgot to bring out silverware/napkins. I've had a couple times when they've forgotten to bring out my margarita (they're really good here btw) and one time when they brought it out looking like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for 10 minues (all of the ice was melted). It's really sad how bad the services is because I absolutely LOVE the food/atmosphere.

I guess the bottom line is that La Condesa makes some amazing gourmet tacos and salsa but they fall very short on the service. I'll be back but there are plenty of other places I can go and receive great food AND great service (i.e. Gallo Blanco at the Clarendon Hotel).

VERY small, parking sucks, good food. Nice variety of salsas.
*Don't come on your lunch hour unless you are an executive lunch.

If you don't get the horchata then you are making the biggest mistake of your life.... 

There are something's in life where you overlook the bad because the good outweighs it. Not gonna lie, the location and atmosphere is maybe a 3/5. But Dan says good tacos are always in the most ghetto areas so we had high hopes. The place was full when we arrived and filled with an assortment of people. It was promising. 

This place did not disappoint. I had the sorano arrachero taco plate (or whatever... Something like that) and Dan got the carne asada street tacos. Right when I bit into it I knew..... This was going to be a good meal. Dan is a taco snob and gave the street tacos 10 stars. Very rare. 

My tacos made me forget that our table was wobbly and that it was hard to find this place at night.

Just go and eat the tacos.... Just do it. 


Food 5/5 
Atmosphere 4/5 
Overall 5/5
The salsas are so original and delicious, not to mention the delicious food. Also gluten friendly. :-)
Great atmosphere, phenomenal service and fantastic food. I ordered the baja shark tacos and cabo shrimp tacos. Fresh and very delicious to say the least. A MUST TRY!!

Sunday afternoon and we were starving. We saw the gourmet taco sign so we discussed quickly and did u uturn because curiosity set in.  The place looked like a sticky dive but it was packed and we had to wait 15 minutes which was a sign of YUUMY food so we waited! 

See pictures of  what we ordered.

I love the cucumber in my burrito which you made for a unique taste compare to the normal burrito you get everywhere. I order side of red sauce which was also had an amazing consistency and taste. My guest order ed a shrimp taco which was also yummy. She loved every byte of it (her exact words) so much she had it done before I could eat half my burrito.

Our server Joe was also very pleasant and I enjoyed leaving a nice tip.

Going back for sure!
The salsa bar is delicious and surprising, the place was crowded but service is fast. Plenty of chips to try all the different salsas and the prices are sweet!

Over priced for the food.  I got burro stuff with rice and beans very little meat.  Nothing nice about bitting into a fatty piece of meat. For the price you would think have decent amount of meat.  My husband mexi burro which cost 21.98 enchilada style! Only 4 piece of meat in the burro.  I enjoy horchata I have to say.

First of all, salsa bar is HUGE. So many different types from pico de gallo to spicy chipotle to strawberry salsa. They have at least 10 different types. 

The food was really great! I got the al pastor street tacos plate and the tacos were amazing. The beans were also surprisingly really great as well. The tacos had the perfect amount of sauce, salsa, and spiciness. 

The service here is also really great. It's a small place so the service is very fast. We got seated right away and got chips and drinks out within a couple minutes. The location is a little weird, and it doesn't look like much from the outside but the inside is very well decorated and put together. All in all very nice place, and I would highly recommend to anyone in the Phoenix area! I wish they had one in Tucson as well. If they did I'd be there all the time!
Si! Si! Si! Dieciseis salsas. Tacos sabrosos. El pibil? Increible. Los mejores tacos este lado de la frontera.

Salsa bar is so great, so many selections. Only issue is that if you come towards the end of lunch a lot is empty and both times I've been here I haven't been able to find someone to refill. But the food is really really good and while the prices are a little high, the quality of the food reflects this.
Great food, ambience and service! Can't go wrong with the Al pastor.
Al pastor burrito for the win!!! love the pecan salsa!
If you have an interest in the best tacos in the state, then stop playing games and come to this place. not fancy, not cheap, but worth the time and money. these guys are the real deal
Al Pastor street tacos are where its at!!  Solid margaritas.  Hole in the wall place with a good vibe.

Simply my favorite tacos in Maricopa County. We've sampled several different types and they all were amazing! Great for lunch and we got quick service. They also took our large family group even though the space is limited. You should go.

The horchata is worth the trip alone.
I prefer the central location but this one works for the west side. 
Salsa bar is good - nice roasted chili flavor in the green salsa. 
I like the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco.

This is probably one of the worst Mexican experiences I've had thus far. I hate to say it but I will most likely never come back. I ordered a steak burrito and it tasted like dog food. My friends ordered soft tacos and they were not a fan of their meals either. By the looks of other reviews this place is supposed to be amazing. I would like to give it another shot but I felt sick to my stomach walking out of there after eating and that's saying a lot because I love all types of food. The only reason this is getting 2 stars is because the chips and salsa bar was bomb!!!

Great food, Really bad service!  Best recommendation order to go! 
BTW they charge you the extra chips!

This place is wonderful! The decorations are authentic and neat and the food is delicious. They have a HUGE selection of salsas, I enjoyed their guacamole and peanut salsa. My boyfriend and I ordered yummy Mexican Coke in the bottle, our favorite. I ordered two of their carne asada tacos with pickled onions and chimichurri sauce which came with rice and beans with fresh cheese on top, it was fantastic. My boyfriend got the bullet burro which he absolutely loved. We'll definitely be coming back to try more of their salsas!

Answer the phone. We try repeatedly on several several occasions to phone in an order. Yes we understand the order will take an hour, we account for that but ANSWER the phone. Good gracious how rude and unprofessional, you don't answer the phone because you don't want the business. I've heard you mumble this when I've been here. Disgrace for my neighborhood taco shop. YOU SHOULD BE ASHAMED. Ridiculous 

Update. 7/7/2107
AGAIN and AGAIN
No one answers the phone. You think a recording will pass for not answering. You give your neighborhood a BAD name because you can't properly staff your restaurant. Oh and today's recording says "Happy 4th of July", 3 days later.

5 stars because every time I have been here I have not been disappointed! We always come here after picking up/dropping off at the airport since its ohh ~9 minutes away! Really great spot too if you're coming for lunch. Service is really fast. 

Food taste delicious. Salsa bar is huge! 
Huge fan of the el gaucho and the la santiama tacos. The mahi mahi here is also beyond delicious. I've always found that 2 tacos al la carte is perfectly fulfilling but my brother loves their burritos!
This is the best Mexican food in Phoenix.   Very tasty. I grew up in Tucson  where Mexican is great on every corner. The salsa bar is excellent. The chips were ok. I will return for sure.

Been here a total of 4 times and I want to make it my 5th as soon as I can. So this was easy for me to update my rating from 4 stars to 5 stars!  I still love my tacos but my wife recently had the argentine steak quesadilla and it was amazing!! It was very big..big enough for us to easily share. On our last visit we didn't share but ended up taking the other half home and have an amazing snack!

Overall service isn't the fastest, but I'll wait a little for food so good. Nice local restaurant in Glendale!
Let's eat Mexican. Great place, will come back!
Love this place, the food is simple but delicious. Only reason I'm not giving this a 5 star is the salsa ramekin are way too small, but so good ;) !

Best Hispanic food in phoenix by far. Service is on point. Although there is this one male server that always seems to be in a bad mood. Owner is always nice though. Wide variety of sauces. Chips server before dinner was delicious.

The food here is fantastic! The tacos were fantastic! The salsa was great too. It is a very nice hole in the wall with fab food. 

Special mention goes to the steak verde taco-phenomenal! 

As stated before the service is ok, the neighborhood is rough but the food makes up for it. I'm just not sure id come here after dark.

My husband and I stumbled on this place about a year ago after reading about it in the now defunct Calendar Section of the Arizona Republic.  We have been in love ever since.  I want to try a burro or something else so bad but I cannot tear myself away from the Tacos like a few other Yelpers have experienced, addiction, in a good way.  My husband ordered a quesadilla one time and it was delicious but I need my tacos, the shrimp ones are my faves with the chicken mole coming in second.  Vanessa (I assume this is her name from other reviews) has one of the prettiest smiles I have ever seen!  There must be a hidden Wizard at this Oz- like place, I have not ever seen anyone else except "Vanessa".  Whom ever is behind the curtain is a culinary genius in my book.

THE BEST salsa bar in AZ. Amazing everything else, but the salsa bar alone is worth the price of admission.

Expansive menu, the kind that normally would be cause for concern. Yet, everything on it comes out perfect. 

I love the fried shrimp tacos and the carne sandwich thing [I forget what they call it now but it's NOT a torta]

The horchata is diabetes in a glass and absolutely worth it [share with a friend, or bring your insulin]

Horrible horrible service. Truly ruined my Sunday night dinner. Waited for someone to seat us and nothing. Then we asked to be seated and then waited 14 minutes! When I lost my patience and went to a server and had to ask for service! Unbelievable! Meanwhile the 2 servers were taking their time doing in urgent things like cleaning table instead of attending customers. So disgusted. I will contacting the owner and possibly the health dept!!!

Gourmet Tacos at it's best!  The lovely lady behind the counter was the owner that served us. My friend John and I decided to check this out this evening, and all I can say is it's the bomb! I ordered the deep-fried shrimp quesadilla with ooey-gooey cheese! ( I know it sounds unhealthy, but I had to have it) It was enormous and succulent!   John and I both had the pecan horchata, and it did not disappoint.  We went there around 8:00 pm when it's slow, so our service was stellar. They have a lot of great sounding items on their menu, so I am looking forward to returning.

Excellent salsa bar. There were 14-18 salsas to try. Our favorites were peanut, tomatillo, peppers and onions, roasted red pepper, cilantro. 

I enjoyed the La Santisima Burro with mahi mahi. The salsas were an excellent accompaniment to the burro. 

We will be back soon.
Good Mexican Food,  Long wait but worth it.

This place has become one of my new favorites! On the list of must tries are: fish tacos, salsa bar, and the Horchata (probably the best I've had). This restaurant is small, so if you're coming in a group you will most likely have to wait to get a table. I usually just sit at the bar, order a couple of tacos/rice/beans and then I'm out. Service can be slow at times, but the food always comes out tasty.

We got there...there was a wait...it was so crowded that some people had to stand to eat their food and it was soooo damn worth it.

From the folk Mexican art depicting Santo and Freda Kahlo's uni-brow to the leather and rough wood La Condesa is as much a treat to the eyes as to the nose and mouth.

We are so used to fiery Tex-Mex here in Arizona that it is hard to believe that there is another side to good Mexican food....a delicacy of flavor that counts on subtle textures and refreshing herbs and vegetables to cool our palates and the heat of Southwest days.

I tried every one of the salsas available on Saturday and I can still taste the peanut salsa while I dream of the strawberry salsa (and the cilantro cream salsa and the chipotle...you get the picture).

We split the dogfish and carne asada tacos along with a mahi burrito and were too stuffed to make our way any farther down the menu, guaranteeing we'll be back for more.

Any complaints? Only the smallest of one....I actually prefer water to soft drinks with my meals and appreciate a reasonably sized cup (I promise I won't steal the Coke). I was given an 8oz styro cup filled with ice, necessitating several trips to the counter to ask for more. Totally rediculous since the soft drink dispenser is behind the counter and I couldn't rip them off if I wanted to ;-) ....and yet another styro cup waiting over a thousand years to biodegrade in a landfill.

La Condesa is what a good taqueria should be, just make sure to weedle a paper cup out of the cashier if you quieres agua.

I had to update my review because they have updated their food and service, and they are now back on my list of favorite Mexican restaurants. If you're willing to venture to the vegetarian side the cauliflower tacos are outstanding! Plus the horchata and salsa bar are just as good as Day 1.

If you are a serious taco fan. This is your spot. There's always a wait but that's a good sign. Salsa bar is a highlight too. Cute place & great service. Only downside is that it's in kind of a sketchy neighborhood. Don't let that hold you back though.

This place was a 3 until I ate there again this week....and subsequently had one of the best quesadilla's EVER! I had previously only eaten the cochinita taco which is good, but not out of this world. From now on everything I eat at this place will be in "quesa" form... 

This was unlike any quesadilla I've ever had. The tortilla was thick and crunchy and soft all at the same time and had a taste of sweetness to it. Oh man, Delicioso! The chicken tinga was a perfect compliment as well. 

The salsa bar is kind of BS, as there are only a couple of salsas worth your time. The peanut salsa? Give me a break, terrible! But the mexicana salsa is one of the greatest things ever. 

This is a "fine dining" type Mexican place that will knock your socks off and run you about 10 bucks. Check it out if you're in the area, it is definitely worth your time!

Very, very good "real" Mexican restaurant. This is not in the high-income part of Phoenix, but certainly the area is safe. The restaurant is positioned between a piñata shop & an empty store, but you cannot miss the signage! Everything that our group of five ordered was excellent. I had the chicken quesadilla; it was not like any other quesadilla I have ever had, with the shell a unique experience. Great place for informal dining with a different version of Mexican food.
Excellent menu, chefs, and service ..... just a bit inconsistent sometimes especially at the Glendale store.

This was my second time in and it seems to be pretty authentic. I like the impressive salsa bar as well as the chips. The first time in I tried the tiger shrimp, white fish, and steak street tacos and the second time I had the green chili pork burrito. The shrimp had a bit too much breading on it for me, the fish was fine, the steak was my favorite. The green chili pork burrito was good but not the best I have had by far. My husband tried the al pastor, carne asada, and steak tacos and enjoyed his but was not overwhelmed. The drinks are decent size but overall the food and drinks are pretty pricey. With so many good Mexican restaurants in Central Phoenix, La Santisma would not be my top choice but it would be a good place to bring an out of town guest looking for some authentic Mexican flavors.
Have only been there once but we were impressed. The flavors were rich and delicious and the dishes unique. Looking forward to trying it again!

Excellent food.  Great choice of salsas. Good service.  Can get crowded because it's not the biggest place, but honestly it's not usually a problem to get a table right away if you go right after work and get there between 5-6 p.m., plus then you can take advantage of happy hour. Woot!

This place is really cool and unique. First the salsa bar is insane with like 12 different salsas. From sweet to mild to hot. The food is amazing I told the server that whatever they would order is what I want. I got this quesadilla empanada thing that was out of this world. Very small restaurant and the bar is like 3 seats but loved it.

We waited way too long to check this place out!  I had the Baja Shrimp taco and Fish Taco with rice and beans..... all delicious!   Wifey got the Maztalan taco and we enjoyed sampling almost everything the salsa bar...something for everyone. Will be back soon to try some more!

Some of the best Shrimp tacos I've ever had. Beer battered, everything made fresh. Great authentic Mexican vibe, lot's of Dia De Los Muertos related art throughout. An extensive salsa bar with many clever flavors, many more than most places. Cilantro lime cream sauce, pecan salsa, seven pepper salsa... etc. You get the picture. This place deserves all the hype. Really nice service, very original ideas and flavors like you will taste no where else. Go check this place out for yourself. I personally will now be a regular here.

First time here and it was very good!  The many different salsas at the salsa bar are very good.  My husband had their version of a "torta" I would recommend sticking with the tacos. The steak and white fish tacos are amazing!  

Only bad thing is it not very big and tables are close to each other.  Service was slow but the food made up for that. I would definitely return!

Food was delicious. I got the Argentinian steak burrito and it was really good. The tortilla chips weren't anything special, but I liked the salsa bar. As another reviewer noted, there was a strong smell of sewage coming from the back room which was a turn off. Hopefully they get that fixed.
The Salsa bar is really cool but the food is just OK.  I would recommend going for a snack(chips and salsa) and a couple beers, not dinner.

Is it bad to say the best thing about the restaurant is their Chips & Salsa? Well it's true. The restaurant has a huge salsa bar with about 15 options for salsa; granted I'm a lover of condiments. The actual food I ordered didn't WOW me in the slightest but the chips and salsa are something to write home about! Service was Ok, could be better. I say it's worth a visit so you can judge for yourselves, have some chips and salsa and a nice cold beer at the minimum. ;)

After driving much of the day from being in Grand Canyon and Sedona, our last stop was Phoenix. We were STARVING and tired so we chose this place to eat because of their "reviews". I am sure they have delicious authentic Mexican food but unfortunately we couldn't try it because when we walked in at 9:30pm on Thursday a hostess or who knows who quickly rushed over to us. I thought for a split second she was rushing to greet us instead she said that they were closed ? Google and yelp said they are open until 10pm not to mention their OPEN Sign was on and lighted. She said they close at 9 but their restaurant had customers in there. The worst part was when I walked out I was taking this picture that I have attached and that same girl who ousted us saying they were "closed" came outside and said actually we are open you can come in haha no thanks !

I have been there three times. They have a really interesting menu and a nice salsa bar. Unfortunately, they don't have great service and their food is hit and miss. I had some of the best tacos ever during one visit, but the two subsequent visits were less that good.

Cant believe all the rave reviews on here! If you like to eat dry, chewy tasteless meat in your tacos....this place is for you. If you like to eat with plastic utensils in a dirty restaurant and pay $3 for a coke....this is for you.
If you like grimy walls, dirty floors and a salsa bar with half the choices empty....go for it. The meat in the street tacos were overcooked, chewy and tasteless. The taco meal for $9 came with 2 small tacos, and a thimble full of beans and a similar amount of rice. On a piece of paper in a plastic tray. You have to get your own plastic utensils and napkins...which I dont mind, just not at these prices. The famous salsa bar was half empty and I had to ask for forks as they had run out.
Poor, very poor. Dont waste your money.

This is one of my favorite places for tacos as I have many options as a pescatarian. I have tried the wild white fish, shrimp, and vegeatarian tacos but I noticed they now have a smoked Merlin taco I can't wait to try! The best thing about this spot are the salsas; they are fresh, unique, and so addictive! I love the nopalitos salsa, with red onions, champignon, jalapenos, and cilantro that I can almost eat by itself with a fork. The only thing I don't recommended is the bean and cheese burrito as it is impossible to eat without it ooozing all over the place.

Service was a little slow and the food was good but nothing out of this world I expected more after seeing the show on diners drives and dives. Maybe I didn't order the right thing but compared to my wife's cooking I would rather eat her Mexican food rather than go there again. Maybe if I'm in the area I'll give it another shot but I'm definitely not going out of my way to go there the only thing that was excellent and off the charts was the decorating very awesome
Everything I've had there has been amazing. The Veggie Burro is my favorite. The salsa bar kicks butt and the horchata is the best in town.

Thanks to Yelp I discovered this Amazing  Taco gem on the way to a meeting down town. 
La Condesa has a great salsa bar. The margaritas are tasty too!
Love the selection of tacos on the menu. 
The tacos were so delicious that when I started eating, I texted my husband to go there on his way home from work. Luckily he made it there before I had to take off to my meeting, and agrees, the food is amazing. 
The carnitas is my favorite. 
I cannot wait  to go again.
Awesome food, great atmosphere. Salsa bar is really good. Horchata is a must try. Very well priced. We will be back.

This is our new go-to restaurant for Mexican food. Our group tried 4 of their meals.. We were planning to use the salsa bar for the food we ordered but everything had so much unique flavor that there was no need to add anything else. This is not your typical American version of Mexican food. Everything is fresh, nothing was greasy. We loved it!!

We came here for dinner because of the great reviews and awards. Maybe we caught them on an off night but the food was cold and the pork taco was so tough you could barely chew it. The service was also slow and sporadic. Very disappointed
If "10" were an option, I would have picked that as a rating. This place was off the charts!  Highly recommend the Spicy Margarita. Oh, and bring an appetite.

Came in on a Friday 5-ish for an early dinner with my friends. The place is cute, few tables, it's got a bar and 2 bathrooms. Salsa bar was awesome! There's tons to choose from.. My favorite was the salsa picante, jicama and the cilantro.. Ahhh soo good. I got the fried fish taco plate, the shark taco on the side and I also tried their horchata! The tacos were great! I love the rice it's got flavor to it and the horchata was very delicious! It's got fruit, cinnamon and nuts on top. Ok, so I didn't know it was big! I think the cup was 32oz, it's good for 2-3 people!!! The down side was the service..I don't know if the lady was stressed out because there's a lot of people and there's only 2 of them serving.. But they need to add more server/waiter during peak hours.. The guy was doing 3 jobs, at the bar, cashier and serving as well. I feel bad for them. We were waiting for our food for a long time, probably 30-40mins. When we got out of the restaurant, there was a lot of people waiting.. I will definitely come back again, just not peak hours.

La Santisima's been in my bookmark list for some time. I had heard a lot of good things about it and their menu had some items you don't often see such as cochinita pibil and chile en nogada. We got here around brunch time and I decided on the black mole chilaquiles. I love mole and I also love chilaquiles so the combo sounded perfect. The chilaquiles come with your choice of "traditional vegetable," egg, or options for meat such as chicken. I asked the server what vegetables came with the vegetable chilaquiles but there seemed to be a language barrier; he didn't really understand what I was asking him, only saying yes there are vegetables and when I asked again, that it was a popular choice.

When we arrived we were seated promptly by the hostess but it took quite a bit of time for a server to come over and take our orders. So, we had plenty of time (Plenty....) to take in the atmosphere. I love the Dia de Los Muertos theme of the restaurant and the paintings of la Catrina were stunning. We also indulged in the salsa bar which had a plethora of unique options such as sesame, pecan, and peanut salsa. While I appreciate all the variety, most of the salsas to me were just so-so. Either they were too one-dimensional in taste or had an overpowering flavor that was a turn off for me. My favorite of all the ones I tried was the pecan salsa. I normally don't like creamy salsas but I liked the nuanced, nutty flavor combined with rich smooth creaminess. One suggestion would be to list the heat level for all the salsas since some were a lot hotter than others (I think the peanut was the most spicy of the bunch I tried).

Getting our dishes also took quite a bit of time. There was only one other table (A 4-top) that had ordered ahead of us and our meals weren't really that complicated to make. When I received my dish, it looked nice but when I looked at the ingredients I thought, "This is it?" It was a handful of chips, a ton of mole sauce, a small sprinkling of melted cheese and a small portion of black beans. As for the "traditional vegetables", I received a laughable amount of the tiniest pieces of avocado (2 pieces not quite the size of a pinkie finger), and about 4 slivers of red onion. Are they really hurting for money that much they can't spare me more onion at least? Or at least a regular sized piece of avocado? If I had known there was so little in this dish I might have spruced it up by upgrading to adding an egg or chicken. The taste itself was OK. I did enjoy the complex flavors of the mole sauce and the chips tasted good but after a while the dish really needed some extra forms of vegetable (Or bigger portions of them) to balance out all the deep, earthier flavors. The chilaquiles came with 2 buttered slices of baguette which I thought was weird. I've never had crusty bread with chilaquiles before. They tasted good at least.

I did take a bite of another breakfast dish, one with chorizo, hash browns, beans and egg. That one was a huge portion and a lot better.

While I did enjoy the ambiance, my dish was not worth the amount of money I paid for it. Add to that the painfully slow service when it wasn't even that busy I would probably visit another Mexican restaurant in this area over this one.

I saw this on an episode of Diners, Drive thrus, and Dives. The seating and parking are very limited, but we were lucky enough to find a table big enough for the four of us. Our order did take much longer than expected because they were out of tortillas for an enchilada my wife ordered - so they made it from scratch. When it arrived it was magnificent. I ordered three tacos including a Oaxaca Black Mole Taco. That was one of the most incredible tacos I have ever had. I have had mole before and wasn't a big fan, but this was fantastic. The salsa bar was good, the chips and salsa excellent, and the horchata was the best I have ever had. I would certainly go here every opportunity I had.
Love this place- only wish we didn't have to wait outside to get in!! That beau g said it's worth the wait!  We got tacos but saw some quesadillas that looked amazing- next time!

Yes, my 3 year old spilled salsa not once not twice but 3 times. Our sever happily cleaned it up all 3 times. 

Probably only 1 or 2 salsas that are mild enough for kids. Ours enjoyed the cliantro one and the Pico de gallo. She tried a few others but immediately downed water and her face turned a little red. She may have grown a little hair on her chest. Our favorite salsas were the peanut and guacamole. 

I had the street tacos. Carne Asada taco was on point. Ranking the 3 I had
1. Carne Asada
2. Al Pastor
3. Chicken

Wish I could tell you about the rice but the girl ate it all, so if she ate it I'm sure you will enjoy it too. 

Next time I need multiple margaritas. Happy hour, anyone?!?!

I often judge a Mexican food restaurant by the beans, and let's say this comes close to my nanas beans. The rice is good too! Simple white rice with lime, cilantro and green chili. The tacos where good and full of flavor but the michada toped it off! Probably one of the best I've had; and I make my own. 

The only issue is it's small so you might have to wait to get a table. But it's well worth it!

I was so excited to try this place. Heard great things, however I was so disappointed. The food was ok. I tried 3 different Tacos and the el pastor had a good flavor the meat on the other hand was chewy and didn't taste like pork. Salsa bar had many choices but no flavor at all. This place feels very neglected and dirty. Won't be returning

Wow. Incredible menu of unique tacos and excellent margaritas. One extra secret - a wide array of unique salsa choices to boot!  A no frills environment where you really feel you are in a local's place. Fantastic!!

Great place!!! Service was excellent getting seated took a little longer then I liked but well worth the little wait. I recommend trying the 3 taco platter for first time this way you can try a little of everything. But Mole was definitely my favorite.

Food was excellent, salsa bar was amazing.  The neighborhood is a little sketchy,  I was approached for money by a small family.  Still worth the trip. The art on the wall is definitely worth a visit.

Just really good salsa's and Tacos!!  Just had a late lunch with the wife...had the fish tacos plate and the pork tacos plate accompanied by housemade horchata...both tacos were really good...especially liked the salsa to accompany the pork tacos.  The beans and rice were good. The horchata had fresh strawberries and nuts in it, tasted like they had  just made it!   Salsa bar has a really good selection..especially like the avacado and the tomato chipotle.  Will be back for more and try their queso's or a burrito.
Best Salsa bar in the valley!  Very creative and delicious.  Just thinking about you guys makes my mouth water.

I love the food at santisima.  the salads are much larger than necessary but very tasty and fresh. I usually order them to go while at work. It could easily be shared with two people. 
Another favorite is the Mayan cochinita pibil tacos.  They're not the mini tacos that you find at so many restaurants these days; they're hearty and filling and greasy AF, but also they are what really brings me back. 
Their margaritas are really good and they have several different types to choose from. One common thing I have noticed is that there are not enough servers for the amount of tables and people that are there. I guess what I am saying is that you might only get one margarita, so make it last.

Sorry, Phoenix location...after all was weighed out and a huge discussion...Glendale puts the boot on and knows what to do with it. I think this one converted most of that boot into real estate for Mother Goose. UGH...the parking is terr-id, the food is above phenomenal and the service sucks....what to do. Geez, I mean I HATE to do this to such a quality food place but everything was so frustrating about this morning. We pull up, no parking...end up putting my boyfriends MLC car on the street...gasp, its next to a homeless pretty sure 2 brain celled and sucking on Tide Pods dilapidated shirtless, shoeless walk of life. No good. The service, seriously I can't say much because  it did not exist. I actually got up and went to bar to locate how we were going to wet our whistle...the salsa is beyond the best, the meat, the marinades and the quality is above and beyond the absolute best! Best pibil I have ever enjoyed and the tinga is amazing...seriously GLENDALE, GO.  I just hate the parking, lack of service and the cramped restaurant with a bar that has no bar stools and ...oh wait I got it!!! the server and the parking spaces are the same...they don't exist....damn.

This place is AMAZING!!!! The food, service, salsa bar and atmosphere are all excellent. The Conchitna Pibil tacos are the best thing ever. My family loves the Mole! I have also had the Mahi Mahi tacos, they are great too. I have not been to the original location but nothing about this location sells you short. 

The strawberry salsa is surprisingly great. I fact, all of the salsas were. There is so many its unreal! I had a house margarita, it was great too. I have nothing but great things to say about this awesome establishment. I have now been back 3 times since my first visit and have not been let down.

PS....the beans and rice are authentic and extremely great too :)

It is interesting that the bust of a tattooed woman above this restaurant specializing in tacos should have such a strong Aztec feel to it since, according to Wikipedia the Spanish conquistadors were the first Europeans to enjoy tacos and incidentally wiped out the Aztecs. I guess that means cultures may come and go but tacos, they are forever, and thank goodness because this place, one heck of an bargain for such a great foodie experience.

The restaurant, if you don't know what you are looking for, can be easy to drive past so have you smartphone out with the map function on Yelp to make sure you don't miss it. Once I arrived, as it was just me, I sat at the bar instead of taking up a whole table. After ordering my drink, which comes in a take-out cup (and I ordered iced-tea, not the famous Horchata which seems well worth trying) you get a basket of tips and then you can go hit the salsa bar which has at least a dozen different types of salsa. I was partial to the peanut salsa, sort of feels like a Thai/Mexico crossover though the pecan salsa, which creamy, was somewhat bland.  I did especially like the 7 pepper salsa, a mix of roasted green peppers, slivers of garlic and olive oil, from what I could tell and their more traditional red salsas seemed quite good.

I had the two taco special, which is about $10 and comes with a small side order of rice (fluffy white rice with corn in it, nothing special) and a small container of re-fried pinto beans, also nothing special but they look nice on the taco plate. For the two tacos I ordered, and this is a mouthful, the "Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco" and some sort of grilled steak taco..both came made with two corn tortillas instead of one and the nice thing, they were not overly soft but had a dry feel to them that kept them from getting soggy from any juices from the taco fillings.

The grilled steak taco had some sort of lime based topping that was really good and both tacos were quite substantive. The Cochinita taco was made with pork shoulder roasted with some sort of red spice and what tasted like orange juice and topped with pickled onion and it was also quite delicious. I did like adding some spicy salsa to that one to kick up the heat a bit.

The menu online is rather limited compared to what they offer now but for a meal that was $13 with a drink and tax, it was a great food experience. If this place was up in Scottsdale instead off of McDowell and 16th St (by the way, easy to get there on the 202, just get off on 24th, go to McDowell, drive to 16th Street and turn. I plan to take some co-workers from the office here next Friday so I can share the experience.

Oh, by the way, found t his place because it was listed as one of the best new 25 restaurants in Phoenix in Phoenix magazine, and they were spot on. Next time I have to try the Horchata which is enhanced with pecans and fresh fruit. Bottom line, worth you time to go here! :-)

Bit of an add on - went back this Friday and boy, even at about 11:30 it was packed. I tried the Horchata this time and the best I've had - I like the pieces of pecan and diced fruit they mix in with it. I also had the steak taco, I guess it is the Condessa taco, that has the spice and olive oil mix on it and it was wonderful, especially with the oil based salsa that tastes like it is made with oil, dried crushed papers and salt, excellent, and I also ordered the grilled squash which, while not amazing, is a nice addition to the meal. I have decided, now that I've eaten there a second time, that I like the grilled steak tacos but the pulled meat, both the chicken and the pork, nothing special, and the side of rice this time, really clumpy and overly sticky, not like what I had last time so I'll give it four stars but need to do something a bit more special with the rice and beans to get a five.
Love this place for tacos, beer and a huge variety of different salsas! If you're looking for good tacos in Phoenix, you should definitely try La Santisima.

OK so I came here to try the Horchata because I saw all the great reviews on it and I am glad I did because it is AMAZING!!! They put just the right amount of ice in it and the bottom has strawberries and it's mixed with a bunch of other yummy fruits such as mangos (i'm not entirely sure what else quite yet... still in the process of drinking lol) and then it's topped with just the right amount of cinnamon.  The only reason why I only gave them three stars is because I have yet to try the food but I will on my next visit and on top of that I tried to call multiple times to place my order and nobody ever picks up the phone which is a no go for me because I'm always on the run!

Best Mayan Cocinita Pibil this side of the Border!! I've been coming to this place since they served tacos on wax paper in plastic baskets, and though the atmosphere has changed, the food has not. Solid menu, great salsa bar, delicious albeit expensive margaritas, and very friendly staff in a cozy, genuine atmosphere. Be prepared to wait -this place is small, with only a handful of tables, but very worth the wait!
ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!! Everything here is fabulous. The drinks the food and the atmosphere.
Amazing fair with a laid back atmosphere. Love the salsa bar!

We are talking about "one of" the best Mexican restaurants in Phoenix according to the internet, a city with a huge Hispanic population. With high expectations, La Santisima was the first restaurant I visited after I landed.

Saw some reviews saying that the wait is usually insane, so I went for a late lunch at around 2:30pm, and it was pretty empty. There were still parties leaving and coming. The inside has beautiful art, and great Mexican restaurant vibe. My server handed me the menus and came back shortly for my drinks along with some nachos. There was a whole list of margaritas to choose from, so I asked him to bring me the best seller. 

Near the back of the restaurant is a sauce/dip station where you can go customize your own personal dip for nachos according to your preference, or you can get each sauce individually. There were at least 14 different ones to choose from, and I never tried most of them!

Server came back with my margarita, and helped me finalize my main, something that he said he loves as well. That's great, now my expectation is even higher. 

The margarita is B O M B. The first sip made me go whoa and my super cool server chuckled. He came over and told me he has made at least 5 of them today! 

Food came faster than I expected, in under 10 minutes. It looked massive, could probably feed 2. At that point I was close to drooling and the excitement on my face probably gave it away - my server asked if I wanted a picture with the food!! LOL how awesome is that. Took pictures with the food and I dived in. 

First bite and I was in heaven.....

This is what I call perfect Mexican food. The green sauce was perfection, I could literally eat anything with it. Rice and meat were cooked just right, and I ate about a quarter of the food in less than 2 minutes. My server checked up on me while I was in the middle of stuffing my face, and he mentioned that I came on a good day. Usually theres a line up throughout the day.

I was only able to finish half of my food, really want to go back and try the Quesa that my server was raving about!

My daughter took me here after a Cardinals game and it was Great!  It's a small place with lots of character.  The salsa bar is amazing and the food is even better!  It's far from QC where I live but if I'm in Phoenix I'll stop in for lunch or dinner for sure!  Give it a try!

The worst thing about this place is the number of choices.  Well, they also charge for extra chips.  But you shouldn't eat so many chips anyway, save room for their delicious tacos.  The Pibil are great, as are the gaucho tacos. I'll definitely be coming back to try more of their creations.

This place has some great tacos that are on par with some of the best that I've ever had in Mexico. I order a slow roasted pork shoulder taco and the veggie taco. As great as the pork was, the Santisima veggie taco was out of this world. I will probably order one every time I go back. The ambiance and were awesome as well. 5 stars all around!

I love the food here, but service is at best two stars.  The wait staff tends to gather around the bar and chit chat, instead of checking on patrons.  During our last dinner, we were lucky
to get one refill and at no point did the waitress check on us after the food was delivered. I actually had to leave the table and go looking for her so we can get the check.
The kitchen as always is very slow, so plan on waiting for at least 30 min, even if your order is a simple burrito. The guac is very good for the first few bites, but then you discover that the bottom half of your $10 guac is nothing but onions and tomatoes.  So I am paying $10 for a few slivers of cut up avocado and the rest is the free salsa that's sitting on the salsa bar?

Again food is excellent, but they really need to make sure that the rest of the place comes together.  I am willing to drive out here and search for parking, but more visits with bad service and I will not be coming back.

Came here with a party of 10 and had an awesome, awesome meal. The waitress was so on top of things, and made sure that everyone had drinks (relatively) quickly, and always had full water glasses. (I say relatively because one margarita took a while and it took a few tries to get my coke, but again, we were a party of 10, so it wasn't a big deal). 

While we waited for our food, we sampled the salsa bar, which has 16 flavors of salsa. The waitress brought baskets of chips as soon as we sat down. Each one tasted so different, and while we didn't love all of them, we had so much fun sampling and comparing the different flavors. 

I had the fish tacos, which were awesome. Everyone on yelp raves about them, and they were totally right. So flavorful and the tortilla held up well. I also had a quesadilla - most places make their quesadillas with flour tortillas, so I was ecstatic to see that they made theirs with corn (extra points for being gluten-free-friendly!). They let me sub out the pork for the steak, and the quesadilla did not disappoint - stuffed with cheese, steak, and some veggies, this this was awesome. 

Wish I didn't live so far, because I would absolutely become a regular here. 

Good for: cheap dinner, night out with friends, date night, any time you're feeling hungry!

It is in the weirdest area!  But the food, good!  Had the shrimp and carne asada tacos, the beef was a little tough, but the shrimp tacos were yummy!  Best part, eating all the guacamole they had out, yummy!!  It's worth going back ::-)
Their tacos are some of the best I've had.  My wife got the quesadilla which is fried and very big.  Everything was really delicious.

Loved the salsa bar. The food was good. I got the quesadilla and it was delicious. 

However, the customer service was horrible. The server took forever on our order, refilling our drinks, getting our checks etc. The place had flies flying everywhere we had to shoo the flies away from our food. The restaurant was dirty.

This is a cool little place! I thought the day of the dead type decor was cool. I also appreciate their salsa bar! It's a serve yourself and had lots of choices. Free chips were served per usual, and the bar pared with these. The menu is HUGE, lots and lots of choices. It's a little confusing but the server was helpful and could answer all our questions. I ordered a burrito enchilada style. It was good, just too much rice for me. The overall attentiveness of the server held this place back, we were not greeted or served in an acceptable amount of time, and we did not get a single refill. We were a group of about 8, glad there was not automatic large gratuity.

Just left this place. I understand they're busy, but that's what every business tries to achieve right? Because they were busy they gave below subpar service. It was a man and woman working and the woman looked miserable and wasn't exactly polite. The guy was trying his best but service suffered. We were told there was a thirty minutes wait originally, but noticed two spots at the bar open. So we asked if we can sit there and she said let me ask. After walking around for ten minutes, not talking with anyone and seeing that we didn't leave she wiped the bar down and we sat. We got our chips and we grabbed our own salsa. After ten minutes we got water. And that's it. No one offered to take our drink order or food order. A single man sat next to us after us, and a four top behind us. The four top was the last to be seated. Got their order taken first. Then the single man. Never us. They looked at us and it's a tiny restaurant so they saw us. The woman seemed like she didn't want us to eat there because they had a bad rush. Well don't worry we won't come back again. And all the placards for their awards were for another taco shop.

Went to the symphony during the mid part of the day and happened to run into La Condesa based on a Yelp review. This place is very tasty. Their salsas are exceptionally good and a must if you make a visit. Their drinks are good as well. All items served are unique in preparation and taste. We had the taco's gaucho, quesadilla and some orchata. The food was excellent and the service was friendly and attentive. Overall this place great for a mid day lunch of evening meal.

If I happen to be driving on 16th street south of McDowell and want a margarita and some fine Mexican fare, my first choice is Barrio Cafe.  However, when venturing out with my nonalcoholic parents this weekend, I consulted Yelp for some good Mexican food, subscribing to my parents theory that the most authentic Mexican food is in a hole in the wall joint in a scary part of town.  Well, La Condesa is not in an area where I would take an after dark stroll, but it is by no means a hole in the wall!  The restaurant is small, clean, well decorated and most importantly they have a salsa bar filled with amazing salsas, made fresh daily to suit all taste preferences.  

My parents and I had various burritos and the bill was under $20 for the 3 of us.  Mom still hauled away quite the selection of "to go" sauces and the waitress was very polite and didn't even call her cheap (which I of course made sure to do)!

To make the evening even more exciting, I accidentally spilled my water on the floor and knocked a painting off the wall when I stood up to leave.   I will return to this restaurant not only because i feel guilty that the restaurant lost revenue by us dining there, both through extra takeout and damage, but the food was also excellent!

The best tacos, hands down. Comfort food: beans & rice are just as great. Salsa bar is unique and amazing. Kinda steps out of the traditional taco scene, but great food none the less. On the downside: small dining area, spotty service, lighting is a little off. Overall this is a must-try.
Wanted to try this place out after driving past it so many times. Good food, and atmosphere. Service was extremely slow. I enjoyed my experience but probably won't be back.

Great food. Tiny hole in the wall. We went for our first time on a Sunday about 430pm. Didn't think it would be busy since it was a little to early for dinner and late for lunch but we're we wrong. Had to wait only a minute or so for someone to leave and a table to open up but this place had people coming in non stop. My wife and I split 6 different tacos that the waiter recommended. All very good. Favorite two were the steak called something else and the shrimp. Those two were unbelievably good. Steak was super tender and shrimp tasted very fresh. Very well seasoned. The other tacos we tried were all good too but not as good as the two listed above iny my opinion. We both also had their house Margarita which was fantastic. Definately will come back. My new favorite mexican place for tacos.

I came here because my coworkers were all talking about how good this place was. I also heard that they had shark tacos that my bf really wanted to try. The place is super small and kind of divey. They have a salsa bar for you to enjoy when you first sit down. The strawberry salsa was my favorite. Sweet but a little bit spicy. They definitely get you on the chips though because there are no free refills like most other places. Another basket of chips is almost $3. I got the chicken mole quesadilla. Their quesadillas are definitely not like your typical quesadilla. It's almost like a deep fried calzone. The portion is huge though, I could only eat half of it. My bf got one shark taco to try and it was kind of disappointing. It tasted like cod and there wasn't very much flavoring. The taco just came with a tiny bit of lettuce and some green sauce. We got the guacamole and it was delicious. They put raisins and some other fruit in it. At first it sounds strange but trust me, it's so good. Wish we saved some chips to eat with it since we ate most of it with the salsa. The service is friendly and the food came out pretty quick. I'm glad we tried it out but don't know if I would be dying to go back.

Gonna keep it short(ish) and simple today.  Arrived at 6PM on a Sunday, and to say that parking is extremely limited is an understatement.  The restaurant itself is small, which explains why there weren't too many parking spots.  It was a 45 minute wait for a table for two so we ordered takeout instead.  A little crammed and loud with people talking over one another, but it was actually pretty cozy.  The staff were really nice, pleasant, and efficient even with the crowd and gave us little lids for the salsa, along with our horchata, after we placed our order.

Fast forward through standing around awkwardly in what felt like everyone's way for 20 minutes in the restaurant, we had our burros in hand - an Al Pastor burro and La Santisima burro (chicken).  The burros are pretty sizable and scrumptious.  The salsa bar is probably what sets this place apart from the rest.  It's fun and most of them have a little kick to it, so have a glass of water nearby.  I loved their horchata, it's a little sweeter than other horchatas, has more cinnamon, and the fruits (strawberries) are a great touch.  Definitely will be back, probably for takeout.

Nice, small restaurant and good music as well.  I showed up on Tuesday around 4:00 PM.  Only 3 tables occupied, had to wait for service for at least 5 minutes and of course, when dining alone, 5 min seems like 10.   I ordered the 3 street taco plate with chicken asado, al pastor and the Mexico City Taco (can't remember the name).  They were tasty, but truly uneventful.  Ive had better flavor from a roach coach and I am a street taco lover!!!  The chips were good and the salsa bar had a wide range of salsas to choose from and all were delicious and tried 6 of them.  On a side note, the chair was old and ripped my pants!!!  Oh well, shit happens.  All in all, it was good, not great.  I would have hoped for more timely, enthusiastic greeting.  I rate it as "average"

La Santisma has some loft reviews and on top of that it has been visited by Guy Fieri.  You probably already know that if you're reading this review.  Those two items equate to a chance for a letdown of epic proportions.  I'm happy to report this place lived up to the hype and then some.

It is really small in terms of dining space, so arrive early or be prepared to wait.  Also straddling up to the bar is a good strategy to get seated as well.

The salsa selection is extraordinary - I think there were 10 or so different offerings ranging from pico to sesame.  If you're a lover of all things fire, definitely go for their hotter sauces but beware as these pack a punch.  

The menu is loaded with tacos - this is Santisma's speciality.  Very vegetarian friendly but it also has choices if you're feeling like more of a carnivore.  I went with the fried avocado, cactus and la santisma tacos - all were awesome.  These things are big and they come double wrapped in tortillas so definitely keep that in mind.

Santisma also has a wide variety of margaritas available and to top it off - free chips (first serving).  Go!  This place is legit!

Delicious, authentic Mexican food with the most amazing salsa bar! We were a very large party and they weren't prepared for us, but they did their very best to accommodate our group! Food was very good and they served a great margarita. Very reasonable

Hello this was rated Top Mexican by Guy F. Need I say more. It's got a feeling not vibe with a traditional Mexican menus. If you like the day of the dead - the s place is all about that and what drew my husband and I to this place. The strawberry Mango Salsa is so addictive! They have about 10 different salsas to choose from - you can't go wrong. 
Tacos are awesome - burritos are big enough for 2 hungry people!

La Condessa is muy Bueno in many ways. The tacos are always fresh, from shark to carne asada you really can't go wrong. (Although I heard it is bad karma to eat shark).

They carry Mexican beers that I have never heard of before, last time I had an Estrella and it was delicious. They have a full bar with tons of exotic tequilas and they are generous on the pours.

The servers are attentive and sweet and the set up is old style cool. 

What really keeps me coming back is the salsa bar (oh the salsa bar)! Pecan salsa, 7 pepper, chipotle, sesame... They carry over a dozen and you will have to come many times to experience the perfect salsa/taco combination. It is worth every delectable trip!

Not a fan. We waited 15 minutes for a table when the place was practically empty. They sat us next to the hot window (triple-digit hot day) when there was plenty of open tables all over the restaurant. The guacamole was weird (cranberries in guac?) and I hate those salsa bars that give you those tiny plastic containers that are too small for you to dip your chips into. The margaritas and tacos were good though. Just a warning...don't get the three taco plate...it's too much food. One taco was enough with the beans and rice.

My friend raved about it so I thought I'd try it. First off, the place is SMALL. luckily we got there right when they opened. Seemed like as soon as we got seated, the place started to fill up. I enjoyed the salsa bar and the different assortment of salsas. As for my actual food. I didn't care for it much. To me, it didn't have much of a flavor to it unless it was drowned in the salsa from the salsa bar. Was going to order a strawberry horchata to go but every time we asked for something, the waitress took a while to come back (she only came back in a hurry when it was time to pick up the money), so I said forget it. I won't be back but at least I can say I went.
Waited 20 mim, to get water and no service.  Its ok your not the only place that serves Mexican

Wow!! The place does not lie! The name says it all - gourmet tacos!! 

Upon arrival, I noticed the authentic touch with the outside doors - 3 to be exact. Check out the pics! Then coming inside, I see vibrant colors with matching works of art affixed on the walls. A patio is also available if you're looking to soak in some sunshine. 

Once seated, we got a basket of warm chips. They have an amazing salsa bar with a variety of flavors to try. Some of the ones we tried were the: pecan, cilantro, La Santisima salsa, chipotle, radish of some sort, guacamole, and more. So fun to try different spicy kick flavors!

Today I tried the Aztec Tinga taco (a Mexico City specialty), which is shredded chicken with tomato, onion, and Aztec chipotle salsa. It's got a little spice, but balances out with the double corn tortilla. This taco was meaty and juicy! 

The other one I tried was the Mayan Cochinita Pibil taco - a Yucatan speciality! This was a true fork tender pork shoulder with achiote rojo topped with lime marinated onions and salsa Habanera Maya.  Lots of meat!! Love! 

I also had the chance to try the La Santisima special taco with chicken and cheese and a steak filled taco. Both were amazing as well. Each of these were ordered a la carte ($4-$5 each). If you order 2 of the same, you get it with a side of rice and beans. The beans have a bit of spice and the rice included kernels of corn. Yummy! 

Finally, I ordered their version of a horchata. It is unlike any other horchata I've tried! It's my first one that included fruits and pecans! Quite unique and refreshing! 

I'm looking forward to trying the other gourmet tacos and hopefully will make room for the flan!!

Their food is good, the low rating is for their customer service. The waiter is rude and inattentive. He completely forgot about my friends drink. The lady who brought out the food realized she didn't have a drink so she brought her one. Not returning - not worth the experience.

I mean, it's whatever. At 1500 reviews, who cares at this point. 

We're never in the area and decided to stop in for lunch this past Saturday afternoon. Bad choice. We were completely underwhelmed.

Pros:

Food. The salsas were great (our chips were stale though...), the tacos were outstanding. I had a chicken tinga taco (so juicy and topped with my favorite: picked red onion), a steak/veggie taco (topped with some sort of fried cheese...HELLO!) and a battered fish taco. I finished most of it, but I should have stopped way earlier. #fatpants

Cons:

Literally everything else. They were clearly understaffed (which by reading the reviews...is a trend? What?) and kept a wait, even though tons of tables were empty during our meal. 

Bussing: We finished our chips and I piled the empty salsa ramekins, used napkins, etc. and pushed it to the side of our tiny table. You'd think our server would remove it when she set our plates down. Nope. WTF? I had to flag down a bus boy to put in his tub. Our table was so small and we needed the real estate to eat comfortably. When we were clearly done and asked for our check, she still didn't bother to pick up our plates and clear the table.

Wait: I get it. I worked in the service industry for way too long. I do understand. However, I've never been so close to walking out of a restaurant before. It took about 40 minutes for us to get our lunch. Our server walked by and told us "Oh, your food is about to come out." That was the midway point, as we waited about 20 more minutes. Why would she just say that to us when it wasn't clearly ready? It felt like bizarro-world

The dining room was pretty grimy.

Truly, the food was amazing. But, we won't be back.

Hands down best horchata I've had.
Great variety of salsas to choose from.
Good food!

4 stars because the tortillas weren't as good as other places.

I have been here twice now and both visits were great. I love the Salsa Bar they have with fresh homemade salsas. Both visits I ordered Taco plates. I have had the Tinga Chicken and the Carne Asada. The Chicken was much better. I have also had the mahi taco and a shrimp taco. Those were amazing. Their Horchata is delicious as well as their rice and beans that accompany their Taco Plates. I highly recommend this place. I hear their margaritas are great too. I will be back.......many more times.

I went to this place when I was in town visiting friends an I loved it! The tacos were great and the prices were very reasonable but what made this place amazing was the salsa bar that had over 12 varieties that were some of the best salsas I've ever Tasted. I will absolutely go again when I'm back in town.

We had a few hours before heading to the PHX airport so we stopped by La Santisima for lunch. Being Mexican from SoCal I know good tacos. This place does not disappoint, everything we tried was good. Plenty of taco options and an awesome salsa selection (strawberry salsa my favorite). The only disappointment was that they didn't have any horchata when we arrived. Had the following. 
 
- Sonoran Carne Asada Taco
- Aztec Tinga Taco
- La Condesa Veggie Taco
- Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco

I'd definitely go back and recommend it to anyone looking to get a local meal near the airport (about 5 mins away)

A huge fan of tacos!! This place use to be a lot better. However, the service is definitely better now days. The tacos are just so dry.. there was three of us and we tried three different tacos each.. and we all thought the same thing "they were too dry!" I do like the fact that there is a salsa bar! Oh and Mexican coca cola!

Wow...this place really knocked my socks off.  This is exactly what Phoenix needs, a cool place to eat great Sonoran/Mexican food.  The owners sure had a nice vision and succeded in creating a great spot for the neighborhood.

The tacos and quesadilla I've had here was nothing less than spectacular.  Having lots of flavor and not skimping on the portions. The salsa bar is quite fun as well with many different and uniques choices to choose from.  Never seen so many salsas offered anywhere else and I'm sure I will make it through all of them with my many visits to follow.

Keeping the flavor of the area being on the edge of a very artsy neighborhood the decor is amazing.  Vibrant paintings all around and murals on the bathroom doors definitely makes this place stand out with style.

This place is a must see for anyone who likes great food and culture.  Take a deep breath before you walk in and inhale an experience I am sure you will remember.
Best gourmet tacos in Phoenix.  Don't worry, even though the tacos are nice you don't need a tie to dig in!

I was here!  Guy Fieri came earlier than me as well!

The best modern Mexican and first Mexican place we went to in Phoenix.  This place is a hit!

The service was slow and they forgot our drink orders a few times.  But the tequila they suggested was good.

Here comes the most important part.. their food.  We ordered their shark taco to share.  I had their El Gaucho Burro and my wife had their El Gaucho Quesa.  My wife is not a big quesadilla fan, but she liked it and it was so good when I tried it!  Her quesa had the perfect crisp texture to each bite.  My burro was excellent.  Since we both had El Gaucho, the fillings were the same ingredients.  Here's the climax.  They put cucumbers and bell peppers into their El Gaucho Burro and Quesa; that is a genius idea!  Those 2 ingredients brang out the taste of each individual ingredient from our burro and quesa.

Man, it was good!

Prices are good.

They have their own salsa bar.  I recommend their creamy cilantro salsa.  They also have good spicy ones as well.

A chips refill for your chips and salsa will cost you about $2?

Oh yeah, this place is pretty small.  They try to utilize as much as they can.

Very rare you will find Chinese eating Mexican, but I saw a few here.

Got to come here.

I desperately wanted to love this place.  Unfortunately I thought it was just average.  The salsa bar, the unique tacos, etc. all seemed like the right lineup.  Taste is king and I didn't think any of my 4 different tacos was striking.  Not a bad dining experience at all, just not amazing.  

Ambience, service, etc were all great.  Perhaps others will find it more amazing.

Maybe I would try a burrito next time?

We have been to Santisima several times. The food is very good and the salsa bar not only adds, but makes it fun, too. Drinks were tasty, and service is good. One point to improve would be that we almost always have a long wait for our food. Given that it's tiny, there might not be much to do about that...Maybe expand?

This was my second time visiting this location...while the food is good the service absolutely SUCKS! If you bring up your concerns to the waitress it will just be laughed at and disregarded. We sat with empty drinks for over 20m and we're never offered refills  The entire time we were there we only seen the waiter when he placed our order and brought the check.

So good! So good. A must try taco shop if you are in Phoenix. I ordered 3 different tacos and was able to turn them into 6 since they put a lot of fillings and 2 corn tortillas. The mole is so delish and you gotta order this taco. I ordered the steak and it was good too, but my fave...the carnitas taco. The pork is so tender and flavorful! I also love all the salsas! I just wish they didn't run out of some of them...there were so many to choose from it was hard to decide what to try so I relied an a regular to steer me in the right direction. The margarita was ok, but I would definitely go back for the mole and the carnitas!

I don't know why this place has such high reviews. Ate here on the way to the airport. The restaurant including our table was filthy. The whole place seems like it is covered in grime. The food was greasy and lacked flavor. We had horchata, shrimp and mole tacos. Does not live up to the hype. Our waitress was non-existent for most of the meal and the food took forever to come out. I would never eat here again.

Tacos with unique ingredients, salsa bar with endless options. Need I say more? So delicious. Quaint and cute inside. Delicious! And reasonably priced. Two tacos with beans and rice for around $10 and it's plenty of food.

One of many great little Mexican restaurants in the area, this one definitely has the best salsa bar. This provides for amazing combinations on a variety of tacos selections. Great place to drop in for a late lunch or early dinner, when they aren't too busy.

My favorite taco shop! The variety of tacos and salsas make it nearly impossible to choose even one favorite meal. The horchata is great- mixed with fresh fruit and spices...different from how I've previously had the drink, but a happy surprise!

So people rave about their food here. I had the Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco, Cabo Shrimp Taco, Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco and the Santisima taco. They were good. The seafood tacos were basic but good, I wish they put more effort into the slaw they put on them. The other two tacos were shined much more. The big hitter of the meal was actually the salsa. I would come back to this place and just eat salsa and chips it was that good. I had a house margarita and took one sip and non another sip it was gross. Overall stick to the taco, salsa, chips and a beer (don't touch the margarita), stick to that and it will be most likely in your top 10 Mexican restaurants you have ever eaten at.

Vegan post- this place is the ultimate. The salsa bar is on another level, the avocado is my favorite. The quesadillas might be the best meal I've ever had. I got no cheese, add beans to quesadilla. The rice is the best rice I've ever had, easily. The nopales tacos are also amazing.

Vegan: I got the veganized quesadilla based on a few reviews here. They can't add beans inside like somebody mentioned, only on the side (make sure to ask for beans without cheese on top) If you are a "junk vegan" you may be good to go. I personally hardly eat fried things and wanted to make an exception for this. They fry the whole thing so it sits in a layer of oil on the plate and the spinach and mushrooms etc inside are soaked as well - all I tasted was the oil. I have only been vegan for a year so I can imagine this must be really good with the cheese but in vegan you may be better off with a burrito or taco. 
Omni hubby had the tacos and loved them! Salsas are really nice as well, cilantro, pecan and Mexican were really good.
I would go back to try their other stuff!

The best part of this place is the salsa bar and chips!  There were 15 different salsas to try and you can make a meal out of that!  The beef street tacos were yummy along with the rice.  The horchata was very tasty and unique with the fruit!  Go early because there was a line out the door, but it is worth the wait.

I really wanted this place to be good, the reviews certainly make you think its going to be, we went here twice, the first time our food was under whelming and service was ok and the atmosphere was fun.  We always try and give a place two tries before never going back or writing a so so review, so visit two was actually worse than the first visit. Tried various street tacos, no seasoning, meats dried out, and service was so so.  This will not be a place we try a third time, there are to many other great places in Phx.  I wish them luck, I hope it was just two bad days, and we happened to show up both times.

I love their salsa bar , there is a taste for everybody. You should try mole they make , it's excellent. Good portions, I can barely eat half of my burro. Food is just amazing. Very neat small place, one of those places that you should try at least once. Bathrooms is a little bit of an issue , that ladies bathroom door should be fixed , it's little uncomfortable to sit where while someone else can just walk in while you do your business.

My tinga taco was soggy as if they left it there for awhile. The salsa bar was amazing and the customer service was too. The reason why I gave it 3 star is because we were charged gratuity even though it was only 5 of us. The receipt clearly said 6 people or more. My party was going to give her more than the gratuity rate, but because of that, we decided not to give her anything. I shouldn't be asked to give them tips. I want to tip them according to the service.
Stop reading and GO HERE NOW! Best tacos ever. No really, they also have a crazy awesome salsa bar.... SALSA BAR! Why are you still reading? GO!
I enjoyed this place.  Pretty good food and interesting decor.  Not the usual "Mexican" place so come in with an open mind.
Very different from your average Mexican cuisine. Everything we ordered was yummy. Love everything from their house made salsas to their artwork. Thanks for your warm customer service!

The Salsa Bar! Holy moly! I wish I took a picture, it was huge. I was enamored by the strawberry salsa (tried to replicate at home to no avail). The food was served on clay plates, nice touch, and it was pretty tasty. I recommend this place every time someone asks me of a Mexican restaurant that will blow their expectations away. I do warn, there can be extremely long waits, like at least an hour wait if you're lucky....hence my 4 star review. Now I do know that they were working on opening more dining space, but at the time they also lacked staff. I will try out soon to update this review, but overall it is a great experience.

This is the best Mexican food ever. Holy moly. Like, not even a competition after I ate here. The food is unbelievable, authentic, and delicious. The location is a bit sketch, but don't let that deter you! Nice and modern on the inside, and can we talk horchata? We should talk horchata. fresh strawberries IN THE HORCHATA. It was like experiencing your first orgasm. You guys are amazing, keep it up, I will for sure be back many many times.

The sauces.  Wow.  Go here and have some tacos and chips and beer and salsa.   Enjoy.  

Repeat.  The salsas.  Did I mention the salsa bar.  Not like anything else


And order the daring tacos.   Not the stuff you can get anywhere.

-----
Second review eating in

Fantastic.  And all those salsas.  Got the burrito this time and it's just as good.  You really can't go wrong here.

What a cute little place! It's hard to not notice it when driving by :) I had the shark and beer battered fish tacos and they satisfied my craving. First time trying shark though! Love the salsa bar! lots of variety to choose from. Would love to come back and try other options on their menu next time I'm in the area!

I like the Cochinita Pibil the best. Not a fan of the other tacos and I could do without the rice and beans. The horchata is something to write about. I have never had horchata with fresh ingredients...Very Tasty. The server was nice and quick. You have to get your own salsa so stock up. Would love to stop by again!
Well reviewed for good reason. Tons of options and cheap margaritas on Tuesday!  If I lived in Arizona I'd for sure be back.

I'm obsessed with this place's Horchata! The salsa bar is great, the tacos are incredible. I love the cute small atmosphere. Great vibes, great food, what else could you ask for? Definitely going back over and over.
We went based on recommendation and it did not let down.  Great taco place.  Ok I am going to go Spanish on this one.  Delicioso!

Not impressed. We went in around 4pm and there was only one table in there. Exterior was really original and set a good vibe, then we stepped inside and I felt like I was in a tattoo artists bedrooom. 

Took about 5-10 minutes for someone to come out of the kitchen to greet us and seat us which was not a good first impression. The salsa bar had good variety but was set up very poorly. The "togo" salsa containers you use to grab you salsas were so small you couldnt even fit a tortilla chip into it, We had to get a plastic spoon to get our salsa onto our chip because there was no metal utensils on the table. They didnt provide us little plates either so our table was a mess before we even started ordering.

As our tacos hit the table the first thing we noticed where that both mine and my husbands plates had big cracks on them. Flea market much?I got the smoked marlin taco which had the texture of canned tuna fish with a minestrone like vegetable concoction on top and the shrimp tacos, pretty decent. The corn tortillas were pretty flimsy though and resembled the storebought el paso brand.

Service was not the best either, our questions about the tacos were answered with finger pointing at the menu and blank looks like...uhh you dunno what achiote rojo is? 

All in all, the fact that we said we should have gone to chipotle instead says everything.
Amazing margaritas. Very strong. Probably 2-4 shots in each but so smooth you can't taste it. Food was good, nothing too special but decent, as well but best value margaritas I've ever had.

Yes! Yes! Yes! ....
I've been here a few times now and every single time I come I ask myself "now why don't I come here more often?" I do live close by, but then their long line reminds me why lol. 

This place is so freaking delicious! First of all their beans are perfection. And their salsa bar is like its own tasting station lol. 

I've had their bullet burrito, azteca Tinga burrito, shark tacos, shrimp burrito, quesas, guacamole, and their veggie burrito. Everything was great I have no complains. 

If you love horchata you have to try theirs. I promise you will love it! I can go in there for just that a bullet burrito and chips with salsa. LITERALLY.  

It is a very small place so I wouldn't suggest coming during lunch/dinner hours. You will just stand there looking at everyone enjoy their food thinking to yourself "ok can you please hurry and swallow your meal, because it's my turn to sit and swallow mine". Lol 
I usually come here before busy lunch hours and dinner hours so I can get a table asap. 

Customer service is always great. Their menu is to the point, my kind of menu!

I was really excited to go and try La Santisima because i have read great reviews and friends have told me it is amazing. I'm not sure if I had it built it up so high in my head or if it was just meh. I think it was just meh. I ordered the Cabo Shrimp Tacos and they did not have much flavor to them at all. The service is very, very slow so be prepared to spend a lot of time dining here.

Not from around the area and came here based off of the string reviews. Pretty disappointed in the service and quality of food. The tacos were average at best and the drinks were all overpriced. Would not reccoment to others visiting AZ

Absolutely phenomenal. I can't say enough about this GOURMET taco restaurant. Granted, this menu has more than tacos but you need to look no further than those filthy goooooood tacos. I have came here a few time with several different groups, not once did the sitting render tasteless. I've ordered almost every taco and each is extraordinary within itself. I am a Carne Asada enthusiast! With that said this dandy delight of a taco magician has various types of steak cooked various ways, all producing the bountiful bliss of juicy satisfaction. The salsa bar is a blessing in itself, so many varieties you don't run across at any other taco restaurant. The reviews speak for them self... Get here!
