Finally visited La Santisima.  Thought I would really really like the food, but I didn't.  Although I did finish my plate, it wasn't spectacular in any way.

Before I get to what I ordered, let me make note on how important it is for a restaurant to have an eye soothing menu.  The online menu is great, but the restaurant menu is much more extensive than the short list on the website.  

Unfortunately for me, the menu was much too busy.  The colors were awful and I didn't want to look at it for more than two minutes.   Red and black text looked crammed and didn't stand out the way text on a decently designed menu does.  I barely read past the tacos.  

Ordered three tacos a la carte ($3.99 each). The mesquite cactus taco (I can't remember the dish name) with no queso, La Condesa Veggie with no queso, and the fish taco.  Also a side of guac which cost about $4.

Honestly the guac was the most exciting thing on the table. The food was filling but all three tacos needed some DIY spicing.  Ranking:
1. guacamole - made with dried cranberries and mango.  A bit tangier than I prefer, but palatable.
2. spinach taco - wished the spinach was chopped smaller
3. cactus taco - slabs of cactus made my mouth work overtime 
4. fish taco - too much breading on the fish, and just plain cabbage with bland white sauce drizzled on top.  Wish I had asked for no white sauce. 

The salsa bar is okay.  There were only a few salsas that I thought looked appetizing.  Most were watery and needed some DIY mixing of two or three to get a fantastic flavor.  And with the serving cups being so small, I couldn't grab a decent serving of a favorite salsa.  I refilled at the bar three times and then just gave up.

Our server was kindhearted and brought a sample of horchata.  I have tasted something similar to it, but didn't like it.  Sweet drinks with cinnamon flavor aren't my thing.

If I'm in the area and feeling hungry I would go back.  It's a decent restaurant, but not one to where I would plan a night out.

Question: Living in the vast sea of Arizona taco shops, how does one stand out?

Answer: Just do whatever these people are doing.

From scanning the menu, it seems like the concept here is La Santisima wants to give every regional tradition of Mexican cuisine its chance to shine through a specialty taco. They absolutely knock that goal out the park.

I wish I had 4 stomaches so I could have sampled everything. What I did get though has given me reason to go back again and again to accomplish that goal. 

Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco - bomb

Cabo Shrimp Taco - Bomb.

Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco- BOMB! (please order this for yourself)

Excited to try more when I get the shot.

As someone who's travels to Southern California a few times a year, I sort of know my Mexican food especially as it comes to street tacos and such.  I do admit this place has more protein for your tacos than any other Mexican restaurant I've been in.  It can also be overwhelming the number of choices but at $3.99-$6.50 for a single taco, the prices are pretty high so I had some high expectations.  What I can say is that the al pastor tacos were dry, in fact tasted like tree bark in terms of texture.  The braised pork was good though but the tortas were very interesting, it came out on a toasted French baguette.  It was decent but I had to put quite a bit of salsa in it to moisten it up due to it again being very dry.  Imagine dry meat on a toasted French baguette.

What I believe does set this place apart is their amazing salsa bar, it's self serve and unlimited.  You get your first bowl of chips on the house, refills are $2.70.  The other thing that stood out was the horchata, it had fresh ground cinnamon, some oats and bits of strawberries on the bottom.  It was very interesting, but nonetheless, was very good.  We also had a strawberry margarita, tasted more like sugar water with a half shot of a tequila and very very sweet.  I believe the strawberry margarita was $9.00, so it was a little high.  If I ever go back, I think I'll stick with the horchata instead of their margaritas.  

They said an hour wait for two, we waited outside for 30 minutes and was called, so at least that's nice.  A tip is to write your name, party size and phone number on the waiting list, they will call you when your table is ready.  And no waiting inside either, all waiting is outside.

Stopped in for lunch, the incredibly LARGE parking spaces in a small amount of space leads me to believe this place was either small inside or has horrible drivers for customers, once i entered i assume now it is the latter, a spacious dining room, bar, and outdoor seating available.

First off i ordered a horchata, which was the second best i have ever had, they put a good variety of fruits in there that perfectly complemented the flavor.. 

I then ordered some street tacos, and before they came out i walked up to the Salsa Bar.. oh man, i need more than just a spoon for this place, they have every flavor you would expect, and an delicious peanut salsa.. it was soo tasty i don't even know if the tacos themselves were any good, guess i gotta go back!
Awesome street tacos. Best in phoenix and cheap! The place is small but the service and food is amazing. This is my new favorite place for tacos.

Just. Brilliant.  This place puts Barrio Cafe to shame.  There isn't a bad thing on the menu.  The food is amazing, the atmosphere is warm and fun, and the service is spot-on.  Oh, and unlike Barrio, the prices are very reasonable.  

Forget the Barrio Cafe hype, THIS place is "The real deal."
The space is tiny. Like the variety of salsas. BOMB Horchata. Food was good. Would try it again.

What makes this place special is the salsa bar like none other.  Some are good on the complimentary chips; others are good with your order.  It's up to you to find out.  The oversized paintings reminiscent of Kahlo and Rivera adorn the walls.  Frida and Diego also appear in the pictures, and, yes, we're on a first name basis.  The restaurant was just about empty when we entered on a Friday night.  Hopefully, this was because it is new.  Pssst, you're missing out.  I had fish tacos and my Frida had some vegetarian dish.  Both of us were very happy.  They didn't have margaritas, just beer.  But I keep trying to order a margarita every time I go for good measure.

Taco Tuesday !! Omg perfect .. Have the street tacos if you can't decide .. I had the cochinita pibil, al pastor and carne asada.. 

Loaded up at the salsa bar.. They have so many options and all were delicious.. Tried for the first time the strawberry salsa, which I drank like a shooter (yum!) and the jicama salsa was really good, you could eat this like a side salad, nice crunch!! 

Jamaica was served in a huge to go cup.. Thumbs up..

Get here early this place has a small dining area and it fills up fast !! Worth the wait though!!

This was my first time at this location .. it was chosen because of the vegan/ vegetarian options on the menu (and there are lots of items!!) .. truly something on the menu for everyone in the group..

Our drink order was taken care of right away and our food order was placed .. we waited a while for our food .. be prepared for a long wait and they weren't crowded or busy..

The food however when it arrives, is full of flavor and the portions are generous.

On today's visit I had the three taco plate with rice & beans.. the tacos are served with double tortilla, the filling has great flavor (the pickled onion although pretty to look at on top of the tacos did not compliment the tacos, way to acidic).

Try the salsa bar there are plenty of delicious options ..

Omg. Amazing! 
The food here is so rich and filling, i couldnt get it into my mouth fast enough.. i seriously was in heaven.. 

The salsa bar is to die for. All their salsas are amazing. Im a sucker for salsa that has a good garlic taste with a kick. These were perfect for my taste buds. I enjoyed EVERY single one! They are not overly spicey either where you can enjoy your food. Also you get free chips and you bet i got every single salsa to go with my chips and meal!

I ordered the asada street tacos. It came with rice and beans. They were AMAZING. Beans were rich and creamy, rice was salted perfectly. The meat was not fatty at all, which is huge for me because most resturants have such fatty asada. 

The place was decent and extremely clean. Artwork was amazing too. There seemed to only be one waitress in the whole resturant which was fine she was nice and attentive. The place is decently priced and well worth the food if you enjoy mexican. Honestly i wasnt even done with my meal and i was already plotting when to come back and tell everyone how good it was.

It was good but they only serve tacos, quesadillas, and burritos.  I did go with the fish tacos and they were very good.  My son had a steak burrito and was disappointed because it had beans in it.  He  considers beans a cheap filler to provide less meat and he said the beans ruined the flavor in his opinion.

Amazing food! Horrible service. Called in 4x to try to get a pick up order. No answer. Went in and informed the hostess who just brushed it off and handed me a menu. Took them 10 mins to take my order, which I already had in mind since it had be 20 mins after my first phone call which gave me plenty of time to make my food selection. 

After finally taking my order, the gentleman hands me back partial change and tells me that I have to wait for the rest of my change ($5). I was surprised because they were busy and as a professional establishment you should definitely have $5 change readily available. Gentleman said it would be 10-15 mins for my food to be ready. Took them 5 mins to get me the rest of my change. I filled salsas, brung them to my car and went back inside to wait for my food. There were 4 different couples waiting to be seated, looking extremely uncomfortable.  After overhearing one of them ask their partner "Is this a bad joke?" , I asked them how long they had been waiting...20 mins! There were plenty of tables open where these people could have been seated and had drinks at the least.

Finally got my food 35 mins later. If I was the owner, I would fire the hostess. Everyone else seemed to be TRYING to do their job. Seemed as though maybe she was trying to get fired with the way she was treating customers. 

Again; food is amazing...but this is my 3rd bad experience with customer service here.
Always good, always more than satisified! Get there when they open because it can get busy. The new expansion was a great move! Love everything about this place!!

Food was very good, it wasn't what I expected as they use different ingredients together (like pecans in the sangria or cranberries and mango in the guacamole). Everything was fresh and home made. The only thing lacking slightly was the service. They got a few things wrong, took awhile, and was a little slow. But it definitely wouldn't stop me from going back. Menu is very extensive and you can customize.

Really really slow service. The food was good. I recommend the oaxacana mile taco. I don't mind waiting for gourmet tacos (they post blunt signs warning "we're making your gourmet tacos as fast as we can") but I do mind waiting for water.

This place was extremely disappointing! 

After having some amazing fish tacos in SD, I wanted to find something here that would hold me over until my next trip. 
After reading the reviews for this place, I was sure this was going to be my spot. Oh how wrong I was! 

I got the shark and mahi mahi taco special with horchata. My friends got the white fish taco plate with that nasty ass red drink. 

Everything tasted so awful. I didn't even finish one of my tacos because I was so disgusted by it. My friends finished theirs but that's just because they were hungry. Afterwards, we all got sick from the food. 

Yuck, even thinking about it makes me want to vomit.
Was here 2 years ago. They've added a sit down bar. Interesting variety of unique salsa. Small place but not cramped. We all tried different tacos. Was fun .

DELICIOUS tacos and a wide variety of salsa to choose from.  I LOVE the strawberry salsa. Restaurant is very clean. Staff is very friendly . Music is good. I would bring my family and friends  here. Definitely deserves five stars.

AVOID this place is dirty and has a bathroom smell as soon as you walk in... waited to be seated and the server said wait a minute and never approached. Waited 10 minutes- looked at the food and said forget it. Not up to par with the restaurants from Los Angeles at all. If I could give a negative start review I would.
HORRIBLE SERVICE.  The food is good but the terrible service killed it for me.  It appears as though the waiter didn't know the menu very well!  Won't go back!
Fantastic, everything on the menu is great and the decor is very nice. Lots of salsas to choose from.

Amazing Mexican food with a variety of delicious salsas at their salsa bar. Our favorite was the salsa pecan and the tomatillo salsa. Lots of taco options including a yummy veggie one with beer battered avocado. Definitely check this place out.

La Santisima, known in a past life as La Condesa, makes some of the best...THE BEST burritos and salsas in the valley. It looks like fast casual food, but it's a sit down restaurant that costs less than competitors while offering way higher quality eats. 

Like the 15+ varieties of salsa, ranging from a spicy, smoky chipotle to a light, creamy cilantro. Your food is going to take forever, so you might as well enjoy as many as you can. They all come across as very fresh--none of that canned crap. 

My burrito, the Gaucho, was up there with the best I've had. And I've had a LOT of burros. The grilled white cheese, rich steak that had a faint wine flavor, cucumbers, and some peppers. Amazing. Great! The portion was huge as well, and I could barely finish it. I have a HUGE appetite. 

The coolest part was that it was only around $9. That's somewhere between fast-casual and sit-down prices, but with better quality than virtually any Mexican restaurant. For about another $4 you can add some awesome aguas frescas like the horchata, complete with a touch of strawberry. I actually don't like that type of fruit infusion in something I expect to be straight up rice and cinnamon, but I can appreciate the quality ingredients. 

I'm sold on this place, and I definitely recommend you should go, but that doesn't mean I'm going to overlook a few flaws that irk me. The first is that I'm not sure the furniture is either comfortable, tasteful, or clean. The high wooden tables are much obliged for taller patrons like myself, but they were sticky...despite being actively cleaned as we walked in. Gross. The seats are shoddy as well. The airbrush-on-canvas Frida Kahlo paired with the "no no THIS IS HOW MEXICAN FOOD IS DONE WE USE PROPER NAMES" motif on the menu give this a unique, yet eyeroll-worthy vibe I can best describe as try-hard and totally hipster. 

Service is questionable as well. Although I appreciate that everyone who is not American actually takes their time at restaurants, I don't find anything particularly complex that warrants 20+ minutes for a burrito, and tacos/beans/rice for my dining partner. This is on top of the 10+ minutes it took to get a menu. We actually had to get up and grab them ourselves! They were not really paying attention. 

Oh yeah, and then there's the warm tap water. Gross. 

Anyway, Santisima comes across as a place with great cooks that don't know how to run a restaurant. I can't say I enjoyed any aspect of dining in besides salsa sampling, and so I've gotta deduct points even though that was a 5-star burrito. Fortunately, you can avoid these issues by just ordering something to go, which is probably what I'll gladly do when I undoubtedly return.
Authentic tacos. Wonderful flavors, and an awesome salsa bar...what else do you need?

My most absolute favorite place to eat! The chicken quesadilla is my favorite and pairs the best with an ice cold Corona and a handful of different salsas to dip their awesome chips in. I love the cilantro salsa as well as the chipotle, but they are all so amazing! 
The quesadillas are huge and I always have leftovers even though I stuff myself because it's so tasty. 
This place is one you cannot pass up!

Went there with the whole family cause it was nearby. We weren't expecting to walk out so satisfied, especially cause we're all so picky. Highly recommend the quesadillas. They're filled with Oaxaca cheese and flavorful meats/veggies, folded over fresh maza then fried. The salsa bar is colorful, unique, and spicy!!
The salsa bar, the horchata, the veggie burrito, the fish burrito... SO GOOD. However, their tacos didn't do it for me (specifically the tortillas). Hey, can't win them all.

I work nearby and have tried this place for late lunch a few times. THE TACOS ARE A MUST. I've only ever ordered the 3 chicken tacos with rice and beans on the side, but it hasn't disappointed each time. The meat in the tacos are juicy, flavorful, and def hits the spot. And yes, the salsa bar is to die for, so definitely try these out if you visit! 

The service has been decent each time, although I do think they could do better with being attentive when refilling drinks and overall checking in on customers.

La Santisma was our first stop upon arriving in Phoenix. It was over 100 degrees outside and my family, bf and I were hungry. I was craving street tacos and found this place on Yelp! The Argentinian steak and the dog shark tacos were my favorites. The salsa bar was awesome as I laid out different types of salsa in front of my plate. The best part was sipping on a huge drink of horchata! I also admired the Mexican paintings on the walls. The restaurant was small, packed, busy and worth the wait.

This is one of the best places I have ever had the pleasure of eating at. Best burrito I have ever had!!! No joke I kept eating it because it was just that delicious and almost made myself sick. Please try!!!!

the food was good, but not great. the horchata; however, is one of the best i've ever tried. i could come back just for that. 

the real reason why this place gets 2 stars instead of 3 was how the manager dealt with our issue. my friend ordered the filet mignon taco plate and the menu clearly said it was 15.99. We got our bill and it says 21.99. So we asked why and she said it's because they changed the menu. Well.. not the 4 menus that we were given. Instead of fixing it, she argued with us and tried to find a menu with the new price. when she couldn't produce one, she said she would need to call the owner blah blah. seriously?! and then she takes another 15minutes talking on the phone with the owner, I'm assuming, instead of dealing with her waiting customers. left such a bad taste in my mouth. in the end, she changed the charge to 15.99, to which i left a $6 tip and a scathing note on how they can have their money back. we will never return to this place.

I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place.  Shocking.  I LOVE this place.
Their quesadillas are doughy cheesy heaven.  HEAVEN.
Their tacos are the stuff dreams are made of.
Their salsa bar proof that there is a god.
Well, that may be much, but still, awesome place.
And guess what kiddies? They finally have beer!
Decor is nice, room is a bit small to contain all this awesomeness though.  Its cozy.
let me recommend  the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco.  That pork, tender, so very very tender.  Amazing in the quesa as well.
The dogfish shark and shrimp are great too. 
I haven't been disappointed yet actually.
Order one of everything! (maybe two of the pork)

Awesome. 

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Phoenix. The food is amazing, I get the Taloc taco, it's vegan! The real shining star of this place is the salsa bar. Always a ton of options, all ranging in different levels of spice. Be careful, you might think the fruity one won't be spicy, but it'll surprise you :) 

The drinks are also good and reasonably priced. 

Always consistent, always good.

I was looking for a quick street taco fix and what I found was La Santisima.  Calling it a gourmet taco shop is fitting and more importantly the price was right!

The list of Mexican restaurants and taco shops is endless in Phoenix and while I can't possibly try them all, I have at least found one I thoroughly enjoy.  From the quality of meat, to the portions, to the highly touted salsa bar, this place delivers on all levels!

I started with a half order of guacamole to compliment my assortment of chosen salsas.  Their guac tends toward the chunky side mixed with red onion, tomato, mango, and cilantro.  The chips were disappointing, but they served their purpose of sampling salsas and the guac.

I also heard great things about the horchata, which I can never pass up when available.  First of all, it comes in a massive 32 oz cup.  I would definitely share this with somebody else next time.  It's also loaded with strawberries and mangos, which I initially thought seemed unnecessary, but provided a unique twist.  The fruit proved difficult to fit through the straw, so maybe I'll order without in the future.

I ordered 3 of the gourmet tacos - El Gaucho Taco, Baja Sur Shark Taco, and Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco. All were $3.99 and excellent and I would say the Cochonita Pibil was the best I tried!  It went really well with the salsa cilantro, a cream based cilantro salsa.

Mouthwatering,  Flavorful, Love at first Taste, Insanely Good!!  

First, this place is super small but the wait is worth it. 
The salsa bar is Authentic Salsa!! 
I haven't tasted such great salsa till I came here. 
The horchata is Wow. 
The beans,  and rice, Tacos YUM! 
Price is just the icing on top 
Must try!

I"m feeling a little tepid about this place.  People just rave about how good the food is and so I expected to be totally wowed.  Not so.  We walked in around 7:00pm on a Saturday night and we were told it would be an hour wait.  Okay, we hunkered down for the long haul.  It was actually more like half an hour before we were shoehorned into a long table in the back room with a lovely view of the ladies room and what appeared to be a storeroom.  

The artwork is quite interesting and provides contrast to what otherwise appears to be a dining room transported out of a tiny village in Mexico.  It was hot and loud and being hearing impaired, mostly just a wall of indistinguishable sound.  Our server was nice and efficient, getting margaritas for the others and for me, as the DD, iced tea.  There was one tiny corner of a wedge of lemon in my tea, but fortunately, the well-appointed salsa bar had more.

Speaking of the salsa bar, that was the highlight for me.  The first time I've ever had a strawberry-chile salsa and it was delicious.  I had several of the mini-cups with the abundant and fresh tortilla chips.  I also had a peanut salsa that tasted like a sambal, but with a nice, slow burn.  Again, a very tasty salsa.  There were about ten other salsas and they all appeared fresh and very popular. 

The menu is like a regional loop through Mexico, and I found that very cool.  There were regional specialties with a local twist like Mole, Tinga, Cochinita Pibil, and fish tacos.   There was also a variety of vegetarian/vegan options that appealed to the veggies in my group.  I couldn't stray from a "burro norteno" that was a combination of beans, rice, potato and green chile pork.  I wish there was more green chile pork in it, and it was a bit dry, but flavorful.

Yeah, I plan to go back some night with my wife who is a vegetarian, and perhaps something will trigger that spark so that I can rave about it like everybody else.

Great food. I had the smoked Marlin burrito and the La Samita taco with shrimp.

The waiter was pretty awesome, he brought us samples of the different meats to make our ordering process much simpler. The salsas were great. The tomatia salsa was my favorite. The strawberry salsa was surprisingly good as well. 

All in all a great experience for $20 with tip. The burrito was enough to eat without the taco but the two together we're very filling.

Tried them on a whim in passing by today, it was just ok. .my carne was well seasoned and flavorful,  my pork was horrible, they screwed my order up only to correct it...then when i got home I realized it was still screwed up...

My total for 3 tacos, small rice & beans came to $14 and some change, I don't think it was quite worth that but i may be inclined to try them again - at someone else's expense. I'm a little salty that I didnt check groupon before going lol.

I was excited to eat here as I'd heard good things but was mostly disappointed.  Their horchata was really good but that was about it. They didn't allow us to order a side of just beans and rice for our kids which I found strange and I ordered 2 horchatas, 1 for me and 1 for my kids to share. They brought the kid's out in 2 separate tiny cups; not even close to half of a full serving and still charged us for a full size! I ordered tacos with beef brisket and the meat was dry and chewy.  In the end I was dissatisfied with their food and service.

I read alot of reviews and had very high expectations of this place. The food was good but nothing that made me say "WOW". Out of the 4 tacos that I tried, the CABO shrimp taco was the best and would return for it.  The salsas and chips are a good way to down down some beers before your meal. I'd say give La Santisima a try and make your own decision.

Sometimes, Yelp is right on.  I was looking for a great Mexican restaurant in the neighborhood to take my wife to (it was date night).  This place had far more stars than most, so we gave it a go.

Upon entering (we visited on First Friday last month) it was so loud that it was like bombs going off.  The decor was unusual and had an interesting botanica vibe going on.  Service was a bit slow but they were so packed that I wasn't surprised.

Their salsa bar had more flavors than I've ever seen at a restaurant anywhere--and I've been to a lot of Mexican Restaurants.  As for the food itself, there was nothing "traditional" about it, but everything was so bursting with incredible flavor that I was savoring every bite.

Holy sh*t, that was good.  My burrito was loaded with CHUNKS of marinated steak--not ground, not shredded, but chunks.  I was blown away.  Next time, there's a SHARK burrito on the menu that I can't wait to taste.

If you're in the mood for something "traditional", I still point people to Mi Patio in Phoenix.  However, if you're looking for something other than the same old Mexican taste, may I recommend this landmark.  It's just a few blocks north of McDowell on your right hand side.  You won't regret it.  The place is small and can sometimes be packed with noisy gringos, but the taste is unforgettable.

Food was good.  Place was small and it took me a while to figure out that we had to order at the bar.  After paying for our meal, we enjoyed the salsa bar, then out of one of the black t-shirts a roach comes out and was about to get on another woman who was leaning on the wall.  I immediately informed her and they left.  I just sat there and pondered whether or not to eat the rest of my tacos, they were good after all.. I won't be going back.

This salsa bar will ruin your life. You will lay in bed awake at night thinking about the salsa combinations you didn't try and how your life is not as fulfilled as it could be if you had tried it... The food here will change you life for the best and for the worst (cause you'll want it all the time).

Delicious!!! First time there and I had the Oaxacan Mole Quesadilla and my friend had the Pastor quesadilla and they were both delicious!!! I also recommend the margaritas! They had orange and grapefruit juice!

It is a little confusing when you walk in, but you do seat yourself and a server comes over with menus and chips. Help yourself to the wide variety (about 20) of salsas @ the salsa bar and your server will come take your order. I got the cochinita pibil tacos and my husbannd got the carne asada tacos...we got the combo plates with rice and beans, 2 tacos for $6.99. I don't know where that person has been eating who said this was expensive...the plates (baskets) come looking a little plain, but you have all those salsas to add to your tacos which makes it fun and filling! Rice and beans quantity was a little small for my husband, but just right for me.
The carne asada tacos were good, but the cochinta pibil were amazing! I love the artwork and the tables and chairs...it's a great place! Plastic cutlery is a turn off, but who cares when the food is so good. I like La Condesa more than America's! *ducking behind the sofa*
Great food! Reminded me of my time in Oaxaca! Wish they had silverware because the plastic ware made cutting the Quesa tough lol but so small in the grand scheme of a great restaurant!

Wonderful food!  Awesome food!  Out of this world great food. Service is spotty. Great guy that works weekdays, but otherwise the service is terrible doesn't matter which female it is. Getting food before drinks. Sometimes order food before drinks. Tonight the drink arrived 2 seconds before the meal, my taco was incorrect (I don't complain just go with it). Then they are all over us asking if all is ok. Then clean our table, working at pushing us out the door because they close in 15 min. 

Again great food, worth all my trips there (10+) but don't ever expect exceptional service unless you luck out and get the male server, he is good!

I want to say don't go here... Why? Because my wife and I loved it so much on our first visit to La Condesa that we selfishly want to keep it a secret from others.

The food was really good and such a unique sampling of traditional Mexican food dishes, with a twist.  The mole was to die for and the shark tacos were amazing.  The rice is also so tasty and I am not usually a rice kind of guy.  I always forgo ordering the traditional side of rice & beans and initially I did the same on our visit.  But my wife ordered the rice with her meal and after seeing and tasting hers, I actually added that to my order even though we already had received our food.  Everyone has already mentioned the amazing salsa bar so I won't repeat the accolades other than to say what a journey of amazing and unique concoctions, coupled with a few of the standard salsas.  Have to recommend the cilantro salsa if you go and be prepared to order more chips if you want to take the salsa adventure and try them all!!!

Gets pretty packed during the standard rush hour periods but worth the wait and if you plan accordingly (noon or early dinner meal), you can avoid the surge.  Definitely one of my favorite taco places in Phoenix.

Ray

Really great salsa bar, tacos, quesadillas and burros.  Service is hit or miss depending on how busy they are but are very friendly.  Just get the food ala carte, the beans and rice portions with a combo are small and aren't that great.  Not a very good selection of beers and the regular margarita is just so so.

Best bean & cheese burrito in town!  And, the salsa bar is fantastic!  Try the pecan salsa... Its delicious on everything!  Sometimes the servers seem unorganized/overwhelmed so, you'll need to be patient.

As soon as I walked in I had wonderful service. The gal who took my order was so sweet. I order a carne Asada and horchata! Yummmy! Literally the best tacos I have ever had in Phoenix and the horchata has a little surprise inside!

Truly an amazing Mexican restaurant! The salsa bar is the winning touch with over 12 different unique salsa for every taste. First time here so I had to try the tacos. The chicken and steak were marinated wonderfully and the flavors combine well. It was definitely worth it. They have great vegetarian/vegan options too! Cannot wait to come back and try the other options on the menu.

Was very excited to come here after all the good reviews.   Overall, our experience was quite "meh".  The menu was inspired.  I loved the idea of having a taco to represent the cuisine of so many different latin american places.  I also loved the salsa bar with its dozen or so unlimited salsas.  However, the food its self was nothing to write home about.  We tried six different tacos, and none of it seemed particularly fresh or interesting.  Had to rely heavily on the salsas to revive the tired tacos.  Doubt I'll be coming back.

Do like to try new salsas? Do you love Mexican food?? Well then this restaurant is the store for you. I came upon this hidden gem by mistake, what drew me in was the nice piece of art of a lady on the front of the restaurant. Walking in it's very small but, don't let that discourage you from eating there. Starting of they have different types of salsas the peanut salsa, pecan salsa, and many more. First I thought ewww peanut and pecan salsa?? I was so wrong don't judge a book by it's cover the salsas where delicious! I ordered the shark tacos omg they where yummy I was licking my fingers lol and didn't care who saw I was happy enjoying my plate. With the plate came beans and rice, the rice was moist and soft. One thing have to applaud is the lady that was our server I totally should of asked for her name she needs to be recognized on top of being a friendly employee she also has integrity. Let me explain, so I basically ate and left on my way home I was looking for my most precious thing ugh oh my cell phone where is it?? We all know that scary sad feeling. To make things short I went back to the restaurant and who was there at the cashier greeting me with a smile and raising my phone up high the wonderful employee! So YES I totally recommend going here the restaurant, the employees, and even the food totally 5 stars.

WOW! Visiting in Phoenix so visited Yelp for a restaurant recommendation. La Santisima was the winner and I couldn't be moe pleased with my meal! You MUST try the Shrimp Taco! It is fabulous!! I will definitely be back for more!!!

We were really excites to try this place from the other reviews. Unfortunately, we didnt really get to try it. We showed up and there were only a few other customers. 6 or so tables were open and three or four still had food sitting. They asked us to wait 5 min before seating us but it was 20. Then we ordered tacos....after waiting an hour from ordering we decided to leave. We did have a single coke and a very small bowl of guac. This cost us $12. The food that came out to customers after us ( some who had gotten there a full 30 minutes after us) did look wonderful. The guac was tasty. Our server basically avoided us the entire time. Im just so disappointed.

Drove by it the first time due to major remodeling on outside building , small and quaint inside - many salsas to choose from for your chips ( additional chips are $2.40 a basket) Street tacos were excellent , one person in our party said the retries beans were the best they ever had . Good  quick service even thou every table in the place was taken.

Absolutely amazing tacos here.  The best part is that you can order tacos a la carte, so you can try several types in one meal.  There is an option to do a taco llate, two tacos with a small side of rice and beans.  I'd skip this option.  The sides were quite small.  If you're hungry go for another taco or perhaps a side of chips and explore the free salsa bar.

You must order at the register.  You are given a number so they can bring out your food.  This is all fine and dandy until you have to find a table.  La Santisima is quite small and has very few tables inside.  We had to stand, basically hovering over people who were eating, and leap at the first table to open up.  I'd say it would be obvious to follow etiquette and let those who ordered before you grab a table first, but we all know not everyone is that poliet.  

They do offer to-go orders if you don't want to wait for a table. I'd also recommend that La Santisima invest I outdoor seating to aleviate some of the indoor congestion.  I'll keep my fingers crossed for my next visit.

Busy hole in the wall restaurant that exceeds expectations in several areas. Salsa Bar is quite impressive w array of choices especially the 7 chile salsa which stood out.
The Shark Taco & Ghandi were fine, nothing special in my opinion. Shredded pork my friend ordered was seasoned out standingly, will try that next time. Salsa bar lived up & exceeded reviews as the well decorated & tasty Horchata

Dear La Condesisima or whoever you are now...I don't need to add to the already glowing reviews of your food, I love it and hope you stay around forever (especially your chile oil...I could drink that stuff).

In fact, I love it so much that I frequently crave it on my way home from work....but I am almost always thwarted by the fact that no one ever answers the phone to take my order. I'm not going to stop and wait for you to take and make my order when I'm trying to bring dinner home to my kids, I just want to order over the phone so I can walk in and pick it up. 

Please answer your phone so I can spend my money at your place.

(unless you're trying to discourage take-out orders, in which case please tell me so I can stop getting my hopes up when the craving strikes!) 

Thanks!
All I can say is SALSA BAR. I love this place. A little bit expensive for a taco place, but I'm not complaining. I'd recommend this to anyone who wants fresh authentic tacos

The good:
The tacos here are amazing. Best I've ever had? No. But enjoyable, if pricey. I had the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco and the La Condesa Veggie Taco. The pork taco was tasty, though extremely messy; the onion pieces were huge, but weirdly enough they had no flavor at all. My favorite was the veggie taco. The vegetable variety was great and they were all cooked to perfection--crisp but fully cooked. The cheese on top was like the glue (best glue ever!) and had a lovely salty tang.

My husband had the pork taco as well and also the Sonoran Carne Asada Taco. The steak taco was his definite favorite; he thought the pork chunks were way too big.

Our server was good--much better than when I visited the Glendale location by myself and was ignored.

The bad:
Yes, the salsa bar is great, but the restaurant is so crowded that it makes getting the salsa difficult. The restaurant is downright claustrophobic, and it wasn't even fully packed with customers when we were there. We wanted to finish our food and leave ASAP so we could stretch out and breathe. There's not a great deal of parking, either.

The tacos are served in baskets lined with tissue paper. With really messy tacos, that means the paper disintegrates and you can't easily cut big chunks of meat with a knife.

Really, it's a place with great tacos and a horrid location. We won't visit again.

My experience here left me willing to try it again, though it didn't live up to expectations.

I came in by myself at dinner time. I was promptly seated and provided with chips. The server was by herself handling the entire dining room and bar at supper, and as a solo diner, I was last priority. It took me all of two minutes to choose what I wanted--a single taco--but it took fifteen minutes for my order to be taken. If I hadn't been given the chips, I would have given up and left. In the meantime, I saw people who came in after me get complete service because they ordered drinks.

The chips were excellent--very fresh. I like the salsa bar but the lighting was poor back there so it was hard to see what was what.

Finally a male server joined her and he took my order. My Aztec chicken tinga taco came out about five minutes later. It was excellent. The chicken was very tender and tasty. Just the right about of spice. It only took about five minutes to catch the server's eye and soon enough I was on my way.

Delicious street tacos. Chicken asado was very tasty. The salsa bar was fun to try the different kinds.

Servers/ staff was polite and helpful.

Sometimes you buy a groupon and then you accidentally don't use it your first try.  So you come back.  That happens.  It happened.

With my two visits to La Santisima, I'd say they know what they're doing.  The offer some dishes that were new to me.  Lonches, for one.  I know what lonche is in Spanglish practice, but what_a_ lonche is, was news to me.  And it was good news.  All around, the food was good.  Salsas are even better.

I did order horchata my first time...but I've totally forgotten what that was like.  That seems to have happened to much of what happened during my first year on the job.  This isn't the only thing I've forgotten.  I've blocked out a lot, apparently.

The service was fine.  I've never seen the place hoping, but maybe the weekend dinner crowd is bashful or something.  Our water cups stayed pretty full and our server was otherwise attentive.  The wait for food was never long.

Cost was fine. It is a gourmet taco shop, after all, so you get what you pay for.  Portions are not huge and style comes with a cost.  The decor is lovely.  I could steal some of their paintings for home, I like them so much.  That is, if they weren't so darn big.

I'd likely give it another visit, that is if we're in Glendale downtown, just walking around, or something.  It seems to be one of the best options.

This place is amazing!! Can't say enough good things about this restuarant! The set up is nice and the art work is superb! A great place to go have a date night or a quiet family dinner. The food is always fresh, (highly recommended the el pastor quesadilla!!) 

The only thing negative per se about this place is the service. They really need another waiter. I give respect to the guy that works there solo, but he's so busy hustling and bustling that it's hard for him to give adequately good service when he's rushing through our orders. We have been there 3 times and each time it is the same, 4 or 5 tables and we end up waiting 20 minutes to get a drink order.

I love the atmosphere and food too much to stop going, just hope they hire another waiter in the near future!!

Definitely recommend this place to others!!!
Absolutely amazing tacos. This place has the best tacos in town. Great value great quality. Very very impressed. Can't wait to go there again.

We spent a few days in Scottsdale a week ago . We ate at few restaurants that were recommended in Scottsdale and we were not happy with them at all . Our last day in Arizona I went on a search myself and found this little gem . I had the tacos Sonora . My husband had the 3 kinds of tacos . It all was very delicious !! We loved all the Salas's they had . 

You need to go off the beaten path to have good food and I totally recommend this restaurant. 

The service was also good!

I have been here many times! The food is great and I haven't ever had a complaint. Today I came in for just a side of guac and was surprised by a 7 dollar charge. Of course being $7 I thought it was going to be big, right? I'm given the tiniest scoop! I asked for a refund and they told me they could not and refused to do anything about it l: won't be coming back sadly!

Best Cadillac margarita I've had in all of Phoenix. The place would be dazzling with a patio and more seating, but even without I'm sold on the food and definitely the drinks. I had the Santisima special quesadilla, which should not be named something so bland and unremarkable as a quesadilla; it was the demi-god of quesadillas, more of an empanada, the hercules of Mexican food; it could beat up your dad is what I'm saying, unless your dad is really old then it would help him out of his chair and bring all the salsa options to the table to give his old bones some rest.

Other than the fact that I should have brushed up on my Rosetta Stone Spanish Edition before trying to find La Condessa I can honestly say I haven't had better tacos in PHX. 
The place is a little hard to find if it's your first time so after multiple turn arounds and a stop at the Panaderia to ask for directions my colleague and I arrived at taco bliss. 

The meal starts off with an endless bowl of fresh tortilla chips and a salsa bar that would make Bobby Flay  jealous. They had some of the best homemade salsas with a large variety. From your classic Pico De Gallo to a Creamy Cilantro salsa. 

I ordered the two taco platter with a tinga taco and a carne asada Taco. These were both great. The carne asada was a little dry for my taste but with the assist of the homemade salsa's it was a perfect combo. The tinga taco was a perfect combination of slowly cooked shredded chicken and seasoning. My colleague got a carne asada burrito and a tinga taco and was satisfied by both. 

In short if I am looking for a great taco for a good price I am going back to La Condesa.

Every once in a while yelp is just flat out wrong and that is the case with la santisima taco shop.  Every review makes you think it will be amazing, but the reality is that the food is ok, but there are much better places to eat in Phoenix.  

So what is wrong with this place?  First off, what the heck kind of quesadilla are the making?  I am still not sure.  Why fry a tortilla and throw some cheese in the middle, it just doesn't make any sense to me.  I love quesadillas, but this one was not good.

Second, the "carne asada" was not good.   It just didn't have much flavor.  The only burrito that I liked was the shrimp burrito, although I didn't realize that it had mushrooms in it, which was disappointing. 

The salsa bar is very good.  The tortilla chips are ok.  The location leaves a little bit to be desired and so does the food.  

I am sure many will go to this place based on yelp, but I was not impressed.
Amazing salsa,  seriously. This place has redefined delicious Mexican food for me.  Great music,  great ambiance, great drinks,  great food.

This definitely takes the cake for one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Phoenix. The diverse salsa bar and extensive menu allow for a lot of taste-testing, and the restaurant seems to be known for its many vegetarian options. I ordered the tacos al pastor, and they were some of the best I've ever had.

Oh wow!!! This place was amazing. The staff was very understaffed even though there were only about 9 tables but you could tell the waiter was trying very hard. We started out with a strawberry marg, which was okay, the lime one was much better. Excuse me while I write the rest of the review... I can't remember each plates name... We got the steak quesadilla stuffed with avocado, peppers, onions, etc... I thought to myself this might be my favorite thing I've ever had... We then ordered 4 tacos to split. I wasn't the biggest fan of any of them besides the white fish! The shark, and steak tacos were very good but the quesadilla you couldn't be satisfied with tacos... Last final thing.... We ordered the burrito to split (yes we took half of it home). We got the steak burrito stuffed with all the good stuff! WOW - I thought okay this might be better than the quesadilla but close call. Must try place in AZ.
Decent to good food but expect to wait and wait lol if I was only rating on service I would rate them a 1 star. I have been 3 times and I'm done !

Honestly, love this place. The Yelp reviews don't lie. I can't get over La Santisma's  salsa variety. I literally had to dig into my memory to remember what I even ate here because I was so amazed by the salsa bar. I literally got up and filled containers nonstop with EVERY single salsa (no shame). I didn't let that go to waste, I tried them all and left little behind. Of course, I loved the spicier selections, but everything was amazing. After eating so much salsa, my pastor burrito came and was pretty good. I think it was a little dry, but nothing salsa can't fix. I tried some of Eric's shark taco and carne asada taco, those were really good! Next time I think I'm going to give a carne asada quesadilla a try! The beans were also great and I must say I left full and satisfied!  Can't wait to come back!

Went here for the first time a few days ago and it was great. Food was delicious and the margaritas are even better! Service was a little slow but nothing too bad, still very nice and polite. also very affordable which is great!

Poor service, took over an hour to get burritos, freezing air conditioning blowing right on us, sound system not working just crackling loudly the whole time. They charge 5$ more just to get sour cream and enchilada sauce on burrito.

I went to La Santisima for the first time when a friend took me here for lunch. I have been here about a dozen times since then!This place was on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives, so there is a lot of hype around this place, and trust me, it's real!

La Santisima has a superb menu with a big variety of items to pick from. Their tacos are delicious and they have a great Aztec Tinga taco. The quesadillas are huge, I can only eat about half when I get it.

They offer a large salsa bar that has at least 10 different salsas ranging from spicy to mild flavors. 

They offer a house margarita for $5 that is delicious, I get about two when I come hehe.They have a small bar but the drink offering is big, including Mexican beers. 

Service is friendly, fast, and courteous. 6-7 PM seems to be a peak time for this restaurant, so make sure you're here on time to get a table since it's a bit small and can fill up quick!

This is one of my favorite Mexican places in Arizona.  Always fresh food and very tasty. I normally get the steak taco combo with rice and beans.  Lots of salsas to choose from and usually pretty busy inside.  Would come here more often if it wasn't a 25 minute drive from where I live.

Well we went back just to check and, sure enough, this is still the best mexican food we've ever had.  My taco with pork cooked in a banana leaf was uh-mA-zing.  And the margarita was too.  I think I just gained five pounds.
stoped by on yelp to see whats near found this place...never did i think it would be this good....i will totaly recommend it will be back

Food was decent, salsa bar was grate! But let's face it folks, this place is a dump. The bathrooms were disgusting. Smells like methane gas, giant holes exposing past plumbing problems and no way to dry your hands. The wife said the woman's bathrooms were the same. The service wasn't the best and the kitchen was quite filthy.  Overpriced food, warm beer ( which they ran out of), $9.99 for salsa to go, but they had no containers. Woke up the next morning with severe diarrhea!!

La Condesa, you stole my heart.  Gourmet Taco Shop indeed.  Your saucy molé put me over the top.

You really know how to spice up a relationship with your many wonderful salsas.

I loved your warm decor and warmer service.

I can't wait to come back to sample your salsas and try more tacos.

I finally made my way here to meet some friends on a trip to Phoenix about a month ago, then I met another friend here on my most recent trip.

$3.99 gourmet street tacos.  Filling.  20 or so salsas.  Delicious.

My favorite Mexican restaurant in Phoenix, hands down!! An amazing variety of different salsas and they have a very unique horchata with fruits and nuts!! Come here, you won't regret it!! The only bad thing I can say about this place is limited seating, but it's worth the wait :)

The food is INCREDIBLE. Best burro I have ever had! The service, on the other hand, was pretty bad. This was this past Sunday afternoon. It was busy, but we had to wave down a waiter to even get drinks.

I will always come back, because the food is absolutely worth it.

I am always looking for an authentic mexican cuisine experience and this place is up there with the best. Some of the best salsas I've ever had, the 5/7 chile salsa is amazing if you like a little heat in your life.
First time at this Taco haven.  Simple and funky spot with unique combinations, flavors and choices.   A definite stop for Mexican food.  I'll be back!

I had high expectations for La Condesa, but it quickly turned to La Confusión. The three of us went in during the week for a late lunch, salivating at the thought of some tasty tacos. We each ordered a different  taco combo plate, one Aztec Tinga, one Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken,  one Baja Sur Dogfish Shark, and a quesadilla. 
After waiting a significant amount of time, the waitress brought out our quesadilla and one combo plate with one Aztec Tinga taco and one Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken taco. Despite going over our order numerous times with our server and another gentlemen, somehow, what we wanted seemed beyond comprehension. They brought out the Baja Sur Dogfish Shark taco combo plate and, after waiting so long and confusion over our order, we gave up and ate what we had.
The Azteca Tinga was superb. The Oaxaca Black Mole was good. The Baja Sur Dogfish wasn't really any better than your average fish taco. The rice is a white rice that had decent flavor and the same can be said for the flavor of the refried beans.
La Condesa has a great salsa bar, a cozy interior decorated with some great Día de los Muertos art. The staff was nice and friendly, despite the fact our order remained so elusive.
But, after the ordeal with our order and the less than stellar meal, I have to say that La Condesa was an utter disappointment.

Great service- server was friendly and attentive. Small place, will probably have to wait if you could at a typical busy lunch or dinner time. Food was on point, even a few options for vegetarians! Good sized portions, not overly pricey. Love having the salsa bar there!! The jicama drink was similar to a berry juice, was a little too sweet for my liking but once it was watered down a little, it was delicious. Will definitely come back here next time!

Probably some of the best tacos I've had in Phoenix (i was spoiled living in San Diego). I ordered the 3 Al Pastor street tacos with rice and beans, for my daughter we got the Pollo asada tacos with rice and beans and she sure enjoyed it! Normally she is very picky about onions but she sure enjoyed them from here. They have a large selection of salsas to choose from but there were only a couple that I was fond of, a lot of them seemed to have some weird mixtures but to each their own ? I would recommend this place if you're looking for tacos here in Phoenix!

What a great place!  Good food that is very reasonably priced, and more types of salsa than I've ever seen before.  Our group had a lot of fun going up to the salsa bar, and bringing back samples of the huge selection for everyone to try.  I'd go back there in a heartbeat!

I've been here twice now for lunch with a co-worker and I'm obsessed.  First thing you notice is their huge salsa bar in the corner -- looks like they always have about 8-10 different kinds to try.  My favorites: strawberry, pecan and cilantro.  The whole place is decorated with Dia de los Muertos art everywhere -- very colorful and authentic.  Next...the meals.  So far I've had the shrimp burro and some of my co-workers chicken mole quesa.  Both were absolutely delicious -- melty fresh cheese, the mole sauce was unbelievable, and the shrimp burro was a great mix of cheese, an assortment of vegetables and a yummy sauce.  If this place was closer to my house I'd be there way more!

Great place for delicious Mexican. Had the 3 tacos plate and half order of guacamole and was all really fresh and authentic. Salsa bar is great and the salsa verde is some of the best I've had in years ( Shout out to Dos Coyotes in Davis, CA). Love that it's a small off the beaten path location and even though I was interested because of Guy I was not disappointed.

Decided to stop by as we made our way though Phoenix along our road trip. Was very excited and had my hopes up for a delicious Mexican meal. Decided on their taco combination plate which is a order of 3 tacos along with beans and rice. Salsa bar was pretty good as we're their chips. Unfortunately their rice was awful, was overcooked and microwaved to a large glob of paste. Honestly it was unappetizing to have it on my plate as it made me think that the rest of the meal was also microwaved. Made a comment to the waiter as I felt it could be a point of improvement. He received the criticism well. 

Don't think this restaurant is deserving of a four star based on my experience.
The street tacos were delicious and we had fun sampling the different types of salsa. This food has f-l-a-v-o-r.... there is definitely a  reason this place is busy!!

Everything is good. And hands down best salsa bar imaginable. Best, best, best! Small and always crowed though, which I blame mostly on the awesomeness salsa bar.... Did I mention how great the salsa bar here is?
Slow roasted pork burros!!!
Really good tacos!!! Love the multiple choices of salsa!!!!  The protein style taco was crazy!!!!!

This place reminds me of my Nana's (Grandma's) home cooking.  For instance, when you order a carne asada burrito... it doesn't look like your typical fast foot burrito... which is great.  You truly get a more authentic Mexican feeling here.  I'll be back soon.
Yeah this place is really good. The food is definitely worth the wait and all the other negative bs people write on here.
Food is fantastic!  Service always stinks.  Will keep coming back though.  Food is too good:)
This is by far the best Mexican food I've ever had! Al Pastor is amazing and all the salsas in the salsa bar taste great! Get the Cadillac Margarita, super good on the rocks.

The food gets a solid five. Service a 3-3 1/2. Service wasn't bad, it was just busier than I think they expected. It's small, and a bit crowded, but worth it.

This was my second visit. This time I had the molé quesa.  OH MY GOODNESS! Amazing.  It was so big I had to take half home. 

The salsa are great. Love the creamy cilantro salsa and the strawberry salsa. Try the guacamole with mangoes.

I'm so happy that there is a La Santisima near me now. Although not very large, this location isn't nearly as cramped as the original location, and overall, the service was much better! The food was as tasty as the original location. I had the mole quesa and my husband had the al pastor quesa. Both were delicious. I'll definitely be back.

This place is awesome, and I am deciding is my favorite Mexican food restaurant (restaurants-both locations are pretty much the same) in the Phoenix area. I have eaten here (and at the Glendale location) a total of 4 times, and each experience has left me wanting to come back. 

The salsa bar is the best I've experienced with an amazing variety of tastes, fresh ingredients, and mild to moderate spice. Order extra chips straight away if you love chips and salsa.

The food is outstanding-from their pibil to their arbol, to their beans and rice. They use very high quality fresh ingredients with KILLER flavor and spice. While there is a very strong Mexican feel to the restaurants (no gringo influence that I noticed-Thank you), there is also a modern feel to their menu. So I've started out with the more popular dishes/recipes, but I am excited to try out some of their other offerings that appear more modern.

Their margaritas (I've only had the house) are the best, period. End of sentence.

Finally, you should be aware that the physical spaces are pretty different. I'm going to guess the owners are young and without the resources to afford something more expensive. But don't be put off by the space. I love that they have more modern art, and the food more than makes up for any misgivings one might have about the space.

If you really love Amazing Mexican food, you must try this place. I can't imagine you will be disappointed.

PS, I don't think their prices are reasonable/not expensive.

If you come to Phoenix and don't eat here you are missing out on life!!!! I have never had Mexican food like this. I had the shark taco and a Marlin burrito!!!! Life changing is not a bold enough statement. I'm a foodie and this place is incredible. Please come here!!!!!!  The salsa bar alone is worth the visit. It is cheap in price only. Everything about the place is magical. It looks a little scary from outside and at night the sign is not lite up but we took a chance, and it was one of the best choices in eatery I've ever made. Salsa Guacamole is to die for!!! THANK YOU FOR EVERYTHING LA SANTISIMA!!!!!!!!

If a place in Phoenix has almost 500 reviews and it still has almost 5 stars, you know it has to be good. I came here for a quick lunch after work one day, and couldn't have been more pleased with my experience. The fish tacos I ordered were absolutely delicious, and the staff was very friendly. The salsa bar is genius! So many different flavors, it's like having 10 different dishes in one. 

Overall, do yourself a favor and try Santisima if you're in the mood for Mexican.

Awesome food, great service! Love the guacamole. The lighting outside the restaurant is not so good, so we passed the place twice. Once inside, everything we ordered was great! Tacos with mole, El Pastor tacos, steak tacos and - did I mention - guacamole! A must do in Phoenix. Go now!

Dear Arizona,

Over 1.5 years ago, I visited your state and ate at a Mexican restaurant that I neither remember the name nor want to. It was awful. And I reviewed that restaurant and commented that a place so highly reviewed in Arizona must have meant people in Arizona don't get food. I was wrong. So wrong. And for that, I apologize. After visiting la Santisima (a different restaurant than the above mentioned disaster), I realized you guys have got the Mexican food down to a T.

Your Midwestern friend,
-Deena

Okay now for the review:
We were in town for a wedding and we had a lot of time between the wedding and our arrival so we looked up some good places to eat. Thank GOD for yelp because it helped us find this holy landmark of Mexican food. 

Atmosphere: 3.5/5. Small restaurant. You will definitely wait so get there early. Nice paintings around. Modern American music playing which is fine by me. You don't need to play mariachi music for the place to be authentic. If your food is this good, I don't care if you play Beyoncé or sounds of the Amazon. 

Food: fresh corn tortillas. Fresh chips. Guacamole with chunks of avocado so ripe it melts in your mouth. Salsa with fresh peppers. Mole so good it could only be holy. Fish and shrimp tacos as well as "shark" tacos that melt like butter !! Horchata with fresh fruit and cinnamon and nuts. Oh my gosh. Never ending food ecstasy here. I wish I had an extra stomach so I could have ordered more food to try before I left this place. 

Service: they are a limited number of servers but they bust their humps walking around serving , taking orders , etc. Five stars to them! 

Miscellaneous: limited parking out front. They take all credit cards except American Express. 

PROS: great food and memorable flavors
CONS: can't think of any

Our group arrived a few minutes early.  We spent a few minutes talking with a bartender.  He explained a bit about the restaurant and made some recommendations.  We spent a few minutes admiring the artwork that adorned the walls throughout the restaurant.  

This is really a homey sort of small place, but the variety of choices is impressive.  A large variety of tacos and tortas are the main choices.  Fish, shrimp, chicken, beef and pork are protein choices for Oaxacan mole, Tinga, chipotle, Sonoran and several other flavorings.  
The black mole is a standout.  Slightly sweet with a strong earthy flavor - it was a favorite at our table.   

The salsa bar has close to a dozen different choices for chipping/dipping and adding to some of the tacos.

My order of Grilled Calabacitas fell a bit short.  You usually don't order this unless you really like it.  Only a few rounds (8-10) of thinly cut zucchini served on a large platter.  A smaller plate would have made these tasty morsels seem like more but actually, more would have made it seem like more!

One of our group is a perfectionist and was put-off by the chipped terracotta plates and platters used as serving pieces.  They seemed very at home with the restaurant's decor.  Mine was scraped clean of any extra bits.  Service was quick and efficient.  They may have been a bit understaffed but our group of six had no complaints.
Ohhh baby the horchata is simply amazing. 5th star well deserved. I felt like a little kid scooping the pecans and strawberries with a spoon at the end.
Great!  But long lines and crowded.  Huge servings, lots of tasty choices.  Salsa bar is varied and delicious.
The place is amazing. And it's REAL Mexican food. Don't be fooled by that la piñata bs. Do yourself a favor and check this place out.

Everything was terrific! The salsa bar had huge variety. Had the Condesa Mahi Mahi tacos, and the veggies were fresh and perfectly cooked. We had a huge party, 8 moms and 10 kids under the age of 5. (We had just toured Stuffington Bear Factory and we are a very rowdy hungry crew). They treated us wonderfully and service was exceptional. All the moms raved about the food. Next time we visit we need to leave the kids at home ;-)
Unique atmosphere complimented by wide variety of free salsa. Reasonable prices and pleasant service. Food is great!

Authentic?  First, we were hoping the tortilla were homemade (likely not).  I ordered a pork/tomato/onion "not a" torta, and it was most certainly a sandwich with mustard and mayonnaise??  That didn't seem authentic.  But I ate the thing- it was good.  But I would get tacos or a burrito next time... if there is one.  DUN DUN DUNN!

MILEY, WHAT'S GOOD?
The salsa bar is great... though the best ones ("guacamole") were empty the Friday lunch hour I went.  Chunky pico is good.  Strawberry salsa?  Um ok.  Peanut salsa.  Sure.  Cilantro salsa- tasted more like bell pepper to me.  Hit and miss, but fun to try them all regardless.  

DRINKS?
Skinny margarita so watery my wife switched the beer. But the iced tea is good and comes in a big 32 ounce cup so you don't have to bother anyone for refills.  And you get your own water bottle. 

Kinda of a fun, dark, (maybe too) little dive w/ good service.  Would be greater if they could extend the bar to more than three seats.

I still love this place. A lot. Perhaps even more so now that I can walk there from my apartment. One thing I forgot to mention in my last review is their fantastic margaritas, which have squeezes from fresh orange or grapefruit, pack a punch and are very cheap ($6) for the size. 

I know I said I'm not much of a "regular," but La Condesa has made me one. Spectacular.

Top Mexican food in Phx
Try the peanut butter salsa.
This place has the best horchata!!!!! You have to try it, but it only comes in one very large size so it is best to share. They also have a great salsa bar and good vegitarian tacos.
This place had an awesome selection and different from the Mexican food/tacos that I'm used to. I'd say a must try if you're in the area.

I can not say enough good things about this restaurant. If you come for no other reason you have to visit the salsa bar. There are no less then 20 different salsas. My favorites are the pecan (yes PECAN), cilantro, chopped chilies with garlic and the jicama. They say the first bowl of chips is complimentary, but I have never been charged for additional chips. There are so many delicious choices on this menu, and there really hadn't been an order I have regretted. I always come back to the chorizo fundido and the veggie quesa with extra cheese. I have tried about every quesa option at this point and the meat in this quesa, while optional, detracts rather then adds to the flavor. The chorizo in the appetizer more then hits my carnivore button. I would also highly recommend the tamarind margarita, with its tangy tamarind fruit muddled into the drink and the chili salt rim, you can't go wrong. On the way out you have to order a horchata to go. With its fresh strawberries and chopped walnuts it is unlike any horchata you have ever tried. You may be tempted to get one with your meal, but that would be a mistake. This drink is so complex and delicious it needs to be sipped and savored. The spices, flavors and textures of the food needs only ice water and a single shared bottle of Coca-Cola to complete the experience. They don't offer dessert, so take the horchata to go. You won't be sorry!
I would also like to add that apart from the burritos all the menu items are gluten free. You need only stipulate corn tortillas when ordering things like fundito or as a side to the soup.

The food was excellent but the service needs a lot of work.

The girl working up front does not know what she is doing. It was hard to watch her struggle as the two groups in front of us left after waiting for 20 minutes. The kicker is that it was not even packed. There was about 10 tables open and she made four groups wait for over 20+ minutes. She needs to be trained or let go.

The waiter was stressed out and could not remember something you said to here a few seconds ago. I ordered a Coke and horchata a total of three times. We only got the horchata as we were leaving...... The horchata was delicious though....

We ordered around 8 street tacos of different varieties and they were all A+. The selection of salsa was also very good. You can tell that they are understaffed and struggle with giving good service.

We thought we would try some tequila and the waiter brought us house tequila which tasted like cleaning materials. We then ordered the $15 Don Julio tequila and she brought back out the same house tequila..

Even though the service was terrible I would come back for the food.

I reserve 5 stars for meals that are  exemplary. This "gourmet" taco shop is truly that. Every bite is a flavor party, including the array of succulent salsas ranging from chipotle to creamy cilantro. The spicy jalapeños are truly spicy, turning me into a fire-breathing dragon for moments after I ate them.

This restaurant does justice to vegetarians, all veggies are sautéed with care and attention to spices. The mole nearly made my partner dance, dark and intricate like a Spanish tango. My Santisima quesa was a revelation, full of flavor and topped with Mexican crema, a thick corn crust that managed not to be greasy.

And the horchata? It's the real deal. We shared a margarita that tasted natural and refreshing, not a bottled mix in the house.

NOT FOR KIDS. Food is amazing and yummy. But they neglected to tell us they put hot chiles in the beans. We ordered bean burritos for my 5 and 6 year olds. The poor kiddos were screaming!  My little boy was in so much pain, he soiled his pants, and his lips swelled firey red. It was a bad end to a great day. 

Great food, spicy, and not for children.

La Santísima is not authentic Mexican food at all. Only the plate names but that's it. I liked the chips, salsa bar (because of the variety but I only tried the Mexican salsa and guacamole salsa), avocado salad side and decoration portraits but the tacos, burrito and horchata were not good. The tacos were plain, the chicken in the burrito didn't have flavor and it was served on a broken plate and the horchata didn't taste like actual horchata. Also, there was only one another party so I don't understand why the service was so slow. I definitely would not go back!

The cabo fried shrimp tacos are the best thing to me. Salsa bar is awesome as well. Little over hyped. Cramped seating. Service is mediocre. One guy does a good job but he's not always there. I've had to wait for a while before. One time I just estimated my tab, left money and left. For a spot that made it on diners and dives they need some work. I would think they would care more about service and presentation. Food is always good. But I'm not there to hang out for long. Reminds me of a little dive in mexico. I usually enjoy myself despite the flaws. Best is go when its slow.

This place was ok...

Parking was slim, but there was space on the street. 

It's a nice, friendly place.. small, but welcoming to our large group.

The salsa bar was nice.  There were a lot of different ones to choose from and everyone was able to find ones that they enjoyed. The chips were free (there were some reviews saying they were charged for chips..)

i had the taco/burro combo.. I got the shrimp taco and the gaucho steak burro.  The shrimp had a lot of breading.  It had good flavor, but the shrimp was a little dry. I also found that the steak in my burro was a little dry.  Again, it had good flavor, but i was disappointed in the meat. The grilled squash that came with the plate was good though! 

I decided that I had to try the horchata because of all the reviews.  It was pretty good, but I didn't care for the chunks of fruit.  It was difficult to drink through the straw towards the end, and I ended up wasting 1/4 of my $4 drink... 

Pricing is higher than noted.  My plate was $12ish and the horchata was $4.  After tax and tip, it was over $20.  

All in all, it was a decent meal/experience, but I probably won't go back.

I normally do not like Mexican food in restaurants because I am used to having my friend's mom's cooking at home. This place was great, the food is fresh and made when ordered. The salsa bar is also great. Highly recommend it to people who wants Mexican food that tastes great. Thank you guys for the wonderful experience

The sauce bar alone is worth the trip. Jenny C and her horrible taste buds can have her Taco Bell and their sauce. I enjoyed trying peanut, strawberry, radish, cilantro, guacamole, Cabo, chipotle, and Mexican salsa. We ordered a carne asada burrito. Good sauce in it, a healthy amount of peppers and avocado and cucumber. Fresh tortilla and ingredients. Cool dia de las muertes decor and a tight, cramped but bustling crowd. It's probably a better foodie place than a first date location. I loved it. I realize tastes differ, but anyone who thinks Taco Bell has more to offer ought to get their head and not just their tongue checked out for damage. That's you Jenny C.

I thought for sure I had already reviewed this place long ago... It is, hands down, the best Mexican food I've had in Arizona. We come here at least twice every time my boyfriend is in Phoenix for Spring Training. Best tacos. Best salsa variety. Best service. Can't wait till March when I get to come back!!

Decided to drop into this establishment that I kept hearing amazing things about. First I ordered the Award Winning Margarita, and if I could I would give them another award. Holy cow this was delicious with the spicy salt on the side!!!! (Sighhhhhh) I was sad when I finished it...three drops of tears came out. We got some of the tacos for appetizers and let the waitress order them for us. Let me just say that the baby shark was fried to perfection. The signature taco everyone needs to try because the flavors coming off the steak were tasty and forced me to sit back and enjoy. Finally for our final dish of the day we had a Quesa which is this interesting take on a quesadilla that was more like a stuffed sopapilla with a delicious filling of steak, mushrooms, peppers, onions and some sort of magical dust that made me fall in love! This place was awesome and the only reason that it lost a star was that they seemed short staffed  and the poor waitress was running everywhere and appeared to be the only one there. Thank you for upping the downtown food game.

Offers more of a unique offering to the traditional mom-and-pop Mexican restaurant. Lots of tasty tacos to choose from (the tiger shrimp was the best we tried) and they do a different spin on quesadillas. These are served fried and puffy. Lots of cheesy filling inside- the Gaucho was tasty but with all of the unique flavors (chimichirri, pickled onions, etc) I thought it would be a bit more flavorful. Definitely large enough to share. 

Salsa bar has many flavorful options, but I don't like the idea of all patrons having access to something I'd consume (too many dirty hands, coughing, sneezing). 

The margarita had barely any tequila, but I did appreciate the fresh fruit slices in it.  

This is a TINY, TINY place and doesn't offer much authenticity when it comes to decor or music (Katy Perry and other pop music - cringe).

I read about this place in New Times and saw two words that always speak to me like they are some alluring foreign language.... COCHINITA PIBIL! I've made this dish at home a couple of times, and it takes me a couple of days, so when I get to eat it it is a real treat. 

Went into La Condesa around 7:30 on Thursday night and went straight to the counter and ordered the glorious achiote and orange maranated pig, along with rice and beans and a homemade horchata. Chips were included. While I was waiting for food, the people running the place were over the top nice. The man told me about some tips to making cochinita pibil including using cinnamon, which I'd never done. The girl actually introduced herself, shook my hand, and asked my name. I've never had anyone do that in a restaurant. She proceeded to explain the salsa bar, which had about a dozen different salsas though they plan to have 20 in total eventually. 

The chips were fresh, all 5 of the salsas I tasted were delicoius, especially the green cream and the watermelon. My Horchata was amazing, just perfect. They topped it with crushed nuts, and there were strawberry chunks and whatnot in it. Very unique but amazing. My tacos came, and I was quick to pick off the raw onion and replace it with the proper pickled onion slices as it should have come in the first place. No problem, they have the pickled ones at the salsa bar along with all the other veggies. The tacos were full of meat bursting at the seams... large portions were great for me as I'm used to such small tacos. Their refried beans were creamy and well cooked with a nice cheese garnish, and the buttery smooth rice was delicious as well. 

For the fact that this place is nice, decorated with dia de los muertos style art, mexican wrestling posters, the niceness of people, and the excellent food, this place gets five stars as easily as any restaurant I've been to in Arizona. It reminded me of Mama Testa, which has grown to be one of the best known taco shops in San Diego. Phoenix has never seen anything like this. They asked if I want to come back, and I assured them, it will be soon. Very soon.

Had the 3 taco plate.  One was really good(the chorizo one), one had no flavor and was so dry i had to douse it in salsa to make it edible.  The third was fried in the tortilla, which was a bit strange but ok.

My friend had something else.  I forget what but he said it was fairly poor.

We waited a long damn time to get food.(30 min at least).  They gave us free chips, but it turned a quick dinner that i had high hopes for into a very long one that i would have rather not eaten.

I liked the salsa bar.  It was pretty impressive in its variety (16 different types i think)

Not going back without a gun to my head.

This is a petty good hidden gem that sits on a Main Street. Found this place on diners drives and dives. They were famous for their tacos and salsas. 

The decor is very nice. The chairs are comfy and they have a wall with bench seating which is very cool a gets a thumbs up from me. They have beautiful paintings on the walls. They have a small bar with a good selection of hard alcohol, wine and beer. They also have a outside patio which is pretty large.
