The food was pretty good. We ordered our tacos a la carte because we wanted to try different ones. The street tacos have a good amount of meat in them. Not skimpy like most places. And we also ordered one of the signature tacos and they are big. No wonder why they are $4+ a taco lol. 

Over all this place is a nice place to hang out at. I can see them having a great taco Tuesday. My reasoning for only giving them 4 stars is because I can't give half of a star. The reason for hall a star off Is because they serve can drinks instead of fountain. I hate when a restaurant gives you can sodas.
Amazing food! Awesome salsa bar! I especially enjoyed the tiger shrimp tacos! Friendly staff, this place is a little bigger than the 16th street location.

The food is good from prior experience.  I love the concept but the service was lacking here.  My friend and our kids were waiting at a table for a bigger one to open up and nobody came to clean the table.  To me that is just rude to offer it to us to wait at and not clean it.  The place is just too small and they should change their policy of not letting you order anything until seated.
Very authentic Mexican place! Great fresh guacamole, tacos, burritos! Really enjoyed.

Best authentic Mexican food in Phoenix that I have ever had! They have an amazing salsa bar with flavors I never could have thought to be salsas. I have the mahi burro and it was awesome. Everything made from scratch down to the tortillas. It's in a kind of "rough" location, but don't let that stop you from this place!

The food here is amazing.  So many unique and delicious salsas to choose from and the entrees  were superb! Very unique Mexican food spot that I'd definitely recommend. Friendly staff a real plus, too.

Tacos the way they should be. I cannot rave enough about this place. Considering myself a foodie that likes to try NEW places all the time, I found myself coming back to this gem on vacation. The mahi mahi and shrimp taco special combo were so unbelievably good, I would rank them above the Grand Canyon. Was I just that hungry?...um no. 

Salsa bar is great and there are bottomless chips, margarita was tasty. Service is average, but if you come here for service you have it all wrong!

When we first walked in it was a really welcoming vibe, the waitress was really friendly and the service was fast. The drinks were amazing! I can't express how good the drinks were. The tacos were not bad but felt that they were over powered by the vegetation, but once all that was clear it was game on. The best taco was the chorizo and potatoes, there was a lot of flavor and soaked all of the taste buds. Will definitely come back for more. Keep cookin la santisma!

If you are looking for a hidden gem of Phoenix, La Santisima is definitely one of those places!!

The decor and vibe of the place is top notch. Even though it is a bit small, it has a bit feel on the inside. The decor is not over the top and for being a taco shop, has the ability to seem a bit classy.

The biggest thing that would sell anyone on this place is the salsa bar. Every type of salsa you can think of. Some ranging from really hot to super mild. Some specialty salsa as well made form guacamole, cashews, and fruit. You can definitely chow down a few baskets of tortilla chips trying all the different types of salsa.

I ordered the Azteca Tinga Burrito. It came out really quick and was huge. The burrito itself had an amazing flavor on its own, but I added some of their salsas to spice it up a bit and it made it even more amazing. The chicken was cooked very well and was very flavorful. Even the beans and veggies in the burrito had their own flavor to it.

I am looking forward to visiting this place more and more and trying as many different items on their menu as possible. Not to mention all the salsas!!

This restaurant is schizophrenic.  The front of the house is a nightmare: incredibly slow, somewhat aloof service, small plastic cups of water that don't get refilled, restroom issues (the men's was closed and the women's was dirty which is unacceptable at all public establishments but especially in a restaurant).  When we sat down there were chips on the table but no napkins; those didn't arrive until dinner so I went into the restroom and grabbed some paper towels.  Speaking of salsa, the restaurant has a salsa bar with at least a dozen different types to choose from -- great idea in theory, but unfortunately about half of the containers were empty and they were not refilled the entire time we were there.  

However...I gave this place 3 stars because the food is indeed delicious.  My husband and I ended up ordering the same thing -- a "street taco" plate with 3 different tacos, rice, and beans.  The al pastor, chicken mole, and pork pibil tacos are fabulous, with complex flavors that explode in your mouth. The food is high quality, fresh, and incredibly tasty. I would have liked to tell you about the guacamole, but at 8:00 p.m. they were out of it.

We noticed that they offer take out service and I would recommend that as the sole way to get food from La Santisima.  In addition to the lousy, indifferent service the restaurant is tiny, crowded, and doesn't have much atmosphere.  They really should expand to a larger space where they can better meet the demand that's been generated from all the favorable press and their admittedly delicious Mexican fare.
Food was excellent. Great service. The restaurant was nice and good music. We definitely be back.
Great food, only bad thing is that they only have one or two people hosting and serving at one time so it takes a while. But food is Amazing and staff is friendly they just need more help.

I found this jewel recently. From the Dia de los muertes theme to the salsa bar. To the people to the amazing food. You can't beat this place. One of the best experiences I have had. Go! You'll thank me

So many salsas at the salsa bar, which is like candy land for someone like me! I had the Carne Asada  taco and Aztec Tinga burrito and my lady had the street tacos ,the food was different , don't know if I'll  ever come back to this places . It's want them were you scratch off your bucket list..  You'll understand what I'm talking about !!!

Item's tasted include.

Free Chips and Salsa Bar - options including Chipotle, Pico de Gailo, Robano Pibil, Peanut, Jicama, Pecan, Soy, etc.

Baja Sur Shark Taco - Corn Tortilla with Beer Battered Wild Dogfish and lettuce with cilantro mayo

Cabo Shrimp Taco with Beer Battered Wild Tiger Shrimp and cilantro mayo, jicama

Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco - Roasted Pork Shoulder with Achiote Rojo slow cooked in banana leaves topped with lime marinated onions and salsa habanera mayo

Oaxacan Black Mole Chicken Taco - Spices, Chiles, Nuts, and Chocolate

Realizing that an inordinate portion of our travel west, from the Port Fonda experience at Greendirt Farm outside of Kansas City to The Shed and Salsa Brava, had focused on Mexican food I couldn't help but pass by La Condessa while my mother was in town for tacos and although I know some in Phoenix may claim the space is not "authentic" enough for them (from what I've gathered, according to some locals you need to have questionable evaluations from the Health Department to be legit) I can say without a doubt that although I've not been south of the border, these are the best tacos I've ever tasted.

Beginning first with another free chips-and-salsa-bar stocked with a baker's dozen of house-made salsas and sauces paired with slightly salted, almost greaseless, and pleasantly warm tortilla chips and moving on to the four tacos featuring local produce and fresh proteins on (unfortunately not house made) imported flour tortillas I particularly enjoyed the crunchy texture and delicate flavors of the shrimp taco while the bright acidity of the pork shoulder and smoky spice of the chicken taco both worked nicely as well.  

Perhaps not as regional as some taco stands (or trucks) and instead choosing to focus on the depth and breadth of Mexican cuisine from coast to coast I'm sure the is "better" or "more authentic" cuisine to be found both here and over the border, but thus far I've not experienced it (outside of the vastly more upscale, expensive, and certainly less authentic Distrito.)

Walked in tonite which restaurant was busy due to Glendale Glitters. Since I was by myself I sat at bar. After at least 10 minutes, I left due to no one greeting me or asking me if I wanted a drink despite multiple servers coming in & out my of bar area. Maybe no one is served at bar & only for show. Even as I walked out one server just looked at me & smiled which she saw me sitting at bar. I suggest your restaurant work on greeting people & making them feel welcome instead of ignoring them. You lost a customer tonite.

For our Sunday lunch we were in the mood for some truly authentic tacos and thought we'd give this place a try.

Location & Aesthetics - located on N 16th Street in Phoenix which I noticed can be a little busy with traffic even though it was Sunday.
Parking is a little poor (-1) with a few stalls located outside the restaurant, and some of these parking spots are shared with another business on the corner.  
I did notice some other available parking in the vicinity but believed they were for other businesses.
Unfortunately N 16th Street was busy, at the time of our visit, so you can't really stop alongside the parking spots to wait for someone to leave as that might cause some traffic on the busy street.  Thankfully there's a side street on the right that you can turn into to turn around.
The facade of the restaurant cannot be missed with its brightly green colored painting and large saint figure adorning the front of the restaurant.  
Another drawback the restaurant had going for it, in my opinion, is the small interior size (-1).  
As soon as you open the door, you will immediately notice how small it is as you will see diners siting at their tables right at the door as you enter.  I can see this could be a little bothersome if you've been seated close to the front door, and with it opening and closing, doesn't bode well for a nice dining experience for some.
There is a bench outside of the restaurant for you to wait for seating if the inside is full, and with no real shade and I didn't see any misters, that can be uncomfortable, I guess, during the summer months.

Menus - provided to us as soon as we were shown where to sit and were pretty self-explanatory.   

Service - We were warmly greeted by staff upon entering.  It might've been nice if we were asked if we've been here before but no problem as any questions we had, was answered promptly.

Food - Once seated, you are provided with a bowl of tortilla chips, and there's an available salsa bar with a large variety of salsa dips to choose from.  The dips all sit on ice being chilled and have varying degrees of hotness.  From the 5-6 dips that I chose from, they all tasted freshly made and was enough to open the appetite.
Prior to ordering, I was in the mood for some libations and ordered myself a mojito which in my opinion was perfectly concocted as you could taste the lime juice (tasted fresh), rum, right amount of sugar, and contained enough leaves of mint.
For food, I ordered the -- Baja Sur Dogfish Shark Taco, Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco, and the Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken Shark Taco with a side of rice and beans.  
All three tacos tasted absolutely great and delicious.  There were all flavorful, seasoned well, fresh, not too spicy, and cooked just right.

Definitely a place I wouldn't mind returning to.

Salsa Bar is still on point. I feel like with the expansion its not as cozy and the music did not match the restaurant any more. Food was still great and the Horchata is still MVP. Service was still great, I just personally enjoyed the place when it was smaller. The air conditioning was a bit to cold even though it was 115 out! All in all not a bad place to grab a bite.

My mom and I were referred to go to this place for some tacos and so when she was visiting me in Phoenix, we finally went to check it out! We pulled up and were very skeptical by the look of the outside, but we were greeted right away to pick a table. We both got the Cabo Shrimp Taco and a steak taco and it had this amazing fried cheese in it. And the salsa bar was amazing. I think the Cilantro salsa was my favorite. The beans and rice were also to die for. The shrimp in my taco were so delicious. I couldn't get over how amazing this place was. We happened to go for happy hour and got $5 Grapefruit margaritas as well. BEST MEXICAN FOOD EVER. I wish there was one in California. 

P.S- Everyone around us ordered a quesadilla because they are stuffed inside their homemade tortillas and deep fried. Can't wait to go back and try these. 

The service was awesome, too!
This small restaurant is amazing! The food is wonderful would highly recommend this place. Its not super fancy but the food all but makes up for it. The El Gatcho is the way to go!~

Great place. Easy to miss though, so look closely. Small place and not much parking! Once we actually found it (we drove right past it the first time) we were greeted warmly. The menu is extensive and there are a ton of great options for vegetarians. First time I've ever had grilled cactus (and it was great!). The server was friendly, the food was fresh, and everything came out really quickly. They also have a salsa bar so you can try a bunch of different salsas on your food. The decor was also pretty awesome- lots of Day of the Dead decor. The overwhelmingly positive reviews are justified.
Vine  aquí con mi familia después de ir al zoo   La comida excelente el servicio maravilloso especialmente nuestro mesero  Joe.  Esta es nuestra segunda ve y se que volveremos

Thanks fellow yelpers. 
Heading home to Seattle from an awesome spring break with family needing some good Mexican before hitting the airport. 
This place delivered. Exactly what we were hoping for. Street Tacos were awesome, salsa bar a hit with everyone in the family and the guacamole with cranberries were legit. 
Thanks for keeping it real.

The Gandhi burrito was amazing!!! I substituted the rice for cheese and it tasted delicious!!! Everyone raved about the salsa bar, but the salsas seemed old and noone was refilling them, it was a great concept but wish it was more fresh! The horschatta was also good, a but pricy but it has fruits and pecans which we never had before! My husband got the tacos which were good but not the best hes ever had. I would def go to get the burrito
Definitely the best mexican place in the west valley! Very authentic and unique flavors! Escape all the chains and go to this place! You can't go wrong with the margarita that has grapefruit in it!
Diverse menu and great salsa bar.  Fabulous service and will return.  Came in for breakfast, but ended up downing 3 tacos.

I was craving tacos and so glad I came here. Food is very well priced and service was so friendly. They were very patient with my mom who can be slow to order and very picky so I really appreciated their taking the time to explain the menu and make recommendations. The salsa bar is unbelievable, like 12 different kinds to try. I got street tacos and they were very filling and tasty. The space is small and it's in an area that could use some love but I say have the proper expectations and you won't be disappointed. Finally, the art will catch your eye from the old timey wooden doors to the luchador decor in the bathrooms to the day of the dead altar. My favorite was the painting over the salsa bar.

The best Mexican restaurant in Phoenix. Amazing recipes for tacos and quesadillas, like the chimichurri style Gaucho. They have incredible breakfasts, too. Incredible chilaquiles! And their salsa bar is world class. Finally, the servers are pros: so efficient and friendly. We don't go anywhere else in downtown.
Incredible tacos and quesadillas and salsa bar like the original, plus the space is large and beautiful! Service is a little slower, though.

Yummy deliciouuuuus mole!

A bit too pricey for Tacos/Mexican food.

Place is VERY small.

Salsa selection is very interesting, lots of different ones, some that I had NEVER seen in my life, and I am Mexican.

I will definitely try their quesadillas if I decide to give them another chance.
Great food all around. I usually get the Fundido, Argentine quesa, or any of the tacos. After that load up on the crazy salsa choices.

The place is very compact. Way too small for my taste so it's not very comfortable to dine in. The salsa bar has good salsas but presentation make sit unappealing. Service took really long but all in all the food was ok. The horchata was really good!

Really disappointed in this place, the two stars were  only given because the restaurant and bathroom was clean and the only saving grace I would recommend is the "cochinita pibil" taco. Let me begin by saying we came in sat down restaurant was empty waitresses were talking amongst themselves for a good 8 minutes before we were greeted. Cool not a big problem they are only human. The menu had a terrible background which made it hard to see the selections and I kind of wished our waitress interacted with us and suggested some good eats. It was like a hi here's the menu Be back in 10 kind of service. I ordered the Hochata because of the good reviews husband ordered a sprite. The hochata had walnuts with strawberries, but the strawberries tasted very acidy which threw off the drink and the hochata was very watered down. The complimentary chips were cold,stale and burnt.  It was nice they had a salsa bar but they weren't anything special the cups were so tiny you had to go multiple times(not a deal breaker as I can see it as cost effective for them I suppose.) The restaurant was cute but very tiny. My husband's order was "meh" from what he said  he ate only  half. I ordered the three taco plate because I wanted to try the selection here's where it gets interesting: the "cochinita pibil" was pretty good if there's one stand out thing I can say in that menu it's that! Tasted as good as authentic. It was the only solace for me. The other taco I ordered was the "Al' pastor" guys this taco was so bland and dry and fatty not in a good way but when you bit into it it was literally chewy pieces of pork fat there was more fat then meat. The worst taco after this was the Mahi A'l pastor" it smelled really bad. I've had mahi before and it wasn't the regular smell it should smell like however I thought well I'm pregnant so I thought maybe it's just my hormones and smell sense. Well I decided to give it to my husband because it was giving me nausea and I thought nothing of it til we left and I asked him what he thought of it. Now mind you my husband is not picky and loves fish loves the outdoors eating deer wild things etc. but he said "I took one bite and almost threw up" it tasted like the smell of cow manure I couldn't swallow the first bite." So we both guessed late that it was spoiled. He didn't want to make a fuss and I thought it was just me. But nope we were right. The only thing that crosses my mind is as a cook as a server why would you think it would be alright to serve this to someone if it smelled awful? We paid 40 dollars for three tacos,beans rice and one burrito and two non alcoholic drinks. Which was pricy for the quality to be so disappointing. That was enough for me to say on to you guys that be very cautious in going here. I do not recommend it and we will not come here again unfortunately.

This is taco heaven. 

Starting with the salsa bar that has several different types of salsas. From your classic pico, to pecan, strawberry, and the popular cilantro-cream, plus many more. Emphasis on the pecan because sweet jesus that stuff is so good. 

Refreshing Jamaica? Check. Sweet, milky horchata with nuts & fruit? Check. 

Lots of variety. The Mahi Mahi tacos, the Sonoran carne, the Dogfish, the Cabo shrimp - all of them are incredibly delicious. They do seafood very well here; never over or undercooked, and usually served up with fresh cabbage and drizzled with mayo, mole, or what have you. The rice is also excellent - always tender and perfectly seasoned. The Bullet burro (beans & cheese) is also pretty good, especially when you smother it in their fresh cilantro salsa. 

I've noticed some people saying they wish it was located in downtown-downtown Phoenix (what they really mean is gentrified), but I disagree. I like the location, especially because it's nestled in on the same street with other less "hip" mom & pop shops. It has a great neighborhood vibe - very comfortable. 
 
Put simply, I love this place. If you haven't tried it, you're missing out.

Mixed feelings about this place - the food was great, the salsa bar awesome, and the service really bad.  I really like the filling choices,  especially in a taco.  Their quesadillas are like a thick fry bread, I though they we're too greasy but everyone else raved.

Leave extra time to check out, it took longer than the meal.
Amazing food!!! Great service!!! Loved it!!! I will go back for sure! The guacamole salsa was amazing!!!
OMG! The best horchata and the salsa bar was great. The tacos were to die for and I loved the mole taco.

Went to La Santisima for lunch on Cinco de Mayo with some colleagues. The restaurant is on the smaller side, and you order your food and pay at the register, and then find a table. 
The restaurant has a salsa bar with a lot of good options. I had the guacamole and pico, both were excellent. Would have been nice if they replaced the chips on our table - having four of us the first basket didn't last long.
I had chicken tacos for my meal, which were also good. The tacos were a lighter Mexican meal, which wasn't a bad thing for lunch time. Rice and beans both good. 
Prices were reasonable. Overall would recommend.

Best part was the chips & different salsas (tried 3 & they were all fresh & delicious). The tacos were another story. Had the carne asada: dry, chewy, and flavorless. This isn't a taco truck, I expect better.
Food is very good. I had the al pastor quesadilla which is unbelievable. The service was slow and waiter a bit grumpy but the food is worth coming back for.
Taco are good but the service is always very disappointing. Very slow...... My husband order a margarita and even though it was very delicious it took 15 to arrive vat the table.

My coworker and I stopped here for lunch today. The selections on the menu are plentiful and overwhelming. I was impressed with the variety of vegetarian options. I had the gaucho burrito, and my coworker had the Azteca Tinga burrito. The food was amazing! Make sure you get the horchata. It was the best I've ever had. There were strawberries, apples, and nuts in the drink. You will be mad at yourself later if you don't order it. The salsa bar is also ridiculously good, but your burrito will need no condiments.

This place is completely unique and the food is very good. They have this thing they call a quesa, which is raw corn tortilla dough that they roll out and stuff with the meat of your choice (we tried the Sonora Arrachera Quesa), close it up and deep fry it. OMG, what a flavor explosion! We also had the Carne Asada and Aztec Tinga tacos. Both were delicious, but fair warning, the Tinga is a tad messy to eat, so don't wear white. Their list of taco and burrito options is lengthy, (including meatless) and there has to be something for everyone. I was a little dissapointed in their salsa bar. It has tons of tasty choices, but really, most of them are what I think of as sauces (no texture) and not salsas. Great for the tacos, not so much for the chips. Besides the chips, there is nothing with any crunch (i.e. flauta, crispy taco, chimichanga) on the menu, which is odd since they do fry the Quesas (they have a light crispiness, but the thickness of the dough prevents them from being crunchy). For those two reasons, I am giving four stars rather than five, but don't let that fool you. The food is top notch!
I love this restaurant!  Everything I have gotten is delicious.  I am a vegetarian and there are multiple options for me when I go.  They have a salsa bar so you can try different things at once.

Tried the tacos and their unique quesadillas. Two thumbs up - though my waistline might not appreciate too many of those fried quesadillas, lol. They'll have to be a treat - not a regular thing for me.

Their salsa bar is a lot of fun. Be prepared to spend some time sampling all of them.

Gotta love the dia de los muertos decorating. Unique!

BEST HORCHATA EVER!  I've never liked horchata, but I was told this was the best of the best and I absolutely had to try it.  So, I did and I am SO glad that I did.  I would go back for the horchata alone.  Amazing.  I'm already planning a trip back just for the horchata!

I get the 3 street taco combo with rice and beans.  I've had the carne asada, al pastor and cochinita.  The carne asada was delicious and the cochinita was good, but my absolute favorite was the al pastor.  It's the best al pastor taco I've ever had!

The salsa bar is awesome.  My favorite is the tomatillo and my friend loved the chipotle.  It has something for everything and it's all fresh.

All in all - a great little place (emphasis on little - probably not great for a large ground of people).  The food is authentic and very, very good - I'm pretty sure you can't go wrong here.

Worth any wait,  ours was minimal.  Horchata and salsa bar were great highlights! 

Loved the decor and character of the place.  Dia del morte all about including cool mosaic tile art. We walked right up past the bar to look up menus and wait on a table.  No tables available.  I was directed to use the men's room.  Which was decorated yet cluttered with a music stand,  stool,  and supplies.  I couldn't open the slider lock easily and had feared they'd have to break the door down but I got lucky and got out.   By the time I got out,  only a few minutes,  my friend was seated.  Tunes were good,  Even when I couldn't understand the music I was grooving. 

Menu was a bit overwhelming with so many choices.  Got the best horchata ever with strawberries, cantaloupe, and pecans.  It was mammoth. 

Settled in on a fish taco and Mahi Mahi,  both grilled.  They were hot to handle,  and a bit over filled.  Nice because good value,  but the bottom tortillas were soggy. 

Only got two bites of this delishness in,  because I filled up on chips and fun salsas from the salsa bar.  The horchata contributed too. 

The peanut salsa was the hottest,  and the salsa de albor was my first experience with this fruity hot Mexican Chile.  The jicama was nice and refreshing and cooling but very hard to get on the chip as by its nature wasn't saucy.  However the cilantro was too soupy so I could only pour it on.  The pecan wasn't spicy like the peanut and was therefore nice against the heat as well.

My friend and I stopped in here after a day of shopping and it was nearby.  The reviews on  yelp made us stop by.

The three stars are really based on the quality of the food and the location of the restaurant to me.  

The food quality was good, but didn't knock my socks off.  I can get just as good tacos elsewhere in the valley.
- Two taco plate ($9) - had two different kind of tacos, with two tortillas per taco type, rice and beans.  I had the smoked marlin, which I tasted more of the salsa than the marlin...  and the Sonoran carne asada tacos which were yummy but I've had better elsewhere.
- I also wanted to try the el pastor street tacos ($3 for two tortillas).  They were yummy but sadly I had Rocky Point on the top of my mind and I remember getting better there.... 
-My friend got a chicken deep friend quesas that had peppers and onions in it.  It was very yummy and a large portion but very rich.

The restaurant was cute, but small.  Luckily it was just the two of us because a large group would be too much.
The menu was extensive, it was hard to make a decision.
There were tons of salsas to try and a free basket of chips when we sat down, so it was fun to try all the different salsas.

The wait staff was friendly and attentive, I really did like my lunch there but I wouldn't call myself a "fan".  It was good though, and if I happen to be in the area (which is very rare) I would stop in.
Smells like mop bucket from cleaning floors. Ordered pastor burrito enchilada style. No cheese inside or out. Was still pretty tasty.

Food here is delicious and the drinks as well.
My issue is when you call to try and place a pick up order; they ask you to hold but take forever or don't come back to the phone. I've been on hold for over 22 minutes to place an order for co-workers and myself. I would rate it higher if the phone orders weren't such an issue
Wonderful food, great service. This place is a must go to. The food is very authentic and presented well. Will come again.

The first time i came here i remember sharing the hell out of it on social media and kind of convincing myself that the $5 tacos were amazing.  After visiting a few more times i realized the cool factor and individuality here just doesn't really match up to the much more traditional tacos you find at other spots.  The tacos are not bad, but overthought, and the flavors in many of the "gourmet" tacos just don't really do it for me.  Too much going on at once.  Another thing that causes my 3 star review is the salsa bar.  At first glance it looks very promising with lots of options and colors.  Once again the taste of the numerous salsas is lacking something.  Its like 10 salsas that are just OK when you could have knocked a simple red and green sauce out of the park instead.  They're drinks are good and i really like the vibe inside, but i don't think it lives up to the hype that the many reviews will lead you to believe.

Service was super slow we waited 70 minutes from when we ordered to get our food. Food was cold the only good thing was the chips and salas waitress blamed it on having only one cook because the other two cooks left early. Will never go back there hopefully the one off 16th street is better. Oh and my Wife had to leave the bathroom door cracked open with a chair because the light was burnt out

I was so disappointed by our meal! :( I really wanted to give this place a chance..

PROS
The salsa bar is very extensive and you can tell that it is all homemade! Great selection and favorites were the salsa verde
Cheap beer - Modelos were $3
My favorite taco was the Al Pastor, added pico and extra lime

CONS
Very small place, we got there early to avoid the wait
Seating by the window can be VERY warm especially during these summer months
Music was static and scratchy it was annoying while eating
The chicken mole taco was such a disappointment - the flavors were not right
The rice was non traditional was just plain with no cilantro or salsa/seasonings

Did we eat most of our taco platters? Yes.
Did we think service was a little spotty and can be improved? Yes.
Do we think that our divey place in Downtown Chandler is levels above this "modern/more pricy" version that is out of the way location wise) for us? Yes.

After sampling five tacos, I'll jump on the La Santisima train. A lot of other people have already been riding it with the four and a half star rating in 1.3 K reviews. The street tacos, the service, and the salsa bar were the standouts for us.

We had no wait when we entered on a Friday at 1:30 and were seated at the two top right by the bar. We were served by I believe one of the owners or managers and he took great care of us also answering questions and offering suggestions. The tacos are divided into a "gourmet" and "street" section, priced at $3.99/$2.25 respectively. If you don't want your protein in a taco, they also serve burros, quesadillas, and lonches. If I had my dirty menu police badge on, I would have cited them for one count as there was a couple splotches of salsa verde on my menu.

We upgraded to two combos for a buck and change so we could have some beans and rice. And of course we sampled plenty of salsas while eating our chips. I enjoyed all three of the street tacos we ordered. The shark taco was overcooked and the corners were tough. The black mole was different with a deeper flavor with bitter notes and very mild sweetness. For two combo plates with 5 tacos, $20 was an affordable price. I'll definitely see what else they have to offer on the next train stop.

I can come back to this place anytime! I always recommend this Mexican Gourmet restaurant to all my friends when they are up to trying something new. 
I love ordering the street tacos with rice and beans. The Cochinito Pibil meat is very delicious. The horchata is mouth watering! The horchata is served with pineapples, strawberries, and peanuts at the top of the drink. 
It's a great place for a date, lunch, or after work happy hour. I wouldn't recommend big parties.

I was excited to try this place as had been recommended to me by several people.  The white fish tacos are amazing, the salsa was fresh and yummy! Sadly only one girl was serving the entire restaurant, she did the best she could.  Oddly our table was falling apart, literally the pieces of siding was broke and hanging on, was just hoping it would not pinch our arms. I was ok with the broken furniture; but was very disappointed in the temperature was the adult beverages.  Initially ordered a glass of the house white wine and it was served warm, decided to grab a beer in hopes the beverage temp would be different sadly it was not. The beer was a hair colder then the warm wine, beverage refrigerator may need to be checked. Will try again if see coupon.

Oh the HORROR!! 

I can here on a lunch date with my husband and two year old. We had an hour since it was on my husbands lunch break, and decided on this place because I was craving some "street tacos", and the reviews/pictures looked awesome.... oh how I was wrong!!

Seems easier to number all the issues we had!

1. We walk in at 12:10 to a nearly empty restaurant, I first try to use the bathroom, and the light wasn't working... that should have been my first clue. 
2. We sit down and a few minutes later the place is packed, but for some reason everyone has been help except us!?! 
3. Finally someone comes to help, I ordered the horchata since it was mentioned so frequently in the reviews, my husband ordered a Sierra Mist (remember it came in a to-go cup with a lid)  The horchata was bizarra, and $4
4. My 2 year old daughter grabs the free chips.. and I see MOLD on it, then realize the whole basket is full of moldy chips!! No wonder they are free!
5. A different waiter finally shows up since the other waitress was busy taking care of the customers that came AFTER us... I ordered the Sonora Arrachera Taco, and told them about the MOLDY chips, he apologized and took the chips away.  The original waitress came back, apologized for the chips, and said she would comp the drinks, I returned the horchata, and got a Sierra Mist as well (also came in a to-go cup, there's a reason I am mentioning this)
6. After 20 min and being there for 40 and food had not arrived I asked for it to-go. about 5 min later it came along with the bill that only included the food.

By this point I was annoyed but probably wouldn't have given it 1 star, so we leave with to-go cups in hand along with food. I dropped my husband off at work, then drove home. When I got home I ate 1 taco which was pretty good, the meat was flavorful and tender, I only wished I had some of that salsa to add to it. Then I got a text from my husband.....

7. My husband asks "is your Sierra Mist BROWN??? I  open the lid and sure enough it looks like dirty water!!!

Seconds later the entire meal... is in the trash! VOMIT!   I gave this place more chances then I ever give a place. WILL NOT BE GOING BACK!

We were taken aback by the decor, waitstaff, the patrons, and classic rock playing, because it appeared filled with hipsters,  an all male staff, and an interior with a very confused identity.   HOWEVER, I will be returning, and I will tell you why.....
       1. Salsa bar, simply delicious.  All of them. From mild, to smoky, to hot, there's a peanut and pecan salsa, jicama, guacamole, Pico de gallo, and several more. 
       2. Great menu choices, not your typical American/Mexican options.  
       3. The street tacos! !! We chose Al Pastor,  Carne Asada, y Cochinita Pibil with rice and beans. Uhhhhh-mazing!  

From a white girl who used to never eat Mexican, who is now married to a Mexican.....
I was totally impressed. My husband said 4 stars, because he's got a picky palette. 
Thoroughly enjoyed my meal! Can't wait to return for a Horchata, and to try the Mole!

I think most people have a "go to" restaurant & for us it's this amazing place for Mexican food.  We've been around the Phoenix area for many years.  It's wonderful to see a new business succeed right from the start.  That's this place !  Wonderful menu!  Excellent service!  Nice atmosphere!  If you're in the east valley or really anywhere in the valley, give it a try!  You won't be disappointed!

We were visiting from Seattle and were excited for some great Mexican food and based on the reviews La Santisima seem to be the spot. Our visit started with us waiting for about 5 minutes to be seated in a restaurant with only three tables being served. The service continued to be slow and not very interested in our experience. We started with two margaritas and when I finished mine I wasn't offered another. Once the food arrived it was very authentic but wasn't fabulous.

Met up with Aileen mid week.  A really cute place! I loved the artwork. I had this place bookmarked for the  longest time. 

I ordered the fish tacos and they were a-ok nothing stood out for me. We both ordered house margaritas and mine was a little too strong but tasty to Aileen.   If I am ever in the area I might try different menu items.
Stopped in for lunch. Had the dark mole shrimp tacos. Delicious, with a great salsa bar. I like the atmosphere of a small place with good tacos.

LOVE LOVE LOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOVE this place.

I have found my new place that I will go to for tacos over all else now. 

So my mind was way bigger than my tummy but here is what I ordered:

1. Aztec Tinga Taco- Spicy yummy and honestly one of my favorite Mexican dishes so this was one of my top fav's

2. Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco- This is how I found this place and it was a good taco but didn't stand with my other tacos in taste.

3. Arrachera steak Taco-  This was the first I ate and it was awesome the steak was nice and charred and the flavor was just killer.

4. Oaxaca Black Mole Chicken Taco-  Woooooow this one was awesome packed full of flavor and was very moist.  This was another one of my fav's.

5. Gaucho Taco-  This was my total favorite.  It was a carne asada steak taco with avocado and Argentinian Chimicurri sauce on it.  Oh man sooooo yummy I am drooling just thinking about it right now.  

Last I had the Horchata which had a interesting twist with fresh fruit and pecans in it.  Honestly it was one of the best Horchata's I've ever had.  

On top of all this they have an AMAZING salsa bar with about 15 different salsas for all palates.  

If you've never gone take my advice and go and thank me later.  I can't wait to go back probably won't make it past tomorrow.  :)

Finally La Condessas sister spot is open. If you love La Condessa and are on the Westside then make sure to come in. The Horchata is the best I've ever had. My favorite tacos are the chicken mole, tinga, cochinita pibil, and el gaucho. They have a huge salsa bar with tons of options.

I was craving nopales so I searched for nopales. Not only did La Santisima have them they cooked them to perfection. I can't recall the name of the taco I had but they're in the veggie section. The salsas are tasty, the service is friendly and the tacos are bomb. You can't go wrong with this place.

Saw this restaurant on Dinners, Drive-ins and Dives tv show...went down the next day and had lunch with my son and future daughter in law...OMG! This is what I have been waiting for since we move to Arizona 11 years ago...Let me describe the food...no wait...I can't except to say that layers of complex and subtle flavors is unique in every dish. I had tacos...These are the real deal tacos and they do not skimp on the meat!
My son is a fine dining head chef and has taught me how to taste and eat really good food. This place is all of that and more...We ordered the Al Pastor Quesa to share...my sone that is without doubt the finest and most complete Quesa he has ever had in his mouth...It was to die for. 
I had the El Gaucho Taco...trust me...order this! it was huge and complex...I was tasting new flavors every bite...I also got the Mayan Cochinita Pibil Taco...pulled pork with a hint of some spice that drove us all crazy tying to identify it...I will be back for both for sure. I waited a long time to find this place...you simply must try it...you will never go back to your heavy, greasy stand-by.
I wish they had 10 starts to award. this place rocks in a way your mouth will now best!
Enjoyed this small boutique Mexican restaurant with emphasis on healthy and unique dishes.  Friendly service.

We just got off the plane from Kansas City and needed to eat quickly. We looked on Yelp and found this amazing place. We loved the salsa bar and the three different tacos we had. All we can say is "WOW"!!
We now wish they would come to KC.

A coworker introduced me to this place.I went to their Glendale location. There are a lot of different types of tacos with very different types of fish and meats you just don't find anywhere else. The salsa bar has a wide variety of salsa's with varying amounts of heat. My only con and I took away a star for it was service. It was sooo slow. Even to pay the bill I eventually had to get up and find someone to get the bill. Overall I really like this place and would recommend it.

I had been wanting to come here for a long, long time! My friend Cynthia went here a few months ago, and told me it was legit! (I trust her opinion...she was born/raised in San Diego, and she knows what's up when it comes to Mexican food!)  We finally made it down here the other day for dinner.  We parked in the back lot, and walked inside.  We were greeted immediately and shown to a table.  We were served a basket of chips, browsed the menu for a bit and then placed our order.  I went with a plethora of tacos which included a fish taco, a mole taco, a cochinita pibil taco, an al pastor taco and a carne asada taco.  Here is how they were.............

Fish Taco-  They make these with dogfish.  It was a hefty sized taco and it was mighty delicious.  It had 2 pieces of perfectly fried fish inside.  I had never had dogfish until today.  It was a very meaty and chewy fish.  Most fish tacos are white fish that break apart easily.  This fish was almost like a steak!  I would definitely get this one again.

Mole Taco-  Shredded chicken with a rich mole sauce service on top of a double corn tortilla.  It was good, but not my favorite of my selections.  Not sure if I would get this one again.  A tad messy, too.

Cochinita Pibil Taco-  This was roasted pork shoulder topped with pickled red onions.  The pork was nice and moist, and the onions gave it a nice bite.  I would get it again.

Al Pastor Taco-  This taco came topped with a a decent amount of pork, some hot red sauce, some cool avocado sauce and also some pineapple.  It was definitely tasty.  Maybe not on par with my Tacos El Gordo in SD, but still a good al pastor taco.  I would get this one again.

Carne Asada Taco-  This was my favorite of the day!  This taco came prepared simple with just steak and some cabbage (It's an AZ thing..the cabbage).  This steak was so well marinated, and so tender, it was a pleasure to eat.  I wish I would have ordered maybe 3 or 4 of these things.  It was by far the best carne asada I have had in AZ, and could hold its own vs any asada back in SD.  It was incredibly legit!  I may come back and get this in a burrito from here.  Winner, winner, carne asada dinner! 

Besides the great tacos, this place has a super awesome salsa bar!  They had at least 10 different, home made salsas on display.  I tried about 5 of them and each one was unique and tasty.  They have great chips, too!  Thin and crispy!  They went well with all the great salsas.  We got 2 baskets full.

Service was on point and all the young ladies working in the place were on top of everything!  I'm glad I went here and will definitely be coming back...soon!  Best Mexican food I have had in AZ so far!

Good tacos that are large in portions and progressive on taste (not your typical sauces)  with an even better salsa bar.    Reminds me of a high end mexican place with the prices to match.   As a result, I would highly recommend you to visit this place for the food.

I was excited to try this restaurant because of the other great reviews that others had written. The restaurant is fairly small, but definitely authentically Mexican. 

When my party and I first sat down, we were given a bowl of fresh tortilla chips, and were encouraged to try a variety of salsas at the salsa bar. The salsas were interesting to taste, and helped make this restaurant unique from others that I have tried.

I ordered the tamarind soda, which was nothing special, and honestly just tasted like normal soda. Although the restaurant is well-known for their tacos, I decided to order the Al Pastor burro (burrito) which contained pork, guacamole, pineapple salsa and lettuce. The burrito tasted flavorful, fresh and delicious. I would definitely come back for another round.

The salsa bar is the reason to go.
They also have a full bar with a bunch of tequila options as well.
The restaurant is kind of dark and small but I'm kind of into that so I liked it. They are vegetarian as well as vegan friendly, limited options but still always appreciated.

I tried this joint simply because of the great reviews on yelp. I was not disappointed. There is an awesome salsa bar. The service was great. The staff was helpful and friendly. The food alone was worth the trip, but there was just so many wonderful elements. I had a steak and bean burro. The steak was seasoned perfectly and had a nice crust of season on it. The horchata is seriously the best I've ever had. I can't wait to take everyone I know to this great spot. Enjoy!

Amazing salsa bar, I have still yet to try all the salsas but I'm working on it. The food is good, environment is cozy. Not some sort of franchised restaurant which is a plus (2 locations tho), overall good place though.

The Countess, she is beautiful, she is talented, she is delightful and she is bountiful, she is saucy (in the "salsa" sense of the word, not the "descarado" sense of the word:)...she's also cheap:)

But then again, so am I:)

It's Taco Tuesday (as I write this...who knows when I'll finish it and post it...maybe next Taco Tuesday...maybe not:)

But today, I needed to retox after my run along the mighty Scottsdale River (or the Crosscut Canal as the flatlanders refer to it:)

I was going to wander over to Cien Agave, when my buddy called and said he'd gotten done with an open heart surgery early (usually, that's a very bad sign, but not today...he said everything went "swimmingly":) but after 12 hours of holding someone's life in his hands, he too was in need of a retox:)

We agreed that it was time to go see The Countess:)

I've seen a bunch of glowing reviews on good ol' Yelp and as I always do when I read the praise heaped on a particular place by my Yelp brethren and sistren, I thought "I'll be the judge of that!":)

Not that I don't trust the reviews...I do, or I wouldn't have jumped in the rig, pulled the belts tight and lit the turbocharger in order to get my retox going:)

No..."trust, but verify"...those words were given to all of us during an episode of Death Valley Days by a nearly washed up actor (whose name escapes me at the moment)... 

http://tinyurl.com/yfg9e39

Well, it's all true enough...the black mole chicken is subtle but spicy...the cochinita is saucy and inviting...the dog shark taco may be made with the only fish that travels well to the desert (no, don't get too excited...not the best fish taco I ever had...but very good:)

And more than enough to eat from an inexpensive platter of softball sized tacos (I know, I called The Countess "cheap" a few paragraphs ago, but what I meant was a solid value:)...Two big, round, tumescent taco's with rice and frijoles'...$7.59, USD:)

And plenty of salsa...oh yes...lots and lots of salsa...saucy, saucy salsa:)

None of the legendary "strawberry salsa" today (probably like the Yeti...plenty of sightings, but no actual evidence:)...but I didn't care...they still had a dozen salsas to choose from:)

And all the salsas seemed to complement my taco's...how is it even possible that Peanut Salsa and Smokey Chipotle Salsa BOTH taste exquisite with the moles and the pork shoulder?

I don't know...I asked my buddy...he's a trained physician and he didn't know either (so what good is he?...unless I need a heart transplant and then, you know...he's a god:)

As I contemplated all of the fresh and interesting selections available at the salsa bar, I thought to myself "well, it's a bar, why don't I just pull up a chair and make a day of it?" :-)

After The Countess herself came out and asked me to please eat at my own table and quit embarrassing myself and my lunch buddies, I remembered that this kind of thing is what got me banned from the Top of the Mark in San Francisco (although I will tell you what I told the SFPD...having a Caviar Bar with bar stools in close proximity is just asking for it:)

We finished our delightful lunch without further incident and agreed that this place should be much closer to our respective homes and open 24/7 so we can walk over and grab a burro or a platter of tacos whenever we feel like it...which would be pretty much every day, for at least 2 meals:)

Do you think The Countess will go for that?

She is sweet, spicy, smooth, and exotic.

But don't talk about her like that, because she is La Santisima, and that means saintly, perv.

To her 16 salsas, I'm forever faithful. I can't even bring myself to eat a shrimp burrito or dogfish shark taco* from anywhere else.** 

I swear, I'm a one-burrito woman. Let La Santisima show you the light.

*No dogs/fish were harmed in the making of this taco. 
**dogfish shark tacos aren't available anywhere else around here, anyway.

Dayyyum! I'm not Mexican so you could cook a cat in mole and call it authentic and I'd believe it so if this place is authentic, good for them. It's not your run of the mill taco truck kind of food. Fancy tacos that are worth the price. I'm sad I don't live closer :( but I'd travel for another of their shrimp taco. Also, I'd recommend the mole taco...everything was really good. Beware about the guacamole at the salsa bar!!! It's beyond spicy! My tongue is still recovering from the scorch. The horchata is really something you've got to try too. Prepare to spend a weeks worth of groceries kind of money...but enjoy :)

the service wasn't the greatest, but their salsa bar makes up for it... and their guacamole is the bees knees the place is rather small so it wouldn't be the best choice if you have a large group. also, get the horchata! it's really big and pretty sweet so it's something you could totally share with a friend :)

Very good Mexican food, would advise anyone in the area to try this.  We make it a point to go to Triple D restaurants and decided to give this a try and it did not disappoint.  It is a small venue with not much seating, but it is well worth the little wait that we had.

We will NEVER return. This was a TERRIBLE, AWFUL experience from beginning to end...service, food, everything has taken me from a patron who took out-of-towners here, to someone who will NEVER return to this location. Biggest offense - serving beef in the veggie tacos and burros - more than once to the same table, and other tables.

The scene: Friday evening ~6:30 pm. There are six 4-tops available, a long both (seating ~15) reserved with no one there yet, all but 1 table unoccupied on the patio, and the long table with 6-8 seats left. In other words, they were not full, no one ever waited for a table to finish before being seated. Despite this, the hostess (and waitress) looked around curiously wondering where to seat us? Anywhere would have worked, and so we were seated. As is custom, we quickly received tortilla chips and were welcomed to the salsa bar.

However, 20 minutes passed before our waitress returned to take our drink order. Based on this, we also placed our entree order. The waitress either has issues with getting the orders correct, or just likes to correct guest annunciations. For instance, the menu says quesa, so we say quesa and she has to repeat oh you mean quesadilla? Not sure why but we rolled with it. 

Another 5-10 minutes pass before everyone's drinks arrived (and some of the salsas are very spicy!). We had to ask for waters and were served warm water in clear plastic 12 ou solo cups. The table next to us actually received iced water in real glasses with beautiful blue rims. 

We witnessed another table receive their food, only to have half the food removed before two new entrees appeared They were served the wrong items. Huh. Kinda weird. That happened to me last time we were there, but they caught it before I could even take a bite. These people had begun eating and had to point out to the staff that there were issues. Wanna know the issues? BEEF in the VEGAN tacos. How did we find that out you may ask? Guess!

So, after at least 15 minutes (all our drinks are empty and were never asked if we wanted another cerveza or margarita or even sip of water), two of our four dinner entrees were served. Here's where I believe you Yelpers probably have guessed it - one of those was a VEGAN burro - served with BEEF! When we mentioned this to the waitress 7 minutes later refilling the tables drink order next to us. She apologized and mentioned that happened at another table too. She returned with a new (not grilled, kinda gross looking) burro.

Apparently there was a new chef. Yes, let's blame everything on him! More time passes and my entree (taco plate) contained a veggie la santisima taco (missing several listed ingredients such as onions and spinach) but only with cheese, mushrooms, and peppers, and BEEF! Yes there was beef on this too. Not much, but at least one piece is something suppose to be meat free. My shrimp cabo was SPECIFICALLY requested without sauce and it was covered. The waitress actually asked me if I could just pick it off. No, I cannot because the sauce is touching all the cheese and cabbage and I paid for an entire taco. The beans and rice were horrible too, the rice tasted plain, no flavor with bland corn. The beans tasted like watered down gruel - no taste, no seasoning. And last time - I devoured the beans and rice because they were tasty. No amount of salsa bar could fix these tastes today.

So, how about that fourth entree? After the first two people FINISHED their entire meal (one Churro in the Quesa section) then the 4th entree appeared. What about that replaced veggie burro - BEEF in it AGAIN!

You can blame a chef for mixing up orders at a table. But, can you continue blaming the chef when you serve the wrong food to every table? We watched as 2 more tables received incorrect entrees. Oh, and the large party arrived after our troubles began. I can't forgive a wait staff that doesn't know how to handle these situations-wrong food, long wait times, inconsistent timing, beef served to vegetarians. You cannot serve vegetarians meat in the burro - twice. Come on now! Why are all the veggie la satisima missing half the ingredients and containing meat????? 

There were some rushed apologies, but no call to action. Asking me if I'd like another taco after we pay is more like salt on the wound than a bandaid. I loved this place our first visit. We couldn't wait to take our parents here. We REGRET deeply what they had to endure and wish to warn others that the salsa bar is NOT worth all the other troubles. We were charged for all the food - even the food that couldn't be eaten (Shrimp cabo, Veggie Burro) and for food that appeared after most people finished their meal at our table of four. 

We will NEVER, EVER return to this location and cannot think of how the manager would even attempt to rectify this situation.
Small restaurant, but bar seating is nice.  Great salsa options.  Food is excellent and great quality.
Seriously amazing food. Salsa bar for whatever you need. Food was very well priced and service was friendly! Highly recommended.

This place has some of the best food I've eaten. Even the tortilla was superb! Any downside with limited parking and a slightly cramped dining area are quickly forgotten when you take your first bite. There is a great selection of salsas at their salsa bar, ranging from mild and tasty to hot hot hot and tasty. Staff are pros and friendly and will help with the menu if your not sure what to order or if you have any questions. They also seem perfectly willing to make accommodations if you ask for substitutions or additions to your order. This is a definite must try place, cause you'll love it.

I would not recommend this location , the service here was so bad . Came on a Sunday not really busy at al , took them 40 mins for us to get a table when I could l see open tables ( more then 3) . Then when we sat down it took over an hour to get our food . The food was good nothing bad to say about the food . Just the service. The Glendale location was so much better . I will never come here again , I will drive out of my way to Glendale next time .

A plate with 3 tacos, a scoop of rice and a lick of re-fried beans was $15 dollars! I ordered a michelada after seeing the pictures of it here on yelp (which let me add that the michelada was not even on the menu) and that thing costs $12 dollars... for 1 beer and some clamato juice in it!

I saw of bunch of plaques on the well for "best of...." this and best of that, including a 2012 "cheap eats of phoenix". I interpret that plaque as something having to do with "low prices" however, it seems like the restaurant totally moved away from low cost!

taking away the cost factor, i think the food is good. i ordered a Marlin, Cochinita Pibil and barbacoa taco which were all great and my wife ordered a "lonche" with skirt steak which was also good. the salsa bar does have great salsas but they're watered down... it can't even be scooped, you can only "wet" your chips in it and if you add it to your food be ready for your tortilla or lonche to fall apart ... they might as well serve the salsa on a cup with a straw so you can sip on it as you eat!

There's one plaque that this restaurant deserves to have on the wall... the one that says "Best use of a small space" tables are so close to one another, it gets really crammed in there.

OVERALL Rating
Food is an A
Prices C
Horchata B+

Terrific food -- and very creative! Loved the peanut based salsa and chicken tinga taco! Service was a bit slow, but we did arrive right as a rush began. Also def recommend the Margarita Santisima! Yum!

I've held off on writing this review because I knew that to sit down, revisit my visit in my head, and dream of the flavors would hurt my heart. There is NO Mexican food in Hawaii. I repeat, there is NO Mexican food in Hawaii. Don't let anyone fool you...there is NO Mexican food in Hawaii. See, now my heart is already aching. 

It was 10:20 PM on a Saturday night when I touched down in Phoenix. Somehow, I made it out of the airport before 11 PM and that is how my journey to La Santisima began...

Hurry up, catch a Taxi, and Yelp the nearest, best Mexican food that is still open! BOOM, La Santisima! 

Arrive to La Santisima with my colleague at 10:58 PM. Okay, I know it's fucked up. Let's be real. This is the nightmare for anyone working in any kind of customer service. "Oh you want help right when I am in the middle of ending my day? No really, ENDING my day in 2 minutes. Please get the hell away from me." 

We knew we were taking a chance, we knew they might not seat us, or even let us order food to go. We walked in, with our luggages, and we saw the jaws drop. "Yes, hi...we just got off a 7 hour flight and we are very hungry. Can you help us?" 

We see that half the tables are already stacked up but after a sigh, they seat us. Mind you, there was another couple in there WAITING for the rest of their food. Praise Jesus, hallelujah! 

The menus were handed to us promptly and in the same motion, we apologized for coming in so late. The very nice man, I think the owner or at the very least, the manager, said not to worry and that the kitchen wasn't done being put away so take a moment. 

Right away, my eyes fell onto the word "Cabo." What can I say? My last trip to Mexico was very good to me. Cabo Tacos it was! My colleague ordered 3 different tacos and we both ordered the horchata. 

Now, this is where you may say that we were so damn hungry and that saying this was the BEST Mexican food we have EVER had is an overstatement but no, it's not. We both lived in California previously and we are both well-traveled. This was the bombest of the bomb. Is that a phrase? Better than any food I had my whole time in Cabo, too. 

The Cabo Tacos were fried lightly, fresh, and piping hot. The slaw was perfectly crispy and cool. The tortillas were soft. The rice...oh my god...the rice...If Heaven is just clouds of this rice...I'm down with it. 

The salsa bar didn't have as many options left at 11 PM, understandably so, but what was left, was great. There was a peanut sauce and radish sauce that still stick out in my head. I wish I could have had them both bottled up and shipped to me. 

Anyways, WHAT NICE FREAKING PEOPLE. They let us sit down at 10:58 PM and happily served us food, waited to clean the salsa bar until they saw we didn't need/want anymore, and gave us the biggest freaking horchatas in a to-go cup. The horchata had a bunch of fruit in it. I've never seen it or tasted it like that before. Magic. Better than tequila. That's a bold statement coming from me...

I love you chef, bus boy, and boss man. I love you and I miss you and I love you and I miss your food.

I can't get enough of this place. I consider myself a bit of a taco fan and this place keeps me happy! Also the salsa bar is pretty creative. Only complaints are if you order their amazing horchata, it only comes in one size which is a bucket and the other complaint is they only provide 1 small basket of chips per table, any more will cost ya like $2!?! Forget the chips and spend that on another taco!!

Delicious food - had the different veggie tacos and the cactus taco. A plethora of vegetables cooked just right. The rice and beans were the best, THE BEST, I've ever had. Also, One outstanding veggie quesadilla. What !!!

I'm not even a fan of Mexican food but this was pretty damn good !

So many colorful unique flavorful sauces and salsas helped a lot. Really really delicious.

The chips were good too, not greasy at all 
Hot hats drink had nuts and fruits in it which I ate with a fork afterwards...

Service was good. There were two servers and they handled it well. Alan took care of us and he was friendly professional and nice and efficient. 

When we came in, the place had three tables. By the time we left it was packed and there were people waiting outside on the bench and inside at the bar. 

We parked around the corner in the white spaces.
The place has a cool exterior and a cool interior. 
I'll add a photo of two

Enjoy, folks, this one is a winner...

I had lived in Phoenix my whole life and had never been here until recently.  My first visit was a great experience and I highly recommend the shark tacos and horchata. Parking isn't always easy, but it's definitely worth the trip.

Hunting for authentic Mexican food??  La Santisima is the REALS!! They have over a dozen salsas in their salsa bar and let you help yourself with the complimentary basket of chips.  I ordered (2) Carne Asada and (1) Al Pastor taco and added the rice and beans for a total of $8.97.  Let me start by saying your food comes out piping hot on a hot plate.  The food is made fresh and it shows.  The refried beans were delicious, really creamy, and flavorful. The rice was not dry and also way above average in taste.  The Asada was so flavorful and tender. Definitely better than most places I frequent. The beef was not chewy at all and has an almost melt in your mouth consistency.  The Al Pastor was also amazing with all fresh ingredients including the pineapple.  If you're in the Coronado area, do yourself a favor and check out this little gem!

This place has been bookmarked for well over a year. I finally got to try them out recently, and on Taco Tuesday, no less!

I love that they allow you to mix and match different tacos to create your own taco plate.  I ordered the following 3 tacos:

Tlaloc (grilled cactus, caramelized onion, garlic, jalapeños; I omitted the additional options for this taco -tomato, mushrooms, and queso fresco)

Guisado Tenoch (Grilled Cactus, Potato, Guajillo & red salsa; I omitted the mushrooms and queso fresco)

Mexica Ahuacatl (Beer Battered Avocado, cabbage, salsa jicama; I omitted the pico de gallo and the salsa cilantro, the latter of which contains dairy)

The Guisado Tenoch & Mexica Ahuacatl were by far my favorites.  The Guisado is terrifically tantalizing to the tastebuds and needed no extra salsas.  The Ahuacatl was equally delicious once I added some Strawberry Salsa. (It's delicious alone, just a little dry w/o the salsa.)  I wasn't a fan of the flavors in the Tlaloc, which were too tart and robust to my liking. Just a personal preference. 

I ordered my plate with rice and black beans, and I mixed them together.  The flavor of the beans was delightful; they were seasoned perfectly, and not too salty.  (It's my understanding that the refried beans contain dairy, so vegans should stick to the black beans.)

Another shining star here is the unlimited salsa bar, which features about a dozen different salsas.  The salsa ingredients are not listed, but after spotting a particularly milky looking one, I inquired and discovered that there are a few salsas which do contain dairy, including the pecan salsa and cilantro salsa.  I have since been informed that the following salsas are all vegan: salsa 7 chiles, árbol, cabo, chipotle, sesame, peanut, strawberry, pico de gallo, jicama, cruda, tomatillo, rábano, and the Mexicana. The guacamole is also confirmed as vegan.  The strawberry salsa became an unexpected favorite, winning me over with its refreshingly sweet and spicy flavors. 

The service was great and I absolutely adore the wall art.  The only thing I do not like is that the bathroom is in the dining area and several people kept leaving the door open... The salsa bar is right outside that door. As an OCD germaphobe, I was terribly bothered by this.  Aside from that, I love this taqueria and cannot wait to return and try the rest of their vegan menu.
Great little Mexican restaurant with the most authentic Jalisco cuisine around.  Highly recommended.  Suggest the caso with pineapple and pork.
The best service, great food,and a very friendly staff. A great restaurant close to downtown Glendale

I really like the choices of salsa. They give you some interesting flavours and textures by using pecans and jicama. As weird as it sounds, it's worth trying it out to discover new things and it might surprise you like it did me. 
When I came here, I was a little disappointed because they didn't have any shrimps so I couldn't get one of the tacos I wanted. I ended up getting  the Baja Sur Shark Taco and another taco. Both were very good, but I did prefer the Shark Taco. I also had their horchata which was just okay...it had too much cinnamon for me, but I like the addition of fruits and nuts with it. 
This place gets crowded especially during lunch time and it's a small place. They've got interesting paintings on the walls.
I like a lot. Good selection of food... spotty service, rough but ambient location. A little grungy, but I will be back.

Wen there on a Friday night at almost 9 PM and had a 5 minute wait for a single seat. Service was very welcoming and fast. Upon being seated, I was given a basket of complementary chips, (1st basket is free), I sat there waiting for salsa and forgot that there is a salsa bar with numbers of salsa to try out. I've decided to order just tacos and all were delicious. In order of best to least favorite was shrimp taco, fish taco, Aztec tinga taco (chicken), and finally a Sonoran carne asada. I highly recommend this place for anyone who enjoy tacos. I've seen neighboring tables had huge burritos and decent sized serving of margaritas, which I would love to try on the next visit.

There are several reviews here that state that the service is poor - I humbly disagree. While it may take a few minutes to get your order, the atmosphere and the servers are awesome. Our waitress was fantastic from the get-go. To top it off, the food is unbelievable. Highly recommend.

This place is amazing!!! You'd never known it from the outside---it's a little hole in the wall on Calle 16 right in the middle of Mexican mercados y paleterias. It's tiny so expect at least a 30 minute wait at peak hours. They have a serve yourself salsa bar with some of the most unique salsas I have ever tasted---from strawberry to pecan to habanero. The menu is not your typical Mexican food but there isn't a single bad thing on it. Don't bother with rice and beans on the side-- not needed. Try the mole quesa-- its my absolute favorite. The horchata is a family recipe with fruit and pecans in it and its amazingggg and a great big size option. You won't be disappointed in this incredible spot.

LOVE the dogfish shark taco and the chicken mole taco. The salsa bar is awesome. The horchata is delicious. Perfect tacos at a reasonable price. But the restaurant is small, so avoid peak times or get your food to go.
Great gourmet tacos! Recommend the brisket one on the street taco menu. The pecan salsa is very tasty as well! Classic margarita-phenomenal! Wonderful lunch spot.

Get there early because it might get packed later. Food comes very slowly but it is worth waiting. Definitely best tacos we ate so far, recommend trying their signature santissima gourmet! There is a big choice in the fresh salsa bar and the whole place has a nice decor inspired by dia de los Muertos.

I was craving street tacos and this place is as close to the street tacos you will get in Rocky Point. It's a small quaint place but they have such a variety of different salsas I didn't even know existed. The corn tortillas were fresh and the carne asada tacos were extremely on point. 
I'll be coming back here sooner than you think just to get my taco fix!

Stopped for what I heard was excellent tacos from many people. They were so right!   Hands down, best tacos. I had the fish and chicken Tinga taco and my daughter had the Carne Asada tacos. My came with the most moist and flavorful rice with a lighter side of beans. The chips were served warm and we had a variety of salsas for dipping. The standout salsa has to be the smooth and creamy cilantro. Soooo goooood.  Ok, the fish taco was served with coleslaw. The corn tortilla was doubled and made to perfection. Probably the best fish taco I ever ate. I will dine here again before I leave Phoenix. 

Well, came back for dinner and was not disappointed. Tacos rice and beans were delicious. I had a brisket taco that was grilled in shell with seasoning and sautéed onions on the exterior of shell. Yum. This will be a regular stop every time I'm in Phoenix. I've been cooking for years and don't know How do they cook the rice??? It's so good.

I really enjoyed the salsa bar from the Mexicana to the 7 chile's one.  I had the 3 street  taco meal with rice and beans.  Meats I chose were carne  asada, mayan pibil and the Aztec  tingi. The carne asada was dry and not flavorful and i didn't enjoy the taste of the tingi taco.  the last taco made it all worth it the Mayan pibil was delicious and I can't wait to have this again. They marinate the red onions in lemon, this simple touch makes the tacos so much better.  Javier had the red beef burrito this was very spicy but he enjoyed it.  We also had the house Margarita. They put lemons and orange slices in the drink.  This was an excellent margarita and for 8.00, I think this was a great deal. Our total bill for 2 meals, 2 beers and a Margarita was 37.00. The only down side to this place was the old plates. They were not the glossy ones and had chips and paint missing. I know it goes with the decor but i think this could be worked on.  We will be returning to try more food from this taco shop.

I've been in to La Condesa twice now, both during their happy hour. If you're not aware of their happy hour, familiarize yourself with it. It's pretty damned good ($3 delicious margaritas and $2 chicken tinga or carne asada tacos). 
To start, there is the salsa bar. You get one basket of chips (any more than that you pay for, but my wife and I never eat more than 1 basket-full) and then there are about 16-20 different types of salsa and sauces to try. I've only been brave enough to try about 5 of them, and they've all been decent-really good. My favorite was their tomatillo, and their chipotle didn't really do it for me, but I don't usually enjoy the taste of chipotle peppers in general. Too smokey.
The first time I went I got 2 carne asada tacos and 1 chicken tinga taco. I was disappointed in the carne asada. The meat was dry and topped with dry shredded cabbage. It has a decent flavor, but I had to put salsa on it because it was too dry for me. The chicken tinga, on the other hand, was pretty fabulous. The chicken has a very flavorful sauce on it with good spice, and it's topped with pickled red onion. Fantastic. I also had a plate of rice and beans which were delicious as well. So, the second time I went in, I ordered only chicken tacos. No biggie.
I highly recommend checking this place out. 5 tacos, 2 margaritas, and some rice and beans for $20. Brilliant.

I have nothing bad to say about La Santisima! One of my favorite restaurants for sure! Sure it gets busy but the waitresses that work there are ALWAYS sweet and positive. The food never disappoints me. I always order the Jamaica or Horchata and the street tacos with the beans and rice.

Food is phenomenal. Horchata is the best in town. Love the cozy atmosphere but on a busy night it can be a little too intimate with strangers squeezing and bumping through to tables. Choose a weeknight late or early dinner to avoid.
Absolutely amazing tacos and drinks. I'm an Arizona Native. This place has not been influenced by the Midwesterners and snowbirds so the food is still full of flavor and spice. Great salsa bar!
Amazing! Cant wait to go again. Really great salsa bar, and lots of choices on the menus. Hubby was a bit apprehensive about going but he enjoyed it

I LOVE La Condesa.  What more do I need to say? The salsa bar is amazing! I really like their carne asada.  They do but beans in the burrito, which, at first I wasn't sure how I'd feel about it, but after a couple, I really like it.  I've had the pork and shrimp tacos also.  The quality is always top notch.  I did the artwork too!  Two negatives...The music can sometimes be loud, and sometimes they are REALLY packed and parking is a bit tough to find.  Other than that, I HIGHLY recommend!
The foods is amazing and the mole is out of this world.  I will be back many times. My husband had the fish tacos abs he said they are great.
Very good. From the hot chips to the variety  of salsas great flavors. I had the steak taco and shrimp taco excellent  seasoning, piping hot and nice waiter.

I had the gaucho taco (chimichurri beef something or other) and the cochinita pibil taco. 

Honestly amazing food. 

Really interesting assortment of sauces and salsas (jicama salsa, peanut sauce stuff was great.) Looks like they just recently added some awesome new tequilas so I'm looking forward to stopping by at dinner time. Really authentic stuff. Looks like they just had Diners Dives and Drive ins there as there was a cool metal art piece signed by Guy Fieri.
Food came out quickly despite lunch rush. I'll be back soon. 
Recommended to people looking for authentic places to make their more boring friends jealous of their foodie acumen.

Best salsa bar in Phoenix
Amazing tacos
Always a wait in the evenings and you can't even order drinks at the bar while you wait which kind of sucks.

This was a little hole in the wall spot, looked sketchy. The insides not much better but has some nice art. The food was great! A fresh salsa bar with flavored like cilantro and strawberry salsa. I had a type of corn quesadilla with steak and Mexican cheeses, all GF. It was thick and puffy, tasty!

The place is a little small so we had to wait a bit for a table. The food is fantastic. 

Steak asada tacos were perfect. Nice chunks of meat with shredded cabbage. 

We also had the black mole tacos. Also outstanding. 

The selection of self-serve sauces is the standout.  They have maybe 20 sauces for you to sample. The variety and quality of the sauces is excellent and should satisfy any palate. 

If I'm ever back in Phoenix I will definitely be back.

Great place for salsa, tacos and quesadillas. I had street tacos, very good, different and fresh. My friend had a quesadilla that looked more like a calzone. It was superb. Tried about 10 salsas, fun to try then all. Loved the cilantro salsa. Small place and lots of people so try to go outside of the noon hour.

Gourmet tacos from abuela's kitchen, an off the beat location in Little Mexico. The well ornate sit in resturant has a great vibe, bright colorful art work and a strong Dia de Muerto sets the right mood. Service is great and simple, from the self serve salsa bar to the strong drinks menu, adds to the home feel.

La Santisima's staple taco is a must have. Nicely toasted cheese over well seasoned steak makes for a great combination.  The roasted peppers and onions add a nice balance and grilled mushrooms just work. Not much on sauce but the beef and vegetables highlight the entree. 

Mayan cochinta was loaded with flavor. Tender and savory pork shoulder has a ton of favor, the pickled onions help add a zing to the dish. Recommend you have it over a plate cause it'll ooze down you hand.

We have been HUGE fans of this place since the first location in Phoenix. We love both locations. We always bring friends and family. Everyone adds this place to their list for amazing tacos...especially the tiger shrimp tacos! There is no better place to get Chimichuri Beef  (Argentinian Marinade). Fantastic food and beautiful art what a great combination.

La Santisima is delightful from start to finish They have a buffet of salsas available from guacamole to peanut to strawberry to....kimchi salsa?! It was heaven. 

Highly recommend the quesadillas. They are deep fried to a perfection. The rice/beans that come with the tacos are out of this world and the horchata is also incredible--and strawberry infused!
